3NhFkNOmysxYH-qrm5RXBA.text: Wow, I saw the yelp reviews for this place, and I kept trying to think of things while I was eating my dinner to not give it 5 stars since everyone did but... it's just SO good you have to give it 5 stars.  Everything was perfect.  The service, the food,the drinks, the restaurant itself... impeccable!  We weren't going to get appetizers but the waiter talked us into getting a sampler type special they had going on and it was so worth it!  The crab cake isn't like ur average crab cake... it's boiled chunks of crab in a lobster remoulade sauce... and we had shrimp cocktail with 3 different sauces... so good... we both had steaks, i had the filet and he had the ribeye... both were cooked to perfection and we had creamed corn and potatoes au gratin for sides... everything was SO perfect... we were too full for dessert.  I also had the VIP martini which was a 10 day old Vodka Infused Pineapple... soooo good!!

hWumIT7YK2HLyn0FQ9mJTA.text: 32 OUNCE BONE IN RIB-EYE!! They call this one the tomahawk cut LOL. Well I had to try it and it was definitely worth the artery build up. I would still rank this slightly below Flemings because the fatty portions didn't melt in my mouth as quickly and the appetizers weren't as appetizing. The service was top notch, I never had my glass of water less than 3/4 full, and the ambiance was nice. The west coast oysters were a little on the small side but still fresh. If you're in Vegas, and you're feenin for some steak, Del Frisco's is the spot to go. HIP HOOPPPP!!!

jkRVYrwsQ8aSuHeIqfzN5g.text: went here on a Saturday night for a pre bachelor party meal. I ordered the "featured" filet mignon. Man, was that an awesome steak. cooked to perfection. The waiter even asks you to cut down the middle of the steak to see if it is cooked correctly. I kinda brushed him off thinking it was all talk, but he waited patiently for me to slice it. These guys are serious. Even though they warned me that the plate was hot, i forgot and paid dearly for that mistake. The sides of broccoli and mushrooms were wonderful. Overall, the place is expensive, but customer service and food were outstanding.

vaGA1OKf5n60GPepV-_BWA.text: highly upscale steakhouse, it is classy and romantic too. people have to go this place one in their life !!

st2V6_QadwEyIpUSu31-Rw.text: Probably one of the best if not THE best steak house in Vegas.  Have been here on multiple occasions and the food is always cooked to perfection and they are always more than willing to recook your steak if it is not cooked to your liking.  They have some of the tastiest steaks West of Texas!  All prime and they even have kobe available on occasion.  Great crabcakes and salads - love the wedge with green goddess dressing.  Even the regular salad is great - came with two whole slices of bacon the last time I ordered it.  Great wine selection as well.  They even gave us a tour of the wine cellar and played the James Bond table for us - very cool.  Decor is very old school - they even have a cigar room!  Service is always great - Great experience overall.

LOZzLz992_Aa1GFyW5CIwA.text: This place has been a staple in my family's Las Vegas vacation for a long time.  We have always loved the attentive service, good food, and the cigar lounge in the back (well my father and brother really loved this, my mother and I remained neutral).  Flash forward to this weekend, and the family has had another good dinner, yet has also left a bit dissapointed.  The food remains top-notch, and for that we are thankful.  The pleasantness of servers also gets high-marks, however, this is where the praising ends.  There were small errors on the wait staff including handing a steak knife to me with the blade facing me.  Unfortunately they are now using cheaper wine glasses and silverware on the tables.  We were seated right next to the bar, which got pretty loud as the night drew on.  And, due to the no smoking ban in Nevada now, there is no more cigar room in the back.  Totally not the restaurant's fault, just a bit dissapointing.  To me, the little things in a fine dining establishment matter.  If I am paying $50 for a steak, not only should service and food be impeccable, but so to should the atmosphere.  This restaurant is still good, however, with all the other well known steak restaurants in the city that fall into the same price range, it may be time that the family move on and try another restaurant.

xy0LGJxg0huj9eO6hZ4YMQ.text: This place was awesome! The wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive. My ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and had amazing seasoning. They have an excellent wine selection and had two sommelier on staff to help suggest wines. All in all, highly recommended.

S2kC905JgJoh3yZAb_3oSg.text: I have been to Steakhouses all over the country and this is as good as it gets.  Service is impeccable, prices are fair, menu items are delicious.  I have been there numerous times and don't have one bad thing to say about my dining experiences.  It is off Las Vegas Blvd but WELL WORTH the cab ride.  We drink beer (not bottles of wine) and wear shorts and are still treated like royalty!  If you don't do anything else in Las Vegas go to Del Frisco's!

tHK8OaqWxXND8gC2JV9RiA.text: this place is like almost tied with my "best steak i've ever had in my life" at peter lugers in ny.  i had a bone in fillet and it was freakin juicy and perfect!  i woudl so go there again. my runner up for steak is also mastro's in beverly hills.  omg, so good. so so good.

U1I_xaitZOo5OwitZnUokQ.text: If I could give it another star I would.  It was that good.  The overall experience was, I dare say, even better than Luger's in Brooklyn.  First of all, the service in this restaurant is impeccable.  The minute you walk in the door, from the hostess to the server to the bus boy, they are attentive and professional.  Your water glass and bread basket will never be empty.  Further, and more importantly, the steak here is awesome.  We opted for two specials-- the bone-in filet and filet with blueberry reduction.  Although both were really tender, cooked exactly as we ordered them, the filet with blueberry was particularly delicious.  I mean it literally melted in your mouth.  For the starter we had the crab cakes which were good.  They were broiled not fried, consisting of lump crab meat in a rich and creamy sauce.  For sides, we ordered the onion rings and sauteed mushrooms.  The mushrooms were actually really good, very juicy and firm, pretty buttery though.  Don't be fooled by the innocuous sounding onion rings because this thing is huge.  It comes out as 10 big onion rings stacked high on top of eachother.  Our server advised that they tasted the best late night so we packed these inevitable leftovers into our doggie bag.   To complement our meal, we also ordered two glasses of white and a bottle of red wine (recommended by our server).  Our server was knowledgeable about wines yet not stuffy at all.  This place is a definite must dining spot for steak lovers passing through the Vegas area.  Yes it is on the pricier side, but it is worth it.  We will be stopping by this oasis on all our future trips out to the desert!

-xawN-Sxi-SUZeEUEVLlQQ.text: By far this was the most wonderful steak experience.  After arriving in Vegas for a girl's weekend, we were hungry for some good eats.  When I called to check in with my boyfriend, he had mentioned that he had gotten a thank you card from Del Frisco's after going there during SEMA and highly suggested that we try it.    I ordered the house salad, filet and shrimp, and the creamed spinach.  The salad came with two pieces of crispy bacon on top, the vinaigrette that it was tossed in was okay, I think  i would get it with the house ranch dressing next time.  The steak and shrimp were amazing.  The filet was the most tender  piece of steak I've ever had.  I tried the Chateau potatoes that my friend got and they were amazing.  The creamed spinach was like no other, with chopped pieces of bacon.  Good thing I don't eat like this every day.  a week later I got a thank you note too.  guess I need to go back soon.

SEeZZPBV9W_zl_iHT_q4Ng.text: filet is like buttah oh god it was so good it was just so damn good!!!! my boyfriend had this huge 24 oz cowboy steak, that's not what its called but that's what it reminded me of because its so big! our server recommended the macaroni and cheese yumm yumm yummmmmmmyyyyyyyyyyy she also recommended a lovely wine to pair with my steak i don't know anything about wine but it was delicious!

QrqpeI197daeYHhPUqOvmw.text: I have been wanting to come here for along time after reading so much good stuff about this place so we decided to take some friends to celebrate a birthday and a wedding anniversary, to say the least it was pretty fab! I ordered the bone in rib eye it was so flavorful, we basically ordered one of each dish to try to get a good feel, the only thing to be a miss from everybody was the Mac & Cheese i read that alot of people did not like this side dish but we had to try it for ourselves since they said it was a specialty. All the other side dishes were good! They served us a creme brulie & lemon cake it was really good and we made it into a birthday cake for the birthday girl! The service was awesome they brought all the main courses out at the same time, everything from the drinks to the bread was very good! This place has large rooms and a very nice bar area for very large party's even wedding parties, i cannot wait to go again real soon!

oWvjF51RsWHPIDBFkuarTQ.text: All the reviews are correct..This is the place to go for a steak in Vegas! Amazing wine list and don't forget to try the lump crab cake...Yummy!!!!

RH_qw17TkqlNpWayLP--1A.text: Del Frisco's what a great place to eat. My Wife and I went on a trip to Vegas in January. So we made reservations to eat at Del Frisco's while we were there. Because a friend of ours told us it was a must to eat at Del Frisco's when you are in Vegas. Our big night was Tuesday Jan. 26, 2010. It was fabulous, what a great meal. For starters we had a salad with the house dressing that was to die for. I ask our waitress Liz, if they sold it? The answer was no. To bad, I would have bought a case! So after the salad we shared a bone in filet mignon ( mouth watering ) and a lobster tail with an order of the chateau potatoes. Every thing was superb. We were treated great from the minute we walked in the front door. Out waitress Liz  was wonderful and all the other staff members. After our meal Liz treated us to a viewing of the James Bond Wine table. That was pretty cool. Then a few days after returning home from our vacation we received a Thank you card from Liz. That is a very nice ending to a great vacation and a wonderful meal. So the next time you visit Vegas I would highly recommend that you eat at Del Frisco's .

bLmPHwGl-MBD28HwSswSCQ.text: First word wow second word let's order more cause this was to good anything on the menu is good from a 2 z honestly love going here everytime I'm in sin city its the first and last thing I eat when I'm here I can't stop talking about this steakhouse this place is beyond a must go when your in sin city

TCL-bK7wsa6NAy23kS8fig.text: I've hit just about every top-notch restaurant in Vegas, and this is by far my favorite. This is without a doubt the best steak I've ever had. Yes, the seasoning tends to the strong side, but it definitely adds a unique flavor that most steaks lack. The sides are phenomenal as well. We ate there for the big meal during my bachelor party, and the staff was very accomodating. I guess the only downside is the off-Strip location. Spring for the taxi ride, though, because it's well worth it.

WoiIxTE90FxdvdbcK1k8KQ.text: We just recently discovered this place on one of our trips to Vegas.  It's off the strip so we didn't know about it until it was recommended to us. This place has become my favorite steakhouse now.  We decided to go on a Tuesday night and they were jam packed so I had a drink at their bar as they tried to squeeze us in. We started with their crabcake with cajun lobster sauce appetizer which was delicious. I then ordered the filet mignon while my boyfriend ordered the ribeye with an australian lobster tail.  The filet was very good but the ribye and the lobster tail were out of this world. We also ordered the creamed corn and chateau potatoes as sides.  Both were good.  The whole dinner was great.  I also enjoyed a couple of their signature pineapple infused martinis.  We found the service to be quite attentive and above par.  After our dinner, they gladly called a cab for us back to the strip and after we arrived home from our vacation, there was a thank you card in our mailbox from them!  This place definitely rivals much more expensive steakhouses on the strip.

rbYqmPVFUtfHt4Zb-n8qPw.text: I was in Las Vegas this week with my family. The four of us went to Del Frisco's on a Monday at around 10pm. Had reservations initially at 6pm, but had to change due to late lunch and no one was that hungry. When we got there, restaurant was pretty empty, just us and two other parties. We first saw the James Bond wine table, pretty neat. The table opens up to James Bond theme music and there are number of wines with various James Bond movies etched on the bottles. It was obviously for display only and not intended to be consumed. Anyway, was pretty cool. We were obviously seated immediately since the restaurant was empty (reflects the overall Vegas economy and time of year). We had the following: Crab cakes- delicious, full of fresh crab meat and very little filler. Sauce was very good but bit salty for SF Bay area tastes.  Strip steak- cooked just as asked. Very tender, good flavor. Filet mignon- again, cooked as asked. Full of flavor. Lamb- again, very good, lots of flavor. Only problem was trying to get each bit of meat off the bone without picking it up and chewing on it. Since not many people around, picked it up and started chewing. Pasta with scampi- excellent dish. Just the right amount of butter and garlic. Scampi were very tender. Asparagus- good side, but not that different from other restaurants. Bread- warm, just baked, really good with butter. Do as they suggest, tear it open, don't use a knife.  Lemon cake- we debated if we wanted dessert since we were all pretty full. We decided to shared one very large piece of lemon cake. It was delicious, full of lemon flavor and moist. Those who initially did not want dessert actually wanted more once they tried a small piece. The service was excellent. They were there when you needed them and were not overlly intrusive. However, considering that the restaurant was empty, I would hope that service would be excellent. The prices were high, but no more than other steakhouses in Las Vegas. We had been to Craftsteak this time last year. If I were to compare the two, I would say that the entrees and appetizers were better at Del Frisco's, the sides dishes better at Craftsteak, dessert equal in both places, and the service better at Del Frisco's (however, not fair comparison since Craftsteak was fairly busy when we were there last year). Finally, I think that Del Frisco's was cheaper for what you got. The final conclusion from our family is- Del Frisco's is the default steakhouse for us in Las Vegas. One last point, we are from the SF Bay area. We found the food in Las Vegas (at all the restaurants) to be very salty compared to comparable restaurants in the SF. May want to consider asking them to cut back on the salt if you are use to lower amount of salt in your food. We went to Nob Hill at the MGM the next day. We specifically asked them to cut the salt and they did.

LpGAzJ_9iD-BPNw9UyC1ng.text: The service was impeccable and the ambiance was fabulous, but unfortunately we had a terrible experience with the food. I've heard great things about this restaurant for years and was excited to try it. Everything was beautiful, but every dish we ordered was just average. The potatoes were creamy but too rich to eat, and my salmon (or the sauce on the salmon) had obviously gone bad. It tasted moldy! Everyone in my party who ordered the salmon experienced this. The vegetables were steamed simply, which I'm fine with, but as I was unable to eat anything else on my plate they weren't enough to write home about. The bread pudding was too sweet to eat, and had an unpleasant consistency. I was with a large group and we all ordered the bread pudding, but no one was able to eat it! An incredibly expensive meal for low quality food. Skip the menu, have a drink at the beautiful bar.

oC2uuuhEDkR0y4yzVvc4pg.text: Great early dinner option with terrific 4:30-6:30 bar menu. Piano bar and great bartenders to boot.

d5NOp7BpDSyyy7zE3hR1sg.text: Food was ok, not as good as we expected. Started with the calamari which was the best thing we ordered. It was a bit spicy, which was nice. Next was the Caesar salad which had no flavor whatsoever. Then I tried the tuna tartar and it was also flavorless and the tuna was not fresh. The pineapple infused vodka martini was delish! Waitress was nice but our drinks sat empty for a bit before she came back by and asked if we'd like another. Had high hopes for this place. We ate at Maestro last night and it was by far better. Food and service were both top notch there.

yL0NHMSO6UVkmbDzOxVMBQ.text: This place is all about service, service, service... From the moment your valet greets you to when the valet closes the door for you after you get in your car, it's top notch service.  Five of us were in Vegas to celebrate hubby's 40th birthday and he chose this place based on Yelp reviews.  He did good!!  I made reservations and noted that it was his birthday, half-hoping they'd do something to acknowledge it.  Imagine our surprise when the hostesses greeted him with a chorus of "Happy Birthday" as we walked in.  Upon being seated, our server walked over and placed a card that had already been waiting on the table in front of hubby.  It was a birthday card signed by the staff!  Our server shook hubby's hand and also wished him a birthday.  Not to belabor the point but a couple more people stopped by to wish him a happy birthday.  Now the food.  Probably the best steaks I've ever had.  Seasoned perfectly throughout and cooked perfectly as well.  Although I went with the smaller ribeye cut, I ended up eating only half of my steak....because I became distracted by the sides and the appetizers!!  To start, we had fried oysters (excellent, large and fresh - not overcooked), tuna tartare (old school preparation and very good) and a dozen oysters from each coast (fresh, briny and sweet though that's probably just because they were good oysters).  Sides were the lobster mac and cheese (perfect level of richness where you don't feel all icky after eating some), asparagus (okay, just steamed and topped with almonds) and creamed spinach (amazing!).  Gf ordered a plated dish (with sides) and her chateau potatoes were spicy and delicious (I'm going to get a side of it next time).  Hubby ordered a baked potato for himself to go with his porterhouse and while he felt guilty eating it, he loved that they put melted butter into the open potato and then scooped more whipped butter on top, alongside the sour cream.  We'd brought a cake and they were very gracious in serving it up for us.  We gave them the remaining half in gratitude for their service.  There were no foams, gelee's, dry ice, constant utensil changes or pyrotechnics in our meal...none was needed when they shocked and awed us with their wonderful service and impeccable steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday card

VV3yno8jaf4hT6VzM9_3wA.text: Amazing! We celebrated our 11 year anniversary there and the place was terrific! Loved everything! Pineapple vodka, filet, sauteed spinach and wedge salad!! And dessert too!! Great restaurant and location to Rockefeller plaza!

rnKIIhgh7GbldezCEp3xtg.text: One of the BEST Steakhouse Experiences Ever!  Several years ago, I had dined at Del Frisco and thought the food was mediocre and the steaks were overly seasoned. However, one of my friends had recently seen Del Frisco featured on a TV show and wanted to eat here for her birthday. Let's just say, the second time around was definitely a charm. This time, the food and service was outstanding which earns Del Frisco's 5 STARS!  On Saturday, 9.10.11, my friends and I came for an early dinner at 5:30 pm. We were promptly seated with reservations.   F O O D *STEAK TARTARE ($16) - 4 STARS The steak tartare was tender and smooth with a nice savoryness to it. Paired long with the garlic crostini, it was the perfect blend of garlicky crunch with savory softness from the tartar.  *32 OZ. BONE-IN WAGYU RIBEYE ($90) - 4.5 STARS Perfectly seared to a medium rare with a warm pink center, the wagyu had a nice crust which sealed in all the juices. The first bite was sublime. Ribeye is already a fatty cut of meat and the increased marbling from the wagyu and the bone-in added an intense richness full of decadent beefy flavor. Each bite was sinfully good and a carniwhore's delight.  *SPINACH SUPREME w/ Bacon ($12) - 4 STARS Talk about kicking up creamed spinach a notch. Already rich and decadent, the bacon added a nice smoky flavor with an extra layer of savoryness.  *CHATEAU POTATOES ($10) - 3.5 STARS Like chunky mash potatoes, the chateau potatoes were smooth yet had a nice bite to it. I liked the addition of the cayenne pepper which gave it a nice kick.   *LOBSTER MAC 'N CHEESE ($16) - 3 STARS Though the macaroni was perfectly cooked to an al-dente, I felt the bechamel sauce was lacking that ooeey gooey cheesiness and no lobster was really detected.   S E R V I C E ABSOULTELY IMPECCABLE! From the moment we walked in, we were greeted warmly and whisked away to our table. A card signed by the staff was brought to the birthday girl; what a nice touch! Our waitress Kelsey was AWESOME! She was very friendly, down-to-earth, knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive.  Food service was timed very well. As soon as we received our steaks, we were asked to cut into it to make sure it was cooked to our liking which it was. All the sides were served by the staff upon getting our entrees.   They even brought out a complimentary slice of their famous lemon cake for the birthday girl.  Though the food at Del Frisco is about 4 STARS, the service is everything you would expect from a restaurant of this caliber, so I must reward them with an extra star.  A M B I A N C E / D E C O R Classic steakhouse feel with crisp white linens, dark wood furnishings, hardwood floors, and dim lighting. Del Frisco is the perfect place for a romantic date or a large party as they have several private dining areas.   The restroom reminded me of a restroom at a club complete with a bathroom attendant, mints, gum and various lotions.   San Francisco has no shortage of steakhouses but can rarely live up to the ones I've tried in Vegas. Del Frisco is unequivocally no exception.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breath of Fresh Air Peach Martini - $15
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complmentary Five Layer Lemon Cake for the Birthday Girl!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartar with Crostini - $16

RsjZW-z2sDL53-qs5qokfw.text: I've heard this is the best steak house in town, and since I've never been, it seemed to be the place to try.   Reservations were easy via Opentable and I made it 15 minutes prior to arrival. Granted this was an earlier reservation at about 6pm, when I checked in to the hostess stand, they said they were ready for me. Nice.   There were a couple of servers who assisted with taking our order and they were both very friendly and informative. Before diving into the menu, wait for the specials of the day. They also have off menu items too.   We shared:   Del's salad which was a mixed green salad with tomatoes, and a couple of thick bacon strips. For $10, it was not worth it. I could have bought a pack of greens, box of tomatoes and a pack of bacon.   Seafood Soup: It was a light bisque with fish and shrimp. It was ok but it was only a cup for $11.   Bone in Prime Rib: Since this was a large hunk of meat at 22 oz, we split it and they split it in front of us. I had a bit of each side; filet and ribeye. Between the two, I liked the ribeye more, as usual. It was tasty and just enough fat.   Potatoes au Gratin: Usually this dish is with sliced potatoes but this dish was quartered red potatoes. What made this dish was the creamy buttery sauce with the baked cheese on top. Weird but this was my favorite dish... but maybe because I love carbs.   It's True, there is a weird sewer smell at the entrance. It's not appetizing walking in or out of the restaurant.

ss5Uzrz1Oz8T9WF4Akugkw.text: We had one of the most lovely meals ever here! The crab cakes were better than the ones in New York, the steak was perfectly cooked, the sides and the wine were delicious, and the service was very welcoming! If you are visiting Vegas - this is definitely a place you want to have dinner at!

QBP6-nqAXyUlHYsitkbzTg.text: We came to eat on Super Bowl Sunday during the game, so when we walked in, I felt like the family on "Christmas Story" eating Christmas dinner at the Chinese restaurant. There was one other table at the time. We had lots of wait staff to look after us! Best lobster bisque I've had. Amazing service, amazing onion rings and crab cakes. I am super difficult to please when it comes to steak at a restaurant, but they had a wagyu bone-in filet that was delish. Wonderful all around. Our server was very attentive, and knowledgeable, and personable. The sommelier was helpful and really spent some time with us. All around fantastic dining experience.

xivFRdMzxW1xiYEFpAGuSA.text: The service was one of the best I've had. My server was "Richard" who went above and beyond to make sure we were getting the best service possible. He cut our stake, served our sides, constantly checked on us, and made great recommendations. The Prime Ribeye was one of the best I've had and the lobster macaroni as a side is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese chopped salad (special order - not on the menu)
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Ribeye! Will cost you $49 but it&#39;s totally worth it

C6kO7ePG0daA6Rm7yTyyJQ.text: If you want the old school vegas steak house feel then this is a good place to try . I got the tomahawk Wagyu and it was probably one of the best wagyu steaks I've ever tried . Customer service is excellent!

idCziv1N3_LJs3ohLNitDg.text: Just went for my one year anniversary dinner with my girlfriend last Friday night and once again the food was exceptional.  We both ordered the filet mignon, sides were creamy spinach and potatoes au gratin and it was all amazingly good. My girl even loved the filet even though she's not much of a meat eater.  Drinks were VIP martini, I had about five or six of them they're so crazy good, and she had the pomegranate martini. Drinks, top shelf. Love it!  Only draw back our server at first seemed to want us to hurry and order even though we were trying to take our time and draw out our dinner as we were in no hurry. That made my girl a little uncomfortable. He backed off though and everything else was perfect! They even sent out a celebratory slice of seven layer lemon cake which was silky and delicious!  Thanks Del Friscos you did it again! See you next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VIP martini. If I won the lottery, I&#39;d only ever drink these.

PhFJXc3or5eInlJKBChewg.text: Came here for our 14th wedding anniversary. Must say we were not disappointed. We ordered the beef carpaccio as an appetizer...never stood a chance! We looked over the menu and decided to go with the summer prix fixe special. Definitely the best choice. The steaks were cooked to perfection, best steak we've ever had! The creamed spinach is to die for and a definite must if you order a side. Service was fantastic - Nick was our server! We will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake and New York strip...mmmmm

HpxN2dlyqq_V9s4Io8-leA.text: Came here with a prix fix menu. First up, free bread and butter. Then shrimp cocktail with three accompanying sauces. Shrimp were plump, fresh, and served at the right temperature. Good start, bad finish.   Next dish was the Del Frisco house salad. Good balance of toppings and delicious dressing - minus the fruit fly. How does an upscale steakhouse allow that to happen? I was pretty embarrassed for them. But I let the manager know and he replaced my salad and treated the table to the infamous VIP martini. Nice recovery. Onto the entree.    Order the ribeye. Perfect amount of marbling for extra fatty juicy goodness. Pretty good portion too - I couldn't finish my steak. Sides were forgettable. Green beans were fresh but greasy, as were the cheesy potatoes. For dessert I had their cheesecake topped with strawberry sauce. Again nothing unique, but something sweet to finish the meal is always a nice treat.   Probably wouldn't return again as there are plenty of other places in Vegas that are worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Med rare ribeye with greasy green beans and potatoes

1xs0sxF-DYzRp0v95NcXbA.text: Thanks for American Express and their $50 gift card to this restaurant, we were able to venture out of our usual Vegas strip restaurant and try a new steakhouse.  So glad we found this place because it became our new favorite!   Everything from the food, appetizer, dessert, ambience, service, bathrooms, parking, etc was perfect.  We made a last minute reservation on a Sunday night at 5:30pm.    Our server Gustavo (I think that's how his name is spelled) gave us an impeccable service and we really enjoyed his sense of humor along with his charming personality throughout our meal.  It's not everyday you get a server who can provide a smooth flowing comfortable dining experience.   Thank you Gustavo!  We look forward to dining here again real soon.    For appetizer, you must order their raw oysters.  Between the East and West, we liked the West side oysters because they were smaller and sweeter.  This was a great start to our meal.    The prixe fix dinner was only $50 but came with a choice of salad, appetizer, choice of bigger cuts for extra $$ or the 8oz filet cut and one family size side dish.    My husband ordered the Tamaha Wagyu 32 oz cut for extra $50.  That steak looked like something Fred Flinstone would devour!   Only a True steak lover with a huge appetite can finish this steak in one seating!   I was skeptical about the 8 oz steak and thought it would be more dry and boring.  To my surprise even the filet was very juicy and flavorful!   The different side dishes were all perfect and big enough to share with the family.   Crab cakes and Scallops were all good portions to pair with our steaks.    They are known for the Lemon debosh cake.  No matter how full we were, there was no way we were going to leave without trying this cake.  It's big enough to share between 4 people.  Despite not being a huge lemon fan, this had to be the best lemon cake we've had and would order it again next time.  Not too tart or too sweet.  Perfectly moist and delicious.  Save room for this cake!  We love this place so much better than SW steak or CUT!   Glad to have found Del Frisco's!  Wish they had another location in LA!

yfIhykeDnrZpX6utTef60Q.text: 4 out of 5 of these stars go to our waiter (Bradley). He was very knowledgeable, patient and personable. He made our first time at Del Frisco's one to remember! The food was good - my husband and I had the filet mignon, salmon, oysters, crab cakes, onion rings, mashed potatoes, butter cake and cheesecake. The oysters were my favorite and the cheesecake was his.

P77-GMtldw-hXMQ70IaU8A.text: AMAZING! Hands down one of the best meals perfect way to celebrate my 30th birthday! Brittany was awesome very knowledgeable of the menu and the staff was very warm and attentive! I will definitely be visiting every time I'm in town!

zb0vNMkPe1vmyUqZx-YUUw.text: From the moment I walked in the door the service was exceptional. We had a special filet mignon with the asparagus and lobster mac and cheese and it was incredible! The banana bread at the end of the meal was also a good choice. This steakhouse is easy to find on Paradise Road. The menu is typical compared to the other Del Frisco's.   Definitely an excellent choice, you will not be disappointed.

BLay_T-Bjvam59Dab3uLxg.text: Great food $$$$$$$$ - gets LOUD there later once  alcohol is flowing hard. Bring ear plugs or aspirin as you will have head ache after you leave

sqEdXdd667Anp-FMTV4dzw.text: Del Friso's is a fantastic restaurant. They excel at more than just steak. Great Service, soft lighting - not dark. The wait staff is well trained, very knowledgeable and helpful.  The Filet Mignon was cooked perfect just the way it was ordered. The side dish of Sweet Potato Casserole is enough for 2 and some to take home. If you like Osso Buco Veal Shank, don't pass this one up. The pasta that comes with the meal is a bit much. Sorry no room for dessert, maybe next time. Before you leave ask to see the James Bond Wine Table.

4Jjvja-_Y-qMmpnZ7nnrbw.text: This place is off the strip but totally worth the effort and trip, if you manage to extricate yourself from the trip. The price is better, and if you were to eat the same meal on the strip it would likely cost you double if not triple the price.  The boy and I shared the namesake steak, it was delicious. When the steak is brought to your table, the waiter will cut in the center for you to make sure it's cooked to the proper temperature.   Oh the CRAB CAKE! It is the best crab cake ever! Seriously! That sauce had so much umami flavor and the crab cake had little to no fillers. After eating the cake, I used my bread to slop up as much of what was left on the plate.   We also brought cupcakes for our friend's dinner to which the restaurant stored for us and didn't charge us a cake cutting fee. I thought that was amazing. A lot of restaurants try to nickle and dime you here and there. They also brought out two large slices of their own cake for our two friends.   I am definitely returning! Make reservations!!

XXEH1ZTUhfMS6mb8wvGXng.text: We had the Fillet mignon, and it's the first time the get the medium Well perfect The seasoning was great The stake was so tender that Youtube can cut it with your fork The location it's pretty bad The Service was Ok But We'll return for the food everytime

Y169kn6Qbl8i-YGWcZO-Bg.text: I'm actually not sure how to begin this, so I'm just going to start at the beginning and let you decide...  Four of us choice this steakhouse because it was the only one in Vegas with 4.5 stars. The other high end spots had a max of 4. Personally I've always been a fan of Jean Georges at Aria but they were booked tonight so we had to pick a new spot and so I made the command decision to go with the highest rated. Biggest mistake I've ever made.  Things started off behind. We showed up ok time for our reservation at 800, only to stand in the lobby for another 10 minutes while they mustered up the enthusiasm to seat is at one of the empty tables. We order crab cake, king crab and salads to start. Crab cake was good. King crab okay. But then the real insanity began. The first came out scallops on a plate smothered with a thick sort of teriyaki soy blend paste that was so powerful, I recoiled upon taste. Unfortunately it wasn't strong enough to mask the flavor of the scallop which was clearly a few days old and or frozen (very thick, like a meat not a fresh scallop) if I you do choose the scallops, pair them within sauteed mushroom...why, because these canned caps will have the same dense flavorless texture and taste.  Then here comes the Double Eagle prime strip, which I asked for a thin line of Pink, but like my friend and her hubby all meats, Lamb, Filet and Strip were rare. The filet and strip were sent back with once again specific instructions to have them just a line of pink. ****to be fair, I never send back steak, why? Because inevitably the cook is gonna take it personally as if we're insulting their taste buds and my dinner is gonna come back burnt.  Before the plate hit the table I could tell it was over cooked. The plate was radiating heat around 800*Fahrenheit leaving nothing more than a lump of low grade dog food. (Which I'll talk about in a minute)  The manager asks what's wrong. And at this point I say, "nothing" because I'm no longer interested in playing this game. I just want to go but they insist to pick something else at it won't be charged. So I ask for a filet and a box to pick the dog food in so my puppy can at least benefit from my night out. The waiter tells me, "don't worry about the box, we'll take care of that after its all done"  What happens, my filet comes out and in the drop off, they steal back my dog food and leave me with the remains of the only meat that came out all night that was anything near a real piece of meat. But to be honest, now that I'm home, I would have rather brought the dog food home. At least I know he would enjoy it. Because none of what I ate feels good in my stomach. I feel genuinely robbed!!!  Mind you...we've been ready to leave for the last 10-15 min but we can't leave because no one stops by our table anymore to see how we're doing. Finally after going to find someone myself, they ambush is with a lemon dessert cake and the check.  ***thats right, the check, which still has the other two pieces of meat that were undercooked as well as the untouched mushrooms. $300 and when I look back and try and remember what I ate...I honestly can't remember. Couple bites of bland lettuce. Half a filet. A two bites too many of food and sauces so disgusting, you wouldn't serve it to a volunteer shelter with a good conscience.  Come to think of it, I would have rather, done a spa day, then watched the Mayweather fight again before stopping by chipotle. At least then my nails would be done.  I have NO idea how they achieved this rating, they must give away free meals to elite yelpers because I dare say if you just had 10 regular yelpers dine in and give ratings, your have 2-3 star tops and only because average customer feels bad for writing a negative review.  Ps-in the spirit of full disclosure, the manger did come out with the intention of making it right. Her intentions were good. So she gets a thanks. But the rest, is upsetting when think anymore about it.

eOYHonmnMyg3G71XONJYrQ.text: As a local, do not ever go to this restaurant on Valentines Day. We had reservations and still waited for 45min. During dinner it was so crowed and loud that i had to yell to talk to my date. Very lit up and not intimate at all. Our server was too busy to even give us refills. They also did not have a special desert for the holiday. I have had way better dates at other high end restaurants on the strip during this holiday.  $300 later and we were disappointed.

LeZQw0fLcgAFcB4CgkTeRQ.text: First and foremost, my favorite steakhouse...  Oh my G!  Del Frisco's holds a special space in my heart.  My first Del Frisco steak was in NYC, the first weekend I went low carb in 2007, still low carb strong in 2013, I gauge a restaurant by the steak. . So sad to leave NYC, but I was so happy to find Del Frisco's in Vegas...we are regulars...Coming here about every 3 months.    We always order a bottle or two of wine, a chopped salad and  a Tomahawk Ribeye Waygu steak ample enough for two-about 32 ozs (12 oz bone and 20 oz of meat).  While it costs $90 bucks...it can be a value if each individual steak is starting at $45. BTW, TDF...nothing like it...impressive to the eye, like a Flintstone steak, big, beefy, hot, and  juicy... what is not to like?  Service is always impeccable, but we've definitely had some characters, such as Amber that flat out denied our frequent customer card because we were going to split a $500+ bill with another couple, but the next time our waiter was AWESOME!  He hooked us up, taking care of all 6 of us, but  still (I am pretty sure) sticking to their "make you feel like a million bucks" policy.   I HIGHLY recommend a sommelier to navigate the expansive wine menu...they always have good recs.  Tell them your price point and a few flavors or characteristics you like in a wine and they will help you find a gem.  Really take advantage, some of the best soms in Vegas.   While i am female, I love the old school massive testosterone feel of this restaurant.  I even saw a group of men walking to the restaurant still about a mile away and I said to my husband that "Yep, they are going to get some meat at Del Frisco's, before they start their night"  About 20 minutes after we arrived by car, they sure enough were walking into Del Frisco's.  I always chuckle at the Thank You card I receive in the mail  a few days after I devour my Tomahawk steak.  Nice touch.  IDK, I just love old school masculine feel...but I sure feel and get treated like a lady yet still can eat and enjoy like a "man".

MospdstiwNQEnH27Bxm6QA.text: Wonderful experience from the service to the food. Staff was friendly and attentive with bring annoying. Best lettuce wedge salad we have even had. Our filets were tender and flavorful. We will definitely be back.

ll51HHiNRTPamh3UcRGCRA.text: Ate here after having a not so good experience at another steak house. Was pleasantly surprised. Fit us in to a nice table, The food was great the room was not too loud and the bread was really good, along with the steaks of course. Will be back next time I am in town.

z_IScSjIb19oa0o_r2BvTQ.text: Let's just say I found a new favorite steakhouse when I visit vegas. The decor is amazing and service was top notch. Mastros was great but this place gives you a nice relaxed vibe when you want to get away from the usual vegas non-stop partying. I had the lobster tail and also the tomahawk steak. Two thumbs up !

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak

0MP2kPYNfbVeie0ekxEnGQ.text: The food was great as usual. I had the gumbo which had fresh okra and had a nice kick . The ship scampi was great. Sides were terrific  . However the service  was slow and we missed desert. I am headed back on sunday

zXz6I-rh4dUSz5vbuP_qbQ.text: Wow! I had heard of Del Frisco's before, but have never had a chance to visit one until I moved to town a couple of months ago. I went on my first night in Vegas, and it was the best welcome to town experience I could have ever hoped for!  Top notch service, great ambiance provided by the talented pianist, and best of all, the food.  I had the ribeye and it was PHENOMENAL. Juicy, delicious, and cooked to perfection. The Caesar salad was quite tasty, too. I went back a few weeks later and tried the Double Eagle, and that was also a winner.  Overall it is a wonderful establishment, and I can't wait to go back this coming week.

xTv6kSKXD1hGEbQq5xtAMA.text: Sunday's fixed menu is the way to go.  Appetizer, salad and entree.  Filet Mignon was the best I've ever had!

a2NI2PeR9DIjR2bldkXBMQ.text: Heard about this place because of its great Yelp reviews so decided to check it out.  There is a good reason it has 4.5/5 stars with almost 800 reviews. It is a very chill yet classy setting inside. I like the fact it is off the strip so it isnt overly crowded and touristy but yet it is still busy.  Everyone was very friendly from the hostess, to the bartender to the server and the manager also touched down at our table after the meal.   We got the seafood/shell fish appetizer to start that had crab claws, crab legs, oysters and shrimp which was a bit expensive maybe for the size of the platter but overall great quality. They could have maybe threw an extra crab leg or claw on there.  We also split a wedge salad that was on point.   For the main course we both got the lump crab cakes in lobster sauce which were amazing. Some of the best crab cakes we have had in Vegas. Im sure the steaks are great too but we have been shying away from red meat as of late.    It is a very nice establishment and you should dress accoringly not your shorts, flip flops or tank top kind of place.   Overall a great experience and we will visit again sometime!

zmQTVeYrcYg4enNnXWozLQ.text: I thought I had experienced a good cut of meat until I went here.    I'm not big on atmosphere but if I'm going to pay for a nice meal, then it matters.  This place has a perfect old-school leather and wood boardroom feel.  The menu is simple- steak, seafood and sides.  No trendy fusion fare with unicorn horn or rainbow dust.  This place simply serves the best meats with best ingredients and meticulous preparation.  The sides were basic but tasty and perfectly complimented the entre.    Yes, it's a franchise but it's a damn good one.  It's not cheap however the quality and service make it worthwhile.  The only problem is that it practically ruined me for other steak houses.    Simply great steak.  Correction: simply excellent steak.

mEj2t1YN3CWWvBXuG76S1Q.text: 4.5* Really?  Yea, the James Bond table is cool but after the second time the laser beams shined straight into my eyes, I had enough of it.  We were in a hurry to eat and get back to the hotel for a planned eventful evening that ended up turning into an uneventful evening due to my ability to sleep at anytime anywhere. But I digress. I got the Bone-In Ribeye, which was delicious. It had a good amount of fat to balance out the medium-rare lean meat.  He had the signature "Double Eagle" steak and boy was that bad. It was like my ribeye but with all of the life sucked out of it, then repackaged for more money.  It was too thick, hard to cut, and too lean.  The two of us ended up finishing the ribeye and we took the majority of the very pricey Double Eagle steak back.  I guess we were planning a late-night snack but when we saw the box in the morning, we contemplated giving our $65 steak to a bum.

BtFtOHZbkiau6oz_C39PrA.text: Love love this place! My family took me for my BD when we  Were in town. I had the best steak & since I am unable to eat  Gluten, which our waiter picked up on I received sorbet with a candle. I would highly recommend del Friscos if your in Vegas!

BipikukAFrA-Xj2VEdN6GA.text: While I was in Vegas in February and waited for my friends to get ready for a night out on the town, I was watching TV and Del Frisco's came on as one of the restaurants in Vegas to try out.  Immediately I bookmarked it and decided to give it a whirl for my birthday this weekend.  I was not disappointed!!  My friend made reservations at 5:30pm on Saturday for our party of three.  Del Frisco's is located a short cab away (about $10 from Encore).  We arrived and were seated immediately.    The Appetizer:  *Steak Tartare - Yummy!  The tartare was tender and flavorful.  I will admit, I did miss the egg you usually mix in, but the dish was still delicious.  The Meat: *Bone in Ribeye Wagyu - Yum! My friend and I decided to split the wagyu since it was a 32 oz cut of meat.  The meat was delicious, extremely flavorful, and cooked to a perfect medium rare.   The Sides: *Spinach Supreme - MMMM...Definitely a must order!  The spinach was creamy and had pieces of bacon in every bite (bacon does make everything better). *Lobster Mac & Cheese - Good.  The top of the dish had a nice panko like crisp to it.  But...where was all the lobster?  I sat there picking through the mac and cheese and noticed there was not much lobster meat. *Chateau Potatoes - Pass. I'm not much of a fan of potatoes so maybe that's why I didn't enjoy the dish.  To me, it tasted similar to a warm potato salad.  SERVICE: FABULOUS!  The hostesses greeted us as we walked in and wished me a happy birthday.  Our waitress, Kelsey, was great.  She was helpful, good natured, and friendly.  She checked on us regularly and made sure the meal was to our liking.  While she cut into our meat to make sure it was to our liking, there were three servers going around, each serving us a scoop of one of the sides.  For those looking to also drink, Del Frisco's does have a fully stocked bar.  Oh yeah, one of the cutest things I've seen at a restaurant, in addition to the slice of lemon cake for my birthday, I was given a signed birthday card from the staff.  Thanks to my friends and Del Frisco's to the fabulous birthday dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare

hNle4W61dGDXDBXFPYAc1Q.text: This place is crazy expensive but has delicious food. Great service and high end atmosphere.

kxFSX4unP9rRNwwxIvdxeA.text: Wish I could give half stars, but it's about as close to a 5 star as possible. Having been on the Strip for a few days and dining there, my party wanted to venture out a bit, try something new and classy. Ended up here at Del Frisco's. For a restaurant of this class, you would expect impeccable service. Impeccable is exactly what we got. Hostess, waiters and waitresses were all extremely attentive.   Our waiter started off by introducing all the specials they had that night, including their house specialty drink called the "V.I.P". Essentially a pineapple juice for adults and it was delicious. Looking at the menu, it was difficult to choose what to order. Started off the dinner with a Del's salad, which was iceberg lettuce, grape tomatoes, croutons, topped with a light yet flavorful avocado ranch dressing and two strips of bacon.   But what we were here for was definitely the steak. I was tasked with the impossible; trying to choose between the 8 or 12 oz Filet or the 16 ounce Prime Ribeye, but the Ribeye eventually won out. Cooked to exactly my preference of medium-rare with my only complaint being a tad bit too much char. It was definitely a good choice as the marbling was there, but no overwhelming. Flavors and juiciness still intact. When you're nitpicking about the amount of char on the steak, which was pretty negligible, you know the quality you're getting.  However, the highlight of the meal wasn't even the steak; it belonged to the sides and appetizers. That Crab Cake, not a hint of fishiness, paired with a Cajun Lobster Sauce is something to die for. I love the way they serve side dishes also. Family style is definitely the way to go, as it allowed my party to try multiple sides. My favorite sides were the Maque Choux Corn and Chateau potatoes (basically cream corn and mashed/whipped potatoes). Other side dishes available were the Spinach Supreme, Potatoes au Gratin, and the Lobster Mac and Cheese, all of which were great.  Topped off my night with a slice of the lemon cake. Fluffy, light, not too sweet, with a strong hint of the lemon flavor. The priciest dinner I've ever had, but sure was worth every dollar. I would go back in a heartbeat to try the other appetizers and cuts. Highly recommend for the ambience, service, and of course the food.

m9XISp6lmkpcL2zXeXHP4w.text: Service was on point and food was delicious! Really enjoyed our Valentine's Day date here! Can't wait to return :)

KFDl61FyHl870ha1QXgnCA.text: Could not have asked for a better dinner!!  GREAT FOOD!!!!!!  You get huge portions including your entree.  We had to wait a while to get a seat on what looked like a very slow night.  The manager found us waiting outside on the patio and immediately got us seated.  The steaks were great!  Watch out for the plates because they are so hot the food comes out still sizzling.  The place is most definitely an upscale restaurant.  I would go there again on my next visit to LV.  Just save up before you go.  LOL.

XhdYGqQ9tO-KTxPmR3nAAA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! The steaks here are superb and the crab cakes are to die for. The drinks are delicious and the fact that they serve hot fresh baked bread simply puts it over the top for me. The sides are yummy and fresh and the service is exceptional. The staff is friendly and makes you feel like a VIP. The sides are served table side to each person before being set in the middle family style. I wish I had saved room for dessert but the extra dirty martinis took up room for dessert. Well, guess I'll have to go back next time!

7cEqFBWOybd34Gi7n1kygA.text: This restaurant came highly recommended  by Yelp.  The food didn't disappoint.  I had the filet which was excellent.  We also had the broccoli and cheese which was quite tasty.  The reason it only scored a 3 for me was the service.  We weren't greeted by the waiter until 10 minutes in to sitting down.  He didn't apologize for his tardiness.  Then We were charged twice for the wine.  Again without apologies.    If you are going to 5 stars, you better bring the whole package.  My friend and I had a debate about this and said they don't have  the "Michael Jordan" wait staff on a Thursday night and I'm a bit harsh on the score.  My contention is that acknowledging the customer and providing a correct bill is not hitting a phenomenal 30 foot shot to win the game but rather the simple layup with no one guarding you.

RwQ_D_-jI4GG-bNTrHBRCQ.text: I'm not going to fall in line here with the 5 star treatment for Del Frisco's.  Sorry.   I've had a lot of great steaks, and while the 16 ounce prime strip that I ate half of was excellent, it just wasn't one of the best Ive ever had.  Del Frisco's seasoning is quite overpowering if you aren't ready for it, and by overpowering I mean--SALTYCALAFRAGILISTICEXPIALISALTY!    I tasted all 6 steaks that were served to our table, and all of them were similarly over-salted.  I understand that places like this have their "style", and perhaps this is just the way they serve meat. However, for a person who usually gets annoyed with incessant "Mny dnish nis tnoo snalty" type people to get salted-out by his chunk of meat, there must be some salt in that mofo!  Four stars are because the service here was awesome.  Our waiter was very nice, and extremely gracious.  He even hesitated to politely inform us that we forgot to tip him on a $600 tab (we assumed the gratuity was already added...our bad).  Piano man with the drum machine and crazy Falsetto was off the hook (he even rocks the synthesized horn section... very chic). He whipped out a smooth jazzy version of Ray Charles's "You Don't Know Me"  upon request without batting an eye.  And the MF'n place gives you all the free golf tees and jelly beans that you can carry!!  Damn, I almost wanted to give it five stars just for that! (big golfer here, not so big on jelly beans, but the lady is)  Oh, and the lemon cake was bomb.   4 estrellas.

QrgsISHInEdch66XC2WCPA.text: Went here awhile back when I was in Vegas for a bachelor party.  My buddy picked this place out cause it got so many great reviews.  So we went here on a saturday night before we went out on the strip and this place was packed.  Literally packed.  Even with our reservation, I think we waited a little but I didn't mind that.  It's saturday night and the place was booked.   We finally got seated at our table and after they took our order, they brought us some garlic bread.  I could not stop eating the bread...it was damn good.  It's like they sprinkled crack on it.  I ordered the Porterhouse and the thing was the size of a calf.  Seriously, it might have been the biggest steak I've ever consumed.   24 oz of madness but in a good way.   The steak was very juicy and tender.  They could not have done a better job with this gorgeous piece of meat.   If you're in Vegas, I recommend you check this place out.  Definitely worth it.

4C8pzs8fCFzEQXasXB5aqA.text: We were served/waited on by at least 4 staff who were all very friendly, conversational and professional.  The food was excellent - filet mignon, asparagus, potatoes au gratin, banana bread pudding (must-have).  The ambiance was very classy, the live music was soothing and subtle.  The place is located in an office park just off the Strip on Paradise Road.  Will definitely go again next time we're in town.

mVg99GHZqL9coW0b265LgQ.text: This was easily the best steak dinner I have ever had and one of the very best meals I have ever had.  The rib-eye was cooked to perfection - perfect medium-rare and the seasoning was just enough and not overbearing.  I woke up the next day craving another.  The side dishes were all fantastic sounding.  We had the baked macaroni and cheese (with blue cheese as well as other cheeses) and it was out of this world.  The creamed spinach was delicious.    From the warm, freshly baked break brought out to the table, to the dark wood and old-style interior, to the excellent service we had - this place was outstanding.  Their wine list is extensive - think small city phone book.  Many excellent choices.  Not inexpensive but what nice restaurant offers a cheap wine list?  And for Vegas - was actually reasonable.  The food prices were actually very reasonable compared to the hotel steak houses (actually on par or less than the steak houses here in the Bay Area as well.)  And I seriously doubt any one of them is this good.  I WISH this place was here in the Bay Area - I'd go more often (so maybe my waistline wouldn't be so happy!)  For dessert we had their house speciality - the lemon cake.  Ginormous piece (split between 2 or 3 people for sure.)  I am of the mind that if it is not chocolate, why eat it - but this was very, very good.  We shut the place down, literally no one else there but the staff and they never rushed us out while we finished our wine.  Can't say enough about how great the service was.  And yes - bathrooms were spotless and well stocked.  And this was at the very end of the night after a busy Saturday night crowd.  If you want a good steak dinner while in Vegas, I highly recommend veering off the strip (4 minute cab ride from The Wynn) and away from the hotels and coming here.

bL9XM1f_f7mF0tNLz7bxxw.text: One of the best steaks I have ever had.  This place has the total high-end restaurant feel without the attitude that normally goes with it.  Great decor and well dressed friendly staff.  I had a fantastic filet, the asparagus with toasted sliced almonds was crisp and tasty. The spinach was great in that it retained the spinach flavor that normally gets lost when you cream it.  The potatoes were good. The sides are huge so we each ordered one and worked them family style.  They had an okay selection of beer but their house pineapple martini, where they soak a pineapple in vodka, let it sit then press it was out of this world.  Totally worth it.

kNnOHL6BrGouJmufZcit6Q.text: $38 dollars.  That's what it cost for the best piece of meat I have ever tasted and it was worth every penny.  I have been to Morton's, Abe & Louie's, Smith & Wollansky's, Del Frisco's  has them all beat.  It was a 12 oz filet and absolutely amazing.  The sides of creamed corn, mashed potatoes, veggies, etc are well worth it.  We started out with a seafood platter of crab, shrimp and oysters.  Fantastic but too much if you are getting a entree.  The service was outstanding, waited on hand and foot by a warm, friendly and knowledgable staff.    The wine list is a dream list for the wine lover however the mark up is way too high except for the high rollers.  Best deal on the list was the Salentin Malbec for $40, (retails for $18).  Great time and will be back when the wallet can afford it.  If you hit the Vegas location, ask for Josh.  Great server!

THnMOpIWeQ-DWnVSY28OHQ.text: I had never really heard of this place before my initial visit. We came here during one of our Legendary Vegas trips. It was an extremely early dinner. Had to be because we had a long night of boozing ahead of us and let's face it. Nobody wants to throw up a $90 meal.  Del Frisco's is an amazing steak house that prides themselves on quality food and service that makes you feel like a king. We were a party of approximately 12. We had very polite and courteous waitress that I honestly wouldn't mind taking home to momma. She was amazing. Despite lame advances of my friend at the end of the dinner, she kept it professional. Aside from her, they had an army of servers. No joke. Our drinks were refilled constantly. Never were our cups half full.  The steak itself was amazing. I got the Prime Ribeye and it was cooked exactly how I like it. Slightly bloody, still twitching and spiced to perfection. The side dishes are family style. We ordered a hand full of them that covered everyone. I wasn't as impressed with the side as my friends were but they complimented the meal very well. As soon as the sides came out, the army of servers circled the table and attacked, literally...  "Sir, would you like some corn?" "Sir, would you like some Potatoes Au Gratin?"" "Sir, would you like some Asparagus?" "Sir, would you like some Mac and Cheese?"  It was quite overwhelming, but in a good way. Great service. Definitely a spot I would recommend if you're looking for a pretty money steakhouse in LV.

Cup0WIWc6-KrBgv8ro230w.text: Decadent from the 6oz filet, to the loaded baked potato, to the avocado dressing on the salad, to the most luscious lemon cake... Need I say more!  Btw matt is a phenomenal waiter...

5KIC9Xmj6SGdsKQnSAnAWA.text: Really expensive but also really good. The VIP martinis are also to die for. Be ready for superb service and mouth watering steak. Ordered the 8 oz. filet mignon with broccoli and potato au gratin on the side. Best $75 I've spent on dinner.

CAVaYVNVFw05K5plJm2Ong.text: I do not believe in god. But I do believe in Steak. There is only one other place that I have had a steak that rivals Del Frisco's but that is a different review. I recommend a special I was fond of years ago that is not mentioned anymore, but they are willing to make for you if you ask for it. It is 3 pieces of Filet (about 3 ounces ea.), each cooked to your preference and topped with 3 different sauces. 1) is a cream sauce with crab, 2) is a butter truffle sauce (my favorite) and 3) (I cannot remember, go find out weirdo). I also usually order a side of something green and 99% of the time it's the butter, sauteed broccoli. The wine selection is great and the bar is very good. Tip the piano player, tip the excellent service and before you leave, ask about the secret JAMES BOND TABLE (it's so frakn cool)!

04ojssUC2NmweV4U1Fkuow.text: Loved my filet mignon the crab cakes are delish and go with the del salad! i cant wait to go back in November when we visit vegas. Tatiana our server was just top notch!

uHN1qH7Ma2Upazwq4hTfXg.text: This little gem is hidden inside a commercial business park, a huge contrast to the glitz and glam of the Strip two short blocks away.  The interior was wood grained and elegant, typical for a steakhouse of its stature.    The sesame bread served upon sitting was nothing spectacular, I would have preferred the onion rolls served at Morton's.  The wine menu was several pages long, it was fun just perusing through the different varieties of wine (most which I couldn't afford).  I ordered the bone-in ribeye like the rest of my party, it was superb.  The seasoning was absolutely perfect, each bite was divine.  The sides were excellent, I've never tasted such exquisite potatoes au gratin and macaroni and cheese like that before.    The lemon cake was good, but nothing to write home about.  The service was excellent, for the servers were very knowledgeable, but never seemed hurried at all.  Not a cheap place, but I think everyone should treat themselves occasionally, especially in Vegas.    Overall a great experience, and they even sent a handwritten thank you card!

8mZxlMAW0CkCdREBNiy24A.text: average at best.  the place smells musty/like cooked food. Needs to be aired out and carpets replaced. Service was OK. I dont mind spending the $ on a good steakhouse, this place would be fine for most punters, but if you have ever eaten at a great steakhouse, then this will disappoint.

aZDL3Xeo_0Atglw6rFBUVQ.text: I've been to many great steakhouses.  Peter Luger's, Manny's, Magnums, Domenico's, Cutz.  This had the BEST rib-eye!  Wait staff was on their game.  Everything was perfect!  Pricey (parted my hair - or what's left of it), but worth the splurge!  Moderate selection of wine, but seem to have enough good ones.

4tQAUTZ2VcEK-atK_wzQwg.text: First to say that my husband and I are Steakhouse people, and quite picky. My father ran the butcher shop in my small hometown, and I expect high quality. That being said, my husband and I were in LV for our 10th wedding anniversary, and Del Frisco's came highly recommended.  When our hotel made the reservation, the restaurant was informed it was a special ocassion and we were treated like royalty!  Atmosphere is romatically dim, hushed voices, pleasant music overhead.   Food. OH MY GOODNESS!!  My husband had the apptizer special of Alaskan crab legs - a huge plate full. I had the hand-crafted onion rings, to die for!  Prime Rib, and my fillet were cooked to perfection. Their meat is 'wet aged', and perfectly cooked!! Tender, not mushy, didn't need the steak knife at all!   Service: Since it was a very special ocassion, we got lots of attention! The resaurant was pretty empty when we arrived for a 5pm reservation and by 6pm, the bar was full and patrons were arriving for dinner, and the service was still great! We took a limo to and from the restaurant, and our server called for the car, walked us outside to say goodnight. Very special evening.  I agree with the other reviews, the Lemon Cake - HEAVEN! We left the restaurant dizzy with food overload!

C39U892nudD72cI-ALV5MA.text: By far, THE best steak I have had in my entire life. The service was PHENOMENAL! Every restaurant should be like this one when it comes to service and attentiveness.   While it might be a tad on the expensive side, I can honestly say its worth every penny and more!   I loved it so much that I am flying to Vegas just to eat at this place again for my birthday.

X5L2diRe5J0Du9oc4L_aaA.text: This was our first time to this location of Del Frisco's.  The restaurant was empty (and its SAT night...hmm....) other than one table for two in which they seat us right next to that table......and by the back area where all of the servers hang out and talk LOUDLY.  The service was not great as the only other table that came in was a large party of 12 which they shifted tables and put them right next to us.  So, our server completely abandons us and goes to help them. (Why not one of the other 20 servers standing there talking?????)  I had to finally flag down someone to get our check!  Food was ok, nothing spectacular, just OK.  Too many other fabulous steak and seafood places to go to for the same price point such as Mastro's which I highly recommend.  MUCH better ambience and top notch service there at Mastros! Del Frisco is an outdated, stuffy feeling place and for what ever reason, it smells like the sewer in there but it may be just the old carpet.  DEFINITELY needs updating.  There are too many other great places in Vegas to go here again...not for us!

G6-4SoP9atvxihNeRqJUjw.text: Excellent! We had the following: Vodka-infused Pineapple Martinis - very tasty and refreshing Oysters on the half-shell - very fresh Chopped Salad w/ Basil Cream Dressing (special) - best salad we've ever had Weygu Ribeye (14" bone) - well prepared and melt in your mouth Sauteed mushrooms and Sauteed onions - great accompaniment to the steak Fresh berries - nice palate cleanser Lemon cake - too full to properly taste, but looked good  We will definitely return!

_DclEgJnUXRwafxYU6b77g.text: Thanks again Yelpers for suggesting an amazing steakhouse while in Vegas last weekend!  It's everything you think a steakhouse should look like. Dimly lit, beautiful decor, pleasant waitstaff.     I chose to get the filet mignon/jumbo shrimp and our table split a bunch of sides.  The filet was juicy, tender, and literally melted in my mouth.  The shrimp were HUGE, and very flavorful. I recommend the macaroni and cheese-it's the first time I've ever had blue cheese mac n' cheese and I was pleasantly surprised!!  My friend was very ambitious, and decided to order the pound and a half bone-in ribeye and proceeded to eat the entire thing. Very impressive.  They also hooked up our table with some free desserts because we were celebrating two birthdays!    I definitely recommend this place if you are craving a delicious steak and overall amazing dining experience!

w_Sm9tQvFmMECZGJzFop_g.text: *******Updated:  Del Frisco's reaches out to me about this experience looking to understand how they could make things right for me, collaborate on how they could improve for future guests, and to let me know that the guest verifying their steak by cutting it has been part of their tradition for decades.  I am completely satisfied by this response and look forward to dining at the upcoming Del Frisco's in Pittsburgh, PA to give them another shot and hopefully more positive review!  Original experience below.  Pro tip: if you aren't satisfied, speak up!  They can only make it right if you tell them.  16 oz Prime ribeye had little marbling, tough veins of gristle and was so over salted and peppered that all steak flavor was completely overwhelmed.  medium rare was totally purple for all but the 1/8th inch around the edge.  I didn't send it back because I don't mind rate and don't like drama, but comeGetting it cooked right is pass and catch and should not be a struggle for a dedicated steakhouse.    Easily the worst prime grade steakhouse steak I've eaten.  Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Hyde park, and any of the big chains, etc. are better.   Super disappointing for the high end price point.  2 stars instead of 1 because the stone bar is really cool, but seriously, an Outback steak would be better.

4sXwWsdbdW12QPLHFD0nSA.text: I think I need to be done with this chain. Horrible experience. Was there with a group so I had no choice because thats where they decided to go. I would have rather spent my money at a slot machine-the odds would have been better that I would have enjoyed myself. Food horrible-service even worse. 3 tries for a simple 8oz filet mignon medium. Sides (asparagus and mashed potatoes) came after we ate our steaks. 1/2 the table was served the other half waited and waited and waited. The excuse "we are busy tonight" then turn people away if you cannot provide quality food and service because I paid for a good meal and service and I did not get that. I bet I would have gotten that at McDonalds!  Epic fail-Never again unless I have no choice because of work and then I just order a salad and be done. HORRIBLE experience for a lot of money!  And not even an apology but we were offered a sip of port wine.  I do ha e to tell you that the General manager of the restaurant called me and was empathetic and apologetic. I was made to feel like a called customer and she turned my frien up side down!   Kudo's and I will try the location again because of this call.

-XHwpZuYwgHDSvkUuxT-UA.text: I was really looking forward to going to this place. The reviews are great, we've heard from friends how great this place is, the food, the service, double eagle, blah, blah, blah. Well DON'T waste your money here, if you want all that go to Hugo's Cellar at a fraction of the price. I will give my food review then the service review. Disclaimer: We went on Valentine's Day 2/14/18 this is our anniversary. When we made reservations they asked us if this was a special occasion we said yes and we understood the busyness of this day so maybe just maybe this review would have been different had it been any other day.   We had ice tea and coke, the tea was good and the soda was brought in a small glass coke bottle and a glass of ice, which is typical of a higher end restaurant. We don't drink so I can't review the wine service although the wine selection is extensive. We also were brought a small loaf of sesame bread with butter while we waited for our dinner.  I had their Del Frisco's salad with their avocado ranch type dressing. It was a typical tossed salad with two cherry tomatoes sliced in half, two croutons and two thick slices of bacon across the top. Was it worth $11.00 well no, but the price is also typical of this type of restaurant. The bacon was very thick and was serve in whole pieces. I had to use the butter knife provided to cut the bacon which was not effective so I had to use my hands not a big deal but I would have preferred the bacon pre-cut or a knife provided.  For sides which are family style and ala cart we had the lobster and cheese mac at 18.00, as well as the creamed spinach 12.50.  Both were decent and flavorful, the lobster mac n cheese was well worth the price. I would say it was delicious and the lobster in the mac n cheese was very tender more so than the lobster tail we ordered. (More on the lobster tail below). The cream spinach was good and flavorful.  We also each had ordered the prime rib eye at $58 dollars.  What we received was the prime strip which was also $58 we didn't get what we had ordered and I did not realize it until my husband pointed it out but it was so busy and the prime strip was delicious cooked to perfection.  This is probably why I'm giving this review 3 stars. The horseradish sauce was very good I had the creamy my husband had the raw horseradish.   My husband ordered the broiled lobster tail which is carved table side. At $6 an oz. this was very pricey. We had the 16 oz enough to share with each other. The lobster unfortunately was by no means tender and the heated butter which was served with it was flavorless this was a huge disappointment to both myself and my husband. (Hugo's cellar lobsters were a bit smaller, but very tender and a fraction of the cost, also carved table side)  Service: the service was good despite the Valentine "holiday" crowd. We had a nice young lady named Erica she did her job well despite the wrong order of the steak. The problem I think we had was the restaurant is very large and has several rooms to serve the crowd that came, although they only used one room to serve the crowd so it was very crowded and very, very loud not at all an intimate setting. I'm sure there is reasoning for this but we noticed two separate room tables ready but no one in either of these rooms. We were really having a hard time talking to each other and we heard everyone's conversations close to us and even sitting three tables down, I assume because everyone was trying to talk over each other. It was just really loud no at all what I expected.   We've been to Hugo's and for Valentine's Day we would have to make reservations three months in advance which we will next time. I just had to compare what you get for the price you pay and the value even for these higher price places for which some people money is no object . For my husband he works hard and his way that he splurges is through his stomach he loves food and loves to try new places. He had to admit he didn't think it was worth the cost. When you can get a great steak elsewhere in town at a fraction of the cost why would you go somewhere and spend the amount and it's just not worth it. Restaurants that have steaks just as great are listed below: Hugo's Cellar  Herb's n Rye (Go during happy hour the steaks are half price)  Golden steer

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz broiled lobster at $6 an oz you&#39;d think it wouldn&#39;t be so tough. The butter was flavorless. So disappointed.

c4JBji_x-FXnjB0etGbdIA.text: Okay this might be a little bit long but I just love, love, love this place! Did I say that I LOVE THIS PLACE! Five years ago we held our wedding reception here complete with 21 close family and friends. Best choice we could have made. The servers were very attentive then, and 5 years later they still uphold the same high level of attentiveness. Just the right amount too. Not like some places where your server is back at your table every 5 minutes to the point where you wish they would just let you enjoy your food!  Let's talk about food. EVERYTHING, and I do mean EVERYTHING on this menu has your food palate watering! Deciding what to order is going to be tuff, but no worries, you won't be disappointed with your final decision. Portions are very generous, and in direct proportion to the quality and price for your meal. Desert anyone? Okay, but you'll have to get it to go it you plan on finishing it. Cheesecake is my favorite. The 7 layer lemon cake is my husband's favorite.   Oops! Almost forgot mention that you must start the night with their signature VIP's!!!!!!!  If your ever in the Dallas TX area visit that location as well. You will be greeted with the same great service, food, and overall experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature VIP&#39;s!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MWdqM-swZHbS4pzO_l4ErA.text: I came here a year ago with my love and some friends and we came back tonight. My last visit I ordered the filet and tonight I ordered the king salmon. It appears in the last year they did a bit of remodeling and it looks really nice. I adore the crystal chandeliers. The food and the service were fantastic as always.

eYXhCcGmVuPcFIm2se-s_A.text: Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday.  Food ended up great, it's what I'd expected for a steakhouse and the bread was definitely good!  The service was interesting...it was sort of awful for how many people were around and checking in on us. but they were also super aware and did a lot to try to make it better.  Hiccups included : taking away our bread plates after we asked for more bread, needing us to ask for wine / drink top ups multiple times, overcooking our steaks, coming in confused when they came to check in, apologizing a tonne.  That said, they were super nice about the whole thing, and gave us 25% off.  They were also nice enough to give the birthday girl a card, and let us bring in our own cake without a cake fee.    All in all, I'd try them again.

soDPVqu6ps2dOPaILp_Qnw.text: I had THE BEST COCKTAIL IVE EVER HAD. We showed up before dinner. I had the best cocktail I've ever had. Ron is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fd092R0SnuIsL-wqe27jlQ.text: Excellent food with a superb service. It is not too common to see a dry aged lamb on the menu and it was the best steak i ever had. If you like earthy dry aged steaks, then you should try their 14 days (im not too sure how many days it was) dry aged lamb.  Also, their bread pudding dessert was amazing.
