LqEitQdkvqNwNu7nyFGHhQ.text: Exceptional is how I would describe del Frisco's. The experience almost surpassed the food because the service was exceptional. Everyone from the host to the manager and sommelier made sure our experience was extraordinary. I highly recommend getting the full experience and starting with some crab cakes, followed by a house salad paired with a recommended wine, and spoiling yourself with lobster and steak. My boyfriend ordered the tomahawk steak and I have no idea how they perfectly caramelized it on the outside, JUST on the outside, and kept every centimeter inside perfectly cooked to order. My boyfriend ordered his steak med rare, and no part of it was cooked differently. They carved my lobster for me at the table, and brought me a heated saucer with butter to dip, as well as bringing me garlic butter I asked for.  Do yourself a favor and get dessert too, we had a dessert cocktail that tasted like it was made with haagan daz ice cream, as well as the cinnamon white chocolate creme brulee that tasted like horchata! Our server went above and beyond, but honestly the managers served as just as much as she did! They are so hands on here, and every detail was minded by the entire staff. Thank you del Frisco's for being a huge highlight of our trip to Vegas. Next time, I'm getting the biggest lobster!

lsjclpHragZQyAQLi2D-Xg.text: When we first saw down our table was covered in rose petals because we were celebrating our second wedding anniversary! That was really special! We also got complimentary dessert at the end of the meal. They literally served two full desserts on a plate. I've seen it where fancy restaurants give a small tasting of dessert but this was two full size ones and they were unbelievably good. The chocolate lava cake and the butter cake, unreal.  The dinner was delicious but even more memorable was the service! Our waitress (we can't remember her name but do remember she lived and/or was from NJ) was really amazing! She was very attentive and energetic and made our meal very enjoyable.   The food was also really great. We had a gift certificate from the holidays to use here and so we got a lot of different dishes to try. We had the Caesar salad, bacon appetizer, crab cakes, and porterhouse for one. The sides were Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. My favorites were the bacon, Caesar salad, and mashed potatoes.   I was absolutely recommend this restaurant! It's pretty close to the strip and was just a $7 LYFT ride. Try it and hopefully you get the same waitress we had!

WW-UuRxcSipJolZooqUA_A.text: Heaven on Earth! Best place in Vegas for steaks. Check out the Janes Bond room prior to dinner. They also have an outdoor smoking lounge.

EFci-DTBvzp3ChpDnotSGg.text: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Las Vegas is by far the best dining experience that my husband and I have had. We make a point to go to a fancy restaurant every year for our anniversary. This year we happen to be visiting Las Vegas the weekend prior and had received an open table gift card for Christmas. We had many restaurants to choose from and after about 4 hours of my reading reviews we chose this one. My first impression of this place was that they were professional, a few days prior we received a reminder phone call. All though I was looking forward to the dinner and had not forgotten it was a nice gesture. We arrived early, mostly because we are really prompt people. We were seated very quickly at a really sweetly set table. It had rose petals and a card signed by the staff wishing us a Happy anniversary. Our waiter Roland was extremely knowledgeable of the menu. Our meal consisted of the following   Starter  SHANGHAI-STYLE FRIED CALAMARI Dinner THE DOUBLE EAGLE" 45 DAY DRY AGED DOUBLE BONE PRIME RIBEYE CREAMED SPINACH CHATEAU MASHED POTATOES The steak was cooked perfect, all the sides are shareable we ordered to much, one would have been enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0lFdLCVquqHzLl5ZVIp0rQ.text: I had dinner here while in town for a convention / trade show.  I had one of the best steaks I've ever had. The 12oz. bone-in filet... Excellent! The service was also outstanding. Only wish there was a location in LA.

Cnty8YBZd8r_G58DdBKRpQ.text: Kudos to these guys and especially our server Chris. We had a last minute CES cancellation and we needed a dinner for 20 people with only one day's notice. They were able to accommodate us (including four more who showed up last minute) and exactly on time.  In the private wine cellar we had an amazing meal, served perfectly. Seafood platter was fantastic, the crab cake was unlike anything I've ever had. The steaks for 24 people were all brought out at the same time and were all perfectly cooked to order.   Easily one of the best dining experiences I've had, this will be a regular stop for us at CES and whenever we are in Vegas. Amazing.

lHhY3df7jXMhIbqQMONurA.text: Great customer service , super friendly and attentive but the food was super disappointing . The steak was all fat and the salmon was soggy and flavor less .

w8vDsjs5VXzmL5zkzQoeOw.text: This place is absolutely fabulous. You need to be prepared to spend about $100 per person, but you are going to have huge for portions. We enjoyed one of their already prepared tastings menus with a side of baked potato and we both got our own appetizer. I enjoyed the crabcake immensely and my dining partner had their delicious shrimp cocktail. The staff there was lovely and incredibly accommodating. For dessert due to the prepared menu, we each had our own. Cheesecake was delightful and also their key lime pie was beyond amazing.

zqAtdmpHMNGLmzUAL0HDkQ.text: Great meal and very nice service. Steaks were cooked just right. Drinks were good and never had to ask for a refill.    We had a party of seven and everything went great.

czTPMqG2evnjXHZEWj68aA.text: This place was awesome! Service was great! They were very personable! Dry aged ribeye, lobster Mac, butter cake...really it was all great! Only bummer we experienced was that our lobster tail was spoiled (nothing they could do about that) but they took care of it & us!

am744pVcsJTJRnvnPJuD3g.text: Made reservations for my birthday dinner since I was celebrating with my friends in Vegas.   We arrived on time and were promptly seated during Valentines weekend. I heard great reviews about the other locations so I was excited to try Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House.  I'm a carnivore and I dine at a lot of Steak Houses.  My friend said that she loves the New York location and the decor but to me the Las Vegas location falls below par.  It did not wow me at all.   The restaurant looked very busy.  We were seated at the back room on the right side when you enter.  Now, go figure with my luck that the restroom (only 1) is located at the other end of the restaurant.  :(    Our server was very nice and attentive.  She took the time to do a group shot of me and my friends.   Food:  22 oz Double Eagle Bone-In Prime Strip Lobster Macaroni & Cheese Baked Potato Baked Potato  Dessert:  Lemon Cake that was delicious  This restaurant did not leave me wanting to return at all and I was hoping it would.  It was not intimate but a loud atmosphere.   Props to the marketing/management team who sends out the thank you cards.  I did appreciate that.

5AGOwVJU8IBqRxkrtIowjg.text: I really enjoyed this place except for one thing;  Food 8/10 Cocktails 8/10  Pricing 6/10 Location 8/10 Music 8/10 Cleanliness 9/10 Overall atmosphere 8/10 Customer service from the hostess 10/10 Customer service from our waitress 10/10 Customer service from the GM 10/10 James Bond wine rack/table 10/10 The smell of old building or sewer as you walk into the restaurant 1/10!!!! :( Please do something about that smell.

pOPcQan5AnXrbRk98wLy4A.text: Best steakhouse in Las Vegas, amazing Rib Eye with Alaskan King Crab Legs heaven in your tummy.  The best lemon cake for our anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebrating our wedding anniversary,  so nice to receive a card signed by the staff. Lemon cake delish

ChbPJIjURGlo2hpR2ANAZA.text: Wow!  Great staff and very professional staff.  Worth every penny!  I'll definitely come back on my next trip.  I came early which was better because there wasn't as much of a crowd.  The cream brulee was amazing as well!

TWNDikNkhuou6hCXAA5h-g.text: A buddy of mine hosted dinner here last Thursday.  This is a good place, reminiscent of the classic steakhouse with live music.  Please see the pictures I have posted of the food we had.

6hU0KM0-HIFh2C0FCqBtmw.text: Place is awesome.  Great ambiance.  Dress attire is anywhere from casual to upscale.  Food was excellent.  I had the bone in filet and other 3 people had 12 oz filets at our table. Perfectly cooked.   Prices are reasonable as well for a las vegas steakhouse  our waitstaff was tremendous

3SI2IEu3L4yDUqv-WzNDFA.text: This place was by far the best steakhouse my husband and I have ever eaten. We started with the crab cake for an appetizer and it was phenomenal. The filets were thick and tender. So good! The sides come in proportions, big enough to feed 2-3 people so it's well worth the money to get a couple and share! Will definitely be back!

nDU86jamSn1F_egEslYTyw.text: Was recommended by a friend of mine while i was craving some steak so i made reservations got ready and headed down to Del Frisco's upon entering i felt the place was too crowded in the way their tables were set up . i had to squeeze my self between the waiter and the tables sitting next to us, the table was already set up with too many sets for just a party of two there was almost no space left on the table i had to move things out of the way in order to read the menus and then it gets really confusing.  there was three menus offering the same thing in different deals , the regular menu, the sunday menu and then a restaurant week special menu PLUS two more additional SPECIAL OFFERS the waiter mentioned and he tried to make sense of their overwhelming menu choices. i am a fan of simplicity and a fine dining restaurant with great food should not have such overwhelming choice of deals going on. finally got to order our choices for the night! THE ESCARGOT WAS DIVINE ! great choice. Then Shanghai Style Fried calamari was DELICIOUS! Then came the steaks! we order the Filet Mignon and The Porterhouse steak .. Both medium rare UNFORTUNATELY THEY WERE JUST DRY AND OVERLY SALTY. There was no juices left on the steak as if it was old, frozen or somebody had taken a towel and soaked all the juices out of the steak . no a single drop of juice on my plate . just a dry steak with some toppings .  i was very disappointed with the steak quality in this steakhouse,i didn't even finish my steak as i normally would clean my plate i left craving a good steak more then when i first entered. i have definitely had better

34ZK5giw9HeyoxfxJVHh2A.text: Had the best experience for our anniversary dinner at Del Frisco's last night.   There was a glitch in their reservation system and somehow our reservation was cancelled but the problem was handled promptly and we were seated right away,  Our server was Ro and she was great!  She was knowledgeable about the food and recommended a special cocktail that was delicious and she made us feel welcome. I ordered the filet and my husband had the ribeye. We also ordered the creamed spinach and Del Frisco's potatoes. Both steaks were outstanding and the sides complimented the meal perfectly. We brought a special bottle of Cabernet to enjoy which made the meal even more special. I would highly recommend dining at Del Frisco's for a truly special dining experience.

25NYNDYhR1byivIiyD4hGw.text: Wonderful ambiance, the are we sat in was near the bar and was narrow so with all the rich wood and glass it had the feel of eating in an old classy train car. But not confined or stuffy, just a classic San Francisco style steakhouse ( from Dallas). Food was top notch. We'll prepared and presented. We were three couples celebrating our anniversary. Table was sprinkled with fresh rose petals and anniversary cards signed by the staff. Our waiter, Freddis was very helpful and attentive all night without hovering or rushing us. We actually spent over three hours with drinks, appetizers, dinner and dessert (including a very nice trio of complimentary anniversary desserts). We all ordered off the Restaurant week menu plus other appetizers to start. Most had the files and ALL said they were probably the best steaks ever! I had the files medallions, excellent. My wife had the crab cakes. She thought they were ok but I tasted them and they were very good with huge lumps of crab meat. We were treated exceptionally well and we will go back for sure! Oh before I forget, the piano player and singer in the bar area was very accomplished and contemporary. I did not get his name but great music to accompany a great meal. Thank you Del Frisco's steakhouse!

fbcM3IwUVYGiNDwNXi7rZQ.text: By far the best experience I've had in a restaurant lately. Beyond amazing service, and the food was perfect. Waiter explained all the food perfectly, and was super friendly. The chef came out to meet us at the end of our meal. I will definitely be back, and i recommend 10/10.

vLAvvT4YpuseuiN8tE8evg.text: Haven't been in a about 6 years and I don't know why. The food and service is a A++++. I had group of 8 guys for dinner and everyone was full and satisfied. 6 of us had to take take a to go box for our leftovers. We order 4 apps (2 calamari 2 bacon slice) 5 sides (onion rings,Brussels sprouts, mashed potatoes, lobster mac and cheese, and the wild mushrooms) and everything tasted great. The servers served us all the sides and made sure our steak was cooked to our preference. I mentioned to my friends that sometimes fine dining is alittle salty and the waitress overheard me say that and offered to cook me another steak. What SERVICE. But my Steak was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Will  be in rotation every time I come to Sin City. Thank you Del Frisco Las Vegas for a memorable dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calimari

KD6w8q4A8-PTtSDMSrManA.text: Our party of nine came here for dinner for my brother's bachelor party weekend and we were not disappointed.  We arrived a few minutes before our reservation but ended up waiting about ten minutes.  At first, I was somewhat disappointed with the wait on a reservation, but I found out that since they had a last minute cancellation, we were moved to the Wine Cellar Room - probably the best room in the house in my opinion.  The wine cellar room was beautiful.  It made for a very personal but grand feel for our special dinner.  The service and food were top notch.  For dinner, we ordered a few appetizers, which were a good start.  Salads were good but unremarkable - your basic wedge salads.  The dinner was the star.  The entire party ordered a mix of the house specialty long-bone wagyu Rib-Eyes and Bone-in Strips.  Every steak without exception was cooked to temp perfectly.  The family style sides were presented by the servers and portioned on each of our plates for us - a mix of lobster mac and cheese, potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach.  Of course my favorite part of dinner was the wine.  As usual, and especially to accompany a good steak, we enjoyed 2010 Far Niente Cabernet - made for an excellent pairing to the steaks as expected.  After dinner, we had to forego dessert as those tomahawk steaks were huge.

MMp-fsA8Bw3LtMS5WWRIFA.text: I've had my fair share of steakhouses in Vegas and Del Frisco's rises to the top of the list. I like that it's not part of a casino that houses a steakhouse with marked up prices just to bring in the cash. That isn't to say that the prices are cheap, because they aren't, but Del Frisco's knows how to cook a steak. I came with my group of friends who were visiting for my friend's 30th birthday. The majority of us ended up ordering the $55 Sunday Prime Pair, which was a surf & turf of sorts, pairing an 8 oz. filet with a seafood option.  I started with the Del's salad, which had two big crispy strips of bacon to go along with salad topped with an avocado Caesar dressing. Next, I opted for the filet paired with the lemon-garlic scallops and fried capers. This piece of filet was one of the best, if not, the best cooked piece of steak I've ever had. When you say medium-rare, they actually cook it perfectly through and through. It was red and hot in the center and tender beyond belief. I enjoyed the scallops and the signature crab cake I tried was good too. But the focus was all on the filet. For sides, we shared the spinach supreme, chateau potatoes, baked potato, and maque choux corn. The portions were big enough for everyone to share each other's sides. My favorite was split between the spinach and the corn. Unless, you count the lobster mac 'n cheese as a side, which we also ordered. One order was more than enough to share between 7 people, but we went ahead and got a second for good measure. They don't skimp out on the lobster either. By some mix-up, we also ended up with truffle butter for our steaks. Yes, it was that extravagant.  The meal ended with a delicious pecan cheesecake topped with caramel. Many steakhouses have the same menu with similar salads, sides, and seafood. But, Del Frisco's just does it a little bit better. It's easy to drop more than a bill here, but remember what to order: the filet, lobster mac 'n cheese, maybe the spinach supreme. You will be set.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel pecan cheesecake

LGtgMNoBSnR1dHjk9Q3nfg.text: Had the pleasure of dining at this fine restaurant a few years ago with my adult daughter.  We had a wonderful dinner! The service was impeccable but most importantly, the food was delicious!!! We also enjoyed the James Bond table, a must see if you go there!

uxNhHeCL1hEezWbfwc3LTg.text: Awesome Bone In Steaks. Celebrating a Wedding and it is a perfect venue for that.  Great Service as well. What Happens in Vegas Stays in Vegas! This one I can tell you about....

DWEM7-KsKWxBRWerBHqt0g.text: Delicious steaks!  It's a traditional steak house and you can't go wrong.  Since I OD'd on meat the night before, I opted to get the lobster instead and it was delicious.  My husband got the ribeye with the bone marrow sauce on the side and it was divine!  You cannot go wrong with this place.   We also got an order of their lemon cake which was on steroids it was so huge.  Unlike most cakes it wasn't cloyingly sweet and it was quite refreshing to eat after our indulgent meal.  We had a party of 11 and surprisingly they did not include gratuity on the bill.    Perfect dinner and it was great service.  The drinks are served stiff and the meat is well done!  Bravo Del Frisco.

sVgmbJZ_pGLhPZaJp3zITg.text: Went here for my birthday dinner, I've been meaning to check this place out for awhile now. I had reservations and was seated right away, the bar seemed to have happy hour going on when we got there so I had there VIP martini since it was half price before 6:30, it was the most delicious martini I've ever had. For dinner me and my boyfriend got the pre fix menu that consisted of     Wedge salad, filet mignon with a crab cake, creamed spinach, an extra side we ordered was there famous lobster Mac and cheese. The server who I forget what his name was found out it was my birthday so he brought me a signed birthday card and lemon cake with  a candle I thought that was very sweet. Overall I will definitely come back great food, and excellent service. Thank you Del Friscos for making it a memorable birthday, you did not disappoint!!

mA-jx_Y0gBnu6nowYnzXig.text: This place is truly amazing! After trying multiple steak houses, the wife and I fail in love with Del Frisco's. The hostess were very polite and helpful, our server Erica was awesome, she recommended several menu options and even some off the menu options, which I took her advice and went with the halibut (sooooooo good) and all my friends and family know I don't really like seafood lol Thank you Del Frisco's for putting together a top notch staff, and thank you Del Frisco's STAFF for making our anniversary special and rememberable..

qUtjzrpC8MAV_072ry6eIw.text: My new favorite restaurant! Went here with a group of co-workers last year and decided to come back with my wife and friends. It was even better this time! Food is outstanding. My dry aged ribeye was probably the best I've had. Their side dishes put the menu over the top though. We literally ordered half of the sides menu. Service was impeccable; the manager was genuine and wanted to ensure a perfect experience, which was what we got. Thank you!

si8dZJsFBXr3GN7njxNY7A.text: After several visits since my first one over 3 years ago, I have the confidence to rank Del Frisco in the 5 star category.  Over the long term, service has been consistently excellent and the steaks are flavorful and delicious.   When your server remembers your name (and you remember hers...Pam - she rocks) and she remembers what drink you ordered and what drink your wife ordered on your last visit a month ago and treats you like an old friend it doesn't get better than that.    The rib eye (no bone) is my favorite.  I have had the tomahawk wagyu and that is excellent as well but I can never finish it because the portion is like Fred Flintstone size. The sides are simple and give your palette a variety. I focus on eating the juicy and delicious ribeye and hardly touch the sides or dessert.   Del Frisco...They know how it's done!

BNT9Yxo3XV2YL85Y5h6aYw.text: Great time .... We got there early and waited or our party to arrive we drinks and spoke to the emp.... The were so nice and when friends arrived we had first class service loved it and food out of this world.... We tryed everything and food quality was 5 star and had a team of servers waiting on our needs.... Felt like a king.... My to friends just got married and they brought out extra cake and drinks on the house which was so thought ful..... Clean and nice bar happy hour was doing good not a chair left at bar so happy hour here is rocking they say ?... Will be back for that for sure and the people eating here were dressed nice and had class good crowd felt just right had a great first time here want to say thank you to the staff and cooks you rock and made a Vegas memory for us all..... Steve and the Rocco tusscano party of 7

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good.... Drank a few bottles and loved the taste!!! Steve you have to try this!!!!

o9ZbIn8XdLYzascWRB7uBw.text: Had diner here 2 weeks ago with my wife and it was one of my top 3 dining experience's! We both ordered cocktails and they were nice and strong. They started us off with some delish bread and butter that I swore I was only going to taste..yea right we ate the whole thing! We then ordered the calamari app and it was incredible. If I wasn't in public I would have licked the plate clean. We then had the fillet's with crab cakes and sides of mashed and creamed spinach. Every aspect of the meal was spot on and to top it all off our server was absolutely incredible. I've already told all my friends and family about the place and can't wait to go back!

4OIPIZnDA7ZgkHcgya3gow.text: every thing was good.. the lamb was AWSOME!!  - 1 star cuz one of my firnds order was totally messed up

XmJrpcGlHSYDCbv0VTPg6Q.text: All I have to say is WOW. Like 3 fingers, mouth in O shape, 3 fingers. My old college friends and I decided to go on a vegas trip kinda like a reunion and wanted to eat at a nice place for dinner the first night. Oh yelp, this is why I love you. I just yelped steakhouse, las vegas and sure enough this place popped up with its 4.5 stars of glory. DID NOT DISSAPOINTTT.  The place itself has a real classy feel, yet not pretentious. Our server was super friendly and he joked around w us as we took thug life pictures w the ginormous steak knives they gave us. (Yes, my friends and I are the pillars of maturity =))We started off with the crabcake. ( notice I say cake and not cakes) They only give you one, but shoot that one crabcake was probably one of the best ive tried. Surrounded by a creamy delicious sauce that was almost like a soup of its own, the crab cake was indeed FULL of crab. Advice: dip bread in sauce as not to let the sauce go to waste.. its bomb! Got the Bone in Rib eye, its 22 oz, so my friend and I shared. Zommg! Now that is steak, perfectly crispy salty on the outside, pink center on the inside, you will not leave one bite leftover. I usually don't eat the fat, but shoot their fat was even good! Mmm faaaatttt..    Our server told us that the sides are pretty big, they are kind of family style here, so we shared broccoli in white wine and garlic sauce, and lobster mac and cheese, both of which were plentiful and suppppperb in taste! And our steaks were paired perfectly with the wine we chose, a Spanish wine called Termes. Look for it, it was wonderful and well priced.. someone once told me to avoid the well known area wines like from napa or sonoma because they tend to be priced upwardly just because they are well known.. okay I think I just realized that someone is Rachel Ray. Haha sometimes I think the food network people are my friends.. now Im off topic. Anyway, it was a great meal, wonderful evening, and an awesome way to kick off the vegas weekend!

wNMKer9rKwLa5gFvXntyLQ.text: I have been here more than 10 times and the experience and the food still amuses me.  I take my CES, SEMA, G2E and ASD clients here every year and we are always in big groups, I guess I can say I have brought hundreds of people here and I can say every single one of them are impressed from the food to the service.  The Wagyu is amazing and thank you to the amazing manager Jackie V., she made our experience even more delightful, amazing place,amazing team leader...they will not disappoint!

GczCD3tk44jbYj-g0W1M0A.text: 3.5 stars for the food  4 stars for the ambiance and service  I just couldn't bring myself to rate it a 4 star.  Well, I took the BF to LV for his birthday and took him to eat here on 8/25 bcz of all the raving reviews!   The atmosphere of this place is great, they have an intimate side and a social gathering side! A little bit more of a relaxed feeling than Morton's or Ruth Chris. Not too uppity and not too business like.   The negatives:  -Lamb chops. It didn't melt in my mouth compared to Ruth Chris. Not that great of a seasoning, just salt and pepper. I should not be able to have an after taste of salt (table salt) on my tongue for hours after dinner.   -Sauteed mushrooms. OMG WTF!!! When the hostess brought that next to me I said BUTTON MUSHROOMS with a snotty attitude and a look!! But I calmed down and tried the mushrooms anyway.   Let me tell you how disappointing this is! For a pricey restaurant to serve their guests BUTTON MUSHROOMS that is just a BIG NO NO!! Button mushrooms are not gourmet and cannot carry a gourmet flavor. Let's just say McCormick and Schmidt's sauteed mushrooms is what I was expecting! On top of that the mushrooms weren't even sliced, they were served whole. The flavor was there, but the BUTTON MUSHROOMS just ruined the flavor.  -The BF's steak tenderloin was good, but not great. Again too much salt. It tastes like table salt! It may just be me. But again having an after taste of salt in your mouth for hours after dinner and even with dessert not impressed.   The positives:  -Great service.   -Great atmosphere.   -Delicious crab cake, mac n cheese, and asparagus! Previous yelpers were right on those recommendations!   -Great concept on having women hostess serve you the sides. Each hostess has a side and serves it to each guest. (although I would have appreciated the girls looking cuter and dressed sexier than that evening, I like pretty people, plus it's Vegas a city to impress)   -The restroom: I've never been to a restaurant where there was a bathroom attendant before.   All in all, I would recommend this restaurant only if they had a pre-fixed menu. Or if you are having an important business transaction.

o26AoUQBUd26raxaRAgaIA.text: Hands down, the best steakhouse I've ever been to.  The Bone-In-Rib-Eye was amazing, the service was impeccable and you have to love the fact that you aren't sitting in some restaurant located on the strip and feeling like you're getting robbed. The party we had was 11 guys and the wait staff took care of us.   Definitely a favorite and I will return.

XTQDVkhajO1J2p9ivGTStg.text: The restaurant is about 10-15 mins away from the strip but it's very well-known in Vegas.   The restaurant was really romantic. I totally fell in love with this place right when I walked in. We ordered the Crab Cake as an appetizer, and it was SO good! Probably the best Crab Cake I ever had. We had 3 rib-eyes and a surf and turf. The steaks were amazing. I think we had about 6-7 people serving us. We felt like a king or something haha. One of the waiters accidentally took my side dish away. When I found out, I asked the waiter and he said he will be right back. Guess what. He came back with the whole new mac & cheese and sauteed mushroom as a sorry. I was.."wow!"   The food and the service were AMAZING! You won't be disappointed. I would highly recommend this place to all my friends and family.

AvT8KIjycxRRnPG3gGLfMA.text: Great service, great food. The lamb was soooooooo good. And the crab cake app? Have it.

FCVmlO0oL7gtvYoG1wwl9w.text: Lobster Mac n cheese was to DIE for. My soon to be hubby took me here for no apparent reason. But glad he did. It was a little rich for my blood. But my blood loved the richness.

jzrr8WIPaMRVUJx3Y7xTtQ.text: Inside the place certainly seems like a steakhouse, and the menu looks impressive.  However it fell short of my expectations.  The menu carries high end steakhouse prices for items which are below that quality.  Everything was prepared well, and the meal was decent, but the price we paid was not representative of the food we received.  In all honesty, there are quite a few better steakhouses in this city, and ones which are more deserving of the money paid.  I had a shrimp cocktail appetizer which was very boring.  The three gourmet sauces were nothing unique or impressive, and I was forced to try them if I wanted the shrimp as each shrimp was bathed in one of them.  The filet oscar was decent, and at 8 oz a reasonably sized protion.  However it was not worth the money as my oscar treatment contained only a tiny bit of crab and diced asparagus (which wasn't even properly cooked).  I tried some of the lobster tail ordered by a friend, and it was okay, but absolutely not worth the $90 pricetag for the "12 oz tail" which wasn't even close to that size - perhaps it was the tail of a 12 oz lobster.  Dinner was enjoyable, the service was outstanding.  But if you truly enjoy steak, go to a real steakhouse.  You will spend the same amount of money, but you will receive a FAR better meal.

d7GPIcGHNYP4nVgS0OqUCw.text: So amazing!  We had the $99 menu with salad, 8oz filet, crab cakes, sides and dessert. Amazing deal and so worth it!  Food was absolutely delicious, everything was cooked to perfection, steak was mouth-watering and crab cakes were so meaty and tasty. The service was also great, the waiters were unbelievably attentive and the manager made a point of coming over to chat and make sure everything was okay.  We were driving so didn't get a chance to try the cocktails but hearing the waiter describe the VIP cocktail made me want to abandon the car and try it out!  Would 100% go back next time we go to Vegas! Don't think I could fault them on a single thing!

4GhDk_h-9rBwXdXySr__IQ.text: On my last night in Vegas, I went to check out this place on the recommendation of a friend. She said it was the best steak place she's ever been to, and since I love steak, I simply had to try it out. I figured that it would be expensive (which it was), but who cares, it was compliment of the casinoes anyway =D.  The hostesses were cute, the setting was dark, good for romantic dinners. They even had a cool piano where this one musician played music on throughout the night. All the servers/bartenders were well dressed with tuxedos. Great, the atmosphere looks nice and fancy, but that's not that important to me. I care more about the food, and this place had better deliver. I had really high expectations of the food coming into the place...   And boy, did Del Frisco's ever deliver. I ordered the 16oz Prime Rib since there was no way I was going to finish the house special Double Eagle Strip on my own. That piece of steak was definitely one of the best I've ever had. It was so full of flavor that you could practically eat it without the steak sauce. The meat was so tender and juicy (ordered medium rare) that I cut through it like butter. I also had the spinach supreme on the side and it was good, despite the fact that I thought the mix of onions, mushrooms, and bacon bits were weird. Their bread was also very soft and their butter was very creamy... very simple to spread on the butter.  Service was exceptional. Though I don't really care about service as much as I do about the food, it was nice being pampered. They made sure my steak was cooked right when it was brought out. My water was filled constantly without me having to ask . And since I'm such a slow eater, when my food got cold, they reheated it for me, and even though it's no longer medium rare, it was still around medium-ish and very tender.   One disappointment: after reading some of the other reviews, I realized that I didn't get a chance to check out this James Bond table. Argh, that would've been a nice photograph to have!  Overall, if you're a steak lover, this place is a must-visit. The expensive price may discourage us normal people from visiting often, but since I visit Vegas once a year, it was worth the trip.

QCfEEme0U2Q7fW0UBa-yIg.text: Looking for steak dinner in Las Vegas? Skip the celebrity chef driven steakhouses in the hotels to this slightly off the strip restaurant. Located on Paradise Road, it is about 10 mins taxi ride from most of the hotels (we stayed at Palazzo which was about 1.5 miles away). We were a party of 11 people and they seated us in one of their many dining rooms with spacious seating and lighting. Service is quick and attentive, our water glasses never went below half full. Many at our table ordered the VIP cocktail - vodka and pineapples - and they said it was great. We ordered 5 crab cakes (2 entrees and 1 appetizer) to start off and these crab cakes is unlike any that you probably have tried or will try elsewhere - pan fried instead of battered and deep fried, almost no filler, pure crab meat chunks. Well worth the price. The table ordered various cuts / sizes of the steaks, from the 22oz prime ribeye to the double eagle, and all agreed that the steaks were well seasoned, cooked to perfection. We also ordered for sides the lobster mac and cheese (can taste lobster chunks), asparagus, potato au gratin, which were all good. When I made the reservations via phone, I told them it was for 3 peoples birthdays. At the end of dinner, they brought out 3 of their signature desserts with a candle on them to the table (desserts on the house) which was great service. Amazing staff.

P05oEUd_aq6XiVXqBzM8jQ.text: I have been to Del Frisco's in Las Vegas many times with family and friends and they always impress, with both service and food. We ate there about a week and a half ago and again, the service was great and the food and the VIP's were too! We took the kids as well and our server Jason made it a point to include them when discussing food and was engaging. We had a great meal and a great experience. Will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas!

ZjlRYtRPOfGAkYAyFFfPvg.text: I was not that impressed with Del Frisco's.  I can understand how some people like it, but not me.   I went on a business dinner.    The ambiance is very nice traditional steakhouse, and very well done.  Dark.  Lots of wood.  Staff dressed well.  The steaks are served a la carte for the most part.  Order veggies separately.  Plenty of choices.  By and large the steak were decent.  I had the fillet trio, with three different sauces and was satisfied.  You have to figure how the do their meat here before ordering medium, medium rare, etc.  They explained to me how the do their meats, and I order medium, and got it how I like it, warm pink middle.  That being said, 1 associate ordered his medium, and got rare, and another medium, and received medium well.  Asparagus, grilled mushrooms, potatoes were nothing to write home about.  Wine list was very comprehensive, and way overpriced.  Very difficult to find a good deal on the wines.  I felt that the big wine list was to impress and confuse.  I was in charge of ordering wines, and found a few good bottles.  I tried to use the sommelier to make sense of the wines, and the one he suggested, was the most expensive, and worst wine we ordered.  Service can be perceived as "attentive" or "intrusive".  I always felt they were trying to "up sell".  More expensive cut here, more expensive wine there, trying to get more appertizers or bottles of wine on the table before we were finished with the ones we had (this happened three times, one time is good services) as we were winding down.  We spent about $150/person so I expect more.

fAtKUByC1YpdG87cRe19hQ.text: YEAHHHHHHHHHH MANNNNNNNNNN!  We ordered the Power Couple deal, which I believe is for their restaurant week or something. The deal was quite a steal. Each person gets: Salad, 1 crab cake AND 8oz. filet mignon, 2 sides, and a choice of dessert for $99.  - Del's Salad: one of the best & beastliest salads ever. I'm not much of a salad person, but I didn't feel like less of a man for eating this. It came with super fresh cabbage and veggies, with 2 very deeelicious strips of bacon laid on top. The wonderful avocado-based house dressing brought all the components of the salad together. I forced myself to eat only half, for I wanted to finish the rest of my meal. - Off-menu bone-in filet mignon 16oz: This phenomenal piece of meat went for $60. They allowed us to upgrade the steak in the power couple deal for an extra $25. So glad I did this. I've eaten at a lot of steak- Mastro's/Morton's/Ruth's Chris/Lawry's etc etc, and I gotta say that the steak I had here was one of the best I've had. - 8oz filet mignon: My gf had this one, and I tried a bite, of course. This was even more tender than the steak I had. - Crab cake: Heavenly? Delightful? Fabulous? Blissful? Whatever. Best crab cake I've ever had, no argument there. Not your typical crab cake - it's just layered chunks of juicy beautiful savory crab meat formed into a cake of perfection. - Lobster Mac & Cheese: Not included in the power couple deal; we ordered this separately $16. Yes, I loved this, too. - Alaskan King Crab Legs: $49. Huge legs. My friend said it was the best $49 for crab that he's ever spent. - Sides: We pretty much got all the available sides - the spinach, veggie of the day was broccoli, potatoes.  - VIP cocktail: it's from those large jars they have with pineapples in them. The ladies seemed to a be a big fan of it. - Cheesecake: We ordered the strawberry cheesecake and the butterscotch cheesecake. We were crazy stuffed, but it was so good that we still ate most of it.  All steaks were cooked perfectly, except for one of our's (5 of us). She said some of the outside portions of her filet mignon were a little burned. The servers here did a great job of making sure the steaks were cooked to our liking, but my friend didn't bother saying anything because she didn't want to wait another 20 minutes. What I really liked was the hospitality & service of every single employee. When your entree comes out.. it seems like the entire staff comes out to swarm your table to give you your steaks & scoop ur sides for you. That experience in itself makes this place very unique and memorable.  We sat at a table located next to a bar, where a guy was playing jams on the piano. Awesome. I also noticed that there were many other rooms/sections in the place, hopefully we'll try the others out next time. Located slightly off the strip, this Del Frisco's has the feel/vibe that it's been around for a while... and it'll probably stay around for much longer, for very good reason.  Cliff Notes: If you want to have a nice steak dinner in Vegas, you have to eat here.

KOUSRUqvUkMQqrjnzUQysA.text: Everyone pretty much said it all. We came to Vegas during the off peak time in December. I know the place can get crazy packed during peak time so the review is based on how it's like when it's not crazy packed.  Food: Basically it's meat or seafood here. I came for the meat as the name of the restaurant contains the word Steak. Their steaks did not disappoint. I ordered the porter house medium and it was cooked to perfection and my GF ordered the filet mignon medium well and it was perfect for her too. Shanghai calamari was excellent. Basically fried calamari with sweet and spicy sauce, although it was sweeter than spicy.   Service: Excellent! Food was half the better, service is the other and they nailed both. Our waitress was in training so it was kind of interesting to see the person training her and how he was shadowing her every move and whispering in her ears what to say. Water refilled constantly, our waitress always checked up on us even after food was served. I don't mind tipping more for service like this.   Price: Cheaper than the steak house on the strip. Comparing it mainly to the prices at Craft Steak. Their 8 ounce filet mignon cost more than Del Frisco's 10 ounce.   Portions: Even though it's a la cart style of ordering, the portions are huge.   Bonus: Received a Christmas card from our waitress, handwritten! Priceless!

xtwL6jGzRqf0mABfzFoEtA.text: After reading the great reviews by others on this site, I made a boking for Del Frisco's during a recent trade show that took me to Vegas. I was not disapointed at all. I got to sit outside on a nice evening and enjoyed a great steak. The service was a little slow at first but I was not in a hurry.  I asked for fries with my meat and got some huge cut fries. They were not good at all and the waiter graciously took them off the bill for me.  The wine list is very pricey but has an incredible collection of great wines. A few quick searches on my iPhone showed that they multiply wine prices by at least 3 (when compared to retail).   They also have a nice cigar selection.

bGogXCmqk5JWH5LZNoSDxA.text: Hands down, some of the best meat I've ever had. My brother and I walked in on a Saturday night for dinner on a recommendation from a cabbie. Figured we wouldn't get in without a reservation since the place seemed so fancy, but we were seated immediately. Since we were on a schedule, told the waiter we could only stay for an hour and change, and he totally accommodated us. We were out the door in exactly the time we wanted to leave.  The restaurant interior and ambiance is very nice. Looks a bit like a old fancy saloon. I had the lamb and it was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Also enjoyed my dish with a side of au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach which were richly creamy and succulent. The place has a couple plasma TVs, so my brother and I were able to catch the Ohio St./USC game, which was awesome!  The service here is impeccable. Our waiter was always attentive, friendly and helpful on suggestions whenever we had questions about anything. Overall, it was a great experience. I wouldn't come here every week though, since the prices are sky-high, but hey, when you're in Vegas you have to splurge once in a while. :)

Yi80ZVmnApkX5ea3gF8whQ.text: I would fly to Vegas from San Francisco, just to have a meal here. It's worth it. It's THAT good. No - it's better than good. It's Steak, done to perfection. Here are the highlights: I made my decision 100% using Yelp. I read that their customer service was stellar, and the food was amazing. Those were my two main criteria. Del Frisco's completely exceeded my expectations.   1) On the phone from SF when I called a week before the trip, they didn't treat me like just another voice on the other end of the line. The hostess answered all my anal-retentive questions. Then she offered to fax me the menu (it's not on their website) - nice touch. I wanted to make sure they had seafood, as well as steak, and I also wanted to make sure their prices weren't out of control. Their menu looked straightforward and simple, not a lot of fancy descriptions, just meat, and how many ounces, etc. I was a little nervous when I found out there are 8 other locations, I normally steer clear of "chains" but this place really has defined what steakhouse should be, and they were really personal in every way.  2) Once in Vegas: Just me and my Mama at the restaurant. Early reservations because we had to make the Bette Midler show at 7:30pm at Caesar's. We show up and are the ONLY ones in the restaurant. Semi embarrassed because the place holds like 800 people, it's huge. They kindly invited us into the bar to wait 15 minutes, because the kitchen wasn't fully open yet. Bartender Robby poured us some cocktails. He told us his favorite cut is the Ribeye. My mom was slightly salivating by this point. She loves a good steak, and this is why I wanted to impress her.  3) We ordered the Jumbo Crab Cake with Creole Sauce, it was wowza! They didn't put a whole lot of bread crumbs or fillers in it, just basically pure crab meat and seasonings. It was buttery and perfectly cooked. The sauce was so good, I could have drank it - neat.  4) We split the porterhouse. It was 24 ounces, including the bone. Our waiter Ryan was patient, attentive and super informative. When our steaks arrived, he did the "tasting" which other reviews have mentioned, slicing 2 pieces for each guest tableside, and then waiting for the reaction... it was UNREAL. I have never had a steak like this. When I asked him how it was so flavorful, he said it's BROILED. He didn't act all pompous, like it was some trade secret... he let us know their ovens are 1500 F degrees and that's what gives them their perfect sear on the outside. We asked for the Porterhouse = Medium. It was like butter. My mom couldn't wait to get her hands on the bone, which still had quite a bit of meat on it. Oh yeah, it was THAT good. Bone-sucking good.  5) We also ordered a side of bearnaise sauce, but we really didn't need it; the steak's seasonings were perfect as is. And we ordered a side of sauteed mushrooms. Their #1 side is the Potatoes Au Gratin, Ryan told us. Too heavy for us.  6) For dessert, we got a special little surprise. The lemon cake on the menu was some kind of Southern Lemon cake I'd never heard of before. When Ryan described this decadent cake: 7 layers, buttercream, lemon glaze... I said, 'you should put the description you just recited on the menu!" It was lacking any description at all, and I thought that was strange for a lesser known dessert to skip the details. Five minutes later he emerges with a piece of this cake, on the house! It was sooo tasty and zingy! Lemon to the power of 10. He said, "I saw your eyes light up when I told you what was in the cake!" Really super cute of him. Of course we couldn't finish this huge slice, after such a rich steak, but I loved lemon, so I was super happy I got to taste it.  7) This place is a class act all the way. They know how to make the customers feel totally at home. And as for the price, our 24 ounce porterhouse came in at just under $50. Comparatively speaking, this is very reasonable for fine steakhouses in Vegas. At the MGM Grand, the Porterhouse at their signature CraftSteak restaurant was $92. We didn't go there, just checked out their menu. I think it was a larger cut, but nevertheless its half the overhead of the hotel you end up paying for. Del Frisco's is a short $8 cab ride off the strip, and I would go back again and again and again.

7evx85adLsQaa5y3doitTA.text: We attended a private dinner party hosted by our friends last night. We have never been here before. On walking in, we were warmly greeted by a hostess and was instructed to wait in the bar until the party organizer arrives to approve the setup.  Since this was to be a surprise bday for her boyfriend, we thought this was a bit strange. After clearing things up w the mgr we were promptly escorted into a private dining room next to the wine cellar. The room was arranged beautifully. All the chairs were covered in white seat covers w a gold sash. The dinnerware and glass stemware were arranged perfectly. Our wait person Tiana came in all smile and welcomed all of us.  She gave us a brief overview of the night and proceeded to take our cocktail orders. Everyone enjoyed their cocktail and admired the vast wine collection in the cellar through a floor to ceiling glass wall. Once the guest of honor arrived the party started. We dined on appetizers of Shrimp Cocktail 3 ways, Philly Cheese Egg Rolls, and Crab Cakes.  The menu selection had 3 types of salads, 7 different meats from steak to fish to chicken. Then there are 3 sides and 2 options for dessert.  I Andorra of the attendees had the prime ribeye or filet mignon and they were cooked perfectly. Red center and pink on the outside.  The salmon was cooked medium which is more done then I prefer, but they do ask you for your preference so I would not ding em for that.   However, is ding their salad offerings. When you state your house salad is a mixed green,  you shouldn't be offering iceberg with a few sliver of carrots & croutons. That's and iceberg lettuce salad not mixed greens...it was awful. But it's either that or Cesar Salad or a blue cheese wedge salad. Our drinks were always full and Tiana and the rest of the team were fantastic.  To finish off our dinner, we enjoyed a special birthday cake them Tiana took us inside the wine cellar to admire their collections. Then she showed us the 007 James Bond table which was awesome. You'll have to ask to se that whenever you're there.  We'll definitely be back.

yxcusOAD3hMZcu9pwLiqfQ.text: While the food here is beyond amazing, the real star at this restaurant is it's wonderful staff. We were in town celebrating our 2 year anniversary and not only did they give us a very sweet card, but literally every staff member that came to our table told us Happy Anniversary! Our waiter could not have been nicer or more lovely to talk to and even took us on a little tour of the restaurant's wine room after we had finished our meal.   The food at Del Frisco's is insane. I ordered the Crab cakes and they were so delicious! The Cajun sauce they are served on is to die for. My boyfriend had the Porterhouse and it was perfection! We chose the corn and famous lobster mac n cheese for our sides and were extremely happy with both, though we both favored the corn as it had more flavor. A nice surprise slice of their lemon cake was given to us at the end of our meal and while neither of us really even like lemon cake, we devoured it because it was so good!  Yes, this place is a little pricey. You definitely get what you pay for here though because the service and the food are impeccable. Del Frisco's is definitely a must and absolutely worth the splurge!

MYaLzvwLS_AMtSjf6_Sq7Q.text: One of the best steak houses I've ever been to. Everything is delicious here from the appetizers to the main course and dessert. I always get the ribeye, one of the best tasting ribeyes I've ever had. And you must try the butter cake with a P con ice cream. And outstanding service. I don't drink any alcohol, but they have a very good selection of wines and mixed drinks fully stocked bar.

txRlHgBuTA1c0sN0wkdQsg.text: Had to try Del Frisco's after all the yelp reviews.  Tried the deal they had for a 3 course dinner for two. It was amazing. Bone-in Fillet was cooked perfectly and all the food was excellent. Possibly one of the best steaks I  have ever had.  Recommend it to everyone!

EfbOT-_jiKjGw8DWAWNHXQ.text: Its off the beaten path, so best to visit if you have a car. We had been to the one in NYC and as good as the food was--the service in NYC Del Frisco's was awful. Happily, Las Vegas Del Friscos met and exceeded our expectations. We made a 6pm Sunday evening reservation. When we were given our menus, we asked about the $55 Prime Pair Sunday special, which we already knew we wanted to order this because I had researched it. The hostess kind of made a face and said she had to get a different menu for that. This place is really empty on Sunday so its the perfect time to go and have very attentive servers.  The $55 Sunday Prime Pair was a perfect sized portion. The salad, a small 8oz filet, the perfect crab cake and side dish. We did not leave hungry. If you're on a sort of budget but want to go someplace really nice for a good meal-do the Sunday Prime Pair.   I also read about the James Bond Table and if you ask the hostess to see it before you leave, they will gladly open the room and tell you the story and open table for you. If you like Bond, this custom made table is a must see.

Ubsr_idRO8b_m8m00-3iyA.text: Over-the-top service, but there was a horrible smell of sewage. My husband and I went here on the 8th for our anniversary. Upon entering, we were immensely overwhelmed by the smell of sewage. After about 10-15 minutes, we got immune to it. Normally, I would give a much lower rating for something like this, but the amazing experience we were given when we were seated deserve for a 4 star.  - As soon as we were seated, we were immediately greeted by our one of two servers. He was amazingly nice and gave us an anniversary card that was signed by the staff. - The drinks were ordered were the best we have had in Vegas and perfectly mixed. - I ordered the filet trio which was so buttery tender. The best filets I've ever eaten. My husband ordered the 16oz filet mignon on the bone. - When our steaks came out, they asked we check to make sure it was to our liking and offered to refire my husband's filet more while keeping my order warm. - We also ordered sides of asparagus and sauteed mushrooms as well as the lobster mac and cheese. About 5 minutes after the sides were delivered, our bus boy came out with another order of the lobster mac. He said he noticed the one originally given to us didn't look creamy enough so he brought us a better one. Glad he did because it amazing! - Our servers consistently checked on us to make sure everything was okay without seeming pushy. - After eating dinner, we were stuffed and decided to order desert to go. When we asked for the desert menu, they came out with a huge lemon cake that had a lit candle and even did a little celebratory happy anniversary song. The lemon cake was amazing and even better later that night as a late munch.  Despite the smell when entering, the experience given to us was amazing. I'd come back again for a special event.

YuurimLkkgtikLtci9Kqlw.text: I went to Del Frisco's for 2-person birthday dinner. I ordered the Tomahawk Ribeye, Crab Cake, Sauteed Mushrooms, and Potatoes Au Gratin. Tomahawk Steak - This was enough to split between the two of us. At $90 per steak, it's expensive, and would've been too much for just one person considering the other food we had. However by splitting it, it turned out to be just fine. The steak itself was pretty good, but I wasn't blown away. I actually expected more considering it was Wagyu beef and was one of their most popular cuts. I had it ordered medium instead of my usual medium rare preference per other reviewer's recommendations.  I also had their peppercorn sauce which cost a whopping $6 for a small bowl.   Crab Cake - Just like everyone else says, it's incredible. And I don't even care for crab cake. It's not like other crab cakes that are deep fried and mostly breading. This one is mostly crab with a delicious Cajun sauce.  Sauteed mushrooms - Pretty basic, but tons of flavor.  Lots of butter, yum.   Potatoes Au Gratin - Also good, but it was very rich. LOTS of cheese and cream used. I'd probably get something else next time.  They comped us a 5 layer lemon cake at the end. Or was it 7 layers?  We only had a few bites because we were both way too full.   The part that stands out at this restaurant other than the exceptional food is the exceptional service.  The staff obviously is very well trained. They refer to you by name, write a hand-signed birthday card, and overall are extremely attentive. No complaints here.  I highly recommend you try Del Frisco's!

pdxEAD4WUYt9ebHLmA_cNw.text: Have been to a few expensive steakhouses in Las Vegas including Carnevino and Cut. Del Frisco's was by far the best, and even somewhat reasonably priced! Our favorite steak place in Vegas by far.

snCqt0KdxTtBdrScszMsNw.text: Hubby and I order calamari everywhere we go and Del Frisco's sure delivered an amazing dish.  The Calamari Shanghai appetizer was the best part of my meal!  It was absolutely fabulous.  Crunchy, sweet, tender, and delicious.  The caesar salad was tasty and was a generous portion.  The sesame loaf was served warm with soft salted butter- you'd be amazed how many restaurants get that detail wrong but Del Friscos passed with flying colors!  My filet duo was a daily special and was tasty although a bit chewy.  The lobster mac n cheese was good if you like mild cheese flavour (I am a sharp cheddar girl myself so it wasn't much to my liking but that's a personal preference thing).  Our server was Annamarie, and she was attentive and personal.  They do team service and they were all great.  Annamarie arranged for us to celebrate our occasion (Anniversary weekend) which was a lovely touch.  My husband got the 26oz Double Eagle strip and he ate every bite.    Their lemon cake is amazing.  Huge and very home-made flavor.  We'd definitely return.  Totally worth the short cab ride off the strip and we had no trouble getting another cab back to the hotel after dinner.

O6oOOl104aFXts4jQvkZpA.text: Sunday fix price menu a great deal. Food delicious and you must ask to see the "James Bond" table!!!

9aoYKlHNVoCRfmIE621vvg.text: Over price, I cook better steaks than this place. Not too impressed at all. I ate the ribeye and my medium rare was over cooked more of a medium well. My girlfriend ate the filet mignon and that was so so. From what i read up about I had better.   I tried the sides chateau potatoes were pretty good, but the spinach supreme I wasnt impressed with at all.   Customer service was nice ate least at this place.   It was really overpriced for the steak that I ordered.  And I wasnt to happy that for the price that I paid for my rib-eye it was over cooked badly.   When I am paying 70$ to 90$ per a person for this place and you have over cooked meat of course I am upset! I went  with a group and some of them had really well cooked meat and mine was just over cooked and pretty dry. So I was just upset. Good thing I ate my friends wifes steak because she couldnt finish it. But for my steak that I ordered I wasnt too happy.

FF2_CQMuz0zeCEVLfj_BOw.text: I go to Del Frisco's for happy hour at least 1 time a month. The bartenders are so cool and I love the live music. The steak salad is a steal and I love drinking those delicious VIP martinis!

CyD6Z3YADuH3XIJODMuTJg.text: This was probably the second best steak I've ever had, yet I was super impressed with the restaurant as a whole. To Frisco's defense the best steak I ever had was a 12oz Buffalo Ribeye....I know, I know. I loved how this place was just off the strip allowing us to truly enjoy the atmosphere and have a nice quiet conversation.   I have to give a nod to our Server. This guy knew more about the menu, specials and drinks than anyone on the planet. This place truly requires their servers to be on top of their games. No stoned waiters here. He walked us through the menu and described everything that was done to the steaks to include the sides. I ended up opting for the Filet Trio and it was epic. The steaks were cooked to perfection as well as the scallops and shrimp that topped my beef. I'm not usually a filet guy but these things were worth the hefty price tag.  Now I know drinks usually come first but somehow this treat slipped my mind. We ordered their house cocktail which has their pineapple infused vodka and an ingredient or two that I can't remember. But this nice and light drink paired well with my heavy, strong flavored filets. If you're looking for classy steak meal without the Strip vibe than this is the place for you.

9WjKlxCe6AzBG-DUUEZ65A.text: Oh man. I got a gift certificate to this place for doing some pro-bono work and almost sold it... let's just say that would have been a huge mistake.  I'm not exactly a steak connoisseur, but I will say that Del Frisco's served me one of the best filet mignons I've ever had. My girlfriend and I split the filet mignon trio. If memory serves, one was paired with a scallop, one with a cheese that I forget the name of, and one was topped with sauteed salmon. Each of those was better than just about any other steak I've ever had.  Service gets high marks, too. Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and also took some time to chat with us about mixology bars in the area.  Highly recommend that you getchu some steak here.

4wp4VZDjiugD_Se9wqj8NA.text: Came for my husband's birthday and we weren't disappointed! Some of the best steak I've had!! And the service was amazing which topped off a perfect night.  -Crab Cakes: almost pure crab meat, so delicious. Recommend for two people to share as a appetizer -Filet Mignon: So tender and juicy and just mouth wateringly delicious. The night we went, they offered a Mignon sampler. Three 4oz steaks prepared 3 different ways. AMAZING! Just outrageous!  -Dessert: Lemon cake! It was complimentary because it was my husband's birthday. It was good, but I don't know if I would pay $11 for it normally. It's a HUGE portion, so maybe make sure you have at least 4 people to share it with.

vZGIuX8Ht8FvHwYadDYrBg.text: I was originally introduced to Del Frisco's years and years ago in Denver, and really, really enjoyed it.  But alas, at the time, they didn't have anything closer than Denver (and as good as they are, going to Denver from LA is a bit much).  I was very happy to see that they are now in Vegas (still a ways from LA, but closer).  And I was just as happy to see that the quality of the food and service is consistent.  5 stars because they had my "most favorite" cut, the bone-in filet, off menu, for my visit.  Prepared beautifully.  A great experience.

ox6u3em45av0qe8ZPctgwQ.text: Simply the best tasting and perfectly prepared steaks in Las Vegas (try the truffle butter over your steak of choice).  On top of that, the service is impeccable, the sides are exquisite, and the desserts devine (lemon cake is redonkulous).  If you love steaks and are in Vegas don't miss this experience.  Or if you plan on enjoying steaks anywhere else you go for the rest of your life, maybe don't go here.  They'll ruin every other steakhouse for you.  I guarantee it.

ibOuJx8SmKJU3XMR1bwbnQ.text: Oh man, this place was good.  My coworker and I shared the 22oz bone-in ribeye and it was so good. Juicy and tender, and cooked perfectly (medium).  We also tried their maque choux corn (creamed corn) and their potatoes au gratin (potatoes with bacon and cheese) and both were delicious, though my preference would be the corn.  It is on the pricier side, but the quality is well worth it.

TSG-n56W7SEKEteMtL9sIQ.text: Awesome service.  Food was good steak cooked perfectly side dishes excellent. We never needed or had to ask for anything .  Server Miss Jessica and the others were fabulous....will definitely come back every time I come back to Vegas. Lemon cake melts in your mouth.... Thank you all for your hospitality....

xeSgtkca0gQijaU2qHHH-w.text: This has become a standard in Las Vegas, but I'm not sure if it's the brand name or if it is that good.  I mean, Las Vegas is becoming the mecca of the culinary world having branches of the country's best restaurants situated on the Las Vegas Strip.  Even though Del Frisco's is not on the strip, there are lots of people who search this place out.  The steak was good, but not spectacular.  The ambience was nice, although just a little too dark.  The service was impeccable and our waiter was both knowledgeable and helpful.  I think that this is just one of many nice steak restaurants in Las Vegas, but it is still worth visiting if you can get a reservation.

qr7xevjIrjamoVn3GS8zOA.text: The two stars here are for the good food. Really enjoyed the Del Frisco's in San Diego so bought the gift card and wanted to treat my parents to a nice dinner in Vegas. From my previous experience, I had really high hopes for this place too.   Our dinner reservation was at 5pm, we got there at 4:45pm because we were starving and couldn't wait! We got our table around 4:55pm and was handed our menus. THE END.   We were the second table to get seated for the night as they start their dinner services. Multiple tables arrived after us and got serviced right away with their servers getting them bread /drinks and taking their orders. Everyone else seemed to be having a great time, so I just kept waiting for our server to show up. We waited and waited and waited, as other servers passed us by and glanced at us, no one bothered to stop and ask. Eventually I just walked to the front desk and told them we've been waiting for 20+ mins as everyone who came after us got serviced. After the complaint, they were quick to getting our orders in and getting our food out, but our appetite has been spoiled. There was no explanation of any kind other than apologizing for the wait.   For a $400 meal, this was not the dining experience I was hoping for. The food is still excellent, but service, not so sure.

FuObcKXzdo34zka0XYmtmA.text: Still one of the best steakhouses in town, IMO. Service is top notch, food is of the finest quality, and ambiance is classy.    What we ordered, two Prime Pairs @ $59 each: Del Salad Iceberg Wedge Two 8 oz filet mignons  Two crab cakes Asparagus Creamed Spinach  In addition we ordered, Brussels sprouts, two Pinot noirs, and two Pinot Grigios. However, since we were celebrating our 7th wedding anniversary, Del Frisco's comped us a trio of desserts. It included a molten chocolate cake, ice cream, and butter cake (WOW must order).   Did I mention when we arrived, there were rose petals scattered on our table with a card signed by the staff, congratulating us on our anniversary. The entire staff and management were super nice and sincere. Make it a point to stop by for your next celebration, you will NOT be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
