iKShqp0vTve2UHSo12CpZA.text: The service was amazing. The food was amazing. The Atmosphere and ambience was right on point. It was just a fantastic dining experience all around. We were seating promptly as well. It was wonderful, I totally recommend it- it was perfect.

HL9SF2pjXZrWAtNom3PD1Q.text: This is the best steakhouse in Vegas.  Ive been here several times and its always glorious.  The porterhouse is amazing.  I usually get this with asparigus and mushrooms.    The desserts are also amazing.  If you like Creme Brulee then this is a must here.

V0lzJhfra3nTTyNzHz6Ypg.text: One of the best dinners I've had in a while! The food was really good and the service was amazing. Our sides took longer to come out than the rest of our food and the server was extremely apologetic and even gave us free dessert after our meal because of it. The manager came but and apologized as well, their staff is super nice and the food is delicious!   I'm not sure if I had a special at the time but it was $59 for a salad, I got the wedge and it was so good! The New York steak also really good the crab cakes and a side which I chose creamed spinach and it was all amazing. My family also got Brussels sprouts, lobster Mac and cheese, and potatoes au gratin so I tried everything and loved all of it! Definitely a place I would recommend and go back to

UUH-u7E2BBxgEJtMWqiurQ.text: As always this place knows steak and understands what a medium rare steak should be cooked like. Do not miss out on the truffle garlic butter to top the steak off. Pour the whole thing on top of the steak and then dip the steak pieces as you cut them off into the melted butter on the plate. The asparagus was well prepared and the potatoes at gratin was amazing. A special treat this time was that heirloom tomato caprese salad - the pesto made me want more even after I was full and finished

G7SSpEQmFrFrjzALUPWplw.text: Overall, we found the food very good and the AAA+ service extraordinarily attentive. High praise to the waitstaff for making our wedding anniversary celebration so special. The multiple verbal acknowledgements, personalized greeting card, and fresh red rose petals sprinkled about the crisp white linen table cloth confirmed the wisdom of our choice of Del Frisco's to mark the occasion.  Compliments to the chef for the well seasoned, juicy Bone in Ribeye cooked perfectly to order. The colossal tower of mouth watering hot Onion Rings proved as delectable as visually delightful. Although the Shrimp appetizer disappointed with its rubbery texture (excessively chilled, perhaps?), the tasty Trio of Sauces accompanying the dish almost made up for it.  We also observed a couple of oddities. The 80's dance music playing in the background didn't jive with the setting. For a Friday night on a holiday weekend, the restaurant's crowd was noticeably sparse. Such a contrast from the lively, near capacity environment we experienced during our last visit several years ago.  Bottom line, Del Frisco's fine dining well worth the $$$.

avCf43AdPF6u-JR6iXXPyA.text: The reason for my 3-star review is the food. Yes, service was top notch. Yes, the decor is titillating to the eyes. BUT, the food could be so much better! I came here for a business event, so I was able to sit down for an entire 3-course meal. The night started off with a Del's Salad which was not anything special. The salad had an interesting green sauce that was good, but it was too overdressed and I had trouble finishing the saucy greens. Then came the main course of an 8 oz. Filet Mignon with a side of Chateau Mashed Potatoes and green beans. For $45 a steak, it was lacking flavor and the meat did not melt in my mouth like it should. I've been to my fair share of high-end steakhouses (i.e. Mastro's or Ruth's Chris) and this place did not compare. My standards are high if you're charging those kind of prices for steak. The sides were good though! To bring my disappointing dinner to an end, I went with the cheesecake dessert with strawberries. Sad to say, that was also quite unsatisfying. The texture and taste of the cheesecake was unfulfilling, lacking the creaminess that one would expect when eating that dessert. The crust was it's saving grace. Overall, I had an okay experience. With all the positive reviews people leave about this place, I might assume that my bad experience was a result of a set dinner menu and lack of attention to the food made in bulk for a big party of about 20 people.

EWaqrGfgdkUMn_RDkmYddQ.text: Whomever does the staff traing here needs to be the world superchamp trainer for any business in the service industry.  This was hands down the best service I have ever experienced.  Enthusiastic,  informative,  everyone from the hostesses, the server, the water guy to the GM made sure our experience was great. Great atmosphere to enjoy conversation. The food was to perfection. I had the pan seared chicken and my friend had the filet mignon. Both were amazing. As were the craft cocktails and the dessert. The lemon cake and the bread pudding were a perfect finish. Thank you for a lovely evening to celebrate a birthday.  We will be back for sure.

c9NOZEbUycR9hAy7arlqgw.text: This is probably my favorite steakhouse that I wish I could visit more frequently,  simply the best! We had our annual mother daughter day and chose this for dinner, not our first time! We had to sit at the bar because my mom wore a hat,  no big deal, actually ended up being a great experiance! Meeting Gavin And Trish was a pleasure,  very knowledgeable about drinks and menu. We started with a makers 46 old fashioned,  martini and  a rose cocktail,  followed by sharing a wedge salad, with 3 rib eyes, house del potatoes,  and corn with shishito  peppers. For dessert they recommend the butter cake? Omg to die for.. I've never been one to sit at the bar for a gourmet dinner? But the these two made the whole experience a dinner to remember and I would highly recommended this place to locals and anyone looking for a unique dining experience!

g7Uy0jVIJxUsUj7HxEKzjg.text: I visited Del Frisco's along with my folks for my birthday dinner on 6/26 around 6pm. I had been wishing to try this place out and I am so glad I chose a special occasion to finally try it out! I tried out Del Frisco's during restaurant week and got a huge and delicious meal for a great price! I tried the fillet mignon with mash potatoes and I can say it is the best steak I have ever had. I also had the Caesar salad and cheesecake and they were also very delicious. I took the time to write this review not so much to rave about the food, but to rave about the impeccable customer service Del Frisco's offered my family and I. I have to say this was the best service experience I have ever had from the time I walked in, to the minute I left. Every staff member my family and I came in contact with made us feel extremely welcome like they truly take pride and enjoy what they do. I want to thank our 3 servers, 4 hostess, restaurant manager, valet attendant and everyone else for taking the time to make our first visit as enjoyable as it was!

KsbKsrSWnmwlQ-FpDabz9w.text: The food was great but Ronnie the bartender was awesome had a great time talking to him.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttercake..... delicious!!!! Everything was great!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

joeqdaEH7lCrhHkYo_H2Zw.text: Wait, isn't that Bond music playing in the background?  Maybe this restaurant is themed after those very alluring signature Bond scenes that involve classy lounges and beautiful people, I thought. Little did I know that Del Frisco's is known for their "Bond table" until today when I read a couple reviews. So if you pay a visit, be sure to ask to see the James Bond Wine Table!  We got to sample a good variety of menu items as we visited during LV Restaurant Week. I think we would have enjoyed the food if the chef didn't go salt-happy on most of our dishes. Thought it was just me, but everyone at the table seemed to agree that the food was overly salty to the taste.   My favorite dishes of the night include: Shanghai-Style Fried Calamari ($18) Prime Ribeye ($49.5) with mushroom sauce (extra $) Lobster Macaroni and Cheese ($18.5) Warm Banana Bread Pudding ($10)  Everything else... The Lobster Bisque ($14), Sauteed Wild Mushrooms ($14), and Prime Ribeye without the sauce were too salty to be enjoyable. What a shame.  On the brighter side, A+ for the service we received that night. It certainly did not go unnoticed. We were told to cut our steaks once received to make sure it was cooked exactly to our liking and the water refills were constant. Terrific!   If I were to pay another visit, I would definitely request to order everything with light salt.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz. Prime Ribeye
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

AMbgpsmb7Yt8-xMkq6F8fg.text: I don't know why I've waited so long to try this place. Finally made in for happy hour & glad I did. They have some pretty good drink specials and all the food on the bar menu is half off. Can't beat $7 for a burger & choice of chips or fries! Service was good the entire time. The only downfall is when you walk in the restaurant it has a slight sewer smell that others have mentioned in reviews. However, I only noticed it in the entryway. It was not noticeable while dining at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger. $7 HH

Sz3AOCfVElGNMNEOjniN7w.text: My first upscale steakhouse chain dinner in Vegas was a 4-star review. This one was not as good.  I went to Del Frisco's for a private group dinner this week, covered fully by the host. I was anticipating a great dinner and primed to compare it fully with Fleming's, where I'd had a similar complimentary-for-guests meal.  Service here was certainly great, with constant water refills and timely plate changes and utensil removal. Judging from web site descriptions of private dining options, we got the Sports Room; the three television sets were reasonable for our purposes, albeit a little on the small side. Light and background music control were present.  As for food, I wasn't as fully impressed. It appears that we got a slightly adjusted Dinner Menu One, priced at $79 per person (similar to the listed price of my other meal, but with considerably fewer appetizers).  Complimentary bread and butter: fluffy bread coated with sesame seeds and fluffy butter. Pretty standard stuff.  Del's Salad: the only option for the first course. All the veggies were fresh and crisp, and the creamy dressing was addictive. The bacon was delicious, although not very crispy. It required considerable effort with the butter knife to cut it apart. I would've also appreciated more croutons on the plate, not just two modestly sized cubes.  8 oz. Filet Mignon: my choice, rather than the Roasted Chicken Breast or Salmon with Lobster Tomato Jus. I was instructed to cut it in half upon its presentation (on a very hot plate) to ensure proper doneness, and it was a very pink medium-rare. Tenderness was evident, as expected. However, the flavor just wasn't there. Whether it's a lack of seasoning on the crust or a less-than-stellar aging process, I was let down by my steak.  Green Beans and Chateau Potatoes: two side dishes, both served onto my steak plate upon my verbal confirmation and then left in the middle of the table. I loved the crunchy, buttery green beans but could've used a touch more salt and a lot more flavor in the potatoes. They were a mix of huge potato chunks and some mashed parts, which was fine, but I didn't find myself wanting to clean off that plate.  Chocolate Mousse: chose this for dessert rather than the Cheesecake with Strawberries. I'd been disappointed recently with various chocolate mousse desserts around town, but this was delicious and dark enough all the way through. Texture was consistently smooth as well. The raspberries were fresh but overpowering, so I opted to devour them quickly before enjoying the chocolate alone.  The red wine was okay. I overheard that it was a Malbec, but I wasn't intrigued enough to look into it further. They also aren't generous with the refills, which is probably best for the safety of all parties involved.  I would've given Del Frisco's 3.5 stars based on this meal, but I don't have the option of half stars and I certainly can't give it equal footing with my other recent steakhouse dinner. Maybe I'll come back in the future to try some other menu items, but I won't be in a hurry.

JJKg8Fz_c7TYG2Niw4T92g.text: This place is terrible. These reviews must be fake. My Wagyu steaks were inedible. Stay on the strip for a good steakhouse.

3l1j3-bX8D3TLVuaGJk9Tw.text: Returned after many years and those crab cakes were just as good as I remembered. Crab cakes, shrimp cocktail and beef carpaccio were our starters. One crab cake per two people was the perfect amount. That fresh lump crab meat and very little filler is what sets these babies above all other crab cakes.  The sauce with a touch of heat doesn't hurt either. Try dipping your bread in it.  My husband and I shared a wedge salad which they were able to split in the kitchen. I was not a fan of the bleu cheese dressing, which had a slightly sweet flavor.  Our friends shared the burrata and heirloom tomato salad. We didn't get a bite so I think they loved it!  For our main courses, we shared a dry aged ribeye and a bone in tomahawk cooked rare plus. These steaks were incredible. Melt in your mouth and so flavorful.  Sides were Brussels sprouts and chateau potatoes. The Brussels sprouts were good. The chateau potatoes were way too heavy on the truffle butter for my taste.  Full disclosure, I'm not generally a fan of truffle anything but chocolate. Just too rich for my tastebuds.   After all that and several bottles of Nickel & Nickel, we still managed to split a butter cake. This dessert was the right amount of sugary crust and paired perfectly with Butter Pecan ice cream.  Lest I forget, Zane & Lauren provided top notch service.  All things considered, we had a great meal and you just can't beat the cigar club ambiance of this place.

1z7S5-fFrMfcummYXQCy5g.text: We REALLY  Del Frisco's ALWAYS, ALWAYS GR8 SERVICE and last night no exception. Our server, Morgan was a deeelight, friendly, knowledgeable without being overtly selling the menu.       We like everyone who dines @ DF, goes for the crab  cakes~ simply thee BEST anywhere including Joe's Stone Crab, which don't EVEN compare and are 2x's the fare ~       Lots of Gr8 places in Las Vegas to get Steak~ and if you haven't been RUN , don't WALK to Del Frisco's Double Eagle.      The ONLY mishap we've EVER had @ DF were our cocktails.......I ordered a speciality Pecan Maple Manhatten $16.50  biggest error? Presentation..... dark & murky with a limp piece of beacon??? Even my brother asked what the H--- did I order? The 2nd error, served barely chilled~had it been served correctly the taste would have been spectacular ~ I did look at the bartender who was working the service window, he seemed quite active with a couple gals seated @ the bar. A recommended would be serve ICE COLD, keep the bacon  smaller & served across rim to rim on top of glass, not touching the actual cocktail.    My husband's Kettle 1 Martini , also served barely chilled, a wasted opportunity on both counts.     We should have returned them ~ I believe a restaurant of DF quality should get these things the FIRST time. HENCE 4 STARS

8cxiB88Fv2xNsCeeZtBM9A.text: I think this is the best steak house in Vegas. It's even better because it's off the strip. All the other steak houses have big name chefs, but not this place. The steaks are just the best. Our friend took us to Del friscos in NY which is the busiest one, and my wife and I loved it from beginning to end. The prices are like normal steak house prices, but it's a little cheaper. We brought our son who was about 2 years old, and everyone was professional from the server to the manager. My son gets a little fussy and loud sometimes, but the manger came by and entertained him for a little while, which I thought was really nice. After we reached home, the GM wrote a thank you card which I thought was a really nice touch. We always go back every time we're in Vegas. Two thumbs up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8gWcJHQn9smzXwx2FQMSfw.text: Love love love.... I was put in charge of finding the best steaks in Vegas for our Marine Corps Birthday reunion.  I don't really have much to say except the service and food is simply the best. We had a group of 10 drunk Marines and they did an excellent job of catering to us and even hook us up with deserts for our celebration. This was my 3rd visit and it gets better each time. FYI, the bone in filet is phenomenal.

kadP7aXHCMmQTFdsqtJJ-A.text: Best dinner I've ever eaten and I have been to a lot of excellent restaurants. Our first time - went for my wife's birthday - our waiter Brendan was awesome. All his recommendations were spot on. Had an amazing old fashioned, steak, uptown del's potato. Ridiculously delicious. Then they brought an awesome dessert for my wife and a card. Service, food and atmosphere were perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KJgLYbm4QccK-tcrNlonBw.text: Best Bone-In filet I've ever had in my life... The service is friendly, accommodating and fast. The restaurant is a little bit off the strip, but easy to reach by any type of transportation...

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RoAOwj6s4au8fv6CeOu0Yw.text: Made reservations for a Thursday night dinner and didn't have to wait at all. All the food was fantastic. The service was also super. The VIP drink is very good. Tasted like fresh pineapples. Me and my friend shared the bone in rib eye. I thought it was a bit too fatty, but it was very tender and juicy. We also got the truffle and fois gras butter in the side to try. The truffle butter is sensational. Definitely try it. There is another mushroom butter the server recommended that I would like to try next time.   We also ordered lots of appetizer. The best has to be the crab cakes. It was filled with chunks of crabs, hardly any fillers. The tuna tartar was okay, but the crunchy bread that went along with it goes very well with it. The Shanghai calamari was a bit too sweet for my tasting.   Another friend ordered the jumbo crabs and it was very fresh, but nothing out of the ordinary.   We also ordered the lemon cake to share with coffee. It was a huge piece. Even for four people we took half of it back with us. It is supposedly made freshly from scratch.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle butter. A must try.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo stone crab
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shanghai style calamari

tjfY2nC3jpI2jY_FADk_ng.text: Even truly great restaurants mess up sometimes.  But what keeps them truly great is how they react to a misstep.    We recently hosted 10 people at the LV iteration of Del Frisco's to celebrate a wedding.  Our staff was impeccable.    We went soup to nuts crazy ordering, lots of everything!  From apps to desert, wonderful delights came out of the kitchen, and everyone was in love.  A misstep?  What could have been a major bungle was so succinctly and professionally handled, that I won't even specify what it was.  But know that if you come here- the amazing staff at Del Frisco's will do whatever it takes to keep you satisfied, and then do even more.  A True gem.

J6lmwbLJBKQD-Hf94a1BdQ.text: I'm ready to go back! The staff here is unbelievably attentive and knowledgable!  But wait, the food!!!!! Do not fill up on the bread, you will regret it! The Del's salad is fantastic, and you literally could put the avocado salad dressing on anything and everything! The steaks were cooked to perfection, and I loved the pepper crust. For sides, I'd recommend the mashed potatoes and the spinach, the are not your average steakhouse sides! On to dessert!!! The bread pudding was so yummy and just perfect! I will definitely be back! And on my next trip I will have to try one of their signature pineapple drinks...check out the soaking pineapples in the jars!  It was a great ding experience! We loved dining to the sounds of the piano!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinner in Vegas at a fantastic steakhouse!

iBuEpCO9_2LyicFEdEwzkw.text: Food was amazing! Little off the strip, but worth the taxi drive. Staff was fabulous and catered to all of our needs!

MzJX2BTGATLgeXFLJvwg3g.text: Outstanding service. Amazing sides.   CONSUMER BEWARE: You are expected to verify your steak.   Tip, medium well will be rare.  The waitress will blame you for not cutting into it and verifying upon presentation.

BoRJhE6EH1aVH2O6Yl8tMw.text: What a great meal.  From start to finish a phenomenal dinner.  The service here is so amazing. The food is even better... If you understand great food, go here...

OBIR_rBAC3n_T7u_3UThYw.text: This is by far the worst experience I have EVER had at a Del Frisco's! I waited for about 20 minutes to receive a bottle of wine! On top of everything it took over 2 hours to receive my dinner. Uncalled for definitely not appreciated! I took my fiance there because I am so used to the AMAZING service and quality of food of Del Frisco's in Manhattan (which will definitely exceed your expectations)! The manager tried to make the situation better by taking a few things off the bill and giving us dessert, but by that time the damage was done. The waiter/waitress team we had was VERY weak. Lacked the desire to earn your business the next time you were in need for an unforgettable dinner. Food wasn't the greatest by any means , the only good thing I had I would say is the calamari, lobster Mac n cheese (which is normally to die for) were too runny and the cream corn was absolutely terrible. My steak was trash and it was $125(The Double Eagle dry aged double bone prime ribeye ) . All in all very disappointed with the experience and hope they get back on track and represent that name to the STANDARD THAT IT REPRESENTS!

-l9wl4yBJDF94Hlf_wFKIA.text: I was on the verge of giving DelFriscos a 4 star review (really, it was closer to 4.5 stars), but the banana bread pudding at the end (spoiler alert!), pushed me over the edge to 5 star status! I'm sorry for starting at the end of the meal, but that was one of the best desserts I've ever had! It was like sex on a plate. I'm not even a big banana fan (hee hee), but I love bread pudding, so I thought I'd give it a shot. WOW! It was amazing, like banana bread and bread pudding went out on a few dates and decided to have a baby. And the ice cream paired with it- omg.. I may return and just order dessert!  Ok, let's get to the meat of the review (see what I did there?). Dining with the self proclaimed "King of DelFrisco (DC)", was mildly amusing, because many of the servers came to speak with him and compare restaurant locations. I started with the VIP cocktail, which was perfect. Pineapple taste, but not overwhelmingly sweet, very smooth, really lovely. We got the shrimp cocktail (with all the sauces), and the crab cake for appetizers. I enjoyed them both, the crab cake was light, very little filler, but could have used a touch more seasoning. I still ate almost all of it, though!   I ordered the prime ribeye as my entree, medium rare. This was one of the first times I wished I had ordered it medium. It was just a smidge under for my taste. To be fair to DelFrisco, the server did ask me to cut it in the middle to see if it was prepared to my liking. I just didn't want to be rude and send it back. It was seasoned really well and had great flavor, but a couple more seconds on the flame would have been perfect for me.  We ordered the lobster Mac and cheese for our side dish, and it was very creamy, cheesy, with some lobster chunks, although not a lot. Like the crab cake, I did think it could have used more seasoning, though.   Btw, the bread was soft and warm, and the server gave us a fresh loaf when she boxed our leftovers. Speaking of service, it was attentive and friendly throughout. We had a few people waiting on our table, and the manager came by to check on us as well.  Of course, DelFriscos isn't a cheap meal, so do prepare to spend. I believe that our meal, which included 2 cocktails, 2 appetizers, 2 steaks, 1 side dish, and 1 dessert, was about $230. Pricey, but well worth it!

he8NaHNZcPYtUBz3LgV1Mg.text: PERFECT ANNIVERSARY DINNER! Red rose petals on the table with a card signed by the the staff. Our server, Jack, was terrific. She was the best server we have ever had. We loved the bread so much that we took a loaf home. We shared a shrimp cocktail and the cocktail sauce was great. I had the lobster tail, which was very good. My husband had the 12oz. fillet with peppercorn sauce. Perfectly cooked and he loved the sauce. Best steak he has ever had. We shared Chateau potatoes and asparagus. Both were excellent. Even though we were completely full, we ate the chocolate souffle and cake with ice cream. The manager, David and Executive Chef Fernando both came to our table to wish us a happy anniversary. The dinner and service made us feel special. We will definitely go back and recommend anyone wanting a special evening to go to Del Frisco's in Las Vegas.

w7TLlLiYqRIhvWCeByjcOg.text: This is by far the best steak house I've been to in Las Vegas from the atmosphere to the drinks food dessert and customer service it's all a 12 out of 10 what a great time I had here and can't wait to go back. I had the bone in rub eye with 16 oz lobster tail and sides of cream of corn and lobster Mac and cheese. Hands down best $$$ I've spent on food in a long time

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

76tCzJKK3xOElLUOUlSd4Q.text: Wow, what a disaster!  Been a regular at Del Frisco's since my first 2002 visit to the Manhattan location, on a scale of 1-10 ... its always a 10!  The Las Vegas location always scored an 8-9 in my book, while Denver come's in at 7-8, my last visit to Denver pushed into the 8+ territory.  However something is going seriously sideways at the Vegas location, first of all I didn't recognize a single person. Next observation was empty tables on a CES weekend ... never a good sign!  We were seated and greeted by some sort of team effort wait staff, wow, who's stupid idea was this. My King Crab arrived 10 minutes after the steaks, served stone cold with unsalted, unheated butter.  We witnessed 3 waiters taking food orders at one table while the rest of the room went unattended.  It took 5 minutes just to flag down a bus boy, no eye contact, nobody paying attention.   An unapologetic manager arrived 10 minutes later offering to make things right. By then I had already finished eating half of my wife's bone dry medium-rare steak and the horrible tasting cream corn and potatoes. We would have left right then and there but it took another 10 minutes just to flag a waiter for our check.  With all this down time we had a chance to look around at the other tables. Not one steak had any juice on the bottom of the plate, none of the side dishes had that perfect Del Frisco presentation. To the uninitiated everything may appear OK, however as a long time Del Fisconeer it's a serious disappointment. A free so-so tasting lemon cake did little to take the edge of the experience, I just wanted out of there ...  I don't know what to think ... I'm not looking for a free meal ... or corporate apology.   I just want my Vegas Del Frisco's back.

TIfPUREk2BZCuqoJSXkxGg.text: Unfortunately, I have to update my review and knock a star off.  My husband and I had only been here once before and loved it, so of course, when we came back into town this restaurant was at the top of our list to come back to.  This time I ordered the lamb chops (I was sooo sick of chicken).  I had never had lamb chops before but I can now say, I am a huge fan.  They had such great flavor and the dipping sauce was phenomenal.  I ordered the chateau potatoes with my meal and they were awesome as well.  I couldn't change a thing!!  Here's where the problem comes in.  My husband ordered the roasted chicken.  And although the chicken tasted good, the order underneath it was gross.  I asked him why he wasn't eating it and he told me it wasn't good.  I actually didn't believe him until I tasted it for myself.  YUK!!  It was hard and a little crunchy.  He also ordered the lobster mac & cheese.  It was very good but when we got back to our room we realized that the server who boxed our food for us (you don't do it yourself here) didn't put it in our back of left over items.  BOO!!!  We had over half an order left.  The lemon cake here is exceptional.  Glad that didn't change.    We'll probably come back next time, just wont get the chicken again and will make sure all of our items are in the bag before leaving.

0reKPgaZvdOXbf0S8303XQ.text: Reviewed the wrong steakhouse. So leaving the start but deleting the review.

C47pnnZlCuWwPLog3V0Kew.text: Tasty meal and service! Came here for a friend's bday dinner with a party of 9 on a Saturday and my only regret is that I wish I didn't eat so much before. If I had more gastric space, I would've tried everything.  Everyone ordered some form of steak, from rib eye, filet, to double eagle.  Being worse for wear and not sure I'd be able to take down a steak, I was the schmuck that ordered the chicken. Even that took me down. It was succulent!  Standouts were: Main courses (of course), crab cakes, calamari (DO IT!), onion rings (huge), asparagus, and mushrooms.. Ordered a wedge and it was good too. I might get a different salad next time. Also, the bread was so soft and warm. I'm a sucker for loading up on bread and butter.  Overall, great time here and a good choice if you want to escape the strip for a good meal with great lighting. There was a bit of a strange smell in the reception area, kind of sewery/weird plumbing smell. As stated above, the servers seemed to come out of nowhere and were on top of everything from the get go. They even presented a gigantic slice of lemon cake for our friend's bday. So massive that about half of it was left over after we passed it around the table. I look forward to dining here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium strip

ZR-HYwleLsY9qzUKeg_q2g.text: Been here a couple of times. The meat is great and the service is even better. Portions are pretty large so be ready for takeaway bags. They have an extensive wine selection of 1800 varieties, a cigar room, and even a live band. I think it's a great place to go off the strip to enjoy a nice meal.   Very attentive service and well staffed. You will not be disappointed. Even have some free golf tees for us golfers out there!

BUqk1lgv_jvH3BYAGtekfQ.text: I'll be as direct as possible. I've been going to Las Vegas for 30+ years and I have had a lot of great meals. With Vegas, you have some of the great chefs cooking some really out of the box types of foods that are interesting and creative. This is not a restaurant like that, this is in my opinion, is the great American steakhouse experience. From the moment we walked in we were immediately greeted, brought to our table and had a waiter (Taylor) that made this an over the top experience, as he was extremely attentive, very knowledgeable and had a super personality. Our lobster tail, crab cake, lettuce wedge salad, New York steak & lemon cake experience was a 10+ plus plus! I am a fan forever, Del Frisco's  is now my number one restaurant of choice where ever I go! Thank you for a mind blowing meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well worth it!

t9yMFFbTmS9PBGlWMlwDsA.text: Great food and great service. Was there for a corporate dinner so I gladly didn't have to pay for anything.

j1uOhMah3gV7iZoTNsJvxw.text: We went to Del Frisco's for a friend's graduation and it did not disappoint.  My fellow Yelpers are spot on in the good reviews.  The drinks were hearty pours and hit the spot.  I had an Old Fashioned and my buddy had a Manhattan.  They were spot on.  We ordered several appetizers to include the crab cakes and carpaccio.  The crab cake is pretty much 4oz of lump crab drizzled with a cajun sauce. It's delicious.  Same goes for the carpaccio.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye.  My waitress convinced me to have it done on the more medium side, as opposed to the med rare that I typically do.  She said it would give the fat in the steak an opportunity to liquify a little more.  It showed up and was frankly not what I wanted.  It was just too done.  However, before I could even get to into it the staff whisked the steak away and said that it would be done to my 100% satisfaction.  I apologized for being that guy.  They were awesome about it.  They kept saying that perfection is their goal.  Our waitress even told the chef it was her fault.  They go out of their way to make you feel satisfied.    I would highly recommend go to Del Frisco's.  Although they are in the $$$$ category you get your money's worth.

NNPq3WEgPeh5dFsP3-od4g.text: I really liked this place.  Overall if you've been to a fancy steakhouse, you'll pretty much get what you expected.  It's a little louder of an atmosphere than other steakhouses I've been to.  Overall the quality is great, but if there's anything that stands out at this place over all the other items they offered at this steakhouse, its one thing.   The ONION RINGS!  OMG, I have never had onion rings as good as the ones I've had here.  I even had some leftover and ate it the next morning as breakfast and they were still awesome.  I don't know why no one can make onion rings like this anywhere else, but I'd say it's worth the $10 or more they charge for them.  I've never had such a chewy delicious oniony ring before!  I think if it were possible, I'd just drop by and order a side of onion rings as a snack if that were proper because they were THAT GOOD!   Again everything else was great, but the onion rings really wowed me!

cZkJVfeweSEAbzIThbboNQ.text: Superb service I have ever received. Top notch service anywhere. Live piano player and he had mad vocals. The main host and waitress was very attentive and does not bug you like others in other restaurants. She actually has assistants which I find it surprising that they do not make eye contact with your. I guess the logic is that all your concerns must be addressed to the main waitress.   They ask if you need to go anywhere after dinner so they may prioritize your meal on the line. Don't expect fancy presentation, this is a steak house! But they serve your sides and do not leave the extra plates on the table. Bring your plate meat plate out and have you cut it in front of them so you may investigate the cut and wellness of the cooking. I had the rack of lamb and Loved it!   As we were eating, a piece of crumb was on the table and a waiter assistant stopped, took out a tiny hand spatula and scooped it out and off he left. Didn't make eye contact with anyone of us. I was like, "Woah.... did you see that!" Hahahaha  We were here for 2 birthday boys (I was one) and at the end, our waitress brought out these 2 awesome cuts of lemon cake and chocolate fudge. They were HUGE!!!! Enough for the whole table to enjoy. When she brought it out she said happy bday, but we don't sing. LOL cool, I don't like waiters singing anyways. The best part was at the end of the service, they did not add gratuity on the bill and we are a party of 6. Thats RESPECT!!!!! Worth the $400 bill! Thats with the cakes comped too.  BTW, I just wanted to add that when we left I wanted to use the bathroom. One of the waiter assistants said, right this way sir. As she was leading me to the bathroom, she bent the corner and another assistant came out that same corner and said, "This way sir" and carried on to lead me to the bathroom. WOW!!!! AWESOME!!! It was like a lateral pass. They didn't tell me where the bathroom was, they led me the way.   No cocky waiters/waitresses, no mishaps, no fancy..... Just class and a great experience. I will be glad to come back here again when I visit vegas soon. Just bring a heavy pocket with a big appetite.

8Vumy2vx8Bh72gxbGzRAvw.text: Top notch place. Though it does cost a bit, it is worth it. We had a fantastic server and a great team taking care of us. Unique cocktails, innovative appetizers and spot on steaks. We had a group of 8 people at a round table and it truly was just a fantastic evening. I highly recommend it.

8P7GlKPhvEv_TJ3VAIJFWA.text: the waiter told us you will not have crabcake like this ever...he was right...the crabcake was basically all crabmeat (hence $18 for just one), but dayam was it money!!!  I got the american wagyu/kobe tamahawk chop ($90) and my friend got the double eagle prime strip ($60)...don't get me wrong, my steak was very good but my friends tasted better we both thought...proof that just cuz something costs more doesn't mean its necessarily better.  for the side...GET the CREAMED SPINACH!  best creamed spinach you will eat.  this was a great spot.  if you have a big party, call in advance and reserve one of the rooms.  it was a great dining experience

kXMZvjVERu3z5SLlJ0qjHg.text: Planned the hubster's 40th birthday here - he loves steaks and hanging w/ friends - and this seem to be the best place to fit the bill.    Given some other group dinners we've had where the noise threshold made it difficult to chat and catch up with friends - I wanted to make sure we had a private room.     Del Frisco's has  private rooms availabe if you have over a certain number of folks, but then you need to use the preset dinner options.  They had set up the room so everyone was facing each other which was a nice touch.    We chose the $95 option preset menu which had enough steak options to satisfy this meat eating crowd as well as a salmon and chicken option that worked for others.   It is a lot of food with an appetizer, salad, main course w/ sides, and dessert - although the sides seemed a bit stingy (a tablespoon dollop of potatoes is not what I would consider a side).   A bonus was the perfect bacon slices that top your salad (if you get the house salad) and the amazing croutons that they make every day.    Everyone enjoyed their meal and the wait staff were so sweet and considerate, even bringing out a pen so everyone could sign the large wine bottle we got.  They were always a step ahead.   Making the reservation I was a bit worried as this part was not as friendly, but in the end with the welcoming manner of the wait staff, the intimacy of having your own room (we had 22 folks), and the good food, I was glad we chose Del Frisco's.

WGdEOJFkdqdQzNAEmNJiGg.text: Went here last night with my husband for Valentine's Day and food was horrible!!!  Let me start off by saying I had Del Frisco's 3 times in NYC and it was amazing so while we're in town, I suggested we try Del Frisco's.   The service was excellent but the steak was a big disappointment.  I ordered the bone-in filet and my husband had the double-eagle.  Both wanted medium rare..The first time they brought our steak out, it was medium well so we sent it back. Second time around was even worse...mine was still cold in the middle and my husband was so rare he could barely chew!  They were $70 per steak but by the time the second steak was brought out, we were tired and starving so decided to just eat what we could and left.  Conclusion: I will never return here. Being that they are a steakhouse, they should know what medium rare is vs. medium well or rare.

9uQJkVxOd8CyhJ-_7tMKKg.text: Great service and great food  Specially having Chef Fernando come to our table and hosting us party of 8  Love it!!!!

4HGhw_OysLwq02VGuLCMzg.text: *update - ok so I wrote this on my stupid kindle and I had complaints it wasn't that wordy.  If you type on a tablet you would understand.  And In all honesty the experience at Del Frisco's wasn't remarkable enough for me to write anything thorough, I just didn't like it that much.  I'll try to be more specific.  In short - really super super expensive on par with prices on the strip, but not really worth the price.  Many other steakhouses in town are just as expensive and are much better.  The quality of the meat and the flavor was good on the steaks that rely on aging, in this case we got the bone in ribeye and ny strip.  I prefer steaks that are cooked with a heavy crust and char on it, and I was disappointed, there was very little of that here.  Additionally, when you order medium rare, they cook it blue.  If you like your meat that raw, you will be happy, but it was too much for me.  I told them it was too raw for me and they just threw it on the fire, and it came out too well done, and much of the flavor disappeared, as it usually does when you recook meat.  We ordered a few sides, some asparagus (which was ok), and a corn dish that my husband liked but I thought was very flavorless.  It had tasso ham in it which didn't seem to help the taste of it.  The corn itself was not sweet (since corn isn't in season I expected this), but why serve a dish that doesn't benefit from being in the right season and delicious?  To make up not being real keen on the steak, they comped us lemon cake.  However, I don't really eat sugar that much.  While I appreciated it, I wish they could have asked first.  But taking a taste of it, this became he winner dish of the night.  If you have a sweet tooth and love cake, or lemon cake, it would be worth the trip to only get that dessert.  It was phenomenal.

di9b9UTInuKs7Ses4iHWvQ.text: This place is great. The Prime Rib Eye Bone In was ridiculously good and cooked to perfection. Be sure to get the dozen oysters, six is not going to be enough when they are that good. Chopped salad was dressed perfect and you can taste all the ingredients. We finished with the Lemon Cake and could not have been more pleased.  Get off the strip and go here.

xcsRQyOMYUGIFYZyPIAo2A.text: I will never again come to Vegas without visiting Del Frisco's! Everything we had redefined what we thought we knew about the items we ordered. To start we ordered the crab cake & the calamari. Something about how both were fried created this shell of crispy, golden, goodness... plate scrapingly good. The calamari was drizzled in some sort of spicy sauce that I could only hope was bottled somewhere that I could buy cases of.  Entrees  were shared among us and boy were we glad to do so... we challenged the Tomahawk & largest Lobster tail they offered. Those two entrees w/ the appetizers were enough for 4 people! Our goal was to eat and be comfortable w/out having leftovers. Mission accomplished except for the fact that we were stuffed! Stick a fork in me cause I surrender! I'm a fan for life. If I were a polygamy practicing Mormon, Del Frisco's would be my #2!!!

hFO0i2FJbetuDX3IMVLrXg.text: I've never had a bad meal here. Service has always been great - very attentive, accommodating, and knowledgeable. Food is out of sight. Steaks are what you go for - Bone in ribeye is recommended. Sides - I've had them all and there's nothing you shouldn't try - mushrooms are a staple. Stone crab was in season the last time i went and they were great.

BYAw_ArW9OboJopDmM6sYA.text: I have been to a few steakhouses such as Ruth Chris, Morton's, and etc, but Del Frisco is on the top of the list.  It is one of those MUST go places for me when I'm in Vegas.  The ironic thing is Ruth Chris is right across the street from Del Frisco in Vegas.  I wonder how they stay in business when Del Frisco is sucking up all the business.  Must be a vegetarian Ruth Chris or something.    The ambiance of the place is great.  There is live music and the lighting is not too bright and not too dark, just perfect.  I can see what I am eating.  The service is was top notch.  Our server was professional, knowledgeable about every item on the menu, and very attentive.  The food will have you rolling your eyes back.  It's that good.    You start off with freshly baked bread.  The crab cake pairs really well with the cajun sauce.  Don't miss out on the crab cakes, you will regret it.  I had the Ribeye and it is the best Ribeye steak I ever have had.  It was perfectly seasoned and cooked to the right temperature.  The sides I had with my steak was potatoes au grouton, mushrooms, and mac and cheese.  The best side dish is the potatoes au grouton.  It is THE ultimate man side dish.  It is potato squares with cheese and bacon.  Nothing healthy about this dish, just pure goodness.  If you are a guy, you have to order this dish.  If not, just send me your man card.  Unfortunately I did not try out any desserts because I was stuffed to the max.  I will make sure to try out one of the desserts on my next visit (hopefully soon).  The bill will be over $100 easy.  It is expected when dining in a good steakhouse.    In the end, I wish I can give Del Frisco 6 stars!  Matter of fact, here you go Del Frisco's,  *.  This place knows how to make steak.  If God came down and asked you to recommend a good steak place, you better recommend Del Frisco's or you are going to hell because you are doing God dirty if you recommend any other place.  Bon Appetit everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cappuccino at the end of the meal
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread pudding
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet Mignon

ohT8DDZRbgh_fqSFfNHVDw.text: This is the best steak place I've ever been.  It won't break your bank account, but will come close to doing so, especially if paired with a bottle of wine.  I ordered the 22 oz bone-in prime ribeye.  Now, for those of you who know your customary units, 16 oz is a pound, so this is more than a pound of beef.  It's a huge serving, but it's sooo good!  It's perfectly seasoned and cooked right. I asked for medium, which was pink, but no blood, the way I like it.    Since it's such a huge serving, I thought I would eat half and save the other half for tomorrow's dinner.  Well, so much for that idea.  Now, I'm not sure if I should brag about this, but I'm 5'5" and 110 pounds, so a 22 oz steak would be a lot, but I ate it all in one sitting, because it was THAT good.  And I probably would've been up for sharing another one.    So, to sum it up, this place is absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend it.

besP-p419Bl9OCrbcg3-4A.text: I have severe allergies to gluten and corn. I was pleased when they had a gluten free menu. This turned out to be False advertising however as they clearly knew nothing about cross contamination. I ended up with hours of horrific stomach cramps, and that was the nice part of purging their bad food. Furthermore, the steak was $90. I am used to high prices and good service. In fact, I go to expensive places BECAUSE I have special needs. It really turns me off to pay top dollar and to have full assurances, and then to get so horribly sick. I fed the rest of that expensive steak to my dog. Do yourself a favor, go elsewhere.

wjeWjR1R4Tg7lqhxHLEDng.text: After having a great meal at the NY location, I had to to check out the LV location as well.  I stopped by today with my babe for a holiday feast.  When we arrived , we were seated at a table by the bar.  The furnishings are typical for a grand steakhouse.....dark woods with white tablecloths.  Tonight Del Frisco entertained their guests with a pianist who played and sang soft rock music throughout the meal.......awesome!  We started the meal with their fried calamari and their wonderful, oven-baked warm bread.   The calamari was prepared "Shanghai" style with a sweet, red pepper, tangy sauce....totally awesome flavor.  For dinner, we had the bone-in rib eye steaks and sides of creamed spinach with bacon, lobster macaroni and cheese and skillet potatoes and onions.  The steak was perfectly prepared and cooked.......full of flavor and just the right amount of marbling.  The sides were outstanding......the spinach and lobster mac and cheese were excellent.  The skillet potatoes were thick chips.......and the onions were cut equally as thick.......they went perfectly with the steak flavor.  For dessert, we had the 7 layered lemon cake.....one of the best deserts I have ever had!  It was sweet...tangy and so fucking--good!  Overall....one of my best steak meals ever!

8_4F0APvYMgnYSQDIirRJA.text: Del Frisco's is the absolute best steakhouse in Las Vegas... Hands down.  The night before, we devoured the Beef Bowl Cut (25oz) bone in prime rib from Lawry's Prime Rib and we wanted to continue the good eats tour.  We ordered:  16oz Bone in Filet Mignon ($65) - Probably the most tender piece of meat I have ever eaten... Cooked medium rare, this behemoth was flavorful and practically melted in my mouth. I would definitely order this again!  32oz Tamohawk Bone in Ribeye ($90) - Prepared medium rare as well... This is from a Wagyu Steer and it was perfectly marbled. The meat was tender and robust with flavor. I also loved this choice! Definitely a repeat order.  Crab Cakes in lobster sauce ($17) - I've never had some much crab in my crab cakes! The lobster sauce was a hit as well. Our waiter suggested that we dip our bread in the sauce and boy did we...! I would order this again.   Potatoes Au Gratin - Large chunks of bacon, plenty of cheesy goodness over potatoes. A winner!  Supreme Creamed Spinach - Finally a creamed spinach that taste more like spinach that the cream. It was delightfully delicious and the perfect compliment to any meat.  Lemon Doberge Cake ($10) - The most sinfully delicious lemon cake you will ever have. The cake is light and fluffy and the lemon cream is light and refreshing. I went with a friend who hates desserts and much as he hates dancing. We were at a best friends wedding and she asked him to dance which he declined. How do you decline a dance requested by the bride whom you known for 10+ years? That's how much he hates dancing... And thats how much he hates desserts. After reading that, he polished off a whole slice of lemon cake by himself. Now thats a pretty damn good slice of lemon cake!  Overall I would definitely recommend this place to anyone coming to Vegas looking for a steak... let alone a good meal. Although it was on the pricey side, it was worth every penny. I cant sing enough praise for this place!!  Look at my pictures!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Doberge Cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Doberge Cake ($10)
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats with Creamed Spinach and Potatoes Au Gratin

iZLdI2BngXNE3DvzWZXUeg.text: Don't know why it says this place is closed down? The food is excellent. Sushi not so much. Price wise it's pretty expensive but the flavor and food kind of match. Overall a positive experience for me.

sKARs8wkKlnUPWLDWcdHNA.text: My husband surprised me and took me here for Valentine's Day. It was wonderful. The filet, lobster, asparagus and lobster mac and cheese were all phenomenal. The fried calamari was delicious, it just wasn't hot. We will definitely come back again.

wksEr8AumzAPNF9E3WcEIw.text: What can I say about this place? That I absolutely love it!   It is one of the BEST steaks I ever had! My friends introduce me to restaurant week and I came along for the ride when they decided to go to this steak house.  I remember we had reservations and it was about 20minutes till we got seated, but I didnt mind it because they we were at a bar and enjoying some drinks.    Once we got seated we were served right away and started ordering our food.  I ordered the filet mignon and mashed potatoes.  & my oh my it was just EXQUISITE. The taste of the mignon was extravagant and you can basically cut the steak with your fork, (dont need a steak knife).  It came with a crab cake on the side and it was my very first taste of what a carb cake was & it made me just love eating it over & over & over again. I had mashed potatoes, too it was pretty awesome but I felt like it could have been better! But the filet and the crab cake just blew me away.  I will definitely be back again.

ylxoq0Vfb4MaxKMKXIocng.text: Came here for my 40th with about 7 others.  We had stiff drinks at the bar, excellent service all around, and a phenomenal old school steak house experience.

Hm8Qgf_D80-n9pKqU-bEEw.text: The best steak in Las Vegas. When I asked for as rare-as-legally-possible they delivered! The service was OUTSTANDING, the scotch menu was superb, and the steak was so good you'd eat it as your last meal. The sides are a class all their own with the lobster mac-n-cheese taking the top prize in the flavor department. I couldn't possibly have enjoyed myself more than I did while eating here and look forward to returning!

6J8oMnw8iGpDMnJZ9N3Scw.text: Wonderful service, great food, overall highly recommended!  Well worth the trip off the strip.

fVRN0EV_a3H6EsVgrbs1Aw.text: Had an amazing dinner last night celebrating my birthday. Food was amazing and their service exceeding my expectations! Will not mis a chance to go back here on my next trip to Las Vegas.

kFZCefHDtb6sZVYMQDnCsw.text: Ok yes all the reviews are correct.. I can vouch so no need to continue on... But yes yes yes... best steak house evaaaaah... Great cocktails, piano bar and great steak and lobster... nice wine list, but pretty spendy especially being off strip, but was very well worth it!

kGysY9-YpbQ4imTVu6wmeA.text: This is just a classic steak house done to perfection.  Great quality steaks prepared to the right temperature.  If you are looking for items like bone marrow, foie gras...not here.  Come here for the crab cakes to start ( it's like they took the crab and rolled it into a ball, cooked it and served it, that's how much crab is in it ).  Then the tomahawk wagyu steak.  Very good but definitely not any where close to Japanese wagyu.  I would say more AAA Prime.  So in that regards, not a perfect 5 stars. Food - Steaks...don't come here and order fish, it's not Del Frisco's Double Eagle Fish House Wine Selection - excellent.  If you can't find a varietal and vineyard you like here, then congratulations you're a billionaire.  Atmosphere - more classic than hip on the strip.  Lots of serious " I will take you out for a date " tables.

OQo1wwXezuWIefOMb1cn2w.text: After leaving my poor review for our experience back in Dec 2014, a manger  contacted me and asked me to come back during my May 2015 visit to give them one more try.  She apologized for the experience and told me that is not something that normally happens.  I was first impressed with her sincere response to my review and for dealing with it so professionally.  Good job Toryn! (not sure how her name is spelled, sorry). My husband and I visited last night May 29th and the experience was like what we had in April 2014.  They won us back starting with the service from Benny, he was clear in his communication, offered good suggestions, was attentive, personable and really good job.  The food was spot on this time, my 8 oz fillet was not overly seasoned and cooked at the right temperature as requested.  The fillet melted like butter.  The cream corn side was awesome and not overly heavy.  My husband had the baked potatoe and we both had Del's salad to start.  The VIP was freshing and loved the infused pineapple taste. This is what a great dining experience should be like.  We felt like it was our first experience and are fans once again.

tn32iHD6H5cwelxJcRGKBw.text: Love this place, I feel like they make Ruth Chris look like the MacDonald's of steakhouses.  Great staff, they even asked for my address and my waitress sent me a thank you letter!  Wonderful place, delicious steaks!

2lCN4WJLBaaMWIIBpcuIMQ.text: I checked this place out because of my foodie buddy who is a yelp hore and has been talking about this place for weeks.  Finally, made plans to see what the 4.5 star hype was about.. I had no reservation and the place was quite busy but the patio was empty, so the patio it was. The server was really cool and had many Vegas hot spot suggestions. They served the usual bread and butter, bread tasted fresh and butter was whipped and easy to spread.   Starter: Bleu Cheese Lettuce Wedge = Nicely portioned, Lettuce chopped finely, Bleu Cheese Dressing was one of the best I ever had and the jumbo croutons added the right texture.  Entree: Bone-In Ribeye (cooked Medium Well). Chef actually came out to serve this and asked to cut the steak in half to make sure it was cooked to par. Steak came on a hot plate and had a different aroma to it. This place heavily seasons their steaks. When Slicing the meat I noticed it had a tender falling apart feel to it. After my first bite, I took a few more.. It really had a distinctive flavor that overpowered the natural steak flavor that I'm used to at a Steak House. However, it was delicious and unusual the same time. I personally like my steaks to taste like the natural traditional steaks (Let the natural flavors of the meat do its job).   Sides: Lobster Macaroni & Cheese = 3.5/5              Maque Choux Corn = 3/5              Onion Rings = 2/5   Service was great, the bleu cheese salad got me salivating thinking about it and the steak worth a try

re5DZ0eqHHeKNpI63UtscA.text: I hosted a private business function for about 25 people last month at Del Friscos. I've done these types of business dinner presentations all over the country. Many times when you ask a restaurant to do a pre-fixed menu, they order cheaper cuts of meat for the event and the food is sub par. That is not the case at this restaurant. You could cut the filet mignon with a butter knife. The service was excellent - the servers knew when to give us privacy and when we needed service. The room had a great space and the atmosphere of the restaurant was beautiful.

gbnVji6b0HK9z2pYdfY0fw.text: In a city with 100 great steak houses, this is rated on the bottom of my list. I will say I did have good service, however, with a hefty price tag should come delicious steak. They steak was ok. The sides were ok yet boring. Nothing memorable.

CsMCOhU2bXD2eeeAD1jWTA.text: It was the first time my boyfriend and I went and it seemed like they have quite a few repeat customers.  It was impressive to see the hostess/servers interact with the customers, however... I must say that we felt kinda unspecial because of that.  (i don't know if that's fair to knock them on though...)  Tuna tartare was eh.  The steaks were good and the lemon cake was delicious.  We couldn't finish our meal, so we packed all the leftovers ate it over 2 meals the next day.  Still delicious.  One thing that made our night was the music.  They had a pianist sing and play the piano.  It really created a classy and relaxing atmosphere.

aa6e86I6I7m5pdY6DuU4QQ.text: In a word: amazing.  My date and I dined at this off-strip steak house for the first time after being recommended for some time... and oh boy.  Delicious.   I had the lamb and my date had the rib-eye.  Both were cooked perfectly. We asked out waitress--Katie, I believe--what side we should go and she suggested the lobster mac and cheese.   WORTH EVERY SINFUL CALORIE. I also took her recommendation on wine by the glass, and was pleasantly surprised by her thoughtful choice.    My only regret was that we were so full, we could not order dessert.   The food, service, and atmosphere were all top-notch.  We will be back, for sure!

HuSnm1hZaa3EJK-xD4qStA.text: This is a very good steak house just off the strip. Great ambiance. Amazing number of wait staff. Attentive but not excessive.   My colleague and I both started with the special salad of the night and it was excellent! A chopped salad with a creamy basil dressing. With the bread it could have been a meal in itself.    For dinner I had the crab cakes which I was told was their most popular item. They were also excellent, two large mounds of crab with just enough filler to hold them together served with a spicy sauce. My colleague had the filet and it was good but not as tender as one would expect.  For dessert I had the banana bread pudding and it was very good. Big enough to share. More cake-like than a traditional bread pudding.  Like all high end Vegas steak houses this place is expensive, maybe a bit too expensive. In this price range you can do a bit better even in Vegas. So overall I give it four stars.

UlTMnmhlVfgDD7DeCqP76Q.text: I went to Del Frisco's last night because I had never been to one.  I was starving after a long flight.  I sat at the bar and had a lemon drop where the simple syrup used was way too sweet.  The Caesar salad was good (but did have a leaf with the red stuff in it) and the steak tips, because I was traveling and couldn't eat a whole steak.  I thought this would be a good way to taste the "exceptional" food this restaurant had to offer.  I was wrong.  I know it was a low end dish, but each steak tip almost broke my teeth because they were only grissel (sp?).  In fact, there was bone in one of them.  I wasn't asked how my meal was until after I was done.  For my second drink I asked for less lemon and that didn't  happen.  The reason I'm giving two stars is that it was fun to watch the bartender at work.  There are so many other choices in Vegas--when I come back I will go somewhere else.

5ClUpQb0e2W0n-wM7_lfiQ.text: Hard to beat, can't find a bad thing to say unless you're looking for a very quiet, intimate setting.  Its a lot of energy and high volume in here.  Steaks are outstanding, service is top notch and the drinks are hard to beat.

5aUpb2bjKrTtX4U0VYSznw.text: Del Frisco's is definitely one of the better steak houses that I've ever had. I wanted to try it because I had just won some money playing craps that night and decided what the heck I'll treat myself out to a nice dinner. I ordered the ribeye like I normally do at every other steakhouse I go to. When they bring out the steak they tell you to cut through the middle to make sure it is perfectly cooked. Once I took my first bite, I knew why it was so highly rated on yelp. The steak was very juicy and tender and had a peppery seasoning which kept its flavor till the very last bite. This was accompanied by a lobster mac and cheese which really evened the whole meal out. It was very creamy and flavorful and they topped it with a crust that really gave it a nice texture. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place and would put it in my top 3 best steaks I've had

fV1tdPfyDAEyY7zif4Y9nA.text: quite literally one of the best steaks ive had in my entire life.    entire meal was amazing, I was pampered from the getgo by multiple staff.    totally worth it.

aChRGR3KBdBNODGYB2J3CQ.text: I had the rib eye steak and the crab claws.  The food was excellent, but on par for Las Vegas standards.  Service was excellent and fast.  The crab cake was tasty with a small portion.

Upvo6KJswtEwBsIsLmFq5g.text: Suh-weet jeebus. I can't remember the last time I've had a meal this good. And with such prompt, excellent service as well. We had a huge party of about 13 people and we had multiple servers attending to us to make sure we had a pleasant experience.  The crab cake appetizers were baked, not fried... and you can actually REALLY taste the crab, unlike most other crab cakes. It was almost made of just pure crab flakes (huge pieces actually)... and it comes with a sauce that is to die for!  The prime rib was cooked and seasoned perfectly... oh so good, I'm drooling right now as I write this review. Came on a hot plate. All of their sides were so delicious, I don't even know where to begin to describe them. Even the bread was delicious (unlike other breads... this is extra good!).   We had the mango sorbet to cleanse the palate after dinner. I never thought a sorbet could be so delicious... it tasted like real sweet frozen mangoes! Yummmm.  Any fan of steak (or just anyone who knows what good food is) MUST visit this place while in Vegas.

qdi0WVUMSkM1e8pBt9g17w.text: At the ripe old age of 30, I have come to the realization that meals should not be ordered based on a number or include the words "value meal". Del Frisco's is one of those restaurants that makes me happy to be a grown-up. We usually start off with the calamari which has a spicy kick. The True star of their menu is the steak; it truly melts in your mouth, it's like a piece of buttery goodness like nothing else I've had in my life. All of the sides that we have tried have been good, but I would highly recommend the sauteed mushrooms.  I would even venture out to say that I wouldn't mind eating those damn mushrooms instead of their steaks and calling it a meal, but that's crazy talk. Order both and give your dining companion the evil eye so that he wont feel comfortable touching your food, and call it a day.

wyOx-32hhwBbBg84A6jYeA.text: Holy cow!  Let's just start with that.    We all have them, those moments when we've just lost our taste for life. Maybe you might think your taster is broken.  Or maybe you just need a firm kick right in the taste buds to remind you what AWESOME taste like. No, your tasters aren't broken. The places you've been eating have just lulled them to sleep like a nice warm belladonna tea.  Wake them up!  Eat here!  OMG!  Small filet, medium rare with a side of sauteed shrooms. (Skip the asparagus. Maybe it was a bad night because compared to the taste dynamite on my plate, it was a stack of lady fingers - cute at best but sure didn't blow me away like the rest.)  Wow.  Rinse with a Coors Light. Repeat.  Maybe tomorrow.

W-eWmcJgW2TbMBJK0TqY4w.text: The best steaks I have ever had.....it was delectable. I ordered the 2 steak medallions -  One was sprinkled with black truffle and has a scallop on top. The other had crab and a cream sauce.  and the lobster mac and cheese - IT'S A MUST!!!

inyOFWdWAqDV4QsBX5XP8Q.text: Thanks to Yelp, my husband and I were able to find a really wonderful restaurant to celebrate our 10 year anniversary in Las Vegas. We checked out all the other big name steakhouses and fancy restaurants on the Strip, but we finally agreed on coming here based on the excellent reviews and the $99 summer special!   Yes, you heard that right, it's called the Power Couple menu, I believe, and you do have to ask for it since they only give you the regular dinner menu as soon as you're seated. It's a pre-fixe meal for two that includes a salad, 8 oz filet mignon, crab cake, a choice of side (I highly recommend the spinach), and dessert. Suffice to say, we were stuffed to the gills by the end of the meal.   Price - excellent!  Hurry, the special ends on Labor Day.   Taste - the steak was incredible; the crab cakes were moist and replete with jumbo lump crab, no fillers; the Del's salad was made more extraordinary because of the two full thick-cut strips of crunchy bacon.    Service - In spite of the initial snafu where our server was nowhere to be seen for the first 15 minutes, we were rescued by the friendly and efficient Alana. She profusely apologized for the confusion, took our orders immediately, and continued to check in on us no less than 5 times during the meal. We were served by about 6 different people throughout the night, from the manager folding the hubby's napkin when he got up to go to the bathroom to refilling my Coke without being asked. The manager was even there to ask us if our steaks were cooked just the way we wanted it, as it was being served to us. Furthermore, since we told them it was our anniversary, we were greeted by everyone "Happy Anniversary" at least 8 times, and our drinks were comped too. Thanks to Alana and the wonderful staff of Delfrisco's for a night to remember!

CjEboIf76PB_A70D1lwytQ.text: First of all I'll start by saying this place is top notch. Its definitely a Prime steak house (Not like places that front like they are). Second I cannot agree with people saying this place is Waaayyyy better then Ruth's Chris, I could see people thinking its better, but not by a lot.  Pros: Ridiculous cuts of meat, The table bread was awesome, wine selection is excellent, fast and a tentative service, Lobster mash (I don't eat lobster but the whole table loved it)  Cons: Our server offered us the Awagyu ribeye special for 2, which 4 of us ordered, then later they told us they were out of that cut of meat (Not pleased about that) . My steak was a little over cooked, so make sure you speak up if its not to your liking (I was really hungry and it was late, so I let it slide because the cut was sooo good). Not much else.  In Conclusion this place is worth every penny and deserves all the praises it receives. Ask for a semi private or private room if you have a good size group, they don't charge extra for it.

rQqFcb1Y_mtKX2DpCrAspw.text: I decided to treat myself to nice dinner for my birthday and was very glad I picked this place. Everyone was very friendly and attentive. I also unexpectedly received a free slice of lemon cake. Which is very popular there. Everything was delicious. I look forward to my next visit

PGXeNIGrR2VtINzKnCnuHA.text: Simply the best steak in Vegas.   Staff is super cool, not stuffy, and there is usually a thank you card in mailbox by the time I get home from Vegas.

9ABpk6UYe3sVjTuyfIu48g.text: Too few places in Vegas like this.  Disclosure: I have boycotted this place for years because they don't allow corkage.  However, a couple friends dragged me here for a celebration and I was kicking and screaming the whole way there.  Once there, I tried to get over my personal feelings and enjoy the night.    I'm glad I did.  The service was excellent.  I swear there there about 3 people waiting on us, the manager came by a couple times and the sommelier was very chatty with us, as well.    We ordered two appetizers: crab cakes (good, full of crab with very little filler - the way it should be) and oysters rockefeller (I prefer raw oysters, but this was pretty good).    The wine list was deep, which is probably why they don't allow for corkage, but it was pretty pricey, even compared to some strip restaurants.  However, I dug in and found some two bottles of wine that were maybe 50% over retail.    For our entrees, we shared two steaks: a bone-in filet and a bone-in rib eye.  Both were med-rare, of course, and cooked to perfection.  I really don't like filet, in general, because it usually has very little beef flavor, but this cut was actually pretty tasty.  The rib eye was good, on par with the best I've had.  Meaty, tender and bloody - just the way I like it.  For sides, we definitely over-ordered with mashed sweet potatoes (very good), mac and cheese (meh), creamed spinach (among the best) and potatoes au gratin (nothing special).    For desert, we had the lemon cake (fantastic!!!) and the chocolate cake (pretty good).  The portions of everything were good sized, especially the sides.  We were stuffed.  The food was memorable and the service was spectacular.  It almost felt like it was neighborhood restaurant, as opposed to something so close to the strip and packed with tourists.

mjhCLBw44vqkpc6FfErWZg.text: I had the best steak ever!  I've been to Mortons, Ruth and Chris, Flemings.  All good steaks but the best I've had comes from Del Frisco's.  I had the bone in filet with the lobster mac and baked potato.  Bomb!  Service was excellent.  They have you cut the steak to make sure it's cook to your liking.  Drinks were great.  Can't wait to go back and try the tomahawk steak.

9ITLzL5Nf-32Dt8NxrpLTA.text: This place was really good. I had the filet mignon and i loved it. You can taste the peeper on the filet mignon, which I like. I also had the macaroni and cheese with lobster, creamy spinach and asparagus. Loved it all!  I would recommend the creamy spinach and asparagus side to everyone. I also tasted my husbands shrimp scampi, it was a little to oily for me but the shrimp was good. For dessert the lemon cake was delicious I never thought I would like it but it totally "wow"ed me. The service was even better!!!! I felt like royalty and everyone I mean everyone friendly.

sZFsjnx-fwyHNWwNvVSKgQ.text: Every steak I have had at Del Frisco's has been amazing!  All of the sides have always been great, though I miss the jalapeno-bacon mac & cheese, the lobster style was nice.  Atmosphere is great for dates, business outings or group dinners, and they always have something special to show you at the end of the night, here they had the James Bond table, which was very cool!  Though you will pay a bit more here, you know this ahead of time.  They treat you very well, and the thank you card I got in the mail a few days later was a very nice touch!

96aR_zTgWL1aHoazZKvV-g.text: First time here even though I used to frequent Vegas quite a bit. I got to say the entire experience here was magnificent. We got there early and had some time to hang out at the bar. The bartenders were quite attentive and talkative. Great times at the bar.   The hostess found us at the bar and escorted us to our seats. Our waiter was great and made our time at Del Frisco's fun. Thanks Joey. From your input on the food, wine, and history of the restaurant we had the best time.  The food was amazing. We had ordered the crab cakes, double eagle prime, spinach, and mac n cheese. If you order the crab cakes, I would recommend that you order your own. You probably won't want to share. The double eagle prime was cooked to perfection. I love ordering a medium rare and having it just melt in your mouth. This did just that. The meat was so flavorful and tender. The sides that we ordered were good too but not something I absolutely have to have. I would be content with just the crab cake and steak.  Definitely worth checking out!

gamaiYJK2kOcztgYTtbFcQ.text: I visited Vegas for a tradeshow and was taken to dinner at Del Frisco's. I had never heard of it except the reviews from my peers that it was "the best steak ever."  We had a large party (8) and so we had reservations but had to wait for a table. The place is busy and standing room only in the bar. I had a lemon drop and it was above par.  We finally were seated in the corner and had a semi-private table. The one interesting thing that stood out from 'high-end' steakhouses to Del Frisco's is that we had 2 waiters who constantly stood by us.  They dished us our sides and were always there to assist with additional beverages or any issues we had. I've been to other 'high-end' steakhouses where the waiter is hands-on before your meal but then not present until after. I appreciated the extra touch.  The steak's were quite large and I had the sirloin. I had the 8-oz and was barely able to finish it as it was a thick cut as well as the large portions of the sides.  After we arrived back to our offices, we received a personal thank you card from Del Frisco's hand-written thanking us for visiting and to come back when in town.  Loved the service, quality of food and the personal touches. I didn't end up feeling like another 'customer' who passed through. Definitely going to spend $100/pp for a meal but a nice place to enjoy a quality steak and get away from the "typical" diners on the strip.

QjN_Wxcl43kFGsCGTKQU6A.text: DELICIOUS!!!  We celebrated my mom's 60th birthday here and could not have been more pleased.  J and I had just had the Morton's filet and seafood for two deal and were so impressed that we couldn't believe that we were just impressed with Del Frisco's.  Everything was delicious.  We had the house salad (with two strips of thick bacon on top), the filet and crab cake combo and chocolate mousse and butterscotch cheesecake for dessert.  The filet was soooo good; mildly crusted with pepper and cooked to a perfect medium rare.  The crab cake had so much crab and almost no "filler".  The mousse and cheesecake were good, but by the time they came out, we were soooo full!  THey brought out a piece of lemon cake for my mom's birthday and boy was that great!!!  Light and fluffy and just perfect!  We will definitely be back that next time we're in town!

C6mM82YpxuQaOIIG3OhkVQ.text: Del Frisco's   Wow! what can I say but wow! This is how a meal is supposed to be. Good food, good friends, good times and in Las Vegas what more can you ask for...yes there was a limo involved.   So here's the run down kids, Old fashioned done to perfection. They make you feel like a VIP from the moment you step in the door. The food; Meat, Meat and more Meat. Who cares about the sides, there will be no awards given for supporting cast members on this meal.   Accept for the brief appearance by lobster tail, the steak is the headliner. When you go, act like you've been there before, expect to order sides because the steak stands alone and bring your casino winnings so you can pay for your meal.

x2sDPC0uuMQ_HC9ETNMGdQ.text: great off the strip steakhouse.  they have very decently priced pre fix 3 course dinners which are highly recommended

dFEzsttudnMysvG7mr62YA.text: After 4 days in LV we were really due for something special and searched yelp..  Del Frisco's & yelpers delivered and is hands down the best steak i have ever had.  Ruth Chris is not even close to this place.    We went in on a wed night I made reservation but probably was not needed as the place was not to busy.  I had the Rib Eye and my wife and the fillet.  Both cooked and seasoned perfectly.    Crab cake & Oyster aptz. were awesome.  sides were great too we had the potato au gratin and mixed vegs..  No room for dessert.  Our waiter Joey was great and the service amazing.  I swear we had at least 3 other people serving our table besides our waiter.   With beer, wine, & tips the bill came out to about $280.  Sure pricey but well worth it and in my opinion a better meal than most of the high end Strip restaurants.     I will surely make this must eat next time i am in LV.    Relax...Enjoy...Eat.

Eapv_LWIuQN9MJP6UOJMLA.text: This place was amazing. Great service, perfect timing of all courses, the 12 ounce filet was easily some of the highest quality meat I've ever come across while being perfectly cooked and the lemon cake (made fresh in house everyday) was the perfect end. Will return soon with a smile on my face.

JaPJbDdtvqRX7w4ZOw8Cbw.text: Awesome as usual. This was my 5th time back and every single time it was amazing! Service was great! We came for a bachelor party and had a party of 23 guys, which you can imagine could get out of hand. They put us in a private room and took the best care of us!
