We got there late around 10pm and the kitchen closed at 10:30 but that didn't stop them from taking care of us and we never felt rushed. We left around midnight and there was no one left in the place except for us. If your looking for a great dinner this is the spot of the strip!

lKMR0ARNxB4qqD-nNXQjGg.text: I was in Vegas with 9 of my friends for a bachelor party.  The groom to be wanted to have steak dinner one night, I did some research prior to arriving in Vegas.  After looking through numerous sites for all the steak houses in Vegas, Del Frisco received the highest marks.   Our dinner was on a Saturday night, and I didn't make the reservation until the morning of, and they had no problem taking us in that night for a table of 10.  (I think we didn't have any issues because our reservation was at 9PM)  When we arrived for our reservation, they send us to the bar for a few minutes to get our drinks before dinner, after a couple of minutes; the hostess came by and led us to our table.  We sat in the back corner in the main dining room, the lighting wasn't too bright or too dim, and the ambient was tastefully done. Our servers (we had 3 for our table) were very attentive; the main server recited the specials thoroughly, his recommendations were on point.  Most servers in most restaurants usually recommend the highest price item on the menu, but he did not.  He recommended a red wine that was perfectly balanced with our meal, at $100 per bottle, we ordered 3 for the table, and that was enough for dinner since we will be doing most of the damage later that night. We started off with their crab cakes for appetizer, it was delicious, and I was looking for more after I devoured my in two bites.  I believe everyone else was doing the same thing.  Chopped salad was next, it was very tasty, good pallet cleanser before the main course.   Our main course was phenomenal, everyone's steak was cook perfectly, they will not leave the table until you cut into the center to make sure it's to your satisfaction.  I had the 8oz fillet special cooked medium rare, melted in my mouth, perfectly balance with the sauce that was on my plate, it also came with 2 shrimp, but the star was definitely the fillet.  I get a chance to taste some of the other steaks, they were equally excellent.  For the side dish, make sure you ORDER the LOBSTER MAC and CHEESE, and be sure you ordered more than 1, because you will be looking for more after your first serving.  We did not have room for dessert, everyone was stuffed. If you are looking for a good steak house in Vegas, this is a must, everything I had was delicious.  TWO THUMBS up!

8JXKhSIa7rmkwqjMdUd1Nw.text: Ok so I'm a huge fan of Yelp, but I've never written a review... Why? I don't know, maybe I'd rather read reviews than write them, or maybe it's just pure laziness...   Anyway, I'm finally ready to pop my yelp cherry and write my first review! Here it goes:  My hubby and I are in town for the weekend and one thing that I love about Vegas other than partying, is the FOOD! There are so many great eats out here it's ridiculous. Anyway, he wanted to take me out to a nice steak dinner for mothers day and the reviews here were awesome so we gave it a shot  We got the tomahawk long bone 32oz ribeye and split it. It just Melts in your mouth! We also split the Lobster Mac n cheese and it was another hit! Not too heavy but nice and creamy... Love love love it!   Our server Liz was beyond awesome and the manager(totally forgot her name) stopped by our table to chat w/us and gave us a huge slice of their incredible lemon cake complimentary for mamas day. I've never had service that good!  Definitely coming back on our next visit!

AnLzwj1JCfOzIYYu9dht3w.text: The signature cocktail with tangerine infused vodka with pineapple is refreshing and a nice way to start a wonderful dinner.  The steaks are expertly prepared and really flavorful.  The truffle butter is a nice add-on, but the steaks do not need it.  The lobster mac&cheese was also good, but the steaks are the star of the meal.  The lemon cake met expectations.  It is huge, lots of flavor and a nice way to finish a meal.  The service was very good and the wine list is vast, varied and reasonably priced.  My group enjoyed our experience and it was a nice break from the craziness of the strip.  I would come back again.

eiIRWSKEUJY-vmOi5aNqTQ.text: This place is great for a special night out with your special someone. My honey brought me here for a special date night. Kind of dressy, but evening casual can be appropriate attire. They have a full bar for whatever you would like to drink.  We had the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer very huge jumbo  shrimp and yummy. The Filet Mignon is so tender you can cut it with your fork and special sauce on the side for your dipping. But the steak was done so perfectly done it tasted so delicious,  ono, excellente,  fabulously incredible.  I also had a Mai Tai drink that was like I was back in Hawaii. I had made them make it the way I wanted with the dark rum and the right amount of pineapple juice. I like the layered way and mix it when your ready to drink. I would recommend place to all my friends if they wanted a place to go for that special occasion or for a special evening out with your special someone.  Make your reservations if you decide to go here. The service is superb and the attention they will give you. Of course the tipping 20% is appropriate for this place as they will not ignore you.

zWiYMkj8PoAwIPRtuqpARQ.text: This was a fabulous experience. I can't say enough good things about Del Frisco's. The service was spectacular and the food was delicious. It was my husband's 30th birthday and they helped me make it extra special.

l2YLI7EmN3SbavgGpzseyg.text: This place is very old skool (read: Chicago or SF.) The best happy hour in Las Vegas.  Try the Pinot Noir and the Shrimp tasting...excellent.  The chicken & sausage gumbo is done perfectly. Live music, attentive staff. Five plus!

HtzkTk2eglD-7lFOilPoJw.text: This place is worth the cab ride from the strip. It's actually pretty close to the strip, I think about a $6 cab ride.  I love steak and went here based on a recommendation from a friend. This place is amazing. First off, as soon as you are seated order a VIP martini. This is the best drink I've ever had. But as a disclaimer, it is pretty much pure vodka (which I'm not complaining about). It is so good and worth the $13 price tag.   Food was great as well. I remember the steak being a little over seasoned, but I'm not a big fan of anything salty so I may have been a little sensitive. Waitress was great, she was very attentive, had some good wine recommendations, and was everything you would want in a server. We had a ton of leftover side dishes too, but we ordered three sides between the two of us, so I'd probably do one side per person next time.   Overall, one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I always try to make down here when I'm in Vegas...for the VIP martinis. They also have happy hour from like 3-6 Monday-Friday I believe, and the VIP martinis are half off.    The only thing I was sad about was not receiving a thank you card in the mail :(

5EQxnNPrjG8s7vkP3n3v8g.text: Just returned from a boys trip to Vegas where Del Frisco's was on the agenda as always.  We had 12 of us in the private wine room (which is a fantastic private room if you are looking for such) for the 6th straight year and as with every visit the staff and food were spot on.  Steaks, fish, appetizers were all expertly prepared.    After a disappointing experience at the usually very good Prime at Bellagio the night before, I just had to make sure Del Frisco's was recognized for their execution.  I've also eaten in the restaurant proper several times and have never been disappointed.

sa0rMQqXeQ7-UcvVh118Gg.text: Service was great, ambiance was great, food was EXTREMELY overpriced. I've had many phenomenal steaks for a lot less. $65 bone in filet was ok, not great and certainly not worth the price. DO NOT GET SEAFOOD PLATEAU. Shrimp and oysters were sub par, crab was ok, but for $55 I would have expected a lot more. $15 Old Fashioned was as if it was made by an 18 year old in a dorm room for the first time. Outback Steakhouse would be a big step up in food quality/value

f-oGJOkFvm5svmvFGkHx2Q.text: The steaks are thick cuts and cooked to perfection.  I've been to Mastros, Cut, Ruth Chris', and BOA steakhouse and I consider Del Frisco's one of my favorites.  The staff are the best ever.  Very friendly and  very attentive.  They make sure to ask you to cut your steak and ask you to check if it's cooked to your liking before you eat.  I recommend the prime pair menu (it's available on Sundays and all days in the summer).  I recommend the 8 oz filet, crab cakes, and the lobster mac and cheese.  All of those items were delicious!  Thanks for the great service.  It was definitely world class.

vLH1FR6_Cbm8N7ZhoBkTzQ.text: I love dining at D.F the food is outstanding the CRAB CAKES are the BEST!!!!!!! a must in Vegas never had a bad experience here EVER...... The staff goes above and beyond to make sure your satisfied and music adds a nice touch.

pYV4bYmlw9N8zh3ktHeWzA.text: Bone in filet was perfection and I have been to a ton of steak houses across the country.

79EHHW2ixj3o8fHERtKNGw.text: Spectacular place to impress a date or business associate.  Service was outstanding and the food top notch.  I will be back here for dinner next time in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail

5LKckT4iBFkJPlkU0ueBCw.text: hmmmm, I have to dock them one star for the downgrade in atmosphere from the Del Frisco in Manhattan, NY.  this location had a quieter, sleepier vibe.  kind of a Throwback/Old Steakhouse feel without the old lady waitresses and vinyl booths. the food was still very good.  the steaks were cooked perfectly and the sides, delicious.  I never quiet got over the lacking atmosphere so I probably won't go back to this location but they get good marks for the food.  oh, and I wasn't the biggest fan of the keyboardist at the bar area.  that definitely harkened back to the old steakhouse days.

O46VtQfeCBKgnmvvtJQ2ww.text: My new favorite steak house!  Crab cakes Lobster Mac and cheese Cream spinach Bone in Ribeye  And a glass of the VIP  All great, will come back every time I am in Vegas.

V_7Bp4QK91gRv3J3rnArgA.text: We LOVED Del Friscos!!! Our steaks were perfect and the lobster mac and cheese was heavenly! The service was absolutely outstanding, our server Liz took very special care of us and we had a great time! Even got to visit the James Bond wine table!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our menu, which when our server Liz, learned I was such a big 007 fan, she let me keep it as a souvenir. Liz is awesome, thank u

UD1tWzmVPKhFEnonRyvTCg.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said about this magical palace of meat? Spent Super Bowl Sunday here. Came in post-game without a reservation and was given a nice table. Service was cordial and speedy. Loved the old school steakhouse feel. They have a lovely wooden bar. The place felt very masculine, but in a nice, classy way. Our server took a lot of pride in describing specials and menu items for us. There were a lot of great options on the menu and we first considered ordering a' la carte, but we noticed what a good deal their dinner for two was. On Sundays, they offer a $100 per couple dinner. It includes a salad of your choice, filet mignon and crab cakes, one side dish each and dessert for each person.  I was fully expecting the portions to be smaller because of the meal deal. However, we definitely got full-sized portions. The crab cakes were among the best I've ever had. There was barely any filler and huge chunks of crab throughout. Not really a crab cake, but more of a crab dollop. Loved it! The steak had so much flavor and was cooked perfectly to my medium rare specifications. The filet was the perfect level of pink and the outside seasoning was spot-on. I'm not even a big fan of filet mignon, but this one was like butter. Loved their side dishes too. The mashed potatoes were so decadent and the broccoli gave me the right amount of green, so I didn't feel like a total fatty. I can't remember dessert, except to say I enjoyed it at the time. I think I was in a meat-induced coma and the whole thing is a blur.   While we dined we were entertained by a jazz pianist. Perfect atmosphere to compliment a pitch perfect meal. All of this, combined with easy parking, made it a night to remember. Del Frisco's will always be a part of my Vegas itinerary from now on.

uqa9UJaKNPmKgpJ6_03t5g.text: Had the most amazing meal & drinks at the bar with my husband!!!  We got to talk to the bartender Ron which made the night SPECTACULAR!!!  Definitely will be back!!!  Of course that are sisters with our beloved Sullivan's in Indy!!!  Thank you to everyone back home!!!  -- John Stanley, Kimberly, Stephanie and Sean our bartender back home!!!

ho7PXWbAkPdexGg2nw8CPw.text: Delicious food! Attentive staff! Great ambiance! Steaks are cooked to exact specifications. Prices are reasonable for a steakhouse.

B3qlZXlfgiMXntWL8cBo3A.text: A few weeks ago, I was in town for a business event. I wanted a really good steak, and boy did I get it! The bone-in filet was hands down the best steak I've ever had...and I've had a lot of steaks! The sides, crab cakes, and salad we had were also amazing.   The drink? Killer. I can't remember the name of it, but their signature drink is a vodka soaked with pineapple, and not only was it HUGE, I wanted another one!   For the quality of the meat and the service, I think the prices were spot on. I was a bit disappointed that they advertise a dress code, and there were people in there with jeans on. I wish they would enforce that...

SxH5GxEBaQMcoRl4swE0vQ.text: Amazing meal. It started off with shrimp cocktail and crab cake. The presentation of shrimp cocktail was not great. The steak I had (filet mignon) was tender and cooked perfect. If you have the opportunity to have the butter cake do it! The dessert was great! Great experience, service was fantastic.

9J9RPHjQrr4tFuxoOPp6tQ.text: One of the best steakhouse in Las Vegas, pineapple martini is to die for! Lobster Mac n cheese

tSWspskqpIVKn1fMXZsWDg.text: Smelled a little stinky during our latest visit. Other than that I love the old school vibe, the bartenders, and of course the food is YUMMY! I also love the giant bowl of jelly beans.  We prefer to sit at the bar, people watch, chat with the bartenders.   They have a very nice wine selection. The bartenders enjoy mixing up something special so don't hesitate to ask them if you aren't quite sure what you want. The piano player in the bar area is also a nice touch.

taSAaNdJpbvQhZb7bp5XNg.text: Hats off to Chef Guerrero and the staff. Hands down the best restaurant experience we have ever had.  We made the reservation online and they called to confirm the day of. We had also mentioned in our reservation that it was our anniversary.  When we walked into the restaurant and gave our name, the hostess greeted us with a "Happy anniversary." When we were sat, the server brought us a card from the staff wishing us a happy anniversary.  I ordered a bone-in ribeye, my husband ordered a filet, and we shared a side of chateau mashed potatoes. My husband ordered a beer, and I ordered a Cabernet Sauvignon. The food was AMAZING. Steak was melt in your mouth good. The wine went very nicely with the meal. After talking with the server and mentioning where we were from, he stated that other people from our hometown frequent the restaurant, are good friends with the chef, and work in the same industry I do.  The chef came out to meet us and was just the nicest man you could ever meet. It turns out we know his good friends! He was very gracious and made us a special salsa to go with our meal. I'm not a big salsa person, but it was DELICIOUS!  The restaurant also gave us a complimentary slice of lemon cake for dessert to celebrate our anniversary.  We couldn't have asked for a better anniversary dinner. This place is well worth the money. We will definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wNNQTu8yGitUw53Ec_jCpw.text: I've never known food can be so good.  Start with the VIP pineapple infused cocktail. It's like having your vacation in a martini glass. So good I had four of them.  The crab cakes. Say no more. A baseball sized mound of lump crab meat swimming in a creamy rich sauce. Six monster cocktail shrimp with various sauces was equally delicious.  Bone-in rib eye. Perfectly seared. Juicy. Tender. Well balanced seasoning. Topped with melted Foie Gras butter - are you kidding me?!! I savored each and every morsel. Just wish I had more room to finish it off and jaw on that bone.  Lobster mac and sauteed mushrooms were wonderful sides, but we were so full we barely touched them.  Finish it all off with the lemon cake. A perfect end to a perfect meal. Light, moist, fresh and citrusy.  The service was impeccable throughout. Our waitress was a doll and was very attentive - always smiling. The manager came over for a chat. I felt like I was a celebrity. I frequent the NYC and Chicago DF's and now I'm also a Las Vegas fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake the perfect ending
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib eye with Foie gras butter - ridiculously good
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A baseball size crab cake

zAKoTLleHDXKOyU-H_VIdA.text: Hands down the best steak i have ever had!!!  My wife and i went here for out valentines date, the place was pretty big, they have valet service but they also give you an option to self park.   Going in i already had my mind set on devouring the 32oz bone in wagyu steak! It was $99 but heck, i told myself i needed to experience this. The steak was gigantic! And the whole 32oz was tender! The flavor was great! It was 32oz of pure bliss!   The service was great, they would always ask if we needed more bread, they would make sure our glasses were filled with water, and some would just cheer me on while I devoured my big meal. It was an awesome food experience, i would definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thats a legit hardcore steak knife

erRz9u8pVUzf0enneb0OmQ.text: Omg, I'm so late on this review because um...well I was in Vegas doing Vegas things, BUT this is one of the best steak I'd ever had.  It's off the strip so no tourist drama here. Great service and setting kind of feels like a lodge. I'd forgotten the sides we ordered but it's probably because it wasn't that great. There isn't any side dish I'd say you have to try but definitely do enjoy your steak. We were able to make reservations for a group of 4 the day before on Open Table so that was great. 5 star steak but 4 stars overall because side dishes were ok and not much to say for ambience. It's what one can expect from a steak house, that typical candlelight rustic ole' feel with good Steaks on your plate.

I_8t94KE5ex7R7gfhAfnNA.text: I had thr 45 day aged prime ribeye steak with the cream corn and brussel sprouts.  The steak was delicious and perfectly cooked. The cream corn was also very good. The brussel sprouts were just ok. The server and staff were very friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this restaurant.

11wwL8CxkB7r_BYJWMfW2Q.text: First we had their amazing BREAD, we had the octopus for an appetizer.....absolutely Delicious, a salad...I had the filet mignon and my friend had the 4 0z. TRIO , we had mushrooms and spinach for the sides , very very very yummy , manager comes around and checks on you , waitress doesn't over do it...Everything was a 5star

_o-uWUreTvgD6vtLoDNvuw.text: This is one of my favorite steak house in Las Vegas.  The service is great, the ambiance is very manly and the service is wonderful.   I ordered a lobster and it was bit over done.   The manager came by, apologized and swapped me for something super yummy.   My husband had the steak and of course their steak is just spectacular

c2ZA7pJEwBt2JNcy_7atuQ.text: Came here on 11/26 for dinner, 3 adults and 2 kids.   Love, love, love everything about this place.  From when I made a reservation to leaving the establishment.  This place knows what hospitality is all about, everyone treated us like family. The following are a must when you come here: VIP martini Crab Cakes Cocktail Shrimp Ribeye boned in (The flavor and tenderness of this steak is the best I had so far)  Thank you Del Frisco's for a wonderful time and fantastic food!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lAm31q2DSrVTqK4CBcpp9A.text: So after needing a special place to plan to have my birthday dinner at, I jumped on yelp and came across this restaurant and based on the stellar reviews booked my reservation. Today was finally the day! We arrived about 15 minutes early for our 7pm reservation in which we were promptly greeted by two lovely hostesses that asked for my name for the reservation and immediately wished me a happy birthday. One of them took us to our table and, get ready for this, GAVE ME A BIRTHDAY CARD! And not just any run of the mill birthday card, it was hand written with the words "Happy birthday" and a signature from everyone that worked there. The fact that it was hand written and signed was so special to me, I love that it wasn't just some printed card but someone actually took the time to write happy birthday in a card for me. Now onto the good stuff:  Drinks: I ordered the VIP which is their signature cocktail. It's vodka soaked in pineapple for a period of time and then strained. It is a 100% pure vodka martini, no mixer, no nothing. It taste like fresh pineapple juice, delicious! But let me reiterate, it's 100% vodka. Half of my martini made me feel pretty buzzed, I couldn't even finish it because I didn't want to leave crawling out of the place. But it is a delicious drink, better suited for someone with either a bit higher tolerance or looking to do a one and done to get the job done.   Appetizers: we got the thick cut bacon and the crab cakes. The crab cake was the best thing I've ever tasted in my entire existence. I will dream about it forever. The bacon slab was out of this world, it had so much flavor and it had a delicious sweet bourbon molasses sauce that blew me away.  Entree's and sides: I opted for the 16oz prime ribeye while my boyfriend got the 22oz porterhouse. We also got a side of truffle butter for our steak. Let me tell you, this is the best steak I've ever had in my entire lifetime. I've never tasted a steak with so much flavor, so juicy, so tender, and the truffle butter on top of all of that changed my life. I promise you, this is the best meal I've ever had in my life. We also got the potatoes au gratin and some sort of shaved vegetable (think it was the Brussels sprouts, it was my boyfriends side so I didn't pay much attention). I was so overwhelmed with every bite of the steak and too busy expressing how ridiculous every bite was that I found myself never really reaching for my side dish because I couldn't stop digging into my steak. We ended up taking the potatoes home because I couldn't finish them. My boyfriend didn't love the vegetable he got but he didn't hate it, thought there was too much vinegar taste.   Dessert: the restaurant was so kind to send us a lemon cake which was amazing. I'm not even a huge lemon person but this is one of the best cakes I've ever had. The cake was moist and the glaze between the 6 layers we so fresh. The frosting was my favorite part, I think I might have to steal their recipe because it was amazing.  Service: the service was very good, our food came out perfectly coursed and our glasses were always full. We always had a busser or someone taking care of keeping our table clean and taking away plates. Our server wasn't anyone to brag about, he was good but not great just average. Usually I would dock a star but the food really knocked it out of the ball park for me and I would love to give this place a 15/5 stars because it was just that good. He seemed a bit all over the place and distracted but still nice. Hard to explain but his service was very average.   Overall: you'll notice I've used the words amazing, incredible, delicious, best I've ever had, etc. because this is truly the best food I've ever had in my life. This is the best dinner I've ever had. Hands down, the BEST food I've ever eaten in my lifetime. I can't express that enough. I'm begging my boyfriend to take me back. I'm searching for people to brag to left and right. Server: decent, Food: can't even put into words how incredible it was. I cannot wait to come back here for every special occasion ever. Thank you so much Del Frisco's for the amazing amazing meal!!

tczU6dZcUwGExPJXARmcoA.text: Service and food was incredible. Ordered the crab cake. To follow by another one. It was awesome. Did the tomahawk steak with lobster Mac n cheese. Awesome awesome awesome.

mdMUlLgZLtd9UdBFbhM_VQ.text: My husband and I got married in Las Vegas in 2000 and we had our reception dinner for 8 here afterward. We have since visited every time we come to Las vegas and have yet to be disappointed. Everything is first class from the decor to the friendliness of the staff to the amazing food. The ambiance is so great you feel very pampered and special. It is not cheap but worth every penny. I can't believe the manager remembers us every time we come, now that is unbelievable!

g5aMAgHvopWwceOdfemPkw.text: This place was amazing. Came here for a very special occasion and the food was superb! I had the 22 oz lobster tail and so worth it. My special guest enjoyed his filet mignon and crab cakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JRj-bthuoNYnBJ-jMa5-UQ.text: We had the best service and best food of any steakhouse. The sommelier, David, was one of the best parts of our dinner. Not only does he know his wine, but he is so personable and attentive to the patrons. Our waiter, Roland, made sure we were well taken care of. He went above and beyond, even bringing candles and rose petals for the table (my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary). Everything about this dinner was perfect. The bar has been set high for steakhouses!

LX7Umwbcq28eest9uCDZ1w.text: My parents and I went to Del Frisco for my mother's birthday tonight.  They brought out a nice, little birthday card for her signed by the staff and a cake at the end of the evening.  The service was great and the staff was attentive.  Here's what I ordered:  Calamari: The calamari has a unique twist to it.  The calamari was mixed in with some fried peppers and topped with a black sesame seeds, bean sprouts, and a sauce similar to sweet and sour sauce.  I really enjoyed the combination of sweet and tangy with the crunch of the calamari.  Fillet medallions: This entree comes with 3 little medallions with a side of green beans and mashed potatoes.  It was beautifully played.  I ordered my steak medium-rare and it didn't disappoint! The filet mignon was very juicy and tender.

IgP9hSg0m2PJTlq13W0EPA.text: My wife and I celebrated my 40th birthday recently and what can i say? Del Frisco's seems to get even better with each visit. We started with a couple of their signature beverages: The VIP for me and A Breath of Fresh Pear for the wife. Both were EXCELLENT! My wife had the Bone-In Prime Ribeye and she's not the carnivore that I am, but she thoroughly enjoyed her steak as she praised how juicy and flavorful it was! I indulged in the Wagyu Tomahawk Chop and.......it was AMAZING! A delicate, mouthwatering cut of meat that melted in my mouth with each bite!   Nothing but exceptional service from the entire staff. They enhanced our dining experience and made us feel at home! Especially Ronise (our server), she was "The Bomb" ( "really, really good" for those who don't understand slang..haha) WE WILL BE BACK!

72SnvYGZU2Zk7hadc3q78g.text: Racial service ever. They will not even serve me water. I had all the money to pay but the waitress was so rude. I have been there so many times before but I will never come back.

zIKgiDo_lf6uIo7K3EclKQ.text: I can now see why this place has high star ratings!   Went here for our post Valentine's Date with hubby and our little man on a weekday night. First of all for a weekday night it had a lot of people. I would definitely make sure you reserve ahead to be safe. It's a dressy place but I figured for a tourist area they wouldn't be so strict on it. It does have valet parking but we were given an option to park also which I prefer, always (don't like strangers having my keys)  When you walk in its not DARK like most $$$$ sign places which was great. It sucks eating in the dark! My hubby already had a steak in mind but when we got the menu, it wasn't there. He was sad UNTIL the waiter read us the specials! WAGYU STEAK!!!! It was HUGE but it was unbelievably soft! $90!!! But definitely worth trying! I ordered the rib eye for myself And our little man which I thought was huge already. We had their version of mashed potatoes with chives which was mediocre, nothing special at all. I will go back for the steak which is what the place is known for anyway! Service is outstanding btw! I always rate a place service by my water. If my water cup doesn't have time to empty itself then it's definitely great service!

-Pd-rwlUWco835dsmAPzVA.text: I regularly come here with my boyfriend and we always enjoy their happy hour burger and drink! Definitely, plan to arrive a little early as the bar will fill up quickly! It's amazing how hidden this gem is! I definitely recommend this place!!

VJitNlmEj2u9vJA7HHAjJQ.text: Great food and service.  Felt a little rushed on this visit.  Probably better to go earlier in the evening but 8:15 pm was the way they could accommodate my party of 10

cx3hiLLbGXo3uW7PQtAw_Q.text: Great steakhouse about 5 minutes off the strip. Overall food is delicious , the lamb was very tender and cooked to perfection, the goose liver is definitely a must have. Service is great, they messed up the order but we're quick to fix it, it wasn't too busy maybe because it was a Sunday night but you can see it's a favorite with the locals which is always a win for me!

5ObU0-BLlplhGOVw4pu9kw.text: My friends and I came here during the summer's Restaurant Week, deciding to give this steakhouse a try. Freddy our waiter was very accommodating if not entertaining (apparently he knew the lyrics of Despacito haha), as well as giving us the rundown of Three Square and what the food assistance foundation was meant for. It was nice knowing that even the servers were knowledgeable and supportive of their cause. Many of the employees definitely made us feel welcome, would come by to check up on us a few times, and cleaned up everything per course meal.  Apparently there was a Live pianist playing - music echoed loudly throughout the room. The ambiance being somewhat posh and dimly lit lighting that emitted a warm intimate atmosphere. Seats were plush and comforting. The bar area looked like a giant jukebox with a hidden wine cellar behind it, a unique backdrop in contrast to the dining area.  To start off, we had the lobster bisque, not salty at all - impressive as most places tend to make theirs high in the sodium department.  Friends ordered their ribeye steaks at medium rare - cooked nicely. The servers wanted to double check and have us cut it to make sure it was how we wanted it. The result being that the heat settings was to their liking, thus fulfilling their expectations.   Green beans were satisfyingly crunchy, not salty at all. Mashed potatoes were soft, fluffy, not too flavorful - smooth but not clumpy.  The salmon as my main dish was buttery soft, no fishy smell, and definitely not oily. Surprisingly came on a bed of crab hash (literally made me think of crab fried rice).  For the finishing touch, as a dessert the warm banana bread pudding was soft with every bite, and the vanilla ice cream that came with it wasn't too cold to give me brain freeze nor lackluster in flavor. The cheesecake with pecan crust was pleasant after a few bites, the strawberry sauce not overtly sweet and heartily filled us up to top the night off!

YtlSzo6cfeAfTD96UnJ4fw.text: Okay, I've been known to only leave poor reviews..because I believe they deserved it.  I don't feel the urge to comment on eh, ok anything, but if it's so poor I'm going to say something.  Or if it's euphoric I'm down to review.  Well here goes my euphoric stars for this restaurant.  And guess what...a 5 star review this time!  Del Frisco's was amazing!  From the food to the service.  If I go into detail I'd write a book.  Let's just say everything, I mean everything we ordered was AMAZING!  Highly recommended.  When in Vegas again, I will be back.

ktvHS-iLR-ikys67VJ9iTA.text: It will be hard to top the steak I had at Segovia, but Del Frisco's was still very good. I had the Porter House and scallops. Also ordered some brussel sprouts and spinach. Steak was cooked perfect. I just should have ordered the dry aged instead. I tried the dry aged rib eye and it was definitely tastier. Sides were really good. I also like the 1800 tequila old fashioned. Overall it was a quality restaurant. The best looking item at our tsble was the sea bass. Looked and tasted amazing. Apologies for no picture of it. If you order the steak get it dry aged.

MycbnkVYMvXrC_uEP2B8Eg.text: Let me start by saying I've celebrated my birthday with about 25 friends for many years in Vegas .. we've dined  here for about 10 plus years .. maybe more..( time flys) 3 of last 4 years not so good.. major complaint is service which used to be second to none! Had to ask for bread multiple times.. asked for steak sauce and never came .. friend asked for the garlic butter. Got garlic.. then they took steak back and returned after we were almost done.. worst part manager tried to defend there action.. why?   The icing on my birthday cake , was when she told me I guess we just can't please you... really??? We voted Del Frisco's out for future bashes ... since they went public , not even close to what it once was.. thanks for the memories Del Friscos ... Maestros  here we come!

VLA90LPp5nhq2I7DhNVvmA.text: Just to start this place deserved 10 stars!  We made reservations for our anniversary and there was a card signed by the entire staff and we were in a private dining room very nice touch thanks for that.  I believe they would have grilled a dealer at one of the casinos if we had asked for them to  Our private dining room was next to the wine storage, and it was quite a well stocked inventory of vintages, magnums, and I think that was a Nebuchadnezzar because it was a gigantic bottle of wine. Biggest container of fermented grape juice I ever did see!  Food was excellent. Yes, it's pricey, and the overall quality in taste, preparation, and presentation is fantastic. From what I ordered and sampled among sharable plates, you can't go wrong with any menu selection. They will go the extra mile to make sure your entree is made to your satisfaction.  Service was fantastic throughout the evening. The waitstaff checked on us early and often. Drinks were refilled regularly. It's a good thing we were sequestered from the open dining areas because after a few rounds of cocktails and wine bottles, we got loud and obnoxious. Despite our shenanigans, service remained professional and tolerant. Our waitress was well versed in the menu and made suggestions to compliment and enhance entree selections. Whether you're in Las Vegas or other entertainment destination, it's an added bonus to have a knowledgeable waitstaff, bartender, or other industry professional who might have inside info or the hookup to a nearby hotspot. Take care of them and they might return the courtesy.  Definitely a superb experience at Del Frisco's.

1a2izVUsZumu9Bl5tNcuSw.text: I may sound like a fanboy of this location here in Las Vegas, it is True and I will tell you why. This Del Frisco's location has to be the best compared to its sister locations throughout the nation. The service, staff, atmosphere, food and drinks are top notch. I recommend the VIP martini. The crab cake appetizer is crack; velvety smooth, plenty of crab meat and its flavor is a one-of-a-kind. The thick-cut bacon is absolutely meaty and delicious, just make sure you come in with an empty stomach for it to have more room for your entree and sides. The oysters (west and east coast) are fresh. I order my steak medium-rare and it's on point. Lobster Mac and cheese is great. Creamed spinach, potatoes au gratin are fabulous as well.   If you are in search of a steakhouse in Las Vegas, and there are plenty of good ones. There's just something about Del Frisco's Las Vegas that just makes you come back. Well for myself, it's every time .

jLM4yXG5teHMW51V_kxklA.text: Came here on our final night in Vegas to celebrate a super super early birthday. Our party made reservations prior to coming in and was seated less than 5 minutes upon arrival.   Located not too far from the Las Vegas Strip, Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse features 8 private dining rooms, a wine cellar, and they are widely know for their James Bond Table. Valet parking is complimentary, you have the option of indoor or outdoor seating, there is a and the dress code is business casual.  Our dining experience started off with complimentary bread and not being a fan of sesame, I didn't enjoy the carbs as much as i had hoped. No joke, the sesame taste is pretty intense.  We ordered: 22oz Bone-In Prime Ribeye 24oz Prime Porterhouse Sauteed Wild Mushrooms & Pearl Onions Classic Caesar Salad  Food came out in a timely manner and was cooked to our liking. I appreciated the waiter's request for you to cut into the steak and confirm your satisfaction before heading off. The wild mushrooms are an absolute must have- they are seasoned well and elevates your steak to new heights. I could have done without the caesar salad, nothing made the dish stand out.   Overall: Great food, wonderful service, but there was a strange smell that the establishment reeks of... I couldn't figure out what it was but due to me feeling nauseous prior to coming in, the scent was such a turnoff.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Wild Mushrooms &amp; Pearl Onions

GMaPQ44fWYtv_e9M9GpdrA.text: Great ambiance, the food was delicious and our server was nice and helpful.  Will return for my husbands birthday too

Yw9ZAYD3azZbKur_0jRiSg.text: For our early dinner before with our friend before our flight back home, our friend suggested we eat at Del Frisco's since it was off the Strip on Paradise and the airport was right down Paradise. Our friend said they have a great happy hour and we were able to get the one open table as the bar seating was full.  The bar was next to the main dining room, but there are several smaller intimate dining areas.    We ordered our drinks and checked out the happy hour menu which consisted of nine items, which were 50% off. Our order consisted of: Charbroiled Oysters, garlic butter and Parmesan cheese. These were so tasty that we had two orders. The oyster were garlic butter then crusted with Parmesan.   Buffalo Shrimp, blue cheese dressing, crumbles, smoked bacon bits and green onions. Lightly battered shrimp were complemented well with the blue cheese dressing.    Beef Filet Sliders, sauteed mushrooms, caramelized onions, fontina cheese, truffle oil and horseradish sauce. The slice of filet in the slider was tender.  Though it was good, it was ok in comparison to our other dishes.   Broiled Steak Salad, mixed greens, grilled asparagus, artichoke hearts, roasted red peppers and vinaigrette.  It was a nice salad with the additions of asparagus, artichokes and red peppers.  The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare.   Seared Filet Tips, mashed potatoes, onion rings, red-wine demi-glace, and bourbon peppercorn sauce. This was a hearty dish with the seared filet tips over a large portion of mashed potatoes.  Tasty too.    Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream. Needed a dessert to top off our meal. Our waiter recommended this dessert. Wow, it was large piece of cake topped with a large scoop of ice cream. Though desserts are not part of the happy hour menu, this was worthy of a nice ending to a meal.  Near the entrance, there is a display case that contains custom painted bottles of wine depicting each James Bond movie. The top opens up to the James Bond theme revealing the bottles of wine.  So cool.  Ask the hostess to see the display.   The Happy Hour menu at the bar area is a great deal. Great food at 50% off.  Del Frisco might be a little off the Strip, but with free parking and mellower atmosphere, it is worth it in my book.  A great way to conclude our Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. James Bond wine display case
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broiled Steak Salad
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moonraker bottle

bVIeXUqhNGUuF_mSrXiOug.text: We were in Vegas this past week celebrating my husband and my birthday within a week of each other. I asked my friends for restaurant recommendations and Del Friscos kept coming up for steak and seafood. We decided to try it out. We stayed at the Bellagio and took an Uber to the location. It is a little off the strip kind of in an office park type of location. Hostess staff was very friendly and as we were early offered to have us sit in the bar for a cocktail while our table was being prepared. The bar was full and there was no chairs available so we just waited. The restaurant's decor was an updated version of a steak house with white table cloths, booths and smoked mirrors. I really liked the crystal chandelier feature, I thought they were beautiful and classy. Our waiter was very nice and attentive and very knowledgeable about the steaks and seafood. I had heard about a pineapple specialty drinks. They are called the VIP - Vodka Infused Pineapple. Oh my goodness, they were amazing! But sneaky lol.   My husband ended up ordering the filet and I order the lobster tail and we ordered potatoes au gratin to share. No appetizers, or soup or salad as we felt like that would be a lot of food. Well let me tell you, that lobster tail was huge! The food runner said that it was actually a smaller tail! The lobster was tender and sweet and just plain incredible! The potatoes were tasty and decadent. At the end of the meal our food server was kind enough to bring us a scrumptious dessert to celebrate our birthdays of butter cake, that was to die for and chocolate cake.... so good. Such a wonderful experience..... we will be back for sure!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake and chocolate cake!

9rTWZ9rs8hopqoWo2sHenw.text: Went here for New Year's Eve dinner. I was not disappointed. Only problem was that the the appetizers were just okay. The drinks and the meal overall taste wonderful. The customer service is great also. They gave us a run down of what's good on the menu and we were told about the happy hour they offer.

iSejL5enYXR_JoZW1ozoVQ.text: Came here for dinner. Make sure you make reservations. Had the double eagles and the Wagyu. The crab for starter was great as well. Drinks are also made very well I would recommend a negroni. After your meal ask the waiter to show you the special feature as all the restaurants have one. This one has a 007 special wine installation that's worth a few million I believe. Great service here, and hidden away from all the mayhem on the strip.

WKezJQRsGbNVlxlYZT-lOg.text: Ate at Dels after the sema show today 5 stars as always! Had the bone in rib eye and lemon cake for dessert  EXCELLENT! I will be back soon.

npOC9lldZEz1UkMFVPkVpQ.text: I love that place. Love Ron the bartender, love decor, love the James Bond wine table, love the rolls and steak, I feel like an adult when I go there.

gPNrK1QYKrjj3RLdgZ3k4Q.text: Last night my husband and I had a reservation for 5pm at this steakhouse.   We've never been here before but we had the pleasure of meeting a very nice manager at the Venetian Hotel in Vegas that we stayed at for a 4 days and we asked him what's the best steakhouse in Vegas (off or on the strip) and without skipping a beat he said Del Frisco's is the best steak he's ever had!  This comes from a manager who has steakhouses in his hotel)  He went on and on about this place so we made a reservation.   Let me just say the feel when you walk in was very romantic... very nice.   Our server was beyond fantastic!  She was spot on with every detail and explained things to give you an experience and feel like we've never had before.  It made you feel like you've been dinning ther for years .   The steak we had was full of flavor and so incredibly tender... delicious!   The dessert was so seriously an experience in itself... I can't even describe how delicious it was... it was that good!  We had the pleasure of meeting one of the managers "Amber" who wanted to make sure our experience was fantastic and it was!!!  This place is first class delicious!  Thank you

dwEDDS_ysEU-ZswLIcE4Bw.text: Shout out to Ro, O'Neil, Jack, and Delaney for making our dining experience so fun! The food here is DELICIOUS! worth every bite.  I tried the lobster Mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, potato au gratin, crab cake, and one of the steaks. Everything was seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection. Drinks were on par too.. the VIP (pineapple martini) is dangerous ! In a good way . Will be back again !

ClnA7r-rYEhxFQC9ax9PKQ.text: Zane is the man here!!! Came here on Friday night left so satisfied that I was back for dinner again on Sunday night. Although the restaurant is off the strip I'm really glad I came here this past weekend. The oysters, Brussel sprouts and the Rib eye was great. The rib eye was cooked just how I like my steak done. It's good to know there's a Del Frisco's close to where I live.
