8-FMn_phqHrHgAO5tIIlqQ.text: Fantastic dinner - everything was wonderful!  Jack was our server.  She made us feel special from the moment we sat down.   Food, service, ambiance - outstanding!   Seriously, I truly believe the server, Jack, made all the difference!

CvrJl_fc0LT0vE-a8AaBwA.text: Surprisingly my first time coming to Del Frisco and it was such a memorable dinner!! Came here to celebrate our anniversary and was super impressed with the service amongst so many of their staff. Everyone was super attentive and friendly. Our server Marciano was super nice and seriously knew when to come in or stay away as we were having a personal conversation and I am really grateful for that!   I'm glad I got to try this spot out when we were in Vegas. Came during the dinner time and it was nice and not too crowded. Guest that were dining in weren't loud and obnoxious which was pretty nice.   What we ordered:   Shrimp platter- Comes with a variety of different sauces on a shrimp so you can try it out. Large size of shrimp and loads of flavor.   Crab Cake- A huge amount of crab and it had a wonderful sauce on it.   1 Pound Stone- Its kind of famous in Vegas and a must to order. Get the stone crab claws they are totally different from the normal claws of crabs!   What there famous for- "The Long Bone" 32oz of beef yep its huge and juicy!!   For a side we got asparagus and they threw in their famous lemon cake afterwards for free!   Overall yes I would totally recommend this place. The inside is an old school feel and just the management team knows how to hire really good people! I was so happy for our anniversary dinner.   Thank you for making me feel so special and yes the food was totally perfect!! I'd say this is on my top list of places to visit to have a wonderful dinner. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread yum
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bond menu
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp

nq_Ev4PyZm21ziJXWwe3UQ.text: Awesome. Simply awesome. Very pricey. Old Vegas style joint. Love the atmosphere. Bartender makes a real drink.  No complaints on his pours!  Fantastic. Service is awesome. Nice, informative staff.  They know their stuff. Food is out of this world. I had the filet mignon done three different ways. Melt in your mouth. Family style sides. Great bread. I would eat here once a week if I could afford it. Unreal. Private parking. Big lot. No smoking. Great place!

ipCeYUA1yTdm4KWiQtd_xA.text: OUTSTANDING!!! I'm a steak person, and I eat at about 4 steakhouses a week. (I'm from Louisiana...town call Golden Meadow  a Cajun community.) I fly to Las Vegas every other week, and I try to hit at least 2 steakhouses every trip. I've been flying here 11 years, and I must admit Las Vegas is stepping up to the plate with the food industry. Now...Del Frisco's has been on my list for a while, but we never got around to. I really screwed up...I could have been eating in here for 11yrs. Just think of all that great meat I missed lol. I had a Tomahawk Ribeye...UNBELIEVABLE!!! Of course it's a little pricy $90. My better half had a filet as well was GREAT! Service Great, atmosphere Great! The whole over all experience was to my upmost satisfaction! Also, all the appetizers were great! So, when you come to Vegas, ask about this place...you won't be disappointed!!!  Buddy

eix9fIsRKPUo4BBsnPZQ4A.text: AMAZING food, AMAZING  service!!! These folks know how to make you feel like a VIP! The chefs can prepare like no other,  the "secret" 007 wine table is a must see! I thought the seafood was out of this world til i had the foie gras  (my choice) topped bone in filet and accompaniments til the desserts!!! I strongly recommend ordering one of everything!!

62g7Za88mysNc2OKmNTqdg.text: I had the Tomahawk 32oz Wagyu bone-in ribeye and it was outstanding!  Hy's in Honolulu used to be my favorite then Mastro's Steakhouse but this one is the King of steaks.  I never had a steak that was so flavorful and juicy from the outside all the way down to the bone.  Normally, the outside is juicy then as you get toward the middle, steaks become tough but not the case here.  I live in California and unfortunately their other Del Frisco Grill restaurants (Irvine, Santa Monica, Pasadena) do not carry this steak so I can only have this in Las Vegas.  I guess this will be my go to restaurant every time I am in Vegas.  If you have a large appetite and love ribeye's as I do, this should be on your bucket list of steaks to try.  At $89, it is pricey but worth every juicy, flavorful bite.

dKS3Y-WlwHRSAVDbzyODHg.text: Best Steakhouse ever! Great drinks too.   From the quality of meet to the stellar service to the drinks from scratch, there's wonderful quality all around. Don't worry about the price, it's worth it.

hQgeJRiV4mbrHWn0CbifuQ.text: Never a disappointment.  Sunday we came here to celebrate our 8 year anniversary.  When making the reservation ...they always ask if we are celebrating a special occasion.  When we got there, it seemed the whole restaurant knew it was our anniversary because a few random employees came to our table to wish us happy anniversary.  A little special touch I must say.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail-it was delicious!  I cant say enough about the bread.  I know its a steak house and Im talking about the bread.  Sesame loaf fresh out of the oven.  I wanted to take some home!!!  To die for.   We both ordered the filet with the lobster mac.  The filets cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth.  The mac (a shared side) a little on the flavorless side.  Definitely needed salt.  We were so full and then here came this big piece of lemon cake on the house for -thats right-our anniversary.  The only thing I can say after this wonderful experience is when we were leaving we asked the valet guy to take our picture-for our anniversary.  He seemed very disinterested and took a couple blurry shots with no care how they turned out.  I know thats not his job but we weren't interupting him and a little customer service as we left would have been nice.  Oh well.  ...and if you are asking yourself if we valeted our car, the answer is no. LOL There is plenty of parking right in front-It was a Sunday night remember. ;)  Always recommended and for the price it is a definite "special occasion place"....we don't go there too often but when we do we are glad we did.

ql2LQdvJ7WGrCagR-tbx-A.text: Double eagle prime----OMG! This charred rare steak was among the best I've ever had. I'm not into meat or steaks or the steakhouse experience, but the BF is. So I decided to surprise him with dinner at this place which by all accounts is considered the best steakhouse in Vegas. I even ate a little before heading out knowing that it was going to be another grilled fish/chicken night because I don't eat meat. The BF was so excited that he diligently researched blogs and Yelp to find out exactly what cut and size of meat to order. He soon learned that he had to get it rare and charred on the outside. Omg, how I regret not ordering the beef.   The service was spectacular. Attentive, but not annoying, friendly and warm. The house bread was fresh baked, crunchy and collapsed the moment you broke off a piece because it was so squishy and air fluffed on the inside. The drinks were stiff, the wine list was huge with an extensive and creative by-the-glass selection.   But his meat was my star. I hope my mom's not reading this. It was so delicious. It was so good, I could have eaten the whole thing--all 25+ ounces. It was theperfect combo of moist yet crunchy-salty outside. My mouth is salivating as I type this.   Definitely worth the price and we'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food bliss followed by a little first time cigar adventure
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pure evil--warm chocolate cake with molten fudge inside and vanilla bean outside
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most tender, buttery soft filet mignon ever

VGFgMpEHfWOYAsO_6OihJg.text: Del Frisco's has been on my list of places to try out for awhile. (There's a happy hour there that I want to try out one of these days which ends at 6:30.)  It was a fairly large celebration with 10 of us which was perfect for a Del Frisco's night. We were seated  right away in the corner which was perfect for us.   Since I am the "foodie" of the group, I was appointed the job to order the side dishes and the appetizers. We started of with 2 orders (6 per an order) of the East and West Coast Oysters. I think the West coast oysters were bigger than the East Coast....the quality was excellent as was the freshness. I didn't even use Tabasco or any other sauce! I also ordered the tuna tartare, which was fresh and tasty. I was definitely ready for my main course after that.  For my main dish I ordered one of the specials. Two filets, one with crab and one with scallop/shrimp. I liked the flavoring of the crab filet more, but both filets were tender and easy to eat. I do appreciate the fact that they have you cut into the meat to make sure it is to your liking when they first give you your entree. I wonder what they do with the meats that are too overcooked....Side dishes included the lobster mac and cheese, au gratin potatoes, mashed potatoes, creamed spinach and grilled asparagus. The potatoes and lobster mac and cheese didn't WOW me, but I did appreciate the veggies although the spinach was VERY creamy.   There was a pianist there who was performing which made the noise level a bit hard to hear people in my group talk, but other than that Del Frisco's was wonderful. Service was impeccable and attentive. I definitely will be back!

doe170wA4ukRmdrOSta0pQ.text: I don't issue many five star reviews; I reserve them for places that really over deliver...and this place qualifies.  I got the long bone wagyu beef rib eye.   It was absolutely insane!    Great service  Great drinks  Nice atmosphere  Lots of good lookin' people having good lookin' food.  Don't miss out on the place...a five minute cab ride off the strip.  Check It.

FlAQhUWfD4SuXsaMzObN6Q.text: I have been to a lot of restaurants.. and a lot of steakhouses.. and Del Frisco's takes the prize for both favorite restaurant and favorite steakhouse!  I first visited last year and was very impressed but wasn't sure if we just lucked out.  You know what I am talking about, a "hit & miss" restaurant, you "hit" on your first visit, get really excited to go back only to get a horrible "miss" the next time.  I am happy to report Del Frisco is not such a restaurant!  I just visited again last week, and it even exceeded my already high expectations from my first visit.  Things I have had so far:  Appetizer: Crab Cake - take a note from Nike, and just do it.  It's epic.  The sauce they place it in is absolutely incredible and it doesn't have all that BS breading most places have.  On my second trip there was no way I could pass up having this delicacy again, so we ordered it again and were very very pleased.  Entree: Filet Mignon - Medium Rare.  They cooked it PERFECTLY.  We noticed they have Crab Cakes on the entree menu and I think the next time we would split the Crab Cake Entree and the 12 oz filet for a real treat.  I am really not going to get to try the other items due to my high satisfaction with the ones we have already tried.  Dessert: Bread Pudding & Yellow Cake.  Both incredible, but when it comes to desserts I am going to give that prize to Eddie V's and their Banana Foster.  Drinks: Have tried their specialty cocktails and wine, service and taste were great on both.  Service:  They make you feel like you are the only table in the restaurant.  I also like that it's not as stuffy as most steak houses, the staff is very down to earth.  Ambiance: They even get high marks here, they have live classy music playing throughout dinner.  I  think of going to Vegas just to eat here again!!    10/10

spxB_DJYNz1ai0dtNfg3Ag.text: Avoid this overpriced wanna-be steak place.  I've dined at several Del Frisco's (and was a member of the original location in Dallas) so I've seen the best and worst of this chain. When it's good, it's quite good. This is the worst.  Our steaks were charred and dry throughout. This must be the new definition of medium. The sides were so salty we needed several water refills. The service is what you'd expect at an expensive joint: efficient but a bit removed. And the prices are steep.  So many excellent steak options in Vegas. Not this one.

cpFp6V9_62xHF9820CucUQ.text: This is my all time favorite steak house! We have been here a few times now and we definitely look forward to it every time. On top of the great food, their service is always amazing. Last night we had John he was super helpful with the menu and definitely patient with me! Lol I was really indecisive last night but he helped me make some really yum choices! Definitely recommend this place for any occasion! Fair warning this place will ruin any normal steak house for you!

2Z24voOfTelsJpBsKpejVg.text: This restaurant is a one of a kind place. The service is impeccable!! Our server David was great, he was extremely helpful and professional...he explained everything on the menu. Now the best part, the food is amazing. Our steak was cook to perfection, very flavorful! And the crabcakes, wow! Best crabcakes I have ever tried in my life!! They also have a very impressive wine selection, that would go very well with your dinner. And the last thing that also thought was very cool its the tour of the restaurant that our server gaves us, they take you and show you the famous 007" wine table (which is super cool) right after they take to their one of a kind Wine Cellar! You will probably see the biggest wines you have ever seen! As they do this they told you about theirs wine selection and a lil bit of the restaurant's history. We will definitely be back very soon, we just loved everything about Del Frisco's.

4_5qqxc0RQVjKhHHkh5RmA.text: The steak was amazing. Had the 8 oz medium done. The waiter was very polite as well as the rest of the employees. I came in dressed in jeans and tennis shoes and I felt somewhat under dressed, but they made me feel right at home. The VIP drink is also amazing. We spent 150.00 bucks for 2 but so worth it! Will be back next time in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz steak with crab

5h561UPeDIuUlUEJeXZzog.text: One of the best steakhouses in the country - period!  It is very expensive, but when you are dining with clients or spoiling yourself to an amazing meal, this is the place.  We dined twice last week - once with 6 people and once with 15 people during a convention, so I was able to try a bit of everything.  Everything is amazing.    Best appetizers: Chopped salad, calamari, crab cakes, onion rings.  Best side dishes:  Lobster Mac n Cheese (I would eat just this all night long if I could!), Spinach supreme (to die for), cream corn.  Best main courses:  Bone-in filet done medium or less is pretty much guaranteed to be the best thing you have ever eaten in your life.  It's about $65 alone so pricey is a given, but it is simply amazing.  I also recommend the bone-in ribeye, regular 8-12oz filet, and the shrimp scampi if you aren't in a meat mood.   Best dessert:  Creme Brulee!  You will likely need reservations, some nice clothes and a full pocketbook, but you will not leave disappointed or hungry as portions are quite large. Service is always phenomenal as well :)  Enjoy!

CBP4PaN8nB2O8rVj6zQI3A.text: Del Frisco's was on our to do list for a Bachelor Party I went to, and quite frankly-I feel like I'll have to pay this place a visit every time I visit Vegas.  I'm going to go straight to the food. Some delicious, warm sesame bread and butter came out. Moments later, we ordered the crab cakes which was sitting in a pool of sauce that my brother says they use the enriching guts inside the grab (much tastier than it sounds). This was hands down the best crab cake I have eaten in my life - just lumps and lumps of fresh crab that made you think they literally JUST cracked a crab open and just used the meat from that...   For 6 guys, we ordered 3 of these Flintstones specials (Wagu (sp?) bone-in ribeye). These feed 2 people for about $90. When they came out, they were piping hot and we ordered them 3 diff ways: medium, medium rare, and rare (warm). They seemed to have cooked it all appropriate though the medium rare and rare didn't seem to different in terms of color. But why nitpick? After taking a bite into this piece of meat, you're mind just savors the simplicity of the salt/pepper and natural juices of the meat. OMG, as you get closer and closer to the actual bone, it just tastes great.  You'll have to order some sides to go along with you meal. We opted for the lobster mac and cheese (5/5), the potatoes gratin with bacon, though my actual scoop didn't have any (4/5) and the mushrooms (4/5). If you have 6 hungry guys, probably order one of each will be enough since you still have a ways to go for the rest of the evening and don't want to be stuffed... if not, maybe double up on one of the side dishes or order another one.  Service was great, seemed like 6+ people were tending to our table. It kind of reminded me of a Nascar race when the car needs to make a pit stop. Drinks are reasonably priced here as well, surprisingly.  Man, I need to plan my next trip just so I can hit up Del Frisco's again!

oJKYl5L9Knd6hreoaqIQZA.text: WOW... just wow.. This place is a meat lovers heaven.  To make a long story short but with the juicy details.  I ordered the 32 oz Wagyu Tomahawk Cut Rib Eye... damn.  Ive never had anything like it and it was huge.  The marbling on this thing was amazing.  It was so tender and juicy.  Definitely worth the money let just say its above $80+.  But you have to try it once.  Any other steak will not even come close.  Ive tried the double eagle and that is amazing as well.  Their sizes were ok but the bacon spinach and garlic mash was the best.  Our drinks were well-alcholized so no complaints there.  Don't eat all day and just eat like primate here.  Of course the service was on point and professional.  Worth every penny. hey your in Vegas gotta go big or jsut dont come at all. Hahaha

aPv6VRgsMK7wlbNvzQUh5A.text: How It's Done! -- The best steak I've had in Las Vegas and tied with anything anywhere else! The Ribeye is my go to favorite. DO NOT leave there without savoring their signature Lemon Cake. It is simply the best cake I've ever had. Their traditional Shrimp Cocktail is superb as is their Lobster Mac 'n Cheese.  BTW, their bread is so good, you have to be careful not to eat too much lest you spoil your dinner! ENJOY!!!! -- and their wait staff and service?... Well, it just doesn't get any better. They make you feel special and valued.

0aGvhcxAZdY7bnGeAgH6sA.text: If I could, I would give this place 4.5 stars. Allow me to explain....  We started my birthday dinner off with the tuna tartare and the calamari..  both were excellent apps.. one of my cousins had the Svedka vodka infused pineapple cocktail (the VIP... get it?!?) which I had a sip from and enjoyed a lot.  Our sides for the dinner were the asparagus, potatoes au gratin, and the lobster mac and cheese.  All were good but the lobster mac and cheese stood out.. mostly b/c I love me some mac and cheese.  For dinner I ordered the 16 oz prime ribeye cooked medium. As per our server's recommendation, I cut into it to determine if the doneness was correct... I did and it was cooked perfectly, or so I tthought. As I started to cut off a piece for my tablemates to try the steak, it turned out to be a step below rare.   I advised our server about the doneness of my steak and he apologized and he sent it back.  A few minutes later, another gentleman in a suit came up to me and apologized about the doneness of my steak.  When it came back, MY OH MY, best steak I've had all year.  The service throughout dinner was solid. Waters were promptly refilled.  When my beer was close to being empty I was asked if I wanted another.   As a postscript to my review, towards the end of the dinner, I filled out one of their mailing cards just for the hell of it. This week, I recived a hand written thank you card from our server thanking me and my party for having my birthday dinnner there.  That blew my mind away.  So, 4.5 stars out of 5. It would have been 5 but the 1/2 star deduction was because I had to send my steak back. But everything else was perfect.  Better than the other steakhouse I went to in Vegas earlier in the year.

h-UsrW_Q92KmDy-yLQFkCw.text: How did I forget to write a review for DF?  We came here for my birthday, and wanted a great steak.   I know there are others out there that are a little better for a little more money, but I have always wanted to come here and just never made the time.  The atmosphere and setting is very nice...very upscale and classy.  The service is outstanding as well....some of the best service we have had.  I also asked the hostess to make sure our wine selection came out with the Swarovski crystal flutes I just bought, and it was done without question and seemed happy to do so!  To start, the crab cakes are one of the best things ever.  I HATE crab cakes....I don't like the breading taste, consistency, or whatever it is that in my mind dislikes CCakes, but I tried some and wish I ordered more.  These are so good, and don't taste anything like a regular joe shmoe CC that I have ever had....in a good way.  The sides were also amazing.  We had the mac and cheese and mashed potatoes...both super scrumptious.  On to the important stuff...the meat!  Went with the bone in ribeye...and the bone in filet mignon.  Both were excellent cuts, super tasty, and had a nice crusty sear on the outside packed with flavor.  Since these meats aren't aged, they aren't fair to compete with some of the better steaks in vegas, but what is nice, is their rub/seasoning...much more rich and diverse.  Either way, I think you will have an excellent time here!

Wr0KNrdkzmhcv973ARAGRg.text: OK Del Frisco's, listen.  Ruth's Chris was just a fling.  She was great while she lasted.  But I'm done with her now.  Even LG's, Morton's and Flemmings are nothing to me anymore.  Nobody can compare to your perfectly aged, bone-in prime rib-eye steak soaking in just the right amount of butter, and topped with the most simple but perfectly applied season of salt and pepper.  Your steak was so perfectly done, rare as I like it, and even with a warm center as offered by your very attentive and charming waitress.  You've left me dreaming every night of those very tender, succulent rib eye morsels.  Babe, you're the only one for me.  I promise.  Your gargonzola and blue cheese macaroni is like none other.  A very cheesy blend, with just the right amoung of blue to give it a tang, but not overpowering.  Aaah... It went so well with the steak.  And the chopped salad?  I've never tasted an herb dressing like that.  Just incredible.  Not too rich, not too light and herbish.  And your 6 layer lemon doberge cake consummated my love for you.  Each bite was so moist and rich, with a nice tangy lemon taste, tamed by the rich butter cream frosting.  You took me to paradise and back.  It was a night to remember.    I know what the others have said.  You're taste is too expensive, you're geographically undesirable (GUD), You're not good for me.  But none of that matters.  You're just a flight away and you're worth any amount of trouble babe.  I already miss you.  For now on, it's just you and me.  Oh.. and the wife too.  She liked you as much as I did.  Thank you Julie (our waitress) and Torryn (manager) for helping to make such a pleasurable dining experience.  Del Frisco's truly is the best steak house, and you guys provide absolute top rate service.

aUPQ6adHLkSJI8lfkKq-EQ.text: Well at least on my visit service was Excellent despite other not so well reviews. Steak was perfect and was comp 2 signature drinks known as VIP and a their signature 6 layer lemon butter cream cake. Awesome service. Also our server joey was excellent.  Thank you!

Z4iBBTorVkyeGLO-uZLeQQ.text: I have always associated Vegas with partying, gambling, and some blush-worthy memories.  However, in the past few years, I have come to associate it with the BEST steakhouse I have ever eaten at - Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House.  The service is exceptional - I never placed much importance on great service as long as the food was good but after experiencing Del Frisco's, I know that the great service just makes my dining experience that much better.  And the food, oh the food is incredible!  My personal favorite is the filet mignon medium rare with a generous helping of their mac n' cheese, cream corn, and potatoes au gratin...yum.  Given that I do not go to Vegas all that often, I have tried out many a steakhouses in Los Angeles and not one has come close.  I definitely won't stop searching but it has made me realize even more what a special restaurant Del Frisco's is.  How much more convincing do you need?  Go, go, GO!!! =)

mRsXeBM0aQHyyjZzKcBfCA.text: HORRIBLE!!! Really, filet shouldn't have fat and when you tell the staff they shouldn't be rude.  I love the Del Frisco's in Winter Park, FL. It's one of my favorite steakhouses. This location is nothing like it sadly.

n-MEXx5lbbEiQJsV8VNqsw.text: Very, very poor service.  Mediocre food.  Will not be going back.  Definitely do not recommend.

-5pVNSUTn3WH6MECcjWpgQ.text: Let me make this a short one... Wagyu bone in ribeye was the best thing I ever ate in the protein category. It definitely was A+++ off the richter scale as far as really living it up

3QurXzwFt4wPT0xqqRKgSw.text: You see it's great being a girl!! My bf and i have our REAL anniversary in January...but i made up a "SECRET" anniversary for us in November! It's just to make up for the Valentines day that my bf hates to celebrate!   Anyway, my bf took me here for our "secret" anniversary last November and the whole experience was great!  When we arrived, we did have to wait about 30 minutes AFTER our confirmed reservation time! Was it their way of punishing us? (Minus 1 star!) It was okay coz we got to chill at their bar where a pianist was playing!  Some people actually started dancing!  We finally sat down at our table and ordered drinks! They were really stiff...i mean my martini was enough to last me the whole dinner! I ordered the 10 oz carpetbagger steak and it was the perfect size! My bf ordered the 16 oz bone in ribeye and he said it was better than the Palm! (awww...sorry Palm!)  We also ordered steamed asparagus and chateau potatoes! Both were delicious!  The asparagus were swimming in butter though...they were slippery little things!  Great steakhouse..and it was nice to finally eat somewhere great off the strip!

tMjulFMfjLnoUnzrvmROhQ.text: The only thing i can say is "awesome"  Bread - Eat the bread.  Might as well been a steak.  phenomenal... Appetizers Main Dessert Drinks  All the above was excellent.  I liked the James Bond Table also.  This place is worth every penny.  You will fill out of place if you think you can go in short or something.  Dress neat casual and up.

JMDCTIvOAWetz2FSNmgpVw.text: For a while I had been trying to remember the name of the steakhouse I went to that had, by far, the most incredible steak I have ever tasted in my life. I was able to locate this steakhouse via Yelp and immediately recognized it.  First of all, it's probably been about 3 years since I've eaten there, but that does not mean that any ounce of my being has forgotten about the delicious steak and everything else I consumed that very night. Now, I love a good steak. I order steaks the way they should be ordered, medium rare. And I am not usually a fan of having any type of crust or marinade on a steak because I love the real flavor of the meat. I am only saying this so that you know that this review comes from someone who actually loves steak.  Now, if you are finding yourself in Vegas or are going there for whatever reason, and you are looking for a good steakhouse, you MUST go to this place. Sure, it will cost you a pretty penny, but to me it's worth it.  Ambiance is good, steak is absolutely cooked to perfection, and all the side dishes are killer.

DwQH_4Yvdg12fWiZwPLPhQ.text: Grade: A  As promised, we went back to Del Frisco's so that I could try the infamous rib-eye with truffle butter. I am embarrassed to admit that I used to think "truffle" referred to chocolate (not mushrooms). LOL. In any case, the steak was just as husband had described.   Very tasty, medium rare done nicely. Service was spectacular. Our waiter even sent us a nice thank-you card since we filled out the service survey. haha.  We also ordered cocktail shrimp (good) and some potatoes (which we will pass up next time). We didn't read very carefully, and the potatoes were essentially $8 freshly made potato chips. Yea, no thanks. I'll stick to seafood and steak.  But a definite must if you visit Vegas. Pricey but one of the best steakhouses. Located away from the strip, quiet, seems to cater to a lot of business/professional people.

KgVLPEERKtdGET66MFChDA.text: All the hype about Del Frisco's made me think I was going to have a better steak than Mastro's... It didn't live up to the hype. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice and cozy. We went around the holidays so everything was decorated for Christmas. They had a live piano which was also a nice touch. The food was just OK. The Shanghai-Style Fried Calamari was drenched in a sweet chili glaze, and was super salty. I ordered a bone in ribeye, medium rare plus, per the usual. The flavor of the steak was good, but still not as good as Mastros. It also came out medium rare, a lil too rare for my liking. Other friends at the table also had to get their steaks reheated. Kind of odd?? We ordered sides: potato au gratin, corn, and creamed spinach. All the sides were typical sides, nothing special. At the end they gave us a slice the lemon cake (we were celebrating a birthday), and I would have to say that the lemon cake probably stole the show. The cake was super moist, and the frosting was a lil tart and perfect texture. The service was good. I think our waiter was in training because the manager was following him everywhere, but I think he did just fine. Overall, I'm glad I got to try it... But for the same price, I think I'll stick with Mastro's.

XEON4OotoitB9sR2NMcKtA.text: Fantastic!  Great service. Bond table was a great addition.

Pv9VrHe3mj2cXHfJR3geOA.text: Obviously the Double Eagle has figured out a way to write hundreds of fake Yelp reviews. But their scam worked flawlessly and they got their six Benjamins out of me. I've been to scores of other amazing steakhouses in Vegas and there is absolutely no way on earth that this one could be legitimately rated so high. No way. Nope. Not a chance. Never.

WR8tnADlmYdDGvPPfVo4aw.text: This was good. I wouldn't say it was the best steak I have ever eaten but it wasn't bad by any means. My husband and I came here for our 6th anniversary. Every year we try a new steakhouse on yelp so I was so excited to try this place out. We aren't seafood people, so steak it was and we decided on the Wagyu Ribeye to share. It is $90, but makes sense if you plan on sharing. We also had chateau potatoes and my husband got his mac n' cheese sans lobster but adding bacon. The steak came out sizzling hot on a plate that was equally as hot. They carved it up at the table and then we got to devour it. My husband said his mac n cheese was some of the best he has ever had. Then for our anniversary, they brought us a piece of the lemon cake. I was so full from dinner I could not eat but a few bites, but that too was good. Overall, I was very happy with the meal and the service. I would recommend it.

Oxe4htz1JrOwWHIFeWZssA.text: We used to go to the Ruth's Chris on Flamingo as a regular 2 or 3 times a month for date night and when they closed down we were disappointed in the selection of places to replace it with and until tonight couldn't fine one. This place will become that replacement. Even though we are locals tonight was our first visit to Del Frisco's and it was very good. Got there early for 5 o'clock reservation had drinks at the bar, then seated at a really good quiet table. Our waiter was very good attentive knowledgable about the special menu for NYE. The manager came over while we were waiting for desert and welcomed us and asked if we had a good time. If there is something(s) I would suggest is that maybe not put garlic in nearly every dish i.e. the potatoes both had garlic(augraten potatoes don't usually have garlic) and the asparagus would be much better saute'd or grilled with butter and sprinkled with parmesan cheese instead of steamed with almond slices. My husband had the surf and turf filet and lobster tail and I had the salmon with asparagus as a side. For desert I ordered the chocolate mousse which was so light and delicious. Neither of us are big eaters so we were stuffed with what we had and i ordered the strawberry cheesecake to go for my husband and brought the rest of my desert home for tomorrow. We are looking forward to going there more often and becoming regulars. Thank you to the staff for a very enjoyable night out. Happy New Year.

W1ERUnnc7iLFNIc2VfYwjQ.text: My brother and I always try to find a fancy steakhouse when we go on trips.  I've been to many across the country, so I think I know my steaks.  My brother went here previously and told me that it was outstanding.  So, I couldn't wait.  It was busy the night we went and we were with a large group.  I ordered my favorite cut, ribeye medium rare.  The atmosphere was good, the service was friendly.  But the service was slow.  Perhaps I hit a busy night and was with a large group.  But my steak was not good.  My ribeye was the size of a filet mignon (so I guess they didn't like me) and it was almost well done.  When I complained, they tried to convince me that it was cooked properly.  Then they told me it would take a while since it was so busy to get a new ribeye.  I was too irritated so I didn't reorder.  Meanwhile I checked out my buddies steaks and they all looked overcooked too.  My brother was also disappointed with his meal and thinks we were the victims of bad luck/coincidence.  I'm sure he will come back since he got a great steak here before, but he will have to come without me.  If I pay a high price for steak, I expect a great steak which didn't happen.  I don't care if they are busy since that is no excuse.

flPbzWxucdbAEHFQ5jxFrQ.text: My best friend, his wife, my wife and I have dinned here several times and it has been a wonderful experience each and every time. Love it

B1uu3v0x9VL0Prt_5eGEBg.text: Excellent food (for the most part), excellent service (for the most part), and excellent value (for the most part).  See why it "only" got 4 stars?  A four man group arrived for a bachelor party, hoping for a delicious dinner and a start of a very memorable night and weekend.  Steaks, wine, and appetizers were ordered.    Many have already detailed the food, so I won't go on and on about the food, except to bring out a couple of highlights and lowlights.  The crab cake, as people have said, was delicious - as was the calamari appetizer, which was drizzled in some sweet and spicy Asian sauce.  Skip the bread - it's not that great, is very simple, and will only take up room in your stomach.  The steaks were cooked perfectly.  Get whatever steak you like, and I'm sure it will be done well.  Some of the sides were also stellar.  I've never really had anyone cook asparagus as perfectly - I love it when it's slightly crunchy.  The mashed potatoes had a slight kick to it as well, and was great - I'm a fan of food that comes out piping hot.    Some of the lowlights though, included the lobster mac and cheese.  For me, it could have been cheesier.  I'm really not partial to being able to pick up individual pieces of pasta - I want pieces of lobster and cheese clinging to it.  Also, there was an error in the server simply forgetting that we had ordered the mashed potatoes.  Hey, if you want your 5 stars, you'll definitely have earned it!  After appys and entrees and a bottle of reasonably priced red wine, there was no room left for dessert - simply espressos and coffees.    As many have said before, for Las Vegas, and especially compared to prices on the strip, this is a great value and is a solid choice if you're looking for a steakhouse.

afk-zlEk9_ThzYbynxdRSg.text: The service at Del Frisco's really sets them apart from the other "top" restaurants in Vegas. Everyone - from the hostess to the servers to the bathroom attendant - was attentive, friendly, and really down to earth. To me, service makes the difference between a good dining experience and a really great one.   And Del Frisco's was a pretty great one.   For starters, we had the shrimp with three dipping sauces. I can't remember all three sauces, but I do remember the basil-garlic - it was delicious! The shrimps were plump and succulent. It was a very good start to our meal.  For the main course, I ordered the 12 oz. bone-in fillet: one of the daily specials. I think it was the best cut of meat and most flavorful steak I've ever had. It was cooked perfectly, seasoned well, and my favorite part, the crust, was salty, peppery, and crunchy. Mmm.   The guy and I split a trio of family-sized sides. The portions were huge. Each side is definitely enough for 4 people, so I would definitely recommend limiting the number of sides you order. We had the macaroni and cheese (SO GOOD), the asparagus (needed salt), and the mashed potatoes (pretty tasty).   Del Frisco's is off the Strip, but I would definitely recommend making a trip to this restaurant. It is definitely worth the trek.

xr_vPxHqF4oYwbMmz8hbgQ.text: Our waiter, Marciano was very helpful and friendly. He was awesome. He took care of our table of eleven, celebrating three birthdays. Everyone's steaks were excellent except for mine. I ordered a kobe tomahawk rib eye that was under seasoned, not enough salt and lacking the char flavor of a proper Maillard reaction. Everything else was perfect.

VcaZz9XoXyJcI2FTUwNqMg.text: Outstanding!  I went to Del Frisco's for a business dinner.    We started with the bacon au poivre appetizer -- wow, it was incredible!  I could have made a meal out of it.  I had the prime strip steak, which was perfectly cooked and wonderfully seasoned.  The lobster mac and cheese was also excellent.  While it's a pricey meal, it's cheaper than most of the nice steakhouses on the strip, and better than most of them too.  I'll definitely be back.

0-dYG3XLgS_wfq97dnRV3g.text: We ate here on New Year's Eve so no surprise that place was packed. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the bar is nice to sit at and wait till your table is ready. This is a perfect pick for a special occasion. The service was great and food was even better. If ordering appetizers, I recommend the shrimp and crab cakes. Overall the food was amazing!

bJNvalR7EkrX18DycqZ3hw.text: Short Story: Awesome steak...but pricey!  Long Story: I came here for dinner on a Saturday night and i got the Porterhouse steak that was 22oz.  Holy cow, that was a big steak.  The service, decor, and ambiance was spectacular.  They even refold your napkin when you walk away from the table to use the bathroom or something.  The raw oysters were amazing as was the asparagus.    Verdict: I would go back, but it is extremely pricey.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pfweZDQakx6bOjZBA5zLiw.text: Overall, the experience at Del Friscos as okay. It wasn't mind-blowing, but it was not bad either.   FOOD & DRINKS: Notable mentions is the Crab Cake appetizer and the lemon cake. We also got the Tomahawk Steak, it was a bit chewy for our liking. If we came back here, I would order a filet mignon or something more tender. The cocktail menu was creative and different. They have a unique house-made Pinnapple Vodka that they soak for days, which is in the VIP cocktail. I recommend this drink for vodka lovers.   PRICE: I felt like the value was there. It is clear from the dining experience that the restaurant puts a lot of heart and soul into the meals. I feel it was reasonably priced for what we received and the size of the portions as well.   AMBIANCE: There was a piano guy who was entertaining to watch and listen to during our meal. The lighting and ambiance is what you would expect from an old-fashion steakhouse. Definitely, check out the James Bond wine collection and display.   SERVICE:  The service was a bummer that night. The bartender did say this is slow season and they appeared understaffed last night. There was also a lot of large parties so the service was all over the place and there was a time when people forgot about us. However, at the end of the meal the server made up for it with a complimentary cake since we were celebrating our anniversary.   Happy Dining,   J Tran

1Cziker169quEYeflq99GA.text: Del Frisco's is as good as it gets in my opinion.    With some serious dieting ahead of both Terri R and I, a weekend of cheat meals filled our calendar.  I have to be honest, I originally wanted Ruth Chris but they were booked this evening.  So, I ended up making reservations here solely based on other Yelper's reviews.  Great choice Mel! Pat myself on my back time.   First of all, service was top notch.  It all started with the lovely and very nice, Priscilla.  From start to finish, she was delightful, helpful, and made our dining experience that much better.  Along with great service from Priscilla, we received the same type service from everyone serving the food.  This place is stacked with employees that go out of their way to make you feel like you and your date are the only ones in the restaurant.  Your unsightly empty dishes are swept away with the quickness and they even clean up around you with their handy dandy table swifters.  All this pampering during dinner and you wouldn't even notice it until they're gone  Now for the food.  We got their Prime Pair, which is their $49 per person Prix Fixe. This is a special only running through Labor Day so hurry up peeps.  This is a great deal.   Prime Par (Prix Fixe) 1.  Salads:  You get your choice of salads from their Del's, Wedge, or Caesar.  We both got their Caesar. Although it was good, it was a just a beast to eat since it wasn't chopped.  Terri worked her way through the salad and I didn't because I thought it was too much work. Not docking Del's because you don't go to a steakhouse and review their salad.   2.  Dinner Bread:  Nothing special here.  You get a loaf of their sesame bread.  For a place that serves quality food, the bread was less than average.  But again, you don't come to a steak house for bread.    3.  The entree is an 8 oz hand cut Filet Mignon with your choice of crab cakes, shrimp, or scallops.  I had the crab cakes, which is drenched in lobster sauce.  My goodness....this was delicious.  Terri had the shrimp and she said it was delicious as well.  She offered, but I was focused on my meal.  Now for the filet mignon....this was the 1st highlight.  Great tasting filet, high protein, and tasted like any other top notch steakhouse out here.  I mean it.  This steak can give Ruth Chris a run for their money and it's probably a tad healthier since it's not drenched in butter.  Their steaks didn't have that melt in your mouth feel, but it did have that taste of a well prepped filet.   4.  Sides:  You also have a choice of sides that included potatoes, spinach, mushrooms, and corn. We got the potatoes, mushrooms, and for an additional cost, added their Lobster Mac N Cheese.  The 2nd highlight to this evening had to be their Lobster Mac.  Creamy/cheesy mac, lobster chunks, and a hint of lobster sauce describes this. Tough to explain, but it's probably the best lobster mac that I have ever had.    Overall, I am giving Del Frisco's 5 stars because I expected just an okay, above average dining experience and obviously got more.  I was so consumed with my beautiful date and superb dining experience, I even forgot to snap a few photos.  But at a place like this, photos would just ruin the experience anyway.   Looking for filet mignon, a great dining experience, and somewhere off the strip...look to Del Frisco's.  You won't be disappointed.

mbPq3HnWWWaNlTxwAysg8w.text: Eye opener this last visit. Steaks cooked raw/rare ordered them M & MW we had to send the steaks back and listen to our server try to defend the rawness of the steaks we received. Pump the brakes please! I have cooked professionally for over 20 years in the Midwest and believe it or not we Eat Steaks-lots of them. Everyone has their own idea of what R.MR.M.MW.W is to them. All, I wanted is to have the server say-we will have the broiler chef cook them longer and bring them out asap sorry we missed your expectations. I visit this location twice a year and refer others to try it out. I will be changing those plans yearly now and pump the brakes on the referring

lsj8vKbxfWlya1wqDXleSw.text: I am not much of a steakhouse fan, but I was cordially invited by Randal R. and his family to celebrate his graduation of dual masters degrees, an amazing feat!  The entire state of California seems to be related to him, so we had a sizable group in a private room.  Service was magnificent, and server Andrew knew this family well from its history with Del Frisco's.  This family racks up DF dining points like Eric R. obsesses over credit card points!  I enjoyed rose sparkling wine in the celebratory mode.  We started off with shrimp cocktail (which has this amazing shallot-butter sauce that was so yummy) and tuna tartare with toasts that had olive tapenade on them!  I believe there was a crudite tray but I did not seek it out.  Due to our large group, we had a set menu to choose from that was printed nicely at each place setting.  I started off with the house salad sans bacon, which came with avocado goddess dressing...yes!  Eric R. got the classic Caesar with anchovies.  Next, we both got filet (there were many entree options, but for steak 8 oz filet or 16 oz ribeye).  The filet was flavorful, perfectly tender, and cooked exactly like we wanted.  I ate my entire steak....yum!  The sides for the table included skillet potatoes (essentially house made chips) with caramelized onions on top (yes!) and green beans with garlic, also very good.  For dessert, a choice between strawberry cheesecake and chocolate mousse.  I had the mousse, and it was rather decadent.  I really enjoyed the experience, especially our visit to the James Bond table.  This restaurant is a labyrinth though, enormous and full of happy eaters.  When we got there it was early and quiet, but when I had to look for the restroom I got lost in a maze of people and hallways.  What a delicious way to celebrate educational success!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nUZdkU-s1WAKKoJ8XSerig.text: First time eating there. We had a great server very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I had a rib eye steak on bone! It was cooked to my order. It was full of flavor. The dinner was a winner in every category Try it you will be pleased! I will be back!

BEcUvGkfc8YxH9F2ThhNVQ.text: My husband and I said this was probably the best service we've ever received. Incredible food and incredible service! Jason was our server and he was wonderful. My food came out a bit before my husbands and they gave me a free meal and an additional crab cake. Very kind and unexpected. Everything was amazing and we would definitely recommend this place to anyone!!

cvwoEllKgAdLvIz8bjWYFw.text: I died, went to heaven and they served me a Del Frisco filet.  It's either that or it's because I don't usually eat meat, this steak is comparable to that of other high end steakhouses. Don't take my word for it, you should try this place even if steak isn't your thing. Here's why.    Del Frisco's chopped salad: with iceberg lettuce, shredded carrots and other leafy vegetables, a creamy ranch dressing, it is topped with crumbled blue cheese and two long strips of bacon. Yes, actual strips of bacon! This salad was the perfect size to start off your meal.  Calamari: Don't expect this item to be your typical fried and slightly seasoned calamari. The calamari is breaded and fried, then mixed with a tangy hot and sweet sauce. Very unexpected. Very savory and very delicious!  Crab cakes: 100% all crab meat with no unnecessary ingredients to distract you. Baked in a delicious creamy lobster sauce. Rich and fulfilling and oh so good!!!  After the appetizers, I ordered items from the pre fixe menu which includes an 8 oz. filet, spinach supreme and scallops. While the scallops were too salty for my taste, the steak was an experience all in itself. At medium rare, it melted in my mouth at just the right combination and amount of seasoning. Del Frisco knows its steak as this steak deserves an applause!  Finally, I got to experience one of the most important items on the menu: the banana bread pudding. After a short period of high anticipation and excitement, it arrived at our table on a rather big plate. With a scoop of ice cream and a scoop of whip cream on top, it sat a top a layer of caramel sauce. So decadent, so rightly sweet, this bread pudding can beat any competitions any day!  As we walked our the door, I noticed this place looks rather mediocre on the inside. And of course, the James Bond table was a fun thing to experience. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and scallops
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding.

WjfXzlHN9wDIQ0uc9gBVzg.text: Last night my dame and I came in for dinner. This was our first time at Del Frisco's and it will not be our last.  Let me tell you that everything from the water to the lemon cake was amazing.  The service was great, the ambiance, the decor and the fact that they had game 5 of the 2016 NLDS was simply sensational.    This was one of the best steaks I have ever had anywhere here in this fine country.  I had the 22oz bone in ribeye and my partner had the 8oz fillet cooked perfectly.  To accompany these fine cuts of meat we ordered the silky smooth lobster mac and a side of seasonal mushrooms which came sauteed with garlic and baby onions. The  sides were so damn delicious it would of been a meal in its own.   However, what stole the show was our appetizer..  we had 1 crab cake with lobster sauce and let me tell you that it was simple the best crab cake I've ever had. The taste buds were running wild in my mouth after every bite.   To cap off the dinner , they brought us a complementary slice of there famous lemon cake  as we enjoyed watching the Dodgers defeat the Nationals in a thrilling elimination game to advance to the 2016 NLDS.   Over all my experience at Del Frisco's was amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas.

vsLT_YPlN5CAjCYRfjTiTw.text: It has been a few years so it's time for an update!  Del Frisco is still a fantastic steak option and probably the best chain steakhouse I've been to.  The one star off is only because other steak restaurants have raised the bar even higher in Vegas.    We dined with a friend that's a regular so the host just brought over several plates of appetizers of his choosing which included crabcakes, shrimp cocktail, fried calamari and onion rings.  All of them were great with the crabcakes being my favorite.  The sauce was boss!!  I got the prime ribeye medium rare and even though it was good, it's just not five stars anymore.  Not when famed NYC butcher Pat LaFrieda is shipping his monster cuts to the likes of Gordon Ramsay and Old Homestead right up the street.  My wife got the filet mignon rare with the cold center as always.  She was very satisfied with her steak.  Saving room for the lemon cake is an absolute must.  It was the biggest reason why I worked out before coming here!  One slice is good for four people.    Don't get me wrong.  I won't be bitching and moaning if someone suggests coming here but I've got to put things in perspective.  This isn't the #1 restaurant in Las Vegas.  I'd say it's a top 10 steak in town.  But when you add the terrific service and nice atmosphere you've still got a solid, solid dinner for an evening.

U4tD-xbVcGJZBP3Btw2jpg.text: Great atmosphere..Great service..Food was good but way too much butter in the food and you can taste every bit of it..The crab cake was amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio filet..Good but too much butter

oq-8wt4498FmlI5xma-A4g.text: Great service. Excellent food. It's a somewhat louder place, but nothing extreme or obnoxious. Really can't say I have any complaints, it's a pretty safe choice as far as food quality goes! A pricey choice, but safe!

PdSIH0xQZPbg8J3n1WeDcQ.text: So I know I should review all of the items we tried and frankly there wasn't a single bad item but I will focus on two in more depth because well they are the reason I keep considering daily to catch a quick round trip flight on a Southwest Wanna Get Away fair to have them again!!  Ok so we sat down and ordered up some goodies. We started with the oysters which my friend kindly worked together into a tasty on slurpper that was amazing!! We also had some killer shrimp too. Ok so now on to the two items that stole my heart.  Now we've all had bacon, it's with our breakfast, it's on our burgers and you may even crumble it on a salad or wrap it around a date and you may even have had a slab of pork belly laid nicely on top of a heaping bowl of ramen. If you're fortunate to live in Campbell, CA you may even have had it with the BBB at OCK and tasted the sugary goodness of this porky delight but my friends you have never, and I mean never, had a piece of bacon like this before. Del Friscos does something magical with this bacon. It is crispy, thick, meaty and packed with tons of flavor. We seriously order 6 of these for our table of 6, it was a ridiculous flavor profile. To this day when I see the guys who were at this dinner they all immediately say, "remember that bacon at Del Frisco's". It's simply the best menu item I have probably eaten in my life and I've eaten a ton of places and a ton of diverse foods. If I was on death row and I got my one last meal it would probably be a mound of these (I know my mom is upset right now because she probably thought it would be a bowl of her awesome spaghetti and meatballs but sorry ma).   Alright so awesome item number two and though the detail and love affair with this Sin City delight isn't as intense the Tomahawk Bone In Rib Eye still keeps me thinking back to it. Seriously this thing looked like a flippin tennis racket but it did not taste like one my friends. The meat was super tender, moist and cooked to perfection. The portion size was huge and well so was the price tag. But honestly one of the top 3 pieces of meat I've ever eaten. I know people love their steak but if you want a piece cooked to perfection you gotta give a crack to Del Frisco's.   To say the least when I'm back in Vegas for convention season I'm planting my rear at Del Friscos and loading up on bacon and beef!!

SSf2IvtPedl_-ovuXMHuNg.text: Dropped by with a large group (had advanced reservations) for a bachelor party on a Friday night.    The service and food were as expected from a high end steak house.  Multiple servers worked our large table, which made things efficient.  They offered great recommendations as well.  Decided to go with the Tomahawk wagyu ribeye ($90) and shared it with another person.  Was definitely enough food for two, especially when you include two sides.  Tasty, moist, and cooked to perfection.  Really a great steak.  I believe it was 32 ounces including the bone, and 22-26oz excluding the bone.    They were also very accommodating when we sent back our old fashions.  Del Frisco's old fashions include club soda  - so unless you like that, it should be noted ahead of time.     In the end, our bachelor got a free slice of cake.  Got to tour the james bond table.  And got some free vouchers for the "club."  The total bill came out to be about $150/person, which includes the steak, sides, and some drinks.  Would definitely recommend this place for any meat connoisseur.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WNFwleez7JSIYDCQWc1CfA.text: Tricky experience to review....Great appetizers.  Great wine list.  Solid sides.  Warm service.  Ironically, the steak (I tasted 3 different cuts at the table) was easily the worst part of the meal (2 weren't cooked correctly, and none were that tasty).  I want to give this place 4 stars, but how do you give a steak house 4 stars when they messed up the steak?  I would probably give them another chance because all other signs were super solid.

T_QOq332Wlmd9dvhWah7wA.text: This steak house was pretty delicious. We had a table of 8 guys. Everyone got something different. I got the dry aged prime Strip steak which was delicious. Also got to try a little of everyone else's plate. Service took long to get to us about 45min +. Between the 8 of us it cost $110 each. Once again good food but maybe not worth the price. Only suggested for an anniversary dinner or something important, not your average middle of the week dinner.

20pMvDF7OfHctf53XlST3g.text: The service was outstanding. My server was the most accommodating server. She cared for my sleeping daughter, handled a misunderstanding with the utmost finesse and was always an arms length away.  Now the steak was absolutely outstanding. Cooked to perfection!  My husband and I shared the tomahawk wagyu and they sliced it at the table. Mine was on a hot plate with melted butter that sizzled when my med-rare steak touched it. Mmmmmm mmmm good. The cold seafood platter was good but not all I hoped for. The shrimp tasted of iodine and the oyster are no longer included. Not awesome.  In the end we had a great time and would go back.

wUHoaKrujRwzunqk11ScPQ.text: We came here for quick dinner to try out their special Prime Pair menu. This special includes 8 oz. filet with crab cake in lobster sauce and one side for $50 ($55 now). We ended up getting sauteed mushrooms and Chateau Potatoes for our sides.   The filet was pretty good, juicy and tender the sides were also delicious, however the best item on the menu was their crab cake in lobster sauce. Delicious is the perfect word to describe it. The lobster sauce was bit salty but may be it's me and my hate towards excess salt in sauces.   The service was good and the prices are very reasonable for a big name steakhouses in town. Prime Pair special is only offered on Sundays now, so just keep that in mind when you go to this location.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. anniversary dinner
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Del Salad

xJ1gUWJxDWZEFnF1WT_E4w.text: Went here with a group of six based on other Yelp reviews and was blown away.  I have dined world wide and the service and attention to detail at this restaurant was second to none.  As previous reviewers wrote, you can cut the filet with a fork, done perfectly with great flavoring.  I thought this restaurant was extremely easy to get to.  A lot of the finer dinning spots in Las Vegas are now in hotels and getting to most requires hiking boots and a backpack.  My annual visit to Vegas will now include Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House....Well done!

VLRlqmDnQWYbIGFhjmml1Q.text: When I think about Del Frisco......mmmmmmmmmm...... I begin to salivate because this was one of the most incredible dining experiences and the Kobe steak was the best steak I've ever had!     It's all about the Kobe... it's so worth the price and for desert  a slice of lemon cake is the perfect way to top it off!

wqJw_Q2hkv8gqTiHQZmknA.text: Came here with a group of 12 guys so we were setup in a nice little VIP room in the back.  The seafood was phenomenal. Jumbo Shrimp with 3 sauces, Crab Cakes were missing the cake but had plenty of Crab, and Crab Legs were solid.  I ordered the Porterhouse and the Prime Rib portion was perfect. Rib Eye was slightly charred, but still had great flavor.  Overall, highly recommended for a steak house to try in Vegas!

qN6FRq5Ze636H91j-Za7Vw.text: We brought the bachelor here for dinner, and everyone was happy.  The steaks here are incredible, as was the magnum that the sommelier helped us pick out.  Service was good, food was excellent, ambiance was nice, and the prices were more reasonable than comparable restaurants on the Strip.  I got a bone-in ribeye, my friends all got various filet mignons, and everyone left happy.  My ribeye was as good as any I've had, and I suspect the filets were of equally high quality.  We didn't get dessert because we were so full, so I can't comment on that, but overall Del Frisco's was great and I can't wait to come back, whether it's in Vegas or at one of their other locations.  Too bad there's none in SF.

HkSCc-nw4yyii5gT4P3nFA.text: I had a great time. The wait staff was very friendly, my filet (although tiny) was delicious, and the sides were not, as one digruntled reviewer put it, "cracker barrell" quality. I had excellent asparagus and potatoes with my steak, and all in my party were really happy. We heard about this place because Artie Lange talks about it all the time on Howard Stern's radio show-Trust fat Artie to know a good steakhouse..this place is the shiznit son! The waitress was nice to us even though we just ordered icewater-always the sign of good service if they don't get upset when you don't order tip and bill inflating booze. Definitely would go back next time I'm in town.

6DIVp9wL5bgZKeSbXx2KMQ.text: This is my second time here and I enjoyed it both times. I really like the food and the pricing isn't that bad since its off the strip. I had the filet and it was prepared great. Just the way I like it. Also, they served my food on a super hot plate which is a cool thing. I like their wine selection and the ambiance is more enjoyable then other steakhouses since it was lit better...most of these resturants are dimmly lit. Our waitresses were really nice too. Next time I head over to Vegas, I will stop here again.

06l2FEB8MxG_iGK3IYw70A.text: Del Frisco's is the real deal people!  The first night I was in Vegas the cab driver recommended this place to me.  Right after check in I immediately found my way back to the Double Eagle Steak House for a feast.  The enviornment was pleasant, the people were very accomdating, and the steak was exceptional.    Although 3/4 of the way through my meal I did notice a small 'hair' in my food that immediately turned my stomach south.  Coincidentally my server just happened to be walking by as I was showcasing my "yuck-face."  She immediatly sprung into action and took the plate away.  After a few short minutes she came back with an apology and free dessert.  Even the floor manager visited my table and informed me the steak would be taken off the tab.  Even though the meal was a bit tarnished at the end, the service made up for it.    Fast forward a few short weeks and I received a Thank-You message from my server Amber in the mail.  It was a hand written note that thanked me for visiting Del Frisco's.  That's personal touch boys and girls!  And I'll be headed there as soon as I can make my way back to Sin City.

2OByDOdz-nXHOONk2UZEeg.text: This is a great choice.  The food is excellent & the service is even better.  It's off the strip about 1.5 miles so you need to walk or take taxi.  The pricing is good, given it's a high end steakhouse.  A filet + side + beer came out to $60 before tip.  But, compared to the strip, it's about 1/3 less.  SW, a comparable place in the wynn was running $75 JUST for the filet.  so good choice.  I gave 4 out of 5 only because it's off the strip and not super modern inside.  but, again, that's a small point.

aximlCKXDp75m8tN1OI2zg.text: After reading the reviews and seeing this place had over 800 reviews with a 4-star plus rating, I figured it had to be amazing.  Well, I stand corrected.  I am torn on whether or not to give it 2 or 3 stars, but went with 2 as "Meh. I've experienced better."  In fact, for the price, I've experienced A LOT better! We went to the restaurant to try their summer pre fixe menu pairings.  The restaurant was somewhat difficult to locate in the restaurant "circle" off Paradise.  Upon entering the restaurant we were greeted by teenage hostesses in fish net stockings.  Not very classy.  We read online that the attire was business casual and we dressed for the occasion, only to find a restaurant full of shorts and t-shirts.  I'm not uppity, and I understand Vegas is by and large casual, but that left something to be desired.  Upon being seated we got a waitress whose appearance was unkempt, and when my fiancee asked a question about the menu she proceeded to start talking over her about the specials of the evening and continue through her spiel.  Upon ordering dinner, I requested a glass of whisky to enjoy with my steak.  The glass of whisky made it out after our meal.  We both ordered our Filet's medium rare, and when they arrived they were more well than rare, and very dry.  The server did request we cut into them to make sure "they were absolutely perfect" when they arrived, which was a nice touch.  After much prodding by management, my fiancee agreed to send her steak back for a new one as she didn't want to be a burden or waste food.  The attentiveness was nice, but the steak they brought back the 2nd time (even with my fiancee expressing switch it to "rare" instead) was even more cooked than the first.  Let me be clear, the food was not terrible.  However, for the level of reviews this restaurant has, and the prices they command ($200 after tip for the 2 of us), it is hardly 4-star plush worthy.

Ox4zXUqsGaaboAKU7n5YYA.text: Ordered a steak medium well. I was told that meant "slightly pink".  Steak arrived bloody.  I asked if that looked "medium well" -waiter said " yes ".  Completely lost my appetite.  That and the sewer smell = NEVER COMING BACK.

XMpXRsZa-K9ZErD0JeLWFQ.text: My bf and I were told by his brother in law to not go to Vegas without checking out Del Frisco's.  So we came here for dinner on one of our Vegas trips and I had high expectations for their steaks.  We started off with a shrimp cocktail, shared a medium rare prime bone-in ribeye, maque choux corn, and creamed spinach.  The shrimp cocktail was good and fresh but a little smaller than what I'm used to seeing so that was a slight disappointment.  As for the steak, it was unfortunately too charred and salty for my taste but I was surprised at how big it was for the price.  The quality of the steak was excellent but it just wasn't seasoned and prepared the way I like.  As for the sides dishes, they were good but not memorable.  I really wanted to like this place based on its excellent reviews and recommendation from my bf's brother in law who I consider as a steak connaisseur, but I've definitely had better.  Service was great and the atmosphere and decor is similar to Mastro's, hence I'm still giving them 3 stars.  Oh ya, don't forget to take a tour of their cigar room.

dA0kgzamURMMCjfppDz_Dg.text: Greatly disappointed at this place!!!!!!!! I hardly give bad reviews but I have to give this place a bad review!!!!!!!! My boyfriend ordered the $60 steak (which I can't remember which one), and I ordered the seared tuna - both were wrong texture, un-flavorful, forgettable and totally not worth the money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I must say, place looks great; perfect setting for an intimate event. But overall, including service - would not come back again!

T6Lgl2SLURfJnzOsqc450Q.text: I heart steaks and I heart Del Frisco's. It's a manly steakhouse, no frills, a meat and potato kind of place. It's soooo delicious. Their crab cake is the best and please be sure to smother your filet with blue cheese. Yum.

yc7MSTojnhtRrTOLjoiAOw.text: We went to Del Frisco's because some relatives of mine were visiting Las Vegas. We had filets, salmon, a crab cake appetizer, and asparagus and potatoes with the steaks and salmon.  Everything was completely first class and the food included the best filet I ever had in a restaurant. I had a reservation and when we walked in there was no hesitation or delay. The led us to our table right away. It was in one of the quieter rooms. The service was impeccable and our waiter explained everything clearly. Even the wine by the glass was first rate. I had a glass of Hess Cabernet and it was superb. Steaks were timely and done exactly as promised. Vegetables and potato are served family style so we only needed one order of asparagus and potatoes for 3 people. The crab cakes were superb also.  It's not cheap, but I would definitely recommend going there again.

Rc_1wJco-affD9CpZSPQxQ.text: Stay away!  This place is absolutely awful.  We decided to give Del Frisco's a try since it is a different name from what we are used to in LA.  The service is awful and pretentious.  The food is mediocre at best.  The pricing is downright predatory.  The shrimp cocktail tasted stale as if it sat in the fridge all day.  The filet mignon was tough and was overcooked and overseasoned.  The mixed drinks were weak.  The wine list does not offer an adequate international selection.  They gouge you on the bill.  The prices are high enough, and we would have not minded paying if the quality matched.  They even charged for the bernaise sauce for my filet!  There is a reason that this place does not come up on the top lists for Las Vegas on Zagats etc...  Spend your money elsewhere.

KsfhN_WmRwWuLdAZhJ5phw.text: I have been here on two occasions, the first was with a group of friends and the second was with my girlfriend (now wife). Let me tell you, Del Frisco's did not disappoint at all. The food was excellent, from the appetizers to the entrees. The staff was polite, were not pushy and made great recommendations. Sure, the bill was high, but as they say "you get what you pay for". I will be going back again, count on it.

oVG8N01mzWlXi4bF-jlacA.text: Outstanding service and food.  The crab cake is a must!!  Ask about any steak specials and ask to see the James Bond table.  Unreal!!!

fwHu0Uk9adA0vIbZ8WmQxw.text: Once in a while it feels good to spend $145 on a great meal for two.  This is an excellent steak house.  Decor:  Dark and wooded.  Service:  Attentive.  Food Quality:  Excellent.  The bread was perfect.  The dinner salad was good (house dressing is tasty). I had a ribeye, near perfect.  Au-gratin potatoes nice and cheesy.  No desert.  Too full.  Price:  Expensive.  We are non-drinkers so we went with the Diet Cokes.  Mistake.  10 oz bottle for $2.25.  Stay away from the sodas.

0DKfgmKYG5hgZxUbHOnBaw.text: Got there on a Saturday night around 6:50pm We were seated right away. Heather was our server. She was amazing! The food was great. I had the filet and it was perfect. The lobster mac and cheese was also very good. I would definitely go back. I have been to many steak houses in Las Vegas and this and Capital Grill are by far the best.

BdlAfVMIUcO4kxRafP-otg.text: Greater than great food, excellent service by all the staff that came to our table, top notch. My wife and I celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary dinner here. I mentioned the anniversary when I made the reservation, and there was a card signed by the staff at our table, nice touch. Travis was our server. He was great. He knew the food he was serving, and described it well. Atmosphere was good, dimly lit, and everyone engaging in quiet conversation. We started with the fried calamari, thai style, which is served with a spicy chili sauce on top. It was good good good, yum. For our entrees I went with the Bone-in Ribeye, and my wife went with the Lamb Chops. They were both cooked perfectly to our request, med. rare for my ribeye, and med. rare for my wife's lamb chops. My steak was juicy, tender and perfectly seasoned. You can see the marbling throughout the steak, which makes their steaks so delicious. My wife enjoyed her lamb chops as did I, ha. Yes we tasted each others dinners. We ordered the cream spinach with bacon and lobster mac n cheese as our sides, and they were delicious. We ended with the lemon cake and they comped it for our anniversary, another nice touch. We will for sure be back next time we are in Vegas. While we were there the staff let us know they just opened a new Del Friscoes in Los Angeles by the Santa Monica pier. Guess where we're going bebe?!!!

nTes0GSKANH7ihX2atAzHA.text: What started out as a good dining experience ended on a great dining experience. We were in Vegas for a poker tournament and decided to treat ourselves to a nice dinner. This place had great reviews so we wanted to give it a try. Our waiter was nice enough but seemed to start getting impatient with us when we asked questions about the menu. However, the manager made up for it with her very friendly and open and personable demeanor. I was a bit weirded out as to why the swanky establishment would allow a patron to bring in a dog on a leash that was not a service dog, but whatever. One of the staff members walked by and said, "Well the 'dog' orders expensive wine." Yeah, sure he does. I did drop my jaw to the floor when the patron ordered ice water for her dog. Anyway, I digress with an anecdote. The steak was good but the Del's Uptown potato was out of this world! I'm glad we were able to substitute that on the $59 menu (even though the waiter seemed put out that we asked if we could) because that really made the difference. Mmmm, mmmm!  Now onto the reason for the great dining experience. As we were leaving, I needed to make a stop into the ladies room. I heard music being played but I thought it was music being piped in from satellite radio. However, when I got back, my boyfriend pointed out that it was a piano player in the lounge. We ended up staying for an additional hour and a half just to listen to Tyrone at the bar! What a fun evening! He played requests for us. He chatted with us. We laughed, we sang. Wow! I did hear that once they remodel in July, he will no longer be around after that. So, if you're in the area, go and see him before he's gone! He's the best!  So again, food pretty good (potato even better). Service, good (but made up for by the manager). Entertainment - out of this world! Overall dining experience, "Yay! I'm a fan."

RcPLp_uD7lddWPi93ahFpQ.text: So.... honestly this was the best steak in my life! The lobster was also huge and it was their smaller sized lobster 14oz! We ordered the long born steak with was aged for I believe 25-28 days and ordered it medium rare (we usually order medium but plate is super hot so it keeps cooking) I couldn't believe how soft the meat was! It literally melted in my mouth!!! The lobster was very basic but oh so meaty!!! The atmosphere was ok. I personally like the atmosphere at the Morton's in Las Vegas much more. For being a more expensive steakhouse a lot of people were dressed extra casual. The only reason I took off a star is because we still had food left over and we had like 7 different staff members try to take our food away without even asking if we were done! Like that steak was Over $100 can we please enjoy it without being rushed!!! Besides this our waitress was nice and gave us great service otherwise I would've knocked some stars down. Overall I would recommend! But pay attention to the staff when the get near your food!!!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
