DXv7Uj21HNV-LV_NtXilRw.text: So glad I went here to celebrate my birthday. My husband booked dinner for us here and we really enjoyed ourselves. We ordered the filet mignon and the rib eye and it was delicious! We also ordered the chateau mashed potatoes and lobster Mac and Cheese which were also very delicious, they came in good portions so we had lots of leftovers. The meat itself was tender and cooked to our liking.   The staff from start to finish were so pleasant, they were so kind and made my birthday a memorable one. The gentleman helping us with our order was very nice and he did his best checking up on us, I know he was super busy!   So glad I was able to enjoy this experience. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas! Thank you.   ~V

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a great Birthday dinner with my family. I&#39;ll be back again! Thank you!

MI3kD_EngO989Fb2D2B1QQ.text: Went here to celebrate late father's day. Made reservations and someone called day before to confirm reservations.   No wait. Was assigned to Ro's table. Very professional, knows the specials by heart & very thorough.   Orders:  Calamari - average for us. More on the sweet side w a kick of spice  Blue cheese salad - cant really go wrong w salad  Lobster bisque - husband loved it. It as just ok for me  Bone in filet - loved the tenderness, cooked perfectly as requested. Seasoned well  Dry aged rib eye - husband loved it. Cooked perfectly aswell as requested.  Creamed corn - not too fond of it. Certain seasoning me & my husband didn't like. Prolly cumin? Idk  Lobster mash potato - really good. Only comment about this is its a chunky mash potato, but some chunks where too big that it could be eaten w 4 bites. So it wasnt like the usual smooth mash potato  Asparagus - cooked well, not overcooked  We were impressed w the steaks but not so much the sides. Reason for 5 stars because mainly for Ro.   Great job! Keep it up!

1Xw3xvQSssth981PZU3Frg.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. I can't believe this is the first time we've been here since living in this town for over a decade. How sad!   Let me preface this by saying, the service was BEYOND exceptional. Zayne was just ONE of our three serves. Our table was visited by management at least 4 times. Everyone was conversations with us and really making the service exceptional.   We started with escargot. It was delicious and most importantly, different. It was served with fresh tomato and garlic wine sauce. Then we had the seafood platter. Ice cold. Fresh. Fantastic. Except one extremely small complaint: the seafood is cracked for you and so I had pieces of shell that kept making their way into my mouth. But this is a first world problem and I'm almost embarrassed to mention it.   For steaks we had: ribeye, bone in New York, and of course the Tomahawk. They were all cooked to perfection. Piping hot plates and full of FLAVOR. We got the spinach, mushrooms and potatoes at gratin for sides. All excellent with, again, lots of flavor. The spinach had bacon. The mushrooms had caramelized onions. Not your average steakhouse sides. They had "flare".   Now, dessert. The entire restaurant knew how we were celebrating multiple occasions and apparently, so did the staff because we had a platter full of dessert. Not just one dessert, but pretty much every dessert on the menu. Management, wait staff, sommelier, and our food runner all came to the table to celebrate with us.   This was a fantastic experience and we will, without a doubt, be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0tppDdUUMb9eTWz_bH85Bw.text: One word-Amazing.  Was blessed to be invited with a large group and everything was perfect from start to finish. Our assortment of appetizers was just to die for-Calamari, foie gras, and this bourbon bacon. Our entries varied from Filets to Tomahawks to seafood and no one was disappointed. They do an above and beyond explanation of the menu and difference in steaks. Sides I was so happy because they are family style so we all got a lot of everything. The Lobster Mac was my favorite.   Extensive wine list with knowledgeable staff. Wonderful bartender too!  We were too full for dessert but I am sure it would of been amazing.

SzkKc3r8h_TvxqvrWQ18yA.text: This place is awesome! definitely try the fried calamari its kinda have a hint of spicy and sweet!  The Crab Cakes are good too and the Lobster Mac and Cheese gotta have that!  My bone-in Ribeye so good and tender no need for a steak sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

shQT2HVq7CDi2RfrCxN6Aw.text: Del Frisco's was AMAZING!!! Come here for not only good food, but AMAZING service and a wonderful experience!  When I called to make a reservation, they asked if we were celebrating anything, so I told them it was my boyfriend's birthday. (Yes, it actually was.)  They gave him a card at the beginning signed by the staff, and then they brought out 2 desserts on a plate for us at the end of the meal!  The food was FANTASTIC. Best lobster I've ever had, and of course the 45-day aged ribeye was exactly as it sounds - like the best thing you've ever eaten. Lobster Mac was to die for.  I think my favorite thing about this place was how much time each of the staff members spent with us to make sure we were enjoying ourselves and happy. They talked with us, laughed with us, and I noticed the other servers were doing the same for their tables.  We had Sean. He was so delightful.  Eat here for an experience you'll always remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dinner, served after they scraped the breadcrumbs off of our table!

22JycCs5GbAFUdm2yvopkg.text: My favorite happy hours. Bartenders are the best!  Food always delicious!! A deal!! Gets super crowded so get there early for a seat.

_mPlaMd-a8PL9ySDul-oDw.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate our 1 year marriage anniversary while we were visiting Las Vegas. Many locals we ran into in Vegas warned us of our decision to go to this steak house, but I have to say they were all wrong.  Del Frisco's provided first class service, went above and beyond for our anniversary, and the food was incredible.  From the moment we checked in, the hostess greeted us and remembered from when we made reservations that it was our anniversary.  When we were seated, the table had flower petals and there was a card signed by the staff.   I don't have the card in front of me, so please forgive me if I get our waitress' name wrong but I believe she went by "Jack". She was such a delight! Her suggestions on what to order were perfect and she handled everything in a very timely manner.   We had the Lobster Bisque, Caesar Salad, Wagyu Steak Tomahawk Chop, Creamed Spinach, and the Uptown Del's Potatoes. Everything was insanely good, splurge on the steak because it's definitely worth it.  For dessert they brought us out a free tasting of their Butter Cake and Chocolate Souffle Cake. Skip the souffle and just order a million servings of the Butter Cake, this was probably the best dessert I've ever tasted. We were beyond stuffed but could not leave a bite of this left on the plate!  Thank you Del Frisco's for making our anniversary so special! We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas!

wR7o4TtaEE0opjJSEIM0BQ.text: We had a great dinner. The food was great. The tomahawk and dessert was worth every penny. Service was awesome. Our server Breeze and the general manager Melody was very accommodating and friendly. We would definitely go back!

JOjK7BjvWxoJ1ZmuG5SyLQ.text: Service was great, but the food was bland and not worth spending almost six hundred dollars on just four people. After taking my steak back twice they still couldn't make it well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids coloring

Wvlq6DF0in7uEYDxfyl-xg.text: Fiyah, great ambiance.  Drinks were great. Crab cakes tasted good. Steaks were medium rare and sauce was delish.   My sea bass was cook nicely and the lobster Mac n cheese had great flavor and texture.  Would I come back? Sure but there are a lot of restaurants in Vegas I still want to try.

k88xEQmWwnnm0KIU-sJrmg.text: Amazing! My filet mignon was perfection! The servers and manager were the nicest people. They even put a candle in my creme brulee for my birthday. Very sweet! The restaurants feels old school Vegas in a modern way. Loved everything and will be a regular! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w7LpQNdyZXNINTkYRz8Yfw.text: This place was very delicious, staff was very professional and attentive, suggested some great drinks i had the prime porterhouse (5/5) seasoned perfectly was a little undercooked but waitress insisted on sending it back for it to come out just right (medium) had the crab cakes (4/5) it was very good but seemed to be missing something slightly and the waygu cappricio (2/5) was king of tasteless and couldn't finish it, overall will come back especially for the steaks.

RmL2B58l3BbkyHzsKO3ShA.text: A good friend who is a chef over at palms kept insisting I try this place out and finally I gave it a shot! The food was beyond amazing. I had a medium cooked steak and a variety of sides. My friends ordered different cuts of steak and we all were satisfied. The waiters are very on top of their job to make sure the dining experience is perfect. Will be back again!

jMcS8HtX8Ks1b9nZwe1bqw.text: didnt find the steak that great, was way too fatty for me  i got bone in ribeye, and added crab cake  the crab cake was really good  i wouldnt come back here for steak

-usLQQUAOpBczZ1g4xtXxQ.text: Good     Not only good    the best service and taste Was there for March madness and became my favorite dinner over the four days .Steak was excellent service was better

4OiVpU8Svo_ZQo-X5CEYag.text: No one better! Unparalleled service, food & drinks! Always excellent. We try to hit at least 2x during a Vegas trip, this time we did 3. A filet, any potato choice (we rotated), bacon brussel sprouts- all highly recommended! Del Frisco's delight (aka adult milkshake) for desert beverage, never ever disappoints.  Even better? Enjoy dessert or drinks on the patio on a warmed cozy couch under a heater. Now this is True love. I suppose it's actually a good thing that there's not a (steakhouse) location closer to us. I'd soon be fat & broke. :(

2vEcfaoVmDepuk1_sbyJTQ.text: Party of 7 went here for a family dinner while in Vegas. Very disappointing. The appetizers and sides were ok/good. The regular steaks and dry aged steaks were ok/good. BEWARE IF THE A5 WAGU!    4 of us at the table decided to splurge and go for the A5 wagu. 3 of us had the wagu  sampling/tasting dinner. 1 of went with a 9 oz. A5 wagu from Japan. All of the wagu dishes were terrible.   They were served very thinly sliced and raw and stone cold. I mean cold. The bread was warmer than the wagu.  Seriously, it was like eating carpaccio or wagu sashimi. 3 of the 4 wagu dishes were sent back to be cooked (and warmed) a little more. $160 - $180  for a few slices of cold, raw, thinly sliced wagu beef. The saving grace here was the service. Our waiter and the wait staff was terrific. I prefer Craft Steak or The Cut when in Vegas.  I don't think i will be returning to Del Frisco's.

BUv3oT2GGKIw95Hoo514OQ.text: Excellent in every form. Two visits in three days. Would eat here every day if I could! Everything is cooked and prepared to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare. Splendid taste and capers were perfect. Bread served with a slice of red pepper and an olive tapenade.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 28 oz. Tomahawk Waygu Steak.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz. Medium-rare prime strip with sautéed mushrooms and roasted asparagus.

d20jiTi8yLx0d-mxPO-dsA.text: Really nice staff.  Everyone was making sure our food was perfect. Excellent steak and potatoes.  Just what we were looking for.

B5RkSWfBtCmbklkFrWjZ-A.text: omg... best meal i can remember having... amazing.  best service. best food. best ambiance. this place needs a Yelp loves us sticker!  food: 16 oz australian lobster-  truffle butter... $100  ok, i know sooooooooo expensive but soooooo worth it. it was honestly the best lobster i ever had and ive had good lobster before. omg. it was just seriously a pure orgasm.  wine: bottle of moscato-  good stuff  service: kelsey was our waitress and she was so great! shes so sweet and just friendly. very good service.  ambiance: very romantic and old school  notes: * you get what u paid for * ask for the rewards club * they can call a cab for u (they do have parking too) * this is a high end restaurant * dress code

KNTm96LZ_iLQS9KxiDNTwg.text: Big surprise no one has contacted me to follow up. A woman from corporate emailed me on yelp asking for my number and never called.   Truly impressed with their complete disregard to protecting their patrons and following up with something that effects every guest.

SW4pq8mLYhN7IiwN7vgFvg.text: Good fun, old-school, off-the-strip Steakhouse, with good cuts of meat, well-done sides, and a nice bar-made cocktails to complement.

r-cf5l_oRsywu3RfHwO4vA.text: Hands down the Best steak and best service in Vegas.  You will not be disappointed.  Word of advice, don't eat too many appetizers or salads so there is room for the steak.

opHfSpmwN_TbreKXBvTvdQ.text: Damn good rib eye! Quite possibly one of the best ones I've ever enjoyed. Seriously.   My buddies and I were looking for a good dinner Friday night, and we all though this place was going to be hopelessly packed and out of reservation times. But, one must always try, says the educated Libyan. (If you're watching Boardwalk Empire). I called at about 6pm, and Cheryl, happy and helpful, made us a reservation for 7:30! Awesome!  Stepping into this place, you get a very classy, yet relaxed atmosphere. That's very rare to have...as an experience! Normally it can't be both, just one or the other.   Service was outstanding. Forgot our waiters name, but he was very personable and he was always hovering around to make sure everything was straight.  Definitely get the rib eye, medium rare!! Three of us ordered the exact same thing and three of us were extremely bloated and happy. Crab cake was awesome, however I could take it or leave it with the beef tartare.

g9YNz-UccCT6ZDMzNMezJg.text: If you want a great steak come to Del Friscos!  This is by far my favorite steakhouse. Every time I've come to this establishment I've never been disappointed. Great service and great people. I took some of my friends and we had a great time. My friends loved the food. One of my friends had the crab cakes and they were awesome. My favorite is the Bone in Rib Eye. Thanks for another fantastic dinner.  Oh yeah make sure to order some lobster Mac and Cheese it is literally to die for.

qsIPTzMigJCIJbIGVaZTBg.text: Absolutely amazing. I am a huge steak lover and this was the first steakhouse in Vegas that did not disappoint me. Service was flawless. I actually got a waiter that knew what he was talking about and had some common sense, something a lot of waiters lack.   For food, I ordered the 12 oz filet and it was perfect. The hot plate they serve it on kept the initially sizzling steak hot and warm until I finished it. Other steakhouses serve steaks on hot plates as well, but even still, I always find the steak to cool down quickly. Thankfully, it's not a problem here.  The complimentary bread is pretty meh in my opinion. It tastes fresh but it's not the type of bread I prefer. After eating at Mortons so many times, my standard for steakhouse bread has not been able to be satisfied by other places thus far.  For other sides and apps, I got baked potato, gumbo soup, and the crab cake. The crab cake is incredible, definitely worth a try. Baked potato is good but the butter is not the kind of butter I prefer. The gumbo soup was kind of bland and dissatisfying, something I probably won't get next time.  Overall, my experience at Del Frisco's was amazing and I highly recommend it. The steak was so good!!!!!!

Dk6ym7qKu9NtCRkepzSOdA.text: Went to this place as a group dinner (for bachelor party).   Parking is valet or a private lot. We took a limo there so not sure how much valet is. It's a pretty big restaurant, i think the capacity was around 500. Hosts/Hostesses were polite and courteous. They also have a pianist playing in the main lobby area. Decor is just nice. Nothing too crazy or fancy but just fancy & nice enough.   We got the 32 Oz Wagyu beef for the groom and rest of us got the Prie-Fix menu with the 16 oz upgrade (Prie fix was 49 and you add $12-15 more for the upgrade, not a bad deal if you love meat). We all got different side items (creamed spinach, corn, crab cakes, shrimps, lemon garlic scallops). Crab cakes were delicious as mentioned by other reviews. I liked the scallops and the creamed spinach. I don't think the mashed potatoes were that great but some of my friends seemed to really enjoy them.   The Meat, obviously is the main focus of this place (being a steak house). All the meats were cooked real well. It was seasoned well and the the portion size is pretty damn huge so come hungry and ready to devour. I had a hard time finishing my plate. Service was impeccable as our waters were constantly being re-filled and tables being cleaned.   It is definitely on the pricey side so I'd recommend coming here for a special occasion.

V7YNIiKrP-1XkB6RQELVaw.text: Not worth the time & money.  The only thing that's good is their signature, pineapple cocktail drink.  I got the off menu wagyu and I can definitely say it wasn't a prime wagyu; taste & texture is completely different; don't even bother trying.   Got their maque choix corn & the crab cake.  If you've tasted Mastro's cream corn, then you will be disappointed with this maque choix corn.  Unfortunately, I haven't tasted crab cakes that makes me want more, this crab cake wasn't any different.  My significant other tasted my wagyu & said, "i taste only charcoal."  He was right, but I think it was just the slice he tasted that was more burnt.  The customer service was definitely a 5-star, hostess & waitress were friendly.  I'll probably come by here for the pineapple cocktail & to be in a little more classier environment, away from the drunkards.

MU6GkJQAodTvcHJt85YOhQ.text: I have eaten at this Del Frisco's location 4 times in 5 years. I live in GA. Each time the food has been excellent and the service is the best. This past Sunday, Sept 1 my wife and I celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary at Del Frisco's and our waiter, Andrew Van B and the staff were outstanding as was the food. The prime riibeyes & lobster were cooked to perfection. We love all of their sides & bread. The onion rings are killer. Thanks again to Andrew and the staff for making our evening a night to remember.

uNHtFCIezIbHFwhHP2fmfg.text: Love this place...we started off with oysters and then shared the wagyu tomahawk rib eye and 22oz lobster tail.it was awesome they also came with three sauces which were a truffle sauce, butter, and bernaise pretty expensive though so be prepared to spend some money but it was great!

B3eknUdYBAOAKoCIYt0lWg.text: Wow the 2nd best steak I've ever had. Only behind the great Bern's Steakhouse in Tampa. This is a bad thing, because I will never come to Vegas again without eating here. A truly great steak is something special that you don't take for granted. Once again folks get off the strip, and explore some of the best restaurants in town without the celebrity chef's name attached to it. I've had Del Frisco's bookmarked for a while now and the only thing that kept me away is that I found out it was a chain, so how good can it be? There are lots of Prime Steakhouse chains and while they are all pretty good, they aren't really that special. Well this chain is small, only 10 locations. I hope they keep it that way to keep up the quality. We decided to really give the place a try and went with their signature special steaks. The 32 oz Wagyu Tomahawk Bone in Rib Eye ($90), The 16 oz Bone in Filet Mignon ($60), and the Filet Mignon 3 ways ($60). The 32 oz Wagyu just melted in your mouth. I'm not usually a Rib Eye fan, but the marbling on the Wagyu is a beautiful thing. I love steaks medium rare with a warm red center. Our excellent server Tatyana, told us that the chef recommended going one degree more and ordering medium. This way the excess marbling has a change to "melt" into the beef as it cooks. I read a few reviews, that complained about this steak being too fatty. I'm guessing they didn't take the chef's advice. When cooked properly a Wagyu steak's fat content has a wonderful texture to it that just blends perfectly with a beef. This steak was pure heaven and like I said, the 2nd best steak I've ever eaten. Yes it's expensive but, at 32 oz, big enough to share with others. I would share this steak, before going with one of their regular steaks. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... The 16 oz bone in Filet Mignon, isn't one of their regular steaks. It's a much higher quality Filet than the other steaks on the menu. Again splurge for this steak or you are missing what makes Del Frisco's special. Served right on the tail of the Porterhouse bone, it's awesome and you are getting a large filet as they don't waste too much of the weight with the bone. It pairs very well with the Wagyu and you will be happy going back and forth between them. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... The Filet Trio, while nice, seemed fairly ordinary compared to the other two steaks. The steak quality here was similar to other prime steakhouses, but were seasoned a little more boldly. My favorite of the 3, was the Brie Filet. Melt Brie on anything and it's a hit. The Huge Broiled Shrimp was slightly over cooked, and the oscar while ok, wasn't to the level of the steak it's self. Each was a good size 4oz filet. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... If you want insurance that your steak will be special, order a side of the truffle butter. This is melted table side and is amazing. It isn't needed for the Wagyu or Bone in Filet, but a few bites here and there didn't hurt. It definitely brought the Filet trio up to another level, as well as the Potato Wedges that came with my daughter's cheeseburger. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... Speaking of the cheeseburger, it's prime ground beef and was well seasoned. If you are in Vegas for a few days, it wouldn't be wrong to come back and sit at the bar and enjoy this big burger with a few tasty sides. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... Of the 3 side dishes we shared, the Potatoes Au Gratin were the only one that really stood out. So cheesy with a nice strong cheddar and perfectly cooked cubed potatoes. It was everything the Lobster Mac & Cheese should have been. Not cheesy at all and more like a Lobster Mac & Bechamel, pretty bland. The Mushrooms nothing special either. Read way too many reviews not to share a slice of the 6 layer lemon cake with buttercream frosting. It's big enough to share with a few people for sure. Very moist and along with a dessert wine could be a great ending to a special meal. yelp.com/biz_photos/del-... If you are a steak lover, make sure you bump Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House high up on your to do list. Bookmark now and you'll thank me later!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick Prime Ground Beef Cheeseburger.

Pf8lfYdrZgNJAAWLTw-wZw.text: Always a fantastic meal, one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas that is off the Strip. Easy to make online reservations and typically you do not have to wait long with reservations.

qJUl4vVaNToeNgyGfr_lRw.text: All good... except the medium rare steak is so raw in the middle we couldn't cut it with a steak knife. A butcher's knife would have worked better. Half our party sawed off the seared parts and only ate that. Not a good thing if, you know, you go to the steak house for the actual steak.  Service, salads, lobster mac n cheese, oysters, even creamed spinach were all amazing. Great wine selection, too. But those darn undercooked, gristly steaks! And the bathroom is tiny for such a large restaurant. Even the men's room had a long line at times (3-4 people waiting.)

HPBrhuqlsHHQUMgOSgxFRg.text: Had a reservation for 7 hungry men after a long day at the beach club.  I'll be honest.  I think most high-end steak houses are the same.  I truly believe that what separates them are the sides and appetizers, so I'll start there.  Probably the best crab cake I've ever had.  It was basically an enormous lump of crab with just enough consistency to keep it in 'cake' form.  The sauce that came with the cake was absolutely phenomenal.  Lobster mac and cheese was equally incredible.  The asparagus was rather plain.  It appeared to be simply steamed without much to it.  I prefer mine with oil and garlic.  The creamed spinach is good, but the same as you'd find at other steak houses, although the addition of bacon is a pretty nice touch.  I'm rather used to having porterhouses for 2 (or 3 or 4, etc), so I decided to have the porterhouse for 1.  Perhaps I've gotten spoiled but I've gotten so used to seeing my porterhouse sliced up that having to do it on my own really felt like a chore.  Call me a baby in a grown man's body.  Otherwise, the steak was cooked perfectly, and had a nice progression of rare-ness as I got closer to the bone.  By the end of the night, I was eating with my hands and the bone was cleaner than what a dog would have done.  The other guys I were with seemed to enjoy theirs as well.  We all had been drinking all day, attempted to sober up for a few hours, and so no one wanted to see or smell a drink during our meal.  Overall this actually really saved us on the bill and our fine meal hardly broke the bank.  As for the service, our server Ryan was excellent and we enjoyed the banter, while our sides were plated for us very nicely by the rest of his crew.

hjUUEYeTtACZxVZbn3CSCQ.text: One of my favorite steakhouses to visit in Las Vegas. I have been to Del Frisco's a few times now, and it is always a great experience. This most recent trip for a birthday celebration was really nothing short of great. I even actually opted for seafood this night over red meat.. long week of t-bones and lamb.. haha.. random week.. but anyway.   The quality of the food is fantastic. The service was spot on without being pretentious or rude, and the overall experience was really pretty wonderful. The staff really made us feel great.. and made every effort to keep our drinks full, bread basket overflowing and meals served promptly.   Seriously, i can say nothing else other than it's also pretty fantastic that they are located off-Strip and thus, requires that you do not have to deal with a huge parking garage. While they have valet available, the parking lot is like 50 feet from the front door if you want to just walk.   I will be back.. again and again.

pZsBQ4yDXU1vSC1hCZkotQ.text: Awsome and delicious steak house off the strip. I had the Double Eagle bone in Porterhouse, lobster macaroni and bacon Brussels sprouts. The steak was juicy and perfect. The lobster macaroni had huge cunks of lobster and the bacon Brussels were perfect.    The service is great and the atmosphere is classic and chill. Definitely will be back!!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Eagle with Lobster Macaroni and Bacon Brussel Sprouts!

tciMHZzEk4dRaLi-kw15XA.text: Last night we ate at The Golden Steer, and it was so disappointing, the streak would probably be better at Taco Bell. Tonight was a much happier story, Del Frisco's. Worth every penny! The lobster bisque was amazing. The crab cake was beyond fantastic, and I don't like crab cake, but I could eat that for every meal. The steak was the best I've ever had, it was melt in your mouth cooked to perfection. The staff were professional and friendly. The lighting was nice, I could see my food but wasn't blinded by lights. I can't wait to eat Del Frisco's again.

nzfX4KnpnBI12ZcnltM1FA.text: EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE My boyfriend and I came here on our first date six months ago. It was a wonderful dinner and our waitress, Priscilla, and the rest of the Del Frisco staff outdid themselves that night. They were incredibly attentive and the food was delicious, especially the lobster mac & cheese. yelp.com/biz/del-friscos... For our six-month anniversary, we returned to the scene of the crime. Unfortunately, Priscilla was on maternity leave. How did we know that? Because when Mel called to make the reservation, he was informed of that fact. How did they know that Priscilla was our waitress? They must have a file on every customer and keep notes! Whatever it is, I'm impressed. When we showed up for dinner and checked in, guess what? The hostess told us that Priscilla was on maternity leave-hah! We know, but thank you. We were shown to our table and a gentleman took our drink order and told us that Liz would be our waitress that evening. Liz showed up and told us that Priscilla was on maternity leave with her son. By now, this would be considered to be kind of weird, but we were impressed that the staff of this establishment went to such lengths to make sure that we were taken care of. Note, we'd only been here ONCE before. Needless to say, Liz took great care of us. The manager stopped by our table to greet us. No less than 3 different staff members filled water glasses, brought entrees and side dishes. A big plus to the staff member who brought us our steaks and requested that we cut into them to ensure that they were cooked to our liking before he left the table--that was a first for me and I'm even more impressed. I had the beef medallions, 3 pieces of steak served over mashed potatoes with green beans. I could only eat two of the medallions because we started with the sesame bread and butter as well as Del's salad for me, plus lobster mac & cheese on the side. Mel had the filet mignon with mushrooms on the side. It was a lot of food, but we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner here once again. Another big plus is the cool piano player who plunked out some nice tunes, including one of my faves, "The Girl from Ipanema." I was a happy woman that night and we will definitely be back after another wonderful dining experience at Del Frisco's. I've never had such great customer service and it didn't stop that night. Mel received a follow-up e-mail the next day to thank us for our business; incredible.

saBQRB3A0ua6A-je0tLigg.text: Just got back from visiting Vegas and visited Del Frisco's. Every single thing I ordered was delicious. Lobster mac n cheese was to die for and the filet mignon was cooked perfectly.

jYDnfefOQ5YfGCWz7JONow.text: This is my favorite place to dine in Las Vegas when I want to escape the Sin City madness. I've enjoyed my visits here tremendously, whether it was for a buddy's "final meal" as a bachelor or a quiet date night with my wife.   The Del Frisco's rib eye steak is beyond amazing. This is how a steak should be served: it should be the star of the meal, not hidden under sauces or overwhelmed with superfluous flavors. It's a high quality, 16 ounce cut of rib-eye that's cooked to perfection, with a crust that complements the juicy tenderness of the meat.   Your server will warn you that they undercook their steaks a bit, so if you normally order medium rare, then you'll order medium. They'll have you cut your steak to ensure it's been cooked to your liking. Steak lovers know that if you're at a high-end steakhouse like Del Frisco's, then you're wasting your money if you're ordering a steak well done, since you want to taste the meat, not the flame.   The appetizers are spectacular. When they're in season, the stone crab claws are delicious. Fresh and meaty, they're the perfect starter and contrast nicely with the meat feast you're about to indulge in. The calamari is also tasty, with an Asian-style twist to them. My favorite, though, is the crab cake: It's heavy on the crab and easy on the breading. The sauce might be too rich for some tastes, but during my most recent visit, the waitress saw me dunking my bread into it and she brought out a side of the sauce so I could enjoy a few extra dunks before the main course. Now that's service!  Speaking of, the service is top notch. I love how each server manages to be available without being intrusive. Every staff member I've encountered has been polite, friendly, and attentive.  Finally, the sides are served family-style, so one order is good for two or three people. My favorites are the sauteed mushrooms, potatoes au gratin, and the lobster mac and cheese. Each is a worthy complement to your steak.  Bring at least $100 per person for food, more if you'll be having drinks. After a meal at Del Frisco's, I always stay away from steak for a month or two: it's so good that everything else pales in comparison.   Highly recommended. Be sure to ask about the James Bond table before or after your meal.

Gx1EEHkN1CXGzrqCVjilHw.text: crab cake is full of crab meat...but salty and not fresh  wild mushroom was super salty, nice that they comp it but we didn't eat it after one bite  prime bone ribeye - good tasty, a bit veiny  lemon cake - good, a hint of strange taste

WUI_QHE44049F2ObzwdScA.text: Recommended by a friend who highly recommended we try their steak. As a beef lover, this peaked my interest and put it on my list to try.  To our surprise they didnt have dry aged, which is what we would prefer but we know wet aged steak is delicious too. I think we got the prime porterhouse and bone in rib eye. Both didnt have that much flavor. Was not as tender to chew. Was not excited. It was nice but we would not return. Our server was so nice and professional, thanks for the experience!

NERVggyg0HlfWGGztpHk2A.text: I was just about to post a review of our fabulous dinner at Del Frisco's earlier this week. However, I just read Haley Q's review dated 3/9/18 & I completely mirror her sentiments! We were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary & the entire staff made sure it was special. Brege, our waitress, was just the right amount of attentive & lots of fun. We thoroughly enjoyed chatting with her! We also would 100% recommend the Butter Cake. Absolutely incredible!! I'm not a cake fan but this is the exception. Phenomenal!  Thank you to the entire staff. Every person we encountered congratulated us & wished us well, making it even more special. Thank you to all & especially to Brege!

s_65hTjEVjnbqbBsBw8hdg.text: From the moment you walk in, you know you are in for a treat. Greeted professionally with a genuine smile this place screams quality. Zane our waiter was great as was Alonzon. Don't you hate when you are having a an intimate conversation on a romantic night with your significant other and some jerk interrupts the moment to pour water or ask you if you would like more bread. Well not here, you don't even notice that everything is meticulously topped off. Now on to the food. Bread was like an airy pillow of greatness  Crab cake #1 of all time. Oyster from the eat coast excellent. Wedge salad a perfect ratio of blue cheese to bacon and lettuce. Salmon was perfectly presented and prepared. Filet trio, each piece topped with a special kick, Lump crab, Shrimp and Scallop wrapped with bacon, Brie cheese and all cooked to the perfect temperature. 7 layer lemon cake was amazing. In a city with so many choice you should take a short trip from the strip chaos and experience a True jackpot. Thank You for your contribution on making this a spectacular birthday for my wife.

_lgjewIEGRaj6rcYrmI8YA.text: Now this is a real steak house. Their steak, seafood, and all of the food is incredible. Interesting location, but the ambiance is amazing and the food is over the top! They spilled something on me because it was my fault and they offered to dry clean my shirt and purchase me a new one. They serve Voss water and have a full bar. Can't go wrong with any of their dishes. Off the strip, quiet, and I highly recommend!

vTyyVI6h583UGvvz0LX2kQ.text: Not sure why this place has so many stars.  Here is our honest review:  -- There were literally 3 different types of music going AT ONCE, and we could hear them all mixed together.  I know this sounds absurd.  It was!  I'm including a video that proves this cacophony.  I've NEVER heard anything this horrible in any restaurant, ever.  Oh, and the types of music going were more suited for some hill-billy joint or cafe, rather than a good restaurant.  And, I'm not being snobby -- I've been to many nice restaurants that play easy-going music, or rock music, or jazz....    -- I ordered an "old fashioned" (drink).  The glass it came in was hideous, unrefined.  The drink itself was just OK.  See the picture of the drink.  I do realize this is a matter of taste -- it's just that I've had these drinks in dozens of different fine restaurants, and this glass looks like it came from a thrift shop, or from grandma's cupboard.  -- We shared a steak.  Rather than them garnishing the additional plate, it was bare.  I know this might be the norm of SOME places, but we've been to so many places where they do a little embellishment.  It's not McDonalds or Wendy's, after all, is it.  -- Lobster Mac & Cheese:  Sounds like a dream, right?  Well, I'm a big lobster eater, as well as chef of seafood (most of it I catch myself), and I've caught my own lobsters, as well.  Anyone out there know what happens when you freeze fish, then thaw it, then freeze it AGAIN?  It turns spongy.  If you know what I mean, then you know how the lobster pieces were in this lobster mac & cheese.  They were horrible.  I couldn't even eat it.  On the other hand, if you don't know what I'm talking about, then I guess you aren't that experienced with good seafood, and you probably would be fooled.  I'm not trying to offend anyone by saying this; just being honest & objective.  -- Server -- Was not refined.  Did not provide the type of service we find so standard in a "nicer" restaurant.  Was sloppy and was also hard to understand what he was saying.  -- T.V. playing sports -- a huge T.V. was blasting sports above the bar.  Sure, this is pretty normal in places. I get it.  But, the way it was situated, it could be seen from the "dining room."  It really helped ruin the atmosphere.  Most "nicer restaurants" don't even bother with a T.V.; if they do, it's usually in the bar area, and there are seating options away from it.  -- Not a "good restaurant" environment, in general.  I know, this is an "opinion."  But, for evidence, I present another picture showing chairs all stacked up outside the bathroom door.  Sloppy!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No garnish on plate when we were sharing an entree.  Not a big deal, but it&#39;s nice when a restaurant does something.

62ITRFm-XU7HUgaR7bldVQ.text: Sadly so excited to come here but so so disappointed!! Been to the sister property in NYC near my old job on 53rd possibly 20 times. Never ever anyone had to send anything back. Here at Las Vegas location too much black pepper on everything ! Someone tell the chef you cannot replace taste with black pepper. Re quested Bearnaise sauce for the 12 ounce bone in filet. It was cold. Asked for warm and came back with another cold batch. Three times cold batches of the sauce. I cannot tell you that 15 minutes later I am starting at a filet that's cold. Sorry we are at a private business with 10 persons and a hefty tab. Three other persons had their filets returned for being cooked wrong. Not coming back. I give it 2 stars because wait staff did not cook the food. It's not their fault. Wish I had a better experience. Love the NYC location!!

DoWntfITwv8AjtaesBgloA.text: This is one classy joint and the meals there will not disappoint.  For appetizers we ordered Oysters on a Half Shell. This was my first time eating raw oysters on a half shell, I was a tad hesitant at first, but I read about them and was excited to try them.  When the oysters came out to the table they had 3 different choices of sauces to douse your oysters with: One sauce contained red wine vinegar with chopped onions, 2nd a cocktail sauce, and side of freshly grated horseradish, of course a wedge of lemon.    The first oyster I partook in, I only added the lemon juice and horseradish. With little hesitation I shucked the oyster in my mouth the cold, slippery mollusk hit my tongue like a wave from the ocean. I slightly chewed and swallowed, I LOVED IT!  The next Oyster I ate, I put some of the vinegar sauce on it, as well as some cocktail and horseradish, and a splash of lemon juice.  This oyster was slightly bigger and different than the one I had prior, I think this was from the east coast.  Anyway, I shucked it, chewed it, and swallowed.  This was so delicious, It was almost like tasting the sea breeze, and the after taste was of melon. Kind of like the taste of a watermelon rind. I was shocked to have tasted this, because I wasn't sure my taste buds were to detect it.  For dinner I  ordered the 16 oz Prime Strip.  My friends ordered one 16 oz Lobster, and the fish of the day which was Flounder.  As for the sides: Lobster Macaroni and Cheese, Potatoes Au Gratin, and Asparagus.  The waitstaff serve you each individually asking if you would like each side, and they place the sides on your plate at the table.  They melt the butter for your lobster at the table as well.  The prime strip melted in my mouth, so tender and juicy, I didn't need any sauces or anything, It was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The waitstaff waited for us to take the first bite and asked if everything was prepared to our liking before leaving the table.  The side dishes were out of this world! My favorite was the lobster macaroni and cheese.  It was so delicate and delicious.  The flavors all combined perfectly and was unlike any other macaroni and cheese I had eaten before.  The asparagus was crunchy and fresh, lightly salted with almonds and olive oil.  The potatoes au gratin were cheesy and creamy, definitely one of the best sides to have with a nice juicy steak.  I tasted my friends flounder with couscous, it was so fresh and flaked off in your mouth like it was meant to be there all along.  You cannot forget the mouth watering Lobster tail that my other friend had.  So juicy and meaty. The butter paired with it so well, it was like a velvety blanket of love.  For dessert the brought out a 7 layer lemon cake for my birthday! The most moist cake I have ever eaten. My taste buds were in heaven and I couldn't believe all the wonderful things I was tasting!  I cannot wait to go back to Del Frisco's again!  BTW order a lemon drop martini, they are amazing there.

JQMfQnOtXDpdNH4hlaCSXA.text: Vegas isn't Vegas without having a piece of meat. You know what I'm saying, steak! Dirty minded people! I knew what you were thinking. This location is located off the strip a few blocks from the Wynn. Del Frisco's is part of a restaurant group located around the country. Though this Las Vegas location is nice, their Manhattan restaurant has no comparison. Like most steakhouses, this resturant is lighted dimmed with wood panelled walls and vaulted ceilings. A bar area is accompanied by a piano man signing and playing classic R & B tunes from the early 80's which gives this place a great setting for dinner.  We ordered drinks and a bottle of wine. They sold us on ordering a pitcher of pineapple infused vodka they called The VIP which was $60. I suggest trying it first individually, unless you really like it. The vodka they used was Svedka which I later found out is $10/bottle vodka which is "not so VIP".  I ordered a Del Frisco salad wich came with thick smoked bacon. That was delicious. For the main course, I ordered the 8oz filled served medium rare with lump crab cake. Truffle butter was served over a warming candle for dipping. Steak was perfect and the crab cake was memorable. For sides, we shared cream corn, cream spinach, and mushrooms which were all fairly good. The house potatoes were just okay. Dessert was good to but nothing outstanding or extra-ordinary. I had the chocolate soufle with vanila ice cream.  I came out of the restaurant ready to explode. The steak quality here is very good.  Service like at most Vegas restaurants was outstanding. I look forward to come back again to enjoy a piece of meat in Vegas. I meant STEAK!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate soufle with vanila ice cream. Good, not great. Baked perfectly, not overcooked.

bbM9AJVBuDUYpl5eh2i2WA.text: I want to start out by saying that this place has the best customer service.  They really take care of you here and make you feel special.  Treating the customer well is a dying art and these guys are top notch.  I have been here 3 times now and each time I have had a pleasant experience.  I used to go to Carnevino, but they are hit and miss with their service.      The first time I came here, it was because I couldn't make a reservation for one at Carnevino.  I looked for another steak house and came across this place.  I am sure glad I found this place.  I was treated very well and the food was outstanding. I don't remember the server's name, but he treated me as if I was his friend.  The friendliness and good food made me feel like I couldn't wait to visit again.  The second time I ate here was in August 2016 for my birthday.  I suggested this place to my bros and they were willing to try it.  When we made the reservations, we included in the notes that we were celebrating a birthday.  As we got sat to our table they gave me a birthday card signed by some of the staff.  Throughout the night I was wished a happy birthday from others on the staff.  We had the best service from Jason and Gavin.  They were like the dynamic duo (they can fight over who was Batman and who was Robin, lol).  They were very attentive to us and knowledgeable of everything.  They also treated us like we were all friends.  They made some awesome suggestions too.  They really make you feel welcomed there.  I wish more places or people were like that.  The third time I ate here was in October 2016.  My wife and I came to celebrate our 6th wedding anniversary, our son also joined us.  When I made reservations I included in the notes that we were celebrating an anniversary.  As we were sat down at our table, we got a card wishing us a happy anniversary signed by some of the staff members.  We were sat in the old cigar room, back when they allowed smoking in an eating establishment.  They still have a humidor and you can still buy cigars.  The cigar prices are very reasonable.  Our server Gavin walked up and immediately recognized me from the last time I was there.  He said, "Hey don't I know you?"  I told him that I was there two months ago and he said he remembered that.  He also remembered what I ordered.  That in itself was amazing to me, to remember me and what I ordered 2 months later.   Then Jason walked in and he said the same thing.  These two guys are amazing and awesome people.  They took good care of us and was again attentive and knowledgeable.  The way we were treated by them, in itself is a reason I would come back here.  I have had two different cuts of steak out of the three times I have been here.  I had the Wagyu Tomahawk Chop 32 oz twice.  Both times my steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  Anyone who gets a steak cooked past medium, might as well go get a diner steak.  At that point they all taste the same.  I had my steak accompanied by their truffle butter.  They use a candle underneath to make sure the butter is melted throughout your meal.  Although the steak does not need the butter, it really complimented it.  I have been to many steak houses and this by far has been one of the best.  I also had the Bone-In Ribeye 22 oz and of course, it was just as good.   Based on the amazing service I have had here, I will keep coming back.  The awesome food was icing on the cake.  They have valet parking, but you might as well park yourself.  They have a bar and someone who plays piano.  Everyone here is very friendly and make it worth coming here.

VnTseA_KfJpwhSZZQtQ2ZA.text: This has got to be one of the best steakhouses that I have tried. Came here on a Thursday and the place was packed. Lucky for us we made reservations the night before.   I ordered the 16oz bone in ribeye steak and ask for medium rare. While the wife ask for the beef medallions. Started with the free bread which was a sesame white loaf. It was nice and soft and warm.   When the entrees came out they had me cut the steak to make sure it was done right and it was perfect. The steak was so tender when I tasted it and also very flavorful. My wife beef medallions in her words was marvelous. Hadn't tasted any beef this good.   For dessert we had the five layer cake which was a huge slice. And it went perfect with my coffee. Service was great and the ambience was very relaxing.   If your looking for a great steak in Vegas.  This is the place to go.
