Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2lnQ9r4ZSTg9nyWmB2BvYw.text: Read! Great food but two severely disappointing things when dropping 600 dollars for 5 people on dinner. All 5 of us ordered steaks. 4 of those steaks came out as ordered. One of them was ordered a prime aged ribeye and was served a prime strip steak and when asked to switch to a ribeye the server insisted it was correct. We had a ribeye on the table to compare it with and from experience knew it wasn't a ribeye. The second thing was spending 170 dollars on two lobster tails that were tough and not fresh. 600 is way to much to spend for not getting correct food delivered.

dwnb5sYXK9A9vXMLsnD-GA.text: First class steak house! We come here every single time we are in Las Vegas and it always feels like home. Get the Waygu Tomahawk and call it a day. Five star service and food!!!

tNoR33UtwMNRlaTW9O2ygw.text: Love everything a about this place....I am not sure where to start.  The food is great, the service is great, the location and parking were great! It's a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.  Can't wait to go back.

RW3q9lXcHssMQURlBLzSYw.text: Had dinner there tonight.. never disappoints.. Zane and his crew was awesome.. had the wedge salad so good.. then rib eye rare plus and it was even better than the first time. For dessert had lemon cake all I have to say is awesome.. I will be back soon I promise...

1jhH51bJNmYYTSt1cEt_Xw.text: Thank you, Yelpers, for your awesome reviews and helping us to figure out where we were eating for my birthday on a Saturday night!  SIde note: The $$$$ is not accurate. Guy Savoie and Ruth's Chris are a $$$$, Del Frisco's is more like a $$$. I was prepared to be overwhelmed by the prices but the menu is very reasonable, especially considering the high quality and portions of the food.  Del Frisco's is a steakhouse located off the strip but conveniently located within minutes of the strip hotels. We made our reservation through Yelp and were seated as soon as we arrived. The hostesses and servers are friendly and a nice change from some of the staff who work in LV. Del Frisco's is classy without being pretentious.  We started off with the Crab Cake in cajun lobster sauce and let me just tell you that you have to have one!  The crab is fresh and free of that fishy taste that you sometimes get in other restaurants (yeah, I'm talking about you, Bouchon!). The cajun sauce is liquid heaven and I raved about it so much that our server, Travis, was so sweet and brought us a ramekin of it to dip our bread in.  Next we had a Caesar Salad and a Chopped Salad. They were average but tasty.  In order to save room for dessert we split their off menu Trio of Filet's. These were delicious! You get three 4 oz filets, each prepared a different way. The first is Oscar-style and has lump crab with bernaise sauce. The second was served with scallops and shrimp. The third filet was served with melted brie cheese on top. So yummy! All were cooked perfectly with a lovely sear on the outside but melt in your mouth delicious on the inside.  For our sides we ordered the Lobster mac n cheese and the Green Beans. I'm so sad that we weren't going right back to our hotel or we would have taken the leftovers home. The mac n cheese was cheesy heaven!  Since it was my birthday they brought us a GIANT slice of their New Orleans-style lemon cake. Sweet, moist and delicious!    The service was friendly and they were so good about keeping our water glasses filled and brought us fresh, hot bread as soon as we finished the first loaf. Our server, Travis, was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped us navigate through our different options. We were very happy with all of the food and their unique ways of preparing it.   The valet staff arranged for a taxi to take us clubbing so it was a great experience all the way around!  Del Frisco's, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The VIP

f9ncQIjbXUufO7n8imXQHg.text: This is the real deal.  Excellent food, professional servers and decor that oozes opulence but is warm and welcoming at the same time. A perfect place to entertain important clients since they will leave feeling like they are special! I ate here during my last 2 CES shows, and will be back next year as well.  Well done!

7ZS3tno6w_s8x8bugkbSxg.text: the best steak i've had!  i shared a porterhouse with my friend and it was awesome.  loved every second of it.  their VIP drink (vodka and pineapple) is also quite tasty.  great taste and strong!

aM698BFlqxFYHBcAgP795A.text: Forget every steak house in Vegas---this is THE place ---best food--best service--best ambiance.  Do not go anywhere else!!!

yR0JhZavcsYHWCJGaAQq-w.text: living in las vegas we have so many great places to eat so this place could be just another expensive steak house but that is not the case. the president of my company came to town and when the conversation of dinner came up i suggested we try this place and he agreed saying he had been before to one in California. we went early on a week night so there was no reservation needed and no wait when we walked in. at the hostesses booth we were greeted with a very nice girl that immediately started joking with us. i thought this is kind of interesting for a fancy place but i went with it. when we got seated the waitress showed up and started to run down the menu with us. she was a tall girl and dressed pretty racy with mini skirt and fishnets i also thought this was interesting for a fancy place, even better this girl was HILARIOUS!! i left out she was pregnant and kind of had an Elvira kind of thing going on. when i eat at a fancy place i am always wanting the food to be top notch and the food here is very good but the experience made this meal. i had a bone in fillet (duh! eat read meat here!! don't ask how the lamb is, this is a steak house!!) and it was melt in your mouth good, all the sides we ordered were up to par so the meal was great. i have only been here once so i don't know if the humor is their standard montra but for everyone who does go i hope it is.

uzNZFtoVLpxyLkrRwTZfMw.text: great place, the steak was something else, i went with the filet, ofcourse i got medium rare, me and my buddies are sure to go there atleast once a month. definitely a winner

D3W4wBtFIXyZivKRqsKbEQ.text: What a wonderful experience my family and I had at Del Frisco's.  We were in Las Vegas for a celebration and went to another local supposedly top notch restaurant in town.  After the 5th person in our family ordered a steak, the waitress told us that "oh, I forgot--we are out of steaks tonight".  Out of steaks??  So we called Del Frisco's who said if you can be here by 11PM, we will take care of you.  Well, the 8 of us got to Del Frisco's with about 7 minutes to spare.  I have to say it was the most wonderful time my family has ever had.  The people who waited on us never rushed us, and we were there until 2:30 in the morning.  The food was outstanding; steaks melted in our mouths and the sides were ordered were perfection.  The manager treated each of us to sample each of the desserts they had that night.  The James Bond table was great!  Our custom made bar now has the saying that Del Frisco's has on their bar "Do right and fear no man".  My family still talks about the wonderful time; service and food we had at Del Frisco's.  Expensive--yes but well worth the price. I would recommend this steak house to anybody wanting a great experience.

dEKHbiubpR45s0W8ysvbXQ.text: Was in Vegas this past weekend for a girlfriend's bacherloette party.  She wanted have a nice dinner so one of the girls planned and reserved Friday night at this steakhouse for the 7 of us.  We actually arrived 1/2 an hour late, but called them and they were ok with it.  Once we arrived, we were seated immediately and the hostess was so gracious and professional.   Once we were seated, we ordered a pitcher of their special drink (vodka infused with pineapple juice), really good and I would definitely recommend this. Steaks are usually too big for me since I'm small so I decided to split with my sister and we all shared different sides.  We ordered: - Porterhouse - medium rare - this was so delicious and the cut and cook was perfect for the both of us to share.  It was tender and juicy and one of my favorite cuts now.  - mushrooms - really juicy and enough to share for the 7 of us, they brought out extras just in case - creamed spinach - this was my least favorite, it was a bit on the salty side so I barely touched it - broccoli - this was simple steamed broccoli with butter - mashed potatoes - this was my favorite side, it was so good that I couldn't stop eating it.  We all loved it.  We had so much fun and enjoyed our food here.  The ambiance is wonderful and the staff was a lot of fun and made us feel welcomed.  I heard they are opening one in Irvine, CA, so I will try that location the next time I come visit.

BLG7b8Mt18hOu8dVPKimmA.text: BEST STEAKHOUSE EVER.  Man, I thought Ruth's Chris was great... THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.  I mean, everything looked great. I ordered the 22oz bone-in rib-eye. IT WAS PHENOMENAL! It was so tasty, tender, and juicy.  My boyfriend ordered some seafood platter thing. He really enjoyed it. I'm actually surprised he finished it. There was so much seafood!   And the table next to ours ordered the onion rings...I need to know what kind of onions those were from. Those rings were huge! I mean, probably the size of my neck! They were like genetically altered or something. Maybe they were on steroids?  Like dessert? Try their white chocolate creme brulee and strawberry romanoff :) delicious.   Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm most definitely eating here. That's all I could think about when we got back home from our trip!!! DEL FRISCO'S STEAK, I NEED YOU!!!!!!! :) drool.

J7bIu_W_lDYVWlB1lXYHTw.text: MOST AMAZING STEAKHOUSE EVER!  Yup, it's True! Del Frisco's is an amazing steakhouse!! They're located off the strip, but it's only about a five minute drive by taxi and is well worth the trip and the money spent to get to this restaurant.    Our party of eight was seated in what seemed like our own private room. We were tucked away in the corner and we couldn't even hear the people at the table closest to us. Score!!  Service here is spot on. Our server was very friendly and helpful. She recommended certain foods and was attentive to our needs and wants for our meal, both food and drink. The staff who brought out our food and the bartenders were also amazing as well. I love how they worked as a team to make sure that all the people in our party were taken care of and got what they needed.   I ordered the Filet Mignon. It was PERFECT. So good!! I'd highly recommend this steak. As a table, we ordered some sides as well. I tried the Lobster Mac N Cheese (AMAZING!!) and the Mushrooms (so GOOD). The rest of my table seemed to love their meals as well.   For drinks, we all got a shot of Fireball Whiskey (strong, but good). I got a Margaritini, which is a combination of a Martini and a Margarita. Sounds weird, but it works and I really enjoyed it. As a table, we also ordered a couple bottles of wine. Apparently they weren't very good. But, I had a few drinks in me by the time I got to the wine, so it seemed fine to me.   For a party of eight, the total came to close to $900 with tax and tip. The restaurant did comp the two bottles of wine for us since they weren't very good. If the wine was added, it would have been a little over a grand. Not too bad considering all the food and alcohol we ordered for the amount of people at our table.   Come try Del Frisco's next time you're in Vegas. It won't disappoint.   Cheers!

eSEJah8DOQHKb9soxk3ikg.text: Always a solid choice.  Being a local, there are many choices for steakhouses in Vegas.  This one is undoubtedly the best, their meat is the finest, their ambience is second only to Top of the World, and their service is unparalleled.    One time I even mentioned to the waiter than I liked the jellybeans at the front (specifically the yellow and orange ones) and he went and picked out a cup of yellow and orange jelly beans for me.   Last time, the waiter introduced my girlfriend to a fine Moscato that she loved.  It's the little things that make a good memory.    Always a great experience at Del Fresco.  Worth the extremely expensive price tag.

QWGCDYBkXRAnlYiFbsN_Ow.text: Walked in after a show and enjoyed a great experience. The entire staff were friendly and our server Carly was fantastic -great personality! If you are not on a time constraint take time to enjoy a cocktail before dinner. The Manhattan and bourbon berry ginger beer cocktail were spot on. If you like crab cakes, the appetizer with Cajun lobster sauce added the right amount of spice & flavor to a seafood favorite.  We enjoyed the 32 oz tomahawk chop & filet trio -which were well cooked and seasoned. The tomahawk was perfectly seared. There were big chunks of lobster in the lobster mac & cheese -delicious! Oh and if you are a True meat connoisseur the bone marrow butter is not to be missed. If you have room for dessert the lemon cake and espresso martini will complete the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac &amp; cheese -well about half since the other half was on our plates!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tomahawk!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow butter

pUt8fFF0eCiZ0Hqy_5eKzw.text: Phenomenal Steaks. There is a reason why of all the places in vegas.. this one pops up first on Yelp. It really is as good as everyone says it is.  I had the bone in rib eye. super succulent.   service here is very fast & attentive. I think i had about 4 or 5 different people to meet, greet & wait on my table.  5 stars.  (will update more later)

WiRwhsW_NPOPYEdbO2eZzA.text: went here for a business dinner and loved it.  excellent meal!  ok, let's start with cocktails.  they make a drink called the VIP, which is vodka infused with pineapple.  o m g.  it's amazing.  sooooooo good!! i would go back just because of it.  seriously. try it.  not at all what i was expecting.  it doesn't taste strong, but yowza it packs a punch.  good stuff!  moving on to actual food.  onion rings.  i'm not an onion ring lover (don't dislike them either), but wow, these are incredible.  so well seasoned, and they don't taste like onion at all.  hard to describe, but really... they're pretty great.  i hear the fried oysters are to die for, but i'm not an oyster lover, so didn't try them (but my group ordered a second round - they were i guess THAT good).  steak, i went ribeye.  delicious and tender.  excellent.  dessert.  hard to even imagine after all that other food, but yeah, we went for it.  i tasted the lemon cake.  very light and enjoyable.  it all looked fantastic.

tZ4-enaYw1j6Y3MfpVPmuQ.text: Overrated and likely living on it's reputation.  My wife and I were excited to dine at the "legendary" Double Eagle, we'd heard so much about the place. Sadly that didn't happen and likely will not. We arrived a little early for our reservation only to turn around within a few minutes of looking over the interior and left for a competing steakhouse in a nearby casino. We were so underwhelmed, the interior seemed dingy, somewhat noisy and not anywhere near as welcoming and comfortable as you'd expect a highly rated steakhouse to be. The worst part about this experience is that it began before we opened the door, the valet didn't say a word to us and as we approached the main door a strong sewage smell assaulted the senses. Not what one wants to smell when heading in for a bite to eat.  Because we left, clearly we did not dine so I cannot say much about the food other than we've had the opportunity to dine a couple of times at a Del Frisco's near us in Southern California and food there has been consistently excellent and the service quite good. Hopefully the Double Eagle was just having a bad day but sadly it left a lasting poor impression with us and it's likely we won't return.

awUy83doxvsxFZZdYJusLA.text: This is a typical "old school" steakhouse with a modern menu.  The bar was very nice and they pour good strong drinks.  I recommend the Moscow Mule with Jameson.  We were seated in a very loud room.  I realize this is Las Vegas but it was ridiculous. I think if we had told them we wanted to have a more quiet room from the start they would have seated us differently.    Our server was efficient and very friendly. The wine steward spent a good amount of time with us and really helped us pick a great wine. The seafood tower was very good. We ordered 2 because there were 4 of us and everyone had plenty.  We did notice that, while delicious, the crab tasted frozen.  Ok its the desert not Alaska we get it.  Our steaks were delicious and the sides were huge. Enough to share. We had buttercake for desert which was great and of course we shared it. Even the coffee was good.  So you may wonder why not a "5 star" rating.  Well, one of the steaks (rib eye) came out and it was shaped like a rib eye except for a very large triangular piece had been cut from the edge of part of the steak.  It made the steak look very unappealing and sort of like it was had a problem area and thats why it had been trimmed.  It also was sort of dry looking.  When questioned the server stated she thought it might have been marbling that had melted during cooking but if we didn't want it she would replace it.  Which they did and I must say they did it rapidly and they brought out a lovely piece of steak on the second try.  My issue is that a restaurant that prides themselves on service and quality should have never placed that odd steak in front of a customer...from the cook to the server they knew it was weird and should have sent it back.  If that had happened they would have gotten their "5".  Maybe next time.  Hope you enjoy the James Bond Wine table if you go!!

_s8x6XZyhjWZ19Ztm7ZsOw.text: So am I crazy that I just ate at Rao's a top notch Resturant with many great desserts  and now right after my dinner I'm at Del Frisco's to get their 6 layer lemon cake. This cake is so GREAT that my wife sent my assistant on a plane to get a cake for a surprise birthday party she threw for me. So I'm here and we got 4 pieces just for the 4 of us, I'm thinking about grabbing a cake to take home, thoughts? If you just kind of like Lemon cake you will be in LOVE!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here it is, the lemon cake of all lemon cakes!

zMrLLdzs6bIeKOpG4y5cIQ.text: Everything about it was fantastic! From the hostess, to the bartender, to our server and the servers assistant. The food was worth every penny and especially that lemon came for dessert. Big enough for several people but the two of is shared it :3 The delicious jelly beans at the front door gave it that extra special touch. I'll be back!

aU69S81sC9c1sc0Mz2jBgg.text: Service is phenomenal! Their food is delish but I've fallen for their lobster Mac n cheese and I can't get up!! Once you're done with dinner, I recommend checking out their James Bond table!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscato d&#39;asti. Very light and very sweet.

c5UILP7OqpzmAJnyh7G7qw.text: Del Frisco is the sh*t for steak in Vegas.  Two words...wagyu steak.    Food that I tried: Tuna tartar. Very good. Think of ceviche with steak and add little bits of egg white.  32 oz wagyu steak on the bone.  Holy crap this was big and so good.   Lobster Mac and cheese.  Ditto   Sauteed mushrooms.  Good. As expected.   Lemon cake. Ok.   Wine.  Try the Robert Foley Robert Griffin California Red.  2009.  Very good and smooth.   Service. Exceptional.  Ask for Jeff.   Vanilla and truffle cigar. Enjoyable.   James Bond table. Impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 32 oz wagyu ribeye steak on the bone.

Ci4fY3nwuq5gLssAKERSwA.text: This time around, we were seated next to the bar. They had a piano guy playing and while it wasn't quiet, it was nice. I was afraid we were in trouble when we pulled up to see three party busses for bachelor parties outside the front door. They were apparently isolated to the private rooms because we didn't hear them at all (or we couldn't hear them over the other people yelling in the restaurant.)  I don't know how they manage to draw the delinquents to this place but it seems like every drunken rowdy idiot in Vegas eats here! Fortunately, the food is so good that it's worth enduring such bad behavior!  This is the last place I would go for a romantic dinner but if you want to get crazy drunk, an excellent steak and top notch service, this is the place to go.

1QE53PhTnpjIMJbrWlOfBw.text: The strip is good and all, but sometimes want to get away from that area and have a nice dinner? This is a perfect place! Waiters were excellent. Food was amazing. Specially steak was done perfectly! Very juicy and soft. Can recommend to anyone!

uN0pLNLYp1U1URSYTlZ1hg.text: Sorry this is not the best steak out there , not good enough to deserve 4.5 stars . Id give it 3.5 because its better than average but take off half a star because their mashed potatoes "chateau potatoes " are pretty flavorless and they charge for things like steak sauce . When you're paying $79 for a steak you Don't need to be gouged $4 for peppercorn steak sauce (although it was good ) . The VIP martini infused with pineapple was awesome though, as was their lemon cake . Their scallops weren't as good as I've had in the Bay Area at 5a5, but their crab cake was great . You will have a good meal here but if spending $200+ I expect a great meal, not just a good one.

Rx73hddYgt63y-yEdx_4SA.text: I'd give this place a solid 4.5 stars.  We started with the lobster bisque.  The price was high, but the flavor totally met my expectations, and there was a lot of lobster meat in there.  The Caesar salad was good, but I've had better.  The filets were absolutely fantastic!  The scallops and crab cake were perfect.  I ordered mashed potatoes with my steak and they were some of the best I've ever had.  The service was great too.  I felt like I really got my money's worth and walked away very happy.  My only real complaint was the bread on the table.  It was like a stale, store bought sesame seed hamburger bun.  Up your bread game Del Frisco's and you will be perfect!

A4sLlCM3132zr5C_i9XwAw.text: This place is the best! Every time I am in Vegas, I have dinner here at least once if not twice.  The food is fantastic and the service is amazing.  Great martinis, wedge salad, awesome side dishes and the Bone in Rib eye is incredible.  If you have a big appetite and are not afraid of the $90 cost, the Tomahawk Rib eye  is well worth it.

FaJv7ScJsBtnGNYF21foqQ.text: I have been eating at this place for 5 years I come in to get lobster Mac and a drink before going to work at midnight and as soon as I walk in the manager woman tells me in front of everyone my shirt is inappropriate (crop top) so ok I get a jacket then she says to me when I walk back in "you need to keep it completely covered up or u can't be here" rude as fuck... I'm at the bar and what do you know a woman who is barely wearing clothes is allowed to wear what she's wearing so now I feel targeted and why who knows.. I use the bathroom the manager woman stalks me to the bathroom and waits for me to go .. a friend buys me a drink I eat than some random guys ask me if I'd join them at their table and they would get me a drink .. I was waiting on my mom to arrive so she could have a drink before we headed home. My mom shows up the guys but us both a drink and I go to the bathroom the manager lady stalks me again to the restroom this time my mother notices . The lady then tells me loudly in front of all guests I need to put my jacket on and I'm banned because I solicit her customers.. (mind u I'm w my mom or hubby or kids almost every time I'm there and I won't refuse a free drink if offered) (yes on occasion I've given someone too drunk a ride still does not mean I'm doing anything wrong nor does she have a right to judge nor assume and that's defamation of character. She tries to tell me I show porn at the bar( being a porn star and someone recognized u and walk up and say hey isn't this u isn't a crime nor is it soliciting nor does it mean I'm doing anything wrong once again) because this woman tried to embarrass me and told me I was trying to pick up this guy to go fuck him her words my mom started saying wait a minute she got free drinks and ur saying she's doing this . I asked the guy who was disgusted at how I was being treated if I was picking him up he said no u have a husband but we're having a drink nothing wrong w that then she goes on to tell the customers her assumptions on me in the past.. but where is there solid proof I'm doing anything other than socializing hanging with fans saying yes I'm a porn star or receiving a free drink. I bring ppl there all the time family n friends when they come to town. Ron is always my bartender and his wife danced with me at the strip club. Just because I'm friendly doesn't mean I'm doing anything. So it escalated and she threatened me with cops and kept pushing me physically to the point I almost hit her and told her don't fucking touch me the valet guy has known me for years everyone there knows I come I eat n I leave it's a restaurant anything other than that is not her business nor concern I'm not conducting anything illegal on the premises she's in charge of I felt targeted and my lawyer is now dealing with it . I'll never eat there and I'm a bring all the pornstars to go protest this place idk what her problem is but she's not a good manager chasing away someone who for years spends 2-500$ a week there.

0fuEAgG191_WycQHmPpdQw.text: You can't go wrong with this fine Texas steakhouse! Del Frisco's is by far one of my favorite restaurant in Ft Worth, and Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome cocktails!

iFvAgk4VSOwk4hdF2yaKqw.text: Ease of access : Excellent, we were looking for a top notch SH that we could get into on a Sunday Night. We found a good reservation time for the two of us. We were asked if there were any special requests for seatings on the phone!  Big win right there.  Presentation: The hostess was polite and gracious. We were seated quickly and in a great area. They had the football game on! Score!  Menu: Perfect and we were surprised by their Sunday night couple special. Killer.  Service. Outstanding.Period. No details needed. If you understand fine dining you understand what is expected regarding service, it does not need to be defined.  Food. Steak like butter and tasty, crab cakes, best ever, salad was off the hook. The spinach supreme was so good my bro who doesn't like anything green even thought it was good.  Beer: Dogfish 60 minute IPA...need I say more  Price: Well, when you decide to seek out the best steak houses in town you don't ask cost! But even that being said, on par with the best in their league.  Overall: I'm sure Stripsteak and many others are great in Vegas, but being a SH fan, I could find NO reason why this SH didn't take number one.   Let's see if NYCs location can hold up!   J$

m97eC5rMXzmwVVxIHKeRRA.text: This place consistently delivers.  Great service and good food.  I was impressed when the waiter didn't comment (good or bad) when one of our party requested a small fillet well done. Excellent sides. The down side is that it's a bit out of the way and  the atmosphere was  marred by several tables of young men acting like they were at a fraternity bar rather than a fine dining establishment to the point  that several diners complained to staff without avail.

yyOf5Pb472HHAjfI0nP3lA.text: Favorite place to eat of all time.  Crab cakes, chopped salad, mac and cheese, steak...everything is beyond excellent.  This place also offers 5-star service.

zmoy4UGy--BF7MBRrs4lsA.text: Fantastic! The chopped salad was great, filet trio was amazing. Good wine list, tasty cocktails.  Great service from Ryan, perfect blend of attentive & not bothersome. Wonderful dining experience.

LjoAM-qT5rFyOe5quw9q9g.text: wow. del frisco's was simply amazing. six of us split 3 orders of their wagyu bone in steak. it was so thick and topped with a salty, peppery crust. looking at the meat reminded me of ahi tuna, and the meat melted in your mouth. my meal the next day just couldn't compare.  we also had the crab cakes, lobster mac and creamed spinach with bacon....  Tony was one awesome waiter. he was very engaged, laid back to talk to, and accommodated our strange requests.  great evening, great times. will come again.

z-PXwcq7UpCAPMy_uaQyZw.text: I am a prime beef steakhouse lover! I consider myself an expert in the craft. I have had them all. Flemings, Mortons, Donovans, Ruth Chris ehhh. None compare to Del Friscos! The portions are huge and tasty! The quality of the beef and the atmosphere are second to none! Whenever I stay at the Hard Rock, I make it a point to dine here?By far the best service!

Y03LqFa_VrEupE1PvsyWSg.text: I was a little disappointed. A lot of people told me this was the best steakhouse in Vegas. It wasn't, at least in my opinion. The food wasn't bad, but I was expecting more. The rib-eye was OK and the sides were boring and bland. Also the atmosphere was off. I just didn't get the feel that I was in a high end steakhouse. One plus was the service. The wait staff was very good. With so many other outstanding steakhouses in Vegas I doubt I'll be returning to Del Frisco's anytime soon.

uYPT80R5eEJQWJNygjXyhg.text: Brought some VERY special wine for a very special occasion. The server tells me "we do not offer corkage." What? An upscale steak house that doesn't offer corkage? Only the second time in my life I've been refused corkage.  Sure it's my fault for not checking in advance, but in this era of upscale, wine-centric restaurants, refusing corkage is almost unheard of. Will never return to Del Frisco's unless they change their policy.

ZkotIIUteBaK6b7dz6-s6Q.text: Four for dinner. 2nd time here in about a year. Probably wont cone back here Voluntarily. The oso buco was average. The Cod special was ok; Cod was really pungent and if it wasn't for the micro greens salad, it would have been unbearable. But the stone crab was delicious. Lobster Mac and cheese was just as good as I remembered it from last time. Service was average but not exceptional. We sat with empty waters and dirty dishes. No food/flavor check from anyone except from our main server.

iwgNCtwN2DkzLrFfa83ejw.text: i love this place! the service was AMAZING! they really wait on your hands and feet! never had service better than this place! gave the waiter a very nice tip too :)  the steak really melts in your mouth and i don't remember too much about the side dish. but 5 stars to the SERVICE! AMAZING! :)

j4OY_MUWpSBADH_OmWomiA.text: dude. pricey. but well worth it.   in the heart of the financial district.. which i've never ever seen before. the service was the business.  like 4 ppl wait on you..    my rib eye steak was a a little burned on the outside.. but still tender and non-chewy. it was perfect!    the sides. the shit.  yams and sweet potato mashed potatoes.  yeah.    if u got the ends, definitely try it!

qRpDxEoLCU4NgcjGESpKsw.text: Hands down the best all around meal I have ever eaten out. Bone in ribeye was cooked to perfection and very flavorful. My wife had the filet which was also perfect. Both steaks could be cut with a fork!  Crab cake appetizer was awesome....all crab and no breading. Our party of 4 had several sides, all of which were great. Service was also exceptional. Can't wait to go back!!

nPP4y3XsfsllCi6zApdoiw.text: My absolute favorite steak anywhere! My wife isn't a meat fan and still raves about their bone-in ribeye. Nice atmosphere in a very old school steakhouse environment. My only complaint is just a common one these days and that is no place has old school waiters who treat their jobs like the profession it really is. When a waiter is a skilled and respectable pro...your meal shines!

UfKBOoe0-H84HiJOABa5kg.text: Tonight we celebrated our mother's 73rd birthday at Del Frisco's, and what a celebration it was! The food was out-of-this-world; the portions, huge; and the service, divine! (Ask for Shawn. He knows how to treat his guests.) We had the power-couple dinners and couldn't finish everything. SO good! We'll be back.

DTZRQzHQmMaqaq4bYdzTqQ.text: This is by far the most impressive steak house that I have ever been to. It's off the strip but if you're visiting Vegas, take a cab there. You will not be disapointted. Try the VIP which is an extremely tasty pineapple infused martini, it will run you about twelve bucks. We went on a Saturday night and there was an awesome piano player setting the tone with some Christmas tunes. They are very good at making sure that if you have a show to get to, that you're out in time. The service is swift. They ask you to cut into your steak when it arrives to make sure that they have cooked it to the appropriate temperature. The wine list is obscene, we saw some bottles listed for $15,000. No, thanks. The bread was freshly baked and extremely tasty. This place is soooo worth the money. Go there now. Be sure to make a reservation though.

H2njJmoIpenBBbERAHnZkg.text: You just can't go wrong at this place.  The Rib Eye is to die for and the lobster Mac and Cheese is wonderful.  You are paying a lot for the food. Be prepared to drop some cash but I personally think it is worth it.

OXxyGh1LTO0CIRjW5yo10Q.text: Booked this highly reviewed steakhouse for my 40th birthday. Greeted at the door and taken to the dining room to the right. From what we were told that side of the strip has sewer problems when it gets very hot and it was 112 degrees the day we were there. The place smelled like a toilet. Bottom line is to be seated in the dining room to the left or by the bar. They moved us no problem and that was when the magic began. Drinks were promptly served, great bread delivered and specials were recited. I opted for the bone in filet with the crab cake side. It was great. Go to this place and don't look back just ask to be in the dining room to the left.

QEoasXucO3S65V_B8LljlQ.text: Based on Yelp reviews, I decided to reserve a table here for my friend's bachelor party. Decor wise, it was definitely a more fancy/upscale kind of restaurant. The other clientele also seemed to skew towards an older crowd compared to what you might find at one of the trendy new hotel restaurants on the strip. I felt a little under dressed in my polo and dark jeans. I did see a couple who looked even more dressed down than myself so I don't think they really enforce any kind of dress code. Just to be safe, I probably wouldn't come in sweatpants, shorts, or sandals though.  We had a party of twelve so we were seated in one of the side rooms. I was a little surprised that they had multiple flat screen TVs in the rooms as you don't normally see those at fancy restaurants unless its at the bar. They can be a little distracting if you are trying to have a conversation. Then again, we were a party of 12 dudes and the hostesses probably thought it was appropriate for our "type" of party.  The service was excellent as we had multiple servers answering our questions, cutting our steaks, serving our family-style sides, etc. A friend of mine had ordered salmon that came out overcooked. They replaced his meal no questions asked.  I think that all of my friends would agree that the crab cakes and the lobster mac and cheese were the highlights and are the must order items on the menu. Those things were delicious. All of our meat entries were good but nothing really special to write home about considering the cost. Then again I'm not really a steak guy so I'm not really the best person to judge the quality of a piece of meat.  On the drive to the restaurant we did notice the slight sewage smell that some Yelpers have mentioned. However, we did not pick up this scent while inside the restaurant nor while out front by the entrance and parking lot.

KT5ckDlrqceNMQeIe1BYCg.text: Get the filet mignon, its better than the bone in rib eye. Also get the mango souffle for dessert  its  best part of the dinner.

6JKwRc_6CbXU_24OznUHUQ.text: Every time my bf and I are in vegas we visit Del Frisco's. It's good and quick. This time was a little different. The service was still great but the food didn't impress me. The crab cakes were very delicious but our shrimps were served cold. We thought they were hot shrimps, but they only serve cold shrimps. We had a couple of bites and left them untouched. For my main course I ordered the Australian lobster tail. It was a pretty good size but I think it was overcooked. The meat was too rubbery. Thank god for the crab cakes. I would have been unsatisfied. I had a bite of my boyfriends 38oz fred flinstone wagyu beef steak. I wasn't to happy with it. He seemed to like it. I guess I have lost my desire for red meat. They brought out a slice of bday cake for my boyfriends birthday. It was delicious and thick. Oh! If you ever eat here ask to see the cool James Bond table. Pretty coool.

iUYb2VL6nPJCnuoSRBzfmA.text: After looking at tONS of different restaurants,  my friends and I decided to go to del Frisco's to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was an amazing experience!   First of all the staff was SUPERB. I was given a birthday card the moment we walked in the door.  Multiple people passed by the table to wish me happy birthday.   Our waiter, Chad, was amazing and gave us wonderful recommendations. We had the bacon au poivre. It was pork belly and it was incredible.  It had such a great smoky flavor.   We got 2 steaks so we could do a side by side comparison of the dry aged and the regular.  They were so delicious!  For the dessert,  del Frisco's bright us 2 complimentary desserts for my birthday.  The butter cake was a once in a lifetime dessert. It was so good that I did a little dance in my seat after the first bite! My friends and I are experienced bakers,  and we all loved it so much.  So much so that we went back the next night for round 2.  We walked in and the hostess said,  "Stephanie, right?"  The customer service was amazing. The food was "slap your mama" good.  The butter cake was one of the BEST desserts I have EVER had.   Spread the word - GET THE BUTTER CAKE!

YenK-wS-TWRsmvKGT8qovQ.text: After reading through some of the recent reviews about the drop in service over the years, I was a bit hesitant about dining there but decided to give it a try anyway.  I ended up making reservations for dinner during my most recent trip and enjoyed every minute of the experience.  Our waitress was wonderful and service was outstanding.  She went over the complete "specials" of the night along with answering all the questions that we had. I ordered the bone in ribeye and it was prepared spot on.  The appetizer (oysters), sides (smashed potatoes and asparagus), and steak (bone in ribeye and filet mignon) was all great.  They even brought an unexpected dessert to our table for the birthday girl that had just turned 21! I'm not sure if I could be happier with my choice to dine there, but I will definitely be returning the next time I'm in Vegas.

ZZ7KoFEyA4JTtkBqvXfieg.text: Decided on this place for dinner for the fiance's birthday.  We arrived super early, and they were able to seat us.  We ordered the calamari which was amazing.  Fiance had one of the dry aged steaks, and he said it was the best he ever had.  I ordered the lobster bisque.  It was too salty, and there was a shell in my soup.  I felt sick after eating some of it, so declined them bringing me a new bowl.  I appreciated the effort to replace it but by that time I felt too ill for any more.  I will say, I had WLS three years ago, so that might have been why the soup effected me as it did, was probably too rich for me.  The server was not as attentive as I would have thought based on the high quality of the food, establishment but what can you do?  All in all the place was okay, I would not choose to return however.

oBmjXOV-XU8rh0UKCGZW9A.text: I can't even start, everything's perfect the staff the food the detail they provide is awesome... you must try there meat and lobster bisque it's to die for...the ambience is perfect... it was our 10 yr anniversary and they made it all so detailed the Manhattan  Special drink is beyond I'm telling you won't go wrong...the asparagus side dish is perfect w crushed almonds the drink prices are perfect... did I mention this place is awesome...1st time here the valet is attentive and waitress are awesome they help uh decide w wine n meat...that's a plus

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And a lil special card to make it feel all so priceless..

CV2bjXcK6lXDhmyHfgGdCQ.text: I brought my wife here for our 10 year anniversary. I tried to make an event out of it for her. The staff was instrumental in this. Once they found out we where local to Vegas things became more light hearted. Not everything was so serious, we where treated like humans instead of snobs. The food is well, as they say you get what you pay for. The food is amazing. Take your time and enjoy everything. The wine cellar is a sight to behold! The smell in there is out of this world. If they put a private table in the cellar..    Ps - There is no privet table in the cellar. However there should be one!  Thank you so much for the memories!

6xOkMQoAlD0jYW8I2R45zg.text: Such a great experience at Del Frisco's! I came here for a work dinner of about 20 people. We reserved a private room which was nice to be away from the hustlin and hustlin going on outside. They were busy and super packed so make sure to make reservations!   We had a set prix fixe menu: APPETIZER: assortment of shrimp cocktails with different sauces, crab legs, and oysters - I didn't get to try everything or else I'd already be full before the main course, the seafood was all fresh, shrimp were gigantic and all very yummy.  SALAD: blue cheese wedge salad with bacon bits- Lord I don't like blue cheese that much but I went for it and cleaned the plate up! Super tasteful and has a powerful punch, definite just try!   ENTREE: 12oz Filet mignon - juicy , tender and cooked at the perfect medium rare.. I never had this before but it was nice to have the servers cut through the steak to make sure that we were all okay with the result. The rub on the filet was mouth wateringly delish.. pretty up there in my list of good steaks.  DESSERT: Chocolate mousse- ugh so decadent and delicious. You have the light mousse and rich chocolatey liquid (I don't know what it was) so amazing!!! Chocolate overload but nice sweet ending to a fabulous dinner.  DRINK: must try one of their famous and well known VIPs, be careful though this one sneaks up on you ;)  *Don't forget to check out their James Bond table* super coool, I'll leave it at that. Great restaurant and superb staff!

NzQzlxGDs13LxhbSuoJ9dQ.text: Valentine's Day 2018... babe and I's first valentine together. I know what're you thinking... a steakhouse?! On Valentine's day?! Well babe got reservations and at a great time at that.   I am actually shocked that I've never heard about this place before and I've driven past the area many times over the years. This is my first fancy steak house that I've ever been to, and I'm so happy I got to experience it with my babe.  The parking lot was very small and full so we had to park at the neighboring lot. They have a valet service but seeing that it was a busy night I'm sure their services were very busy as well. When you first walk up to the building the aroma of delicious food just fills the air. Steak is my favorite type of meat and I'm so happy he brought me here!  We checked in and had to wait about 15 minutes from our reservation time before getting seated. They were busy, people in and out. There's a lounge to enjoy cocktails (with live music) while waiting for your table. The restaurant is very big and there are multiple rooms.  We got sat and the hostess was very nice. Hot, toasty, and flaky bread and butter arrived at the table. We got our waters and I had babe order for me. We were both so excited to try everything out!  I got the Wagyu Tomahawk Chop - Medium - for $95. Babe got the 45 Day Dry Aged Prime Strip - Medium Rare - for $69. Lobster Mac and Cheese $18.50  Mashed Potatoes $12  Everything was made very well and I am surprised at how full we got. The portions were huge and I am very impressed by the taste.  I am so thankful to have been able to have such a great date night with my babe! 100% recommend! Make sure you grab reservations for special occasions!

ndZ_3MwHMazIPXMCbzXPyg.text: The restaurant is incredible! Definitely 5 star service and 5 star food. If you're looking for fine dining with amazing touches to service and delicious food you've found the right place! Chad was our server and he was knowledgeable and provided incredible service!! We got the Long-Bone tomahawk steak, a side of potato ah gratin and Brussel sprouts. So much flavor and such great presentation.

ExXCpOIpdWQZpBvId2yWdA.text: Celebrated a friends birthday here tonight. The service was great, Ro was extra nice and helpful. The food was so good. All four of us had filets cooked to perfection. My boyfriend had the King Crab legs as well, he loved them. The butter and lemon cake topped off a perfect night.

KXhoeMo5gauNBMoIoUhc_g.text: We love Del Frisco's.  Everyone is always very helpful and very "on top" of things.  Great service all around!! They also have the best lemon cake, in this world - 6 layers of perfection!!

y900DW_y_pcAHEjgZreTBw.text: I hate to give Del Frisco's anything under 5 stars, but having to send both steaks back for a re-fire is never a fun moment at dinner. Every other aspect of our meal was top notch.   5 star service, excellent appetizers & drinks. And of course their amazing butter cake dessert that is the best cake I've ever eaten in my life.   If you haven't been to one of their locations, you are missing out.

WxphVPpPc4FKKskkHd62jw.text: I had the best time eating at the bar solo tonight and chatting with Trish, who is amazing! Try the signature pineapple martini, along with a tasty ribeye and you're on your way to taste bud heaven.   I randomly saw this place on the map near my hotel and figured, why not?! It didn't disappoint. I'm definitely going to come back to DV and see Trish the next time I'm in Vegas!

muYV45qKq5uGI8Fz2me3BA.text: First time here. Great service. Crab cake was amazing. Food is good. Drinks are good. Not the best steakhouse I've been to, but it was worth a try.

hWv_pn1VlnFUshSsBTIqNA.text: We came in this weekend.  For the first time.  As a birthday celebration.  ( Inspired to try you guys watching law abiding citizen.     6 top.  Lots of apps, drinks.    You were out of the stone crab that I had my absolute heart on.  So I got the king crab instead.  Fucking outstanding.  Chilled COLD. full and meaty.    All the sides were great.  Staff showed up and had them distributed in the blink of an eye.   Steaks came out.   Slighty overdone.  Not terribly.   But not cooked perfectly for a 70 dollar aged ribeye.    The manager was there to see me cut and judge reaction.  She agreed it was slighty over done.  ( Note, if it was average restaurant, I'd never have expected any better). Approximately 9 damn minutes later, she had a perfect replacement in front of me.  I had already told her I'd eat it as I was in a rush.    Mistakes happen.  Went well above needed to make me happy.    Marciano was our waiter and was perfect in his service.    Overall, outstanding experience that could have easily soured.  We will certainly be back when we can afford to treat ourselves again and will recommend always for fine dining experience.

YtiG_86kNR9n2-4c-Xg0Uw.text: It was my wife's birthday and she wanted to go to Ruth's Chris's. They were closed for renovations so we decided to try Del Frisco's. We were both pleasantly surprised. They have a special summer menu that includes a salad, 8 oz. Filet mignon or NY strip, a side and dessert for $59. Each item was a full size portion. The food was a solid 4, the service was good and the value for the money was a 5. Therefore,  I give it 4 stars and will be going back soon.

3mR9-uNv_mi2eoLUPuisRA.text: Not impressed.   We went there with a group of seven.  It wasn't busy at all but the server seemed like she was always in a hurry to get things said and to get our orders. Her impatiens definitely showed. The drinks were generous and the appetizers came quickly. Unfortunately the appetizers we chose weren't that great. We had the shrimp cocktail with nice size jumbo shrimp but a little bit chewy. We also had the bacon fat pork belly thing whatever it was. Only a third of it was eaten by a table of seven.  For a main course most of the people liked their steaks and I'm glad for that. I however had the lamb blackened and cut for me medium. It had a little extra flavor from being aged but I can't say it was that great for the price.   What really disappointed me was ordering an 18 ounce lobster tail to be sliced and shared by the table.  I don't remember looking at my itemized receipt but I'm sure it cost over $100. Unfortunately it was chewy as rubber.  I mention to our server that it was overcooked and she questioned other people at the table if they thought the same thing. I pointed out you have seven overweight men sitting at a table with pieces of lobster left over. Captain obvious shows that obviously wasn't good if we didn't eat it all. Someone from management or the kitchen came over and asked if we were not happy and I told him I wasn't unhappy it just wasn't very good. Their condolence was to send us a couple of cheap desserts as an apology. I'm sorry but the white table cloths and the big-name don't justify the cost of the bill for the quality of the food we received.received.  This is my first and last time eating the Del Frisco's. For all the times I eat out there are plenty of places to spend half the amount of money and get a better meal.

IICV8_O7o2pmrXNtnlTXYQ.text: I made a reservation for my birthday for 7 and it was on time, me being on time I'm sure helped as well. They had great customer service skills and it was a very clean, chill but upscale place. The appetizers were great, omg the crab cakes melt in your mouth! Then again the tuna was awesome as well. Dinner was served in a timely manner even with my well done steak. Everyone enjoyed their food, including me, it was sooooooo good! The steak even melted in my mouth, as well as the mashed potatoes. At the end they brought me little cakes out and sang happy birthday. I'm not a fan of cake but the ice cream with it was yummy! I don't eat sweets really but I had too eat the ice cream! The drinks here were great as well! My whole crew had been there before except for me and I loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet medallions with green beans and mashed potatoes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cakes and ice cream

ral2Mx6PB9aHDJ6vLo0qnQ.text: Unfortunately I have to give this one star to literally one of my favorite spots. It's vday. I get it. We had a reservation at 830pm. Got there at 820 and they said they are running at least 30 mins behind. Here is where they earned their one star--- they are still accepting reservations right now on open table. This is a huge miss. We are heading to another steakhouse at Crystals. Please pull your reservations in these cases like all other respectable restaurants. Mind you - we make our reservation yesterday. Now you have mad loyal customers- so the extra money tonight won't even out.... even the bonus points on the Vegas glam remodel didn't get this to a 2 star.... to top it off the valet pulled up the WRONG WHITE car!!! Omg like how do you give us the wrong car?!?!?! That could have been so bad and is terrifying. Like I just tell you the color and make and you bring any one??

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best crab cakes in vegas

AwWBRGGpLMFCACPcOByEWg.text: Made our reservations on Open Table so it was quick and easy. Arrived about 10 minutes late and was seated after a five minute wait. This place is located in a corporate business center. But it's not hard to find. Waze got us there no problem. It was very busy when we arrived but we were seated in a more quiet area of the restaurant away from the bar. Service was superb. We went here for my daughter's 20th bday celebration and it did not disappoint. Ordered filet mignons, lobster tail, prime rib eye with bone, lobster Mac and cheese, seasoned corn, and shrimp cocktails. My steak was ordered medium and it was a little on the medium rare side but since the plates were hot I just cooked it more by leaving the exposed raw part on the plate for a little bit. Bread is complimentary with butter. When the steaks come out they ask you to cut it down the middle to ensure it was correctly cooked. They also went around and served the sides on your plate. At the end of the meal my daughter was presented with their famous lemon yellow cake slice and a candle (this was also complimentary). Total bill came out to $465 (including an 18% tip). Would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QSjQ0m52kS8NyrF0XZZULw.text: Wow! Wife and I were impressed.We done out a lot with customers and live in Vegas so the restaurants are top notch and often over priced. Del Friscos has great price points food and is delicious. Not over indulgent to over compensate for poor quality food. Most important, the customer service we received from one of the managers, Anthony. He took his time to educate my wife and I about port wines and paired our meal with great reds. My wife and I will definitely be back with my customers.

xCuOUqXiQl3qidVidgYx6A.text: Great steak perfectly cooked , sides were phenomenal.  The optional steak toppings were a great added plus I added Alaskan Crab to the top of my steak. We were a party of 5 and showed up with no reservation and were seated after 10 minutes on a Saturday night. Good food good service good times .

Ghu6bD4cKORyTOxqTjbOHQ.text: I was looking forward to my visit at Del Frisco's, it has such good reviews, I couldn't wait to get there. Unfortunately, my experience was less than amazing and not smooth at all.   Before I explain my experience, I'd like to give credit to the servers, they were very nice and attentive and I don't hold them personally responsible for my bad experience.   With that being said, I'll start with the bacon appetizer. This was actually really good and flavorful, I would recommend bacon lovers to give it a try. After the bacon, everything seemed to go down hill.   Sides: mashed potatoes and "cream of corn". Mashed potatoes were just OK at best, I've had better instant mashed potatoes to be honest, not impressed. Not fluffy at all and had a dry, blah taste to them. "Cream of corn" which was recommended by the waitress as being amazing and a must try, wasn't exactly "cream of corn", rather it was just normal corn sauteed with some stuff (forget) with a kick of spice. It wasn't bad but it was not what we were told. Disappointing all around, you come to a steak house for a great steak but also for great sides.  Entrees: We ordered the bone in filet cooked medium well and a porter house cooked medium. The waiter took the time to specifically talk over the temperatures of "medium well", slightly warm pink center, cool....and "medium" pink throughout but no red, cool. Steaks come out and filet that was supposed to be medium well was medium rare and the porterhouse came out straight rare, very very very red/bloody. Steaks were sent back, 20 minutes later new steaks arrived (as well as new, fresh sides, which was a nice though). This time the porterhouse was prepared as ordered but the filet was well done, extremely overcooked and dry....guess what happened? Yup, sent back for the 2nd time....another 20 minutes later, we got both steaks. Porterhouse was still fine and the filet was back to being too red. I didn't say anything, at this point it was already getting late, we'd been there for forever and just wanted to leave. I ate the ends of the filet as they were more well done. They did bring us each out 1 glass of wine during the waiting periods for the steak but we had been drinking a bottle of wine and they didn't bring us the same wine as we we were drinking, so while it was a nice gesture, it didn't seem to make sense....plus we were done with the drinking, we just wanted the food and wanted to get out of there.   At the very end they offered us complimentary dessert, which again, we didnt really want but ended up ordering one thing to split. I forget what it was but it was good.  Overall, my experience was tiring, frustrating and expensive. Instead of comping us 2 glasses of wine that we didn't want, they should have taken my steak off the bill. Three times and they couldn't get it right. They blamed the cooking issue on the bone, saying cooking a bone in filet is very tough.....but I've had bone in filets prepared perfectly plenty of times so to me that wasn't a good excuse.   If you don't care which way your steak comes out, whether it be bleeding on your plate or so well done it tastes like leather, come here. Otherwise, theres many other options in Vegas where you can get a steak cooked the way you ordered it.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon appetizer

_gUTVbGAER38zOGuAL2wTA.text: Amazing!!  My husband and I have been here twice. A great place to celebrate anniversaries, birthdays or to just celebrate life! Being that it is a steak house, it is pricey but totally worth it. We shared the wagyu tomahawk steak and it just melts in your mouth, cooked and seasoned perfectly! We paired that with the lobster mac and cheese and it goes so well together. Before that we started off with crab cakes. My husband doesn't usually like crab cakes but will only get it here. Lastly, the VIP cocktail is deadly but so yummy!!! You'll keep asking for a refill on it but won't realize that you're drunk already.   To top all this great food off is the AMAZING service we get there. Friendly service from the person that sat us down, the waitress/waiter and people bringing the food out. None of that fake customer service, they're all genuine and all have a great sense of humor.   Happy Eating!

JGfouhhaD40WCsSnXtRCTQ.text: This is my favorite steak house by far. Our waitress was so great and she knew the menu so well so she was able to help us to get what we really wanted. She also made our anniversary so special. She offered gluten free bread and dessert for my wife. She actually requested it for us.  The food taste was so great as well.

LjXt4YRp0ZBojJxxdtbqug.text: Overpriced for decent steak.  Sides are separate.  The atmosphere was nice.  I got the bone in rib eye and felt it lacked flavour.  The bread and butter was delicious.  I expected more for the price off the strip.

qnos3dRJxKE9kOBBuqHY2A.text: I came here for dinner this past Saturday when my cousins and I were all in town.  We were celebrating 3 belated birthdays and Del Frisco's definitely did not disappoint.  I really really really wanted to give 5 stars because of the service and friendliness of everyone there, especially our server and the one southern guy with a beard!  I didn't catch their names but service was impeccable!   We also had a 15 month old at our table and they were great with him as well.  "Southern guy with a beard", which is what we all referred to him as once we left, even offered to show us the 007 wine display (which my nephew loved) and explained the story behind it!  Super cool!  Anyways, we kind of went all out for dinner.  We started with 2 of the shrimp appetizers which came with several large shrimp prepared 3 different ways.  All 3 were good except the shrimp was overcooked and a bit chewy.  We also had 2 orders of the foie gras.  It was my first time trying foie gras and I actually did not enjoy it at all.  Of course, the complimentary bread and butter was delicious and we devoured 3 loafs!  As for dinner, they had a prix fixe menu option that night and we all ended up going with that.  It was $59 and included a salad, a steak, and a side dish.  The salad choices included a classic, a wedge salad, and a ceasar salad.  All very good, especially the classic which came with 2 large strips of bacon.   For the main course, there were several choices which I don't remember specifically but we all ended up going with the 16oz Prime Rib Eye for a $15 upcharge.  The steaks came with a crab cake and a choice of a side dish ranging from mashed potatoes, sauteed mushrooms and onions, and creamed spinach with bacon.  We all got different sides so we were able to have some of everything.  We also added 2 orders of lobster mac n cheese.   The steak came out perfectly cooked and was delicious!  Seasoned very well and perfectly medium.  I really liked that our server explained how their chef cooks medium rare, which sounded a bit too 'rare' for my liking, which is why I ordered mine Medium.    As for the side dishes, my main gripe was that everything was extremely salty.  The creamy, buttery, and oily was all expected, and of course it was delicious, but everyone at the table agreed that the side dishes were just a bit too salty.    Now with all that said, I still think this was one of the best birthday dinners I've had in my 30 years of life which is definitely saying something.  They brought out a couple of desserts (not sure if it was complimentary or not) for the 3 birthdays we told them about and they were all good as well but by that point, we were all so full that we didn't really get to appreciate them.  **Edit** How did I forget about the VIP Pineapple vodka cocktail.  Holy moly, I don't normally drink vodka but this cocktail, which is literally just vodka infused with pineapple, was amazing!  It tasted like Pina!!!  Definitely try this on your next visit!

0PMYbXyBPGo2Nv3NPBuhag.text: My wife and I had dinner at here on 12/29/17. We planned to order the dry-aged 16oz Ribeye (me) and 8oz Filet (wife), but the waiter told us about the 32oz dry-aged double eagle Ribeye, so we decided to split it. It was a huge disappointment. It was tough, dry and flavorless. It was somewhat comical watching the waiter trying to cut it table side. It was a mess. Management tried to make things right, so that was good, but I really just wanted a delicious steak.  This place has lots of good reviews, so we might have been really happy if we just stuck with our original plans. I would stay away from that 32oz double eagle Ribeye ($125).

YlkWMJZ_0Rb6EbLofX3AnA.text: What can I say this place is nothing but great service and great food. Happy hour is the best. Always a stop while in Las Vegas!!

mpZWCkclpuHIYNBTAYOOPw.text: Came by for dinner the other night and the experience was mediocre at best. Our party reserved a private room and noticed that the restaurant was 2% full...   Other tables in our party received a drink order, prior to wine...not ours. Our lead host informed us that we would also have hors d'oeuvres including crab cakes with our meal...our table didn't get any crab cakes...  The bacon wrapped scallop & lamp chop hors d'oeuvres were decent with the lamb chop standing out for being light, delicate and flavorful.  The meal started off with 3 shrimp cocktail which were overcooked and not too fresh...they were pretty big "shrimp" though.  Ordered the blue cheese iceberg lettuce salad and the Del's salad came out instead?!? The Del's salad wasn't too fresh and there was a tad too much dressing on the salad.  The 16 oz ribeye was cooked to perfection at medium rare. It was definitely the highlight of the meal. The ribeye was a Prime cut and was super fatty...since the 16 oz cut was too big anyways.  The waitstaff seemed to have messed up the steak orders for other folks at my table...some received a filet instead of a ribeye while others received their steak medium instead of medium rare...  Meal ended off with a chocolate mousse which was too rich and sweet.  Service was very prompt and efficient by the staff...but they kept on serving while we had a speaker speaking?!? ...the staff also disappeared after they served dessert?!?

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 Oz Prime Ribeye

si_eV83bfBWjxF1LZuq0ow.text: Definitely a must have when in Vegas one of the best steaks I've ever had the wine seller is an awesome privet area if you're with a big party we were 8 guy we ate so much we were about to sleep in our seats not to mention the amount we drank between the 8 of us we ordered almost every kind of steak they had on the menu plus a lot of appetizers this was one of the very very few places that we all walked out saying it was great food and the price was very well worth it

m2MiDsWEG34sstqBrALJsw.text: Five star experience for a five star restaurant! My boyfriend and I came here and literally had the best meal of our entire lives. Everything was phenomenal whether it was drinks, an appetizer, our entree, or dessert, it was all just so unbelievably good. We had the bone-in filet and my boyfriend had the double eagle steak. We had outstanding service from our server, Ronise; she was incredible and really made the experience that much more special. 10/10 would recommend if you're looking for a place to eat for a special dinner. It was the best dining experience we've ever had! We wish we could afford 5 star restaurant dining more often, else we'd be here everyday.

g7ZKDL999wH-xl6fy3v6_Q.text: This restaurant was perfect for my Birthday Dinner Party.  The private room for 22 was gorgeous!  The set menu was customized to allow for even more choices.  The service & staff was excellent. The event manager Nicole made sure we had music outlets, candles, mic, everything we needed and a JOY to work with.  The wine selection time spent in your cellar was another special touch.  Thanks for a wonderful night!  We can't wait to return!

ERvwuTvp_8wpLZopB4r63Q.text: The burger at the "bar menu" is a must, probably the best burger i've ever had!bread pudding is super good too, great service!

RfTtk5dywvUS_dLkiQOLww.text: Well executed steak orders and worth every bite!  We started out with the shellfish plateau, a trio of Alaskan crab legs, jumbo prawns, and stone crab claws....fresh and delectable.  I ordered the Lobster Bisque soup and it was by far the best I had compared to Ruth's Chris.  The pieces of Lobster were exceptional.  The 45-day dry aged prime rib eye did have a complex flavor and didn't need any sauce to enhance it, although I did order the bourbon peppercorn which paired well.  As for dessert, I can't thank the staff enough for surprising my friend's birthday with a delicious serving of the buttercake.  As shown, this is what we thought about it!  5-stars: food, service, and value.  I look forward to visiting again!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MEiIp_Dkdtyocx933T5fww.text: While staying in Vegas for our anniversary, we decided to try this steak house because it was off the strip and came highly recommended on Yelp. I called that morning and was able to get a reservation that day for 6:00. We were warmly greeted at the front and was taken to our seats rather quickly. Upon seating, we found an anniversary card signed by the whole staff which was a nice touch! Our server was Gary and he was very accommodating. We ordered a bottle of red wine, and cocktails to start with their Shanghai-Style Fried Calamari which was delicious! For our entree, my husband and I both ordered their famous Wagyu Tomahawk Chop (and no we didn't share! I was hongry!), the Broiled Lobster Tail, the Iceberg Wedge Salad, the Sauteed Mushrooms with Pearl Onions, the Lobster Mac and Cheese, the Potatoes Au Gratin, and the Asparagus with Roasted Almonds. Did I mention I was hungry?? Everything came out quickly and all the items were delicious. They even provided us with an Anniversary dessert . I must say, they made our Anniversary very memorable! After coming home a week later, we received a handwritten card from Gary thanking us for visiting them. I did take off one star because I was a little disappointed that my Tom Ford sunglasses were left on the table and was never found.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Mushrooms with Pearl Onions!

sd1ns03_CW7MXExWETPcjA.text: Interesting steakhouse. Very high hopes given the reviews. I give it two stars because of the service which was 4 to 5 stars. However, the food left a lot to be desired. There is a clear issue with cooking the steaks. One of our parties orders steak was over cooked and had to be sent back, then was not returned until everyone had completed their meals. The second member of our party ordered a medium and it came out rare. The waiters said to cut it and use the hot plate. No luck. Sent it back. They cooked it more or did something. Came back rare again. Just gave up at that point. The manager did give a 25% discount on each ruined steak item which was pathetic.

ijabSm1DWwWcPKmLG7ycgA.text: A buddy made reservations for our group and we sat at the private room behind the James Bond table. Spoiler alert! You can see the uploaded pics, and I won't ruin it with a description, but it's not quite the same as seeing this contraption up close and personal.  Our private dining room was next to the wine storage, and it was quite a well stocked inventory of vintages, magnums, and I think that was a Nebuchadnezzar because it was a gigantic bottle of wine. Biggest container of fermented grape juice I ever did see!  Food was excellent. Yes, it's spendy, and the overall quality in taste, preparation, and presentation is fantastic. From what I ordered and sampled among sharable plates, you can't go wrong with any menu selection. They will go the extra mile to make sure your entree is made to your satisfaction.  Service was fantastic throughout the evening. The waitstaff checked on us early and often. Drinks were refilled regularly. It's a good thing we were sequestered from the open dining areas because after a few rounds of cocktails and wine bottles, we got loud and obnoxious. Despite our shenanigans, service remained professional and tolerant. Our waitress was well versed in the menu and made suggestions to compliment and enhance entree selections. Whether you're in Las Vegas or other entertainment destination, it's an added bonus to have a knowledgable waitstaff, bartender, or other industry professional who might have inside info or the hookup to a nearby hotspot. Take care of them and they might return the courtesy.  Definitely a superb experience at Del Frisco's.

zJobGNzKh8eOIEXnReq1BA.text: Our favorite steakhouse ever!!! Theres something about the crust/spices on that steak!!! And the buttery melt-in your mouth meat...  The service is always so good!  On special occasions they give us a lemon cake that I Iove!  I like the live piano music for ambience!  Love this place!

H4jjQyB5ypgkv9fIHJriKg.text: my friends have been yelling at me since, 1.) i am a frequent Vegas goer, 2) i love food and enjoy fine dining; but after all these years hearing about it, i still haven't made my way here! well... i finally did! and it did not disappoint!   the whole experience was awesome. our waiter was tentative and give us plenty of suggestions. their signature VIP pineapple cocktail totally lived up the hype (four of us got a pitcher), the crab cakes were YUMMY - so flavorful and you can for sure get crabs in each bite, we also got the Alaskan king crab legs (very good, but a little pricey...) and escargot (just OK, can skip), the steak was cooked perfectly (at medium) - paired with bone marrow butter - mmmmm worth every penny! sides were both good, the Brussels sprouts and mac n cheese. we were there celebrating birthdays, so we got a HUGE piece of complimentary cake - o.m.g. so yummy and not too sweet!   would definitely recommend and come back again!
