Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pea7wQTyQi21VLRIbHk2wg.text: Let me get the bad out of the way first... the only thing that didn't allow this to get a 5 star. There is no french onion soup... but it does have the VIP!! But I need to get into a little more right now.  Mac N Cheese? Yes. So rich and creamy and it reheats well, and you just continue to eat it... and eat it... and eat it. YOU CANNOT STOP!!! I am eating some right now... but please come stop me,  Au Gratin potatoes? Cheese on cheese on cheese on tickles with cheese. And the potatoes are soft and so buttery. Go now... why are you still reading this!  The Meat... I can review this so freaking fast. Cooked perfectly melts in your mouth a nice medium rare is all you need. Anything above medium... get the hell out!! You don't deserve meat.  I have had every single dessert they have and my suggestion would be to get the lemon cake... I was lying about eating mac n cheese earlier but I am in fact eating my left over lemon cake right now, gleefully laughing at those of you who are not!  THE VERDICT: You feel like royalty here and like any steakhouse they treat you like royalty which technically I am... about 600 years back so, I kind of deserve it. This is one of my 3 go to steakhouses when i go to vegas. And it should be yours, it is totally once a year kind of thing, pretty expensive... well I will see you later!

gNZh4AEpgT0lW_Jxh-ZVMg.text: This place is really amazing. After a disapointing Vegas steak experience at Golden Steer (see my review) we decided to check Del Frisco's out on our next trip. We were very glad we did!  The service and staff were impeccable, friendly, knowledgeable, competant and most important: friendly..(did I mention that once already?).   Now the food..AMAZING. The steaks are incredible, perfectly cooked and flavorful. My medium Filet Mignon was perfect pink, swimming in natural juices, and tender enough to cut with a fork..it was carnivore heaven. If that isnt enough their hot bread and butter is to die for!! Also, their desserts are incredibly scrumcious. I had their signature lemon cake and it is the best I have  ever had. I am quite the lemon connoisseur and even I was blown away.  This place truly cares about giving a great experience and backs it up with its amazing food. My highest carnivore recommendation!

He4z2pJHUFH0woIVhufIWA.text: An amazing experience. You get what you pay for and from beginning to end, the care and attention given to us as guests was stellar.   The steaks are a must.

N1JsIxjR3r5gWl4wJEwn2Q.text: Everyone was telling me how great this place was....I've dropped off a few clients when I was driving limos....i tried it out for the first time and I left disappointed. ..first the hostess was rude and asked us in a rude manner that we only had one hr to eat and leave...who saids that in a place where ur steak is more than 100 bucks!!!!I called the manager even though I didn't want to make a big deal about the issue...the food was ok....not the best...all the manager said was "sorry about that I'll talk to her"...she didn't even know who the hostess was...first and last time I'll b in that restaurant and no more referring guests there...

yUq4YrbxKemd5SBc7uSwRA.text: Classy ambiance with very pleasant staff, Marciano, our waiter was informed and fun.    Martini's were delicious, they have a house pineapple infused vodka they use for their house martini, it was great.  The chopped salad (may have been chef salad) was drenched in dressing and that made it soggy, could have done without it.  Rib eye was yummy.  Cooked perfectly and the waiter was thorough in making sure we sliced our steak before he left our table.  Chateau potatoes were also great, not the best, but definitely yummy with a right texture.  It was costly, and for special occasions, I would say worth it.

JUqiyNfuhRCO77TqKNs0Ng.text: Really great dining experience. We went with a very large party (about 50 of us!) so limited menu.  But, it was delicious!  Had the ahi tuna and crab cake appetizers...both delish!  The petite filet was cooked to perfection and seasoned beautifully. Side dishes, mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli, we're fine.  And, as stuffed as I was, once the banana bread pudding came out I couldn't resist.  And, it was exceptional.  I couldn't stop eating it!  Great service too.  Would definitely recommend this as a quality dining experience in Vegas!

e6BZSRMA1Jl0h-MPWHBL-A.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and it was unbelievableeeee.  My food baby cried out with tears of happiness with everything that we ordered.  Our waiter was also a Californian so A+!!!  Haha jk, but really though, that was pretty cool that he was originally from Santa Barbara!  He recommended that we order two crab cakes because we would end up not wanting to share it and he was correct.  The crab cake was the perfect amount for an appetizer without getting too full for our steaks and sat in a heavenly pool of cajun lobster sauce *drool.  I ordered the filet and I forget what my boyfriend ordered, but he couldn't finish it lol.  We also got an order of the lobster mac and cheese which was probably one of the best mac and cheese dishes I've ever had.  If you've read my other reviews, I've stated that I generally do not like mac and cheese, but this one....god...just order it.  You have nothing to lose!!  Overall the ambiance here is wonderfully romantic, the service is top notch, and they brought me a fat slice of cake for my birthday!  I can't wait to come here again and am so happy that my boyfriend's friends recommended him to take me here for my birthday.  Wahoooo!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake in Cajun lobster sauce (?)
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac and cheese :)

DW8l0a9cUhk0kuE8afNaCA.text: Everything was perfect! The Waygu steak was so delicious i cant wait to have it again. The service was great, Ryan and the other servers are very attentive.

zKiX-MHvdElJRe4GN_VwAA.text: Great service! Food was delicious! We had the summer special, it was the best choice! The steak was cooked perfectly right and the crab cakes are very tasty. There was also a pianist when we came in, it made the restaurant more lively and entertaining. We will definitely come back soon.

lGY7ErFnkmmhOYX5reTsUg.text: My first time here and got everything the server recommended...didn't regret a single choice!   Tuna Tartar Lamb Lemon Cake  AMAZING!

KGCb6tXyDdkgxcXm7XadsQ.text: I went to Del Frisco's with friends for my Birthday dinner.  All of the staff were very accommodating. I had to bring in a cake the day before our reservation and it was no problem.  All of the food was amazing and top quality.  The filets were cooked and seasoned to perfection! We took advantage of the $99 special and it was worth every penny.  We enjoyed bread pudding and cheesecake along with our filet, crab cake, potatoes and the best creamed spinach I have ever tasted.  You also have to taste the Lobster Mac and Cheese!  Our waitress was very attentive, sweet and genuine as were all the staff.  I can't wait to go back and just sit at the bar and have their signature pineapple martini!

YBVjYerr6sG_W-OHi9x3Zw.text: Great steaks, fantastic crab cakes, excellent service. Not inexpensive but you definitely get what you pay for here.

NWj0c9JGJjryL19CWj9DjA.text: A pretty typical old school steakhouse - just like a dozen others in LV.  The food was pretty good. We didn't care for the service...they threw food at us and continually interrupted our conversations, and I didn't care for the hard sell on steak toppings or sides.   I won't hurry back.  There are too many other good steak places in this town to warrant a special trip to this one.

IVUy6a3iYp0c3owompZXjQ.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas. My wife and I come here almost everytime we are in Vegas and it is always amazing. We have tried all of the other top steakhouses on the strip but this place is much better with out the over doneness of the casinos and they dont rip you off.  Steaks are always cook perfectly and their sides are great.

T9dLBeaT21a7edGJJk3mgg.text: Wow! This place has some of the best steak i have ever ate (and i am a steak and potato person). A little pricey but well worth every cent. Did have an issue with the hostess when i called to see about their wait, she said there was none and when i got there it happen to be 30 mins (took like 20 mins to get seated) and it took me 3-5 mins to get there. If there was a wait, she should of just told us and i would of been okay with it.   Stepped into the bar area and they had some live music playing, a guy on the piano. The bartender was nice and they had a decent selection of beers. We finally got seated and it did take a minute for the waiter to attend to us but it is ok. I ordered a wedge salad to start with a rib eye steak as my main course. I ordered the asparagus and my coworker also ordered the rib eye with potatoes au gratin (caesar salad as a starter). Sides are family style. Started with the bread which was wonderful, the salads where good but nothing spectacular. The steak was the main event! It was seasoned perfect and cooked exactly how i wanted it. The sides where a good companion to the steaks. The steak here was one of the best steaks i have ever eaten in my life time. I will go back with no hesitation (actually i will hesitate a bit, $160 for two people with no tip)!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye with asparagus and potatoes au gratin

5kGEvgtcpc1HEtWwESpiaw.text: We had dinner here last night''food is always amazing and the staff''''Awesome service!   The one BIG that that bothers me is the awfull sewer smell '''You can smell it as soon as you get out of your car and the smell lingers in the resturant:{ This is the only reason I would think twice about going again'' Sewer smell''yuck

l6QLQTzC25Mjj6o7l_ZYUw.text: Dry bone-in ribeye. They sat us in the d cigar room with old carpet and a creepy atmosphere. Save yourself the grief and keep looking.

ffFhay_T8C6EnTZL6SmOdg.text: Excellent Food. Excellent Service. Zero Complaints. The Tomahawk Ribeye Steak is fabulous. Expensive but well worth it.

EZXV9vKXe9QQ6vIUgvvOcw.text: Awesome crab cake! Love that it is not fried. The lobster sauce they put with it is so good. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly and seasoned perfectly. I can't wait to go back again!

D79NaZEWIUeONumNEafFAQ.text: Been to this particular location several times and never, ever I have I been disappointed. This steakhouse is my favorite steak house in Las Vegas and I have visited them all! Steaks are always juicy and flavorful. The sides are simply amazing. Crab cakes before is never a disappointment. Toryn the GM is always a pleasure to deal with. Looking forward to taking my sales team at the end of the month!

Tx1N5JHUpCFHow10iaZqLQ.text: I was a little disappointed, considering the high reviews and the namesake of the restaurant.  Here's why:  The PROS: 1) THE STEAK:  we got the signature Double Eagle cut medium rare.  It's True what people say - that the steak are a little undercooked than you're used to - HOWEVER, the steak is so gorgeously cooked, it didn't bother me at all.  The steak had a lovely crust on it with great seasoning, and the inside was a little undercooked but the steak's flavor and tenderness was so good that it didn't matter. 2) THE CHOUX CORN:  Really interesting twist to creamed corn.  It's cooked with bacon bits and poblano pepper bits.  It's just a tad creamy - not too decadent, which is a nice change because the steak was very decadent.   3) THE ATMOSPHERE:  The place is really nice - lots of mahogany wood and glass.  It also smelled of cigar which gave it that Vegas/baller air to it.  The CONS: 1) Our seating area:  The hostess sat us next to a table with 2 kids in their party.    We were obviously a couple trying to have a nice dinner, but the 2 kids were so noisy and whiney - it killed the mood until they left after we finished our appetizer.  I wish they were cognizant of what kind of dining atmosphere a couple would want. 2)  The sides:  lobster mac and cheese - unfortunately the lobster was so fishy, I just took a few bites and was over it. No offense, but Mastro's lobster mac and cheese still takes the crown.  The dish was also not cheesy - it was creamy but I'd like to see strands of melted cheese getting pulled as I spoon it onto my plate and into my mouth.  The spinach supreme - I usually love bacon.  I seriously do.  This dish had half bacon, half spinach/sauteed onion.  I was expecting bacon bits accenting the dish - I wish they asked me, "would you like some spinach with your bacon supreme?"  =( 3)  Service:  She was good but she didn't ask us if we were here for a special occasion or if it was our first time here.  It was our anniversary and it was indeed our first time, but I'm not going to mention it if she's not going to ask us.  I feel like if I do that, then I'm asking for a dessert handout - which I'm always welcome to, but I'm not a beggar. 4)  Dessert:  She recommended the lemon cake and the chocolate mousse.  We went with the mousse.  It was good but we were so surprised at how dense the chocolate mousse was.  It was way too rich, so we started eating only the fluffy marshmallow top instead.  They have sorbets but no ice cream variety - only vanilla - that was really disappointing because we expected at least a variety of basic ice cream from a fancy place.  Overall, the steak carried the stars to this rating.  The steak is truly amazing, amazing enough to visit an off-strip restaurant, but unfortunately everything else fell short.    I don't think we'll return but we were glad that we tried it.

dJkEmFvarFBlNmMUpUAtyQ.text: This steakhouse blew every other steakhouse I've been to out of the water. The menu was simple yet had some of the best cuts of steak I've ever seen. Recommend the 26 ounce American Wagyu bone-in ribeye. Perfect for 2 people to share.

pzfptOfTej-d1uTjiaMFrw.text: My fiance and I dined here the day after Turkey Day.  Del Frisco's is a short cab ride off the strip.  You will notice an older crowd dines there which is a nice change from the hoochie mommas walking the strip.  We were seated in one of their dining rooms and lucky enough for my man they had a flat screen showing the game.  I had to have a cocktail while looking over the menu so I ordered their signature drink "The VIP."  It is a pineapple martini where they soak the fruit for days in vodka to get all of its juices.  It was faboosh!    After taking some time with the menu, my fiance and I decided to split the wedge salad and a bone in filet.  As for the sides we had the lobster mac n' cheese along with the grilled asparagus.  They brought out our steak and it was a little too bloody for me so they kindly took it back to be cooked more.  Once that was done they served up our beef and side and now it was time to chow down.  The whole meal was great.  No complaints from me.  The staff was more than helpful, the cocktail get me a lil tipsy, and the meat put me in food coma.  I just wish after devouring our meal I had room for dessert.  There is always a next time.

ubL7ovcSD9RoN-FnVwjOrA.text: Aaaaaaaa... so disappointed in giving this place 3 stars... mainly because it's partly my fault and mostly theirs...  First I have to give 5 stars plus for the staff, waitress, for making the dining experience top notch... when my son's girlfriends steak was under done they immediately took it back to make it right... they then brought us another side dish to compensate us for the wait... the waitress found out my daughter was graduating and brought out the lemon cake (which was the best dessert) along with our other two desserts we had ordered, fully comped... the service was as good as Mastro's steak house where we live in Costa Mesa... So why the 3 stars? The Wagyu 32 oz. bone in ribeye was 2 stars... for $90 you'd expect non-chewy texture, like the Mastro's 32 oz. bone in ribeye for half the price... I was expecting melt in your mouth over the top steak just like the service and staff were... unfortunately, each bite had sinew strands throughout... I've had better pieces of meat at Costco...  and this is where it's my fault... I needed to say something to them... if I did they would have tried to fix it or probably would have comped me for the dinner... but I felt guilty for complaining to them because that's just not me... I don't complain... I'm Japanese, I smile a lot, say it's good, but never return if it's bad... especially if I spent $100 per person for steak...  My son split the Double Eagle ribeye and unfortunately it was also tough... my daughter ordered the filet and it was great...  I should have listened to the waitress, I think she was trying to steer me to the filet... she did mention she enjoyed the filet because of the texture and she did not like the "chew" of the ribeye... hmmmmmmmm... that was the tip... never heard someone say "chew" for an expensive cut of meat before... but "chew" is the perfect description of what I had... and unfortunately, "chew" is not what you would want to pay for. I probably would have given this place 2 stars because that's how bad the rib eye was but I have to give this place 3 stars because that's how good the staff was... I'm sad I won't be back... but glad Mastro's Steakhouse is in my neck of the woods... never tried Mastro's here, but did try the Mastro's Seafood house in Newport Beach... and experienced the samething as Del Frisco's... great service... bad steak... so I don't want to try the one in Vegas... What I noticed about steak in Vegas is... over priced and not as good a quality... I don't think I will eat steak in Vegas anymore... period.

1UpQLDhyBPaL5u1h11SjLA.text: Travis, Chris and Tony made the excellent food and decor really sing in harmony. This was a flawless experience and the glasses were never empty and glances never ignored.

_p69dJLOWVqP1N5n2Zt5KQ.text: Update: The manager reached out to us to address our concerns. She was very apologetic and offered to correct the situation for us. Not very many businesses these days will even make the effort to read Yelp and address satisfaction issues. Kudos to Del Frisco for their efforts.

jUvn-xVZkqjegPk32WJGqw.text: Del Frisco's is amazing!  We even got a tour of the wine cellar and the special 007 table.

ZkuNTkV2Sbd-0f-oIaVung.text: House drink is tasty, crab cakes delicious. The ambieance is nice, it feels nice and welcoming, without being pretentious like other steakhouses. the steak was tasty. The service was ok, the waitress would disappear for long stretches, granted she had another large party, but she made all great recommendations.  I will definitley come back and recommend this place.    last note, didn't appreciate peoples casualness, people going in shorts and hawaiian shirts, c'mon people, step it up.

maTizH6mgB393eRHj4wPAg.text: They get everything right every time. Great service, top-notch and very consistent service, and a wonderful dining room that can, however, get a bit noisy. It is quite expensive, and everything must be ordered a la carte, but it's worth every penny. We come to Del Frisco's every time my dad, a True steakhouse connoisseur, is in town. and we have no been disappointed. World-class steak -- no question about it.

__evOuguBC0Fs9TG9uhmfw.text: Having been to Vegas more than several times, eventually you get tired of the food on the strip even if it is the best dinner buffet of all the hotels on the strip. So I asked my friend who goes there for business for one of his recommendations on where a member of the Rat Pack may have dined (although Vegas has changed so much since those days, and even since the last time I've been there!).  Forget Gordon Ramsay's "Steak" - go to a real steakhouse in Del Frisco's! Even if they are not unique to Vegas (check their website for all their locations), the experience felt like Vegas.  I don't really know where to start because everything from the moment we walked in to going out the door was fantastic.  Service - it was all hands on deck as we had a server and host for every aspect of the meal and they were each genuinely attentive. We were "personally" served by at least 5 different people for our party of 4.   Drinks - not a large drink menu, but each drink was made to perfection. For me it was the perfect opportunity to order Don Draper's drink of choice - "An Old Fashioned" - and I could see myself definitely trying to keep up with Don just because of this drink. I don't need to go into their wine collection except needless to say it is amazing - including an appraised $1.5M James Bond limited edition wine set which you must specially request to see.  Delicious sides - I haven't even gotten to the steaks yet because I'll save the best for last. But the sides are a close 2nd. You don't need 2-3 sides per person, but it'll be hard to decide what to share amongst your party. For our party of 4, we got 5 sides and each one no matter how simple it was - it was better than any version of it I've had before. Like spinach! or mushrooms! The MUST have is the Lobster Macaroni and Cheese. Again, one would think based on how good it is we should each get our own order of this super delicious side. But amongst us 4 guys, we barely finished it because it was so rich. And of course we were pretty filled from all the other food/bread.  Finally the steak - good. Very good. My buddy and I had to share their "Tomahawk" Rib Steak which is the biggest steak on their menu - a 32 oz Wangyu American Kobe Rib-eye steak. As mouth-watering as that sounds to the steak-lover who wants to devour all 32 oz of it, there is simply too much goodness to save room for. So if have a willing partner to share the Tomahawk, I highly suggest doing so so you can dip your fingers in everything else Del Frisco has to offer.  We did not make it to dessert but I'm gonna stake my next steak dinner on that it's gonna be worth bursting a button for.

8-3gyJxKmEnXYPYbpdU0gg.text: The best crab cakes I ever had, EVER!!  5 stars for service.  The wait staff was impeccable.  They were very attentive and actually served our sides to us!  I ordered the filet mignon and thought it was okay.  I loved their side dishes (creamed corn, lobster mac n cheese) and crab cakes more.

4iMq-PqJNIaOxn6V1EelcA.text: Excellent service, and they aim to please!  My friend didn't enjoy her food due to regional taste differences, not the chef, and they insisted upon a refund. This restaurant is what you'd expect a fine dining experience to be! Ample free parking in their parking lot. James Bond table on display serves as a neat conversation piece.

xhP6lvcKNybXyPjBK1wvYg.text: Had the Power House Special for $99 but we upgraded to a 16 oz rib eye on one of the steaks from the 8 oz filet for an extra $10.  PH came with salad (Caesars or del), steak with a crab cake (cc was soooo good), choice of dessert for each---we upgraded on one to the lemon cake.  Everything was really good and quality for sure.  Came with sesame bread and butter which was also very tasty!  Atmosphere was not bad but we were seated near the bar so it was noisy...next time I would prefer to be seated away from the bar area.  Service was good and server was attentive and friendly.  Overall had a very nice meal.  Almost forgot to mention each came with a side--we had the chateau potatoes and supreme spinach...both were yummy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake...11.00

1UvWgCmLxXLnWex9om5FqA.text: It was nice that this place was  a little quiet...off the strip but near a lot of other steak places like Mortons and Ruth's Chris...   We started with the crab cake, which was amazing... it was baked and large lumps of crab, and the cajun lobster sauce was really good too.. I had the prime ribeye and it was just wonderful..husband had the 8 oz filet.. we also got the asparagus and the au gratin potatoes.. The asparagus was really good, but the au gratin potatoes were sort of meh.. We were asked to cut our steaks to make sure it was cooked to our liking.. Our server was just great.. we drank ice tea and our glasses were never less than half full...   They offer valet and self parking.  Overall our experience was just wonderful, and we hope to return.

PzYjmkRd67Pkat-LhKSwVQ.text: Great food, great service.  Rib-eye medium rare done perfectly.  Sides - lobster mac and cheese, asparagus and scalloped potatoes - all excellent.  The crab cake appetizer is a great way to start off the meal.

T7uI02KbTFCq9T9RdksiWQ.text: This is my go-to place for the best ribeye in town. The staff is always on point and making sure everything is to our liking. The place isn't cheap so to have staff constantly checking on us makes it worth the price for the ribeyes.

5BDfkAv_sr9gstYD_cJVHg.text: An absolute joke. Party of 10 seated for 45 minutes without a waiter ot water. I got up and asked for a waiter and he came and faked an injury walking behind my chair. 2 hours later still no food. Left $200 with my to cover my share of food I never got. I talked to the manager and told her to everything. She said she would take care of my friends. 4 hours later and nothing, my friends finished dinner. Lot's of great steakhouses in Vegas. DO NOT GO HERE!

JcUlRlU410u0K7Yt4UdNwA.text: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at Del Friscos in Las Vegas and we enjoyed our dining experience. Nigel, our server, was very informative and extremely helpful! We were very pleased with Nigel's drink and food suggestions. In addition, the food and cocktails that we ordered were absolutely wonderful! For starters we both chose the VIP (Vodka infused with pineapple) cocktail. For our first course we ordered their chopped salad that had blue cheese, avocado, bacon with a basil vinaigrette. For the entree we ordered the Wagyu Tomahawk chop, Lobster Mac and Cheese and creamed spinach. Our dessert consisted of a sorbet trio which consisted of a lemon, mango, and blackberry sorbet. The dessert was a nice and light palette cleanser to a rich and delicious meal.  We will be returning for sure!

58B2SuTAvNVqDRGxf-Sz7A.text: Came here for a bachelor party. Great service and great food. We were loud, had the drinks flowing, and there were no problems.  Bachelor enjoyed it and that's all that mattered.

g_qtJmGsPFUXVbWu8Dw9rg.text: Del Frisco's is definitely a go-to place for delicious meat and sides. We had a party of 8 people and had plenty of side dishes to go around. I indulged in the delicious crab cakes and lobster mac 'n cheese. That's right I said LOBSTER mac 'n cheese!! Everyone else had steak and repeatedly salivated with every bite taken, so I take that as a positive sign of delicious goodness!   Sides: + Creamed Spinach + Lobster Mac 'n Cheese + Scallop Potatoes + Sauteed Mushrooms + Creamed Corn

r_A-ho1rdz-6sMMEEzqkew.text: Reservation went off without a hitch and we got a nice comfy seat in the quieter part of the restaurant.  Service was impeccable, our waiter was attentive, knowledgable about the food, not overbearing (good balance between "there just before we needed him" and "gone when we did not") and quick with refills.  Food was very good! Steak was cooked just right, maybe slightly on the rare side like it ought to be, sides were yummy and plenty of 'em, salad was crispy and fresh. The filet was buttery, tender and with great flavor, my better half's crab cakes had big chunks of crab in them - all good. Anything wrong? well, the ice tea was good but I had better, maybe this was an older brew.  We checked out the James Bond wine table afterwards, pretty corny in a good Vegas-style way. Made some jokes about the wine bottles being "shaken, not stirred" and after a tortured smile from the staff we went our separate ways. We'll definitely BE BACK! Oh wait, different movie, nevermind... :)

GgTa2Hil9jGfTATkSggnsQ.text: Great food & friendly service. Food was mouth watering!  Ribeye was cooked perfectly, steamed and sauteed veggies done just right. Must try the lobster Mac!!

uolLTy8OpjuJ1pRphSXfoQ.text: This place was GREAT! My mom took me here for dinner while I was in Vegas and I had a great experience. Service was excellent, the live music was enjoyable, and the food was phenomenal! All of us had filet mignon, which was cooked to perfection and plenty flavorful. The sides we ordered (baked potatoes, sauteed mushrooms, onion rings) were also fantastic. We brought leftovers back to our timeshare! This is a great place to take people, but you WILL spend quite a bit of money. However, it's COMPLETELY worth it!

7ZvX83DNKMM7KO5iDIW-MQ.text: My husband and I came here this past Friday night.  We read the reviews and thought we HAD to try it.  The decor and entertainment (live piano player) was great, but the food was so-so.  I've definitely had better (Ruth's Chris; Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak and Stone Crab).  My steak was cook right, but there was a major lack of flavor.  It tasted like a plain piece of meat.  We ordered the potatoes au gratin and those were blan tasting too.  I'm not too sure what everyone else is raving about?!  Perhaps my husband and I ate there on a off-night? Not too sure. All I know is we definitely won't be coming here again.

4fCcBl0R_PGIyuXdSzduww.text: A wonderful dining experience. The service was impeccable and the food was wonderful.  We started with the crab cake with cajun sauce which was delicious. We each had a salad. The caesar was good and the croutons were obviously made right there because they melted in your mouth. I had the 22 porterhouse steak, medium rare, which came out exactly as ordered. Delicious clear to the bone. My wife had two 4 oz filet mignon medallions. One was served "oscar" style with bernaise, crab and asparagus. The other was served with a jumbo shrimp and a large scallop.  For sides we chose the asparagus, sauteed mushrooms and the potatoes au gratin. The whole meal was a great dining experience. For dessert we had coffee and the lemon cake. We will definitely be going back on our next trip to Vegas.

aV1gpKclpJ-US_lFJci11g.text: delicious!  was in vegas over the weekend with the bf and some friends. we went here for a birthday dinner on saturday night. the service was stellar. our waitress was very friendly and personable. the bf got a humongous prime rib (something like 36 oz!), two friends got the porterhouse and myself and kat a. got the featured filet with shrimp. everything was wonderful. paired that with some mashed potatoes, 3 cheese macaroni and some asparagus and you're in for a treat.  try the creme brulee. it was amazing. it had a little bit of cinnamon in it which brought out the flavors nicely.

XhqQ_Ja2IpYIiFqdb4sonw.text: Waitress was amazingly attentive, food was delish...only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because it took FOREVER for the food to come out.

Agh73MY2toWjJURGijP3pA.text: I can't stop raving about this restaurant. This is the best steakhouse that I have ever been to and my steak came out absolutely perfect. They want you to cut the meat to make sure it is to your liking before walking away. I promptly cut off a piece of meat, stuffed it in my mouth, and salivated as I tasted an explosion of flavors. The fish and seafood soup was delicious too.     The service was fantastic and I was so impressed on how on top of things they were. The servers, hosts, and managers all worked together and catered to the customer's every need. Our server was friendly and attentive and when he wasn't around there was always someone to assist us. At one point I was reaching for the spoon for the yummy sauted mushrooms and one of the managers rushed over to scoop the mushrooms on my plate.  Unexpected, but definitely appreciated. Different hostess and managers would walk around and make sure you had water etc.   I am making it a point to stop by every time I'm in town

FJLEIHfjPg66xupHaFv5UQ.text: Love the steak over here. I have tried 3 steakhouses here in Vegas and this one is my favorite.  It is located outside of the strip so you would probably have to drive or cab there.  They have an extensive winelist and we had the rib eye and a fillet mignon which were both cooked to perfection.  A no BS, oldschool steakhouse where you can get full off of good, fat, juicy meat

0mNnQhcPDrEzvyxcV-3sgA.text: Just OK. Will be heading back for a second time to do a rereview though.

IL0y8vm8wUjg8MQuoECBRw.text: My favorite Rib-Eye in Vegas besides my own.  It is about the same price as every steakhouse in Vegas with sides ala carte.  But it is by far the tastiest and the decoration is nice and classy.

e2f6AN93uN_U_uwqYe-ASg.text: This might be the best steak house I've ever been to.  Got a bone in ribeye that was so juicy and so good I wolfed that thing down like I hadn't eaten in days.  The sides were pretty good and were served to us by the staff.  The best part about it was that when your steak came out they asked you to cut a slice and taste it to make sure that this is what you want.  Presumably, if they over or under cooked the steak they would take it back and get it right.  Mine was perfect but I appreciate that they wanted to make sure the steak was properly cooked.  I'm heading back here soon!

G2JQtIawSASSd1Cr6mKy4Q.text: Took several business associates to dinner last week just prior to the start of our trade show.  I dealt with a knowledgeable booker who arranged a private room, Dakota,  for our party of 9 the afternoon of my dinner.    I arrived 30 minutes prior to the scheduled time and was escorted to the room promptly.  I was introduced to my two servers, Jonathan and another guy, who were both professional and proficient.  I explained how I wanted the meal to proceed and they were appropriately accommodating.    Most everyone in our party ordered some sort of steak and they were uniformly excellent.  Mine was the bone-in filet and it was great.  I started with the shrimp roumalade (sp) that I had ordered on a previous occasion there and it was great.  Large, meaty shrimp in a tangy sauce.    One of the sides ordered was some potato chip thing that got raves from everyone there.  The wine list was extensive enough to enable anyone to find something appropriate.    We were fortunate enough to wind up getting a tour of the kitchen as well as a first hand look at the James Bond Table.  It was a great way to break up the meal and my associates are still talking about it.  The whole meal was great start to finish and I would certainly recommend Del Friscos to anyone looking  for a reliable steak place in Vegas.

zHrnI1rcEneBZZ69VsOl7A.text: Bite after bite was orgasmic!!! I ordered a filet mignon special and it was amazing. This is a great restaurant, with awesome service. Unfortunately, there was a fly in my wine which turned me off severely. Other than that, great choice nat! I'll give it an A-.

Rr78w4hWPqfJTPoL1A7Pkw.text: An absolute must if you're in town. I've eaten at Cut at the Palazzo and I still love Del Frisco's and their "steakhouse" feel of a restaurant and the food is devine!!! YOU MUST GO!

cS8tNnIVeEoFnu4IDoxrxw.text: The filet smothered in a blue cheese sauce was decadent...to say the least.  Been years since I've been there and it still gets my vote for best steak ever!

nJcftoqX5wpiuiBQuq_NWw.text: My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!! Great food and the best service Anywhere in this town.. The staff really want to make Sure your meal is Perfect- and always make me feel so welcome!! The singer/pianist is wonderful too. This reastaurant has the perfect blend of sophiscication and comfortable atmosphere!

ifuQCwmEWc8xu-Ye391b0Q.text: We come to Vegas once a year and we were looking for a killer steakhouse. Yelp did not disappoint. Everything was great from the service to the food to the Kobe beef steak for 2 to the wine and desert. We enjoyed ourselves for about 3 1/2 hours and were never rushed to get out of there as they did not need to clear the table for someone else. $350 for 2 including the tip and it was a very nice evening. Agree 100% with all the other reviews. You can't go wrong here.

0Ya91j-xclMDxQ-kyLlfuw.text: I went here for drug company dinner and I was impressed. The service and filet were perfect. I prefer this establishment to Mortons or Ruth Chris. I didn't get the opportunity to order off the wine list but next time.

d4S4qvLD71fOAnRYHm97rw.text: Amazing!  Each time I go to Del Friscos the experience gets better and exceeds my expectations.  Great steaks, seafood, side dishes, wine selection and most of all, excellent service!  Their staff is so personable that you immediately feel as though you have had a long friendship with the server.  This is the place to bring friends who are visiting Las Vegas as it is sure to impress.  So far, my favorite place in Las Vegas.

vHuL8Yksg6D95Xf-bTWJkA.text: The boyfriend and I took a cab here from the Strip.  There's plenty of parking and valet, so I would recommend driving here and saving yourself $10+ for the cab ride.  Overall, the food was good.  It wasn't spectacular so I probably wouldn't come back again though.   The cream corn was disappointing - the manager took it off the check.

HcqwDVK8xpSKU6xrKxvqxw.text: Perhaps the best meal I've ever had in my life!  For starters, service was definitely the best I ever had.  He knew the menu inside and out and was a great host to our bachelor party.  My 12 oz filet was perfectly cooked and I mooched some truffle butter off someone else which was delicious.  The creamed spinach, corn, lobster mac & cheese, and mushrooms were all perfect complements.  You'll pay the price but the quality doesn't get any better than this.

SpvEstCGjzZyGfLiVaEsfA.text: Wow, great steak. I ordered the american wygu tomahawk ribeye. And we also ordered the 1/2 pound king crab. We should have ordered the full pound half was too small. Everything was great! The service was incredible from the hostess that greets you at the door to the team of servers that take care of you at the table. For dessert we itdered the banana bread pudding. It was delicious just wish i had a little more ice cream.  The wife got the vip martini and she loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American wygu tomahawk ribeye medium. It was incredible. It was also $90.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding.

02BtyP43sH_L3_oMTxADkQ.text: What an excellent experience my wife and I had!! We came in for a early anniversary dinner and we're greeted with a nice card and congrats by the hostess staff , the manager and our waitress Lisa. The food is very good and the service from start to finish was impeccable!! Thank you all for a great evening!!

eTjllRXlQvGCn68OmACLkQ.text: This place rocks, Over the top service, Great food, Have never had a bad meal  We have been going here for years

XgiVHHApWPr5tZRNH-tgJQ.text: I was very disappointed in my last visit to Del Frisco.  Let me set the stage, I was with a large group in a private room that had a minimum spend of $1200.  We had brought a special (and expensive) bottle of wine to celebrate the occasion.  The restaurant stance was that they will not open any outside wine that is on their wine list, mind you the wine list had the incorrect year, so technically it wasn't on their wine list.  After much hemming and hawing and getting management involved they finally agreed to open the wine for an outrageous $50 corkage.  Also keep in mind we had told them we were going to order at least 3 additional bottles of wine from their wine list.   I was shocked by the behavior and attitude that we received over this bottle!!  Onto the food.... I started with the crab cake and seafood soup, both excellent and worthy of 5 stars. For my main course I ordered the petite filet, I was so disappointed.  It was way too thin and overcooked.  My husband got the larger filet which was nice and thick and cooked beautifully.  I was surprised by the quality disparity between the two filets. For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake, very rich and delicious.

KZdqI_rG4Jr9MwOClKP53g.text: This is my favorite  steakhouse  in Las Vegas.  They know you by your name.  Service  is outstanding.  Great bread . Steak was cooked  perfectly.  Large portions.  Private  rooms are available.  I love their  ribeye. It  can be a little  pricey.  We rend to share dishes

VFRMZhscGZA9BflHzXx5lA.text: I was very excited about visiting this place and wanted a good steakhouse off the strip while visiting Vegas.Let me just say, food was extremely good here! I got the filet which was good with crab topper, my boyfriend got the bone in prime ribeye which was amazing! Crab cakes are a must! The only thing was service was not great. Loved my waitress- sweet and knowledgeable-but everyone seemed to rush us and gave us a lot of information at once so it was confusing. Bartender at the bar was rushing, they sat our table near the kitchen when there was a lot of other open much better tables. The wine recommender didn't seem happy to talk to us about the wine. I will come back for the food for sure, just hesitant with service.

7kuudd9CA3e25qogU4XN_A.text: I really hate to leave this place only one star but I didn't have such a great experience here. I'm going to talk about the food and the service here.   Regarding the food - their crab cake was pretty good, but I feel like the filet is so hyped up. I honestly didn't think it was as good as other places in Vegas. I thought the filet was a little too burnt on the outside, and yes, it did somewhat melt in my mouth, but there wasn't enough flavor. I also got the sauteed mushrooms, which I thought were bland and regular. Their scallops were too salty and their mashed potatoes weren't great either :( I would rate their food a 2.   But their service is what really got to me and why I'm giving it only one star. First, we ordered the crab cake, and then we decided to switch to the prix fixe menu. And it said crab cake was part of the prix fixe menu. So from our two prix fixe orders, we told the waitress that since we already ordered the crab cake as one appetizer, we'll just get the scallops as the second appetizer. We kept clarifying, because we knew she was confused, that we were only going to get ONE appetizer because we already ordered crab cakes as the other appetizer from the two prix fixe menu.   In the end, of course, she brings out two appetizers of scallops and we get charged for an extra order of crab cake. We didn't even bother trying to argue it out with her. It was just a mess, she gave us the wrong check and then it took forever for her to swipe our card.   I would honestly never go back. I think I'll be trying Mastro's next.

uNxS_gg3vLC5yZDLPwaNJA.text: If Yelp can do more than 5 stars, this restaurant deserves a 10! Very much impressed by this establishment. This restaurant needs to come to Orange County-- it would be my Mastros. I give this 10 stars for 10 reasons: 1.) Staff/ Servers are very friendly and accommodating. They would have conversations with you because they have time to& because they want you to feel comfortable; not one attends to you, several servers do- They work as a team.  2.) Water level --on point. Never had to ask for refill!  3.) Atmosphere . Some say it's loud, but I enjoy the live performer on the piano singing. Definitely a personal touch rather than the same old music playing through speakers  4.) Yes please, scoop those sesame seeds (from complimentary bread loaf) off my table ;) Cleanliness is always a plus and never goes unnoticed :) 5.) Crab cakes --TO DIE FOR. Best crab cake I've ever tasted! (Even though I only got one)Crab in every bite! And that sauce!! Mmm! 6.) Serving your dishes: Had 3 servers come out at once to put sides on your plate . Wow, talk about a proper serving! 7.)  House salad n chopped salad . Simple yet delicious! Thee best! Thick slices of bacon *thumbs up* 8.) Lobster Mac so creamy n cheesy. & the Sauteed mushrooms --just the right buttery n peppery flavor   9.) THE STEAKS . O m g .. Thick n cooked right the first time. Medium well. Dry Rub was perfect 10.) Our complimentary lemon cake . Such a huge slice! Tasty n not too sweet    10 STARS!!!! Will be back forsure !

Qtry3kFP5h9YHUj5soZIFw.text: The service was excellent and the food was good.  Tuna tartare was soooo yummy that even my husband who doesn't like raw fish ate almost the whole plate :)   But the chop salad had too much dressing on it.  The bone-in rib eye was so tender but I would like it to be less butter. Bone-In Filet was flavorful tho. When the steaks came on the table, our server asked us to cut in the meddle of the steaks to see if they were cooked what we liked. End up my husband's filet needed to cook a little longer. The lemon cake was so tasty that we had to pack the left over cake :)  Over all, worth the price, we will definitely go back!!

qL0a4C8-6hdISnobSDvfEA.text: For my friend's birthday, she wanted steak, so after looking around at several different places in Vegas, we decided to try Del Frisco's because they have a summer special of dinner for two for $99.00 and boy oh boy, it was an excellent meal!  The "Power Couple" is a specially priced three-course dinner for two.  Valid until 9/5/2011.  From the Del Frisco website, it comes with:  -  STARTER (Choice of one per guest) DEL'S SALAD or CAESAR SALAD  - SIDE (Choice of one per guest) CHATEAU POTATOES or SPINACH SUPREME or BAKED POTATO or SAUTEED MUSHROOMS or VEGETABLE OF THE DAY  - ENTREES (For each guest) 8 OZ. FILET MIGNON and SIGNATURE CRAB CAKE  - DESSERT (Choice of one per guest) CHEESECAKE or BREAD PUDDING or CHOCOLATE MOUSSE  The food and service was superb.  Absolutely excellent!!!  I had the Del's Salad, Baked Potato (and some of her sauteed mushrooms), filet (medium rare), crab cake, and bread pudding.  The restaurant makes double, triple and quadruple sure that your steak is cooked perfectly to your liking!!!  The night we went, there was a live performer, a guy playing piano and singing.  Most of the selections were Earth, Wind, and Fire, Barry White, etc.  Overall, an excellent dining experience!  Just too much food for me.  We couldn't finish the baked potato, sauteed mushrooms, or the desserts.  It's too bad we weren't able to eat them later.  The restaurant decor is very classy.  There's hardly any light in the restaurant, so it was hard to take pictures without a flash (Please see my pictures).  If you're looking for an excellent steak, try Del Frisco's!!!  Xie Xie!!!

MMLxaE8IYc64959rE9T8Eg.text: Came here for dinner with a bunch of guys  and it definitely is a very man's place.  When I walked in, it was all men which was weird.  We were seated quickly but as one of my friend's pointed out, why are there TVs, it makes the place tacky.  I'm not a big fan of TVs in restaurants unless it's in the bar or if it's a sports bar type of restaurant.  TV in the dining room in the steakhouse?  No thank you.  I think with the NBA playoffs on, it took half of my attention away during dinner.  So how was the food?  Eh, it really wasn't all that good.  Steak was oily, didn't have a lot of flavor and the foie gras buttered we ordered didn't even have that much foie gras taste to it.  They didn't specify the steaks were dry aged or anything and I felt the selection was limited.  The waiter kept on pushing us to order the lobster tail which was pretty pricey but we didn't.  We ordered crab cakes and calamari to share and it was average.  They do have a James Bond table which opens up with many James Bond bottle of wines (labels had James Bond pictures and etc) and plays the 007 theme.  That was pretty cool and probably the highlight of the place.    If you like old school steak house I think this would be good for you but if you don't then skip it.

pv-aBiTQWXTD5Tnk9yo8JQ.text: My favorite steakhouse in Vegas! Now let me clarify.... I have been to a ton of steakhouses here. That is kinda my thing. But.... If you want the chaos, hustle and bustle of the casinos.... THIS PLACE ISNT FOR YOU!!! Located off of the strip, it is easy access in and out, best service ever, and the food is amazing! Don't forget to have the staff show you the James Bond table!

N1CodioifqIP0oi-5V7jrA.text: Now here's a great restaurant that server great food.  The rib eye was cooked to our liking and the service was stellar.  If you're in the mood for steaks, this is a a must try!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o8YsgldWAFZUVwFVzvmOuA.text: We dinned at Del Friscos last night and ate the best steak we have both ever had. The service is exceptional. Would recommend the crab cakes, potato gratin and mac and cheese.   Superb restaurant all round and would defo eat their again.

li2EedjBDIPFI_wtjNRbHQ.text: Food was great but it was the service that was so incredible! Trina was our server and she did an amazing job!

_X209yXpcVMxPXTnUXHKOQ.text: Best steak in the world!  The James Bond themed wine carousel room  is a must see!  The atmosphore and service = A+  Make sure to call ahead and make a reservation! You won't find better service anywhere else.   They even put ice in the urinals!  Cleanest bathrooms. You put me to bed with the key lime pie. SO GOOD! See you soon.

Bmjl_I1ucQNAKOuZ8e96Mg.text: I had my very first steak experience at Del Frisco's for my boyfriend's 21st birthday in Vegas. He's somehow slowly turned me onto beef, and this was the perfect place to try the highly lauded steak. First of all, the sesame seed bread that is served before the meal is incredible. We went through almost 3 rolls before our food even got there! We also tried their signature martini that had a great pineapple flavor.   I had one of their specials of the day, which included two jumbo shrimp and an 8 oz filet mignon. The meat was perfectly tender and juicy. I'm not a huge meat lover, so the portion was just enough to not be over the top. We also shared a lobster mac and cheese that was a little too creamy and cheesy for me, but it was overflowing with tender pieces of lobster. Since we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us a piece of their lemon cake on the house. It was a huge slice, and the texture of the cake was dense in the perfect way. The frosting wasn't overwhelming, with just a thin layer between each of the six layers of cake.   As a poor college student, this kind of dining experience only comes around once in awhile. The service was extremely attentive and the food was probably too high-quality for me to recognize! I now have exceedingly high standards for steak, so if I can ever come back I definitely will.

jJ7X_MVeSWbNI6XacnbSdg.text: It was pretty decent. Nice ambiance and staff. High quality meet and tasty. Might be a lil on high side but like any other Stake place! Had to wait for 25 min but it was NY time too. Liked their cocktail.

Tl6Emu_0tbh4dc2cgIReWg.text: Great service in a relaxed, elegant atmosphere. The service was superior, with a good blend of professionalism and friendliness without being "snooty". Not for the fair of heart on a low budget maybe, but the food was incredible. I had a daily special of three filet medallions each with their own topping, along with the lobster mac-n-cheese and they we're absolutely wonderful. My sister had the large lobster which they crack and de-shell at your table for you.  Everything was exceptional (again, for a hefty price tag) and I'd certainly recommend it for anyone interested in fine steaks & seafood a little off the strip.

Fka0gi5IQ9WOu6gn9PmpCg.text: Love this chain! Always great steaks. This location is very welcoming and kids friendly. Visited and enjoyed it normally. Basic things like - Knowing there is no kids menu we asked for lobster mac and cheese for the little one (without lobster) - well it was served w lobster and an apology. We had couple of basic pairings - my steak was served w my daughter's pairing and vice versa. I think when I go to any of these high end chains I expect some basic service.  Finally my son and my wife had bunch of fat that was suppose to be trimmed IMO.  While our waitress was very friendly - service and good quality was average this time - below our expectations.

dVb-CW7H0EERnCLpfwFa3Q.text: We had ribeye, Mac& Cheese topped w lobster, and   red wine! OMG best dinner  ever! Must try the signature pineapple drink-

PP_7l-VqNv7Qx2VE9HD_1Q.text: Looking for a steakhouse? You're in the right town. It seems every casino has one, and the usual suspects are also here, as well as Brazilian and Italian steakhouses and meat markets of every variety.   We visited Del Frisco's on Valentine's Day and were not blown away, although the food was really pretty good. The shrimp cocktail came with huge prawns, the oysters on the half-shell were fresh, the steaks were excellent, and a lamb dish was delicious after we sent it back for a bit more searing - it originally arrived nearly raw. The side dishes were good, too - creamed spinach with bacon, and lobster mac and cheese.  The service was oft-putting. Way too aggressive. Almost like we were being coached...to spend more money. Back off on the up-sell, people. Your customers are going to overspend for dinner, regardless.   Four stars for the food. Minus-one for the service vibe.

BuFDd9EemMHlT2fvm8bi7w.text: If you have been to the Del Frisco's in Houston then you are probably expecting a wonderful experience in Las Vegas. Sadly, when you enter Del Frisco's of Las Vegas you quickly find that not only is it in a terrible location with no view - but it's interior and overall atmosphere is poor right from the second you enter the door. Aside from that, let's just get down to the food which is what we want. Del Frisco's prides themselves on service and presentation - you get neither in Las Vegas. I loved Del Frisco's in Houston - I went several times per month.   Upon making a reservation in Las Vegas - they asked was there anything special - I advised them a birthday. Once we arrived, we were placed in a table in the center of a room. Not that I'm too particular, but the arrangement of their furniture in this cramped dark building does not make for a nice dining experience. Anytime they place you in a table in the center of the room you get the great fortune of being gawked at as others lose interest in their table. As well, the service was not up to par. One server waited on us - rushed through the menu.   Once the food arrived, it was not up to standard. Steak was not cooked well and the cut of meat was poor. As well, the drinks did not taste fresh. Lastly, the birthday we mentioned during the reservation was forgotten. I will NEVER go back to this one. Horrific! Poor location, no view, horrific lighting, poor layout of tables and poorly trained staff. If you want a solid steak - Fix at the Bellagio is the best in town.

XJJ7E6ZY-oCicYalFoxNwQ.text: The filet mignon and lobster mac and cheese was to die for! The James Bond table was pretty awesome too.

nUqrF-h9S7myCcvNDecOvw.text: SUPERB customer service.  Came here for steak of course, but I got bacon on demand here. I was being a drunk idiot and they still provided excellent customer service.  To the waiter's name I forgot. Thanks for running out and giving me the order of bacon I jokingly asked for you. You my bro, bro.

wQS5l-TEQSZNNcz_SMZhVw.text: Good food, good service and decent ambience. I'd return for sure. No complaints! Steak, sides, drinks and dessert hit the spot :))

Es3MjP7evyWpv75mJ7kEBg.text: UNBELIEVABLE Steaks!   Came here with my friends for my birthday all the way from California and was not disappointed.   Between the group we tried the F.M., the Prime Rib Eye, the Prime Porterhouse and all where cooked to perfection. The meat was so well cooked even the small amount of fat was delicious.   We also had the lobster mac n cheese and sauteed mushrooms, both totwally worth it.   One warning if you're getting a larger cut of meat (16oz +) you may want to stick to the leaner sides as the lobster m&c was delicious but very rich.   We saw a couple of tables around us order lobster tails that where HUGE so if you're a lobster nut then it may be worth it. All of us where there for the steak so we where good to go.   Last note the service was top notch and everyone from the hostess to all the wait staff where amazing at their jobs so it made for a extra memorable meal.   Til next time D.F.!

nYKJSvdYQiZ3WKl27eXpFQ.text: Awesome service, Destin you rock, great atmosphere, Piano Man off the charts, and the food had to be Great!!! Video or pic of the 007 wines will do you no justice, gotta see to believe... See you in September for sure...

fDG0e-Q0QOj_f1BdwMVq0Q.text: This place was awesome.  Everything was amazing. The steak down to the side salad (and to be honest, I am not a fan of salad). I am sure this rivals the top steakhouses on the strip (it's probably even better). The service is top notch, they seem to work in a team and to make sure that you are taken care of. There was a slight delay with getting one of our mixed drinks and they made sure to let us know that we weren't forgotten.  We added on stone crab as well (the same as what Joe's has). Very nice.  Everyone dresses up so go at least business casual. They do have a sign in front, something like "dress code required". I didn't read any anything specific (jackets etc). There patio set-up looked nice. Next time, assuming it's not blazing hot, I would like to sit out there.  They also have this awesome James Bond table (you gotta ask about it!). I would definitely be back!!! Well worth it!!!!

QblPZ79-a7FF2X29pd5T7g.text: I have eaten at Del Friscos at least three times, due to friends birthday dinners and have never had a good experience. The service is always slow the food is never cooked right. I ordered the bone in filet this very last time and it was extremely fatty definitely not a good cut. We were even told our cab was outside waiting for us towards the end of dinner and in fact it was not. This place really needs to get it together and I do not understand the excellent reviews this restaurant gets. the only thing we enjoyed here was the lemon cake.   To be honest this restaurant is at the same level as Outback Steakhouse. The only plus is that the noise level wasn't too loud so you can actually conduct a little business during dinner. With so many options in Las Vegas I will never return to the steak house no matter which occasion it may be.

PwfnRr2UPZQGbVQRdLFeHw.text: Without a doubt, the food here is exceptional - just read what everyone else has to say about this place.  However, at this price point, if your experience isn't flawless it's just not worth it. Here's the experience I had:  I recommended this place to a buddy of mine for his first wedding anniversary.  I personally called and made the reservation and let them know and he and his wife would be celebrating.  I did make a special request,  I asked if there was any way I could get them a round of drinks and a dessert on me.  The person who took the call said they could accommodate this request, asked me for my e-mail address and assured me everything would be taken care of.  I never heard back from them - my buddy never got his round and his dessert.  I realize that they probably don't get requests like this often, but if it wasn't possible/feasible please let me know.  Don't promise me that you can accommodate when you can't or don't have any intention in doing so.

cwkwOlqFxJ6IbSlSDIkLKg.text: My last meal would be from Del Frisco's.  My first experience was with the Del Frisco's in Orlando.  When I found out that there was a Del Frisco's a little closer to home (closer as in Las Vegas is only 270 miles away from SoCal), I was ecstatic.  The food and service is unparalleled.  It's an upscale, expensive steakhouse, but soooooo worth it.... over and over again.  I'd go there just for the bread!  I request some bread to take home at the end of the meal.  I treated my family to an extravagant dinner here (mostly because I wanted to go).    We went in for an early dinner because we had slightly unpredictable 3- and 5-year old boys with us, so we didn't want to go when it was busy.  The waitstaff was extremely hospitable and went out of their way to cater to all of us.  I was blown away that they didn't mind the kids making a bit of a mess and running around getting in their way.  In fact, the staff was more amazed that my nephews figured out some of the silverware was magnetized!  A fun distraction for the kids.  I think the staff quickly printed out some pictures for the kids to color when they saw us sit down.  Back to the food.... amazing, heavenly, mouth-watering.  The steak is the best I've ever had, and I'm a steak kind of gal.  Sides are usually ordered separately, but the prix fixe menu was very convenient.  Del Frisco's is hands down, my favorite restaurant.

NXPDdw5m-KYXfqa-qB1IQQ.text: I came with some colleagues for dinner on a Wednesday evening. We ordered the Seafood appetizer. I got the 22oz bone-in prime rib and my GF got the 8oz Filet mignon.  - Amazing service. Truly 5 star.  *We came 30min late, and the hostess escorted us to our party  *She asked if I had a preference of the kind of Vodka for my screwdriver, then gave me recommendations.  *Waitress addresses today's specials and recommendations.  *Multiple servers catering for us *She asked me to cut my prime rib to ensure that it was cooked medium, if not she'll take it back *Hot towels. Not the ones in a plastic.  *Farewells from lots of staff as we left.  *They hand feed you...lol. jk.  - Great presentation. The seafood platter looked like a piece of art.  - Delicious meat. I usually stuff my mouth with all kinds of food at once, but the prime rib was so good that I chewed each piece independently. No concurrent side in mouth. No fast chewing. Really enjoying the rich flavor and texture until I swallowed it. haha. sounds gross.  - Nice piano cocktail music that sets the tone.  - I do have a bias for Maestro's Ocean Club in NPB simply bc that was where we had our first date. Nonetheless, this is an incredible place for any special occasion. James Bond table!
