Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar menu. Happy hour 4:30-6:30.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bacon cheeseburger.

KhhrUCSYChl9Y9ZgpcVPxQ.text: Traditional steak house where sides are separate orders. Had the filet mignon and it was delicious. When they brought out the steak, they ask you cut it to make sure it is cooked to your liking. The steak is pretty good. I for one am not a big fan of filet mignon but this one was good. I am definitely a fan of this place now.

QJ-Wnn3zf78-OHREXtyUWA.text: I loved the food and service. Definitely 5 stars. I can't wait to go again!  I had the tastiest filet of my life and one of the best crab cakes too. My husband is a big fan of Mastro's, but I liked Del Frisco's meat better, it just tasted better imo, and was memorable. Del Frisco's crab cakes were sweet and juicy and meaty, with just the right amount of filler (almost none lol), even better than some crab cakes I've had in Maryland (I'm originally from the east coast). Banana bread pudding was also better than I thought it would be! So yummy! I don't really remember the side dishes though.  The entire staff went out of their way to be friendly and attentive. We were on our honeymoon and the staff hand signed a card for us and everyone that passed our table gave cheerful congratulations. It was fun.  The only minor complaint is that I wish the music wasn't so loud, or maybe classier or jazzier. I also wasn't a fan of the pineapple infused cocktail, it wasn't sweet enough and too strong for me! Ha ha, light weight.

OOUZ5kH6aQdMC_QA_9EySg.text: What can i even say about this place? Well it is the best damn steak house in all of Vegas (IMO). And i've been to all of the good ones i think. SW, Botero, Switch, Cut, Del Monicos, Prime Steak house, craft steak, the mansion, and even paiza club, and others. But this is until i find another one this steak house is the best.   What we had: 3x Bone-in Filet Mignon 1x Gumbo 1x Seafood Soup 1x Seafood Cocktail 1x Asparagus 1x Lobster Mac & Cheese  The steak was flavorful almost too flavorful and seasoned, juicy and succulent. My  mouth is watering writing about this. They do it just right while they cook the meat, it's hot through out but red and not over cooked. Do you know how hard it is to cook a nice rare piece of beef?   Mac and cheese hmmm cheesy with lobster and small shells.  Asparagus - steamed Shrimp Cocktail - big fresh pieces of shrimp.  and the soup was just ok.  We ordered a bottle of wine called Mica by Buccela one of the up and coming wineries that most have yet to hear about it. Great Cab blend.   All in all my dining experience was a 5.5 out of 5. I mean it was phenomenal.   I will be back for more next time i'm in Vegas. Always a stop for me...

TDsAIXdC0Nm74mNvTSqrGQ.text: Fantastic service.  Very personal and welcoming.  Great with my kids    The food was fantastic the portions were large

atQHtaJcYD0VcEDkk2YQ-w.text: Had a great dinner there. Great Ambience. Very good service. Loved my NY Steak. Friend liked his bone in Filet. Loved the Sweet potato side dish.  Bread was just fair. Head chef came over and chatted with us, what a nice treat.

bGUFBuMqZsKN-mqqKc8w-w.text: We went for a bachelor/bachelorette/birthday party, and made a reservation for 18. Del Frisco's staff was not only easy to communicate with regarding he reservations and details, but they were always 1 step ahead of what we needed. Amazing customer service by their wonderful staff, very great and entertaining people they have there, everyone was just so friendly! They're steaks were perfectly cooked, and for 18 people, everything came out fast, in past experience, the larger the party, the slower the service. Not in the case of Del Frisco's! If you're in Las Vegas, definitely give this place a shot. A wonderful way to end our last evening in Vegas. Thank you Del Frisco's. We will be back!

f0vfiVIje7RPAToJbUiDbA.text: Del Friscos is my pinnacle of sublime cow. Several years ago my husband and I discovered Charleys Steakhouse in Orlando, and we picked up a list of the Top Ten steakhouses. We've tried several of them, but we always come back to Del Friscos. This is our third visit to the Las Vegas location, and once again we were impressed with the service and the food.  Service at Del Friscos is always amazing. We received our salad and entrees perfectly prepared and with panache. Who knew that spooning potatoes onto my plate could actually be an art form? My husband and I shared the Porterhouse, medium rare. It was deftly sliced into shareable pieces and placed on perfectly buttered and heated plates. The sides, potatoes and asparagus, were portioned on to our plates alongside the juicy steak. Everything was cooked perfectly, and the utmost attention was given to all diners in the restaurant.   I'm ridiculously happy that a Del Friscos has finally opened in Boston. This could get dangerous.....

xobonCRg-HFzQ_2jplsQSQ.text: The bad- Well for the price I expected more.  Don't get me wrong the food was good but boy was it expensive.  I dont usually eat at high end steakhouses because I can cook a steak at home.  We were out for a night on the town so why not splurge a little.  I think our server was not as experienced as the others.  I heard other servers articulating the menu as well as mentioning things that were not on the menu.  Ours did not do that.  The place smelled like sewage in the main area.  Luckily our section was fine.  The air conditioning was awfully cold.  We spent just under $200 once tip was added for my wife and I.  And that was without drinks. The good- 32 oz was cooked and seasoned just the way I like it.  Its nice having a steak being served on an extremely hot plate.  Mashed sweet potato were really tasty.  And the asparagus was perfectly cooked and still crunchy.  The chocolate mousse was not overly rich tasty like many other places.

ehtVbmkW5nJJajRsVkXGIw.text: We have been going to this place for years. It has become an excuse for a 4 hour drive to Vegas. Everything about Del Frisco's from the service to the wine list to the food...hmmm the food...is absolutely top notch.   Considering other places that offer this level of quality the prices are actually quite reasonable. With appetizer and dessert (no alcohol) my wife and I usually spend $150 (including tip).   The key things on the menu that you should not miss are:   Crab Cake - Large and very dense. these are not the crab cakes you find at most restaurant that are fried, these are mountains of crab surrounded by a delicious spicy sauce (i would call it medium). 2 people could share one easily.   Rib Eye - All the steaks on the menu I'm sure are delicious, but our our order is always the rib eye. We usually order the carpet bagger (10 oz steak with Mash Potatoes) or you can order the steak alone that come in 16 oz + sizes.   Mash Potatoes - These are a dream. buttery with a kick of onion. They bring it to the table with fresh butter on top to make it extra creamy. The carpet bagger has enough for one, other wise the family style sides can all serve 3-4 people.   Asparagus - If you are a fan of veggies you will love these. They are cooked medium, so they are tasty but still have a crunch.   Mushrooms - They go great with a steak. The mushrooms are whole sauteed in butter with plenty of black pepper.   Finally, last but in no way least...dessert. Warm Chocolate Cake.....hmmmm. This used to be served in a pastry shell which was tasty, but hard eat. The new version is served warm with scoop of vanilla ice cream. The ice cream is good, but the cake is center stage. It has a melting center that is pure chocolate goodness and the cake itself has the texture of a fudge brownie that just melts in your mouth. Really...don't pass this up. It's the reason we only order the 10 oz steak.   Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. warm chocolate cake

zEIoxRPZY-LOuU6nZQ8WQA.text: Omg this place was amazing!  First time here and the steak was unbelievable!  I had the tomahawk and it was sooo soft it melted in my mouth! U should also put truffle butter on it...May not b too good for the heart but it's ooooh so yummy!  :-)     I don't think I can enjoy another piece of steak anywhere else now. Lol.  The staff was amazing as well.  I even received a personal handwritten thank you card from my waitress.  Thank you to the staff at Del Frisco....u are wonderful.  Can't wait to go back!

11ESsPMnf9PIJB8EQAPbQQ.text: Not too far off the strip, located away from all the chaos; this place is a definite gem. The service was phenomenomal. Our waitress had a lot on her hands when she had our table of 13 to handle. She did a fine job, kept it professional, and answered all of our questions to her best knowledge. Our waters never went below half way down the glass. It was refilled everytime someone took a huge gulp.   As for the food, I had one of the best filet mignons ever in my life. I got the smallest cut too (8 oz.) but it was thick enough that I was still not able to finish it. There's no word to explain the flavoring, it was that good. The texture of the meat was perfect. I'm getting hungry just thinking about that meal. I'm so excited for it that I skipped describing my appetizer first, which was shrimps served with 3 seperate sauces and crab cakes. Amazing is all I can say.   The dinner roll was also very good. It was fresh and seemed like it just came out of the oven. As for sides, the mac n' cheese is a must order as well as the cream corn. The potatoes au gratin didn't live up to the hype. The way they serve the sides is family style. We first received our main entree'. It was immediately followed by a an army of servers. I swear, there were about 6 of them surrounding us. Each had a side dish in their hand. They came around and asked if we'd like that specific side and if yes, then they would scoop it on plate and move on.  In the end, we had no room for dessert. Everyone in my party seemed very pleased with Del Frisco's. It wasn't the most inexpensive meal but it was sure worth it. I would highly recommend this place for steak lovers. If you have a big party, it's probably best to make reservations because this restaurant got pretty occupied.

lZg17ZFt-MhtiQRQ7bfWZA.text: Tomahawk cut Wagyu, Lobster Mac and Cheese... Amazing!!!  Hands down, the best steak ever!  Super flavorful and tender!  They don't skimp on the lobster.  You get plenty of it in the mac and cheese.  Service was great.  Decor needs to be updated though, really dated.

qrtBwceF8fbQAHz1PnwXTA.text: This place is the bees knees!  Went here for a bachelor party and had a great time.  Our server Chris, took good care of us during the dinner and was very attentive to our requests.  The lobster mac & cheese was awesome... wasn't overly cheesy like kraft mac and cheese and the lobster was abundant and not overcooked.  I ordered the Double Eagle, a 22oz  steak.  It was cooked exactly what a Medium should be.  There was just enough fat to make it tasty and not overly fatty.  It was a good cut and full of flavor.  My knife was cutting it w/o any effort as it was like butter.  The wine we had ordered was the perfect pair with the steak.  I have been to a lot of steakhouses (flemmings, morton's, maestro's) but I'd have to say this place was one (if not) the best steakhouse I have ever been to.  It was a great way to celebrate my buddy's end of bachelorhood!

I2ZgPymesPy1PDCS6hYGXw.text: Great service, exceptional food! We ordered filet minion and potato, both were amazing.

QKF65YtKa5b2QcQBZBQ48A.text: Was there 1.19.18 for Aniversary dinner.. All that I can say it's amazing. Our server David hands down best Service ever.. We will be coming back.. Everything was good you can't go wrong..

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DFi3W9iUFw1s78gjTng23w.text: Disappointed overall.   Total bill $549 for dinner for 5 after all the appetizers and one entire meal was credited off.   Lets start from the beginning.   Reservations for 7:15. Arrived at 7:00 seated at 7:45.  During the wait we sat at the bar which was very busy. The bartender Ron was very quick to take our order and bring our first drinks and did a great job to check on us for addition drinks. We decided to order appetizers while we were waiting.  Just after ordering we were seated and Ron had the order transferred to the table.  The waiter came to take our drink orders, we all had full drinks as they we brought them from the bar, order appetizers, we had those in already so we ordered or main meals at 7:45.  Soon the appetizers arrived but only half of what was ordered. We had to follow up with the waiter about the missing items which came 15mins later.  Dinners took too long, we enquired and were told we were the next ticket.  30 mins later we asked again,  the manager came by and apologized for the wait and that they would comp the appetizers, which was a nice touch.  Dinner arrived at 9:20. That's just not acceptable in anyway especially when one of the $50 steaks arrives cold. It was sent back. Again the manager apologized and had a new steak done quickly and took it off the bill. The steaks were good. The green beans blanched at best and the asparagus extremely undercooked.  We ended the night with a $549 bill despite all the credits and did not wish to invest further time for coffee and dessert.    Nice place, friendly staff, great bar staff, stylish and clean, big issues in the kitchen.  Very disappointed with this visit and we were there with a prospect hoping to earn their business. I hope they don't make their decision to do business with me based on my choice of a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet Medallions

RV-vi-7OlRYcd4oZQQ3j_A.text: Not worth the price. Had to move the table ourselves out of the corner because there wasn't enough space to sit. Waitress knew very little about the steaks they were selling. Told us they had "lean" wagyu steaks, haha! I ordered the porterhouse and it was all gristle and I could barely cut it with the knife.

X-LhGai0jpGdDmMscEjSKg.text: Hors d'oeuvres: The crab legs and the crabcake were wonderful. However, the shrimp cocktail was overcooked and rubbery. The lobster bisque was cold as well as the room because Jackie the  waitress, was feeling menopausal And lowered the temperature without checking with the rest of the guests. We were a party of 17.   Main meal: The 8 ounce filet was cooked excellent however the Oscar on top was cold. The scallops were bitter and had an unusual tangy taste. The baked potato was not freshly cooked it was obviously pre-cooked and warmed resulting in a disappointing baked potato. The cream spinach and corn were delicious but the brussels sprouts were old, mature and bitter. Desert: The butter cake was phenomenal. Two of our guests were celebrating birthdays and Del Frisco served  a medley of three desserts. Lava cake, the butter cake with pecan ice cream and fresh strawberries Thelemon Cake was somewhat tasteless it would've been improved with lemon zest. Overall for party of 17 and roughly $150 a person the experience as a whole was a disappointment. Other than asking how the steak was cooked we were not asked how our meals were meeting our satisfaction. At this price point the service was poor.

Y0D21bcWI7k6zO36Fqp-6g.text: At Del Frisco's, you expect a 5 star experience. Surprise: you get that 5 star experience. The steak is cooked perfectly to your taste. If they bring it out too rare, they'll take it back for you and cook it longer. The side dishes are all to die for, from the lobster mac n cheese to the creamed spinach to the asparagus. The staff is simply tremendous. All kind, respectful, and obviously hand-picked. As an 18-year-old visiting the restaurant, they treated me as if I were royalty. In the future, I'll be going as much as is physically capable of me.

gXIWyA6ySzSMTpicX716Aw.text: This place deserves 10 stars!  Went with my bros to celebrate a birthday.  From the moment we sat down until the time we left, the customer service was top notch! Jason, the manager, and every single one of our servers held the customer to their highest regards.  I don't believe I have EVER received such high quality service from any establishment in my life.  Not only did they treat us right, their food was top notch as well.  I ordered the 32. oz Wagyu Tomahawk Ribeye.  By far the best steak I've had in my life.  And I've been to many top level steakhouses around Vegas, including Carne Vino, Delmonico's, Vic and Anthony's, etc.  Although the price for this particular steak was $89, it tasted like a steak worth well north of $100.  I also got it with Bone Marrow Butter ($6) on the side which complimented and enhanced the flavors even further.  The sides we ordered, Lobster Mac n Cheese and Potatoes Au Gratin were excellent as well.    It's not often that a dinner night out totally blows my socks off......

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 32 oz. Wagyu Tomahawk Ribeye

kV20hn3puIBuMs4AbhqYOQ.text: I came here for my anniversary dinner right after I got off work. I was terrified of being that customer that shows up an hour before closing but they were more than accommodating. The host gave us a signed card saying Happy Anniversary and I thought it was the cutest touch. The food was delicious, I'm not a fan of lobster and they were more than happy to make me some mac n cheese without it. I still dream about going back just for that. Service was fantastic, at one point while our server assistant was filling a water glass his pants ripped along the wall. As he tried to maintain his 5-star composure we thought it was a great laugh. It was a really nice upscale yet casual dinner, we had a great time and truly can't wait to go back!

V4EqJpJQhPGTU2WHkS1odg.text: My review is for happy hour at the bar. The bartenders were really friendly, attentive and funny.   There was a piano guy playing and he actually sang a bit.  The happy hour food specials were fairly prices and the speciality martini was great. The martini was infused pineapple vodka, very similar to the knockout martini at Sullivan's.   The food was pretty good. Cheese steak egg rolls were a little to greasy for me.  Overall, if I was in the area I could easily be a regular here. The bar filled very fast and we arrived right after HH started.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo shrimp

9-TvhU1F-bZaIiCybd4isQ.text: I'll compare to other comparable places I've been to back home in New York.   It's better than Sparks Better than Keens Better than Old Homestead  Better than Smith & Wollensky Better than Strip House  Better than Club A Better than Palm Better than the Capitol Grille, Ruth's, and Morton's Better than the Luger's Children Better than Luger's   Better in every way. The steak, the sides, the apps, and the service.

4RCbQefh_VFw27O9vSQQ7w.text: Fantastic steak house with great customer service, good food, and an elegant ambiance. Del Frisco also has live musical entertainment.   Three happy hour visits in and the food, service and entertainment have always been consistently on point. You will enjoy listening to Jerome, who plays a mean piano and sings with a smooth vocal range. He can belt out R&B, jazz, soul, and classic pop favorites!   I have not had a full steak dinner here yet, but the items that I have tasted tells me that their steaks will not disappoint!! I highly recommend the crab cakes for an appetizer. You can tell the crab is fresh and does not come from a can. The bruschetta or the meat n cheese egg rolls are mighty tasty.  The buffalo style shrimp is good too. Also, their steak salad is delicious. Great amount of steak ratio to green mixed lettuce. Even their house bread is great. Always served warm with a side of whipped butter! Save room for dessert. The lemon cake will not disappoint or the creme brulee. Fantastic coffee as well!!   Del Frisco is an excellent choice whether you come in for dinner, drinks or seeking to entertain business clients. Your out-of-town guests will get a kick out of the James Bond 007 wine collection table. Great photo opportunities, as the table rises up and opens up to the one-of-a-kind wine bottles. Also, if you sit at the bar, you will enjoy Ron the bartender. Funny, witty and smart conversationalist who knows how make a well made drink!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ron the bartender
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of private spacious dinning rooms to host parties or events.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. James Bond 007 Wine Collection

SkcJpbS9bSLSFwox-Xw54w.text: Had an awesome time here with my two best buddies. Their Lobster Bisque was superb- possibly the best I have ever tried. We all shared the 32oz Wagyu Ribeye which was cooked perfectly as asked (medium-rare). It was extremely flavorful, but sadly American wagyu and not Kobe wagyu, so it didn't "melt" in my mouth as I was expecting it to. With the Uptown Potatoes and the Lobster Mac & Cheese (could be the best tasting lobster Mac & Cheese in the known universe) there were sides leftover. Our server and the somnelier were outstanding. Cocktails were strong and well made. Since one of our group was there for his 50th, they comped our table a dessert platter consisting of their  Lava Cake (good), Ice Cream (better) and Butter Cake (best).  Awesome experience! Go!!!

WCPLJLfpNhufqBhFLquabQ.text: mu meal was under cooked i asked for well done they gave me rare

IB4XRWSYlEFVC4JRTzm1dA.text: Came in for restaurant week because I have wanted to try del Frisco's for a while.  Booked a reservation and upon entering I was greeted by two hostesses and seated right after. The server we had gave our table tons of attention, and we ended up striking up friendly conversation about living in Las Vegas. Two different managers checked on our tables insuring the most excellent experience. Food was off the charts in quality: the lobster bisque was the best I have had along with the 45 day aged ribeye. Dessert was also amazing I could not stop eating the mousse, excellent recommendation by the server. Overall I had an A+++++ experience the staff really outdid themselves from the valet, the hostesses, the managers, servers, bussers, and of coarse the chefs who delivered a perfectly prepared meal!

BGnTU0sYjzFENRhzgwr8-A.text: Del Frisco's has been bookmarked mentally by me long before I was ever on Yelp and always a place I've wanted to try, yet I had never made it there until now. It was a memorable meal that left me full and satisfied.  We were seated immediately when we arrived a few minutes early for our 7 PM reservation. William greeted us at our table, which was isolated toward the back and gave the wife and I some quality one on one time. William gave a fine introduction of himself, the restaurant, and the menu. His service was flawless throughout the meal, from his excellent recommendations to the perfect timing of the courses. He was a step ahead of everything and addressed concerns before we even had to ask.  I had a great start with the VIP which is vodka infused with pineapple. The west coast oysters and steak tatare were our appetizers followed with the 16 oz. bone in filet and shrimp scampi as entrees. I was completely ready to order the Prime Pair, but with William using catch phrases such as: "dry aged then wet aged," "two cuts per cow," and "melting bone marrow," I couldn't resist. The steak lived up to everything he described, cooked perfectly and I cut the steak into the smallest bites to savor every melt in your mouth ounce. The creamed spinach and mushrooms were excellent sides to our meal. For the wine drinkers, on the second to last page of the wine list they have a list of half bottles of wine if one glass is not enough for you and a full bottle may be too much. I had a half bottle of the Fedilitas Merlot.  The perfect finish to the meal was the lemon cake which my wife and I polished off, or more like me polishing it off with my wife having a bite or two. I'm happy we finally made it to Del Frisco's and can't wait for the next trip.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz. bone-in filet

ekOu1g7l96LwJhOAR7BsDg.text: Check out the happy hour. Best burger--ever. $14, but amazing.  But at happy hour, all the bar food is 1/2 price. You'll never get a better burger for that price.   The bartender is old school, and fabulous.   This is a great steakhouse. Don't miss it if you need a great steak. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best burger - ever.

AaOzwoG1ugqFgv7OPAZPiQ.text: Good food. Well trained staff. Foie Gras was great, but $50 corkage, which I consider arrogant.

sylG6UEnukKTl2f-KqMeVw.text: Not nearly as good as other Del Frisco's Double Eagle's we've been to, in both food and service. On a Friday night, the place was only 1/3 full at 7pm. Long wait for both beverages and food, and our multiple servers messed up 2 of our drink orders. The manager walked around to talk to some tables, but not all....

q1cE_civiIEJABcRxZmI4g.text: Sat at the bar. Good food. Service at bar kinda short, not rude just impatient & a little grumpy staff.  Ordered Nantucket scallops but got large st georges. Bartender swore they were Nantucket but I know the difference. I showed him a pic of Nantucket. He agreed too big.

999chPTv9vsM51GMRafTuA.text: Ain't a big fan of steakhouses but this one's a keeper.  Highlights include the excellent crab cakes, ( believe it or not, subtle, sweet, and plain delicious) great sides, and steaks portioned generously and bathe crisp in butter.    Missing a star due to poor bartending.  I had to give my old fashioned away ; it was one part fast melting slits of sink water ice, and the rest, pulpy orange juice w/some whiskey and peel muddled in.  It was not pleasant.  Should this place update its bar (maybe larger, house carved ice balls or cubes) I can easily see my self being a regular.  Delicious steaks and sides.  Crab cakes that are next to none.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese, potatoes,  and mushrooms are recommended as sides.  Crab cakes are excellent here as well
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye, perfectly medium rare
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you want a proper whiskey cocktail skip the old fashioned and order a dry Manhattan.

ebmCVZhkq1zYL_6Skx-6jA.text: Probably my favorite steakhouse next to Ruth's Chris, very similar in taste to it and Fleming's.  Make sure you have them turn on the James Bond table for you.  Bread is excellent.  Had the lemon cake, it was good, not amazing like some people here think.  It's gigantic though, probably can feed 4+ people, was way too much for two.  Staff is very friendly.

ZvV4ZGLWtvz88BPiJlnQ2Q.text: My favorite steakhouse EVER! Best filet, mashed potatoes and salads ever! Did I say my favorite steakhouse EVER!

0n7yk_-1wbjPvyhhFHwzqw.text: After reading the five star reviews on Del Frisco's and then trying it, I have lost some faith in my fellow yelper's. This is supposed to be a site of reviewers with an edge.. cool people with great taste. A site that stands apart with reviews you can trust.... But I guess I will only be able to trust professional reviewers from now on. And Yelp will just be a barometer but not the final word. Here's my review on Del Frisco's: The wedge was good, not great. My tuna was good. It all goes downhill from here. We ordered my husband's ribeye medium and asked if it was a True medium or more medium well. They said it will have pink all the way through... that it was a True medium. The thing came out with hardly any pink at all. Totally overcooked. Even being medium well, he should have liked it. He ate a few bites and pushed it aside. Flavorless. It must have really been bad because he usually loves ribeye.  And he was hungry. This would never happen at Ruth's Chris. The steak would be gone!  We ordered the Potatoes Au Gratin and they came with bacon, something I had just informed the waitress I don't eat when attempting to order another side.  My husband said it was near raw, anyway.  She whisked them away and brought us onion rings. They looked great!  But... they were undercooked and the batter had zero flavor. It's sad when the Awesome Blossom at Outback (I've had to go when in small towns!) is a hundred times better. Del Frisco's thinks they know meat but they don't. Sides are INCREDIBLY mediocre. So fellow yelpers, were you just so swept away by this "real fancy" restaurant that you convinced yourself the meat here was good? Or maybe it's your first time at an "upscale" steakhouse? I noticed the 5 star reviews are mainly from out of towners. Hardly any locals who know better. I have lost confidence in some of you but I will continue to write because I want to help others avoid making the same mistake we made. Don't let Del Frisco's happen to you.

8TEg9p-x36vlYKAkRllWnQ.text: LOVE this place. Off the strip, but not too far of a drive and definitely one worth making. The decor of the place is very old school steakhouse, which I love. Great for large parties which is difficult for some steakhouses to handle, but not Del Frisco's! The meat is cooked perfectly and come in various sizes - their tomahawk bone-in ribeye is absolutely gorgeous.

5VaybTPQX6eT9uJ9fe6r9A.text: Being a high end steak house, my wife and I had higher expectation around restaurant's service.  Manager was rude, and dismissive when we questioned restaurant's corkage policy.  He made us feel like we weren't good enough for the restaurant.  My wife and I dine out quite often and we have never walked out of a restaurant, and we did with this place.  I'm sure not all Del Frisco's restaurants will have same service level, but I would never go back nor will I recommend this one to any of my friends.

gJ8vu62hL9hdWP1brrBqJQ.text: Everything at this place was excellent.. shrimp, crab cakes, bone in ribeye, and the service was great too. Would highly recommend it.

FHDvs5LZ4RT5_Rjb6sUeaQ.text: It's so rare to find a restaurant with service like this. Just like many of the reviewers here, we celebrated our anniversary and were given amazing service throughout the entire meal, along with a free piece of cake for dessert. Our water glasses were never empty which is a big thing for me. I've been to other steakhouses on the strip (DelMonico's comes to mind) that didn't even come close to the wonderful service and food we received.

ND05GQsHpk9oMWR7DHwtpA.text: Steaks were amazing.  Had the bone in filet mignon, and it was very good.  Service was excellent.  Most steakhouses leave the sides on the table to serve it yourself.  Here they bring extra staff to serve the sides to each guest before they leave it on the table.  Great restaurant!

rwKewn9jizugThqkKYQ1rA.text: If you want your filet mignon to melt in your mouth, this is THE place to be.  It's real close to the strip in Vegas.  Crab cakes appetizer were yummy.  I ordered a the Governor's Filet (6oz) which comes with its famous Chateau potatoes (BEST garlic mashed potatoes EVER!!).  Literally, I used no effort to even chew the meat because it was so tender.  The flavor of the meat and the mashed potatoes were delicious.  I've eaten at Morton's and Del Frisco's by far surpasses it.  And the best part besides the delectable food is the price.  You will definitely get more than your money's worth here.  I highly HIGHLY recommend this steak house.

i6TfIC7yJu2cIFJdt328jg.text: Best part of going back to Vegas for another Bachelor Party? Another steakhouse dinner! Del Frisco's is absolutely a must visit. Since it was our first visit, they recommended starting out with seafood appetizers. The Crab Cakes, Shrimp Cocktail, Shrimp Remoulade, and Marinated Shrimp were totally fresh and delicious. For myself, I decided on a 8oz Filet Mignon- excellent and juicy red! The service overall is top notch like their dishes- with no upselling either- and are much friendlier to large parties than some places.

DOXNEyavriYs2mJ5m-ZoVw.text: Oh Del Frisco's - such promise and unrequited possibilities, but the execution is not quite there.  I tried you for your happy hour, with advance notice of a reputation for good stiff cocktails and well executed small bites/bar food, but it just was not to be.  Sure, your happy hour burger was a good deal and well prepared, and I would expect nothing less from a high-end steakhouse (see Flemings).  However, drinks were underwhelming (particularly mixed drinks and special concoctions) and food on the bar menu was poorly conceived and prepared - see BBQ shrimp which was nothing like any BBQ shrimp I  have ever had, and so oily and excessively over-spiced (to the point that all one can taste is excessive heat on a delicate ingredient such as shrimp) that it threatened to both burn my mouth and linger for hours with uncontrolled and irresponsible use of heat, and run right through me.  Bartending staff was inconsistent as well - a few good actors, but some inattentive and cold players as well.

wqk_V2oIDBDeabaDUqAPjQ.text: Worth every cent! I was full before my steak came but I still ate it... a PERFECT medium rare.  I would go there more if I could afford it.

ZjX4xjxUzjIGKw65GSpr7w.text: One of the best meals we ever had.  Can't rave about it enough. The VIP martini was awesome. Rochelle was our waitress and she was great. Must try this restaurant if you are in Vegas. Not cheap though so bring a full wallet.

ZHliYhY_8bwCbQXwx3eN6w.text: Del Frisco's is wonderful. I love the filet mignon and their sides are insanely delicious. My favorites are the crab cakes, spinach, and the sauteed mushrooms. And they have a great selection of yummy desserts. If you like (or in my case... LOVE) lemon, you HAVE to get the lemon cake. It's to die for!

xpTTWL_JQ3sm0OaghIxIhA.text: I love this place!!!  It's a visit for me everytime I am in Vegas.  The food and service is excellent.

VvtCEEC_adpJ4UtEF79RkA.text: I went here for dinner with a bunch of friends and family for my Fiancee's birthday. I asked several different casino and cab people where the best steak place was. Seriously, all 8 people said The Double Eagle. I had the prime rib medium rare with the baked potato and a lettuce wedge. Normally when I go to a nice place like this with clearly featured entrees, I want to try their fastball. The prime rib was perfectly cooked and well seasoned on the outside. The potato was also very good. I could tell it hadn't been cooked hours before and left in a warmer, the outside was seasoned with thick Kosher salt. The lettuce wedge was a very cold iceberg quarter with huge blue cheese and bacon bits. I Love food that is straight forward and spot on. This was a meal you would think you could prepare at home but if you tried, you would come up lacking.  Our server was very helpful and received a well earned 30% tip on like a 700.00 check.   ***Note: As a rule of thumb, at a new restaurant, I follow my nose. I could smell the coal grill in the kitchen from the second I came in and in a very good way.

ISKONXi1sAuWsyE5txSqIQ.text: This review is long overdue.  We celebrated by husband's 40th birthday here on 12/10/10.  There were 6 of us in our party & we were fortunate to have David as our primary waiter.  David definitely helped make the evening very special & exceeded my husband's high expectations about how we should be treated at a nice restaurant.  Even better - the food also exceeded our expectations - 4 had the filet & 2 had the mahi mahi.  My husband really likes chocolate lava cake, while they did not have this on the menu, David talked with the chef & came up with a similar option that was wonderful.  After our meal, the chef came out to greet us & ask how everything was - our response was awesome!  The special evening did not end there.  David arranged for us to have pictures taken in their phenomenal wine cellar along with a tour.  It was definitely a special evening...we will return the next time we are in Vegas!

XdxZnNJcHOhIbJoKGUqXcA.text: pricy but worth every penny. the filet is to die for... and you have to pay for sides too!!!!

Mpf77yceQ94PoYLph6MBxw.text: I have been here many times and have always really enjoyed it.  I think this is a local favorite but if you are visiting, it is a must see.  I don't know if I could say it is the best steak I have ever eaten but it is close.  And don't get me wrong, the food is amazing.  My favorite is the filet, but the ribeye is great also.  The side dishes are wonderful as well, great choices. The ambiance and service are always terrific.  You can tell that the staff is well trained.  They are very knowledgeable and friendly.  Not something you see everywhere in Vegas. The last time I went was with some pals.  One of the guys is very picky and he was so impressed.  When he does not complain, you know you are doing something right!

Oop2Iw6TMmK32Hf4G-fmPQ.text: Have eaten here several times.  Amazing meals served with wonderful sides.  Seriously, the best crabcake I've ever had in my life and I've had them everywhere!  We go often and sit at the bar and get cocktails and appetizers - always a crabcake.  Pricey but worth it.

zipbcGtruMuzCvu-M1TYTQ.text: Our holiday party hosted by the fine folks of Del Frisco's was quite amazing.  The staff were great, the decor and ambiance was just perfect, and the food was amazing.  I hope to come here and visit again in the future!

QVVIghFH3Yw7F7kTnGGF4w.text: I would certainly recommend Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse to a friend and I have, several times! I took a group of 20 there in January and went back for Valentine's Day with my wife. We had a great night! They were a little slow on seating, but that's probably to be expected on the busiest night of the year for great restaurants. Their Valentine's Day special was AMAZING! Our waiter, Roland, was wonderful. Take your significant other or a business group or a bunch of friends. You won't be disappointed!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

e50ErrtDxZZpdfWNUxiLkQ.text: *** Review is for Restaurant Week 2018 menu ***  The RW menu had some upgrades on it.  I ordered Lobster bisque for a starter.  For the main course, I got the 8 ounce filet mignon that came with chateau potatoes and I paid $6 for an upgrade to wild mushroom Bordelaise sauce.  I finished the meal with strawberry cheesecake.  After ordering an iced tea, I put my order in with my server, Dane.  Since I ordered the filet blue, he said he'd make sure it was courses correctly and wait until I finished my soup before they did the steak.  The lobster bisque had very rich broth and was brimming with lobster pieces and some good sized chunks.  One of the best lobster bisques I've had.  The steak was done correctly and was covered with the very tasty wild mushroom Bordelaise suace.  Thew chateau potatoes were mashed with parsley and some seasonings.  A nice accompaniment to a very tender piece of beef--almost fork tender.  I went with the cheesecake for dessert since I've had a number of chocolate desserts recently and I wanted something different.  It was standard cheesecake with strawberry sauce and some fresh strawberry pieces.    Service was excellent.  Another time, I'd take the option of sitting in the "back room" because the bar was slammed with people enjoying Happy Hour and it was a bit noisy in that section.  50% off all bar bites and drinks certainly brings them in.  I had been told by a friend to make sure I checked out the James Bond table.  It's a large round table on the way to the back room.  If you ask to see, the host will press a button and the top of the table rises and opens up in wedges and bright lights come on.  It consists of 18 custom wine bottles ranging for James Bond movies ranging from Dr. No to Tomorrow Never Dies.  It's worth a look.  This is worth a repeat visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bond table bought in bought in 1997 for $362,00 now worth over a million.  18 custom wine bottles from Dr. No to Tomorrow Never Dies.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. James Bond table opening.  Closed but when they push a button, it opens with lots of lights.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry cheesecake.

8HPYg3IZXlHzvUqZotdqKg.text: Amazing food, Amazing wine selection!  We went there for my bachelor and got great service! Even though our food took over an hour to get out, their hospitality made up for it! They even gave us a tour of their wine cellar, which was a treat!  I got the Bone in Prime Ribeye and it was the best I have had in long time. To make it better, the Sommelier introduced me to Fisher Vineyard Coach Insignia and I am in LOVE!!!  Thanks for a great meal and for the memories!

LyCZ4RnTQkAlaeyO_UFFTQ.text: Food was amazing customer service was top notch we got the Chilean seabass and 45 day dry aged striploin! It was extremely filling but it was really good! Definitely would come back here again! They also showed us a 350k James Bond table! Ask them to show you the table when you eat at this place ! It's a must see!! 350,000$ for a table wow

K4jseyIvYPIPtBQv6TJkyA.text: I used to love this place. We ate her every year for at least a decade. The level of service went severely downhill, especially in the last year.   We go with a group of 25 people every year and usually have a good time. This year it took an hour and half to get the food out. People were also missing good and requests were just not answered.   They knew it was a birthday in the group too--no lemon cake with a candle like usual. We want the old Del Frisco's Back. We

ReHb6UFKUDBrJT9iSbmmyQ.text: My husband and I are locals and we've been taking advantage of Restaurant Week this week- Del Frisco's has an amazing RW menu with tons of choices to make everyone happy. In addition to our incredible food, we were treated to incredible service- our server Amber, manager Mark, a wonderful bartender whose name I didn't catch- everyone made us feel like valued regulars instead of first-timers. We can't wait to go back- whether it be for a special occasion or a casual happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake entree
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

VKWZ7HOCWF9ZCqDrQ77vyw.text: Let me first say we have been coming to Del Frisco's for years, not just for birthday celebrations and anniversaries, but when we wanted a date night out. My birthday dinner was by far the most disappointing dinner at Del Frisco's by far.  I understand that menus change over time, but I look forward to the lamb chops every time I come. They were the best lamb chops in town. They are no longer on the menu and have been replaced with a 'Dry Aged Prime Lamb' that is cut off the bone for you. I asked our waiter about it and he went on and on about how wonderful it was. Don't get me wrong, it was pretty good, not great, just pretty good, but the Chops were always AMAZING.   My husband ordered the 'Prime Steak(16 oz)' and it had to be sent back because it was way over cooked. That meant my lamb had to be taken to be kept warm. The mushroom and onion side was good, but not quite a mushroom that you want on top of a steak. We did really like the Del's Potato.  Our drinks were great as always though. Like I said, we have come here many times and I look forward to celebrating special occasions here, as I save all the cards that the employees sign. When we get home, I put the date on them and put them away. This year there was no card, no nothing.  Sorry Del Frisco's, you dropped the ball this time and we will be shopping around for a new favorite upscale restaurant to go to where we feel valued as a patron.

ChttNH8yuAVsip7yyjHEGw.text: Great food! Great Service,  and Kelly the Somm was awesome.  You won't be disappointed here. Get to onion rings too.  .

JWs5lXEH9vBaV4P_rRH_yA.text: This place is mind blowing good. I think it's the best steak I've ever had in my lifetime, or up there. We ordered the super gigantic steak that has a huge bone in it along with a regular bone in rib eye, and prime rib. And man, the super large meat cut that costs about $100 but can feed two is absolutely worth it.  The manager stopped by to say hello and the service was extraordinary from start to finish. I'd come here any day knowing that my guests will for sure be satisfied.   It beats a couple other top notch steak houses on the strip. DEF WORTH TRYING!!!!

3cxpEu9h4VShjOvZCSUn-g.text: Visited again tonight, enjoyed the bar Happy Hour (extraordinary value) and celebrated a friend's BD. Service is exceptional. Marissa, Mel, Ron and Brandon are wonderful. The lobster bisque is delicious, fresh bread is yummy and the tips fabulous. Really happy they're bringing back Tyrone and his live music on Fri and Sat.   One of the best dining experiences in Las Vegas for locals, Convention goers and those celebrating a special occasion.

ZYcC9mxHpNPCMvXgidpHjA.text: Absolutely amazing experience here on this past Friday night. Though it was the last night of restaurant week, I was able to schedule a table for a party of eight to celebrate a friend's bachelor party a couple of days before after cancelling a reservation at another steakhouse.  Service was great, our waitress was attentive and super friendly. The maitre d' came by about half way through our meal and was an incredible host as well.  The steaks were perfectly cooked-- my 12 oz filet mignon with truffle butter and king crab meat was one of the best cuts I've eaten in my life. Wine glasses weren't too overpriced-- $20 for a glass of Duckhorn Merlot seemed very fair to me as well.  Also, thank you to the staff for being able to speed up dessert and process checks separately for us when we were running late to our show!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate mousse dessert
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 oz filet mignon with king crab meat and black truffle butter

F9vhOQ6nZR6qErQpqOaTvQ.text: This pretty much is it. I came here on the recommendation from a friend and really enjoyed it. I would say that one of the keys to its success is its approach to people and hospitality. Not many places strive for a good customer experience that is proactive.   I got the 12 ounce filet cooked medium rare and it was served perfectly. (I would say, they do ask you to cut into the middle of the steak to see if it's cooked to your liking. I really don't like this approach since it releases the juices from the inside of the steak and it also allows the steak to cool faster.) I did like the seasoning on the steak, it was a good course salt and pepper. I do feel like it could have benefited from some garlic. I normally don't like butter with my steaks since I believe it makes the steak less tender but they do offer many butter toppings.   All the sides are family style. We got the scalloped potatoes and Mac and cheese. Both were very good, however, I haven't noticed many places that give you little wedges for the potatoes in scalloped potatoes. Either way, it was really good and went well with the steak.   Of course you have to have Cabernet for the wine pairing.   All around it was good, I recommend coming here. I'd like to come back again.

IZSaJLK7GC0VkBQxKYEQeA.text: For Fathers day Me and my brother said we would both treat each other to a Father's Day meal so for my part I went to Del Frisco's absolutely amazing service top-notch professionalism I had Seabass brussels sprouts and a martini excellent choice excellent meal

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass brussels sprouts and crab fried rice was excellent Del Frisco&#39;s definitely is a cut above!!!

EkMDxHxwUv049zlzHdqw-w.text: Went for a customer appreciation event. The food was amazing. The Del Salad was great, they gave two big strips of bacon on top. Had the prime cut steak, prepared to perfection. Strawberry cheesecake, phenomenal. I'll definitely be going back.

loRnMtbwKa1hIw3aMEaOcQ.text: I dined at Del Frisco's last weekend with a party of 10 for a bachelor party.  It was a very positive experience.  More of a 4.5, but we will give them the bump up.    We had a room reserved in the wine cellar area.  It was ready on time, private and very well presented. The service was a 10/10.  Our server was knowledgeable and pleasant, and skillfully navigated our group of somewhat "unruly" gents.  The sommelier was also very skilled and we ended up with great wine.  I didn't order one, but the cocktails were also a hit.  The food was very good to excellent.  Bacon appetizer was awesome.  Not the absolute best bone-in ribeye I ever had, it was but up there on the list.  Cooked perfectly.  Great sides.  No up-selling and everything was polished off in short order.  I recommend this steakhouse if you are in Vegas.

2bn6pQ1FN43jZRot5EgzBA.text: Came here for my birthday a few months ago and absolutely loved it.  This place has managed to be a chain but still have a unique draw to it that makes it feel like an old time classic. From the moment you walk in and see the decor and feel the ambiance it's almost like a pice of old time vegas.   We had reservations for 8:00 and they were running about 10 minutes behind so we ordered a couple drinks at the bar. We were greeted bar a very friendly and knowledgeable bartender. Ordered an extra dirty grey goose martini and a cable car. Both were made pretty perfectly. The bartender was very skilled and knowledgeable and we loved the feel at the bar.  We were escorted to our seats and greeted by our server. Once again everyone was very professional warm and inviting.  After looking at the menu we went ahead and started off with the bacon salad and the beef carpaccio.  If you're a fan of bacon then the salad is for you. 2 crispy smoky full slices of bacon. Not the crumbled underworked pieces you'd find in some chains where you can't tell if it's even really bacon.  The carpaccio was also pretty amazing.topped off with fresh greens, capers and I believed a Dijon sauce, it's served with toasted bread chips. The beef was tender and sliced paper thin. The flavors truly did come together creating a flavor explosion in your mouth of a magnitude 10.0 on the tasty scale.  Moved on the the 32 oz wagu tomahawk steak. It's served on the bone to provide that extra tasty flavor and give you a feel of the caveman days. It was sliced table side and served between 2 of us. It was slightly undercooked from the medium rare we ordered but wow was it delicious. The meat was tender and buttery. Seemed to simply melt in your mouth!  Last was a complimentary dessert that offered their butter cake. It was the perfect end to a  marvelous dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert platter
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty martini and cable car

rkBMhqu88CI7i7ByDJEBAA.text: Snagged a last minute reservation on a Sunday evening. They have a prix-fixe menu available on Sunday's for $59, a decent deal, which essentially gets you an additional crab cake. BUT - you can't get the delicious lobster mac n cheese nor the prime cuts like a rib eye.  Their wines range from affordable $$ to the couple thousand. Could be higher, i stopped flipping pages after that...  Order a bottle of red, splurge on the tomahawk, a side of the mac and a side of asparagus. The 32 oz tomahawk is enough to share between two. The crust is excellent and it was cooked to a perfect medium-rare.  The butter cake is a popular choice. Can't go wrong with butter pecan ice cream and a cake named after butter. For something more classic, the chocolate souffle cake rivals Roy Yamaguchi's signature dessert.  Less than 10 minutes off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk

Ot_3uh3Hn1arabzvSiZHnA.text: Came here for my Birthday and enjoyed a great dinner! My wife and I had the Ribeye, petite filet mignon, wild mushrooms and Brussels sprouts with bacon and some drinks. All the food was well seasoned and delicious! Roland and Ro served us and were True professionals! Everyone from the young ladies at the front desk to the wait staff and manager were so nice to us! We were also treated to a complimentary and scrumptious lemon cake for dessert. Thank you Del Frisco's for a memorable evening! Btw, the booth seating was perfect!

qy6tf-bpyhVUIl_b0e8djQ.text: I've only been to the one in Philadelphia but I tried this location since it was near my apartment and it was Christmas Day and I was far from home. Safe to say Del Frisco's quality is the same no matter where you go! SERVICE AND CUISINE is A1 (hehehe no steak sauce for me) No seriously and if you want an orgasm in your mouth, treat yourself to the lobster mac and cheese...I've made my spouse addiced to it as well....

hwggCtb_Js-6j-wmXQ-fLA.text: We had the most amazing experience while celebrating our wedding anniversary at Del Friscos. Our server, Heather, was absolutely wonderful, as was the rest of the staff. The food was delicious, the best we've had. Everyone was so kind and could not have made our night more perfect.

s_9h-ZMlB0h_AZ4qgFnsYg.text: While in Vegas on business, had the opportunity to dine here....glad I did!  We had a group of seven who were all raving by the end of the evening (raving as in a good thing, mind you).  I ordered a 20oz porterhouse - one of the more intrepid in our group ordered a 40oz porterhouse....(heart attack waiting to happen, one would think).  We all ordered different veggies, and we had various wines open around the table.  The steaks were all cooked absolutely perfectly.  The veggies were awesome (so the group says...I stuck with a perfect baked potato with all the trimmings).    The wait stuff were absolutely stellar - almost, but not quite, to the hovering effect.  Wines stayed full, dishes were cleared immediately, and all of this without disrupting conversation.  Overall, probably one of the top three steak experiences I've had in Vegas.  Recommended.

Zb-WdS1Ks8fmQG5H8G7SNA.text: Great Happy Hour!! Price and Food!! I love this place. The atmosphere is very high class. They have piano music in the bar to enjoy while having a drink.

9IsALY4NqLeTh9QkdfRDNg.text: Came here for the first time with a group of friends that I convinced not to dine at Gallaghers Steakhouse in New York New York Casino.  Ordered the following:  - Crab cake, this dish is a must have unless you are allergic to crab. Most crab cakes have quite of bit of breading which I do not like. Del Frisco's version has hardly at all, 95% is all CRAB!!!!! It was very tasty. Too bad it was quite pricey ($19) but you get what you paid for. I would definitely ordered it again.  - Ribeye (16oz), tasty. No complaints.  - Bone-in ribeye (22oz), tasty. No complaints.  - Double Eagle Bone-in Strip (26oz), I normally order ribeye but I do like to try the restaurant's 'signature' steak. I was surprised that it was good. I am always afraid that a thick steak will not be cooked to my liking. I was glad I tried it but I miss the flavor and texture of ribeye.   - Lobster mac & cheese, I was disappointed. Hardly any lobster. It might as well be called mac & cheese.  - Asparagus, decent. No complaints.  Service was great. Everyone was attentive and our waitress was knowledgeable and answered all my questions.  Ambiance was nice.  I do wish it was a bit brighter. The lights was dimmed for a 'romantic' setting.  My friends thanked me for dining here. They all said the steaks were much better than Gallaghers. We will be back!!!!  One of the managers told us that they are looking to open a location in Southern California. I plan to make a reservation on opening night!!!!

a7s8OxJDlMOlnDkm9hK3Fg.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. It's the first place I ever had a bone-in-filet. Get it. You'll be so happy. The server was excellent, and when we got home, we had a card from her thanking us for coming in and wishing us a happy anniversary. Now, that's what I call service!

8r8fnAByBk3Oe0oOiDVLvA.text: This place is insanely good.....ton of food and steaks are off the hook. Took my parents here for their birthday....everyone was really happy with the service, the environment and more....I'd recommend it. Pricey...but worth checking it off the bucket list.

tKzJ3fiPty-R1BX6xJYjVw.text: After the last manager that hadn't called me back, another manager had called to tell me that they were undergoing management changes and they had apologized for my last visit and requested that I'd give them a second chance.  I finally made my second visit a year later and this time, I was pleasantly pleased with their service and their food. Our waiter introduced the specials including each dish's price, which our last server neglected to do. Our server also warned us that they tend to undercook their steaks and made recommendations how our steaks should be prepared. We took his advice and went with medium for their double eagle bone in steak and that did not disappoint! When our food came, they were all served on hot plates and since I was sharing my steak, they brought out an extra hot plate for me. I hadn't noticed the hot plate during my first visit so this may be new. I was very delighted that this kept my food hot for a while, just the way I like it. We had also tried their lobster mac and cheese, which is mind blowingly good! Please get this as your side! You will be in heaven, I guarantee it!   All in all, I'm very happy with my second visit and I will return in the future!

O4tlNnuo_TLcgBhoa0ab8g.text: Amazing..I was here for a work dinner and I couldn't be more pleased with this place. Food is so delicious and service is remarkable

-N1-VAFMZpm8eNiZ6OMS3A.text: Its a sad moment when you realize the you'll probably never eat a better steak than the current steak you are eating. That being said, this was the best steak by far I've ever had.   The restaurant ambiance is very romantic. Softly lit dining rooms and extremely professional waiting staff. I don't remember our waiters name, but he was also amazing.   I got the tomahawk cut Wagyu beef cooked medium. Amazing, perfectly seasoned and melted in your mouth.   It's on the expensive side, but I'm willing to pay good money for the best (insert food name here) i've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tomahawk cut wagyu steak

zBMPdIkKykW2yRAP2YfFLg.text: If you like pepper, you'll love this place.  Seriously, they put pepper on everything, and lots of it. I had a smaller meal, from their oddly-named langiappe section, and my god, the pepper. The steak was heavily peppered, the potatoes were peppery, the sauce was peppercorn. All I could taste for a good hour or two after eating was pepper.   I complained to the server, Ben or Benny, who said "well I wished you'd have said something earlier" -- not a great response when you're paying $40 for a plate of, well, pepper.   The sides, too, were disappointing. The lobster mac and cheese was watery, lacking in both flavour and lobster. The potatoes au gratin were underdone, and the cheese appeared to be that american "cheese" you try to avoid if you like actual cheese. The "bone marrow" butter tasted like butter.   And the bill was around $70 a head with a glass of wine and service. The server told us he couldn't split the bill, so we got to work it out ourselves. Thanks I guess?   One to miss.

tZrKAqcuhJ6Ws6cR9WISIg.text: First time heading here, it was during CES.  Needless to say we were unable to get the more desirable reservations.  Friend drove us and accidently made a wrong turn and somehow ended up in Bally's parking lot.  It seemed like we were driving around in circles.  Arrived and was asked to wait for our table.  Approached the bar and ordered a round of drinks.  Finally was seated and started ordering.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye and we all shared a few sides.  They brought over 2 baskets of warm bread which was devoured in a matter of minutes as we were all starving.  Waiters brought the steaks and we were asked to cut a slice of your steak just to make sure it was cooked correctly.  Mine was cooked perfectly and everyone else's was as well.  Sides were all good and were served by the waiters.    Didn't have any of their desserts as we all were stuffed.  Waiter asked that we provide either a business card or our address.  What's cool is that they personally write a letter to you thanking you for the patronage.  Definitely a nice touch.  Second visit was just recently where I took a few coworkers for a nice dinner.  Of course it was during the Western conference semi-finals.  We were lucky to get a table facing the bar where we could watch the game.  Two of us had money on the line so it was perfect.  This time around ordered just the normal ribeye.  Again it was cooked perfectly.  We ordered a special side for the night (forget what it was) along with the skillet potatotes.  The special side was tasty but the skillet potatoes was a tad on the salty side.  Again we were all too full for dessert and just asked for the bill.  Waitress again asked for our contact information and a few weeks later, a nice letter arrived in the mail.  Definitely a solid steakhouse in the Las Vegas area which is only a few minutes away from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ftD_4y4J4Lz7e52lfZ4bEQ.text: Del Frisco's is a great example of a classic steakhouse.  It's got a huge mahogany (or appears to be mahogany anyway) bar, classic menu items, and excellent service.  We have been to this particular location many times, and I've also eaten at one in Dallas.  This Del Frisco's may have the best crabcakes I've eaten.  Just fantastic, and it's hard to call anything a "value" at a place this pricey, but you certainly get a lot of crab meat for the price.  My wife has had the blue cheese wedge salad which is a hit.  It's large, and the blue cheese is of excellent quality.  Very veiny and flavorful.  I typically get the bone in ribeye when it's available at any steakhouse.  It's usually one of the largest cuts on the menu, and is very flavorful.  Del Frisco's offering is no different.  We have had probably a half dozen of the sides, but the onion rings and lobster mac n cheese stand out.  The wine list can be high, but there are bottles on the list that can give you a great pairing to your steak.    As noted above, the service never lacks.  Water glasses rarely get half way empty, much less all the way empty.  And, it's a nice relaxed meal, they aren't rushing you.  There are a bunch of great steakhouses in Vegas, and this location of Del Frisco's can hold it's own with the vast majority of them.  Recommended.

MbzqeBqlh7krJ25a4ie6kg.text: Client took me here when I was out for a trade show.   - Fried Calamari: BOMB - Spinach Supreme: BOMB - Lobster Mac & Cheese: BOMB - Chateau Potatoes: BOMB  I'm not a fan of steak so opted for the lamb - it was...mehhh.   Stellar service. Drool.

FzKC9YlrnAGnoZNqgA6vBA.text: We had a private dinner in the wine room next to the bond wine table. Once again after some serious business, our conversations were completely stopped by the presence of our fantastic meal.  We all agreed that business can wait as appetizers and salads came out.  My bone in rib eye was accompanied by bottles of Justin red wine.  We enjoyed lobster Mac and cheese, cheddar potatoes, and grilled asparagus.  It is fair to say that although nothing was completed, all of our stomachs were happy.  Can't wait for the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hxWwstExk989HXXHJKIdxQ.text: It's a noisy place that they squeeze too many customers in bar area. The host should have mention us they had a big party when we made reservation over the phone.   The star is for their tender and juicy Prime ribeye ($49). It's one of best steakhouse in Vegas. However, the service and their seafood are unacceptable. We ordered shrimp cocktail and shell oyster for our appetizers. The shrimp looks huge , but taste really hard. We talked to the server the shrimp seems overcooked. He didn't say anything at all then walked away! This is my first time having oyster but no water in each shell! I can tell the oyster wasn't fresh.  We spent about $110 per person.

kAhMcYQrQhPX983kgxyGEg.text: The service is superb! The food speaks for itself. The filet is one of the best in town!!!! The atmosphere is awesome. Sexy ambience, along with a traditional old fashion setting. Very romantic!   Don't forgot about the happy hour. It's the best!!!

BfTrHm40V_-MakgzsYsxYA.text: Had such an amazing experience. The staff was top notch like the food. Went with a 12 oz filet and it was perf cooked. I don't usually go to places off the strip when I am visiting Vegas but this was well worth it!

jm52TittiHgoxDmXWs2s6w.text: The food is impeccable.   The rib eye literally melts in the mouth, it is so soft.  Our waitress "Ro" Roneice (apologize if spelling is incorrect) is phenomenal.   She takes fine dining up several notches.  She's fun, very knowledgeable, and has the BEST service!  Ask for her to be your waitress,  you will not regret it.  We were celebrating my husband's birthday and she highly recommended the Butter cake, yummy!!!  Definitely going back, again and again and again!!

xp60_5XkwJ9L3AGe0mYniQ.text: Just stellar food and service! They baby you with excellent service and keep your glass and plates full. Beware the bread, cannot stop eating and their wine selection is top shelf. 5 thumbs up

hnJbcrBpJwvpqDxxVRP_fQ.text: I typically go for a ribeye, but decided to branch out and try the filet (medium rare). Just amazing. My knife just cut through it like butter and it just melted in my mouth. The beef tasted pretty good. But not as good as a rib eye; the filet doesn't have much fat so it loses out on those flavors.  For sides we shared the lobster mac & cheese and the mashed sweet potatoes. Both were just great. How I love carbs...

qcSIfUN9324UI6kvm5G6IQ.text: BEYOND THE STEAK  (cause it was perfect and doesn't need changing)  Del Friscos needs to update themselves. What once was probably a well planned interior with appropriate decorating at the time now just seems dated. Now, from a business perspective, that's okay if you want to retain your regular customers and keep them happy, but not okay if want to attract younger new customers.   On a recent visit there, I felt as if I should have been with my parents.  They would love the quiet side rooms and comfort of the dark interiors.  As for the menu, it's not that the food was bad, but it just didn't inspire any excitement in me to choose one item over the other versus what some of the newer high end steak houses do.   32oz Dry Aged Sirloin $90 was cooked to a perfect medium rare, the Mac & Cheese with Lobster $16 was just alright, Caesar Salads (2@ $10 ea.) were not bad, but disappointing because it was just average. The bread and butter was above average.   For drinks, we had the Blackberry Ginger Martini $14, Champagne  Cocktails (2@ $14 ea.) and Woodford Reserve $13.50.

LDGC4v63L1rn35PP7RV0qw.text: So far, this is my favorite steakhouse in Vegas.  I have been here multiple times and never have been let down.  The service here is impeccable, and if you fill out the card at the end they will send you a personalized thank you note.  Now on to the meat and wine list.  The wine list here is very nice and very well stocked.  Almost all the servers are very knowledgeable, and I'm pretty sure that there is at least one sommelier on staff.  I usually get the bone in Ribeye, which I really like, it's flavorful and so far has not been overly fatty.  I have also had their Wagyu beef tomahawk chop, which was also superb.  I like that they tell you what each done-ness means, as each steakhouse seems to do it slightly differently.  I will continue to frequent this place until I find a better steakhouse in Vegas that can compete on price.  It should also be mentioned that you can get away with dinner under $60 per person if you want to be a bit thrifty.

xzaS5B2lUk6uitipMiLmhA.text: Went there on Saturday night, 9-27, with 17 people. Since I was hosting the party the waiter came to me and asked be about the bill and the dinner strategy. i thought that was cool. I decided that I would order appetizers for the table so Jumbo shrimp cocktail and crab cakes for all. Also, i ordered 3 huge lobster tails for everyone to share. The waiter was completely on the ball with everything from the Appetizers, sides, wine and the bill.  Jumbo shrimp cocktail with 3 sauces: everyone received 3 jumbo shrimps covered with 3  sauces. Excellent all around, especially the garlic style scampi sauce.  Crab cakes: Best I ever had. Jumbo lump crab meat with minimum filler. Cooked perfectly.  Main coarse: Bone in rib-eye. (picture posted) Cooked perfect. sides were:  asparagus: excellent scalloped style potatoes: excellent mac-n-cheese: average/fair  desert: Lemon cake: super dense and flavorful. The only downside is there is a huge shortening after taste with the cake. Double espresso: sucked. should have ordered regular coffee.  Service: excellent. At one time we had 8 servers at our table, each with 2 plates in hand to serve the main dish. No questions asked. They knew who had what cut of meat.  pros: Great beef great appetizers great sides excellent service (waiter was Troy and he was awesome)  cons: overpriced wine list bad espresso (do not order)  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves beef. It was one of my top 3 steaks ever eaten.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in ribeye

hLdCFslvBtVpaItBUepvhg.text: Del Frisco's is a great steak house. I love eating here every time I go to Vegas. The Vegas is strip is filled with excellent places to eat. Many of the top chefs and restaurants reside on the strip. However Del Frisco's is just as good. It is worth the drive off the strip to eat here.  Service: We always have reservations when we eat here. Reservations do not seem too difficult to get. We normally come with about 8-12 people and we are seated immediately. The staff is always very helpful when going through the menu. They are extremely attentive. They go the extra mile to make sure every minor detail is covered. One time our waiter overheard us planning our night and he offered to try to get us on the list to XS! They consistently strive to provide customer satisfaction.  Food: The food is great! I have had both the Porterhouse Steak and the Bone In Ribeye. Both were excellent and cooked to perfection. My preference is to eat the Ribeye. It is perfectly marbled and juicy. Sides are served family style and are all very good. I especially like the lobster mac and cheese.   Del Friso's has great food and awesome service. I recommend this place if you are in Vegas. Its a great place to go out with friends, while getting away from the crazy busy Las Vegas Strip. They offer great food without the hassles that come with eating at some of the places on the strip.

Ilvs48NPdEzd6DBXkFtdDw.text: I agreed with another Yelp review.  The service was outstanding and the food was great.  However, it was very similar to every other big chain steakhouses and had no big wow factors.    Reservations - Highly recommended.    Food - 1. Crab cakes - A definite must.  No bread fillers.  Just crabs and seasoning.  2. Special of the day salad - Caramelized bacon, basil dressing, what more would you want from a chopped salad? 3. Special of the day filet mignon trio - Three 4 ounce steaks, one with brie, one with truffled cream sauce and topped with asparagus and crab, and the last surf and turf style with a scallop and shrimp.  Perfectly cooked with a great crust.  4. Lobster Mac and Cheese - Skip it.  5. Creme Brulee - Watery. Skip it.

2hyNkx-l1b6tbjORj-kZfA.text: Service was incredibly good!  Brandy was super attentive, knowledgable, kind and pleasant!  Having tried other steakhouses in Vegas, I couldn't give Del Frisco's a 5, but the service gets a 5 for sure.

i_4Vdpf3qewLL1fFp2UQwg.text: Food and service is absolutely top notch- Great for business dinners or special occasions. I went to Del Frisco's for a business dinner, now I have to take the wife back. Pricey but worth it when you feel like splurging a bit-

H_uaN_R6bMfHcuCp8HBf2g.text: I love this place!!!  This is one of the best steak house off the strip. Very seldom we will dine off the strip, but this steakhouse was an exception. I ordered a RIb Eye Steak and shared other sides with friends. The sides were all ordered separately and shared with the table. The bread is very good!!! We also tried the stone crab claws which was okay. Nothing so special about those.   Make sure to order the pineapple vodka. It is very DELICIOUS.  One advice...  We had a party of 10 and we ordered less sides than recommended and it worked out perfect-no left overs. We were stuffed!!! The sides are pretty big, I would say almost equivalent to Mastro's.  In addition to providing great food and service, make sure to ask to check out the James Bond wine case inside the piano.   ...It will make you say... W O W!

455Gwgj_BbaX2NuDO7ssTQ.text: This town has a lot of steak joints, and I'm telling you that this one is at the top of the heap... The steak here is always great and the sides are always great and the sesame bread that they serve is good enough to fly in for; but what really makes this place the absolute best is the service... The servers here work together like they are doing an air show routine.  All the entrees are delivered and set down simultaneously, the sides are served by hand, and just as quickly as the swarm of servers entered they disappear into the shadows leaving you and your guests to enjoy the meal and conversation... Drop a fork??? instantly a server swoops in with a replacement as if he had heard the utensil hit the floor.  Not convinced that they take attention to detail and service seriously here??? Wait a week and you'll get a personal thank you note from your head server in the mail...

mbhDQX4lqCFd3IKhk6aHaQ.text: Came here for a 40th birthday celebration and it was great! Atmosphere was upscale but still upbeat, staff super friendly, and food was excellent.  Ribeye, crab cakes...all the way down to the side dishes.  And the VIP beverage was off the hook.

0YkPCRSJg6ctdruzifp-oA.text: One of my 3 favorite steak houses anywhere! Couldn't ask for more that what they offer!!! Amazing food!!! Drinks are good and stiff, I come here every time I visit Vegas;)

xMnB4OMRrrpW-o3w6PEdhg.text: 1. Great service! Friendly, yet still formal enough for a high end restaurant. Not too over bearing but still attentive and not pretentious.  2. 8oz filet was cooked to perfection but a tad bit salty for my personal choice. As was everything as as a whole.  3. Lobster Mac and cheese was THE BEST.  4. Lemon cake didn't sound appetizing but it's their signature dessert and i wasn't disappointed. Definitely worth a try.

fGeiC2Jnu7IQyqFeg3rYQg.text: Excellent food but the service really makes this place top notch.  Also very kid friendly Which was a bit of a surprise ;). Stick to the steaks as they are the best i have tried.

v6BNLTzuXHO5P8ufQ257AQ.text: Definitely recommend this restaurant. I had the best restaurant experience of my life here. The food was great, the drinks menu was great, the service was great. The prices were also lower than Ruth's Chris or steakhouse of comparable quality.  We had reservations and were seated within a couple minutes of our arrival. Our waitress showed us the "James Bond" table at our request - a tip we got from Yelp.  We were served delicious bread, were told the specials, had all our questions answered and were impressed by the menu. The rib eye was flavorful and very tender, the beef medallions were also tasty and my lamb chops were perfectly cooked and had excellent flavor.  Our sides were delicious: asparagus, mushrooms, potatoes au gratin and cheddar mashed potatoes.   Cocktails were tasty, and the wine selection was like heaven.  Dessert was fantastic. Definitely try the Lemon cake and the Chocolate cake.  Ended the night with coffee and a star-spotting of Dan Aykroyd.

y2CNnVqKB-F3Z1-stPE82g.text: Great steakhouse and outside the strip. I've had this bookmarked for such a long time now. I am finally glad I was able to dine here for NYE. It had a nice old school feel inside. The service was on point. The bread that was brought out was amazing. It had sesame seeds on top and extremely soft. I ate that thing like I was on crack. I decided to skip the appetizers and go right for the prime bone in porterhouse steak. It was well cooked, buttered right, and tasted amazing. I had it medium rare so it was a dark purple/pink on the inside.The sides I went with were the mashed potatoes which were too spicy and was overdosed with pepper. The asparagus was good but I've had better. This is a great steakhouse and one of the best I've had in Vegas. Oh forgot to mention that I had a glass of pinot noir red wine. I ordered it while I was at the bar and it was happy hour pricing =D  Great steak dinner  Recommendation: Prime bone in porterhouse steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame bread
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime riveted

O9MLy2X_8ioxbDtuJSJKyg.text: Best service-thank you Brandy!, best steak!, best ambience, piano music to relax and enjoy. What more could one ask for? Absolutely nothing! Great dining experience! can not wait for a return visit.

BBZGQ4UlIFb_7j9FDnwIlA.text: Not impressed.   Ruth's Chris is not the end all of steak houses, but I think it serves as a good benchmark and this place fell below the mark. We had a party of 20 in a private room.   1. Place smelled like a musty cooter.  2. Asked for a bruised, dirty martini - got a martini. No bruising, no dirty.  3.
