Found out that the staff was bringing out expensive extras like truffle butter, even though no one had asked for them.   For this price tag, I want my steak and drink to be perfect. This place got it 1/2 right.

2MIeIMYcvy6Dhvilxk2uTQ.text: One of the best steak houses in Las Vegas!  It is up there with SW.  Excellent service by all staff.  Especially loved the VIP cocktail!  YUMMY!  I'd go back just for that.  The steak was of course great, but the lemon cake was moist and delicious.  Will be back again!

rZRnk-3s6rlqeu5JrBGKKQ.text: I'd give it 3.5 stars.   The prix fixe menu is a pretty good value unless you want their 24oz prime porterhouse. I'm OK with an upcharge since that's much different from the 8oz filet it normally comes with. What I have a problem with is getting charged $30 more for a steak that's only $20 more on the menu. When the manager's answer is "that's a corporate decision" and offers no other explanation, I think that's a really really poor answer (if I can even call it an answer).   The food was really good. I had very little waste on my porterhouse and it was very flavorful. My wife's filet was just right. The shrimp that it came with were huge and had a great bbq type sauce to go with them.   The service was very good with one glaring exception. They forgot our au gratins. When asked about it she had a blank look in her eyes. About 5 minutes later they were brought out to us and we were told our order had been burned so they made us new ones. No, they weren't. They were simply forgotten. Just say so and we'll move on, do not lie to us.   A few glitches but the food was stellar. Will we be back......I'm not sure.

ysM8nmqXrbi3RLGqy9vxnQ.text: Wow!!  Really great food! My husband said it was the best steak he's ever had! I loved the shrimp scampi, better than most seafood restaurants. We also enjoyed the seafood soup, lobster Mac n cheese was divine and the asparagus was so good! Nice ambiance great restaurant with a lot of neat rooms for small private parties. Cool 007 themed wine table!

kP30jqUY5Xi1E7DCkzQmjA.text: I was looking for a place to celebrate the hubby's birthday during our stay in Vegas. Having been to the one in NY, I decided to give the Vegas one a shot. Through the pictures, I saw that it had the old school, classy ambiance, which is definitely a positive in my book. Instead of calling for reservations, I made reservations the day of through Open Table, and it was easy breezy.  Upon arriving, we were greeted warmly by the hostess(es) and after giving my name for the reservation, we were seated. It was fairly empty in the restaurant, there were perhaps four or five other tables seated. Our server was great. She came over and asked if we were celebrating anything, to which I responded that we were celebrating a birthday. She gave us plenty of time to go over our menus and went over the specials with us, pleasantly answering any questions we had. While we were still going over the menu, our server came by with a birthday card signed by the staff for my husband, which I thought was a sweet touch.  The food was excellent. Everything that came to the table was hot, not warm, so I knew it wasn't sitting around in the kitchen waiting. We ordered a shrimp cocktail and crab cake sampler appetizer. I'm allergic to crab so I couldn't taste it, but my husband and our friends said it was possibly one of the best crab cakes they ever ate. There wasn't much filling in the cake at all, just large lumps of crab.  The shrimp cocktail was tasty with the different sauce toppings: cocktail, Italian marinade and a remoulade. For entrees, I ordered the filet topped with froie gras butter and two jumbo shrimp, my husband and our friend both order the steak trio, each filet had a different topping to sample and my girlfriend ordered the beef medallions. My steak was cooked perfectly, tender and pretty much melt in your mouth. For sides, the table split the green beans in a garlic, wine sauce and the potatoes gratin. Everything was great.  The topper was the giant lemon cake slice that came out for my husband with of course, a candle. We split the cake four ways (especially since we were already quite full from dinner). Let me just say, my husband is not a fan of lemon cake, and he loved it.   Overall, this is a great place to come to celebrate a special occasion or for a romantic dinner. The service was great and the food, very appetizing. I highly recommend!

SwYnZlxwV0_Ar8T7UHFi3w.text: Everytime I go to Vegas, I mean Everytime, I have to eat here. I love this place, from the Ambience to the food to the great staff.  The Food is Heavenly.

pegQVqjDuKZok3rB0KSeOQ.text: One word. Wagyu. Straight buttery beef. I didn't bother trying to eat anything else, but tasted some oysters and some delicious drinks. If you can drop the loot, you should eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu was like butter. So good. Huge portion, so I had to slice it up for my friends to try too. A must try if you can.

-IkNO_JhHkm-qby-Mo4vhQ.text: Reservations set for 9:30pm on a Saturday night.  Got there and was seated right after checking in.  To start we got a pitcher of their specialty drink the "VIP".  It was so tasty and smooth I feel like I can drink the whole pitcher myself.  Vodka infused pineapples aged for xx amount of days then squeezed and served on the rocks or as a martini.    Starters:  Crab Cake - Simply amazing, fresh and full of crabs with a delightful sauce that just enhances the flavor of the crab.  To top it off the bread that they serve goes really well with the sauce, and we were told that is the right way to eat the crab cake and sauce.  Use the bread and clean the plate =).  Shanghai style calamari - Interesting, and full of flavor as well.  Sweet and spicy sauce that adds a tangy twist to the calamari yet still crispy.    Special chop salad - lettuce, blue cheese, bacon, and avocado.  Simple yet refreshing.  Main course:  Tomahawk cut of the Wagyu beef rib eye - So tender and huge, this is a portion to share between two people.   Bone in Rib eye - Cooked just the way I asked for.  Always a plus when I can get the cut cook just the way I like it.  The plate comes out piping hot so it also helps cook the meat more.  Flavorful and tender.  Sides: Cream Spinach - has bacon bits so it was really good.  MMMMmmm bacon  Lobster Mac n Cheese - This was good as well, but I would pick the spinach to be the better side of the night.   All of this food only cost us around $350, which isn't bad at all.

JxUxLOMqOPoz9DakmOm3aQ.text: I love visiting high end steakhouse but this one let me down. I'm from San Francisco and I had better steak with lower price. Their fried oyster is really good but the steak was not impressive at all.  Customer services was world class.

zSed7BqgBejBbSgVGKyUIw.text: The food was excellent,  the prices exorbitant and the service was poor. You can get a good steak at much better prices around town. This place was recommended to us, but I won't be rushing back.  The waitress seemed to be annoyed we were dining there.

T58HGLeczxkLWL216wxI2Q.text: We met up with some people for dinner at their favorite steak place in Vegas. Del Frisco's  was pretty empty on a Sunday night.  I had the bone in filet, and everyone else ordered the dry aged rib eye.  Normally I'm a bone in rib eye kind of girl, so this was different for me.  We ordered asparagus, creamed spinach, and au gratin potatoes to share.  I read a few Yelp reviews before dinner, so I was prepared for the sesame bread.  It was good; nice and soft on the inside, warm, and definitely messy, as the sesame seeds were falling all over the place.  The steaks were all enjoyable.  One thing I appreciated was that we were asked to cut into our steak immediately so the doneness could be confirmed on the spot.  Another nice touch was we were actually served the sides instead of getting our own.  They also brought out a slice of cake for the birthday boy.  I don't mind paying a lot of money for my dining experiences, but it seemed a little high for what we got.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in filet w/ spinach, asparagus, &amp; au gratin potatoes

BCUHmrOkSIb_bJ8FZMLZpA.text: Have been coming to this location for YEARS, and it is by FAR the BEST steak house, and the best in Las Vegas. Liz is always our waitress, and I adore her. The food is HIGH quality, and the service is up there as well.. If you are looking for high end dinning, and an over GREAT night, I recommend you coming here. THE BEST IN ALL OF LAS VEGAS

iZoEyKnJaROhFyCRB8xaAQ.text: Are you freakin' kidding me? The happy hour at this place has got to be one of the best deals I have had so far in this fair land of ours. $6 for each bar menu item!!! And I'm not talking about crappy tiny 1 oz. sliders but a huge, full-sized prime burger which was fantastic. Accompanying chips were also very tasty.  Friend and I also got the crab cakes (not on bar menu), seriously one of the best around--little filler, all large chunks of crab meat, not the shredded meat crap. We also got the BBQ shrimp, fantastic. Scallops were good, not outstanding but good. I also threw in a strip steak and I don't know if it was just because I ate so much by that point or what but I thought it was good, not great.  Also $6 drinks. Needless to say I had a few VIP martinis.  Danger: sesame bread doesn't look appetizing at all but unfortunately we tried it and we were hooked. That's what did us in. It had a super crust on the outside and so soft inside and it was amazing. Totally worth blowing some carb calories on it. Really slowed me down by the time the strip came out.  I am a buffet aficionado but will be hitting this place every time I am back in LV. Everything above except for the crab cakes and strip steak were on the bar menu.

adjRwnE-lC5ZJlgmZ_aUlg.text: Of course for this place you know you're going to get big portions.  The wait staff was very knowledgeable and after we were seated she started firing information at us but she was going so fast that I missed most of it.  The dining room was really nice but it is what you would expect out of a high end steakhouse. We ordered a soup and a salad to share.  Both weren't really worth the $10 each.  We had the porter house steak which was cooked perfectly and not disappointing at all.  The highlight was the side dish though.  The potatoes were excellent.  So cheesy and creamy and fantastic.  Needless to say we didn't take any of those home with us!  This was a good meal and the service was great.  I would return.

mnWvsa9WLV2vBR1ciy7ybA.text: Yes, it is expensive (as all high end restaurants are in Vegas). But if you are looking for one of the best steak dinners you will ever have, anywhere in the world, then definitely consider this place....also, Charlie Palmer, Smith & Wollensky, and SW Steak House, are all excellent choices

qB4K2UGeNQqLZoYn5-JnkA.text: What an experience!  we order 20oz lobster,12 oz lobster, 26oz steak,buttered mushrooms,sauteed broccoli and more steak. everything melted in your mouth.   Fresh sesame seed bread. YUMMY!  When the waiters brought out the food they served us. We did not have to do anything just stuff our faces.  It's expensive here but worth every penny.  The ambiance is fun, not quiet and stiff.  You have to go and try it out.

Kd5BZ09fJ4mOy7g82zEYlw.text: Had dinner here on a Saturday night and everything was excellent!  Service was great and the food was outstanding.  I had the prix fixe menu for $49 with a rib eye instead which cost extra but was so flavorful.  I had the crab cake which was sooooo good and we all shared the spinach (which was just ok), lobster mac and cheese (delicious) and the au gratin potatoes (decent).  It was my finance birthday so they brought out a huge lemon cake which was pretty good as well.  The steaks are the best and that crab cake!!

sihyHkRCWAbLuFJlV6le5g.text: WOW!! Never had i been to a steak house where the steaks are as big, juice, and delicious as the one I had here at Del Frisco's. The service was spectacular, and all together an AMAZING place to find the best steak.

EC0ZghuWh_IcUoXNmvbm1Q.text: I've been to most of the popular steak houses from coast to coast but to me, this one is my last supper choice for meat. The bone in ribeye is full of flavor and it is always consistent no matter when I visit Las Vegas.

ryWjd7VU2C43RpzYU_cMCw.text: Best steakhouse deal in Vegas.  Super classy, right off the strip, amazing steaks and sides, great service - and a dinner prix fixe menu that is the best deal in town.  My husband and I came here for dinner, it is his favorite place to come with "the boys."  There used to be a cigar room, but it is gone now.  They advertise a set menu on their website and yelp, but not on their menu or at the location.  You have to ask for the menu, but it is really good.  You get a salad (all the good ones are available to choose from), a filet mignon with a crab cake, a side of your choosing and a dessert for two people for $100.  That is basically half off.  Our server was very attentive, bread basket  and water glasses were always full, wine was brought out with dinner as requested, steak was cooked perfectly.   I would definitely go back again, even without the amazing deal!

2bh5Y6aXE0UJrjeYlJtIjg.text: They have some pretty good chefs because the food was delicious.  The steak literally sizzled off the plate and the side dishes were served in family style.  Don't forget the Malbec wine if you order steak. Amazingness in your mouth when you wash it down with the wine. I went with a group of 10 of so and the service was great! You get what you pay for here and it was worth every cent I spent.  I will be coming back here again when I visit! Don't forget dessert!

Xnicrqi-LaCB2nXk8o_tzg.text: This was probly the best steakhouse I've ever been to and I've been to many especially in Vegas. The filet medallion special was spot on, cooked to perfection, and the lobster Mac and cheese was to die for. The service started off slow but once she got started she totally made up for it. Awesome experience, I would do it again anytime, I highly recommend this place

nVtRMBLBxqf1si9Dul7w1g.text: Heard many good things about this place but it just fell flat, aside from a very slow server to average tasting food I can't see myself coming back to this restaurant. The inside looks dated like an old 80s restaurant feel. You think for what you're paying the whole experience would be exceptional,  but far from the truth. The steak tartar was bland and poorly seasoned, I had a bone in ribeye for my entree which actually was decent but not enough to want me to return considering all the other choices around that part of Vegas. The lemon cake was good with no complaints there.

LfxAuktfdKgkI5BaGWigqQ.text: Great steaks and calamari was extremely spicy!  Great spot for a business dinner and the Mac n cheese is excellent.

Moihn6RkfgmU9o9xYBNMTw.text: Extremely disappointed with our experience at Del Frisco's Double Eagle.   Made a reservation for 4 on a Thursday night. All of us were super excited--who wouldn't be, when potentially awesome steak is in sight?! When we arrived at the restaurant, it wasn't as busy as I expected it to be. We were seated at the very corner, next to the area where servers and bus persons bring plates and whatnot for cleaning. So there was a lot of foot traffic.   We ordered the following appetizers: Tuna tartare, shanghai-style fried calamari, and the seared Hudson valley foie gras. The tuna tartare and the foie gras were excellent. The fried calamari, however, was a huge disappointment. There were barely any calamari on the plate. Most of the dish was covered in bean sprouts drizzled in an overly sweet chili glaze.   My sister ordered a negroni to compliment the appetizers. When the cocktail arrived, it came in a chipped glass. She had to flag down our server to get this remedied. The lack of attention to detail was a bit disappointing.   For our entrees, my sister ordered the Filet Mignon and both my brother-in-law and husband ordered the dry aged ribeye. The filet was cooked properly and was seasoned well. My bro-in-law's ribeye was perfectly cooked and also seasoned well. But the ribeye that my husband and I shared was a complete disappointment. When the plate arrived, I noticed the steak had no outer crust. I love a steak with a good crust and a reddish/pink center--basically what we asked for our steak. But what we got seemed like an afterthought. The meat wasn't cooked properly, the seared crust was missing, the center was too red, and there was barely any seasoning. I understand you want to experience the actual taste of the meat, but a little salt and pepper typically enhances the flavor of the steak.   Overall, we were disappointed. I believe if you're a local, you'll probably be treated well at Del Frisco's. But if you're from out of town, maybe you're better off going to a steakhouse at The Strip.

bTFRERRGBHmQJqSIXDMN3A.text: This is one of my favorite in Vegas...  first time I came here 2 years ago with my buddies to just for one special drink call VIP pineapple martini. This drink is fabulous it taste like  lemonade  very very tasty and really enjoyable.  If you trying steaks here you should definitely go with bone in ribeye, Burgers hmmm I must say I never had any better than Del Frisco's burgers in my life.   Once again if you ever come to Del Frisco you should definitely try VIP martini.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VIP

UEajBKVt7D4Z5Aaj2Fa9Ng.text: Del Friscos double eagle is a must try in vegas!! The location is off the strip and away from all the traffic. I loved everything about my visit. They have a live band playing in the background which was very romantic and soothing. The service was excellent and menu was not overwhelming. The top choices would be their filet mignon, bone in ribeye, and porterhouse.   I ordered their $55 filet mignon prefix meal which came with 2 sides and my date had the bone in ribeye. Our server highly recommended getting their crab cakes and I can't agree more! It's by far the best I've had! Each bite was so savory.. so fresh. There was barely any fillers. We also ordered their lobster mac and cheese, another must have. We requested our steaks to be cooked medium rare. It was cooked right on point! Both our steaks were seasoned perfectly with salt and pepper. It was extremely tender and rich in flavor. Between the 2 of us, we still had a lot of food left over. This is definitely a great place to go for a quality dinner at a great price. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lemon cake was such a pleasant surprise! Light, fluffy and layered with flavor! Really blew me away!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon 8oz
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye seasoned with black pepper and salt

d8yiXMh4i19gCV1A23nlLA.text: They have a great Happy Hour! The BAR MENU and some selected drinks are half off. You won't be able to find the times on their website but just give them a quick call.  We got the Prime Burger and the Beef Tips. The burger was far better than the tips. You can chose between chips or fries, both are made in house and equally delicious. The patty itself was big and meaty. It could have used some salt but still one of the better burgers I've had.   The service was friendly and attentive.

avyeRFMlNCux4VhDHqu5pA.text: Only because the place is under construction and no one told us when we booked. The Chilean Sea Bass was killer and the steaks are always top notch.  Unfortunately the place smelled bad as they had a sewer problem due to construction.

WiAMG2vMUhmqMoPmug2nfA.text: One of the best steakhouse I've been to. It's off strip, the atmosphere is very old school and classy, also has live musical entertainment.  I recommend the James Bond table. The service is what you would expect from a five stars establishment. Do not forget to order the crab cakes for an appetizer. Steaks are always perfect temperature and taste like perfection. Overall, like I said, a top rate steakhouse and I most certainly recommend this place!

UT6He3lxmL5KjGbIryDZBQ.text: When the sizzling steaks were delivered to our table simultaneously, a line of servers followed promptly with overflowing side dishes and served them to each guest like a beautifully rehearsed dance. This, ladies and gentlemen, is what heaven must be like...  Hold up.. let's back up a little bit... Recently in town for SEMA and decided to indulge in a nice meal.  Del Frisco's came highly recommended by my cousin, who dines here every time they're in Vegas. My husband and I are total carnivores, so we've seen our fair share of steakhouses, but I have to say, after the dining experience we had recently, Del Frisco's is pretty high up there on our list.   Everything was absolutely delicious--  For Appetizers we had the Crab Cakes, which were chocked full of huge lumps of fresh crab meat, as well as the Wagyu Beef, that just melted in your mouth.  For my Main Course I ordered the 12 oz filet which arrived perfectly cooked to my specifications. Upon first glance, it looked like a small 12 oz, but after all the sides, I wasn't complaining.  Shareable side dishes included Lobster Mac, Mushrooms, Brussel Sprouts, and Gratin Potatoes-- all of which were delicious! I also had the house infused Pineapple Vodka, which was perfectly sweet and tropical.   For dessert, the Lemon Cake and Butter Cake were both to die for.  But the Banana Bread Pudding might have been the highlight of my night-- the bread pudding to top all bread puddings!  Moist, sweet, and decadent. UGH.  Zane (like from One Direction :D) was our server this past weekend for a table of 3 couples, and I don't even know where to begin.  He was amazing.  He gave perfect descriptions and wise recommendations, interacted with our dynamic group and chuckled along with us; he really made for the perfect experience.  One of the managers spent time at our table, and was also very personable.   Better than the food was the amazing service.  With the help of additional staff, plates were cleared promptly, food was delivered in perfect timing, and glasses were refilled almost after every sip.  But not in the annoying way that you feel like you're being watched.  It was all very effortless! Next time you're in Vegas, ditch the Ruth's Chris and Center Cut run of the mill steakhouses.  Spend a little more cash and visit Del Frisco's.  You will be so glad you did!

LgwleC5SmYDC8AoN9yX14g.text: I was very impressed with this place.  I hadn't originally heard of it and was recommended to me by a coworker when I asked about a steakhouse to eat at.  I love that it isn't on the strip and is easy to find.  The service was great. Our server was awesome and gave awesome recommendations. I tried pretty much everything he recommended and I am so glad I did.  I started the night off with their signature cocktail, VIP. If you come here you need to try this martini. It's their pineapple infused drink and it the smoothest drink I have ever had in my life. It's one of those dangerous drinks that you can't even tell you are drinking alcohol. It was so good I had two!  I decided to get the filet mignon special for dinner. This was three, three oz steaks each with different toppings. The first was topped with brie cheese, the second was oscar style (crab, asparagus and a bearnaise sauce), and the third was topped with shrimp and a scallop. I had it prepared medium and they were so amazing! We also had a side of chateau potatoes so I wasn't able to finish the whole mean because I wanted to save room for dessert! This was totally ok with me though because that meant leftovers for the next day.  For dessert we decided to get their signature lemon cake. It was seven layer lemon cake with lemon frosting. We ate most of it but left a lot of the frosting because the cake was good enough without it.   I highly recommend this steak house for those looking to have an amazing steak dinner with great service.   Treat yourself and try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateau potatoes!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon special of the night!

7eMcf1MIGnz_7GaU0yY0Uw.text: Stopped in for great steak with a friends after days in LV.  Want to try out what's all the hype about that has been highly recommended by friends.  The layout of the restaurant is amazing. They have so many rooms that with lots of people dining and waiting that you don't feel crowed or overwhelming.  I was a little disappointed that for a big nice high end restaurant that you have a small bathroom to accommodate all the customers.  The service is amazing, our waiter speaks a little way too fast like he was in a competition but he does know what he's taking about, very knowledgeable guy.  The service staff that service our table was great too. Thumbs up for those guys.  The steak is amazing amazing so juicy and so good. We also had some side dishes too, such as mac and cheese, corn and much more. Side dishes are ok but will definitely go back for the steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B0zvQvYXbzIIYQqvlYKgiA.text: Came here for Valentines Day and it was excellent. I expect things to be a little slower and a little more crammed in on that day but everything was on point. The food and the service were both amazing. Thank you for a terrific evening.

8KFenN2wwZXHgw_ijyECGA.text: I will say that this restaurant truly delivers and really is the ultimate steakhouse. I personally chose this steak house over SW steakhouse to celebrate my 10 year anniversary and 1 year of marriage with my wife. A lot of pressure I felt was on the line for me because I changed my plan at the last minute. Turns out it was well worth it.  Restaurant design - walking inside the restaurant was pretty cool. It had a red carpet and felt like you were vip status. Well we went inside a limo so maybe that adds to it. No greeter at the front, but no big deal. Inside the restaurant was pretty nice and can tell it was remodeled completely. Nice retro feel and lights hanging at the ceiling was pretty cool. It was pretty romantic setting, but nothing super spectacular like you expect on the strip like waterfalls or video shows etc.  Greeters - awesome greeters and were well aware of my intentions to celebrate my special moment with my wife. They gave me a few moments so that way waiters can prepare the table and keep us posted. I got walked to my table with my wife and a nice card was displayed for us with live signatures of all staff members. I found that very clever and really cool. Also it looked as though the card was original and a few hearts were recently drawn on the card as well. Enjoyed that.   Customer service - rate of 10/10.  The service and high reviews and ratings on yelp speak for itself. Tommy was my server and very professional at his job. Tommy checked on us multiple times and always was present when we needed assistance. When Tommy was helping out with a larger group that came in, another staff member helped us and introduced himself. I swear they treated myself any my wife like family. Last but not least, I remember asking for rose petals at the table which I was not too upset but was like it's alright no biggie , but eventually the manager approached my wife and delivered a dozen rose petals with a vase to her instead. Wow, I was simply blown away. Manager greeted us and followed by the assistant manager. Another staff member brought the food for us and served the steak and cut it for us. She took pictures of everything displayed at our table and we didn't even have to ask. We got complimentary dessert as well which is awesome too and didn't expect it. And yes they even bagged our food and placed plastic silverware inside. Truly spectacular service. Mad props to the general manager and her staff.   Food - spectacular 10/10. My wife and I ordered king Alaskan crab as an appetizer, cut to perfection which allowed us to pull out at the top with no problem to share. Bread was offered and three different flavors to choose for sauce. Pretty neat there. Main course was a three piece steak like 4 ounces each, but with each different flavors and toppings on top like shrimp and crab. Highly worth it for the price and cooked to perfection. Definitely make sure you get the lobster Mac and cheese and also the spinach. Sides made the steak even more enjoyable.   Overall - you are not going to get the best view or shall I say like see waterfalls, spectacular views or video display shows or anything else unlike other restaurants on the strip of course. Small restaurant inside and definitely doesn't appeal to the strip atmosphere like bigger is better and more glamorous then all other places etc etc etc. However , this is truly a unique restaurant. Whoever said you need all that stuff to have a good time. This restaurant defines that and truly represents the best of its class on steak at it's finest. Customer service here is truly hard to beat. I work as a mortgage loan officer and I know when I see good service. Talk about a restaurant that truly spoils you. They deserve all bragging rights.  Job well done. Restaurant core values start at service and the level of food. That's all I needed.  By the way, my wife and I ended up going to SW steakhouse two days later and overall was so so. Once you enjoy a spectacular dinner at Frisco's, you expect the same amount of delivery or would like to see same amount of quality and service wise. Not close compared to Frisco's. Definitely coming back when we come back to Vegas again.   Last but not least, I truly believe this was the best restaurant dining experience ever. It was even better at a restaurant that I proposed to my wife in San Ramon ca and that was prepared in two month advance. Love this place and highly recommend Frisco's. Thank you so much for the experience and the memory for life. Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qM4kMcDMxrMD4YuDS7qb0Q.text: This restaurant is simply spectacular! The service is impeccable and the food is outstanding. They have delicious seafood and outstanding steaks. Their desserts are phenomenal!

VakRdgB6MhqNe6Xbzr-3TQ.text: My first time eating at Del Frisco's. We chose here for our last night dining in Vegas. We had a 8:30pm reservation and were seated promptly. I was surprised for a Saturday night that it was not that busy.   For appetizers we had the crab cake which was exceptional as well as the shrimp cocktail. Shrimp cocktail were good but I didn't like the fact they were served with the cocktail sauce poured over it. It was a little on the sweet side and I would have liked to control how much sauce I put on it. After that we shared a ceaser salad which was tasty. For entrees we shared the 16 ounce NY strip with asparagus and mashed for our sides. Mashed were delicious. Asparagus lacked flavor but the sliced almonds helped.  Dessert we went with the butter cake served with pecan ice cream. This was absolutely amazing. Very rich the two of us could not finish it.   As far as service it was exceptional. All the waiters were extremely attentive. I hold back 5 stars because I ordered the steak medium and it was more on the rare side. The beef was very tender and still had great flavor.  One tip I want to add, they have an extensive wine list and if you know your wines they have some exceptional values on the list that are extremely underpriced. 2 cocktails, bottle of wine , shrimp cocktail, crab cake, ceaser salad, steak, asparagus, mashed and dessert came to 300 including tip. I think it's a good value when you take into account the dining choices located in the resorts. Great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EyZpJSfk3Mnb6PsuNcTPwA.text: Absolutely amazing prime Porterhouse.  Thick juicy and medium rare as requested.  The creamed corn and creamed spinach were equally amazing.  Totally recommend if your in the Vegas area.

EkOW318th9hN0kwRC5fcsg.text: I chose Del Friscos over beef wellingtons at Gordon Ramsays because of the strong recommendations my two gfs had made about the steaks here.    Not as snobby fancy as let's say, Mastros or CUT, much more casual and old school in ambiance and decor.  Which I prefer as higher end restaurants make me feel too stuffy.    We ordered 2 glasses of Malbec which Pinky loved, he ended up drink 2 3/4 glasses.. the 3/4 glass was mine that I didn't want to finish.    The complimentary bread they gave us smelled so yummy and was so soft, but I wish there was more of a distinct flavor to it.    Ordered a dozen of their oysters (half east coast, half west... I only remember one of the names, Stellar Bay).  The oysters were tasty, but I had to tweak their mignonette a little to my liking by adding some salt and pepper.  The real downside of the oysters though was how sloppily they were shucked!  There was shell in every single oyster!  We were literally spitting out pieces of shell for every oyster we ate which has never been the case for anywhere we've eaten oysters till now.    Asparagus cooked with almonds, salt, pepper, and butter.  There was no butter on asparagus, but that worked out for us as we preferred it without any butter however I think some people might not appreciate that.  I wish there was a little spritz of lemon in this side to bring out the fresh flavors more.    Lobster mac and cheese was my pick.  Lobster in mac and cheese, exactly how it would taste if you took a piece of lobster and ate it with your mac and cheese.  Not crazy special in my opinion, mac and cheese itself was just okay.  Didn't blow this cheese fanatic's mind.    Shared the American kobe long bone for $90(?), the sides of the meat were buttery and so tender, however when we got to the center it started to lose the flavor we were enjoying.  To be honest the center of the American Kobe became somewhat tough, not flap meat tough, but it definitely was not tender enough to be considered anything kobe in our books.  The seasoning of the meat though was really good, perfectly salted with a tasty crust and the perfect temperature of medium rare.    Lemon cake, yum-o!  I love lemon cake!  What's surprising was that Pinky enjoyed this cake as well and he hates all things lemon!  What's good about this cake is that it has the perfect amount of lemon flavor, just enough for the lemon lovers and not too much for people who aren't fans.  The frosting was pretty sweet, but it was a perfect complement to the not too sweet cake and filling.  The cake itself looks plain Jane, but it's quite tasty!  Idk if I'd come back just because I feel pretty meat-ed out after that meal.  If were to though, I'd come and try their ribeye or filet instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spread
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American kobe longbone

xIndxH-NGZB7eOa7Puz2iw.text: Great steak and onion rings and the butter cake for dessert was awesome. The VIP drink was the best. Kristin was a great server and very knowledgeable. I will definitely return here.

Nt4GrI5FtSc2FtkqAB0FNA.text: Classy. Amazing steak. Sea bass with crab fried rice.... so yummy!!! Potatoes au gratin nice and cheesy. Very good apple martini. Definitely one of the best steak houses in Vegas.

Ftvk_rcaSvKI8YhGF_RMtA.text: The bone-in ribeye was very good. Almost as good as Ruth's Chris.  The lobster Mac and cheese was excellent and the celebration dessert was amazing. Excellent service too.

QYCF9_7jSksjk7c7Lx0nEw.text: A friend highly recommended this restaurant so we decided to try it for my wife's birthday dinner. We showed around 6pm and the restaurant was empty. We were seated 5 minutes later into an empty room and the servers were very friendly. Everything is bad from there. We ordered their summer prie fix New York for $49 and tomahawk for $95. As we are working through our salad a few flies come by and starts bugging us and tries to land on our food. I alert the waiter and he says it's because of construction. Ok, sure no biggie. The flies didn't stop and a manager comes by seeing that we were trying to swat them. We have a conversation about it and she just laughs it off like it's nothing and moved along.   The steaks come out, I ordered medium rare but it came out rare. I didn't get to mention this to the waiters since they were slammed at this point and didn't come by for awhile. When I did mention it, he said he wouldn't mention it to our waiter, but never got back. After one of the flies started to get close to my steak I swatted it and it lands on our table. I wanted to show them but I guess that sucker wasn't dead. It got up after a few minutes and started to bug me the whole time I was trying to eat my steak. At this point I was over it and wanted to get the bill. No one for awhile longer. A couple workers come by to clean up and asked if they could take my plate. I was a bit hesitant (since I wanted to show our server how raw my steak was) and they ended up just taking the plate anyways since it was already in his hand and I was over it. They surprised us with a birthday desert (after about 10 minutes after taking our plates). I asked for our check it and it comes almost immediately.  Overall, the bill with tip is $200 (172 + 28 tip) for a undercooked 32 ounce tomahawk and New York meal with truffle butter. I'm sure you can find a pleasurable experience and meal other places in Vegas...

yawNBefDa_NeRG_oVaZ92A.text: It is hard choosing where to have your Valentines Day dinner in a city like Las Vegas. There are so many great options to choose from, that overthinking your choice can become a problem.   Fortunately, I chose Del Frisco's and my date was very happy. As expected, the place was packed but we were seat right at our reservation time. It is a large restaurant that is sectioned off into several smaller rooms, which was a smart decision, as it keeps the noise insulated and makes for a more intimate setting. It has an old school look to it, a lot of wood and purposely faded paint on the walls.   Our server was very courteous and helpful, and made ordering very simple. We ended up having foie gras and calamari as starters, followed by our main which was the 32oz wagyu bone-in ribeye with mushrooms and asparagus (we split it of course). Everything was simply fantastic, but the stand outs were the ribeye and the mushrooms. The ribeye just melted in your mouth and the mushrooms ate like a delicious steak. Super good.   For dessert, we had the Godiva Mousse cake and the lemon cake. Be warned, the portions were surprisingly large - especially the lemon cake. It could easily be split between two people, maybe three. Needlessly to say, we boxed it up after such a big meal and will probably be digging into it later today. :)

NVl64r2_i4ZEUbNmNCDO6w.text: We found ourselves in Vegas for our anniversary and I yelped steakhouses. Del Frisco's was one I had never heard of and was not on the strip, so we made reservations to celebrate. I let them know it was our anniversary, and when we arrived, they had a special corner table set up for us with an anniversary card and decorations.   We started with the bacon, which they served and cut for us, and it was divine! Just the right amount of smoke flavor and very tender. I had the ribeye and hubs went with the dry aged rib eye. The difference between the aged and non-aged is noticeable in the texture and slightly different flavor. But both steaks were cooked to perfection, and everything you could ask for in a steak. Our sides were the creamed spinach and del's potato, both were delicious.   Can I just say that the service was over the top, fantastic! The servers were attentive, pleasant, and even the manager stopped by to wish us a happy anniversary. We ended the night with a celebratory butter cake which put us into a food-coma. Definitely an anniversary dinner to remember.

z4LHbyI7yW_AkKnKuT9EIw.text: I felt a little dressed down for this restaurant, but right from the time I entered the door, from beginning to the end, the staff was AWESOME!    The woman at the podium took our names for the wait, even her greeting was welcoming and instantly I felt comfortable because of her warmness.  The female bartender was awesome and made our drinks and had them brought to our table.  With the help of James and Mark, our whole experience was a great one! Also our host, I couldn't hear if her name was Melanie or Melody, I apologize, but thank you for being awesome as well. The food was AMAZING! Just as amazing as the STAFF!   We ordered the bone in rib eye, crab cakes, calamari (DEEEEEELICIOUS!), and wine....I actually forgot the name of my steak dish but it was awesome! I can't wait to come back!!  All the way from Frisco, Alofas and thank you!

sa07DMrv1_fvwrPqU5r8bA.text: This is by far the best steakhouse we have gone to in L.V.  We try to go every time we visit Vegas, if time allows.   This time we went and took my mom. Her first time. SHE LOVED IT and is now spoiled. Lol.  Had a couple of house margaritas ($8) and a Chimay Red ($16) at the bar while waiting for our table. Both good!!!    This was the first time we tried the onion rings.  Amazingly big. Crunchy and tasty!  And well...their crabcakes?  Delicious. You cannot go to Del Friscos and not get their crabcakes.  I mean it's all crab!!  Need I say more?    Tried the shrimp platter this time and it was not disappointing. (We normally get the shrimp cocktail, but tried something new)  The shrimps are big and meaty.  Mmmm...mmmmm!  We ordered a porterhouse (ate it before I remembered to take a photo) & it was good. (Sent it back as it was a bit too rare...but when It came back...perfectly cooked)    Mom had the 8oz filet. She dug in before a photo too. LOL.   Everything was great.   And the best part for mom was dessert. The butter cake!  OH WOW!  Please order this. Lol. It's sooo good.    Can't wait ti get back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicous Crabcake $21.00
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake (delicious!!) with candle and chocolate cake with white chocolate. (Bday sign is edible chocolate)
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Cab $20/glass and Onion Rings $12.50

oiXnq0YFJXR4qZOSfK8MNg.text: Due to a reservation error at another restaurant, we decided to make a super last minute reservation at Del Frisco's for my birthday dinner. Since I had visited the New York location and was extremely satisfied with my service, I was excited to try the Las Vegas location.  I made reservations for 5 people for 8pm, and we were quickly seated upon arrival. Right away, we had someone come and explain the wine menu to us as well as bring out bread (which is delicious! Warm and fluffy!) We ordered a bottle of champagne for the table, and they were quick to bring out the bottle, and make sure our glass was always filled.   My husband and I decided to split a 12oz filet mignon, cooked medium, and crab cake. The filet was cooked perfectly, but the crab cake had a little too much lobster sauce, and wasn't as full or as good as the New York location. My friend ordered the salmon, which comes with mashed potatoes. She seemed happy. My brother and his girlfriend shared a shrimp appetizer and a bruschetta dish. They both seemed satisfied with there order.  Because we were celebrating my birthday, a birthday dessert which consisted of butter cake (heavenly) and a dark chocolate cake (yum) was brought out. I definitely recommend the butter cake if you have room, it's amazingly delicious!  Overall, I was pretty happy with our dinner and service. Although I will say that the New York location was a little better when it came to the food. Even though this place is located off strip, I look forward to my next trip to Del Frisco's.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz filet mignon
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dessert. BUtter Cake and a dark chocolate cake. Delicious!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DEL&#39;S JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKE

8-guq4Kv3owoZPY3LxXZ3A.text: I don't eat steak. I don't like beef, really don't care for a lot of meats. Surprise, surprise, I REALLY enjoyed my dinner here!  I ordered the "Prime Pair" prix fixe for $59. Kudos, it's terrific that they don't require everyone at the table to order the set menu. I'm sure it's confusing for the kitchen and for the servers but the flexibility was sure appreciated.   The meal is definitely more than a "pair" as you get a nice salad (the wedge salad was SO good) AND an entree (salmon, yum) AND a beautiful crab cake full of lump meat PLUS a delicious side (creamed spinach is chunky like a spinach dip.) You might also be surprised to learn that the side served with the prix fixe menu is actually a full order and not a half. It's a LOT of food!   On a summertime Saturday night, the dining room was about 3/4 full. It's a fairly peaceful place despite the efforts of the live musician playing classics and odd renditions of newer songs lol. Service is attentive but not overbearing. Staff work as a team on just about everything and with minimal chitchat. The restaurant and restrooms are impeccably clean. This is a very well run operation.   Non-steak eaters rejoice! You, too, will do just fine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prix Fixe menu is a tremendous deal!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge (prix fixe)

F3wC43zwfqYyy-Z1opLlKQ.text: Looking for low carb options for Valentine's Day my guy and I ended up at Del Frisco's. It was excessively busy, as expected, but they handled the crowds like the pros they are.  We waited a bit in a cramped area, but once seated the service and meal was flawless. Our server was friendly and attentive, despite being pulled in a million different directions and she made sure our drinks were always full and our starters and steak arrived promptly.   We ordered the double eagle, because of course, and ate every morsel. Excellent meal as always at Del Frisco's.

FHeSBB3dKcQ7yWTUsl27Lg.text: I can't say enough about Del Frisco's!!! We went there for my husband's birthday. Our reserved table was delayed by about 15 minutes so they felt bad and offered us a round of drinks. When we got to our table a birthday card signed by the staff was waiting for my husband in his name.. The service was impeccable.  The sommelier stopped by to see if we were ok, the manager came by a few times and then when we were about done they brought him a birthday cake. Del Frisco's is an incredible restaurant with delicious food, attention to detail and service unheard of. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting at our table for my husband&#39;s birthday. And service was INCREDIBLE!!!

J3VJ8Jtk9hABaK02x9o0Gg.text: This has been a place that has been a long time staple since I have lived here in Vegas.   In any case, made our trip here for restaurant week.  Just to start it's worth the trip.  My friend and I made our selections from the restaurant week menu a Ceasar salad, 8 oz filet mignon (served with mashed potatoes) (my friend upcharged and got the 12oz) and layered chocolate mousse.  We added onion rings to the order as part of our side.   Each item came out nicely presented.  The food was good exactly the way we asked for it.   The servers were excellent and a wealth of info about other restaurant experiences they've had in town.  The general manager, Melody was a doll and spoke with us about our experience and the restaurant.   Overall a great experience, attention to detail and customer service; just what I like.

J__b1vssXeQUI70X6ucbpw.text: I've heard good things about this place, so I took my husband here for our Anniversary. I had to send my food back a few times (onion rings were saturated in oil and salty) I exchanged it for asparagus which came out COLD smh. I had a lemon drop which taste just like lemonade (I exchange it and it came back decent) the only thing I liked and was really good was the mashed potatoes (thumbs up) I don't like that we had to eat our meals separately and in pieces. I'm very dissatisfied

xlIkVoaN_8GSfdcCTHOpvw.text: HORRIBLE service! I've never felt so judged/offended in my entire life!! We heard amazing reviews about this place so it was a no-brainer when it came to making reservations for myself and 6 of my friends to celebrate someone's 26th birthday. The entire experience was absolutely terrible, from the waitress telling someone in our party that "they took a major step down in life" because they changed their order to a smaller steak and then standing near our table telling her coworker that we looked like we were a part of the mafia to the waitress throwing my card onto a used butter knife and then to top it off she blatantly laughed in our faces as we were paying the bill saying "I've never seen so many $1 bills in a fine dining restaurant before." Unless I missed a memo somewhere that $1 bills are no longer considered money, I'm pretty sure that our bill was paid for and she would've received an amazing tip! I've ate at plenty of "fine dining establishments" in my life and have never been treated to foully! This behavior is definitely not what I would classify as "fine dining".   Note to the staff: do not judge a book by it's cover just because they may be a young group, you never know what they do for work or where they come from!

KJ7sCh78DidGcv4u2MX9Ig.text: A friend decided to do his birthday dinner at Del Frisco's. We arrived to our reservation early on Thursday, January 24th, around 8:30pm, so just decided to chill in the bar area. (I believe our reservation was at 9pm?) We managed to find some seats at a table and slowly had a round of scotch as the restaurant was super busy. Our party of seven didn't actually sit down at our table until around 10:15pm.  *OYSTERS ON THE HALF SHELL ($19) x2 *THICK-CUT NUESKE'S BACON AU POIVRE. Bourbon Molasses Glaze ($16) x2 *DEL'S JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKE: Cajun-Lobster Cream Sauce ($21) x2 *SHANGHAI-STYLE FRIED CALAMARI: Sweet Chili Glaze, Bean Sprouts, Cherry Peppers, Crushed Peanuts & Scallions ($18) x2 *SEARED HUDSON VALLEY FOIE GRAS: Strawberry-Balsamic Glaze, Toasted Brioche & Crispy Onions ($24.50) x3 *CHARRED OCTOPUS: Gigante Beans, Tomatoes, Olives, Capers, Lemon & Cold-Pressed Olive Oil ($19.50) *STONE CRAB CLAWS ($24) x7 *LOBSTER BISQUE: Poached Lobster, Crema & Sherry ($14.50) *BONE-IN PRIME RIBEYE: 22 oz. ($64), add Foie Gras Marrow Butter (+$18) *"THE DOUBLE EAGLE" 45 DAY DRY-AGED DOUBLE BONE PRIME RIBEYE: 32 oz., Limited Availability ($125) x2, add Alaskan King Crab, Truffle Butter, Foie Gras, Foie Gras Butter (+$40) *CREAMED CORN: Blistered Shishito Peppers ($14.50) x2 *SAUTEED WILD MUSHROOMS & PEARL ONIONS ($14.50) *LOBSTER MACARONI & CHEESE ($18.50) *SEASONAL ASPARAGUS ($14.50) *CHATEAU MASHED POTATOES ($12) *Marrow Butter Side ($6) *LEMON CAKE: Six Layers, Lemon Buttercream Icing & Lemon Glaze ($12.50) *OLD FASHIONED FORTY-SIX: Maker's Mark 46, Earl Grey Tea Syrup, Earl Grey Bitters ($15.50) x2 *Bulleit Rye Manhattan ($13) *Tito's Mule: Tito's Handmade, Lime, Ginger Beer ($14.50) *Beringer, Knights Valley 2014 ($49) *Rodney Strong, Alexander Valley 2014 ($55)  Since they ran super late with our table, they gave us complimentary orders of the calamari and bacon. I'm not a huge sweet and savory fan, so I didn't love these dishes. But it was a nice gesture. I adore seared foie, so I definitely enjoyed that app. Great fatty foie flavor. The crab cake was my least favorite appetizer. Very mushy. Two friends and I decided to go for it and share the double eagle. And we went crazy with the add ons. Gimme that truffle, foie butter, and king crab! Made the steak super decadent. Wines were priced well. We were able to find two bottles around $50 each. Service was great. Our waiter was super sweet. We were here until around 1am, so the last ones to leave. We never felt rushed or pressured to leave.  Fun spot to have a decadent steak dinner.

Y1fMDgeycecNAtMetgqm8Q.text: Del Frisco's is an absolute treat and always a great experience every single time I visit.  Drinks are always perfect and staff are attentive and engaging. Appetizers were amazing! The Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious and the porterhouse steak was a thick cut, perfectly seasoned, and juicy! The absolute best steaks! This place is highly recommended.

gFZ57XwjFKLm28m3hHtuYg.text: I had the porterhouse and she had filet medallions. The meat was undercooked for both of us. Potatoes au gratin were very rich but not a lot of flavor. A pretty unremarkable dinner. Much better steakhouses around so go somewhere else.  Bartender was super nice though and made an excellent martini

hcBZpKodgJib0PT37tDUjQ.text: Loveeeeeeee this place! The crab cake wasn't as good as usual for some reason; but, our server, I don't remember her name but she said she is from Hawaii, handled it very well and the manager came by to check on us to make sure everything else was good as usual.  Thank you for always providing an awesome meal and service!

2VxGN7yJmBPle2ICj_bnVQ.text: Was in LV on a business trip with a group of my coworkers, and one of them organized a group dinner to Del Frisco's for 9 people.   We got there at 6:45pm and it was very crowded in the waiting area, so we moved out to the patio because we were still waiting for one person (and they won't seat you unless you have absolutely everyone in your party). While we were sitting out on the patio, waitstaff was coming out to take orders from another group that was out there but never stopped to ask if we wanted anything (we were hoping to at least order drinks while we were waiting).   Once we finally got seated, I was shocked at how crowded the room they lead us to was. There were large groups everywhere and the chairs were literally back to back, which might not have been a huge problem except the waitstaff still had to get through to serve. I was baffled why you would lay out a room like that and not leave walking room between chairs for even the wait staff.  It was at least 15 minutes before a waiter stopped at our table, we asked for a wine list and didn't get that for another 30 minutes. He tried to tell us the specials but it was so loud in there we basically couldn't hear anything he was saying. It was probably another 30-45 minutes before he came back to take our orders.    The only saving grace of this place was probably the food. I got the sea bass and thought it was delicious. Sides are not included, so they force you to order them separately, which or course adds a ton of cost.  One of the mashed potatoes we ordered was not edible because it was so salty, but the other one was ok so not sure what happened there. Overall everyone was generally happy with their meal though. I would like to note there is literally not one vegetarian option on their menu, but they were able to make a pasta primavera for the lone vegetarian we had in the group.  Although the food was tasty, it was not enough to offset my displeasure with the cramped seating and atmosphere. I would personally not choose to come here with a group ever again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TDX4wn8otsf8y_SldqIMfA.text: I was trying to organize a bachelor party for my friend so I started calling around.  I spoke with a lady named Nicole Genet here who indicated that there would be a $1,200 minimum for food and drinks so we decided to look elsewhere.  At the very last minute, we just showed up to this restaurant and we were able to get a table for all of us for dinner, with no minimum.  To our surprise, the restaurant was dead!  After tasting the food, we quickly realized that Del Frisco's is not what it used to be.  Our steaks were very tough and chewy.  Tasted almost old. It was a very bad experience.   Our service was amazing tho!

slnLvhWjiPIuD0Y4l7yaHw.text: Omg, I can't tell you all the good things about this place. The service was great, food was cooked to perfection. Sorry I ate all my rib eye since were visiting and no way to warm up leftovers. The potatoes augratin had too much cheese -should've ordered the bake potato. I would come back and order the filet and bake potato, and leave room for dessert.

sdXyF88gcDP6u3GrxYwD5w.text: Overall: excellent, let's go with 4.5 stars, great experience.  We went on Saturday night with a party of 8, celebrating my daughter's wedding.  They had the table set up with a congrats card and rose petals, which was very nice.  We started with a bunch of apps, the first of which was a seafood sampler, everyone got 1/2 crab cake, 3 shrimp in different sauces and a stone crab claw.  They were very fresh and tasty.  We also had oysters (east & west coast), a huge serving of bacon, carpaccio, and charred octopus, they were all great.  We then had steaks, including the wagyu tasting, filet mignons and 45 day aged strip.  All were cooked perfectly.  We added 2 16 oz lobster tails to round out the main course along with several sides.   The service started off great, with the waiter and attendants very prompt and professional.  By the end, however, with the restaurant becoming full, the attention level fell off quite a bit.  One thing that did bother me; we got charged for a "Celebration" dessert that was provided for my daughter and her new husband.  We did not order this, and assumed is was complimentary, that was odd.  I kind of ignored this, as the $10 was a drop in the ocean that was the bill.  Bring your wallet, this place is great but will cost you a mortgage payment.  Outstanding place for a special occasion!

mi-QB1daRvKZqRVc3yLkgw.text: Phenomenal! My husband and I have been here a few times, but my most memorable was our 1 year wedding anniversary and tonight. Tonight we celebrated a promotion I received and as usual Del Frisco's made me feel special! The hostess warmly greeted us and then congratulated me on my promotion (as well as complement my outfit but that was an added bonus) and gave us the best seats in the house. Our servers, Roe and Collin were great! Roe had such great energy and knowledge and Collin was very friendly and attentive. They also congratulated me and made small talk about my new position, but most importantly, THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! The steaks were cooked exactly how we wanted and so flavorful. It just melts in your mouth! I tried the Trio filets this time and I was extremely happy with my decision and we also got some VIP and Old Fashioned cocktails as well as the jumbo crab cake to share. Did I mention the crab cake there is Life?! It's worth every penny! We'll definitely be back no doubt about that, but I wanted to thank the staff and managers for making my evening extra special tonight. Thank you!

vWK5lCVysRddKBhLJ0uEIw.text: Absolutely amazing! First off, I'm not one of those pretentious yelp elites that act like they know what they're talking about. I do work in the restaurant industry myself and this review is strictly about the service and food. The food here never disappoints. Been here dozens of times and today was by far the best food and service myself, and our group has ever received. Ask for Bailey to be your server. Not only is she attentive, she has a fun and playful personality. She was very suggestive, but not pushy by any means. She knew how to read our table and each of our different personalities. Our food was on point as well. Everyone's dishes were cooked to perfection and everyone on the serving team made sure our drinks were never empty, made sure we all had what we needed and again, made it that much more better. You guys definitely raised the bar on food and service.

TTUO578VImuKPliAnSAb2A.text: Super awesome service. Excellent crab cake. Actually, very likely the best crab cake around. Oh, and did I mention the service?

tnPY1c84ZudbYymv-getCw.text: Steak houses in Vegas are a "dime a dozen" but they aint got a JAMES BOND WINE TABLE! That has got to be the coolest shizzy ever! Honestly this has been the first time I have ever went into a steakhouse dressed in a T shirt! LOL Wait staff was great and very comical...something I wasnt expecting but I guess they saw the casual appearance and lightened up the mood! Your typical steakhouse menu items. All sides are ala carte. My Ribeye steak was just OK...nothing memorable about it. Next time we have to try the famed HANK's!

h4UCeezFbdMe8M_I4EkuOg.text: Del-icious. Double Eagle...why not Triple Eagle. I have buddy who's Indian name is Triple Eagle...honest truth.

Mdwc5lZ28iuz6YiR7EROQQ.text: I wouldn't say this was the best steak that I've eaten in my life.  But as an overall experience I would say this was one of the better steakhouses I've been to.    I'm not usually one to blow big bucks at a steakhouse, not when we can usually prepare very good steaks at home, especially with the quality of beef you can get at mail order and high-end grocers nowadays.  Instead, I usually spend my high-end dining dollars on restaurants with multiple-course tasting menus that would be hard for me to execute at home.  Also, steakhouses usually charge extra for sides, have sky-high markups for wine, and usually don't take (or have really expensive) corkage.  However, my husband (who does most of the actual steak-cooking in the house anyway) does like to eat out for steak occasionally, and it is a nice change from all the other"frou-frou" restaurants that I like to frequent.  I gotta say though, that this place is actually *gasp* a decent value for the money, especially for Vegas where you can easily spend $100 on a single steak.  My friend and I split one of their specials, a bone-in Wagyu Tomahawk ribeye, and it wound up costing us $45 apiece.  Our husbands, who got standalone ribeye steaks of their own (no bone) were definitely jealous as ours was just so much juicier and more tender.  I don't think I've ever been to any other steakhouse where you can get Wagyu for that much.  The steak was perfectly cooked (medium-rare of course!) and I have no complaints about it whatsoever.  The appetizers we ordered, tuna tartare and crab cake, were tasty and well-executed, though not particularly exciting.  But then, this was an old-school type of place so I wasn't exactly expecting cutting-edge.  The sides were also pretty decent...I'm not a big fan of potatoes au gratin but my dining companions enjoyed it, the mushrooms were flavorful but did not overpower the steak.  We didn't order dessert since we were already stuffed from all the steak and even had leftovers.  The drinks were good and reasonably priced as well.  We started off with their signature cocktail...a martini-like concoction with pineapple juice.  It was very refreshing and a good start to the meal.  They also had a very expansive wine list (they better since they don't let you bring outside wine) with many great selections of California cabs, my wine of choice for a good steak.  I was very pleased to note that they had a special section devoted to lesser-known producers that were also more affordable.  Unlike many other steakhouses that tend to push the customer towards higher priced wines (I'm looking at you Alexander's and Harbour Sixty), our server was very happy to talk to us about some of the smaller wineries on the list.  We finally settled on a 2007 Terra Valentine cab from Spring Mountain (one of the less famous Napa valley appellations) which went perfectly with all our steaks.    The service overall was extremely good...they asked us at the beginning if we had a show to catch so they could pace the dinner accordingly, they called us a taxi to take us back at the perfect time, and even showed us their "James Bond table".  This was definitely one of the best service that I've seen for a steakhouse.  One of the best values for a steakhouse, and one of the best values overall in the city.  I would highly recommend this place for anyone craving a steak in Las Vegas.

MesvRYsbLFWdGUHroY2uRg.text: this place is great in terms of quality food, spectacular service and ambiance... but the menu is quite boring and country-clubbish=a very classy Outback Steakhouse. but this place simply offers amazing prices as an upscale strip steakhouse.  the steak was done to perfection, if heavily peppered(not a bad thing for a steak), and sides are served country-style for the entire table, which makes for great dining with friends visiting the strip; however, dessert was boring(i expect more creativity here at any steakhouse).   Highlights:  --wine was cheap  --service/decor/ambiance were impeccable(balanced and classy) --steak was good, but other options were lacking or simply not creative --not a good choice, if you despise "old-school" menus

sKg_iN3lMFPmg6uaWITchw.text: Bottom line: my favorite steakhouse. Rib-eye with truffle butter. You will never be the same again.

Sjo-KgGPAnWeprEul4XwPQ.text: This is a great steakhouse.  Good sedate type atmosphere,  service is excellent and food very well prepared and tasty.  The seafood appetizer tray  $85 is unbelievable.  The crab legs and lobster on it are huge.  I had fillet one night, done perfect medium rare,  crab legs the second night.   Precut big and meaty.  Very good. Butter dip needed salt though.   Deserts, the chocolate souffle is supper good.  We shared all the desert.  I would say second best is the banana bread pudding type.  Biff our waiter was super.

ruUU7CsaB3ANABv8dexlHg.text: This is my new favorite steakhouse!  The service was fantastic from beginning to end, and the food was ... I'm speechless.  We had a group of 8, and we were seated in a semi-private room with three other similarly sized tables.  I loved how the dining room(s) were all very well lit, not like other steakhouses that are dark (barely can see in some!).  It made for a more fun, vibrant night with friends.    I'm a rib-eye fan and  I must say this is one of the better rib eyes I've had.  The plate was, of course, decorated with butter and was cooked perfectly to my taste (medium rare).  Here is what was ordered:  Appetizers: Calamari - very tasty, perfectly seasoned - try it, new twist on an old favorite Shrimp Cocktail: 5 large jumbo shrimp with cocktail sauce Crab Cake: very dense, pretty much all crab meat with some tasty sauce  Steaks: my friend and I each ordered the 10 oz ribeye with potatoes (lagniappe) (still a large portion - I could have split the steak) my husband ordered the 16 oz ribeye her husband ordered the bone in  Sides: Lobster Mac & Cheese - yummy! Some of my friends didn't this dish as much as the Mastro's Mac & Cheese, but I thought it was very tasty Spinach Supreme - YOU MUST ORDER THIS. Enough said. Bacon. String Beans - crisp, we felt we needed a veggie side. Not bad, not good, it's a veggie, after all  Dessert: Lemon cake - YOU MUST ORDER THIS.  The slice is very generous, enough for each person in the group to take a few bites Sorbet - three different flavors: mango, pineapple and raspberry - all very good  Wine: We ordered a bottle of red (I'm not very wine savvy so I'm not sure which one it was...07 something, was about $100.  I liked it a lot)   2 friends split the 10oz ribeye + potatoes, another 2 split the filet.  I think the smaller portions were perfect. Everyone left satisfied but not disgustingly stuffed.  I think it was very reasonably priced, the entire bill for 8 people was about $550 (gratuity not included) - when does that ever happen??  The only downside, which I won't count against the restaurant, is that it is located off-strip.  But, if I think about it, the off-strip location may actually be a good thing.    All in all a wonderful dining experience.  They asked for us to leave contact information so they can send us handwritten thank you notes!!  Too bad there isn't one in LA :(

CMvwT_DIP9vdg0rMFX-hRw.text: My first review on Yelp...Okay first thing, HANDS DOWN the BEST steak Ive ever had in my life..Im from Texas so this says a lot.  Service was excellent and upscale..but not TOO upscale..a nice blazer and jeans kinda upscale.  When I went it was for a Xmas party so we had great atmosphere with 40+ people in a private room. As I walked by some other rooms they seemed kinda quiet and boring...but that's why you bring GOOD company...Lots of a business types (age demo in 40's), and cougars by the bar with a nice live piano man touch...Im a grad student so can't go there too often...a  bit $$$$ BUT..love, love, love the food. Seafood apps were the best as well!  Nice place for a date IF your date really appreciates steak!

GqMmX4fweGQoIMe69fAbJA.text: Best steak dinner I've ever had in my life.   Even better than San Francisco's House of Prime Rib, my former fave.  We had...  (Geez.  What didn't we have?)  Just order whatever looks good.  You can't go wrong!     I even received a hand written thank you card from them in the mail a week later!

EYg3fLXYWK-S35hMd-50_Q.text: I love this place. Whenever I'm in Vegas, I will come here.  Came here on the advice of a cabbie and I'm glad I did.  I've been here twice and both times it was delicious. Great food and great service go hand in hand here! So this time here I started off with the house salad with blue cheese, very, very nice! Came with 2 strips of thick, crispy bacon-always welcome!  Bf had the crab cakes with a Cajun sauce.  Very good also.  Was 1 big crab cake but was a nice size.  Was very creamy, no seafoody detection there.  The Cajun sauce was very good, complimented the cake well. We both had the beef! LOL, don't come to a steak place and order the chicken people, I'm just sayin..... Ugh, the filet was just all melty and rich and seasoned to perfection!  Cooked to perfection! We also had the potatoes au gratin which were a creamy delight!  The potatoes were bluntly cut but nice and soft and covered in cheesy, creamy goodness. MMmmmmmm And also the sauteed green beans, I didn't try them they were a little too garlicky for my taste but bf said they were right on.

CdJyUJiFBQPHNMcTwgr59g.text: Order the long-bone Waygu cut medium plus.

JBlwtJpyAaXTqClAYr5yLw.text: Way over- priced!!!  I just can't see how you can gauge customers $67.00 for 16oz steak with a bone!?!  There is no justification even if the steaks came from golden steers!  Don't fall for the con-job, there is no beef on the planet that warrants Del Friscos prices.  I left hungry any pennyless.

ic61jOywyum-Xssa5Ukxbg.text: Crazy good! Got a 16 oz NY Strip rare , and side of au gratin potatoes, off the charts, thought it was cooked perfectly.  Really impressed with both the food and service, everyone working was awesome to us. Got drinks and bottles of wine for the table and still thought the price was very reasonable as far as steakhouses go. Short ride from the Hard Rock Hotel so if your staying in that area this a great choice.

a1pvRPJbfnl_UQAozbIGmA.text: I love steak! So it only made sense that I ate at a steakhouse at least once while vacationing in Las Vegas.  Seeing Del Frisco's (then yelping, of course) on the way to my hotel, my mom and I decided to try it!  We started off with the Classic Caesar Salad, which the waitress kindly divided onto two plates, as I was sharing with my mom. It was one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had!  With an already satisfied pallet, I couldn't wait for the steak.  We ordered the Filet Mignon with a side of Au Gratin potatoes.  The steak, seasoned with some salt and pepper,  was definitely top notch.  Though I prefer Ruth's Chris, the steak came in a close second!  Juicy & melts in your melt, the steak satisfied my craving right off the bat.  The potatoes were delicious, as well...and I know my potatoes, so when I say delicious, I mean it!  Melted cheese piled on top of slices of potatoes is just how I like it.  Afterwards, I was so full I couldn't even order dessert!  Overall, Del Frisco's is definitely worth a try if you're craving steak.  Make sure you go when you're hungry, so you have room to try everything on the menu!  Great service & great food, this place is an A+ in my book!

_XHrfXUvDMfjmvQ1bRRm6g.text: No doubt about it, these guys are legit. Simply the best steak you can possibly have. Went to Vegas for Super Bowl weekend (see my review of the Encore) and in keeping with our theme of rolling hard and deep, we made a reservation for a saturday night. The joint was packed, even with a reservation and showing up on time, we still had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. The wait was definitely worth it. The wife ordered raspberry martini, thinking it was a fru-fru drink, I ordered the VIP martini. It turns out there's no such thing as a fru-fru drink here; the raspberry martini was stronger than my VIP. Our meal started off with fried oyster appetizer. It was quite tasty; crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. Squeeze some lemon juice and dip in the marinara sauce and you're set. My wife ordered the 12 oz filet, she wanted the 8 oz but I pointed out for just $5 more you can get 50% more steak goodness. And if she can't finish it, I will always be there to clean up. I ordered their signature dish, the double eagle aka el duce, the shitznit, da bomb, the best steak you can have! Go big or go home steak! Both steaks were ordered medium rare, and arrived as ordered. They made you cut into the steaks to inspect the doneness just to make sure you're satisfied when they serve them to you. Needless to say, the meal was epic! The service was top notch, besides our waiter, there were at least 3 assistant waiters/waitress checking in on us at about every 10 minutes. If you're looking to splurge on a steak, you cannot go wrong with Del Frisco's.

QcOjSilIGcvBpAz7Xrym6Q.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas, and the best steakhouse i've ever been to anywhere.  Our total bill for two was around $180, it was worth it, but it's a once a year thing for me at that price!

httMRdtV-ZsZ9rCve63PLQ.text: Absolutely the best steak!! Make sure you try the lemon cake, it is beyond amazing!! This place is top notch classy. Can't wait to get back to Vegas just so we can have dinner here again!!! You will not be disappointed.

1TYWKkAG5KP08B5ZgBwqcw.text: Del Frisco's is outstanding.  I came for 9 days and am staying near Del Friscos, in an area where there are also a half dozen other 4-star-plus yelp restaurants within a short walk.  I've been trying a different one every night, and came back tonight for a 2nd visit to Del Frisco's.  I got the Double Eagle Bone-In Ribeye both nights and it was perfect both nights.  They have the biggest wine list I've seen in Vegas restaurants, and the wait-persons are prompt, efficient, and get everything right.  I'm in town one more night this visit and am coming back for one more Bone-In Ribeye because it's better than any I'm able to get back home in San Diego.  I am thoroughly delighted with the food and service at Del Frisco's and when I come back to Vegas in June, I'll be back to Del Frisco's again.

jKCX9fRVdXMgDicEtuO5kA.text: Great steaks and service.  The Sommelier (Steve) was great and matched the wine perfectly with our food.  Wine price was about 3-4x retail though.  Overall, we enjoyed Del Frisco's Las Vegas.

E1R0QUO76s6EHHJFBnf7QA.text: Had dinner here on Sun/10 Aug with a coupla buddies: - We did a long walk to here from Monte Carlo.  After dinner, we had the staff call us a cab which they did with no complaint.  (Also, they didn't trouble us about our schlubby attire and tacky footwear). - I had the $49 Prime-Pair Filet, Crab Cake & Side.  I opted for the Del Frisco's salad over the wedge, nothing spectacular.  The crab cake, filet itself, with the side of grilled(?) mushrooms I chose were delicious.  I've been in Vegas 4 years and I wish I had tried this steakhouse sooner (even though it's part of a chain). - Also got the pineapple infused martini (next to some tables there are massive jars with pineapple wedges marinating in the liquor), I think that was $13/ea.  Tasty. - My compatriots also enjoyed their meal and we all satiated the appetites we built up making the trek here.

-kScYPQ7LGGnlF5IVtICSA.text: Birthday dinner for the gf and another couple.  We were all speechless.  It was the best thing we ate all week.  Incredible service, incredible food, great atmosphere. I got the triple threat thing with 3 cuts of meat with 3 different toppings.  This was...orgasmic.  You get what you pay for indeed.  Beginning to end.

_cYK7pxb9FWjZn346m0vLQ.text: Grabbed a cab and headed over to Del Friscos arriving to find a dated kinda worn feel to it. Not comparable to a classy Chicago Steakhouse but more of a casual comes as you are feel,  The martini was well prepared and the portion was nice.  I am one for aesthetics and the first one that grabbed me was that the salad fork is the same size as the dinner fork. Call me weird, but I like big man sized utensils  for $50 dollar steaks.   Now about that crab appetizer.  Being from the wine country, I know I am spoiled but if a big hunk crab mixed with a monstrous amount of Old Bay is your thing, you have come to the right place.  I will eat crab served with cardboard I like it so much, but truly just so so.  Next was the Wedge salad with blue cheese. This dish can be great when done right but if the lettuce is wet and leaking, the dressing and everything else turns mushy and bland.  But, drums please, the steak shines.  There I was with my miniature fork drinking some great cab and enjoying the heck out of my tender flavorful steak with some pretty tasty corn, spinach and mashed potatoes. (Yes I did order three sides.)  So maybe skip everything else and have a steak.  Great bartender was very well versed in the wine offerings and made the night a fun one.

5kMUQSYZsIX9uUAw6yaN1A.text: Wow. My fiance and I came here for valentine's day after reading all of the wonderful reviews on yelp. I'm starting to wonder how many of the wonderful reviews on here are fake. I thought the food (besides the steak) tasted absolutely horrible.  The heirloom tomato and onion salad was gross. It had a vinegarette on it that tasted very odd and bland. The blue cheese crumbles on top even tasted terrible, because of the dressing. I was barely able to eat one slice of tomato, even after trying to season it with salt, pepper, and more vinegar. I'm pretty sure the waiter could tell that I didn't enjoy the dish when he came over and I had him take away the full plate of food, but he never said anything or asked.
