A good restaurant,would have been concerned that they had an unhappy guest. So that was weird...   Our steak was delicious & perfectly medium-rare. The sides that we ordered, the  corn and the mashed potatoes were not good.  They both tasted like hospital/cafeteria food. We each had a few bites and that was all we could stomach before having them take that away as well.  It was very disappointing. Also, the bread was served on a paper doily and looked like a cheap hamburger bun, I should have known better as soon as I saw that, it was a great predictor of what was to come.   Another thing I didn't like about this place was the overly bright lighting and the close proximity to other patrons. It was so unromantic.  And the decor was bad too, it was very late '90's/early 00's-ish.  I could have sworn I was at Sizzler, not a nice steakhouse.    I should also note that we didn't appear to be the only unhappy guests that night, because we were so close to the other guests & it was so bright, we got to see and hear it all.

0-X0UckeDbqfsct4Id-3dA.text: I love Del Frisco's.  This is my favorite steak place in vegas.  The service is always super friendly, and the steaks are not as pricey as you find on the strip.  The bread is amazing.  They have specials off menu, as many steak houses do, and the Bone-in Filet was the highlight of my night.  If you fancy a drink, their old fashioned is on the mark.

haXwzMyC5e2iae63SwnY6w.text: We are Las Vegas locals and this is our "go to" steakhouse in town.  We live on the opposite end of the valley and have dozens of great steakhouses closer, but nothing ever compares.  Every birthday, anniversary, and pretty much any other special occasion brings us back to Del Frisco's.  Top notch service and the food is awesome!  You will not be disappointed!

urK8drdcZFcuDnzhrh8YQQ.text: We visited the Double Eagle on Sunday evening for dinner. The restaurant has a large parking lot so there was no need to use the valet. There appeared to be several separate dining rooms in the restaurant, and with our reservation we were seated quickly in a very nice wood-panelled room with modern art hanging on the walls.   My lady ordered the filet medallions which was one of the specials of that evening. I went for the Sunday-only Prime Pair prix fixe special, which included my choice of salad, my choice of one side dish, and an 8-oz filet paired with one of three seafood items. I chose scallops for the latter.   For my salad I chose the Caesar, and it was OK, if a little on the boring side. My side was the sauteed mushrooms, which were fine but certainly not exceptional. My 8-oz filet was brought out by itself on a fairly large plate, missing the scallops. I thought those scallops must be coming along shortly - and for some reason they would be getting served by themselves even though there was a lot of room on that plate with the filet.   So we dine on, and I must say my filet, which I ordered medium rare, was some of the best beef I have ever tasted. We have dined at most of the top steakhouses in Las Vegas, on the strip and off, and my filet at the Double Eagle stands out as the best yet. My lady was very happy with her three 4-oz filet medallions.  One medallion had a shrimp topping, one had a crab and asparagus topping, and the third had a melted Brie topping. She had a glass of red Zinfandel with her meal, which tasted a bit rough and on the harsh side even after sitting in the glass for awhile.   When I was about halfway through my filet I thought I'd better let them know that my scallops were MIA. I let the server know and a few minutes later two scallops were brought out in a tiny glass dish that was likely designed to serve a condiment like mustard or ketchup. The scallops were sitting lopsided in that dish in some butter and watery liquid with some capers in there too. This was very unappetizing; I expected maybe the two scallops would be broiled and served on a skewer. I tried one and got that gritty scallop crunch on the first bite which turned me off immediately. Their flavor was OK but it seemed to me that one more day waiting around to be cooked would have made these scallops inedible. I did not finish the scallops.  A few minutes after my scallops came out the manager of the restaurant, Anthony, came to our table and apologized profusely about the scallops arriving late. He was sincerely concerned and genuinely apologetic; it was clear that this Del Frisco's takes their service very seriously.  I was cool about it; sometimes things like this happen and we were there to have a good time. We appreciated the personal attention by the manager.  As soon as we finished our meal our server brought out a huge slice of Godiva chocolate cheesecake for us to share and told us Anthony was comping this for us because of the issue with the scallops. This is the kind of service and dedication to customer satisfaction that are expected at the highest-end restaurants, and the Las Vegas Double Eagle delivers.   We will definitely return to Del Frisco's Double Eagle and give them another chance to earn that fifth star.

JaqJ2KPuI9yJx09NmfmxLg.text: Amazing truffle butter ribeye  . I highly recommend this place  the sides were awesome too.

etiVdR7KOadE469TJkE1cw.text: I love steak like any non-vegetarian citizen of the US of A and have a list of favorites including The Golden Steer and Delmonico's to name a few, but when I'm feeling absolutely baller and want the best quality in both service and food, I come to Del Frisco's.  STEAKAGE: The menu here features the standards like filet mignon, ribeye, porterhouse, etc. which is all fine and dandy but when I come here, I specifically want their specials.  Dishes that aren't offered at your typical steakhouse, such as:  Double eagle bone-in prime strip (contrary to popular belief, this is not made with two eagles...it's made with three), bone in filet mignon, the filet mignon trio, or my personal favorite:  32-oz WAGYU RIBEYE with tomahawk bone.  To put it in perspective of how amazing this steak is, I will make a list titled "News I Never Want to Hear" (in order):  1. Del Frisco's no longer serves the wagyu rib-eye 2. Zooey Deschanel and Ben Gibbard happily back together! 3. Liam Neeson furious with Michael O's Yelp review of Fresh Brothers pizza.  "I will find him," swears the terrifying actor.  SIDE DISHES: 1. Cream spinach: 2. Lobster mac & cheese 3. Chateau potatoes: I love potatoes in all its forms - mashed, baked, roasted, fried, you name it.  Chateau potatoes are basically upgraded seasoned/buttery mashed potatoes with scallions & pepper.  TIPS: 1. To really live it up, be prepared to drop up to $100 per person.  Coming here on a tight budget is as dumb as coming here on a full stomach. 2. ORDER THE WAGYU RIBEYE and split it with another person (if need be). 3. Before you leave, ask to see the James Bond table.  Grade: I don't always eat steak, but when I do...I prefer Del Frisco's.

cljdr2p_Ci3TXVYn78Uyvw.text: We had a group of 5 people, all enjoyed some aspect of our meal. the portions are giant! And The side dishes are served family style.  We started with the calamari, it was in a spicy chili sauce with bean sprouts and scallions. It had a nice crunch, and wasn't rubbery,  the lobster macaroni and cheese excellent, wish I had room to eat more!  Brussel sprouts, the nights special, nothing grand.  Mushrooms, again nothing special.  My MIL loved her crab cakes, they looked good and were giant portions. my filet was cooked perfect for me and the black truffle butter was delish.  My husband wasn't as happy with his Osso Bucco veal shank, i had a bite, it had very nice flavor, but was a little dry. Overall good experience!  And the James Bond table was neat.

HanLu_ZNEeXXLaI4emgvhQ.text: Prime rib eye 16oz was amazing! Probably ranks as one of the best steakhouses I've ever been too. The potatoes au gratin were a little undercooked. Onions rings were the largest I've ever had in my life! Also very good! Even the bread before our meal was amazing! We also really enjoyed the outside patio area where we had our cigars after our meal. Amazing food, great service, highly recommended, must have for all steak lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Eye, Brussel Sprouts, Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese, and Mushrooms!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Crab Cake is to die for!  Highly recommended!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying a nice drink &amp; cigar after an amazing dinner!

DRMZcceE3qPfQiccX2VJTw.text: Good old school ambience and fun crowd. I work at Hughes center so very convenient.   Service is excellent friendly and professional.   Everything about the restaurant was excellent - except for the food and drink.   My Cosmo was undrinkable and nowhere near mixed right.    My filet had a lot of grizzle. The au gratin potatoes were monstrously bad. I was rooting for them but it's a non traditional recipe that seems like cubed potatoes smothered in cheddar cheese. Nothing close to Flemings potatoes which are pretty much heaven on earth.     Saving graces. My wife's crab cake was excellent and her steak was 4. Her spinach was not edible. Way too much bacon.   As another poster says this location pales to the mid town Manhattan location and sadly pales in comparison to most local steak houses including chains like Flemings.   Glad we tried but honestly I don't see us returning.

trrbcliX3tVug_OvtXOBTg.text: A really great Prime Ribeye here, worth every penny!

AmcQsM5k5KYtFEkiixoJmg.text: Del Frisco's is the place I compare all other steak houses to.  This is the place that you always go to if you want a guaranteed good meal. As far as I can remember the menu hasn't changed in all the years we've been coming here and neither has what I ordered.  Freshly Baked Bread, Shrimp Remoulade, Del's Salad, Bone-in Ribeye Medium Rare and the Bone-in Pork Chop for my wife.  Never disappointed. This place is simple and classy.  As far as price, I say you get what you pay for and this place is worth every penny. No loud banging club music or other distractions.  Sometimes if you're lucky, there is a guy singing some classic Billy Joel at the piano which is always great for date night.

ysCD4jRE0JLtNXrxggqL6Q.text: My cousin and I only had one nice dinner in Vegas during our short stay and decided to ball out. Since she's a steak girl this was our choice, especially after my bf raved about the one in NYC.  I made the reservations on Open Table for a Monday evening with no issues. The hostess was friendly and welcoming. We were seated and our waiter welcomed us and handed us the menus. My bf had given me a heads up that they offered a Filet Mignon trio that I wouldn't find on the menu so I had my mind set on this already even prior to seeing the menu (which I had already reviewed online prior to our dinner). My cousin got the same thing. The Filet's came our perfectly cooked. They were topped with 1) Broiled Shrimp 2) Brie 3) Crab, Asparagus, Bernaise. They were delicious but got me full all too quick. We also got the Spinach Supreme and Potatoes Au Gratin for our side dishes also. This was wayy more than enough food for 2 females. As if we hadn't already ordered too much, we decided to finish our gluttonous meal off with a Banana Bread Pudding w/ Caramel which we decided to share. Our hungry stomachs definitely got the best of us and we brought the left-overs back to our hotel which my cousin ate the next day.   Del Frisco's was a really nice restaurant. They also had someone playing the Piano for most of the evening. Service was great and food was good. I'd definitely recommend this steakhouse.

1evMu1Rtd24JGzLanmnxIA.text: Steak was too dry! Ordered sides and when the waiters came, they served everyone else at the table without asking, so we just got a small portion of our sides we ordered. not cool!

qCiPcPukPYa1Onte4h23IQ.text: We absolutely loved the steaks (and the sides)!  The bone-in wagyu ribeye was incredibly juicy and melt-in-your-mouth amazing! My friend had the bone-in filet mignon that was also semi-orgasmic!  The sides that we chose complimented the meal extremely well: lobster mac-and-cheese, mushrooms, and scalloped potatoes.  Everything was prepared perfectly, and I can't wait to go back the next time we're in Vegas!

6GQdE7yOn1L7Ga5WyGof2Q.text: When we entered we were greeted by a whiff of a backed up septic system which lingered throughout the evening . We were early but they still made us wait even though there were 20 empty tables. The service was good. . The steaks were ok but not at all worth the price they were asking for . The sides were small and the whole experience was cheapened by giving us forms to fill out about our dinner.  The atmosphere might have been ok except for the horrible smell. I will not return

nFSdT-HcbsJkiRZ06Gsqxw.text: Here's the deal. When visiting any steakhouse, I don't dick around with any pee wee hockey puck filets or some half assed fish deal. I don't even require a menu. Bring me your biggest Prime Bone-In Ribeye. Cook it medium rare, and don't fuck it up.   I'm basically a Vegas local and have had the BiR at Prime, Delmonico's, Carnevino, Gallagher's, Gordan Ramsey's, The Golden Steer, and Vic & Anthony's. V&A has always been my favorite, and I have had it countless times. It's usually our default steakhouse. Tonight, we decided on steaks at the last minute and couldn't get in at V&A in a timely fashion, so we just whipped into Del Frisco's and sat at the bar.   Other than V&A, I'm not a big fan of going to a "chain" joint in a town like LV with all its' great options, but The BiR at Del Frisco's is simply one of the best I have ever had. Served on a super hot plate, juicy, tender and flavor that knocked my socks off. Service from Trish was nothing short of phenomenal. $150 plus $50 tip for 2 BiR, baked potatoes, iced teas. Definitely going back.

R_gdUUc7Qbvqj7OAB5HkjA.text: Usually I don't write about service or decor or anything not food related because it really should be about the food. I have to make an exception for this place because they go above AND beyond to satisfy customers.  Ordered their special Wagyu beef and thought it was gamey near the bone areas. Server replaced my order immediately with no questions asked and put food on my table within 10 mins. The manager came out to apologize and made sure I was happy THEN sends me a card in the mail afterwards.   The steak itself was 4 stars (very good but not stellar) but the service made this place an easy 5 star.

3ozTreY2Fd0u0Z88DycPwg.text: This was our second time dining at Del Frisco. The service is outstanding. Dan was our server and he was extremely knowledgable and very personable. From the hostess to the management, everyone gave exceptional service.  The food was amazing. The crab cake appetizer was the best we have ever had. We had the bone in filet with garlic truffle butter, AMAZING! Make sure you ask for the special butter. All of the sides are spectacular, especially the lobster mac. They have an incredible wine selection. And the dessert was so delicious.   The ambiance is romantic. They had a wonderful pianist playing. The perfect date night.

oRMd6UXmHtV9PZUggY6yMg.text: Recently went to Del Frisco's with some co-workers. Service was very good and helpful. I had the 12 oz filet mignon, which was cooked perfectly. Also, really enjoyed the king crab appetizer. The Del Frisco's cabernet was pretty good with the meal. It's not the best steakhouse I've been to in Las Vegas, but it's certainly very good. I would definitely go back there.

zTmzu03tgnuoOkk5Y7KLrQ.text: I have eaten at Del Friscos multiple times in Charlotte and the Las Vegas location does not hold a candle to Charlotte.  The Las Vegas location is worn especially the carpet and does not have a fresh smell. Also I thought the food was just okay.

MIlRq3HOovSN8emocV2O4Q.text: This place has more excellent food options than I normally come across. Spectacular service as well. Had the Trio steak option that's not on the menu and it was outstanding.  Another over the top thing was the sides.... Usually not all that much to talk about anywhere,  but here they are very high quality.  You really get what you paid for at this steakhouse. Not pretentious,  just high high quality. Somewhere you would be proud to take anyone to.

8QVi4KHfOozo9SooZEaYIw.text: My boyfriend and I were in Vegas for his 38th birthday. His all-time favorite meal is very simply, a steak and potato. I did my diligent research and decided on Del Frisco's for a special night out. I made an Open Table reservation for 6PM, as we had a show to catch later on that evening. I made a small notation in the reservation that it was his birthday but didn't think anything more of it.  That evening, we arrived and were warmly greeted by the friendly hostess. She wished my BF a happy birthday and chatted with us for a moment before another hostess took us to our table.   On our table was a birthday card, hand-signed by the entire Del Frisco's staff, and our server came over immediately and introduced himself. He, also, was named Matt and just celebrated his 38th birthday, so it was quite humorous. He was very friendly and attentive the entire night, giving us recommendations when asked, but never was pushy.  We decided on the seafood plateau for an appetizer. We both had the VIP drink -- a must try. The seafood was absolutely perfect. The sauces that accompanied the seafood were also to-die-for!  After a quick chat with Matt the server about what type of steak we like best (my BF prefers marbling and taste over tenderness), we made our choices. I ordered one of the specials of the evening -- a trio of filets, each with a different topping. My BF ordered the Waygu bone in steak. We also ordered a baked potato side, although it merely out of habit to have an accompaniment.  In between courses, we were always checked on, crumbs wiped away, water refilled, and drinks brought out when asked. It was superior service, and I don't exaggerate.   Our entrees were brought out and the steaks were beautiful. My BF's Waygu looked like it could have been off of a dinosaur it was so large! The taste, though, was unlike anything I've had...and I love a great steak. Juicy, flavorful, and tender. It couldn't be beat.  My filet trio was divine as well. After a couple of drinks and the seafood appetizer, I could only tackle one of the filets. (I'm a notoriously small eater) I really wanted to stuff myself, but knew better, especially since the night was still young.   My BF tackled his entire steak and, I think, his eyes rolled back into his head a few times in sheer bliss. He was a happy boy! :)  We took a few obligatory bites of the potato, but the meat is where it's at!   We were asked if we had room for dessert, and, of course, we did now. However, we were brought a large slice of the house lemon cake with a candle. I tasted it, and, I swear, it was one of the most moist, delicate, delicious pieces of cake I have had -- and I'm a Southern girl who loves her sweets! It was the perfect balance of tartness and sweetness, not heavy at all.   The server asked if we were staying somewhere that we could take back what we hadn't eaten (my two other filets, the potato, and most of the cake). We were, so he boxed everything separately and placed it in a bag for us.   I consider myself a pretty keen foodie, and I am not easily impressed with showy foods or pomp and circumstance. I, however, was VERY impressed with both the service and food at Del Frisco's.   Flash forward to two days after we were back home -- my BF received a hand written card from our server thanking us for celebrating at Del Friscos. THAT was impressive.  We will definitely be back in next time we are in Vegas and recommend to anyone who wants their tastebuds to be spoiled rotten.

-CtlEUDboK8rKGVAgv3_6w.text: There's just way too much food here! I made reservation for this stand alone restaurant located among all the business building off the strip of Las Vegas. The boyfriend and I came for the $99 power couple special. Regular price will burn a serious hole in my wallet.   Anyways, so the special was a 3-course meal for each. I went for the Del's Salad, the 8 oz. filet and signature crab cake with Chateau potatoes for the side and banana bread pudding for dessert. The filet was a perfect size, don't be fool by the small number of ounces. The meal all together with their delicious loaf of bread was very filling. The Chateau potato, however, I could do without. My boyfriend got the Caesar salad, a 16 oz. Rib Eye (for an additional $10) with the signature crab cake with sauteed mushrooms for the side and strawberry cheesecake for dessert. It was such a huge slab of meat cooked to perfection and very tender. You can actually order any steak choice for the power couple special, it's just an additional to the individual $50. We also order the Lobster Mac and Cheese because there's no way I would go to a restaurant and not order mac and cheese. One of the better tasting mac and cheese and with REAL lobster pieces? How much better can it get?   Service was more than attentive. We had three people serving us our sides at once. It... was... weird. I'm not used to having a server bring me my sides and then scooping some onto my plate before settling it down on the table. There was a server just to refill our water, another to clear our tables, another to bring us food, another to give us more bread, and our assigned server who comes around and asks if everything's good. SO MANY SERVERS! It was overwhelming. The boyfriend and I had a great meal.   We self parked in the parking lot though they have valet. The valet just moves your car to a parking spot at the convenient lot right in front of the restaurant. No point in really doing valet, in my opinion. The restaurant does get full during dinner time so reservation is highly suggested!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good loaf of bread.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry cheesecake.

7fA6fcWLi_Nc43j3xdIjGQ.text: Restaurant is off the strip on Paradise road like Ruth Chris and Morton's.  They serve awesome bone-in ribeye that was perfectly seared medium rare. I ordered a Red Drum (which is similar to red snapper) and it was delicioso.  I also ordered the recommended VIP (vodka in fresh pineapple) martini and I enjoyed it, but felt a little lemon sweet would have helped the taste, which was on the sweet side.  We split a chopped salad and baked potato and again, way to much left over food but still had room for the highly recommended lemon cake which I am glad we tried. The buttercream frosting was the best part of the dessert.  coffee is good here too.  Service was just as nice as at the Mastro's Ocean Club. Prices were the same, but they did offer a Sunday dinner special for 2 at $99 which was a nice option. (I just don't like a filet mignon)   I would definitely come back to this restaurant for its service, quality of food and decor.

LFlJpesU6V7x5k4_w3x-hw.text: Went here with my wife on our 4 year anniversary. The food and service was phenomenal. I had the 22oz bone in ribeye and was cooked to perfection, my wife had the filet and was just as good. It's definitely not cheap, but places like this you get what you pay for and it was worth every penny. We will definitely be going back. We been to most of the top steak houses here in Vegas and this one was the best overall, food and service.

CPRApjf0amUzif7DKS41wg.text: My favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas. The ambiance is charming with the piano player adding to the experience. The rib eye was cooked perfectly with a nice crust over the medium rare center. Seasoned appropriately with a titos martini up and you can't go wrong. Not cheap but worth it.

K80rK_Ldos6M14WYRY3aVA.text: The steak was absolutely phenomenal!!! It is a little pricey, but great if you want a fine dining experience.

GWYgD1ogF9oX0zjCxGUk2A.text: Great food, AMAZING service. Very impressed with the staff's kindness, honesty, and timeliness. Will definitely come back

YIJLNltvcKsw0VklhEepLQ.text: This IS the best steakhouse here in Vegas. I've been many times and drinks, food, service and atmosphere are second to none. I have tried many other places but Del Frisco's set a high bar and other places like The Golden Steer and Mastros pale in comparison. And it's not just for steak. The fish is superb as well. Do yourself a favor and try the best!

6muvzRQ6Ucwf1dbTx22Yqg.text: Best steaks in Vegas! Morgan was our waitress and she was super knowledgeable and friendly! The bone in filet was to live for!

F8sBNiFMrqm6Uub2cyfZeg.text: Without question the best steakhouse in all of LV and I have been to almost all of them! The highlights are the shrimp with the remoulade sauce (simply divine)! The steaks and lobster tails are perfection every time I go as well.   The overall experience from the bread at the beginning of the meal to the dessert at the end is an absolute 10/10. If your a local or a visitor looking for a steakhouse this is without question the one to come too.

xPFK17QIDyrZxhz1hvoC9g.text: I will definitely be back!!!!   My boyfriend and I dined at Del Frisco's back on May 1st for his Birthday. It is his favorite steakhouse and now I know why.   When I made the reservation I mentioned that we were celebrating is birthday. When we arrived and gave my name they immediately acknowledge it and wished him a happy birthday. I had asked for a nice table that was in a busier room (my boyfriend likes to be in the action) and that was also arranged. When we got to the tnle there was a nice birthday card that was signed by most of the staff. (Nice touch)   We were given water right away and our drink order was taken. Anyone who interacted with us wished him a Happy Birthday, like everyone in the restaurant had been breifed. Then our waiter came over....Jason was absolutely AMAZING!!! Friendly, Energetic, informative, funny, and timely! He had mentioned that he had only been working there for a few months but knew so much that you would have thought he was there for years. We had noticed that he had not signed the birthday card so he graciously signed it making a joke that it wasn't a complete birthday card until it had his signature in it. My boyfriend and I just LOVED him! When our meal was over Jason brought a large slice of their lemon cake with a candle in it and said it was complimentary to help celebrate the birthday.   Other than the amazing food and the wonderful service here is the reason I will be returning! A week after we had dined there I got 2 cards in the mail from Del Frisco's. One was a cards was from the manager saying thank you with his business card and a comlimentary appetizer. The other, a little thicker, was a card from Jason with $12.00 in it saying that he had accidently charged me for the slice of lemon cake and wanted to pay me back! I don't know ANY restaurants or ANYONE for that matter that does this!!!! I was floored. Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday so special and making me feel like I was valued.  I can't wait to return and we will see you soon!!  Stephanie

tj2jx1MTE2JlfMahXckJ7w.text: I went with my whole office on a business trip and we had to try this place out with the amazing reviews. Man, let me tell you they will not disappoint you here ! From start to finish, appetizer to entree, everything was spot on. Our waiter Travis had excellent customer service and we will definitely be coming back next year !

Q_ICW00bNb3d6oMagOKq1A.text: I have been to this Del Friscos and many others many of times. It is one of 2 high end steak places I will go and recommend. But this place is now off the list. I went for my birthday and sat at the bar way longer to just get a steak than anyplace I have been. Finally the bar tender said let me go check, I don't know what's taking so long. Finally he came out with a steak and said if you want something done you have to do it yourself. Not only did it take long but the steak was raw not medium. The manager offered to buy dessert. I didn't go for dessert  I wanted a meal. I was also prepared to spend over $500 dollars of gift cards. This place is now off of my list for high end steak restaurants. I will not only tell others on this forum but everywhere else.

hWvmppCuiZLo8FzS3xV3fw.text: We went to Del Frisco's on a Saturday evening, I made the reservation for 6:30 and when we walked in, they were ready for us. They sat us in one of the smaller rooms which was nice because it was a little more intimate.  Our server, Shawn was very knowledgeable, friendly and funny and helped us understand the menu.  We ordered the ahi and wedge salad to share.  I ordered the 8 oz Filet Mignon, my man ordered the crab cakes.  Shawn said the sides were huge so we decided to share the asparagus as well.  First of all, the bread they serve is friggin awesome!  If it is not made fresh there I would be surprised.  However, sharing was probably not the best move.  Although the ahi was perfectly sized for 2 people as was the wedge salad, with the blue cheese crumbles and bacon, the entrees were smaller than expected. My steak was great, but the asparagus was slightly burnt and my boyfriend was still hungry after the crab cakes even though he asked for and ate a 2nd loaf of the bread!  For dessert, we ordered the chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream.  Again, I could've eaten it by myself but allowed him a couple of bites!  We ended up stopping at Smith's to buy some Ben and Jerrys!  So the service and atmosphere is great, portions could be bigger for the price.

zSj2rpuCmg-G6YFwLXQD8Q.text: Came to Del's for my birthday dinner this year.  We arrived early thinking we would get a drink at the bar.  Their VIP drink is my favorite drink ever.  To our surprise we were seated immediately.  Service was terrific.  Several staff members checked on us and wished me a happy birthday.  Everything on the menu looked so good we ordered way more food then we could eat.  We started with crab cake, seafood soup and Caesar salad.  For mains we got shrimp scampi and bone-in rib eye.  Lobster mac and cheese, chateau potatoes and onion rings were the sides.  Our food was excellent.  I would pass on the seafood soup and onion rings next time though.  Nothing wrong with them, just personal preference.  We finished the meal with a complimentary slice of their famous lemon cake and a card signed by the staff.  A few days later we got a thank you card in the mail from our server.  That was a first for me.  I'm sure they make her do it but it was still a nice touch.  Overall, Del's is a solid choice for an off strip steakhouse.  Oh and at Thanksgiving you order to-go side dishes!

MBLLbd9qd8f1c0xRJr5kEA.text: A "correct" steakhouse offering consistent, quality food and service at reasonable prices.  It's the monthly handout kind of place for the guys.  Throw back a few single malts, enjoy a slab of prime beef and shoot the s#*t as only guys can.  Although a small chain, Del Frisco beef falls above that of Morton's and Ruth's Chris in quality and taste but below that of the celebrated steakhouses of the Strip.    Standard steakhouse starters.  No strong standouts.  No complaints either.   Steaks are steaks.  USDA prime.  Standard cuts.  Decent aging.  Well trimmed.  Juicy, beefy and properly cooked.  Surprisingly, top props go to the lamb.  The double cut lamb chop has a very pronounced lamb flavor.  Lamby?  It's sweet and gamy at the same time.  Cooked with the perfect sear.  Sorry Mary, your little lamb was delicious!  The veal porterhouse is worth a try.  Tender with the unexpected pronounced flavor of beef.  This is definitely not produced from penned up calves but rather those that had the chance to roam free (see, no reason to hate me).  Steakhouse standard sides.  Sharing portions.  No complaints.  Good wine list focusing on US vintners.  Below strip prices.  Recommended for the Vegas local wanting to avoid the Strip.  Visitors, this is just a quality steakhouse.  Pay for the glitz, be a baller,  and live the "Vegas fantasy".

wf1Ui2NVKctTsrcUKiRe2Q.text: We went there for my bachelor party dinner and it was the best meal I've ever had at a steak house.  I've been to the various best steakhouses in various cities around the country, and this is the best bar none.  I'm looking for an excuse to go to Dallas so I can eat at the original restaurant.  Not only was the food fantastic, but it was the best service I've ever gotten.  Friendly and helpful without being pushy or overbearing like you might find at some fancy places.  Our waiter's name was Toby so it might be a good idea to ask for him.

qVzTsVeoWKlm14T7kACUEw.text: - LOVE LOVE LOVE the crab cake.  all meat!  best crab cake ive ever had. - did not love the lobster.  disappointed that after shelling top dollar the meat was a bit tough. - LOVE LOVE LOVED the lobster mac & cheese.  although i think they overseasoned with garlic salt a bit.  a little garlic salt goes a long way. - LOVE LOVE LOVED the steak.  we ordered the special (wagyu w/ the bone in) - tender and delicious. - LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOVE that damn lemon cake.  we had ordered too much and couldnt finish our slice so we chowed down the next morning on it - just as delicious :)  all in all, loved the service and will go again (however i feel like im still digesting this meal).

npEYStuMoc32-AYYjZcoFg.text: Perfect for a special occasion.  Excellent service, the steaks were delicious.  The pineapple VIP cocktail alone was worth the trip but you must try the lemon cake.

FhW_-aXNC7GkiW9hQh0Tiw.text: This is what I imagine a steak house in Heaven would look like.  This is not some trendy techno music steak house with small portions and organic sustainable micro greens as side dishes.  This is huge cuts of the best beef in America, side dishes that could double as meals, martinis like Frank and the boys guzzled generations ago, and all the wood and leather you could ever ask for.  My friend and I ate here while were on a steakhouse tear throughout the Bay Area and LV (Mortons, Alexander's, Forbes Mill, SE7EN, Ruth's Chris, etc) and I can say with 100% confidence it was the best steakhouse experience I have ever had.

pelpjOZ0gKe-ifX5oRm1Sw.text: I was absolutely amazed by the service and the food. I can't think of one bad thing to say . The lobster macaroni was amazing and so was the crab cake. Everything was made with fresh ingridents. It was easy to get a reservation and everyone was very friendly!!!

MHfeUnjzbeGqmuwvt3AcuA.text: Better food and service than the LV hotel "name" hot spots.  Our group tried several and liked this one best by far.  No view. No flash.  No attitude.  Just excellent menu, food, and service.  This one we would do again.

YTzatZPTlfJVbopPLlAG2g.text: Our group of seven made reservations for Del Frisco's on a Saturday night around 9pm.  We arrived and were promptly seated in a semi-private room (which was great as we were a bit loud and noisy).  The service above all else was impeccable - more to that later.  We had heard so much about the vodka infused pineapple and so many of us ordered it.  My feeling was that it was delicious, but too tropical fruity for a steak dinner.  Okay for the lounge chair by the pool, but too tangy and sweet for a rich steak.  Below is my review of our meal: 1) sliced tomatoes and onions..  meh, I've had better, I liked that there was blue cheese crumble on the tomatoes and onions.  But there were only 3-4 tomato slices and the tomatoes tasted like styrofoam - absolutely no tomato-flavor. 2) shanghai fried calamari- wha?  don't understand the introduction of an Asian flavor into this otherwise, traditional steak house menu.  The soy-based, overly sweet sauce was not a good appetizer for the meal 3) asparagus - good, but how do you go wrong with asparagus cooked in butter? 4) potatoes au gratin - not done well at all.  First the potatoes were not hot, just mildy warm.  Second there was no nice, broiled "crust" on the gratin.  It was kinda just mushy, and the potatoes were cut in chunks and not sliced. BE WARNED, there is BACON. 5) creamed spinach - not bad, but again how can you go wrong with mushed up spinach and cream.  Again, there is BACON in this dish. 6) wedge of lettuce - blue cheese dressing is good, I think the blue cheese could have been stronger, but good 7) Porterhouse - good but definitely not "melt-in-your-mouth" great as I have had at other steak restaurants (Peter Luger's, even Ruth Chris). Lacked a crust to the meat, which I usually look forward to.   8) RibEye - again, good, but was a bit salty for some.  9) Lemon Cake - meh, nothing to write home about 10) Melted Chocolate Cake (or something like it) with ice cream - again, nothing special, and the ice cream and a weird, tangy flavor 11) coffee - WEAK, and tepid.  THe manager came back and refilled our cups, but still it barely tasted like coffee.  If you like airplane coffee, it might suffice..  Service overall is FANTASTIC.  At one point, when they served the steak, we had 6 people serving our table, helping us cut the meat, serve the appetizers, etc.  The manager was also very gracious, when we mentioned that people in our party did not eat pork and was disappointed in the gratin and creamed spinach.  She eventually removed those appetizers off our bill and comped us free coffee and dessert!  So all in all, food was meh, service was fantastic.

481b8bAfvHN2DWY0c3gkiA.text: I am big into the old school steakhouse experience. Great food, great service, and big drinks. All come together at Del Frisco's , which I now make an effort to visit each time I am in Vegas. The New York strip is better than Mortons, Flemings, or Ruth Chris.  Outstanding sides that are easily shared, and service that follows up with you in a personable way. The only drawback is that their wine prices are a bit upmarket, sometimes 3x over retail, plus they won' t let you bring wine in.  That said, I will always hit this place up over the all of the nouveau, johnny come lately places that set shop up every few months.

8XEsmFlMYIVDwPL-2xIrVg.text: We went for an anniversary dinner and the staff and food made it especially memorable! Maile took extra care and was on the ball with our every need! I would definitely go back. The potatoes au gratin are to die for!

lDgeOl5qXy9Ks3UCiTnc7Q.text: Went to Del Frisco's based on the reviews on Yelp. Spot on as we had a wonderful meal. Two members of our group had the filets and they were exactly as ordered, medium rare. One member of our group had the rib-eye also medium rare. He said he was full after about half of the steak but by the end of the meal the whole thing had been eaten. When asked about where it all went, he told us that it was so good he just couldn't stop himself. The fourth member of our group had the lamb chops. They were fantastic, perfectly cooked and so wonderful that the only thing left was the bones that the chops were on. Sides were flavorful, dessert was just right. The table split a piece of their fabulous lemon cake. Perfect balance of sweet and tart with a lightness to the cake itself that capped a wonderful meal. The staff was attentive, friendly and solicitous. Water glasses were constantly refilled but you never felt the hovering presence of wait staff. When we needed something, there was always somebody at the ready. Recommended without reservations.

aSMn506ABrH8LNEEt25TcA.text: If I could give this restaurant a sixth star, I would in a second. Del Frisco's has to be one of the best steak houses (if not the best) that I've been to.   Let's get down to business: the quality of the meat is second to none. My friends ordered a filet mignon (warm red throughout) and the 16 oz. rib-eye. The filet was very tender and cooked exactly as described. I had a bite of the rib-eye and it was perfectly seasoned and possibly more tender than the filet. For my entree, I ordered the "tomahawk" cut, which consists of a 24 oz. ribeye attached to a fourteen inch bone. According to the waiter, during the aging process (a 2-week dry aging followed by a 2-week wet aging) the bone marrow from the 14 incher seeps into the meat to add an extraordinary amount of flavor. I would have to agree that this aging process succeeds in its purpose. This tomahawk cut (so named because the actual piece of meat + bone looks straight from last of the mohicans) is the best piece of steak I have ever consumed. If you can shell out $90 for this, DO IT...you won't be disappointed.   As for other food to accompany the gigantic tomahawk, we had a Caesar salad, fried oysters, and mushrooms to go with the steak. For dessert we had the cinnamon creme brulee. All very good.   As many people mentioned before, the service is impeccable. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and could cite every detail of each cut without any UHH's. Straight memorized! They paced the meal well and attended our every need.   The decor and atmosphere had the feel of an Italian social club for the elite yet the comfort of your best friend's house. Right when I walked in, I caught the scent of a light woody aroma (probably due to the cigars). We were seated before our reservation time and brought to a semi-private dining area adjacent to the cigar room. There was only one other party in the room, so we felt that we owned the room. Complete with two large screen LCDs showing Sportscenter, we felt absolutely welcome and comfortable.   I need to go back....soon! I need a Del Frisco in San Francisco.

dXQpIrKvPvQxaykwa2Gkgg.text: I came here last year with my boyfriend's family for a nice dinner. It has a old school Las Vegas feel off the strip. I remember getting the seafood platter which was pretty good. It had an assortment of shrimp, stone crab and oysters. I had some of the prime ribeye with potatoes au gratin. The sauteed mushrooms were good too. It was a pretty good steakhouse but I think I have had better. They have a bucket full of golf tees in front with their logo so you can take one home.

nxweR0WoCyzkShOajpCqEA.text: Another great Del Frisco's! Food is excellent and so is the service. The steak and crab cake were superb, but they saved the best 'till last; the bread pudding! Highly recommended.

dMKWAENjR7nk6B2OWZeqew.text: Consistently excellent, I have visited Del Frisco more than ten times and always left delighted. The service and quality make it worth the cab fare if you are staying on the strip...

jvhV_4EZk0bexSpTfKUe9g.text: best steakhouse i have ever been to.  now we make reservations whenever we're planning to go to vegas. we've brought others with us, and even though we've hyped it up, they aren't disappointed.  if you're watching your calories, this is NOT the place for you. all of the sides are nice and rich. the ribeye oozes "juice" (a.k.a. liquid fat).  great service too! after our last visit, we received a handwritten thank you note from our waiter/server. classy.  dark wood, "old school" interior, with this awesome 007 wine display.  did i mention it was the best steakhouse ever? =) of course, along with that, don't expect to get out cheap. be prepared to spend at least $55-60/each (beef, sharing sides, tax, tip) without alcohol.

T8AysC4jO60mTbVcC5zYpQ.text: Phenomenal food and service. Filet mignon trio was perfectly cooked and tender. Crab cake and lobster mac and cheese had a delicious taste and texture. The sommelier gave us a great wine choice, and our server Anna was friendly and attentive. I am pretty jaded by Vegas dining, where you find a lot of pretty good food for astronomical prices. Del Frisco's was a splurge that was worth the price.

yur16nIAeNUjWxttY2J9YA.text: Hands down the best steak I've ever had!  And their lobster mac n cheese was to die for.  Doesn't quite match the ambiance of a Maestros or Taylor's, but the food and service more than makes up for any "style" shortcomings it may have.  I love steak.  If YOU love steak and you're in Vegas, Del Frisco's will satiate those meat cravings you'll inevitably get after a 3 hour session at the craps table.  Yo elleven and get your steak on!!!

zPZZ0kbiEnSbByBPlRBAeA.text: Great place for a Great Porterhouse. When in season one of the best places for Stone Crab claws. And you must try their bread and Lemon cake both, which are very addictive. However I have to give this restaurant 4 stars because they have no booths and the rooms can be noisy and a little crowded due to a choppy layout and a main dining room with a full bar. This is especially bothersome when you are trying to relax and unwind.  Definitely one of the best steak houses in Las Vegas but they need to change the layout and get some booths to give it a 5 star rating.

cX-AtBzOwYLaQbyiAAwXKA.text: 4.5.  It looks like from other reviews that perhaps the NY strip was the way to go, but I wanted to try the 32oz Kobe.  I ordered it "medium" and shared the steak.  While, it was very good, it tasted like a great steak but not too impressve for the "Kobe" classification.   There were pieces of the cut that were melt in your mouth, Matrix-scene, tender, but for the most part, it was just a very good steak.  The sides are all ordered separately and they were all very very good too - mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and spinach.  Service was fantastic and our waitress was very attentive and entertaining.  It's located just off the strip.  I highly recommend this place for Las Vegas steaks.

8KSYvb1IEe4u1TE84UhSwQ.text: My father-in-law always talked about "Del Frisco's" but hearing about it is nothing like EXPERIENCING it! Probably one of THE best restaurant's I've ever been to. As an engagement gift on a trip to Vegas, F-in-L took us there. 20 oz. lobster, stone crabs the largest I've ever seen - prawns dipped in 4 different amazing sauces, the most perfect filet mignon. There are just aren't words. If you have the money (it's NOT cheap) and time, it's a must!

kcMhOxF9PRXrwWvRQYaWIg.text: I went to Las Vegas for a bowling tournament and heard of this place on the radio.  I made a reservation before we arrived in Las Vegas.  I had to change the reservation because we didn't know what time we would be finished bowling.  When I called, it was no problem at call changing the reservation.  The meal was excellent.  I would have to say that it is far better that Ruth Chris's and I don't think Ruth Chris is bad.  It is on the pricey side though.  When we went, we were eating our meal during closing time but they did not rush us out.  We didn't even know that they were closing for the night.  I felt bad asking about the James Bond table but they showed us the table and also the wine cellar.  If you are asking yourself "What is the James Bond table", it a table that pops up and has a bunch of wines with the different James Bond titles on the bottle.  When it pops up, it plays the James Bond theme music.  I was told that the table is over a million dollars.

6RDT52xHHDbTM_rSjsKu5w.text: If you want THE BEST RIBEYE and THE BEST SERVICE, come here.  A name like Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House better be hardcore/legit and man oh man is it!  It's hard to believe there is a steakhouse that is easily 2-3 notches above a Mastro's, Ruth's Chris, and Fleming's in terms of food taste/quality and service, but there is and the place is called Del Frisco's.    This place doesn't need any gimmicks to get you into the door (i.e. online discounts, club-like atmosphere, etc.).  This place is a True steakhouse with well trained staff that are on top of their game.  Our server was friendly, attentive, polite, and informative when it came to questions on the menu.    Came here for a friend's bday (party of 6) and everyone was blown away.  The steak knife was solid, heavy, and even had a Del Frisco's engraving on it.  That surely sets the stage for what is to come. I ordered the bone-in ribeye and it came out perfect, as a $49.95 medium rare ribeye should. The meat was surprisingly very tender and the seasoning was to perfection.  I'm not going to go on and on about the rest of my evening or talk about the sides.  No need to.  Get the bone-in ribeye and you will easily find yourself commenting with a 5 star post like mine next time you get onto Yelp.

fIiKAegW8V_2sui8SggoWw.text: Amazing food.  Fabulous service.  A bit off the strip but definitely worth it.

RzJ54EyDeym1vKBMjOeNbg.text: I had very high expectations going into this place.  A friend said that it was the best steak he's ever head, and he's a self-proclaimed expert on steak.  It was excellent.  The side dishes were ridiculuous.  We had the sweet potato, mushrooms, and potatoes au graten.  Yikes!  Get it!!!!  I had the New York strip (my favorite).  While it was very very good, it wasn't the best I've ever head.  I do recommend this place.  In a very down Vegas economy, this place was packed.

WnDRLUCmcAdEzr3pNb3aig.text: Excellent service, Great Steak...Reservations recommended. You don't have to dress up just as long as you look okay... It's family style side dishes...and the mushrooms are my fave!  Make sure you ask for Tony as your server..he will treat you well! Oh, and don't forget to check out their James Bond wine collections!

NZkYp2lTzFXTnQ-jy1sH2Q.text: Old school, and I loved it. Was going to deduct  one star because I agree with the girlfriend that the decor could be a bit darker and more clubby (lose the white ceiling tiles), but I couldn't. This place is a class act in True steakhouse style. The server was very knowledgeable and truly seemed to be enjoying her job. Old fashioned, dirty Grey Goose and reasonable Argentinian malbec, very nice. Shrimp cocktail, huge, tasty shrimp. Salads, hmmmmmm, don't remember. Waygu Ribeye for two, so flavorful and tender. Cooked a bit less than medium rare, but we didn't mind. Chateau potatoes and spinach supreme, rich and tasty. Table full of guys on a guy weekend staring at my girlfriend, also nice. James Bond table.....priceless. Highly reccomended!!

07GUMUAQl1Omx6sRFF4g0A.text: From the salads to the desserts, everything was delicious.  The wine list is extensive, but with the help of their wine steward, you will get a bottle in any price range. If you can, ask for Chris (with the beard) to be your waiter - you wont be disappointed  Very knowledgable and personable. Great server!  Top your evening with an espresso martini - delicious!

x2BDuX84US8mWus9EGxqww.text: I do not have a single complaint about this place. What a wonderful find!  Our concierge at the Bellagio very enthusiastically recommended Del Frisco's, saying it was her personal favorite place to get a good steak.  We requested a table outside because it was an uncommonly nice night out in Vegas. We were the only ones out there, and so we were a little concerned that we might get forgotten about. We couldn't have been more wrong.  Their philosophy on service here is commendable. We must have met every waiter, busser, and bartender in the restaurant--the entire wait staff makes it their responsibility to take care of the everyone's tables, regardless of whether they're "theirs". We never wanted for attention the entire meal and everyone was genuinely friendly and seemed happy to be working there.  We ordered the crab cakes, which one of our waiters said they were "very proud of". No breadcrumbs or other fillers that usually plague crab cakes, just honest-to-goodness delicious crab.   For dinner, I had the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the veal. Quality cuts, cooked to perfection and melt-in-your-mouth succulent.  We were also recommended the Grand Marnier-infused strawberries over vanilla ice cream. Nice and light and the right amount of sweet after a heavy meal.  Finally, for you beer lovers, you MUST try the Kwak Belgian beer. Funny name, ridiculously satisfying and uniquely flavored beer.  We'll definitely be back next time we come through town. Keep up the good work!

V8O6j89TQUmfJbipDQhJKA.text: This place is the bomb, for sure. I have been to the Del Friscos in Dallas but it's been a few years, so I thought I'd give the Vegas venue a shot. The restaurant is what you'd expect for an immaculate steakhouse - white linen tablecloths, friendly hosts / hostesses, a fantastic (albeit expensive) wine menu, live entertainment (piano player jazzy kind of a guy singer accompanied with an extremely well endowed bar fly girl dancing around the piano the whole night...ok that part wasn't necessarily "elegant steak house" material but it was fun to watch all the same). So on to the food. I had a very friendly waiter named David who was quite helpful. He was good enough to warn me that the side portions were "family style" and that it might be too much food to order 2 sides with my steak. Nice, most waiters would have simply scribbled down the order and ran to the kitchen.  I had a filet with a side of peppercorn sauce and the au gratin potatoes. It would have been nice if they offered smaller sides; I would have had asparagus but since the sides are huge I decided on only one. The steak did not disappoint. It was buttery soft, served similar to Ruth's Chris with a little butter on a hot plate (not nearly as much butter though, which in some ways is a positive). I had several bits of the steak without the peppercorn sauce to verify the taste of the beef. It was very nice, although it could have had slightly more beefiness to it. I realize this is dangerous territory since most gourmets would probably say that's exactly as it should be, but at this point I am comparing all steaks to Harriss' in San Francisco, and I'm happy to say (because I live within walking distance to Harriss') that I don't think this one was quite as good. As for the au gratin potatoes, they are pure heart stopping bliss in a nice hot dish. Cheesy, gooey, potatoey, baconey heaven in a bowl. Nice Southern cajun accent to the dish.  So, I'd definitely go to Del Friscos again because it certainly doesn't suck. I am still on the quest though for the better steak. Rumor has it that MIchael Minna is offering the only True Kobe steak in town (in Vegas that is). May have to investigate further. I think it's sad how Kobe beef is raised, similar to veal, but if you've ever had real Kobe you will never forget the experience and I may have to indulge once more.

b2l0VN8kck9r79xDz4HfXA.text: We went to Del Frisco's to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday.  I wanted to impress my hubby by going to a steak house he was not familiar with.  Since fellow yelpers raved about Del Friscos and the Howard Stern Show, on Sirius, always gets lunch or catering from them, I knew they would not disappoint.    Everything was perfect.  The ambiance, perfect.  The food, perfect.  The service, beyond perfect.    You walk in and the hostess is super nice.  You notice the decor is of dark wood and the lighting is perfectly dim.  The server greets you right away and makes you feel comfortable (unlike those other snooty restaurants in LA).  We informed her that it was our first time and she was more than happy to explain everything from the size of the cut to what Del Frisco's is known for.  We decided on the crab cakes, Porterhouse Steak and three sides, the corn, mashed potatoes with cheese, and another dish I can't remember with a bottle of wonderful merlot (which I found at Trader Joe's - YES!).  The crab cakes were heavenly.  Soooo yummy!  I enjoyed the steak very much...although I wished it would have been more pink (my hubby wanted it to be medium well, I wanted medium).  Considering it was medium well, it was still very tender and delicious.  My hubby would have picked up that huge bone and sucked on it till it was clean if we weren't inside a restaurant.  The sides were just okee....I think we ordered too much food to enjoy the sides...but the corn was good.  For desert, we ordered the chocolate souffle...yum!  I dreamed of it that night.  They compted the souffle since it was my hubby's birthday.  And, the didn't come in a huge group and sing (I hate that...so tacky).  Our bill, under $200.  Perfect.    A couple of days after returning from Vegas, we got a sweet thank you note from our waitress.  Wow, talk about 5 star service.    Would we return, definetly.  They should open one in Los Angeles.

pkBlgaYJOIbTjnZLRzoBDw.text: Admittely, I've have not tried too  many great steakhouses in Vegas. But this place is the standard to which all others will be compared to. The entrees were excellent, and the appetizers and side dishes were unbelievable. You must try the crab cakes, and the mac and cheese. My entree was the veal (I know eating veal is cruel, but that baby cow didn't die in vein), and it was cooked to perfection. All the other members of my party sampled seperate items on the menu, but all enjoyed their meals equally. This place is a must visit in Las Vegas.

-ftTdVr41JbtJEJDoGKvgw.text: Del Frisco's steak is amazing. The seasoning is delicious, and the flavor had infused itself throughout the entire strip. I ordered mine rare (why wouldn't you at a place like this??), and it came out perfectly cooked. Warm, red, but not still bleeding, tender, and full of flavor. It didn't cut like butter, but it couldn't have been much better.  I'm only giving four stars because of the appetizers. I was tricked into ordering what the waiter called the "triple-double", which was described as three pieces of shrimp per person, plus two additional appetizers. The waiter said he didn't know how much it would be, because it depends on how many people were in the group (9). Fair enough. But he didn't mention that the crab cakes were similarly priced (per person at the table). Just the shrimp alone was over $100, and appetizers altogether were about $200.  The shrimp was pretty standard, and definitely NOT worth it. The crab cakes were excellent, but again, I feel like we were deceived somewhat.  I would highly recommend Del Frisco's, but only for the steak. Save yourself some money and avoid the overpriced appetizers. Plus, the steak is more than enough food for most people.

nXpuroNVTmKIqCUFmUYrMw.text: We had 3 people in our party and decided to go to Del Frisco's after reading the other great Yelp reviews.  We did not have reservations but were seated right away. The bread was bought to our table right away but we did not have anything to drink. Our waiter came and took our drink order, but still did not bring us any water. 2 of us ordered the $99 Power Couple special--a great deal!!. Both of us ordered our steaks medium well--they were more like medium rare. I don't like sending food back- so I ended up taking my steak home. The lobster mac and cheese was fantastic!! When it came to desert one of us ordered coffee but it did not arrive till they were almost done with desert. The banana bread pudding was also great!!  Service was slow. It was my birthday yet no one bothered to ask if we were celebrating anything. We are local and may go back again.

6MHKNSMqgdZrdW0BfOU-gQ.text: Now this steak house is the bomb!!!! Husband and I ordered the 22oz Bone-in Prime Rib Eye. It was soooo good, one of the best steaks we had....can't stop thinking about it! =)  It was tasty and not chewy at all..cooked to perfection (medium), just how we like it! Didn't even need A-1. The Lobster Mac n Cheese was pretty good too, but a few of my friends didn't like it too much. The corn side dish was good but the mash potatoes were ok.  We'll definitely return for the steak =P Service was awesome.

PzbOIsIdyFVp0mC6QpUuow.text: The best steakhouse ever.  Also, the best server and very helpful.  My Fiance took me to eat Filet Mignon for my birthday and he made reservation here at Del Frisco Double Eagle Steak house and it was a wonderful surprise.  He also requested a nice and quite area to eat and sit comfortable.  They have been refilling our water consistently everytime our glass of water was almost half way empty.  Our Server have been very helpful and always came to ask how our food was, asked how everything was, etc.  Lastly, a wonderful delicious cake for my birthday.  Everything was the best ever and delicious.  I would recommend this restaurant to my friends and other people that loves to eat steakhouse.  They also cook it the way you want it.

nEiVqCYZDHygrYi-_NNl7g.text: This place lives up to the reviews of the other Yelpers.  There were four of us and we ordered 2 bone in rib eye's and 2 filet mignons and  they were cooked to perfection.  We started off with shrimp cocktail and a half dozen oysters on the half shell.  Both appetizers were delicious.  The size of the shrimps were just shy of a Black Angus lobster tail.  We also had potato au gratin and mac and cheese as sides.  As for dessert, we had the praline parfait, butterscotch cheesecake, and their well known lemon cake!  My friend works in the hospitality profession and knows the Manager there, so they were kind enough to comp all of our desserts!!!!  We were all impressed about their steaks and as a consensus, this place is just as good as Mortons, The Palms, Mastros, Smith and Wollensky's.  Even though it is off the strip, I would definitely go back again.

or5-FQf_xZVY2GIHp27egQ.text: I don't get the rave about this place. I don't understand how it has survived all these years. The prices aren't the highest I've paid for steak (my all time favorite spot is CUT in LA$$$$) but the prices are so high especially for Vegas where your dining dollar tends to have very high returns. I was a bit disappointed and discouraged really from the moment we were sat in some testosterone infused wood paneled room with four flat screen TVs playing ESPN. WTF I thought I was at a steak house that was going to cost me upwards of 150$ per person. But my surroundings were very much collegiate Dennys. I lost my appetite. The wine list was enormous and lacking a sommelier. It was hard to find a wine under $100 and most were over $200. Ridiculous. They wet age their meat. I'm a fan of dry aging. The negatives just go on... Skip it. There are plenty of steak specials in town for $15 if you're looking for meat stick to that and use the difference of $150 on some nickel slots instead.

S3c57niGgp7TAiz7sGZJ5w.text: I was in Vegas for a meeting and I chose this place for a steak dinner one night based on the Yelp reviews. I truly had not had a great steak in at least 5 years. I am so bored with Flemings, Donovan's, etc., and I was craving a fantastic steak, but not real optimistic given my experiences lately. My pessimism was quickly cast asunder. This place is fantastic. I can usually find SOMETHING to keep a place from perfection, but I cannot here. The dining experience was top notch - and you pay for it. More on that in a minute. My rib steak was cooked to perfection. A little more rare than what I would call medium rare, but I happen to like it a tad more rare anyway. The taste of the steak was nothing short of magical. I didn't add one speck of seasoning, it was great from the start. The asparagus was cooked al dente -- perfect. Everything was hot, the service (Priscilla) was impeccable. When the table of 18 next to us got their entrees, EIGHT waiters delivered their meals. I haven't seen that type of "sweeping" service since I was in Europe, and only rarely there. Price ? Yes. Alot. Not cheap. Think -- $28000 bottle of wine on the list. That'll give you an idea. When you decide you want to splurge and have an expensive night out, this is the place to drop the wad. No complaints. Like a Lamborghini - if you can afford it, It's worth it.

ERgk7HxDbMHtvGV85FDDiQ.text: The best steakhouse in Vegas!!!  Great food, atmosphere, cocktails, etc.!! The wine list is incredible and not jacked up three fold!!!  The mushrooms are the best ever!!!!!!!!    I've been to the one in Dallas as well and it was incredible too.

X8fwo9dQrUl-8ACrboEbxQ.text: I took my boyfriend here for dinner last night.  Our server was Ryan or Brian.  He was pretty good.  We sat on the patio which had a fan and mister so it was not too hot.  We arrived a few minutes before five but the hostesses said they don't seat anyone until five exactly so we had to wait a few minutes at the bar area.  The bartender greeted us and was friendly although we opted to not have cocktails.  Once seated I started with a Caesar salad.  It was whole romaine leaves in dressing and shreds of parmesean.  I really was craving lettuce so that was good, but I have to say the Caesar was truly disappointing.  It was a very bland dressing that I wasn't too fond of, and the croutons were okay but fairly lackluster.  So far I was not impressed and was worried because this place had such good recommendations from friends as well as on yelp.  After my salad my crab-cake dinner came out, and my boyfriends filet.  We also ordered a side of lobster mac and cheese.  My crab-cakes came in a Cajun sauce and they were excellent.  I was relieved!  The sauce was creamy and the right amount of spicy, and the crab-cakes were not full of breading at all- they did have a bit of crunch to them via some vegetables which I did really enjoy.  I had been craving and missing crab-cakes being from Baltimore so these definitely made me happy!  The lobster mac and cheese my boyfriend said was the best we have had.  I tried my boyfriends filet but since it was medium-well I was disgusted though he seemed to enjoy it.  I let the waiter know we were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday so we would definitely like to see the dessert menu no matter what my boyfriend said.  The waiter said "ok" and then minutes later brought out a giant piece of lemon cake with a candle in it.  That was so sweet of the waiter- we were not even asking for a free dessert and he did that without us knowing.  The cake was moist with a lemon-curd filling on each layer and a very good frosting on the outside.  The frosting was just the right amount of sugary that I like and was thinly on the cake.  I loved it!  All in all I don't know that I would go back but I am happy that I went there and tried it!

HmRVG4crVLafHhPXwBHeUg.text: Got the 8 oz filet mignon - was more than enough meat for me and ended up taking a good third home. The sides come family style, which is fun as long as the table agrees on taste. We had the chateau potatoes and asparagus. The potatoes were good, traditional mash fare. The asparagus wasn't all the great - pretty stringy and could only chew half the stalk. They would do better to get thinner asparagus. Overall a very yummy, luxurious steak place.   The cinnamon creme brulee and cheesecake were both delicious. They were new takes on traditional sweets. The cheesecake isn't baked so it comes very light and fluffy - dare I say it was the best original style cheesecake I've ever had [can't say best cheesecake ever, because cheesecake with chocolate in it might still win me over more].

JRKdt0GYxdD3d03CQlizNQ.text: In my opinion, one of the top steakhouses in Vegas. Always perfect service and well equiped for larger groups. The bartenders have great memories, they remember my name even though I only visit one time per month. Steak, Fish, Burgers all have been excellent and cooked perfectly. New York Strip  with Cajun rub is awesome.

k7umjsaAMBJYHw7pVstelg.text: The food was stunning, you come to vegas and expect a great steak. Del Friscos delivers. The ambience is great as well, it's authentic and old fashioned. You couldn't replicate it if you tried. The service was fantastic as well, Mitchell was fantastic. He was what every server should strive to be. Focus on making sure everything is perfect for the guest but also personable and fun to talk to. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely be back!

MGRKJ7ZEggYFW9wR61mt2w.text: Best service, ever!!!  I felt like the moment they asked if we needed anything or when we were done with something, 3 or 4 waiters were there in a quickness to accommodate.    We had the 32 oz wagyu tomahawk ribeye, and I have to say, it was a heavenly cut of beef.  So delicious!  Our sides were the lobster Mac and cheese, sauteed mushrooms, and their version of mashed potatoes (chateau potatoes).  My fave was the lobster Mac and cheese.  Actually, it became my fave side dish, ever!  From any of the restaurant side dishes I've ever had. My husband loved the chateau potatoes.    The lemon cake was superb!!  I'm craving that nowww!

7Jpvrarp7gT54M-5hWIXJg.text: Ok...  Food:  Great Price: Fair Happy Hour:  Excellent Music:  Awesome James Bond Table:  Out of this world!!!!  They often have specials so check out their website.  Great food, good ambiance and killer cocktails!

adYYV94YuD-kOEzopRy5EA.text: Love this steakhouse! Def have better steak than most of the restaurants on the strip or inside the hotels/casinos. The steaks were always juicy and melt in your mouth (we always get the bone in ribeye). The steaks are similar to Ruth's Chris' but tasted a little better. Their lobster mac and cheese was only ok--not very memorable to me. Their sesame bread was delicious. We always go to town on those bread with butter. Even asked for seconds--and they never mind. Service is top notch here.   Definitely check this place out if you're a steak lover! My BF and I always try to fit this place on our itinerary whenever we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye, lobster mac &amp; cheese, crab cakes

-sS3JL-Ddx7ncgS03lX5NQ.text: I love this place. We went there twice this year and once last year and have thoroughly enjoyed each experience.   Once for dinner and everything was delicious and twice for their happy hour eating by the bar. The special Pinot and house pineapple vodka cocktail is so good as well as their prawn dish, burgers and sliders. My mouth is watering remembering how good they were and at happy hour with a brilliant piece tag. Love that their burgers also come with fries cheaper than ordering fries on their own at happy hour. Get there early for larger groups as sometimes there's a wait.  My only criticism is the piano guy can be pretty loud during this time though he does play good tunes.  Love the free del fresco golf tees and Jellybeans. If we ever go back to Vegas we will definitely be back!

pPN7l16rkIJchqV8h95JSg.text: Great restaurant. I saw this when looking for restaurants and had too write them a great review. Three things you have to try. VIP drink, Green Godess Dressing, and the lemon cake. Oh and the steaks are also good.

mm5G8MPwhL4VR4Zv8A67sA.text: The options were Del Frisco's or Ramsay's Steak @ Paris.  I chose Del Frisco because of its $99 Power Couple deal.  I opentabled the restaurant for dinner to save time.  We self-parked but the valet guy ran to the door and opened it for us.    $99 Power Couple is only for Sunday.  We ordered caesar salad, del salad, filet, crabcake, sauteed mushroom, chateau potato, chocolate mousse and bread pudding.  Sesame bread: complimentary hot bread and butter.  Warning: do not eat too much of these!!!  You will be full.  I ate 2 slices of bread because they were yum but occupied a portion of my stomach =(  Caesar salad:  One of the freshest caesar salads I've ever had. Del salad: Served with 2 stripes of bacon on top, this is better than caesar salad.  Filet: The medium rare is rare and the medium is medium rare.  The worker asked us to cut the filet to make sure it is cooked just the way we liked it.   We sent it back to the kitchen because they seemed to be undercooked for our liking.  The filet is superb!!  Ruth Chris got nothing on Del Frisco.   Crabcakes: very lumpy but I don't really care for it.  Sauteed mushroom:  juicy and perfectly cooked but I don't care for it either. Chateau potato: it's just okay...I've had better.  I was so full that I didn't even finish my steak...what a waste!!!  I was so tempted to doggy-bag my steak leftover and eat it in my room.  Bread pudding: crispy on the outside with ice cream, caramel drizzle and mint leaf on top.  I don't really like it. Chocolate mousse: the most creative design with fork and spoon shadows from cocoa powder.  I like this chocolate mousse better than the bread pudding.  My waiter, Matt (?), is super funny.  How many people worked there that night?  We have the hostess, waiter,  the person who brought the salad, busboy, steak delivery boy, 2 side dishes workers, the girl who picked up empty bottle, napkin folder girl, the guy who gave me direction to the restroom....all different people.    4 stars!!  I am a fan of its delicious steak.  Del Frisco is yummylicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread &amp; butter
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frisco&#39;s steak knife
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding

LdYrroR0hdIcPW80zGUWrg.text: Amazing dining experience!  It will now be on the top of my list to dine here again in Vegas.  Started with a delicious Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, Trio if Shrimp Cocktail and The VIP House Cocktail-infused Vodka in Fresh pineapples for days. This martini is like drinking pineapple juice but be careful as it's easy to have one after another.  It creeps up on you! But well worth it! Plenty if selections as it is a steak house.  Couldn't resist the 16 oz portion Rib Eye No bone cooked perfectly at medium rare.   Accompanied with Roasted Brussels Sprouts with bacon, Sauteed Mushrooms and three butters.  Tarragon Butter, Bone Marrow Butter and Truffle Butter which was amazing.  Finished with their 5 Layer Lemon Cake.  Voila that's a dinner fit for a king I'd say. Holidays are for gluttoning and I feel no guilt.  The ambiance was great with a live musician.  A top 10 on my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 Layer Lemon Cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye, Brussels Sprouts &amp; Sauteed Mushrooms
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo

xZhNkM2-oV3t0VCusiO85g.text: Super awesomeness 5 star service ,food was delicious  manager Alexander spectacular service.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome food delicious, manager ms.alexander grazie 10 star service.

EE3N3UU0BPf0caGL5lYGtQ.text: The boyfriend is going to kill me when he reads this review, because he loved the dinner and he spent a lot of money on it, but I was overly unimpressed.  We started off with the special chopped salad. I thought this was rather good, but it was so drenched in dressing that I could barely distinguish the different ingredients. I tasted bacon, and I felt the lettuce, but that's about it.   I forgot, the table bread is forgettable. Yes, it's soft, and covered in sesame seeds, but there was nothing special about it, besides the fact that it was a giant piece you had to break by hand and it left seeds all over the table. I LOVED the whipped butter, however. It was fluffy and salty, overall perfect, and I could spread this on anything and everything.  We ordered the bone in ribeye to share, since we had a large lunch. When it came to the table, some lady mangled it. She cut a 3-4 inch slit to ask us if it was cooked properly. We asked for medium rare, and I saw a lot of white-ish meat, but the bf gave his approval, so we took it. I wanted to let the steak sit for a minute, but the lady proceeded to cut it in all sorts of sloppy pieces.   It was a massacre. I've never seen anything like it before. She first tried to separate it from the bone. It was like she had never handled a piece of meat or a steak before. She was all over the place, and splatters of meat juice were shooting around the table. I don't know if any of it hit us or our clothes, but I saw stains appearing on the white tablecloth all around.   It took her forever to separate the bone from the meat. At one point I thought she was going to give up, because she just couldn't get the job done. The whole time, I was staring at the knife and wondering if she had grabbed the wrong one, or if it was dull or something. It was appalling.  Next, she cut the steak into pieces. She said she wanted us to have equal shares of each section of the steak. We had four pieces (one with the 3-4 inch slit in it), and then she decided one piece was bigger than the other, so she cut off a piece of it and threw it to the other portion. OMG. In the end, there were five pieces of mangled meat that were divided onto two plates. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  The meat looked bastardized after this.  When I bit into my portion, it was, to my surprise, tough. I'm not even exaggerating here. It was really tough for a $50 steak. I've cooked more tender rib eyes bought from Costco or from Omaha's online catalog. And it wasn't anything near medium rare. It was quite possibly medium, if not more done.   The flavor of the steak was good, but most of that was due to over salting. There is a lot of seasoning on this meat, so much so, that it was hard to actually taste the steak. I overly salt my steaks at home, but I'm not buying really expensive cuts. What I'm looking for in a pricey steak is texture, tenderness, and flavor (past the salt). I didn't get any of these three. If I had gotten this steak at Sizzler or at another, cheaper, restaurant, I'd be ecstatic, don't get me wrong. I am so critical, because this was supposed to be the best steak ever, and it fell short. By a lot.  The sides were hit and miss. I thought the mushrooms were nicely done and were bursting with flavor. I don't even like mushrooms, but I thought these were a nice pick. The special green beans were also good. The famed lobster mac and cheese that everyone raves over...wtf? The pieces of lobster were small, and although it was creamy, it was more milky than cheesy. It was extremely loose and runny in texture, and the predominant flavor was the taste of the breadcrumbs. Um, no. I had some the next morning (cold), and the congealed consistency was slightly more appetizing.  Overall, the next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going to look for steak elsewhere. In my humble opinion, it's not worth the price.

MZ3dLblreZH20oDgmUgczg.text: This was our second visit. The first was phenomenal, great service, amazing food, wine, dessert. I had the bone in strip and my wife had the filet mignon. We shared the Au gratin potatoes and asparagus. All very well prepared and delicious. Now for the bad part and the two star review. After we were seated the gentleman brought us bread and I noticed something on my hand. I thought it was a moth but it was a German cockroach. I have been in the pest control business for almost 40 years and know that almost all restaurants struggle with these issues. The guy asked if we wanted to move and I assured him it was ok probably just a coincidence. My wife saw it and freaked out a bit! I killed it. About halfway through the meal I saw another one crawling on the outside of the table cloth and another crawling towards another table!!!! Note to the manager call your provider immediately!!!
