You have a serious health issue at your restaurant, I wrote a note on my tab, I asked to speak with the manager and they said you were not available.i will not return or recommend your restaurant. I may even call the health department.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food minus the roach!

AGRamEymRsiyZSsjcS4xPg.text: Went here when we were in Las Vegas celebrating our ten year anniversary! The service is fantastic,  the VIP signature martini was very good. I had the prime ribeye it was ok I was a little disappointed the meat was pretty rough and chewy. Not much flavor, so I guess that why they offer flavor butter.(make sure to get it)The potatoes au gratin  were delicious. My husband had the lobster Mac and cheese he said it was really good also he had the Chilean Seabass he said it was delicious.  So over all its a very nice restaurant very old school decor which is cool for Vegas. We recommend giving it a try I'd just order a different type of steak next time. It is very expensive so, maybe just a special occasion spot:)

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The VIP signature martini delicious!

eRmjZiJcNzjibnGL4UCQKw.text: The most fantastic steak I've had. Amazing wine selection and my waiter went above and beyond to make sure I enjoyed my dinner.

MnDQEwFknXJqs-KR3V5cuQ.text: I absolutely love Del Friscos everything about this place is awesome. For starters the staff is so nice and personable. Lately my boyfriend and I have decided to sit at the bar because we enjoy the bartender Ron so much. If you ever get s chance to dine at the bar, Ron will definitely entertain you with good conversation. Now their bread and butter is some of the best bread I've ever had; I always get some to go lol. For starters the del salad is good but I am now hooked on their chopped salad, which is not on the menu. I love the fried oysters as well as the buffalo shrimp (bar menu). Crab cakes are like no other, you will absolutely LOVE. Ribeyes are always cooked to perfection and seasoned very well. Once they bring your steak out they ask you to cut it down the middle to make sure it's to your likings. I always order a strawberry daiquiri of a  VIP.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A

ijLV60dpmnj3Ei5nXgcUuw.text: Was recommended to this place by a taxi driver. Excellent choice! Really beautiful restaurant.   Our server was Maria and she was so sweet. We loved her. I'd go back again just because she was awesome!   Food was so delicious. I'm not a big eater so I only ordered macaroni and cheese and it was the best Mac n cheese I've had! :)   I filled out a card at the restaurant and Maria sent a thank you card a couple weeks later thanking us for coming. I thought that was just so cool!   Great overall experience and I would definitely go back again and ask for Maria :)

T4Dk0TQQ9H20iub1cUJuLA.text: We went on a Thursday night for date night.  The atmosphere is dark and intimate with live music playing lightly in the background.  The sommelier, while very helpful and tailored choices to our price range, kind of creepped up on us and never actually introduced herself to us.  She just stood over our shoulders and asked if we needed help.  It was an odd start, but after that she was friendly.  Foodwise, the crab cakes were delicious and I'd go again just to order those!  We split a 26 oz double eagle bone in ribeye.  For being a double eagle steak house, our steak was good (moist and juicy sealed with a light char) , but I've had better.  We also ordered the asparagus and lobster mac & cheese.  The sides portions are pretty big and we ended up with a lot leftover.  Although we had leftovers, we still made room for warm banana bread pudding with a healthy scoop of ice cream on top.  It was a wonderful warm/cold contrast to seal off the night.  The service was attentive and timely.  We did notice an error on our bill and pointed it out to our server.  Afterwards, the manager came over to apologize and advise us he took care of our dessert for the error.  It was definitely unexpected and confirmed their dedication to excellent customer service.  We had heard rumors of the famed James Bond wine table here, so we asked the hostesses on the way out.  They were really nice and showed us the book with the special hidden button to open up the table and let us look around.  Although you can't drink any of the wine, it's definitely a sight to see.  Del Frisco's gets my date night seal of approval.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. because they&#39;re aren&#39;t enough pics of the James Bond wine table on here...

GM1824WmHrsgtGxwxPJ__g.text: We went here for my fiance's birthday and it was a really great meal/experience.  I felt like the waiters were overeager to please at times which could be awesome or could just get annoying.  For some reason I felt awkward with their attentiveness and rejected it (kinda shooed them away).  My fiance and I shared some couples special that involved crab cakes and filet mignon.  He is allergic to shellfish so we asked that the crab cakes be on a separate plate.  They forgot or whatever.  It wasn't a big deal and I moved them myself (and then they noticed and felt so bad).  I had the bread pudding.  I think I now have an obsession with bread pudding.  It was so rich/delicious/awesome.  Yummm.   At the end of the meal the waiter asked if we wanted cigars.  I am not sure if he meant to buy or for free - really odd.  We declined either way.    The steak was cooked (nearly) exactly as we ordered it and they have you cut into it to make sure.  I said something about it being a little pink and the waiter nearly forced me to send it back.  I had to force him to let it go.  It was really great and the sides we ordered (I recommend the mushrooms with some sort of garlic sauce as a side) were fab too.   So overall, the food was delicious. The waitstaff was happy to please.  The experience was positive and my fiance enjoyed his birthday meal.

-8zq1O6GRuq6Wp2y0NsQJA.text: Came in for happy hour on Monday. I've brought clients here for dinner in the past and really miss the Cigar bar in the back!  Ordered the burger and a beer. The burger was thick and tasty although I felt the bun is overly thick. The condiments were fresh and the potatoes that came with the burger were on the greasy side. I ended up half way through the burger and chucked half the bun and finished the burger with a fork and knife.  The bar has cougars and one was chatting my ear off. Don't get me wrong I like socializing but she was a distraction!  Stick with the steaks, lobster and crab cakes,  I've had better burgers elsewhere although the HH price was a bargain for $13.00 for two beers & burger before gratuity.   The bartenders here were both great..

tYvInDh8q-Ag3zm1M2cddw.text: Aaaaaamazing Steaks !!! The Waygu Steak was so flavorful of crispy fat and seared beef flavor.....by the way you only need a butter knife to cut into it!!! Worth the $90.  We also had the bone-in rib steak which was equally tender and rich in flavor. But the overwhelming favorite was the double lamb chops that was so so so tender and the flavor (not gamey) was full of seared fat and rich lamb flavor.  I had to share my chops with my family and got only a small bite size of heaven.  Gotta go back alone !!!  The lobster mac'n cheese did not have enough lobster flavor nor chunks of lobster meat???? The caesar salad was freshly made with excellent anchovies, citrus and parmesan flavor lightly tossed with extra light olive oil.  Love this place, great service but didn't like the fact that they put us near the kitchen especially when we spent over $600 for 4 people.....maybe that's where they put families with teenagers?????

Df6OxHOUr5qlxqXlUjl6yA.text: Great steakhouse!  Excellent and knowledgeable staff.  Had a party of 18 in a private room and service was Outstanding!  I had the Caesar salad, Cajun crabcakes with lobster sauce, bone in prime ribeye and a load of sides!  We were loud as a barfull of sailors but their staff took it like champs.  Ha.    Food:  Well prepared and perfect steak! Service:  Solid Price: Expensive and ala carte but that was the danger going in right?

fIZoic0VkYsqqr2J0r2uYg.text: Dined here on Saturday, 3/3/12 with my hubby.  I have to say what a wonderful dining experience we had here at Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House!!!    We had a 7:30 PM dinner reservation and when we arrived we were immediately greeted by the hostess.  The place was packed and with people and it was quite loud and "happy."  :)  We were seated in 10 minutes.  Service here was outstanding!  Our servers were very helpful and friendly and helped us choose some items off the menu.    The bread and butter they brought to the table was amazing!  Fresh, hot, crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside.  We made the mistake of eating too much bread before dinner, but could not help ourselves as it was sooo good! :)  For starters we had the onion rings.  OMG!  They were HUGE!  MASSIVE!  More like onion "bracelets" than onion rings!  But man were they really tasty!  Best onion rings ever!!!  My hubby ordered their 14 oz lobster tail and I ordered one of their specialty steaks. For sides we had their lobster mac and cheese and chateau potatoes.  Everything was very rich and delicious!  The lobster was tender and juicy!  My steak was flavorful, tender and melted in my mouth.  Quite possibly the best steak I have ever eaten!    :)  The lobster mac and cheese was also very good and highly recommended as was the chateau potatoes.  Both were very rich, creamy, and cheesy!  Sinful I tell you!  For dessert, my husband ordered the creme brulee and I ordered their banana bread pudding.  The banana bread pudding was amazing!!!  It was served piping hot with vanilla ice cream and drizzled in caramel. I highly recommend it!  Pretty big too and could easily be shared between two people.    My hubby and I both really enjoyed Del Frisco's and highly recommend it if you are looking for an awesome steak house and wish to dine away from the crazy/busy Las Vegas Strip.   TIP:  Wear something loose or stretchy!  It's a whole lot of food!!!  :)  You will leave in a food induced coma!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Bread Pudding topped with vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel.  INSANELY DELICIOUS!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac &#39;n&#39; cheese.  YUM!

f_uv33KN0IEkRpRr4T4MlQ.text: My heart sank as the hostess started to lead us away from the main section of the restaurant to a more secluded and far less appealing area.  But even though inside I was screaming for her to stop and take us to where the action was happening, sometimes even I get tired of being such a pain in the ass customer - so I decided to behave myself for once and quietly followed instead.  We were shown to what I assumed to be the couple's section, and as a result, my date pretty much ended up sitting facing the wall.  Not cool when you're expected to drop $200-$300 on a dinner for two.  But Valentine's day weekend had made me all forgiving and pathetic and shit so I held my tongue, and there we sat in a thoroughly uninspiring, lifeless wood paneled room, away from any kind of activity or anything remotely interesting.   Service was on the slow side.  Some guy who seemed to be the manager came and got our drinks orders first.  Then another person brought some bread and butter spread, but for the longest time our server was MIA.  When she eventually did get to us, she was very pleasant, and armed with good suggestions and helpful hints.  The food was great for the most part: Caesar salad appetizer was tasty with just the right balance of everything, but the shrimp appetizer was not my favourite.  For my main course I had the half filet mignon, half lobster dish which was perfect and I enjoyed every bite.   Sadly, due to where we sat, I have no solid idea what the restaurant actually looks like, nor what the atmosphere is like - we could have been anywhere really - so that was a bit disappointing.  I guess they think they are doing couples a favour putting them in a quiet spot so they can enjoy each other's company - but hey, I can do that at home - when I am out at a restaurant, especially for the first time, I actually want to experience the scene, not be shoved in a claustrophobic corner surrounded by dark walls!  But overall, due to the excellent food and (eventual) service, this was a positive dining experience.  My favourite part of the whole evening?  A completely unexpected James Bond related surprise: under lock and key, Del Frisco's houses a unique, one of a kind 007 themed wine collection, estimated at a cool $1,000,000 and pretty damned awesome!  Ask to see it if you're a fan.

CoW9PRiPZmRQ2CUlFYBRZQ.text: I gave the ultimate throne to Mastro's Steakhouse in Beverly Hills years ago and thought His Majesty will never been overthrown.  And then I tried Del Frisco's in Las Vegas. Wow  Title Bout:  In one corner: Defending champion, Mastro's Chef's Cut 33oz Ribeye Chop - Medium Rare In the challenger's corner - Del Frisco's Bone-in Prime Ribeye - Medium Rare  Mastro's trainers are: Mastro's House Salad, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, and Colossal Onion Rings.  Del Frisco's trainers are: Spinach Supreme, Lobster Mac & Cheese, and the Classic Caesar Salad.  "LET'S GET R-R-R-READY TO RUMBL-L-L-L-E . . ."  -Rd 1-  Mastro's 33oz girth is the best pound for pound steak known to mankind. It's juicy with simple flavors, not overly done with melted butter or seasoning.  Del Frisco's 22oz may be smaller, but it definitely packs the punch with intense flavors, and the meat literally melted in my mouth.  -Rd 2-  Mastro's take a slight edge when trainers got involved. I mean, who doens't respect a Lobster Mashed Potatoes and a huge rack of onion rings fried to perfection in light, fluffy batter?  -Rd 3-  Del Frisco's came back with Lobster Mac & Cheese, and creamed spinach with bacon bits!!  Del Frisco steals round 3 with... bacon!  Final Scorecard: Mastro's = 5 Stars. Del Frisco's = 5 stars.  IT'S A DRAW  Welcome to the ring Del Frisco's. Pound for Pound, you put up a great fight, certainly one of the best in the world.  Next fight, only on Pay-Per-View: Mastro's Carrot Cake vs. Del Frisco's Lemon Cake - coming soon to a cable provider near you.

zFmHDHCLV-lDkIQ1rGykXg.text: Dissipointing ambiance (it's old and smelled musty)  but I had a great bone-in ribeye. For the money.. i'd trying something else.

rUX-hlT_7nYDqt7v4nld1g.text: I haven't been to a steakhouse in quite some time and this looked like  The one to "set it off "   The appetizer menu is one of the best I've ever encountered it was tough to choose one but I buckled down and went with the fried oysters they serve big portions and It was the best fried oysters I've ever had  Also had a couple bites of the crab in lobster sauce it was excellent   Main course is simple get anyone of the steaks on the menu  I got the tomahawk for 2 it was really good  Remember its a steakhouse GET a steak don't get cute My side was onion rings and they knocked them out of the park  They are big huge gigantic etc.  Dessert is no joke in here they got two that really caught my eye The 7 layer lemon cake and banana bread pudding  I was able to have both and it was close but where can you find  Banana bread pudding that's the winner   Time to act : Your role = Be a tourist  When you go here say you are a tourist  Trust me they will treat you better  Say you are catching a show later  So they don't take forever   Yes this is a 5 star but there was something a little off

CsplnHVNc8IufTJ9A7AgMQ.text: Have always heard a steak could melt in your mouth. Never actually had one until I went to DelFriscos. A little pricey but totally worth the money! Great drinks, appetizers and of course the steak! It's to die for! The staff is very friendly and takes good care of you. They are knowledgable about the items on the menu and offer great suggestions. You must go there!

Xxr2gvaF-aGr5nD9pTLooA.text: Great Old Fashioned Steak House. I enjoyed the 32 oz Wagyu Bone in Ribeye ... 5 Stars !!!! Oysters were not up to par, but the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Potatoes AuGratin were Awesome !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macallan 12 &amp; Oysters
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Wagyu 32 oz Ribeye

LoUp8jSmDp082uLCP6zsSQ.text: My experience here was thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish and, for me, the off the strip location is one of its attributes.   It's an easy cab ride from many strip hotels, especially those on the east side of Las Vegas Boulevard because it's a straight shot down Paradise Road.    We had a 6:30 p.m. reservation on a Saturday night and were seated promptly upon arrival.    Our server did a great job of walking us the menu and off-the-menu offerings and making recommendations, which later proved to be spot on.    Our server and the other members of the wait staff did a great job from start to finish.  The service was friendly, professional, and attentive but never intrusive or pretentious. The meal was well paced.     My buddy and I each ordered the 10 Oz bone-in-fillet, seafood paring, salads, and sides, all preceded by the recommended Calamari appetizer.    The Calamari appetizer was terrific.    The crab cake seafood pairing was excellent.    The sides (mushrooms and creamed spinach) were very good.    My fillet was perfection.    Sadly, after polishing off the Calamari, the salads, the steaks, the seafood, the sides, all washed down by cocktails, neither me or my buddy had room for dessert.     I will save room next time for the Lemon Cake.

ZH7B-lWsqtZBEjFIQeqmSA.text: We Came here for steak dinner for a bachelor party.  We read some decent reviews about this.  Food:  Started with the tuna tartare and the seafood soup.  The soup was delicious however a bit too much pepper seasoned on it.  The tuna tartare was pretty decent with great seasoning and it came with great toasts.  My friend end up ordering the 8z  Filet,  I ordered the Osobuco veal shank. It was decently marinated. However, the Pasta that came with it was completely dry and stuck together.  It was not edible at all.  My friend's filet was cooked perfectly to do medium rare and seasoned well.   We also ordered sauteed spinach, broccoli and sweet potatoes.  They told us was a family size.  But those portions were NOT family size. Barely enough for 2 people.   For the pricing of the sides,  those portion were Not worthy.  But the sides were cooked very well.  Overall, the food was pretty good. But they seem to miss out on some details.  3.5/5  Service: This Waiter was like a car dealer,  trying to sell every dish that you had questions for.  He was very knowledgeable.   The water boy were attentive and refilled our water consistently. The main waiter kept checking in us to see how we were doing.    It was very good consistence service during a pack dinner time.   4/5  Atmosphere:  When I walked in, It smelt like sewer smell.  It almost ruined my appetite.  However the place is very big and split up into sectors.  I like the spacing of the tables to allow people to walk and you cannot hear other table conversation.  It was decorated very well.   3.5/5    Overall, I will round it up to give it a 4 due to the consistency of the service and most of the dishes came out to be great.

xroM0tfyn3aweglhl9YLig.text: I am a foodie and a fussy steak consumer.  Having worked for a couple years in the high end restaurant industry I'm extraordinarily critical about service and standards.  Del Frisco's is the finest steakhouse I've ever had the pleasure of eating at.  This place is head and shoulders above the other pretenders.  If those other steakhouses even dream about competing they better wake up and apologize.  Any fan of the competition has never eaten here.  That's it.  End of story.  I never visit a city with a Del Frisco's without stopping by.  I have converted many non-believers to the mantra that this is the best steak and restaurant experience they have ever had.  Treat yourself!

oUsAkSE92bOPMqaWJ5MgzQ.text: Best steak out there.  We ordered the double eagle 26 oz bone in cut along with the stone crab claws.  Steak was cooked the way we liked it, and as we requested.  Medium with a pink inside...not bloody.  Perfection in taste with the right char on the outside and flavors bursting from everywhere.  Hands down, this is the place to get steak.  We just caught the end of stone crab season.  Lots of meat in those claws and we ordered the large, not the jumbo.  Lemon cake was absolutely amazing and moist.  I wasn't much of a fan of the lemon cake but after that, I most definitely am.  What made our dining experience cool was the amazing service Brian gave us, as well as the manager, Amanda, stopping by to greet and chat. Amanda and Brian were warm and friendly, as well as professional.  The staff and food make the place what it is.  We were there to celebrate our anniversary as well as babymoon, and they made it special for us.  There are locals hanging out at the bar and enjoying happy hour.  Somehow, the place doesn't seem as stuffy, but do go in there dressed somewhat decently .   This is now my wife's and my top place to get steak.

X006hEJqGBef2q6c-aoEaw.text: I couldn't find anything bad to say about this place even if I tried. Very accommodating. Food is excellent. Staff is attentive. What more could you ask for? Love it!

7iweBYPeGX9htIIDuoLDcQ.text: We celebrated my birthday here on Tuesday.  I have been wanting to try this place for several years but there are so many choices in this town it has been evading me.  We made a reservation for 5:30 as we had guests coming to town later.  When we arrived we were the only food guests in the room.  The bar however was completely full and they had a pianist in the bar which was kind of nice.  The background nose was kind of loud and I am not sure why they didn't seat us in on of the other rooms with less noise.  The service was very good.  We started with the Carpaccio and the crab cakes and they were both very good.  The crab cake was delicious.  I had the braised short rib which was served over mashed potatoes. delicious!  My wife had the bone in filet and she said it was the best tasting filet that she can remember having.  For our sides we had the lobster mac and cheese, Asparagus with almonds and Au Gratin Potatoes. The mac and cheese was awesome, the asparagus was not prepared professionally as they were large stalks with good flavor but very thick skin which should have been shaved off on the lower extremities before serving and the Au Gratin was very good.  We have the butter cake with ice cream for desert and that was also very good.  The signed birthday card was nice but I forgot it on the table.  All in all this was very good but enough flaws that I could not muster that extra star.

-o6F8qX80-2A1Bs6KpSklg.text: Every single second of this dining experience was top notch. It started with a complimentary shot (it was my birthday) of their house specialty VIP Martini which was mandarin vodka soaking in fresh pineapple - Yummy! I had the $49 house special which includes Salad, Side & Steak.  I upgraded my steak to a bone in fillet and it was amazing.  This place specializes in bone in cuts of meat and i recommend that is what you order. The mac-n-cheese is a must order and its a huge portion (easily feeds 3-4) The mashed taters are also very large in portion. Plan on spending some time here - They want you to stay relax and enjoy. Plan on spending some $$$ but its well worth it.

nBPbcrNmQrqrqXV-y3sYxQ.text: Wow , this place did not disappoint.  We started with calamari and onion rings for appetizers.  The calmer had a sweet chili sauce which was DELICIOUS!  Our waiter Chris was great!  My steak was cooked perfectly.  Best side...the lobster mac and cheese!  Don't skip the dessert.  the butter cakes was scrumptious!!!  Good pick Brad!

Ds2lk_6zWUWL4lvQFM8_qw.text: From the moment you walk in to the restaurant you feel like a VIP. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming. And I have been to quite a few fine restaurants all over the world and I am pleased to report that the service here is among the best. All of our needs are catered to but not in an annoying way. The timing was impeccable the attention to detail was meticulous and professional and the service was a large part of the overall experience. OK on to the food. I ordered the pineapple infused martini. Again ,outstanding..a subtle taste of vodka and a lovely aroma and taste of pineapple.This was a well made drink. Very good balance. We split a chopped salad,excellent. My guest ordered the three filet steaks with three separate toppings combo. One with bearnaise,one with hollandaise and I believe it was spinach and the last had a scallop and a shrimp on top.This is a great selection as it gives you a chance to sample three different types of flavors.I had the double cut lamb chops.They came with a pomegranate infused mint sauce that was one of the best I have ever had.Again great subtlety to the sauce,complimented the lamb to perfection. We ordered the mashed potatoes and the asparagus on the side. for dessert we had the creme brulee,again this was among the finest versions I have ever tasted. From the moment we arrived to the second we left we felt as if we had been invited to a vip experience. From the welcome to the service to the meal,this was outstanding from top to bottom.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chips for me !
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three filet special with different toppings
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple infused martini yum !

hZT9xb5fDCOQF99VwLVHmQ.text: Came here with a group of 9 for my Mother-in-law's birthday. Had a reservation and were seated as soon as everyone was there.  The table didn't drink much, but the drinks we had were all good and well made.  Strong wine list, too, as expected with a good steak house.  Sides are big enough for 4 or more people each and they're all good. Had the Asparagus, mashed potatoes and au gratin potatoes. All delicious.   Although I don't usually review them here, I'm a bit of a steakhouse junkie. My personal test is the bone-in ribeye, medium rare, no extra crap on top to hide deficiencies.  Only rarely am I disappointed at higher end places. My steak came out  cooked perfectly. Well seasoned with salt and pepper and butter.  Oddly, once I got beyond the outer portions, I noticed I was chewing too much. Not normally an issue with a good ribeye. However, as I took a better look I realized this particular ribeye had no marbling. Not just less than normal, it was like the cow ran marathons or something. Just no fat to be found. Fat marbling, as you hopefully know, in addition to helping to hasten heart attacks, makes the meat tender. Like you could eat it with a spoon tender. Not this one. It was easily the leanest ribeye I've ever seen, which is why my jaw was getting such a hard workout. I know...clearly a 1st world problem. But when you pay this much for a steak you expect the best, and I just didn't get it with this one.  Had the butter cake for dessert. Full disclosure-we had it to compare it to the amazing one at Mastro's.  It was delicious and served with pecan ice cream.  As this was only my first time at this location, I'll give them a pass for the lean meat. The flavor of the meat was excellent and everything else we ate was tasty.  But if I start reading that other people have the same issue, I'll have to switch to a different protein or another steakhouse.

xYC1I_NT0xkrqdVAN430dw.text: Filet bone in was crazy good ..,!!!!  Special cut was awsome ..  Good job .,!!!

sK3zu1R_C9VkU9F7Nq4lag.text: Great apps, delicious steak, extensive wine list, yummy sides (especially the spinach) and hooked us up with killer desserts. Great meal.

Ubaj4M1T7DDSOZTjWxzHkQ.text: This place is AMAZING, the best steak house we've been to so far.  My husband and I came here for dinner on our anniversary and I have to to say that I was truly impressed with the food, customer service, and ambiance.  They even had a pianist that made the environment romantic. Our waitress was very attentive, she knew what we needed even before we asked her.  My husband had the 26oz new york steak bone in, and it was cooked to perfection, the crab cakes are delicious, and the lemon cake is out of this world. We don't live in Vegas, but when we go back, this restaurant is on the list....Wish they had one in Los Angeles..

rndAKi_Tjkevu-itmGWT0w.text: As a person who does not eat steak, I usually roll my eyes when someone suggests a steak place for dinner because I assume that there will be very little for me to eat on the menu. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the menu at Del Frisco's because of the number of fish dishes available. We started with the Crab Cakes (the extra star to make this resto a 5 on my list) and the meal stayed fantastic. I opted for their Ahi Tuna, which was perfectly cooked. Add to that the medley of yummy sides (the lobster mash was excellent, as were the sauteed mushrooms), and an extensive wine list, and, well, it really can't get better.... until you hit their desserts.  I am generally not a dessert person (as I prefer to calorie spend on salty foods).  But, when someone at the table insisted that I try a bite of their lemon cake, I was blown away!!  Absolute DELICIOUSNESS.  :)  Fair warning: this cake is crack... once you take one bite, you will have to take many more so calorie spend (if you do) wisely.   And, last but not least, the servers.  Service was spectacular.  My water (or, more importantly, wine) glass was never less than full and if a deceptive side (I think it was their creamed spinach that had bacon in it) came to the table, they were quick throughout the meal to point out so that I knew to stay away.   It's pretty rare when a non-steak eater gives a steak resto 5 stars. And, judging from the reactions at our table of those that opted for red meat, it's clear that Del Frisco's really has something for everyone!

8MJ7r_MjNJ6_wUKqstxYyw.text: Date/Time:   Saturday - 10:00pm Occasion:    Dinner Party of:   Two Ordered:   22oz  prime ribeye - medium, 24oz porterhouse - medium rare, potatoes au gratin, button mushrooms sauteed with sherry wine and garlic, and creamed spinach supreme with bacon. Location:   Nice ambiance, diverse, piano-bar feel Total incl gratuity:   $163.00  This place did not disappoint.  The service was very friendly; our waitress very attentive and very honest.  She made some fantastic recommendations of what to order and what went well with what.  The steak was very good; it definitely hit the spot and gave me the long awaited steak fix I was looking for.  They season the meat very well and it is cooked exactly how they describe.  Medium is a red center with hot pink sides.  It was delish.  I thought the ribeye was an excellent choice - tender and succulent.  It wasn't quite melt-in-your-mouth but nonetheless, it was still good.  We chose some fantastic sides...the creamed spinach with bacon bits was creamed heaven.   I enjoyed it very much.  If you like a hint of spice, request some tabasco sauce and sprinkle in into the spinach.  I find you can't go wrong with mushrooms - they always go well with steak.  And of course the potatoes au gratin.  They were extra cheesy and good though I definitely could feel the calories circulating into my body...  Overall, an excellent dining experience!  Great place for steak off of the strip.

EURNHfwmDivSg_V9uPW9Eg.text: This restaurant is out of this world!  Everything is soooo rediculously GOOD!!!   The filet mignot I had was perfectly cooked (medium rare) and super soft like butter!  The best steakhouse I've ever been to!  My boyfriend and I left the restaurant with amazement of how GREAT this place is!  It's expensive but worth every bit!  We will definitely dine here again when we come back to Vegas!

bic_ZOIcWHrqjnu1IL-WmA.text: The steak here is always excellent. This place is a nice, upscale spot not too far off the strip. Friendly staff and great wine selection.

LDw5YdnzNrt5W8CedIm6yw.text: Absolutely awesome. Was in Vegas recently for a little weekend getaway and made reservations here from all the excellent reviews and all I can say is everyone is right. The food was excellent the service was great and the ambiance was exactly what you expect in a steak house in this price range.

SaLwoFiMbHcti_0Cmzx-9g.text: service was amazing, never had an empty glass of water, never waited for anything.  started off with the seafood plateau with extra stone crab claws. soo good.  the steak was HUGE like massive bone and steak. we got the special kobe bone in steak that was a ridiculous size i think maybe 22 oz? i forgot. but it was cooked to perfection  sides were lobster mac and cheese which was good but not amazing, and string beans with were tasty  dessert bleh nothing special about the molten chocolate cake too dense.

qjECVwK0bTHd2OT00g2OGw.text: It may be True that they have the best crab cakes in the world. Or, at least among the very best. My wife and I have eaten crab cakes everywhere from italy to honolulu we know crab cakes! They have some excellent budget wines nestled among some heart stoppingly expensive wines. We also had chopped salad and duo of fillets. Cooked to perfection. Excellent service. Starving musician on the piano also very nice.

78g8W-IbtQnxJt4Ot2zM9g.text: I seriously count down the minutes until the next time I can visit my beloved Del Frisco's!

3Bz8-TKJe7giiC0WawVlxg.text: Although I ate here a few months ago, I have to say this restaurant serves the best bone-in rib-eye steak I have ever tasted and I am a total steak lover.  I ordered the bone-in prime rib-eye steak (cooked medium rare) and it was extremely juicy and tasty! The juices from the steak were so good, I had to get extra bread to soak up every last bit of the flavor from the steak.   When discussing how the steaks were prepared with our waiter, I was surprised to heard that the steaks were wet aged. From researching different methods for aging prime steaks, I was always under the impression that dry aging was superior to the wet aging process because dry aging was supposed to produce a more flavorful cut of meat because the moisture was removed from the meat resulting in a more concentrated flavor. However, Del Frisco's ribeye steak has defied this myth and made me a believer in the wet aging process. Although I do enjoy a good dry-age steak like from Envy (in Las Vegas), the wet age steak prepared at Del Frisco had an extremely flavorful and juicy steak that I found to be the best ribeye steak I have every tasted.   With my frequent trips to Vegas, I used to like to try out a new steak house for each trip. Now, my future Vegas trips will alway include a visit to Del Frisco's!

63cwrEkyb95ppvgqwY1fZA.text: Delicious.  The fillet mignon is outstanding, as are the crab cakes.  Our server was spot on.  The interior is very classic steakhouse, all dim lighting and dark woods.  Very nice.  This was my wife's birthday dinner and they went all out to make the evening special, including a card signed by the staff and a free taste of their amazing lemon cake dessert.  Del Frisco's is off the Strip (thankfully) and well worth the trip.  Recommended!

4CuEyOBzQA4CjetbN1Y0Jw.text: The best steak dinner I have ever eaten.  From the service and dirty martinis to my steak and sides I only wish I had more clients to take here for dinner.

MGUKp0txzkhZO8n3He1DrQ.text: Great atmosphere, great service, excellent drinks!!  Steaks were tender but over seasoned... The lemon cake was amazing!!  I give it 3 stars and O

H0IdPQadfo-VGORVlbQjTA.text: This place is soooooo good!  I cannot wait to go back.  The price is on par with other steakhouses like Ruth's Chris but it is a notch above.  The steak and shrimp were great!  So was the wine!  The wine list is so extensive.  I just got a glass of the malbec but the wine ranges up to $20,000 a bottle!  I topped my meal off with a glass of Dolce dessert wine which although it was $35 for a shot, it was sooooo good.  I cannot wait to go back!

Ourg8AEbU4FUF1mh6-lxOQ.text: My favorite steakhouse hands down.  The steaks are the most flavorful out of all the steak houses I've been to and the service is up to par.  The staff is unassuming and take great care of you.  This is a great place to go out with a big group.  I've always had a great time at Del Frisco's.

VD2SaUxhg8fgBEOTQlRyww.text: Wow!Wow,! What can I say with my mouth full great service, great food.Best steak I have had in years! Just came from iffel tower and spent $500.00 dollars does not hold a candle to this place. I will be back.

ENDweFaK3h_ljNfX32OEog.text: The Steak Here is one of the best I have ever tasted.   I had made a reservation and we arrived about 15 Mins early and sat at the Busy bar for a pre-dinner drink.   The Bartender was really friendly and mixed me an excellent Gin & Tonic,   We were seated promptly and our Waitress Pam was so warm and friendly that we felt very welcome.   My Lettuce Wedge starter was very Good and my wife's Shrimp cocktail equally tasty.   Our Steaks came and the waiter immediatly cut into the middle and shone a torch onto them to ensure that they were cooked perfectly (they were). The 3 Side dishes (Mashed potatoes, Sauted onions, Mixed Vegetables) we had ordered were so enormous that we couldn't finish them.   We had absolutely no room for dessert but they did look delicious.   The combination of fabulous food and great service made this visit a very happy one. Highly recommended.

sU4ljP8yWSSlmkCUDNyYgA.text: Service was great, steaks were good quality as expected for this being Del Frisco and at the price - but the steaks were so over seasoned to be almost inedible about half way through. We scraped it off as well as we could but decided not to send it back and ruin a lovely evening out. We wouldn't go back - or to another Del Frisco for that matter. We will stick with the gold standard: Peter Lugar in NYC.

zHABmUpI-Y8JhhPVxZHzsw.text: this place was awful.  the lettuce tased like it had been gathered onthe Monorail.  the wine was over priced and under aged.  the dressing tasted like it came with a kids meal at MacDonald s.  What a let down.  Will never repeat.  I have bought steakat the local meat market cooked on our grill and it was better. FORGET IT. YMMV.  We won't be back especially with the other choices within a mile.

DAvtlBg4D-odWHsrSaYX1Q.text: I've been dying to eat here for years and tonight we finally made it happen. It was everything I'd hoped it would be and more. What a great place to celebrate our anniversary. Our server and his team were very attentive. We started with the bacon appetizer, holy pig, it was ginormous and absolutely delicious! It had a black pepper crust but the sauce was a little sweet so the balance was very nice. Next we shared the wedge salad, it was good but the blue cheese was a little more tangy then we normally like. I'd probably try a different salad next time. For dinner I ordered the special, trio of filet medallions. Three 4 oz filets, one with baked brie, one with crab/asparagus/bernaise, one with truffle butter and shrimp. It was $65 and worth every dollar. My husband had the ribeye and baked potato. Since it was our anniversary they brought out a complementary slice of lemon cake. The best lemon cake we've ever had!  I can't really think of anything negative about our experience tonight. I definitely have my eye on a few things I'd like to try next time but I'll order that trio again for sure!

Zfe8P-Ba_fVw6nlfUlEwiA.text: We got there about 9 PM Informed our server that we needed to To be at the show by 11 PM with travel time. This place off the beaten path or off the strip as they would say. Service really stands out here all your needs are addressed without even asking for.The food top quality, We start with the shrimp cocktail, Caesar salad, roasted chicken in a brown sauce with corn very good, boneless ribeye medium cooked perfectly not over salty either, Cream of corn highly,mashed potato just like you make it home very good Cream of corn highly recommend mashed potato just like you make it home very good. We ordered The butter cake, and cheesecake with strawberry not a big fan of strawberry but The strawberries work with this one,but the butter cake  is one of the best desserts I've had. The room itself comfortable and elegant piano playing in the background by someone who knows how to play piano. Enjoyable and rememberable will be back. We made it to the show with time to spare..... Argentine cowboys Boston ma......

wLqbPW5RLapBw1p6Y1YM7g.text: I took my wife for her Birthday and we had ribeye and Au gratin Potatoes and crab cake and Cesar salad.  The food was excellent! Most of all, the service was so amazing!  Roland our server was so friendly and very professional.  We were treated like we are regulars at the restaurant.  They even gave us a complimentary desserts that was out of this world! Overall,  I highly recommend  Del Frisco's for any celebrations or just to enjoy the great food and great friendly staff!

EycG2YwBMnS9c5bmcIrJkw.text: Waited way past our reservation but they hooked our group up with free drinks and an amazing room so that made up for it fantastically. Service was amazing.  Crab cakes are mind blowing. Lobster mashed potatoes, also mind blowing. Mushrooms were great. Beer and wine selection were awesome.   The 3 stars is because my steak was WAY over cooked. I ordered the prime, dry ribeye medium rare and it came medium well. The really strange thing is that the EXACT same thing happened to me at Del Friscos in New York around 3 months ago. Since this was the second time it happened at another Del Friscos clear across the country I thought maybe that's just how they cook their medium-rare steaks, way over done lol. I know it sounds dumb, but what are the freaking chances. But after powering through 1/3 of my dry steak with almost no pink in the middle I tried my buddy's (he ordered the exact same steak) and his was amazing. I know we ordered them exactly the same because I ordered mine and then he literally said "I'll have the same steak, cooked the same way." Lol Mine was toasted, his was perfect.   I just don't understand how a steakhouse can over-cook one of their best quality steaks. You're a freaking steakhouse. After trying my buddy's I asked the server to look at my steak and tell me what he would call it. He paused for a second and said, "Medium rare when it came out, but we serve on a very hot plate and it continues to cook a little." Lmao, but my buddy's, which was supposed to be exactly the same was dramatically different. It was a little annoying that he tried to hide the mistake but I was buzzed and didn't want to make a big deal in front of my guests so I just smiled and let them trash the rest of my steak.   So anyway, that's too many ruined steaks for me. That will probably be the last time I dine at a Del Friscos.

WXSXXWQ6ElU3k-lNiO6g_w.text: Let's get right to it.  I made a reservation over a month in advance for my mans 40th and we were sat at a table that was located directly in front of the kitchen door so every waiter, bus person & manager could walk by us all evening long. This wasn't pleasant and insanely noisy with all the plates of food going by over our heads.   As the restaurant filled up quickly on a Sat night we decided to order some drinks to help the unfortunate seating location. The VIP (SVEDKA Clementine & pineapple) was fantastic, one of the smoothest drinks I've ever had and my man enjoyed his Bacon & Barrel (Bacon-washed Bacardi 8, maple syrup & angostura).   The house sesame French bread was toasty & fresh served with soft butter.   The classic caesar salad was good with croutons made from the house bread but Del's salad was disappointing. Mixed greens just like from your local grocery store with a couple tomatoes and some shaved carrots. The goddess dressing was bland and the only thing good about this salad was the bacon on top. I have to admit that the caramelized bacon was really great.  The shrimp cocktail was the best thing we tasted that evening and I really enjoyed the unique way it was plated. The shrimp were meaty, large and fresh.   So now to the star of the show, the 24 oz prime porterhouse with truffle butter. By the looks of it...it's so beautiful! We ordered a medium steak as we always do and we were served raw steak. Not even a hint of pink but just straight up red inside. I told the lady cutting it up that the meat was raw after she cut me a portion from the right of the bone and of the left. She took my two pieces back and told us she'd be back with all of it in a few mins. A manager came by shortly after and apologized and said they would send over another lobster mac & cheese so everything was warm when our meat came back out. None of this was a big deal as shit happens but a few mins later the steak was brought back to us and one of the pieces that she cut for me was MIA. I asked what happened to it and her response was that the steak shrunk since it had to be cooked longer. Well we all know what happens to meat but it doesn't magically disappear and completely shrink away. So our meat still wasn't medium because it was only gone for a few mins and the plates given to us were on fire. They did say to be careful because they were hot but towards the end of the meal I pushed my plate away since it was too close to me and burned my finger. I had a blister 10 minutes later. My man did the same thing and I cannot believe anyone would serve plates that could burn you. We didn't finish the meat and barely touched the lobster mac & cheese. Over it at this point. When the server came over to clear our plates she said "ouch these plates are hot, let me send someone else over to grab them". She couldn't do them herself and most likely burned her hand as well.   Complimentary dessert was sent our way for his birthday but we just wanted to leave. I chose this place because we hadn't tried it before and it has great reviews. Unfortunately our experience wasn't typical and if the steak didn't come out raw it would have most likely been a much better overall experience. I could have dealt with the bad table, bland salad and missing steak but not with the plates on fire that burned our fingers.   For the record our server did take off $25 from the check. Not sure if it was for the missing piece of steak or our burns?

7DEhA8k3HNHLPUygwkqQ6A.text: It was kinda weird walking in. Did not feel very welcomed but the food was the best I have had in vegas. Hands down

RwPh7Lqc0AXWXIM4b7vPfQ.text: First Yelp of 2016!  I have been dying to try Del Frisco's ever since I heard of their Tomahawk. A little disappointed, rating should be between 3.5-4.  Reservation was easy to make. Came in a little early, but they would not seat us until the exact time even though it was pretty empty. Service was pretty on point, always refilled water and cleaned the table.  Parking was free.  Make sure you check out the 007 wine table. Pretty awesome.  The Franc - $45 - Good red wine. One of the cheaper bottles they have on their wine list.   Bread and Butter - Complementary. Bread was light and fluffy. Butter was so soft and creamy.   Steak Tartare - $17 - Nicely seasoned but the meat was cut terribly. There were thick chunks of meat and did not chew well. Had boiled eggs instead of the raw egg.   Sauteed Mushrooms - $11.50 - Cooked well but flavor was just ok.  Lobster Mac & Cheese - $18 - Good cheese sauce. Lobster meat was mixed throughout.   Chateau Potatoes - $12 - Gross - Worst potato dish I have ever had at a steak house. Thick brick of mush.  Tomahawk Wagyu Ribeye - $90 - Seasoning was pretty good. Char was nice. The foot long bone is pretty epic. Asked for medium rare. Some pieces were border line mooing. We had 4 on the table and all were the same. Pretty crappy cooking if 4 medium rares came out super under.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 007 Table!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 007!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom!

M9COiqlsFbe-MYifDrPE4g.text: My husband's office holds their annual holiday party at Del Frisco's so while I've never dined on my own, I always enjoy my group experience here. This year was no exception.   The service is always top notch and super gracious. Even with a large group of people, I've never felt like I was either an inconvenience or irritation to the servers. The food served as a group menu isn't an afterthought as with most events. I usually order the same thing every year: the house salad, filet mignon, creamed spinach, lobster macaroni and cheese and cheesecake for dessert.   The house salad is strangely simple yet delicious. The best part is the super crispy slices of bacon on top. Del Frisco's does steak well, so if you're a meat eater you need to order the beef above anything else that may be offered (the chicken and fish are both tasty, but nothing is a great as the steak). The sides are good but not memorable and are your standard steakhouse fare. The cheesecake is my favorite dessert here too -- ask for it with extra berries!   The restaurant's atmosphere is swanky and old school. The place is appointed in lots of dark wood and there's a pianist in the bar. At Christmastime, the restaurant takes on an even more cozy look with strands of twinkling white lights.  Nobody looks forward to attending their spouse's office holiday party, but call me crazy because I do! And it's all because of the venue.

IsYX2niXgEMIYElZ_web4w.text: Had my bachelors party dinner here w/ my groomsmen and other buddies. Impeccable service by the staff. Especially our waiter Marcelo who went above and beyond to make sure everything was right.   As for the food, side dishes such as: lobster mac and cheese, onion rings, potatoes au gratin, and beef carpaccio were amazing. All our steaks were cooked perfect and tasted amazing. I ordered the tomahawk ribeye.. my god, that was sooooooo yummy!  To sum it all up, Del Frisco's never disappoints. Easily one of the best restaurants I've ever been to!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak aka foodgasm

BWsJe9tWIIqA3pR1rHdOfw.text: I'm going to hope this restaurant just had an off-day.  Came here on a Wednesday night. I ordered the Bone-In Prime Ribeye 22 oz medium-rare. The crust was extremely burnt..really strong burnt flavor. The steak was cooked medium but that's besides the point.  I was SO DISAPPOINTED but I was also hungry. I ate half of it and told our waiter. He offered to make a new one which was nice but I felt bad cause I already had eaten half the steak..so that's my fault I guess.   Another disappointment was my old-fashioned. The old-fashioned I got was one of the sweetest old-fashioned I've tried. There was way too much sugar! Not sure if they used sugar cubes or just dumped a bunch of sugar in. The drink had no balance. Maybe I'm too used to trying it at Whiskey bars but I expect better from a place like this.  Thick Cut Bacon Au Poivre as an appetizer: bacon was really thick but the texture was a bit too chewy. Sauteed Wild Mushrooms & Pearl Onions was whatever as a side. I wouldn't order it. I got a corn dish as a side and that was delicious!   A huge positive was that our server was attentive and helpful..and drinks came out extremely fast.  Overall, for the amount I paid for, I expected it a lot better. I really hope they were just having an off day for us :/ not sure if I'd come back though...

LB2CLY7uWOLPTai4kkCQ4A.text: By far the juiciest prime ribs I've ever had!  Medium-well served with a truffle butter, just how I like it. The crab cake is all crab, no fillings and is absolutely pure goodness! The servers are great and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium-well prime rib with truffle butter.

61RgMIkxoEsLqTP9kOl9fg.text: One of the best steakhouses I have been to. My wife and I always set aside some time on our trips to Vegas to come here. It is off strip but you still get a lot of out of towners here. They are a chain but this is definitely no Outback. Prices are comparable with any high-end steakhouse. Attire is business casual but feel free to dress up. You will not be out of place. All of the food is amazing. The crab cakes, Del's salad, tomatoes and burrata, and the 45 day aged prime ribeye are my personal favorites. Steaks are always cooked to the right temperature and taste like perfection. The sides are amazing especially the creamed corn and maque choux if they have it. Desserts have always been stellar and the drinks...the drinks are stiff and well worth it. Try the old fashioned or any of their specialty cocktails. The atmosphere is very old school and the service is what you would expect from a five star establishment. When I am in another city with Del Frisco's, it is going to be my first stop. Easy five stars.

zvQEuAlu-ay46PdBNr5Ygw.text: Delicious and Amazing service!!! Very thoughtful staff left us a Happy Anniversary card in our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aIwS_MOAY50O_kJojUQCjg.text: Had dinner with a group of 9..Seating was a bit slow, but once we got seated Morgan, our server just killed it...Excellant food, and the most gorgeous server in Vegas... What more can you ask??

7-0MCXK_Gpm2-Mv6GSNceg.text: Just what you would expect. Great food good service and great steaks. Steaks were great. Good for large or small groups. Tip... don't be the guy having to pay

BwL8lGWMTdP39K20oKXh9Q.text: Delicious meal!  We had a large party and everyone was pleased. Great steaks, wine and service.

j4OEH5ppA2hb1qtz9OcAOg.text: Very nice staff, super attentive & thorough. Excellent wine list.. love the live pianist. It's real sets the mood. Quick service, I made reservations & the wait was no longer than 5 minutes. Great experience, can't wait to go back!

N8L-yIjS2pvSJrDMFAuCiA.text: This place was easily one of the best steakhouses I've been to in a long time. Mouth watering tenders steaks, flavorful side, and service beyond compare. I'm just leaving and can't wait to eat here again!

_rX9FAW_XYN-PdGsUXsJBQ.text: I love everything about this place , from the bar to the jellybeans you get on the way out. Ribeye is fantastic, spinach super delicious, the crabcake is full of big crab lumps. Wine has a killer selection and they know how to make a cocktail. They even have a cigar patio !!!!!!!!!!!

w8KmoOVhdTD0zCnXYnyCbw.text: Ummmm so after a loooong drive to the Vegas, was craving a good steak like grand Vegas style... So was yelping away to try good new steak house other than chains like Ruth chris and Flemings.   Saw del frisco was popular.  Although I called one hour prior to their open time, they were able to let me rsvp for 645pm...  Errr I should have known and stopped right thurr!!   Usually good steak house and u calling on weekends, they are completely booked esp if u book in last minute.. I should have known...-__-  The restaurant was located away from the strip and had plenty of parking spots...  Ordered fried calamari as appetizer.  It was good, but how can you go wrong with fried food that's drenched in Thai sweet chili sauce....  Ok to the steak.  Decided to try tomahawk ribeye for first time!  Been wanting to try for a long time and thought this was it!   U r in Vegas and why not? Esp after looooong hard work week!  D-i-s-s-a-p-o-i-n-t-m-e-n-t....  It was the worst 90 dollar steak I ever had in my life...   The taste was so blend...  I needed some kim chi right away -__-   Only had four bites and got rest to go... How can u waste 90 dollar steak.. And the sauteed mushroom was not that great either.... I feel as the Yelp reviews for this restaurant is biased..  I wonder if people came here to eat after they are drunk so their taste bud is biased or seems like lotta fobs wrote reviews here... They need to go try different steak house in America... Errrr...  Sorry about the bad review.. But was soooooooooo disappointed... If you are spending over 150 dollars just on food, I expect the food to be better-

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

HftyrgxfMtFzgjUxuLuTPQ.text: The service doesnt get any better than Del Friscos.  If you want to Get romantic and take your lady out for a nice date look no further.    I really like the service and the nice and chill atmosphere at Del Friscos.    The taste of vegas had me rushing to make my appointment to this jewel.  I ordered filet mignon and lt was umm good.    I did get pumped by some of the reviews so maybe my expectations were to high because it didnt top the my chart for best steak, but it was good. We selected a side of sauteed mushrooms and potatos.  The sides were ok as well.  For desert we had cheesecake, and it wasumm not good.   Overall i would recommend this restaurant if you like good treatment, good food, and good ambience which all equals a good time!

qXqxlO8wRiCvYWs6s2HSgw.text: We attended a corporate Christmas party at Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House. It was a wonderful place for a party and food was delicious. I had lobster macaroni and cheese as a side dish (needs to be shared by two) and lamb as an entree. It was both prepared with perfection. The lamb was served with the right tenderness and seasoning. You can taste the lobster in the macaroni and cheese without the cheese overpowering the dish. I tasted my friend's prime porterthouse and it was also a good choice to order. The staff was attentive and never left you with an empty glass.   The only reason it was given four stars instead of five was due to the second wine pour had sediments floating in my wine glass and coffee grounds in my coffee cup.  The overall experience was enjoyable and highly recommended for couples, special family occasions, and corporate gatherings.

gWIDgUPpTZfToove57-eog.text: YES YES YES YES.   So I went to Vegas for my Grandma's 80th Birthday. Yeah you heard right, my grandma likes to party.   Anyway, I'd been looking forward to visiting Del Frisco's from the day I found out we were going. I'd been going over what I would get - what entree, what appetizer, etc etc. Let me tell you, it did not disappoint.   Here's what I ordered:  - Double eagle bone in prime strip  - sauteed mushrooms - asparagus - lobster macaroni and cheese   I also got to try some of the shrimp scampi from my mom's plate.   What a feast! Let me tell you, that steak was well worth the $60 or however much it is. It was humongous but it was so full of flavor and it was so moist. The food was pretty much amazing. However, I wasn't too keen on the salad that came with the meal. I ordered a Caesar salad and I think the cheese was just a little too sharp for my taste. Whatever, it's a freaking steak house! I don't care about the salad! I can't really say much else about the food, other than I was really diggin' it.   I also have to mention the service at this place. It is definitely second to none. Our server was so nice and helpful, we even recruited him to take a bunch of pictures of our family and he helped us out without even skipping a beat and was really nice about it.   Del Frisco's was definitely the right place to go and splurge a little bit and have a really good time with some really good eats. I will definitely come out here again when I've got a hankering for a meat coma.

Trsftn9iL1RMoEML7MWtaA.text: This place is a classic.  Wife and I meet up with some friends from out of town and wanted to do it up right and this was the place.  We requested to sit outside so we could smoke cigars. Although they got rid of the smoking lounge they have large commercial heaters and thick drapes to block the wind.   I split the bone-in rib eye which was great! The lobster mac and cheese was great, DON'T split his with anybody! Hog it for yourself, you won't be disappointed.   Nice wine selection without breaking the bank.    The patio are also includes an area with some couches by a fireplace which allows for a less formal atmosphere if you just wanted to drop in for a drink, app, and cigar.

yhykCY0e--NUX-iutyg3xw.text: We made reservations for my hubby's birthday dinner and it was everything I had remembered from a few years ago.  The service was excellent and the food amazing!  Their steaks are cooked to perfection.  They even prepared my hubby's charred medium rare.  Most restaurants either won't do that or try and fail.  The shrimp cocktail was delicious and their desserts to die for!  Can't decide if I like the lemon cake or chocolate souffle better.  Try the coffee it is amazing too.  Our waiter recommended the creamed spinach and I was a little hesitant to order it.  I'm sure glad I took his recommendation!  Wow it was so delicious!  They treated my hubby so well and made his birthday dinner memorable!  Oh and don't forget to grab a VIP drink from the bar before you are seated.  The bartender is fun and on top of things.  Can't wait to dine here again!

o5fD31ReEnW6njZ1_eCUjg.text: Great place for steaks.  Walking in, I have to admit I felt like we brought the average age down a bit... First thing we see is a bar, full of 40 and 50 somethings all hangin out...   Anyway, eventually got to our table,and was greeted by our coach, I mean, waiter.  I don't remember his name, but when he was letting us know about the specials, he was pacing back and forth as if we were heading out to the Superbowl, or maybe even war...  I began to think that as we were ordering, they had a script of sorts that he HAS to follow?  His response to my ordering the medium rare prime rib, "pink in the middle, and warm all the way through".  The same for everyone else who had their steak the same... and whatever other variations other people had... By the 5th or so echo.... I started to get annoyed, but whatever.  The pink, and warm all the way through was juicy, and melt in your mouth wonderful... Definitely one of he best steaks I've ever had...  Oh, by the way... The James Bond table?  Didn't realize what it was.  Just walked by it as were leaving.  Halogen bulbs focused right onto the wine bottles?  Aren't most wine cellars supposed to be climate controlled?

qYtiLfqyUXg1g4J72QjTGA.text: Was recommended by a coworker to this restaurant. First impression was very good. The place looked clean somewhat old fashioned. The food was good the steak was very tender. The thing that really stood out was the service. All the staff was friendly. We were there to celebrate my girls birthday so the entire staff signed a card wishing her a great birthday which was a nice detail. Our server Heather is who deserved the 5 stars she was very attentive and funny. She recommended a few things to enhance our meal which were right on! I Would defiantly recommend this place to anyone and look forward to going back when we are in town.

YhCakb6cAK349zd1onK_AA.text: I've had premium steak in many places.. BOA, STK, etc and all I can say is holy cow this place knows how to cook and serve the best! It came perfectly cooked.. Like I don't know they can cook it so perfect cooked. It was like eating hot strips of mouth watering butter. The filet came perfectly seasoned and tender. The lobster tail came beautifully arranged, tasted good but missed the tenderness it usually has with warmed butter. They should serve it with butter but they didn't. Service was fun and quick after we got the order in. Only gripe is location which isn't close to the strip. No question get the filet mignon!!

8DkonN2gtXDKJ0WkI1_LPw.text: Service was great. Filet excellent. Lobster Mac and Cheese is well worth it. Lamb chops was a let down, because the double chops were uneven in size. Thus they were cooked unevenly.  The larger chops came out great. Unfortunately, they char broil the frenched chop so the bones were covered in black char that got everywhere.   If I came back I would see if they could broil my lamb chops without char.  The cocktails were yummy.  The piano clashed with the piped in rock music. We would've preferred just the piano, but we could see how others want the energy of the piped in music.

CluU2Pv5Ybo1iGu2OoaEFg.text: I was a little worried going in because I've read good reviews about other restaurants from fellow Yelpers and came away unimpressed but everything I read about Del Frisco's was True.  This place is amazing!  My friends and I called for a reservation the day of and did not have a problem getting a table considering it was a Friday night.  We waited only a few minutes after getting there before we were seated at our table.  They have the most professional staff working here, our server, JP, was so attentive and answered any question we had about the menu and even recommended which steak I should try.  I ended up ordering the 22 oz. bone-in rib eye cooked medium and it was the best piece of meat I have ever had.  I'm sure you're thinking I'm exaggerating but I'm not, this steak was THAT good.... the real deal.  And it made me feel a little better knowing that my $50 was well spent.  Everything else was just a bonus.  We had a slice of the lemon cake which was good but a little too sweet for me.  It was more than enough for five people.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  I highly recommend Del Frisco's to anyone willing to try it.  Who cares about the price... you only live once.  I can't wait to go back, my mouth waters just thinking about it....

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 oz. bone in ribeye

BtdqTErMCjvrQxKmBlJ7Uw.text: As a professional steak eater, I've been to my share of up-scale steak restaurants.  This one is middle of the pack, could have been a bit higher but.. I'll get there. Went Sat night before Superbowl.  The good. The steaks are top grade and cooked well. Well seasoned too. The atmosphere is classy steak joint, although the lights and ambience could be refined a bit more.  Our server was great, us 3 dudes, giving her a good ribbing, and she was fun and engaging. But that's about all that was good.  The bad. After being seated very close to our ressy time (8:30) we quickly ordered wine and then shortly after, dinner. The wine and tasty bread came, but no dinner.. Still waiting.. and still... 45 min later. We even had to ask our server what the hold up was and we rarely complain. I would expect this if we were on "Island Time"  in the caribbean. But this is Vegas and not acceptable.  I got the bone-in fillet which was very tasty, as were the other steaks at the table. But, the sides, grilled asparagus and garlic mushrooms, left much to be desired. Seems like not much care went into preparing these dishes, aside from dosing them with copious amounts of salt.   Overall for the price, which was quite steep, I expect more. I've had much better dining experiences at steak joints for less then $600 (our bill for 3).  For that price, the experience needs to be grade A, top shelf, not  run of the mill average.. I won't be back.

QlziCk4MR-gbnhquvYp2KA.text: We typically come here when we are in town and needing a nice steak.  My wife and i went over the XMAS holidays and had another great meal.  The steak...what else can you say, but cooked perfectly to a medium rare liking for me.  We added the drawn truffle butter as recommended by our waiter.  The ceasar salad with anchovies was perfect, the lettuce was very fresh with no brown edges and the anchovies make the salad perfect to my liking.  We had a nice bottle of Silver Oak cab and had sauteed mushrooms and potatoes for the sides.  The service is what you would expect at this type of restaurant, not too pushy or trying to hurry you to order.  But tentative enough to make sure your water or wine glass is never empty.    We have eaten hear many times and never had any complaints, the service is what keeps us coming back.

JqmLREwnz-XegfTbClY-ZQ.text: Being hungover all day and eating a steak sucked. Meat was delicious.

Yhv2wtuIn9tnTZzHMYR1LA.text: By far one of the best steakhouses I have ever been to hands down. I took advantage of their participation in restaurant week to try them out and was not disappointed by anything. The food, service and ambiance were all five stars. Most of the time, I feel high end steakhouses are over hyped and I leave disappointed. However, Del Frisco's went above and beyond of not only meeting my expectations, but exceeding them.   My personal recommendations are the filet mignon which one could cut with a fork, the crab cake which is by far the best crab cake I have ever had ever and the baked potato is nothing short of awesome as well. Definitely looking forward to my next excuse to go back.

2_VlzJxSg0t8N0XpRiim8w.text: As good as you could ever expect! Osters, Bread, Steak, Crabcakes, Mac & Cheese..Check., 4 of us left there will full belly's and not a morsel left on a plate! Great solid drinks from the bar as well. This is not your Hotel/ Casino Steakhouse. True pride and perfection when it comes to service and food quality!

-f-7YA8s-ZgxGtonHJKvBA.text: Have been here many times and service has never been an issue.   We had a friend in town so decided to drop by for some drinks and steaks. The boys both got the prix fixe and I opted to nosh on tartare to start with and crab cakes for my main.   First flag: ordered a bottle of wine, it arrived before water for the table. Second flag: my tartare app arrived before the boys' salads (so we ended up sharing the tartare, NBD) Third flag: as the empty tartare plate was being cleared, the boys' steaks arrive!  So we were all confused. Where were their salads? Flagged down the server, he offered to bring the steaks back out to the table after salads were finished. Friend decided to hang on to his steak, hubby opted to send it back to kitchen and eat salad first.  Fourth flag: Hubby got his steak and asked for kosher salt on side (med-rare steak with no seasoning, we've learned from our many trips here that they over-salt for our taste buds even if we ask them to go light, so we ask for no seasoning). What he got was an overcooked steak (we all thought they were going to re-cook his steak instead of keeping it under the heat lamps) and a bowl of morton's table salt. Of course, by this time, our friend had already finished his steak. Hubby didn't send his steak back since we didn't want to make our friend wait.  Fifth flag: on top of all the missteps, the server had the nerve to try to up sell desserts and after dinner drinks while my husband was still eating! Dude, do you have a brain? Don't try to rush us out after you were the one who messed things up!  Needless to say, we won't be back. Will have to find another place to take our friends to when they come in town.

7n55racY6CNShXydvnqcVg.text: This place was delicious.  I had a bone in rib eye or something forgot the name that was on the menu.  There special potatoes which are cheesy and gooey.  Asparagus and something else.  Crab cake was bomb.  The oysters were good and fresh and the king crab legs were awesome.  I love the service here, everyone was friendly and fun and playful when engaged.  For Dessert I had the Mousse I believe it was, maybe I'll upload pictures.  It was TDF.  My friend got the lemon cake to take home for his bday wish I would have tasted that.   Supposed to be really good.  The lounge singer was a little cheesy but overall great place. Sorry for lack of details but I waited two weeks to write this.

ktIAqTUrJQPa2QPucJWEWA.text: Del Frisco is always my choice of steakhouse over Ruth Chris and Morton. One of my meal has to be in Del Frisco when I was in business trip at Vegas, one of the reason is because they don't have a branch in the Los Angeles area and the bigger reason was their Stone Crab Claws.   It is obvious the meat quality between Ruth Chris, Morton and Del Frisco are pretty much the same, the major difference would be the use of spices, how accurate was the steak degree of doneness, seafood choices and the quality of side dishes in my opinion. I prefer my steak with heavier seasonings and Del Frisco really satisfied my preference. They never mess up my steak doneness(Ruth Chris and Morton both screwed up once). That shows me chefs with high level skill quality were behind the kitchen door.   Jumbo stone crab claw is a must try at Del Frisco, the mouthwatering claws cook perfectly as it locks in their sweet, delicate flavor. Even their side dishes were excellent. I always like sauteed mushroom and angel hair pasta. Very simple side dishes but they were perfected with the right seasonings and cooking skill.   Highly recommended for anyone who wants to experience high quality steaks dinner. Remember to leave some room for their desserts too.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Praline Parfait
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye

BnQXBZygrVi6FOI_NEGsvQ.text: So, I was here for a conference and we had a pri-fixed menu.   Upon entering, I was greeted by a very VERY VERY unpleasant rancid odor. I was on the verge of just turning around and going home if I wasn't interested in hearing the speaker at the conference.  I mean WOW!  I was almost knocked out!  I gave them the benefit of the doubt that the kitchen didn't smell like that!  Once we sat down, the waiters brought over two loaves (yes, LOAVES) of sesame bread.  Let me tell you, I LOVED IT... I pretty much ate one entire loaf by myself.  It was very soft and pillow-y with a touch of chewy crust.  Definitely something you have to try if you don't care about counting carbs.  For the appetizer, they brought out grilled shrimp with two types of sauces.  One was the traditional cocktail sauce and the other was a mayonnaise-based sauce (it probably had a little ketchup in it because it was pink....I know there's a name for it, but can not think of it at the moment).  A little oily for my taste (the shrimp), but it was pretty good nonetheless.  Not something that I would order if I came back, but not bad.    The salad was a miss for me.  The flavors were good, however there was a GIGANTIC glob of dressing in the middle of the plate!  They do not toss the salad for you and give waaaay too much dressing.  I should have asked for the dressing on the side like I always do, but I had forgotten to request it.  There were also two HUGE strips of bacon laid across the salad and who doesn't like bacon right?!  The bacon tasted amazing!  Too bad I was feeling guilty about eating the one whole loaf of bread earlier that I only took a small bite of the bacon....  The entree that was served was the filet mignon.  It was pretty good.  I ordered it medium rare and it came out perfectly cooked and melted in my mouth.  However, the waiters asked if the guests could cut into their filet immediately to determine if the done-ness was correct.  I found that weird and would hope that it was only a rule to guests that were in the conference and NOT for the general dining area customers!  So let me begin this paragraph by saying, the ONLY reason this place didn't get 2 stars (especially for that awful odor at the entrance and the waiters insisting of the guest cutting into the filet as they watched us) is because of the dessert that they served:  BANANA BREAD PUDDING!!!  Sounds unassuming doesn't it?  Bread pudding, what can be so amazing about that?  Well, it was one to the most HEAVENLY thing I have ever tasted in my freaking ENTIRE life!  The bread budding came out warm and drizzled with a caramel sauce that was not too outrageously sweet.  As I dug my spoon into it, I realized that there was a crust on the top.  When I took a bit into it, I fell in love.  The crust was chewy and caramelized and packed so much flavor.  Then it was followed by the softness of the rest of the bread pudding.  The banana flavor was strong, however not over-powering at all.  This dessert really worked for me.  I can't believe I would get this excited over bread pudding, but there you have it.  If you can get through the entrance without throwing up, you NEED to order the Banana Bread Pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding. Best thing I have ever eaten!!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding with caramel sauce

fLdv4AVF_H6tG07fyo8tqQ.text: I had a bone in ribeye with spinach. Very delicious. Then came the lemon cane. Soooo good. It was so delightful I brought it to thanksgiving instead of pie.

78ysIlG7HoKz5tC6bA9RqQ.text: forget ruth's chris, forget hy's, forget morton's.  del frisco's blows all of them out of the water!  and i'm not even an avid steak eater.    the atmosphere can be a bit intimidating if you're from hawaii but ask for the gm (jackie) and she'll make you feel like you're right at home.  after that, it's all clear sailing from there.  the service is top notch and very friendly.  everything is super clean, and if you're a girl, there's everything you could ever need in the bathroom (just ask the bathroom attendant).    now that i got all that semi-important stuff out the way, let's get to the fooooooood!!! omnomnomnomnom!!!  we had an order of the onion rings and i swear they were injected with steroids because they were HUGE.  but that's how i like it...my onions, that is.  i ordered the ahi (i told you, i'm not an avid steak eater) and it was faaaaaat.  perfectly seared though, and full of sweet wasabi flavor.  i had a piece of my friend's steak and even though steak is not my thing, it was deeeeelicious.  the baked potato was cooked to perfection and came with everything a baked potato could ever ask for---green onion, sour cream, real bacon bits, cheese, love.    move aside apps and entrees, dessert gets its own paragraph!!!  can i just say...ladies, you better bring an extra pair of panties.   strawberry romanoff, panty dropper!  lemon cake, panty dropper!  chocolate thing with ice cream and raspberries, panty dropper!  if you looked up the definition of decadent, there would be a picture of del frisco's desserts :)  on your way out, ask about the james bond table!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. brontosaurus meat
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gratin
