Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. demolished

lac13ejd0feWP_KjBRy2ww.text: Oh my mac! Talk about tasty.  After spending a fortnight deciding where to eat before my girlfriend went to cancer treatment in Soma, California I randomly chose Del Frisco's (After having spent 11 years driving past it). It definitely was in my top 5 decisions of all time.  The atmosphere and hospitality immediately spilled outside the restaurant, the valet Slava was rad. He made sure my Mazda was well taken care of after assuring me it would be. I love when people do what they say.   The second we walked into the lobby we were greeted by the hostesses, Anji who would later seat us, was amazing she told us how great everything was and that this place was the best. She even showed us the James Bond table and told us all the actors too. What a beauty!  Upon being sat we were given an order of bread by some behemoth of a man. I think his name was Jorgen or Xander, I don't remember I had knocked a few VIPs out by this point.  Then my steak came. I ate that thing so quick. So damn good.

alLhOSNZYi3sWdpPdkgdXQ.text: This is a difficult one due to the stellar ratings that this place gets time and time again.  i will have to say that i walked in with very high expectations.  We walked in to celebrate a reunion of sorts, from seeing a bunch of friends in Las Vegas after a long time of living in different areas of the country.  On top of that, 2 of the folks were recently promoted, and 2 more recently had kids...  The food did not disappoint, and most of the recommendations were right on the money.  here is what i enjoyed: Crab cakes were as good as people said The spinach was as good as everyone says..."bacon in every bite" We also had asparagus, lobster mac which were good, but not earth shattering. For dinner, i had split with another big eater the Wagyu Rib Eye (medium rare of course, not some other overcooked way to eat very high quality beef) - and it was excellent.  As far as the rating, i would say that it met my expectations, making it at best 4 stars, but since i knowingly went in with very high expectations due to the postings i pre-reviewed, my expectations exceeded most other places that i ever go to.  if i have to go to a nice dinner in LV, i will come here again.  The price mirrors most places that one would call "a nice restaurant".  you wont leave here on the cheap, but at the same time you wont leave feeling underwhelmed either.  you will get a great meal, with great wait staff that wont rush you out and will serve you and entertain.  The waiters did make an effort above and beyond the call of duty.  One of our group was bragging about how he "doesnt drink beverages with  fruit or vegetables" as a real man.  Amongst the guys, we all cracked up when the waiter "couldnt help it" to bring his red bull vodka with a mint leaf.  yes the rest of us gave him extra tip just for that!

JFFduTQHWHf447dTvGQlhw.text: Best steak I've ever had.  Went here based on the Yelp reviews.  Loved that it wasn't on the packed strip.  Easy to find, plenty of parking.  My bf ordered the Bone-in Rib Eye and I had the Filet Mignon.  The meat was top quality and the rub that was on the rib eye was amazing.  Our steaks were cooked a perfect medium rare.  My Filet was extremely tender and delicious.  Their sides are served family style so it's enough for a couple people to share.  We got broccoli that was cooked perfectly for a side.  I also had a baked potato which was a decent size.  For dessert we had a cheesecake that was extremely creamy.  It was slightly creamier than we would've liked, but still good.  Our server, if I remember correctly was named Lisa and she was amazing.  So friendly and gave great recommendations.  Everyone who waited on us was extremely friendly and professional.  We are definitely going back when we are in town next!  Also, our receipt came with a survey so we get $25 off our next visit!  Great deal!

WTfVhwo0AEWgiA0kTKz0RQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Great food, service, pricing. Great overall experience.  Shared a bone-in prime rib eye and chose the truffle butter sauce.  Steak arrived on a hot, buttered plate.  The rib eye was perfectly seasoned, tender and juicy.  I was literally sawing bits off the bone to get every last morsel, including the fatty bits.  The warm truffle butter sauce was amazing.  We were dipping our sesame bread into the sauce too.  The corn maque choux goes perfectly with the steak - it has a crispy, juicy texture versus the traditional creamed corn that is served at prime rib restaurants.  And the 6-layer lemon cake is enormous, moist and delicious without being overly sweet. It can be shared across your party.    Double thumbs up to Del Frisco's!

l0d5PRdAuInMLoub3bOuSA.text: After looking at reviews for a few hours on Yelp, this is where we decided to have our post-wedding dinner with our family.   The staff was all very nice, we had a wonderful waitress, and they put us in a back corner so that we had some privacy.   For starters I had a classic salad with avocado ranch dressing, and it was delicious. The veggies were all very crisp, and the avocado put a nice spin on your average ranch dressing. The salad comes with two thick pieces of bacon crossed over it, which I gave to the man and he loved them, and some big homemade croutons that were wonderful, and I very rarely like any croutons in my salad at all. It's a texture thing. Aaanyways.  The shrimp cocktail comes with BIG jumbo shrimp smothered in cocktail sauce, and it was also very fresh and tasty.  For dinner I ordered the bone in prime rib and the man ordered the bone in filet mignon. The bone in filet mignon is an off menu item, but it is INCREDIBLE. If you want it medium rare you have to order it medium because it's so thick, if you order it medium rare you'll get a rare center. It was the best steak I ever had. My steak was also delicious, and I really loved the crust on it.  For sides we had asparagus, green beans, and mushrooms. Everything was cooked perfectly, and with asparagus and green beans it really makes a difference.  For dessert we had lemon cake on the house to celebrate our new marriage. I am not a cake person at all, and i'm REALLY not a lemon cake person, but it was absolutely delicious. The cake was really light and flavorful, not sour or tart at all. We were surprised at how much we loved it.  Overall it was a great dinner and an amazing experience, we made the right choice having our wedding dinner there. Everyone had a great time, and an excellent meal, and it was the perfect ending to our special day. Thank you Del Frisco's for making such a memorable meal for us. :)

QzgtsSAQp7lRc8Mkf9k1Jw.text: It is always difficult to locate a restaurant that makes a really good tasting Steak. There are many American steak houses that are not up to my standards in terms of quality and taste such as Ruth Chris or Houston's, however Del Friscos makes ones of the best tasting states ever!  I had the bone-in-rib-eye steak (22 ounces i believe), medium  and for $49.95. The steak is extremely big, fits basically on the majority of the plate. The steak is super fresh, delivered from the ranch every 2 weeks and never frozen. The steak doesn't need any steak sauces as the the pepper and the nature taste of the steak of more than sufficient. I would recommend getting some sides such as the mushrooms, potatoes etc...  Their famous drink made at the restaurant is their pineapple vodka. the pineapple is aged for a few weeks with vodka. The 5 ounces is very smooth and strong.  This place is a great place to eat after a dance, a Broadway show, a classy party etc.. Its a real classy, high end place :)

xWtcttvUNAUrNiZFxJJO5w.text: Been here a couple times and am now writing a review.  Went here with the gf and we split the 32oz rib eye.  We asked for medium rare and it came out on the verge of rare.  Was great and super huge.  Beyond that we also had the creamed spinach and mac and cheese.  Both sides were outstanding.  Especially worth note was the creamed spinach which was just out of this world.  Drinks were strong and delicious.  Service excellent.  If you are thinking you need to be super dressy for this place think again, you can be casual.  Worth a shot if you are in vegas looking for some great eats.

cZ8aMTqN0bordc02hF8IjQ.text: This place does not mess around. In addition to being an absolutely top notch steak house with amazingly good service, they always have items on and off the menu that will make you happy even if you aren't in the mood for steak. On the night I was there, they had stone crab claws and some other items you will never find on a competitor's menu.    100% legit. I think this is my favorite steakhouse of them all. No joke.

wtMLoLTYVjeneu0fcLSQxA.text: I had heard good things about this place, but it exceeding every hope I could have dreamed of.  My steak (Bone In Ribeye, medium rare) was cooked to perfection, the flavor was spectacular.   One of the others in the party got the Filet, which truly melted in your mouth.  I offered a bit of a swap for the tuna, which had an amazing ginger and wasabi spread that was not too strong, but really fit the flavor of the tuna.  The service was amazing, they were so quick with anything, and I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone, ever.  If you have the chance, go to Del Frisco's.

EIM5fh4YVsX8k2AYT5j-Gg.text: What can I say.. Osso Buco hands down the double eagle since the name is also very good. but I still like the Osso Buco roasted veal shank. Also the Oysters Rockerfeller great!! They pulled it off them menu but you can ask the chef and if he is in a good mood to make it they will!!

OMrP600AQnfW6p-OavH0BQ.text: To start, I've traveled a lot and been to a ton of steakhouses. Growing up in Las Vegas I've been to most of the steakhouses here. This one is by far my favorite. The filet is always consistent and amazing. The crab cakes are one of my favorite crab cakes also. Every time I have gone the staff is always extremely professional, friendly, and knowledgeable. I don't understand why people complain about he prices. It's a phenomenal steak house. Obviously it'll be a little pricey. You get what you pay for. If you aren't willing to spend money on a steakhouse dinner then obviously this restaurant isn't for you. They also have an AMAZING happy hour!

oMMpanaP9EWyNTAXiK0rtA.text: i came here for valentines day with my boyfriend and we had reservations. when we arrived, they told us that they were running behind. me and my boyfriend waited an hour to be seated. we had another engagement that we had reservations for after dinner! that was outrageous to wait an hour even though we showed up ahead of time for our reservation! even after that, we were just hoping the food would be the savior of the night. it wasn't. they sat us on a small circle table that was wobbly with a cheap white cloth over it. for the upscale look and the prices on their menu, you would think they can afford something nicer? apparently not. i ordered a salad to start off and i told the waitress that i was allergic to tomatoes and to not have them in my house salad i ordered. i also wanted extra crispy bacon and cesar dressing instead of the dressing it came with. when it arrived my bacon wasn't extra crispy and there were no avocados.  even though i had been told there were avocados in the salad. my waitress was nowhere to be found so i had told a waiter that passed by what was wrong with my order and he said he would go fix it. when he came back, tomatoes were in my salad, and the dressing wasn't a cesar dressing, and there were still no avocados. when the waitress finally came around i told her that my salad was wrong the first time and that i had just gotten a new salad and there are still things wrong with it. she told me that the dressing is an avocado dressing and they don't have actual avocados to put in my salad, even though she told me it had avocados in it. i told her i didn't want the salad and that i would just want my filet mignon i ordered. the filet wasn't tender. and it didn't have any real seasoning. it was a little dry and a little tough. usually when i order a filet, it is easily cut like butter. this one wasn't. the only good thing there was the lemon cake. it was extremely good. however, a lemon cake will not keep me coming back. they have lousy customer service that is worse than there food.

P435B9ji-Fhn3-Yz5mu1xw.text: Wanting to do a great dinner off the strip, Yelp brought me here! This is a man's man steakhouse.  A cigar store, t.v. screens with the baseball playoffs in most of the restaurant.  But it also had that nice clubby feel.  As a girl, I wasn't turned off by all the man trappings.  Our server was spectacular, well versed in the menu and sensitive to our time issues (a concert).  The starters, side dishes and desserts are all done family style.  Hubby said that his NY Strip was the best he's had.  I tasted it, seasoned and JUICY.  My fillet was great.   Definitely a great place to come and get away from the feeling that you are in Vegas.

MGzio8HTK7MQsIPDI3GNSg.text: First the good...the service....five stars...if you include the manager Jackie, who my friends think walks on water, probably seven stars...  Second, the food- all above average, steaks good not great , sides very good and of course the Lemon cake very good but nothing more than four stars and that is being generous...  So where is the issue...THE WINE....are your frigging kidding me...this list was put together by some pistol pack'n flunky from deep inside the Del Frisco headquarters...they don't allow corkage yet within their limited wine selection they feature- Educated Guess- a red wine for the Bev Mo crowd...and I am sure Del Frisco can pick it up for about $6 a bottle and they sell for $15 a glass...and that is one of the more thoughtful choices on the -by the glass- menu...absolutely shameful...it killed the whole experience for me and if you like wine with your meal it will kill it for you as well..

8dSRh0dHxrJdkkKTBmTgRw.text: After a wonderful girls night out with my mom and sister we decided to pop in to Del's for some apps and drinks. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the lovely Joann and Trish. They made our meal of VIP martinis (amazing by the way....fresh pineapple infused vodka chilled straight up with an orange twist), ribeye, petite filet oscar style, asparagus, skillet potatoes and potatoes au gratin that much more enjoyable (who knew that was possible).   We ended up tucking our knees up and practically rolling out the door because we were so full but very happy. Will always come back to Del's for the food, drinks and fun. Now off to the gym to work off some of that tasty cow :)

PrgSEicgfPMNJpbrjQJSiQ.text: I came in for dinner last week with my boyfriend and another couple and we had one of the best meals of our lifetime! We had such a great time and ive never been on yelp but we got together last night and all we could talk about was our evening at delfriscos!! Everything was outstanding! Service was the best we've had and Catrina was awsome! We will definatly be back to see her!

eetsyT6NYktvL3AtC4FlRg.text: This place is amazing! We just wrapped our trade show and went out to celebrate! Looking for Ruth's Chris but stumbled onto this place. We weren't really dressed well enough for this atmosphere but everyone, from the valet to the manager made us feel right at home. Service was excellent and the salads, steaks and baked potatoes were incredible. Even staff just walking by our table would smile at us! I figured since we were in shorts and T Shirts we would get snubbed! Not here! This place gets 5 stars easily! It made our celebration that much better!! We will definitely make this restaurant a 'must go' on each visit to Vegas!

ig3r72h0Jqsw9P-A53PTiA.text: My husband wanted to go the best Steakhouse in Las Vegas--so I knew right where to go! It doesn't get any better than Del Frisco's...  Classy, old school, dark wood decor, paino music-- atmosphere is very romantic and sophistacted! The service here is unmatched...your waiter/waitress calls you by name and it is a very personable dining experience. Don't come to dinner with a rush to get out-- stay, relax, and enjoy the meal, the service, and the atmosphere!  The crab cakes are to die for. The Bone-In filet or ribeye will literally melt in your mouth, I can still taste the freshness of the veggies to this day!  Oh and the lobster mac n' cheese... Yum! No matter what you order you will not be disappointed. If you have a complaint about this restaurant in any way shape or form... you're just one of those people who can't be pleased!   After dining with Del Friscos--your waiter/waitress will mail you a Thank you card for dining with them. Again, an over the top (personable) experince!

Q6NYn7oxuJny_K6ROAZnMg.text: Good for happy hour, Del Frisco's is a nice location that has $6 bar food items and drinks in the lounge area. I wish the HH drink selection was larger, it only encompasses a few house liquors, 1 house special drink, and beers. All the cocktails are still full price, be careful. The burger was large and delicious, cooked to medium rare nicely. The scallops Rockefeller was 2 good sized and tasty chunks. The only underwhelming dish in the meal was the potato crisp with goat cheese. Not worth it. My burger came with more potato crisps than that whole dish order! I would like to come back again and try more bar menu foods. Nice ambiance.

dLvE-1J8VV4ug7bXq3MupQ.text: Wonderful wine selection.  (How often do you see a wine list has index pages!?)  Great open bar with very helpful bartenders.  Nice and friendly servers.  They would explain everything you need to know about the daily specials, way to cook, etc etc.  Service is superb too.  Steak quality is USDA Prime.  Perfectly cooked to the way you preferred.  They change their Steak of Today menu regularly, but you won't go wrong with either the porterhouse or ribeye which are always on the menu.  Don't forget to order cheesecake.  It is a plain cheesecake that comes with either pecan butterscotch or real strawberry sauce.  The texture is awesome and never too heavy.  I couldn't have the same quality cheesecake anywhere in SoCal.   BIG Con: They do not allow beverages/wines from outside.  That's why I subtracted 1 star from 5...  Be prepared to be charged at least double of what you will pay from outside.

C_Fu15i6t8qgPE0dmTeG7w.text: When I usually go to Vegas, we hit up the buffets and random cafes for late night munchies. It's a welcomed change to go to a nice steakhouse. The ambiance of the place is very cozy and welcoming. Dimly lit, but not too dark. The staff was very attentive, everything was done in a very timely manner.   we started off with the complimentary bread basket. warm and soft with tasty butter spread.   I ordered the 16oz rib eye and had a side of sautee mushrooms and lobster mac n cheese.   the steak was cooked perfectly to a med-rare, really tender. the 16oz was the perfect portion size before a night of drinking.   A+ on the sautee mushrooms, it was simple, but it complimented the steak very well.   the lobster mac n cheese was a bit on the salty side, but soooo good. there are bits of lobster meat and the lobster flavors really comes through the mac n cheese.   my bill came out to a bit over $50... not bad for quality food and service.

IS6MNZZhV9TqKtsAOkjQXw.text: This place is right there with Morton's,Smith & Wollensky, Ruth Chris,Mastro's and any other comparable great American steakhouse....... easily on a par with all of them . Great server Richie ( formerly worked at Gibson's in Chicago another excellent steakhouse )...... gave us excellent recommendations for appetizers,wine and sides...... everything here was GREAT ........ its one of those places that you will look forward to returning to ......

139H2joE_wnitsTCG_A4cA.text: I mainly prefer to get my prime steaks at Costco for usually $15 a piece rather than paying for overpriced steakhouses.  Del Frisco's is one of the rare exceptions.  What other place tells you to cut into the center of your steak and asks if it is to your liking?  Recommend the ribeye steak bone-in.

KwD1B-ZsQ5xeB9mlvLv7ZA.text: Visited in November 2009.  Food was excellent.  The wait staff lacked a little bit of ingenuity.  We asked to separate our alcohol from our food since a couple of us were on company tabs.  Not unreasonable since we asked for this upfront.  She flat out told us NO.  After she ran the tab, the manager came over and said we could separate the alcohol and apologized.  Umm, where were you 2 hours ago??? The food was phenomenal so it made up for their snafu.  Take the cab ride off the strip.  You won't be disappointed

ECmm4O_aPL6AnNGT3U_peA.text: The food was phenomenal! The steak was just a tad too salty but beyond that everything was awesome. We had a few waiters using the buddy system which made things soooo much easier and convenient for everyone. Our party of 11 had a wonderful time (5 of which were 4 and under). I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas!

ZyVQS0R8-xxHAyOZMXlUyg.text: My husband and I tried this place out because of the great reviews on here.  First off, the service here is wonderful.  They not only served us perfectly within the restaurant, but within a week we got a card from Del Frisco's thanking us for our patronage.  If that's not enough, we also received a Christmas card from them again this year.  I definitely feel loved as a customer.  One of the best parts of this restaurant (especially for me, because I tend to be very picky about the way my steak is cooked) is that once the steak arrives at your table, the server will cut into the steak and show you the middle to ensure that the steak has been cooked the right way.  If it's not it'll go directly back to the kitchen. Add that to the truffle butter they bring melting happily over a tealight, the steak here is heavenly.  The only reason I've docked a star from this place is because when we went, my husband's filet mignon was chewy and tough (as if it was a piece of muscle or something?).  However, when we told the waiter about this, they immediately changed his filet for a new one, which was really nice, but I do wish they had gotten it right the first time.  The sides and desserts were delicious, but not as memorable as the steak which was definitely the main star in this restaurant.  If you're visiting Vegas and hankering for a delicious piece of meat, you won't go wrong coming here.    Don't forget to ask for the truffle butter!

XCSbjwkz5cpPlQtjleUsgQ.text: Honestly, not good. Don't be fooled by the gratuitous reviews.

8bTJQQ5GRtMMWwhMn8Ymtw.text: Wygu tomahawk steak was awesome. Will be back for more.

oQzN4MbY0TbM-jlo_6GF5w.text: This is a classy establishment indeed! If you are big into wine, they have a great selection, but be prepared to pay a lot. Like most AUTHENTIC fancy steakhouses, all sides are ala carte so the meal cost adds up. With decent wine plan on $400+ for dinner for two. Without wine you can escape for probably 120 bucks or so, but what's the point of that? You don't skimp on this type of meal. The service was absolutely top notch and the sommelier knowledgeable (though he didn't look a day over 25) maybe he was just a waiter, but nonetheless knowledgeable, non-snobby, and friendly.  Oh and as a kicker, they have a nice cigar lounge with a good sized walk-in humidor.  Enjoy!

ny6d4N6IqjiUWSwK38xJRg.text: Perfect food, unbelievable service. Don't hesitate to try this steak house!

pBd4fc_103ACi-QWqmwYEQ.text: Ok... before you go... you should know that this place is where the phrase "you get what you pay for" was created.  The food here isn't cheap.... but DAMN!  I had the bone-in filet, medium rare.  I wanted to scrape the meat off the bone.  It was a terrific.   Side - mac & cheese and the creamed spinach... way to go.   3 people $450 w/ tip.  We did do a $120 bottle of wine but hey  Only gripe is that they used to allow cigar smoking in there, and while they did the smoke smell was fresh and pleasent.  Now its stale and a bit foul.    I hope they work on that.

Qviqlg7zDF6Eo83qz-m2_w.text: Ill make it quick.   Awesome Steaks  Rib eye is my favorite.  Great sides and awesome service.  Great steakhouse just barely off the strip.  It's a steakhouse so its not cheap, so be ready to spend some $$.  Every time I go to Vegas I try and visit this place.

qrFKjWCm-k3A1ePTk4Kbkg.text: Yes, this is as good as it gets!  I'm so glad we found this place with Yelp via my little mobile phone when a group of friends and I were in Vegas several weekends ago.  At first, we got lost and had to turn around by Desert Inn Road which 1) didn't allow a u-turn -and- 2) it's actually a long road that takes you all the way over to the other side before letting you turn around, so it took us awhile to find it, but we found it nevertheless.  Upon pulling into the parking lot at about 10pm on a Saturday night, there were plenty of parking spots, so it took us a whole 5 seconds to do so.  Walking in, we passed by a group of folks who looked like they just had their wedding reception there, so that's a good sign... right?  Got to the front desk and told them I made reservations for 3 about 15 minutes ago and they found us right away, and showed us to a table with a view of the bar and the piano man.    The atmosphere was unbelievably nice... the dim lights, the jazz music...everything that I like about a classic steakhouse.  After reading some people's reviews on Yelp, I decided to go with the 6 oz. filet mignon "smaller meal" because I could never finish a big piece of steak.  We were going to get two sides to split family style (spinach supreme and sauteed onions), so it should be plenty of food... and it was.  The other two people I was with ordered a porterhouse and I believe a rib eye.  Everything tasted SO good.  They were truly the melt in your mouth steaks that I've always dreamed about but never really got to experience.   =)  On top of that, I enjoyed the side dishes as well as the bread they serve you in the very beginning.  The butter that came with the bread was just amazing.  Something so simple yet can taste so different.  Now for the dessert... it was my bf's birthday so they served a multiple layered lemon cream cake on the house.  We were stuffed, but the moment I took a bite, I kept on going and going and going, like an Energizer Bunny.  I'm a dessert fanatic, but this one tops SO many other desserts I've had.  It was not too rich, not too sweet, had the perfect ratio of cake to cream and it had just the right fluffiness.  It's to die for... over and over again.  Of course the impeccable service helped a lot too in the overall experience.  They stayed next to us when our steaks were served, asking if we could cut it open to make sure that it was the right amount of doneness that we were seeking.  The waiter even had a flashlight in case we couldn't see it well. :LOL:    Until that night, my favorite steakhouse was Ruth's Chris, but I have to say this surpasses Ruth's Chris by a mile!  I'd go back there in a heartbeat the next time I'm in Vegas.  It was worth the $200 total (incl. tax and tips) for the three of us.

K2j4NdtioF9-9_AznIq3Sw.text: A friend highly recommended del frisco upon learning of our trip to vega.  I checked out the yelp rating and was impressed with the 4.5 rating.  Very good upscale old school restaurant. Nicely decorated and comfortable. After some consulting with our waiter Andrew we settled on splitting a bone in New York strip.  Unfortunately for a prime cut and cost it was a bit grisly. However they were very apologetic and comped us 25% of the steak and a couple deserts to make up for it. The nice part was we only off handedly mentioned it to Anthony the wine guy. We didn't expect to be comped anything. So very nice gesture on there part. I recommend this place and would love to give more stars. I think they just tripped on this one. We'll be back to give it a go again

p_aB5VONsB86lSUtnYB7tg.text: Holy cow! Best steak ever!  After hearing so many good things about the crab cakes, we decided to start with that. It was very good, had big chunks of crab and the sauce was delicious. We ended up using the bread to sop up all the sauce. The waiter came back to a shiny clean plate.  I had the Porterhouse and my GF had the Prime Strip. Both of our steaks were perfectly cook, perfectly seasoned. The blue cheese mac-n-cheese wasn't bad either. Definitely my favorite steakhouse.   Good: Almost everything, esp the steaks! Bad: No locations in nor-cal! Ok: Service was not the best but it wasn't bad at all.

tWgrpRrnGCghxiPCNPLLfg.text: Recently visited Del Frisco's after reading so many great reviews on here.  I have to say, it lived up to the hype.  There were five of us and we all left stuffed (and we actually spent less than I thought we would.)  There wasn't really a bad part of the meal.  With there being five of us, I got to try a bunch of stuff.  For an appetizer, I would recommend the Crab Cake.  Only got one bite but it was awesome!  For sides, the mac & cheese was great.  The onion rings were good too and the most massive you will ever see.  For the entree, I loved my Filet but nearly everyone at the table got a different cut and like it.  For desert, the Lemon Cake has pretty much the best frosting on earth.    With a few drinks, I think I spent about $80 on my meal.  I have spent far more than that in Vegas, and gotten much worse food, so I definitely recommend it to all

raX0vqW-d7woBSuICnk5MA.text: I've consistently traveled to Vegas at least once a year for the past 15 years. Del Frisco's is always a must go.   The last time, I ordered a bone in rib eye, med rare. My gf ordered a fillet and we split an order of the lobster mac and cheese. Once again they did not disappoint. My steak was made to my order and you could almost pull it apart with a fork. The staff was extremely knowledgeable and paired an excellent wine with the meal. And no, they did not steer us to the pricier wines. They actually recommended a very well priced house wine.   I also enjoy the ambiance of the business. It's off the strip so it's a nice break away from the big resorts when you're out there. I've been there several times and I always look forward to going back.

9pMlB0O8jqUzdP2z-gMChQ.text: What a treat, I have never been so impressed with a steak house since dining at Peter Lugar's in NY. Their wet aged steaks are cooked to perfection and have a unique taste that rivals Mastro's.  I shared both a rib eye and and A bone-in filet and was blown away by the texture, flavor, and quality of the meat. Every bite was consistent. Next time I am in town i am having dinner at D.F. If you are a steak enthusiast, you will be impressed. Don't pass this place up.

xIQQwkHn3WRGL164piPXbA.text: One if the first places that I look to visit when I'm in Vegas.  Simply the best steak I've ever had in my life.  The service is the best of any food establishment that I have ever been to.  Everything is really tasty and cooked with live.  Old school decor and dining experience.  A bit pricey but worth every penny.  Thank you Del Frescos for setting the bar on an amazing steak!

ogB8Y1bWjY9kfIdQJp3ZTQ.text: We had a huge party of 16 & the server was FANTASTIC (Travis), the service was always going, very fast & efficient. I've never been in a large group like that & had such great service.   The food obviously was fantastic. I would have loved to have a T-Bone on the menu but he bone in ribeye was magnificent.  The sides are expensive & decent but nothing to spend your time on. The appetizers!!!!!!!!! Crab cakes were amazing. Everyone at our table stated they were the best crab cakes ever made; after eating them I had to agree to that sentiment. They were amazing.

qFBSHtcubW2PxeQoOxBPtg.text: Great experience at this restaurant. The wife and I had a tough week of work and decided to have a spontaneous date night. Great wine selection and the sommelier was very knowledgeable as well as attentive. He picked out a great bottle of wine for us to enjoy with our double eagle strip. Fantastic dinner.

cKeowpLVDgMfU5eXduBOlw.text: This place has great reviews, but I just don't know if it lives up to the hype.  It is very good but not great.  The appetizers were very good and the service was excellent.  The steak was a little dry and WAY too much pepper.  I felt like it was poor excuse for seasoning.  I gave it four stars because, although the rest of the experience was awesome, it is all about the steak right?!  Go check it out, you'll be happy you did.  But, there are better options out there.

4EKFW-T_QY_oNOpNqTqgIg.text: I have been fortunate enough to dine at fine steak houses all around the world, but the Del Frisco's filet mignon that I started eating in Dallas nearly 15 years ago has always been my barometer.  Sadly, because of my experience at the Las Vegas location on May 15, I will never be a Del Frisco's cheerleader again.  Went to grab a quick drink after work on Friday with my girlfriend.  There was no where to sit or hardly stand in the bar, so we asked the host if we could sit at a table even though we knew we wouldn't be dining there because we were on a short timeframe.  She said it was fine and seated us, but then the server (Marciano) got upset that we were sitting at a table and not ordering dinner.  We ordered an appetizer as a good gesture but ended up cancelling the order because the manager (Chris) approached us with the same information.  We ended up drinking our cocktails at the well station where the servers come to pick up drinks from the bartender, which was very annoying because we constantly had to move out of their way.  Marciano and Chris were very rude and made us feel like we weren't good enough for Del Frisco's.  For that I will NEVER return.

guxpUmfe78mNz1FUA9uAIw.text: The service was top notch. The manager and several wait staff came by to say hello and to see if we were enjoying our food. We got 8 oz filet special for the grown ups and burger for the kids; filet was a little under cooked (asked for medium rare but it was more rare) but still good.  They didn't have regular fries, it was potato wedges which didn't work out for the kids.

Ov82XIRxCRfz3uGgHLRWPQ.text: Very disappointed. The service was outstanding as was the ambience. However I ordered their double Eagle steak as did another one in my party the meet was very tough. Nothing I would expect the steak was $69 I did not enjoy the steak at all. Everything else was delicious. Three people at the table had steak all three were tough thumbs down for me.

ZDqSSHN1lyYGZ4GS9a4row.text: Best steak and service in Las Vegas! Skip the strip restaurants and get your steak here!

zUQOzJspOe349o0mdIdKxg.text: When I found out there was a restaurant in town that has a James Bond wine table I made the reservation imminently and ran there to stare at it. When I got there I found out the restaurant is actually a high end steak house and I thought to myself James Bond wine and good steak! How can life get any better? Well, unfortunately the wine is all specialty made and you cant drink it. But you can push the hidden button to make the table reveal its secret which was awesome!   The service here was perfect! My glasses of wine and water never ran empty and the sommelier was at our table early without even asking to assist with the wine selection. The bartender accidently  charged our table for drinks we never ordered and when we brought this to the attention of our waiter the manager came over and comped our deserts for the mistake without us even asking which was great.  As for the food: The crab cakes are a must, order many of them and enjoy! The lobster mac & cheese is also great very unhealthy and great. The steak however was just ok hence the lack of 5 stars. We had the double eagle bone in ribeye which was the best on their menu. It was by no means bad but I can think of a couple places that were much better, but those steak houses are much more expensive and often have less personal service.  All and all I would absolutely return here for many reasons. It was a great experience and the check was not as bad as I would of expected for what we got. The food and service were great overall.

dL-wOX0G7DsmTHyjJEnIXg.text: Order the eff up! Bring your Benjamins and spend it on BEEF! Forget about buying good clothes, you don't eat clothes/shoes/watches/etc. YOU EAT BEEF/COW/HEIFERS, be good to yourself! haha!  Bone in RibEye, my favorite cut of Angus Cow, med rare, pink throughout! 6Ls (yes SIX fcukin LITERS!) of red wine on the table, guys knocking the fuck out before we even order, manager asking us to lower our voices. HAHAHA! Sounds like a Bachelor Party!  Remembered I had a spoonful of each: Lobster Mac (I prefer my lobster Asian style!), cream corn (not very memorable), spinach (so-so), 4 mushrooms (blah), and potatoes au gratin (yum,  I luv potatoes, so it's unfair!). Fcuk , we ordered everything on the menu almost!!  So full.. I left about a 1.5in by 1.5 square of rib eye I couldn't power down. booo!!! Better safe than sorry.  VERY GOOD!

1ai2XS6ajrKZNltOYM2nbQ.text: Best place for a steak in Las Vegas.  Eat here, and stay away from those trendy places on the Strip....  We held our wedding reception here. All our Guests had nothing but great things to say about it.  First, Heather, the Banquets Manager, was the best. On top of everything, and gave us the best value in compared to the Palm, Mc Cormick and Schmeck, and other private rooms we priced out.  All but three of our guests, had steaks and were raving. The other three had Chicken, Tuna, and Salmon, and were pleased. Great sides, mashed potatoes, were the best, great service.  It's very rare that Wedding Banquet Food can be ordered off a menu, and get the quality you would expect during regular dinning time.   Best Filet I have ever eaten in Las Vegas!!!!  You can tell the staff appreciates and wants your patronage.   This is my new place for all special occasions.   Read my review of The Palm, and then eat here!!!

xoAFSjp-ak1polSzIayGgQ.text: There are a lot of steak houses in Vegas, and especially on the strip..... but if you meander just a little bit off the strip you'll find this hidden Vegas gem.  To start, this is not a Vegas restaurant.  It's a small chain that has a few spots around the country.  But this is a great spot to have one on the West coast.  Del Frisco's is a very classy/trendy place that won't scrutinize if you're not dressed up.  I would recommend that you dress up at least business casual.  It's kind of nice to do so.  When you walk in you hear the live piano player.  I think he gives the place a special ambiance.  Onto the food..... to start, the bread that they give you is NOT your ordinary bread.  This is freshly made in-house, light, airy, and sesame-seedy goodness.  Honestly, you could eat one whole one yourself and not ruin your appetite.  Get more than one.  Trust me.  Steaks are at the level of the top steak houses on the strip, but just a little more oomph in flavor and tenderness.  Hot recommendation is the bone-in rib eye.  But the last time I went I shared the Kobe waygu.  I think it was a 32 oz steak.  Definitely big enough for two.  If it's you and your girl, get one steak, order a side of veggies, maybe their lobster mac n' cheese or potatoes.... and you'll be in heaven.  Ask them to show you their James Bond wine box.  It's pretty cool.  But you HAVE TO ASK!!!!

yLbyTqjv303T4DOdARBzsA.text: I try with every ounce of my spirit to make it out to Del Frisco's whenever I'm in Vegas (and sometimes even subconsciously organize trips there for the sole reason of hitting it up) and my most recent visit last week did not cease to please me with the salty fatty goodness of a proper porterhouse seldom attainable in my hometown of SF. Most of the group went with the various filet mignon cuts offered (including a sampler special), and while I wasn't quite hungry enough to get the full double eagle (32oz), the classic porterhouse was done up just right, a red but not bloody medium, and delicious sides that are wholly unnecessary.  Last time I was here was the first time I ate (and had room for) dessert -- we had the molten chocolate cake. Very decadent but not overdone, and served with a scoop of ice cream to play off the warm of the cake and provide light contrast visually and flavorfully. Nothing amazing compared to the steak, but nice to split if you are in the mood.  Note: this place cooks their stake on the rare side, so usually it's a good idea to kick up your preferences by a point (i.e. get medium if you usually prefer medium-rare).

eR2KJVulsmZO63_U74ZXtw.text: Bone in filet was bomb, wifey got the lobster and damn! Service was excellent and check out the James Bond table.

MoCujIXHLEqNGeXReg4pvg.text: I was excited to go here as most reveiws were very good and I have been to many top level steak houses around the country.  However, the food/night did not live up to my expectations. The ribeye ordered was overcooked. To the credit of Del Frisco staff they were very apoligetic and make me another. The problem was the next one was undercooked. They then just cooked it a bit longer which always sucks the juices out. Once again they were very apoligetic and not only gave me a free dessert but also did not charge me for the steak.    I found the bread to be good not great,  I found the ceasar salad to be good not great.  I found the onion rings to be very good but the mashed potatoes poor.  The lemon cake mediorce, very plain. The banana bread pudding was outstanding. Service was outstanding.  Lots of pluses and minuses.  May give another shot.

FF0Dz1HJFfDqpSvlr1ImnA.text: This has become one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas. The personal attention they give is remarkable! The service is outstanding every time. My personal favorites are the crab cakes (best ever!!) The chopped salad, and lobster mac and cheese are excellent too. Crab Legs were juicy and sweet. My husband raves about their bone in filet and their bone in ribeye. Don't forget to leave room for the lemon cake, or at least take it home for later.... it is worth it!

-abjiD_rlm7pLy4V23J8BQ.text: Loved the food. It was pretty decent for a steakhouse. A little too much dressing on the salad, but other than that, really good.   However, the Sommelier left something to be desired. Pushing sour wine on people just because the bottle has been opened, and disregarding the opinion of the person at the table who you are pouring for is a little offending. I'm sorry, I know wine, and that bottle was off. It was past it's prime and going to vinegar, and for you to not listen to my opinion and to try and change my opinion by saying "it will blow off" is slightly offensive. Then you left and never came back. By the way, it never blew off. Sour wine for dinner with steak was really fantastic.   The dinner, as I mentioned before, was fantastic, and just what I was looking for.

i18CA7547TZGyE6OfGik5A.text: Very big portions, very attentive service, and very delicious, excellent cuts of steak.  I had a bone-in filet cooked to medium rare perfection. The lobster mac n cheese and asparagus were our sides. They are family style portions, and given the richness of everything you'll be having, you won't need more than two or three sides for a party of four (and you'll have leftovers, too).  The portions in general are very "classic steakhouse" big. I also had a wedge salad, which was not too heavy on the dressing and everything was fresh as you'd like.  The wine list is HUGE and there are plenty of selections at all price points. My wife and I split a half bottle (next to last page).   My brother pointed something out about the prices. While this place is not cheap, it seems that similar quality steak, salads, sides, and appetizers cost about 20% more on The Strip.   The piano featured some familiar hits including Bobby Brown's "Don't Be Cruel." Make sure to ask to see the James Bond table because it's truly unique.

AydVpVvzN7SZSQ3RfmOtdQ.text: Good, but nothing special. There are far better places to get an excellent steak or meal in Vegas. This place is attempting to hold an aire of class and sophistication that old Vegas once held, but it misses the mark in service and execution. It has been franchised and the exquisite dining experience lost.

5Ep15650bujquWPXItVI2Q.text: Del Frisco's is definitely the place to be if you're looking for a great steak. Their bone-in ribeye was one of the best ones I've had. The service is outstanding (from the time I made the reservation with Kate, to the moment I walked in the restaurant and until the time I left) so kudos to the whole staff. My server Travis was not only friendly and attentive but very knowledgeable of the menu. Very impressed with the service here. When Travis asked how I'd like my steak cooked, he went the extra mile to say that "their" medium rare is red in the center and medium is pink. Most restaurants I go to won't even bother.    I like the fact that they want to make sure the steak is cooked to my liking by having me cut through the middle. I was hoping to try the Asparagus soup that was pictured here on Yelp somewhere but that must be a seasonal offer so I ended up getting the Seafood soup which turned out to be very good. I am a big fan of banana desserts so naturally I went for the Banana bread pudding but that was just was ok, I have had better. Despite the dessert not being outstanding, overall though, I still would rate this place a 5 star.

aNKuZ14_2q34Suv72jbVHw.text: Best steak ever!!!  I was here for a bachelor's party dinner with 9 other guys. The waitress was extremely attentive and our water/drinks were constantly refilled. She recommended their VIP cocktail which we ended up ordering 3 pitchers of!   We started out with their calamari. It was by far the best calamari I've ever had. Melt in your mouth and seasoned perfectly. The house sesame loaf bread was delicious! it came with soft whipped butter.  They currently have a $99/couple promo which includes salad, crab cake, filet, side, and dessert. They allowed a few of us to order it individually for $50, paying the different to upgrade the steak.  I ordered their 22oz usda prime bone-in rib-eye medium rare. It came out perfect! The seasoning is amazing! Definitely the best steak I've ever had. The sides are large enough to share...so when those came out, 6-7 other helpers came out serving everyone sides. It was crazy! We had sauteed mushrooms, creamed spinach,potatoes, and broccoli. The crab cake was delicious! It was 99% real crab meat...  Ask to see their "James Bond" table...it's the wooden round table near the lobby area. It opens automatically to review 15-20 bottles of wine....each hand-painted with a different James Bond movie.  I would definitely be back the next time I"m in Vegas... it's off the strip and probably walkable...but just cab it if you don't have a car.   Oh yeah..no shorts, t-shirts, or flip-flops. I'm not sure how strict they are in enforcing it but just play it safe.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz bone-in rib-eye cooked medium rare. Best steak ever!!

iNuAGlBDYniejUyKSA8PAA.text: This is one of my favorite places to stop by in both Las Vegas and New York. The food is always excellent but what made my most recent visit special was the level of service they gave us. We went there to eat early (at 5pm) since we had some young children in our party (somewhat large of 10 people) so we were a little nervous if it was okay. They were extremely accommodating and ensured the table was all set up well prior to us getting there with booster seats, crayons, papers etc. They also brought out the kids food early so they were happy and relaxed. Generally speaking, especially when it gets busy, I wouldn't say that this is a location that is great for kids but if you go early when it is a bit more empty, you can make it work.    My favorite things to order: -Crab Cakes -Raw Oysters -Shrimp Cocktail Sampler -Rock Crab Claws -Rib Eye or Filet (ideally try Bone In) -Lobster Mac -Potatoes Au Gratin -Mushrooms  Their desserts and wines are excellent as well. Since we don't have the steakhouse in California, I would definitely recommend stopping by if you are in the area.

NEHJvoNfxHhMq2OmRx3NGQ.text: 16oz ribeye to much fat not medium well as i requested very disappointed in del friscos but loved the service

ahkYQI0Tnbi4NAv03-WhaA.text: Really great steak house!  The service was very good - they really go out of their way to make you feel at home here.  My husband and I got the crabcake (SO GOOD), the porterhouse steak (AMAZING) and the filet trio (this was so-so).  We also got a side of lobster mac 'n cheese to share which was pretty darn good.  All in all, I'd recommend going with a more traditional cut of steak with no-frills.  The toppings on the filets were a little too much in my opinion.    Also, make sure that you ask to see the James Bond table!  Very worth it. :)

lMI4xn0c11GNosQX7_umzg.text: I tried this restaurant a few weeks ago when I visited Las Vegas for a bachelor party. I know it's a chain but I had an awesome experience. The place looks just stunning. I had a crab cake and Wagyu tomahawk and it was amazing! I just blasted through the whole meal. The meat was tender, juicy and well seared; the flavors were just amazing and the staff was really nice and helpful and gave a very good service. The portions were great as well and I had a full tummy by the time I left. Great price and great food. What else do you need in a restaurant? Definitely going to go again to try their other steaks!

UqS0kwrcHkpoDqQM0tHTeQ.text: Thank you Del Frisco for a wonderful meal!!! Service, food, ambiance was wonderful!!! We loved everything about our recent visit! Next time we are iN Vegas we will stop by again!

PHLs-udsspPqzf5OVh7J7g.text: This place was freaking fantastic!  Got a drink at the bar while we waited for some friends and got a jack and coke.  Nice and strong!  Got seated quickly.  We all pretty much ordered the filet with different side dishes.  Everything was delicious!  The steak melted in my mouth!  The potatoes were amazing and rustic.  The corn is a must as well.  Then we all shared the lemon cake and it was to die for.  I will definitely be back.

V1BBatBOL3GO8LtEZ1QVtA.text: Went here for a friend's bachelor party dinner. Reservations were easy through opentable. Took Uber from the strip, about ~$9.   Food: Got the 32oz bone-in Wagyu Ribeye (not on menu). Shared with a buddy and barely finished it. Most juicy, flavorful steak I had in the states.Their medium rare is red throughout FYI. Highly recommend.   Sides: Lobster Mac & Cheese, Asparagus, Sauteed Mushrooms all really good. Corn was whatevers. They came around and served us all sides family style. Very cool.  Service: Amazing. Servers had us cut into our steaks to make sure they were cooked to our liking. Sides were served to us. Water was never empty, someone always came to check up on us and all the servers were very friendly.   Price: Very reasonable. 32oz bone-in Wagyu ribeye was ~$90.   I will come back here again just to eat steak next time I visit Vegas.

AFzKJEHoZaWy8jqhwe-FXQ.text: If you want to splurge on a very tasty dinner, Del Frisco's is definitely one spot you should check out. This restaurant is a change of pace since it is located off the strip. The staff here provides impeccable service as well as an overall pleasant experience.  The sesame bread that they give you is freakin addicting that I regret not saving room for my steak. I had their signature drink, the VIP (a pineapple infused vodka), but I stopped after one because it did taste like a bad hangover waiting to happen. I normally don't eat seafood, but I actually thought the crab cake tasted good.  This is one of the very few places I've ever dined where I can say I was babied (in a good way)! They cut and served our lobster, served our lobster mac & cheese, served our potatoes au gratin, help split the humongous tomahawk wagyu into two portions, and even helped another Yelper take foodie pics muahaha. I should've visited the restroom to see if they wipe for me too!  I had the prime ribeye which was awesomely delicious and cooked perfectly to medium rare as requested. It was a 16oz hunk of meat that I wished came in a smaller portion (never thought I'd ever say that). They definitely make it a priority to make sure the steak is cooked to your liking.  We came here for a birthday, and it was a cute little touch that the staff all signed a card for the celebrant. We got to indulge in a six-layer lemon cake which was so light and yummy without it being overly sweet.  I would definitely return in the future, but will make sure I come back with a bigger appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz prime ribeye

aOhjFQOfI7LzmNWGagF3ng.text: Las Vegas is a city that built itself upon gambling, partying, and booze. A land where men can take their bachelor for one final hurrah and enjoy their final moments before the chains of marriage tie them to a small home in the suburbs with a van in the carport. When that opportunity arises to bring that man for a True "man's experience" nothing says it better that a crafted cocktail and a slab of meat. If you happen to be in Vegas, stray away from the strip and stop by Del Frisco.   Del Frisco may not be among the most celebrated steakhouses and to be perfectly blunt, not one of the places I had ever heard previously, but it is True to its concept with the wood paneled walls, the grandiose chandeliers, and the starched white linen tablecloths to greet you. It's tables aren't amongst the most widely spaced, nor is it the quietest, but it certainly was comfortable and enjoyable for our group.  The menu is your typical steakhouse fare with al selection of appetizers, salads, entrees, and desserts filled with the classics you would come to expect. Nothing truly standing out, yet nothing missing from what you would expect. Our group started with the shrimp cocktail served with its 3 sauces: cocktail, italian, and mustard remoulade. All were decent, but nothing all that spectacular. The crab cakes lived up to its name with a very high proportion of crab and very little filler. Its cajun lobster sauce that accompanied it truly showcased the flavors of the crab.  I opted for the 22oz bone-in ribeye and it was well seasoned and cooked beautifully to order. The flavors of the beef were highlighted and not overwhelmed by the butter flavors used in cooking and I have to say that while it arrived overwhelming, it was quickly consumed by this writer. In fact, he ended up eating half of his mother's filet mignon because it was simple, but that good.  The sides available to order had high and low moments. From the lackluster chateau potatoes that were ok but overall unimpressive to the spinach supreme which was well seasoned and nicely cooked, it almost seemed that the only thing you should order is the steak. Then the lobster mac and cheese arrived and a new chapter was written. The earth stood still as the first bite hit my taste buds and took my breath away. It was a beautiful creamy symphony of the lobster and cheese flavors set amidst beautifully cooked pasta. You could almost see the smile of God at that moment.  Food arrived in a well-timed orchestration and allowed for us to rest between courses and the servers were quick to serve in classic format that was quite impressive for a party our size. The waiter was incredibly patient and clearly well-versed in their menu and wine list which was pretty impressive.  Price was rather reasonable (even though I was a guest and didn't have to pay) when you look at other classic steakhouses. Wines are a tad on the steeper side, but it is a steakhouse and the pricing wasn't that bad in that sense.   When it comes to a need for a steak in Vegas, skip the $7.99 bargain deal and celebrate your friend's last moments of single-hood with a scotch and a fantastic steak that makes you really feel like a man.

szCTW1uIw42wCStyE4wbKg.text: The atmosphere is that of a typical American steakhouse with large portions, where side dishes tend to outshine entrees. It's a solid choice for a classic steakhouse, but if your focus is the beef, there is better to be had elsewhere in town. The meat may be good, but lacks the intense beefy flavor of other meat-centric spots that have their own aging program (or source from others that do). If prime is all you need, this place will hit the mark. If you're looking for the best dry-aged or wagyu you'll need to look elsewhere.  It was a long meal that took much longer than it should have. Luckily I was in good company. My wife and I (along with out son) were celebrating our wedding anniversary. It was nice of the staff to acknowledge the occasion when we checked in and when we were seated. It was also a nice touch when they presented a card from the staff. At the end of the meal the lemon cake was complimentary. It was a good experience throughout for the most part, but there were enough misses or lowpoints that made it less than perfect.  Steaks are pretty good and side dishes will steal the show. The creamed corn was plenty creamy with bits of bacon sprinkled throughout. The potatoes au gratin were my favorite side dish. Large chunks of potatoes filled the dish, accompanied by lots of ham, bacon, and cheese, making it rich and delicious. The True highlight, however, was the crab cake appetizer. By far it was the best crab cake I've had in town. Little to no filler, seasoned just enough to compliment the sweetness of the meat, and a cajun sauce that added a slight tinge of heat and depth.The low point of the night was trying their steak tartare. It was basically minced meat with very little seasoning. It's in the running for one of the worst dishes I've had.   Despite that awful appetizer, it was a good night. The company, obviously, was top notch, as was the service. And, there were enough good dishes to make this an enjoyable dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Doberge cake ($11) - six layers, lemon buttercream icing, lemon glaze
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Doberge cake ($11) - six layers, lemon buttercream icing, lemon glaze

xm2F3Kg48DxID3S3G8XUOA.text: Out of this world! In vegas on business and off the strip. Across the street from my hotel, how can i not. Everyone so polite and great vibe when i walked in, not too big and over the top.   I sat at the bar and was offered many menus...bar, pre-fix, restaurant week and the regular. No big deal. I ordered off of restaurant week which was $68. Not bad for a killer 12oz rib eye, 2 sides (potatoes and green beens) Caesar salad and bread pudding dessert.   All i can say was the food was so fresh, crisp and came out searing hot and tasty that I was in food heaven. A nive touch when the steak comes out sizzling, that the server asks to cut it open and check the doneness. Mine was a bit rare for medium rare that they brought it back and it came back to me perfect. All the while with a smile on their face. A good night at a great steakhouse.

pp8tje8wQblFXnn3Fte60w.text: I think the food OK here.  I don't think I got a great cut on my steak.  Bone in Prime Rib Eye 22oz - $56 - Average 3/5 The prime rib was OK.  I didn't enjoy the cut of the steak.  The inside was cooked perfectly but the cut wasn't anything special.  Unfortunately the steak tasted a bit standard.  My friends steaks, on the other hand, came out much better.  NOTE -  My friend tried this same restaurant in NY he warned us they tend to under-cook the steak.  For example, a medium will probably come out medium-rare, a medium rare will come out rare, etc.  The same incident happened here as well; 2 members in our party ordered steaks medium and medium-rare, and both were under-cooked and came out medium rare and rare, respectively.  As such, both members in my party had to have their steaks re-heated.  Not a big deal but something to keep in mind.  Old Fashioned - $14 - Decent 3.5/5 I requested the old fashioned have a scorched twist.  The old fashioned was decent; it didn't come out sweet which is how I like it.  Unfortunately, I didn't think our server knew much about the drink.  The old fashioned came w/ a straw (usually it doesn't).  When my drink came the server scorched the twist right in front of me.  I found it odd the server scorched the twist (shouldn't this have been done by the bartender??), also she didn't scorch the twist properly.  The twist is supposed to be rubbed on the rim of the drink afterward (which it wasn't).  Complimentary bread-  Sesame bread.  Really good & soft.  Yummy 4/5.  Appetizers Lobster Mac n Cheese -Decent 3/5.5 Mushrooms Sauted - Decent, 3.5/5 Potatoes au Gratin - Best, 4/5  TIPS: -Corkage $50 (yikes) - steaks have been known to come out under-cooked (which is detailed above)

-O7om7q8LwN84qEU0J5iRA.text: Always a great go to steak restaurant when in LV. Del Friscos never seems to disappoint.  Service is always great , warm , friendly, and attentive.  Food is always phenomenal.  You can easily ruin a steak and I have always been happy with how spot on they cook the meats at this restaurant. Drink pouring here is always heavy handed which is a bonus when ordering a nice cocktail. Do yourself a favor and venture of the strip a mile or so and enjoy yourself at this great spot. Don't forget to ask about the "Bond" table !

6xW3aFOAaWBVk7l4YLkAtA.text: Same sentiments as William L. "I just want my Vegas Del Frisco's back!"  We went in on Sunday during the long weekend. The hostess brought us to our table with menus. A buser brought us our bread and water right away. Our server finally showed up after 10-15 minutes of sitting. He made up for it though by being thorough explaining the specials. I ended up changing my order to the special- filet mignon 3 ways (4oz each). He ended up being great overall.   Now the reason for the loss in two stars:  For one: there must be a new grill cook because he does not get the temperature right on the meat. I order my 3-ways medium well. The first 4oz I had was perfect...the next two 4oz was rare (light purple in the middle) but burnt on the outside. I returned it to have him butter-fly it but the cook made it into carne asada so I just gave up and ate it. Now two: We were looking around at the other tables and the servers,like we normally do. Noticed something very strange that was very not Del Frisco's. All the males had uniform attire nice shirt and tie, black slacks (not unusual there) yet majority of the female servers and female food runners were wearing shorts or plunging neckline tops or both. I get it we're in Vegas, but that is not appropriate attire for an upscale dining experience that Del Frisco's is known for. When we have come to Vegas...Del Frisco's has always had class, elegance, and delivers truly an amazing dining experience that you forget you're in (Sin City) Vegas!  The female manager that was there was dressed appropriately yet her associates were not. Sex does not have to sell food. Del Frisco's food sells itself!  It should be equal both genders should have a uniform and deliver great service.  Our server was great he took the time to explain, checked in sufficient amount, and gave great service as how it should be. All-in-all we want our Vegas Del Frisco's back!

7Tn5qnKsWcdAspNXPxNA3w.text: We went there for the first time. I must say that we love steak and we ve been to a lot of high end steakhouses. First the restaurant smells weird...you can listen to the piano music if you have table in the first room...the other rooms all you can hear is noise from people talking...no atmosphere at all. The bread and butter were so basic (you ll find better in mc Donald's) and the hostess that brings water was dressed up like a hoe...ultra short skirt and sexy tights  omg is this high end restaurant I thought?? The waitress was so self centered, making jokes and laughing by herself...like she wasn't there to serve us but her to have fun. The food was average. We had 32oz ribeye ...wasn't bad but I expected perfect steak for $100 for portion. (The waitress was convincing us that 32oz is not enough for one person)  . Overall if u want to spend some more money, and feel classy, get a decent service this is not the place you want to go. The price you will pay and the things you ll get there are not matching.

QzDxaxaJdFuJKTP3ov1-Sw.text: Waited over 30 minutes for my steak. When asked for an accompaniment side they said ok side came 5 minutes later no Steak. The Las Vegas restaurant is taking national customers for granted. Terrible service. I regret going there for the first time.   I would avoid Las Vegas Del Frisco's many other options. Never had a bad meal or service at Oceans Club or Joes Stone Crab House.

0IFwRTwZpyk6sDRULGD5gw.text: I enjoyed the Prime Ribeye. It was cooked perfectly for medium rare. The popular lobster macaroni's popularity is warranted. I also really enjoyed their broccoli which was buttered just the right amount. Our waiter was very friendly and deserving of working in the service industry.  Unfortunately I had an upset stomach later that night, I think from the rarity of the steak (I didn't have anything else to eat that night). The steak was amazing nonetheless and I would go back.

_io4rckqeuC2plrfYRUfBg.text: My friends and I visited Vegas for the weekend and decided to get a steak dinner on one of our nights there. We chose Del Frisco's after hearing how great it was. Reservations were easy to get via OpenTable. We took a cab from our hotel Vdara which was about $15 or so and a 10 min cab ride.   Main: On Sundays they offer a prix fixed menu for $49: A choice of appetizer, entree and side. I chose the 9 ounce filet that was accompanied with a side of BBQ shrimp, Cesar salad and side of sauteed corn.   Sides: Mac and cheese and the whipped potatoes. The potatoes were excellent.   Dessert: We just had to get the lemon cake. It was HUGE! and soooo good. Not super sweet and not super lemon-y.   Tips: As for help in choosing the wine. The sommelier is super helpful and will work around your budget. Do not be afraid to ask for wines under $100. We did, and she chose us a really nice one that fit our price range.   A must go! Service is spot on. Food is excellent. GET THE CAKE! Be sure to come hungry and not hung over (that way you can enjoy everything!).

vP4efPjto_MFJHOjYAkS4w.text: My husband and I met a server that was sitting at the bar at a nearby restaurant drinking before her shift who told us that this place had a great Happy Hour.   We walked in to sit at the bar.  We were there for over 2 minutes without being greeted while the bartender chatted with another guest...fine...not the best service but we could move on.  The smell was horrendous!  The bar area smelled like mold and mildew.  I started to get nauseous just sitting there!    I can't comment on anything because I could not stand the smell of filth.  I can't image what was being served from behind the bar.

lPZvEyFAzUTAT9fI5rLAbA.text: Five days in Vegas, ate at several top resort restaurants, and this surpassed them all both in service and taste! Started with THE VIP for me and THE OLD FASHIONED for my hubby, great choices! My shrimp scampi was very satisfying and my husbands filet was outstanding. Great ambiance, fun, and relaxed. James Bond table was cool too. Can't wait for a Miami location to open soon!

K_SpkgrNKHfw1Zy9OK7BSg.text: One of the best steaks I have ever eaten- the filet melted in my mouth

JqLcrI6LMg19ROvNxKtVAw.text: Wow. Just WOW.  I live in San Diego, so there's only a couple steakhouses that I've been to. But quote me on this. And I'm gonna say this loud and proud:  "Ruth's Chris and Donovan's ain't got NOTHING on Del Frisco's."  So check it: I came here for dinner when I was in town on business. Everything was a plus. The place was nice. The hostess' were beautiful. The servers were professional. And the food was DElicious.  I had the filet mignon with a salad, and the table split a crab cake appetizer and lobster mac and cheese. YES, LOBSTER MAC AND CHEESE. Everything was cooked to absolute perfection.  Now I should remind you, steakhouses don't go cheap. Especially since  you're in Vegas. So go here on a SUPER special occasion, like if you're trying to impress a girl. Or go here like I did, on a business trip dinner where the company pays for it. =)  So in conclusion, Del Frisco's is the best steakhouse I've ever been to in my years of life. You have to go here at some point in your life. But be prepared to drop some serious cash!

L1AAXJ7RAwLl5RntW4U5DA.text: There are even more expensive places to get mediocre food, if you can believe that.

IerbfEMeXi2tbvTVb1jW9w.text: Went last weekend. Good reviews in yelp. Lemon cake dessert was great--and big! Service was awesome also. Steak was good but not great. But I will go again and see. Overall. I would recommend.

xpYlmnC8yK8tYyWdNRcReg.text: My favorite steakhouse in town. If its quality your looking for then you must go to Del Frisco's. The filet mignon is undeniably delicious, juicy, tender and full of flavor. The lobster tail is cooked to perfection and literally melts in your mouth. We have ordered the steamed broccoli, asparagus, the potatoes and the Mac and cheese and have never been let down. We always start off with a VIP, which is pineapple that they have soaking in vodka, it's so delicious, it has just the perfect amount of sweet to offset the vodka. It's not overwhelming with sugar it's a perfect blend. For dessert we always order the creme brulee, and they flambe that sucker to perfection. Writing this review is giving my mouth a serious case of the wateries. The restaurant itself is classy and clean and the service has always been excellent.

A9E3GFXJTkht1DMynD-G7w.text: I came here twice during the CES shows with my company and each time I was WOWed by the quality of the food.  I would go as far to say that this is probably the best steakhouse I have ever been to.  The first time I went with a large group for a customer dinner and so we had a chance to try a bunch of the appetizers.  The most memorable one was the crab cakes and that was better than any of the ones I've had at other seafood restaurants.  Both times I ordered the New York strip, and they cooked it just right (I like medium-rare) and I love the fact that they cook it in butter, but that it arrives on the plate in such a way that I don't feel bad eating something I know I will regret from a health standpoint.    The service at Del Friscos is top notch; exactly what you would expect from a higher end establishment.  I had to wait about 1 hour even though I had a reservation so I was a bit disappointed but in rare instances like this one, the food made me forget about that.

KBkTnWpyMNBn_79Mcot7IA.text: Every time I visit Las Vegas, i have to stop by here.  I'd have to say Del Frisco's is the best steak in Vegas, and on my  top5!  I'm the type that love my food without the fanfare.  If you make a good steak you don't need the steak-sauce.  You don't need blue-cheese crumble or horseradish...  At Del Frisco's, if you order a rib-eye, that's what you're getting, a damn good steak!  Lightly hinted with seasoning (tastes like a garlic salt rub).  Highly reccomend:  -Bone-in Ribeye -Lobster mac -Cream Corn  I must admit that I haven't been back in a couple of years, not because of Del Frisco's but b/c I haven't been back to Vegas in a while.  Time to plan a trip here!

YBNlApcOXk71FG6cNoRzEA.text: There are a lot of great steakhouses in Vegas, but Del Frisco's is the best that I've experienced.  The steaks are super high quality and the prime ribeye is simply the best steak I've ever eaten.  The meat had wonderful flavor and was seasoned perfectly.  My wife and I had the crab cake appetizer, which I would also highly recommend.  And the chocolate souffle cake finished off the meal perfectly.  I would definitely choose Del Frisco's over any of the big casinos steakhouses on the Strip.

-UyriOCzobhHDKr27RZybA.text: Amaze balls!  From the bone-in ribeye, to the Chateau potatoes, to their moist lemon cake.  Wonderful service and an amazing experience!

zUQGdbzz2RDPErzhoimbcw.text: Superior service. This place is nice. We took a cab here because I think it's a ways away from the strip. It doesn't look like a whole lot from the outside but the inside is dimly lite and tastefully decorated.   And WOW did we eat! We had a bottle of wine gifted to our party and the drink selection beyond that was great and very broad.   The food was excellent. For an appetizer we had a large, cold seafood plate. I actually had fish for dinner as well, rather then steak and we had a lot of fabulous side dishes, including creamed spinach that I especially liked. I believe we also had a lemon cake of somesort which was really delicious as well.  The waitstaff makes it a point to know your name and when possible they try to get your business card so they can send you a HANDWRITTEN thank you note. Who doesn't love thank you notes!   If you're feeling like a hot shot in Vegas, go here. Your pocket may come out empty but you will come out full and extremely satisfied.

on0RhBH7zWHuvK5k2Fxlhw.text: Best. Ribeye. Ever.  A good selection of entre's other than steak, but the attraction here is the beef. Dry aged, seasoned, and grilled exactly how you want it.  Service is attentive but not overbearing. Lobster Mac-n-cheese is a must as your side dish.

WI7HAdqTcqj5fTW6Nu-DXQ.text: ROCK-SOLID FOUR STARS   The standouts: They held our reservation (we called, stuck in traffic) an extra 20 minutes even though the place was packed. And when I say packed, I am not kidding.  Their signature pineapple-infused vodka.  Good doesn't begin to describe this cocktail. The bread.  Yes, it's bread.  But it is everything bread should be.  And more.  Crab cake appetizer.  Best I've ever had without a breeze off the Atlantic blowing gently in my face. We were wished a happy anniversary and served without charge the lemon cake they're known for. The steaks.  Very, very good.  Perfect, in fact.  No children.  Not a one.    The minor irritations: We were seated right next to the kitchen.  I know, I know, SOMEONE has to sit there.  But Liz-the-bitch doesn't LIKE sitting next to the kitchen.  We were rushed.  No 'feeling rushed' about it.  We.  Were.  Rushed. We had to flag down our server and ask for after-dinner coffee.  WE HAD TO ASK FOR AFTER-DINNER COFFEE.  Huge fail.  That lemon cake?  Good, but you know, maybe we wanted to peruse the dessert menu  and perhaps make an additional choice. They lose a Liz-Star(TM) on that one.  I take my dessert very seriously.    Conclusion:  Good steakhouse.  Very good, actually.  The food was fabulous. The minor irritations listed above had everything to do with the fact that it was very crowded.  On a Thursday, by the way.  A restaurant with their reputation and their prices can and should do better regardless of how busy they are.

ownqP08XXpU71y6ddcRHqg.text: Went there last night, always excellent service and top quality steaks. Try the fermented pineapple martini. Great Filet Minion!

xrTUihPMLZdW5_g3B3FB8g.text: By far the best steak house I've been to. It wasn't as expensive as those on the strip and way better.

-X_KgNT-8RFWtjsXw1S5eQ.text: Unbelievable service and food!  An ABSOLUTE must!  Alexis and Jen were our waitresses; they were accommodating, hospitable, attentive, made great recommendations, and really made us feel like we were a high priority.  We will be back for more of the chocolate lava cake and banana bread pudding...though I admit they made a Jack Daniels bread pudding I wish would be put back on the menu.

cRAzMnFVIEHbC_s9g7dbDg.text: My husband loves porterhouse steaks, so I made reservations at Del Friscos for his birthday.  He always works so hard to make things special for me, so I wanted the evening to be perfect.  Unfortunately, we were both disappointed by the bar-type atmosphere.  In addition, the service, not the bill, was equivalent with a much lower level restaurant.

1SfviJ_LhUYIGHwVEdJirw.text: Awesome service and food. Well worth the price. I highly recommend the porterhouse steak, it's better than Morton's porterhouse steak.

BoPLy4tFa8swQHFZke_HkQ.text: We try to stop here on every visit to LAS.  This year we just stopped in for Lemon Cake after the Viva Elvis show. We sat at the corner of the bar. Several patrons were having dinner at the bar. Bartender was professional and entertaining, what else can you ask for? Oh, there is a new cigar patio... (could be two years old for all I know)... Bar is now non-smoking.

_CuS7mF2x9QKG6OlbDiwAw.text: i thought the food was ok.. Service and staff were nice. Atmosphere was great; however, the food wasn't to die for. For the price, I would look elsewhere. I can cook a better steak. Food needed more flavor, or perhaps I wan't feeling it that day, but my boyfriend had mutual feelings.

t4PB6pO7mO_77BoWiN6BKw.text: We were here for my 30th birthday last month.  I've heard a lot of good things about this place so I wanted to try it.  We usually pick Lawry's as our special dinner; but figured to give it a try.    Well, it was not how I had really envisioned it.  I guessed I assumed it would be more intimate?  I was wrong.  We were seated at one of the middle tables in one of the rooms.  When we first sat down (reservations was t 7pm); it was quiet.  But, Boy...when it hit 8pm it was like a party.  So much people crammed in one room, conversations and music.  It was just too much for me.    But, the food was great.  They had this special for 2 people for $99 which included a salad, entree, 2 sides and dessert.  My filet mignon was cooked perfectly and we also had it oscar-style (stuffed crab) and it was filled w/ crab.  It was delicious!  If we were to go back; we may bring friends who want to grab dinner and drinks.  I wouldn't go back for a romantic dinner, though.

rgUWkij8IZt689eSdJTB8Q.text: Came here for dinner on vacation. My husband and I ordered the Pre Fixie Dinner. It comes with salad, sides, and an entree.   I had the crab cake with filt mignon and sauteed mushrooms. My husband had the ribs, chateau potatoes (mashed potatoes) and scallops. We ordered Caesar salad as well and everything was so good. The meat was cooked perfectly, exactly to our liking. The crab cake and scallops were very flavorful.   As for salads, I am not usually a big fan but the caesar salad was really good and I actually finished the whole plate!  Drinks: the pineapple martini is excellent!   Services: 5 Stars Food: 5 Stars

Pgxr4Swc8h09a3PCPS5sNw.text: My fiance and I came here for the $99 power couple special, which features an 8-oz filet & signature crab cake, two sides, a choice of salad and desert.   We tried the Del's salad and Classic Caesar salad, my usual favorite. Del Frisco's Caesar salad left much to be desired, it lacked flavor and needed more dressing. On the other hand, the Del's salad, which came with two thick slices of bacon, was delicious.   For the entree, I enjoyed the crab cake more than I did the steak.
