The crab to filling ratio favored the crab more than the filling, it was the best crab cake I ever had. Why can't all places make their crab cakes this way? The filet was average, nothing out of the ordinary.  For sides, we tried the sauteed mushrooms and spinach supreme, both okay. We would've enjoyed the mushrooms more if they were sliced, rather than whole.  Their banana bread pudding was outstanding. Surprisingly, it was topped with local vanilla ice cream, which according to the waitress had a high fat content. Ice cream beats vanilla sauce any day. The bread pudding had a slight crisp to it and when mixed with the ice cream, was amazing. I would go back for the bread pudding alone.  The service was fantastic. It was the fastest I have ever seen someone clear our table at a Steakhouse.  Exceptional value for $99!!

cNg8TYXoC2FhVGvhVDl2Dw.text: WHAT? How did I not write a review for this place?   I went this summer with 2 guy friends and my boyfriend. PUaha it was like a double date, kinda. We made the two guys also order the Power Couple Special with us and it was SUCH A GREAT DEAL and ridiculously good food. All the sides are good, just make sure everybody orders different ones! We didn't realize the side dishes would be family sized so ordered double of some items.   My filet came out a little rarer than I liked and they were ok with it. They actually stood there and waited for us to cut into the meat first to make sure we liked it, then cooked it some more and brought it back out. Impeccable service and food, I love this place and I am definitely going back for seconds in November!

q9aQPj9i5mcPSco0T8BKAg.text: First time at Del Frisco's and we will be back! Family took me out for a steak dinner for Dads day and wife picked this awesome spot!  Had the Bone-in Prime Rib Eye and it was cooked excellent! Medium rare is how I like it. We also had their VIP drink which was pineapple sweet with a little kick of vodka. Asparagus was ok and the Mac and cheese. Calamari as the appetizer was great! I wanted to eat it all but had to save room for the rest of the courses. Bread was good too. Soft and tasty with a layer of sesame seeds. Great experience here and Matthew was great with our questions and orders.

h64nMC_VQdLzKKgZyW3pTg.text: When in LV, you rarely want to leave the strip since there are many good restaurants within the hotels.  But we wanted to try something off the strip. Del Frisco's seemed like a good choice!  I ordered the bone-in ribeye 22 oz. Wow, really good!  This is the first time that I ordered a bone-in ribeye at a steakhouse. I usually just go for the regular ribeye.   I'm always going to get the bone-in ribeye at other places now too.  The steak was good but as I got closer to the bone, it was an orgasm in my mouth. Yum!  I'm from LA and my fav. steakhouse is Mastro's. Del Frisco's is pretty comparable.

uoMq4yLHdnqO98V1KnA0ng.text: Had surf and turf and it was ridiculous! One best steaks I have had! And I have had a lot of steak at a lot of restaurants. Must go here if in area, I haven't ate at any of the other ones.

uacsPgBPgHm-xWJOFzjCzg.text: Excellent service - our waitress followed up our visit with a thank you card in the mail.  Amazing food, love the ribeyes but the seafood is excellent as well. The VIP martini is my absolute favorite. I wish I lived closer, I visit every time I'm in Vegas.

ira46u1k-PhKLjXqwMthzw.text: This is my fourth time here and they never disappoint.  I come to Vegas three to four times per year and this is my favorite restaurant.  We are usually here with groups and they do a great job accommodating.  Service and food is top notch.

IwF3boh4dh0sWTjAjUabwA.text: Del Frisco's Las Vegas delivers not nearly the quality delivered of their Manhattan location, but they serve a great steak, tasty bread and good side dishes. Plus, the service is excellent.   I ordered the 12oz Filet Mignon and it was served basically as sushi...raw on the inside. I am not sure why they didn't butterfly the tall filet. Anyway, after the second try, the steak was still raw on the inside, so - to the restaurant's credit - the general manager visited our table with a new steak on the house. That action saved the night.   As for the side dishes (everything is a'la carte) the Caesar salad was wonderful with a light and tasty dressing, the onion rings were hot, flavorful and not greasy, and the lobster macaroni and cheese was good, though not my favorite dish in the first place. Their complimentary bread is fresh, hot, soft and flavorful. Even the valet out front raved about the bread.   Getting there requires a $20 cab ride from the Strip. During your 90-minute stay, be prepared for steep prices, dark lighting, great service and above average food. Trying to get back to the trip can take time due to the location, so plan ahead!  This was not the best steak I've had - even within the Del Frisco's locations - but it is a great place for a special occasion or a night on the town.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oD6AgshukS83aqiZXHqH5A.text: We came here while in town celebrating our anniversary. Being from Dallas, we know a good steak house and frequent the Del Friscos in Fort Worth/Dallas. The atmosphere here is not as warm and cozy as the other two Del Friscos at home, but that wasn't deterring us, our server was friendly, salad was good, I ordered the filet which was perfect, husband ordered the bone in ribeye which he was not pleased with, it was more well done verses being cooked to a medium, which being over cooked can ruin a steak for anyone. It was late so he didn't want to send it back. Other than that, everything else as good.

3A7-rT9k6ni9DIshEo_0Nw.text: Easily one of my favorite go to places.  With the dark wood walls it feels very intimate and they have an awesome wine selection.  But really it comes down to their food.  All their dishes that i've ever had were perfectly balanced.  The free loafs of sesame bread are to die for when they are warm (which is always)  They bring the food out appropriatly and it has waiters that really know what they are doing.  Totally great.   GET THE BANANA BREAD PUDDING!  best desert i've had in town...and i've got an overactive sweet tooth.

bU9iPNOsBMOO_Hgi7ee5Ug.text: Update - The manager responded to my three star review and apologized that no body had asked if we wanted to be seated in the sports room or offered to reseat us when we brought it up.  They definitely are trying to do the right thing!  The food was top notch.  The ambiance was poor at best, they had TV's in the corners of the dining room!!!  Is this a sports bar or a fine dining restaurant?  At their prices, I shouldn't have to endure network television.  Our waitress wasn't worthy of Denny's, she deserved no place in this high end establishment.

nGAhI30IurgArq8Z9W7drA.text: 5/27/12 So we were scrolling through YELP and I wanted to find a great meatery...LOL and I'd always heard of Del Frisco's..on a whim, we decided to make reservations and away we went!   LIke everyone else says..the service is seriously exceptional! The location was nice and decor was dark and moody...so needless to say the food photos came out totally dark...hahaha   The house sesame bread was soooo good...my bf practically ate the whole loaf by himself! and he's not even a carb man...I ordered the VIP martini...and it had vodka infused with pineapples...and it was THE BOMB! Oh my goodness by far the best drink I had while in Vegas...even a month later I can't stop thinking about it! I'd go back just to have that drink again!  We didn't really care what we had dinner wise...but their speciall was pretty enticing...$99 for a 3-course meal! You can't beat that! Had the filet and their crabcakes...which the bf also praised...it was one of the best he'd ever had..full of crab meat and not so bready like most other CC's...the steak was cooked to perfection and vegetables were tasty too!   one of the most memorable dinners ever!  =)

T6GAO_Iv31Q3PtzoqQqRSg.text: Consider this a limited review but all signs point to an excellent steak house.  While I was visiting Del Frisco's for a special event, it was suggested I order a dish. While my experience there was limited by my single menu choice, the food was excellent, the staff friendly and attentive.   Initially, I had the opportunity to witness the management and staff interaction both at the function and with other customers, and later interact with some of them as well, as the event progressed, again, impressed with their focus on the patrons and food.  On a light note - generally known to be acutely aware of my surroundings, I did not have a clue that there was a live piano player there for some 15 minutes or so. I thought the smooth sounding songs were piped in, but far from it, live and upbeat.  The feel of the steak house was right on target in every dimension.  And the location is easily accesible on Paradise near Sands/Twain.

LEDpeGhp5mQiUpV5GtVuPg.text: If its quality you want and money is no object.   let me just save you a lot of time         "just book it "  a lot more older croud then id like but hey who drops 1200-1400 on 4 ppl and a few bottles of wine old people.  and they make a night of it    not like us hit and run in a limo .     i honestly am trying to remember more but my circuits are fried

826T0JEq_Sl-ZVPD4woKvg.text: I love steak, and when I travel, always take the opportunity to try a new place. I've tried many in Las Vegas, and Del Frisco's is right up there with the best.  It's off the strip and in its own free standing building, which is nice to get away from the casino crowds now and then.   I had the rib eye (no bone) and it was definitely one of the better. I'm not ready to give it a "best" rating, but it was damn good. What made the evening so fantastic was the service. Some steak places have the older guys in white coats and black pants that seem more rushed than attentive; our Del Frisco's waiter was very attentive, took time to talk us through our questions and let us enjoy our meal at a casual pace.   If you enjoy trying new steak places while in Vegas, definitely add Del Frisco's to the list.

fBFHun1N88263CEW_dVYHA.text: No complaints here.   Group of 4 had bone-in ribeye, bone-in filet, and (2) regular ribeyes. Took a bite of others'... My bone-in ribeye was by far the best. It seemed like the ticker cut allowed the outside to be crispier while keeping the medium inside. Wife's thinner cut and medium-rare inside didn't have the same crispy sear. Lobster mac, and creamed spinich were both excellent and came in large portions.    I personally didn't think the lemon cake everyone raves about was all that, but the rest of the table seemed to enjoy it til it's death.   5 stars because it was the best steak I've had in many years. Service was excellent as well.   They did show me the "Bond" table, but I was unimpressed.

G0gD5jOeKMhWCV4FbSbcmQ.text: This place is a little off the strip but a great place for some yummy steaks!  Came here with a group of girls and felt a little out of place walking in (as most of the diners seem to be guys), but us girls love our meat too!.      I tried the filet Mignon and the prime porter house steak.  I thought both were very delicious.  They were buttery soft that just melt  in your mouth.  What surprised me were the side dishes...even better than what I had expected.  The crab cakes and lobster mac n' cheese were the best I've ever had.  They are a definite must try!! The crab cakes were loaded with tons of crab meat and the sauce complement it so well.  As for the lobster mac n' cheese...I love the little chunks of lobster surprises in every bite.  Such a scrumptious creamy dish.  The lemon cake was awesome as well.   The service was spectacular.  Very friendly staff.  I swear we had like 5 waiters serving us.  Before bringing out our food we had people came by to clean the crumbs off our the table. Then, when it was time to serve our meal, they had like 5 waiters brought out our food so we would all be served at the same time.  I love that extra attention in their service.    I'd definitely come back again.

aNnbpVXEgXLMEnJPgM7bUA.text: The Double Eagle Prime Strip Steak was out of this world delicious.  Perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection.  It really just melted away in your mouth.  The crab cake was also really good.  I haven't had too many so I can't say how they compare, but it was so good I was cleaning up the sauce with the bread.  I did the dishwasher a favor as good as I cleaned up that plate.  Me and my girl shared the crab cake and steak in order to leave room for their famous lemon cake and am I sure happy we did.  We NEVER get dessert but we just had to try this one after all the reviews we read.  It really is worth all the hype and by far the best cake I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of my Double Eagle Prime Strip steak, medium rare.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.

rAnBvN7V2gGS8Y0zgAEG0Q.text: What a fantastic evening!  The lamb and steak medallion trio was absolutely perfect. Had the peppercorn sauce on the side of the lamb...no need. Lamb was delicious on its own! Medallions were cooked to perfection. Joe our server was fantastic and spot on with his options. David the manager was very personable and a pleasure to talk to. Our first time visit will not be our last!

XpiJgGXQAR-U1A1bLb9DBg.text: If I could give Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House 10 stars if I could. Highly recommend this steakhouse for date night, anniversaries, birthdays or a business dinner. Del Frisco's is known for a few items. 1. The VIP pineapple martini. House-made pineapple infused vodka makes the cocktail so fresh! 2. The crab cakes. 3. The lobster mac and cheese.  You have to get the lobster mac n cheese. And lastly, the Lemon cake. A tower of layer after layer of lemon and a lemon curd icing. How could you go wrong? The service is outstanding. We had Bradley and he was fabulous! He gave us just enough attention without being overbearing. Once we were seated we had or drinks within 5 minutes. 10 minutes we had out salads and 15 minutes later we had our entries. Mid way through our meal  Bradley asked if he could "refresh" my VIP martini (which means to re-shake over ice). I've never had a server ask to refresh anything of my meal. The best steak meal in Las Vegas without spending an arm and a leg. I would recommend Del Frisco's over any steak house in Las Vegas. Hands down the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lemon cake of all lemon cakes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic and white wine string beans
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n cheese

ueMJDSFJZ9FXHLCv1j_1lg.text: I guess the reviews do not lie. They claimed to have the best steak in town, which was not far from the truth. We ordered the filet mignon which was very tender, soft and juicy. The quality of the meat was great. We also ordered lobster Mac N Cheese which was delicious! This side dish was creamy, full of flavor and with big chucks of lobster. I would totally recommend it. For our 2nd side we selected the sauteed mushrooms which were also good but very average.  For our appetizer we got the crab cake. This dish was well cooked, filled with plenty of crab, swimming in a delicious brown sauce. I wished $22 dollars would get you two crab cakes, but unfortunately you only get one.  For dessert we got the lemon cake. The portion size is huuuuge! However, I thought it was overly sweet. I personally did not care much for it.  I enjoyed the atmosphere and the customer service. Every single employee was very friendly and well trained. Overall, a good place to enjoy a good meal with excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon mac and cheese lobster and sautéed mushroom
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake

SiwmRHfn7hY3XgExZ1nzig.text: I wanted to take my hubby to a nice steakhouse for his birthday weekend, and decided to go here due to the great yelp reviews.  I perused the menu prior to our arrival and while I'm not a big steak person, found there was plenty on the menu for me to choose from.  We arrived early and were seated right at our reservation time.  Soon after we were seated, we were given a loaf of a sesame seed covered bread and butter.  The bread was hot and very good.  I ordered a chopped salad that was the nightly special.  It was chopped iceberg lettuce, with green onions, bacon, tomatoes, avocado, cheddar cheese and a basil dressing.  It also came with bleu cheese which I left off.  It was okay - not great.  The cheddar was somewhat bitter and didn't really go with the other flavors in the salad.  My hubby had the famed crabcake appetizer.  He thought it was good, but not great.  For our meals he ordered the ribeye steak (medium rare), and I just got two sides.  I got the au gratin potatoes and asparagus.  His steak came out rare, so they put it back on to cook to medium rare.  He liked it, but there was nothing about it that stood out.  I tried a bite and it was good!  I did like the potatoes and was happy to bring the rest home to eat later.  The asparagus was well cooked.  Not at all tough as it can be.  Service - was good but not.  It took three requests for my hubby to get a glass of ice.  When our meals were brought, our server asked if we would like more bread, but it never came.  Our server kept asking if everything was amazing - it was good but not amazing and it made me feel uncomfortable to be asking that.  We were discussing the goods and bads and were wavering about whether to give a review of 3 or 4 stars, when they brought out a beautiful piece of lemon cake for his birthday.  It was huge!  The cake was the tipping point in our review,  We were seated near the James Bond room, which I had read about.  We enjoyed our meal.  I just didn't think it had anything that really distinguished it from Morton's, Ruth's Chris, or any other local excellent steakhouse with similar pricing.

6-xG1g0IYgc713e_YuHdUA.text: This experience started out horrible without any improvements. The manager really tried to correct things, but the ship started sinking from there! Went in, got bread, ate a loaf before we even got water to drink. Then, the lamb was extremely rare, steak was poor quality, lobster had NO fresh flavor. We ordered a $61 appetizer, seafood, eat the crabs with our hands and had to sit around and wait for clean hand towels. First set was dry, second set was dripping wet. Back to the beginning, we will never go back nor recommend this place. We still spent almost $400. A real disappointment. This is the second time we have ever left a restaurant to go eat at another.  A real disappointment.

h57IGpKAX5jtya_NpvS3wQ.text: I have been to Del Frisco's twice in the past few months - one for pleasure, one for business.    When I came on my own, it was one of the best meals I had ever experienced in Las Vegas.  I started with a salad and the house mix drink.  I then had the filet which was cooked to perfection.  I ended with a lemon cake (apparently their specialty), to finish the outstanding meal.  Also included was a nice bottle of red wine, shared with some great company.  That visit alone was a five star worthy dining experience that would have been tough to beat.  And that review does not include the amazing James Bond table located in the restaurant that is a must see.  My second time at this restaurant, for a business event, included many appetizers and drinks.  The waitress, first off, was not as attentive as my first stay.  My drink took a while to get to me and when I ordered coffee it took abut 20 minutes to get a refill.  The appetizers were hit or miss as well.  The bruschetta, sushi, and lamb chop were very good, but the spring rolls and crab were not as great.  The mix drinks were as great as my first visit, however.  Overall, I believe Del Frsico's would average about 4 or 4.5 stars if I went there enough.  It is expensive but I will definitely be back to try their outstanding steak and mix drinks again if I want a great meal a little off the strip.

2nxYsPHBp4BX6tF8IFjEjw.text: Excellent steakhouse with great service & food!! The escargot, tomahawk steak, shrimp cocktail, potatoes & sides were on point!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rt1wse4z0V7gKvFFqRwL4Q.text: This place deserves a five star truly. We had a birthday party and they set the table with flowers and staff signed birthday card. Everything from service to food is perfect to the very detail. We had such a joyful night and I wish I can spread the word so more people can enjoy this place.

KoqKcemGaRlmYLuel8HWhA.text: I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars because although the food was amazing I did find tin foil of some sort in my mashed potatoes. For the price point I wasn't expecting to see something else on my plate other than food. Other than that the food was great, I got the steak medallions and my bf got a strip steak. Both of them had great flavor, however I felt as if each medallion was cooked differently, as I ate each one it got more and more raw. I eat my steaks medium rare so it didn't bother me much, other than the inconsistency. We also got their lobster mac n cheese as a side dish, nothing too spectacular but it was good. The best part we ha me was dessert, we got their butter cake! A must try if you go here, it will not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake for an appetizer! AMAZING!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak medallions.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip steak w/ truffles, truffle oil, and crab.

6vc_N22qA87CRHeNI7gU8w.text: A nice ny eve dinner (second year in a row) was somewhat thrown off by being offered seating in the furthest spot in the place, so far from the main dining room we couldn't even hear a faint version of the music, that we had to ask for the seater to try again. Cocktail waitress was partially professional - heard laughing at other tables, not well organized.and was happy to take my sons order for the Lobster and not even advise of the  nearly 90.00 price. Thanks for that. He didn't even eat it. Cocktails were watered down, inconsistent, glassware too large and not modern. It's time to put a beverage program together. It's 2017. Service was not well executed and both staff and volume were moderate at the time, so considered a miss.  Not sure of "if" or when I'm coming back for a 457.00 check with tip for a dinner for 3, 1 app, no dessert, 3 glasses of wine, 2 cocktails. Too many better places to go for that price.

E42Q_6KX8weqQ00K5uRzvA.text: We went for a team dinner for work, and it was exceptional. My bone in ribeye was cooked perfectly at medium rare. The lobster mac and cheese is a must have!!! We did have one steak that was not quite cooked enough, they quickly took the steak back to the grille and brought it to the right finish, ensuring their customers were happy. The sides are huge. We had the Charles Krug Cabernet ... best value on the menu at $68 for the bottle.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zy6kH0ATejUQrJqRhsXSIg.text: No matter what I'll be a carnivore until the end.  Enter -- Del Friscos ... a steak lovers paradise.  ATMOSPHERE:  As many on here have said, its got that James Bond, Rat Pack, vintage vibe. Which when you think about it goes well with steak and scotch.  I love the live piano music, helps you unwind and just enjoy your meal. I've sat in many areas here, I'm not crazy about the back rooms, I rather be where the action is at, make reservations if you go on a Friday or weekend night.   FOOD:  This is why you go...for the food. First of all let me give Del Friscos props for the great seafood, always fresh, and always cooked just right. Lets start with the crab cakes, I've been to Maryland, these crab cakes remind me of the real deal, nice chunks of crab and served on a delicious creole like sauce. Lobster mashed potatoes!!! Lobster anything is good but oh my goodness, I would go back just to have this dish alone and I'd be fine. Seriously the best mashed potatoes in this city bar none. Steak, I stick to the 16 oz and 22 oz ribeye steaks... you really can't go wrong with any cut here. It comes down to two factors flavor and cooking. They cook the steaks just right here, but when you take that first bite your not just eating meat, the rub used on the steaks propel the steaks at Del Friscos into a league of their own. I mean I've had so many steaks here in Vegas, for some reason flavor lacks more than anything at most restaurants. But with a great steak should be a cocktail just as good, I recommend the Scottish Smash...you can be modest and get scotch or an old fashioned. My only complaint is that the drinks aren't consistent, some nights I can tell my cocktail was made in a rush. If you have a sweet tooth I recommend the chocolate souffle not too sweet and just the right consistency comes with a nice scoop of vanilla bean ice cream.   CUSTOMER SERVICE:  As you'd expect at a fine dining experience the customer service at Del Friscos is exceptional. I've never had to really ask for anything twice or sometimes ever at all. Staff is very friendly and welcomimg.  Four stars because there's an unpleasant smell in the restaurant, and thats part of the experience also drink consistency should be valued. My top pick for a great steak and nice night in Vegas.

_eSE7P6nELjmGeivdMTr4Q.text: I never leave meat.....but this was TOO much! ! One of the best steaks EVER.  24oz porterhouse with green bean side, lobster Mac and cheese potato something lol lost it while eating the meat. I would highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JulCepf0GHasO2HEG21DUw.text: Great steak and wine list, can be price but prime meats cooked to perfection. Classy service as any good steak place

jm8_Jarwoytfbu5o4YF1Yw.text: Best crab cakes and filet mignon ever!  First class restaurant.  They get their meat from Chicago.  You will be amazed how good it is!!  They also make a good dirty martini!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xvzScZAIWOUTfsuAIQgtzw.text: I think this is my favorite steakhouse. Always greeted with a smile and great service. This trip was about the VIP drink and the lemon cake. So we started with the VIP drink and it was all that. Order a smaller steak to save room for the lemon cake. The steak was nice and tender. We also had crab cakes some of the best crab cakes I ever had. Now it's time for the cake....man was it on point. We had a few bites and put the forks down because we was full, but then the cake was calling my name....took a few more bites.... Had them wrap the rest to go. The cake was better the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake - Good
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VIP drink - smooth operator

kdz34HlCGSrfUtSSh7GxvQ.text: Went with a large group on a Saturday night and was very disappointed at both the food and the service.  Entrees and side dishes came up haphazardly and several were very poorly prepared. Don't mind spending the money, but you expect a little recognition when things are f.u.  They didn't seem to be concerned.   Won't go back

I639ehZEDb6cx-Mav_zSHg.text: Great in some aspects and terrible in others.  The good: - Service is exceptional: I love how our waiter anticipated our requests and brought out things before we even asked for them. I felt very well taken care of. I never once asked for extra butter, or bread, or water or drinks!  - 8 oz filet - cooked perfectly to my liking  The bad: - Del's Salad: absolutely disgusting, Denny's salad tasted better than this! Really! - Spinanch and corn sides: let me supress my gag reflex. Both were dripping cream and hard to swallow, I had to wash down my one bite with half glass of water. yuck!  $49 prix fix dinner includes a salad, 8oz filet with a choice of seafood, and a side. Not a bad deal. Although, the only thing I would order here is the meat and that's all.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf &amp; turf

loJVXmX6sDPFNIZp0iT4kA.text: Excellent steakhouse off-strip in Vegas.  Came here with a party of 8 and the service was impeccable.  All of our food came out at the same time and each cut was cooked to perfection.  We ordered just about every side and they were all good as well.    Definitely recommend.  Relatively casual vibe; lots of people came in what looked like golfing gear.  I want to try this place again but save some space next time to try the desserts.

GQFNEJr_U98thD-cLzooXg.text: Ok.. I'll make this interesting.... EVERYTHING was amazing except our server. We'll call her special. When asking our drink order we implied that we would like to start off with soda water while we figure out whats for dinner and then will pick out a wine. She then asks if we would like sparkling, flat, or ice water, and then takes our glasses and wine list away. We thought maybe they just don't carry normal club soda.   The assistant comes by with VOSS sparkling water and then she comes by with two little bottles of soda water.... NOW, why would I want two different kinds?! She's so pretty... My favorite part was instead of apologizing or clearly understanding the situation she replies, "to each their own." Kind of rude and strange that she chose that as her answer.  My other half then tries to stop and get her attention and she does the finger of "give me a second," so she can clear off the table next to us who clearly weren't in a rush. The bartender acknowledges how adorable she is and comes over to assist us. After ordering some champagne and starters only half of our starters show up.. Tells us that's all she was told to put in.. PLEASE can you just own up to the mistakes already.  Anywho, aside from our model server and a few other "mistakes" the food was nothing short of phenomenal!! Do not skip out on their in-house pineapple vodka either! Om nom nom.

zsqUu4H0sctzkpwwk_32kw.text: What a classy joint. This is a definite splurge but the food is out of this world. Crab cakes were perfection with no filler. Even though the place was packed, service was attentive and super friendly, and when our waiter was running around the managers stopped by to make sure we were happy. I really enjoyed this meal. Also get the bacon appetizer, you won't be disappointed!

FsdzlG0cxt3G2G-Mn-_4DQ.text: Came out to Las Vegas for my boyfriends birthday and went to dinner to this steakhouse ... my boyfriend absolutely loved it , the environment was amazing & the service was beyond outstanding and the food was DELICIOUS !

i5MfRB2O1fpzsqYZc47z5A.text: Tried the 16 oz bone in filet and was overall very pleased with its texture and flavor. I like how they have you cut the steak to verify it's cooked to your standards. The service was overall very attentive and professional. They seated our large party of 20+ in a private room.   The lobster mac was above average and I liked it better than Mastro's. The brussels sprouts were very plain tasting and one of the worst I've tried. The crab cake appetizer was exquisite! I would get at least 1 for every 2 people because you're going to want multiple bites. The escargot was also really good and would share with at least 3 or more people as it's very rich.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster mac and mashed potatoes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. brussels sprouts up top (shredded)

gEydIXjvPkI9fCNLd8X6SQ.text: Service was great... Roland was amazing... unfortunately... the steaks not so much.. my dry age NY strip was so hard I could barely cut it with a knife.. and the inches of fat was less to be desired.. also the flavor was not on point as I have had many dry age steaks that were out of this world ... I asked for a filet instead... MR and it came out cold and raw in the middle... I had to send it back and the manager came to to check to see if we were good...  i clearly was not good and very disappointed.... I will not be coming back ... it was my birthday tonight and I thought tonight was going to be special... this experience ruined my birthday

oEs2DpLl3DddqFgxgBE8aw.text: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House was a recommendation by one of my managers. He insisted that this is a "must try" if I'm in the Las Vegas area.  I ended up having a business trip in Las Vegas a couple weeks back and the words "double eagle" popped up a few times. I decided to give it a try with my colleagues to see what it was all about. We made a reservation, walked in, and was amazed by the service and decor of the restaurant. This place was super high end. It was everything you would expect at a Vegas steakhouse.  We started our meal with the tuna tartare and a glass of wine each. The tartare was fresh and tasty, but nothing too amazing. The Pinot Noir that I got supplemented the tartare pretty well.  Now for the entree. We ordered the 45-day dry aged ribeye, the bone in ribeye, and the prime strip. When it came out, the portion looked bigger than expected. Each cut tasted amazing. The prime strip was dense and well seasoned. The meat quality was absolutely amazing. My bone-in ribeye was juicy and tender. I prefer a more fatty type of meat when choosing steaks. Out of the 3 steaks, my vote goes to the dry aged ribeye. That piece of meat was stacked with intense flavoring and was cooked to perfection. The extra 45-day aging gave it a rich and tender taste, unlike the other 2 cuts that we ordered.   By the end, we were stuffed. Our check came out to about $115 a person. Was the steak good? Hell yes! Was it worth $115? I would say no. I'm from Los Angeles and I know of quality steakhouses for half the price. If you want to have the Vegas experience, give this place a try.

Jpj1J9sEZEVviWCjjqPYyQ.text: it's been an 8 year hiatus from del frisco's and...  i am happy to announce that the quality and experience is still consistent.  dropped by saturday to celebrate my friend's birthday and wow did they make it memorable!  food and service were top notch (i think morgan?  was super sweet!).  my 8 oz filet was perfection.  my friend who eats her steak literally right off of a cow (blue, rarest of the rare) was happy with her bone-in filet.  i did wish we were sat out in the main dining area so that we can hear the live music... instead we were placed in a separate room which was much quieter.  the ambience was a little different.  they surprised my friend with a birthday treat which consisted of their version of buttercake (which tasted like a snickerdoodle cookie a-la-mode), warm brownie, AND another scoop of vanilla ice cream.  i mean, wow!  over the top service.  i did think our sides (del frisco potato and cream spinach) were a little bit more on the salty side, not sure if that can be adjusted, but next time i'll keep in mind to hold off on heavy salt.  the only regret?  is that they don't have a location in southern california :(

SYnEp48QjkBP5QJVOfEpCA.text: Birthday Celebration for my hubby in Vegas.. food was delicious as always... staff was friendly.. waiter was awesome!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CpbBVt-lrCKdilfhM61RWg.text: Didn't live up to my expectations.  I was pretty excited to celebrate me and bf's anniversary here and with so much good Yelp reviews, we booked our reservations here.  We were greeted upon arrival but had to wait for our table. People at bar were very loud and was praying not to be seated near that area. The hostess in the front seemed all over the place.  We ordered beef carpaccio for appetizer, rib eye for our entree with side of mash and creamed spinach. We both sent back our steaks coz it was cooked rare but we asked for medium rare. I wasn't impressed about the side dishes as well. Presentation looks ugly - it looks like they just slapped it on the plate. The waiter scooped mash potatoes into my plate with huge chuck of butter on it! Aiyayay!  In addition, we didn't know who was our waitress coz it kept changing!   Overall, we felt like they were all over the place and didn't have it all under control.   With so many steakhouses in the area, I'll prolly not come back here.

PkgF6ONoT97nKiGPJOc2PQ.text: Came here to celebrate my brother's birthday.  The food and service here was great.  I ordered the special that had 3 cuts with various sauces.  All was good but one.  I tried the Tomahawk, and I would say that is one very delicious piece of meat.  The sides were also great.  I gave this place a 5 star because the food and service was spectacular and amazing.  I was stuffed and just wanted more of the sides.  The tomahawk had a great flavor to it and my 3 cuts had a very diverse taste.  The Truffle Butter Sauce was great and definitely worth getting to put on your steak.  Since we also were celebrating my brother's birthday, we received a complimentary slice of lemon cake.  That cake was amazing and very tasteful.  Worth trying out, even if it is off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Del Frisco Special, 3 cut steak with various sauces.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cake.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Butter Sauce.

DiyYVh9ZD1OuVnOVBAZadg.text: We visited Del Frisco's on our last visit to Las Vegas just after Christmas. We made reservations on line and arrived early to have a cocktail.  After a cocktail we were then seated for dinner.  Since my guy is an Executive Chef himself we knew what we wanted to order. We started off with a bottle of wine and were very pleased to see that they had an extensive wine list that included wine from the Valle de Guadalupe, Baja. We choose the Cascabel and were not disappointed. We ordered the dry aged rib eye, filet mignon and king crab legs.  Our server and wait staff were very attentive and took care of every need. As our dinner came to an end to our surprise we were brought out a slice of delicious lemon cake, "compliments from the Chef".  Then out came Executive Chef Guerrero to introduce himself to my Executive Chef Castillo.  What an honor, for Executive Chef Guerrero to take time out of his busy Friday evening to talk with us was beyond amazing.  We love Vegas and will return for dinner again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

31geZHcBwFRmdje1BFk5sQ.text: Excellent food and excellent service! We tried the wagyu sampler - it is every bit as good as you would imagine. The sides and starters were just as fantastic as the meal. Our server was friendly, polite, and made some great suggestions. We even got to try some special tequila that they had just gotten in. Superb!

gvivf5uxmSYJ3My82gXhgg.text: We had dinner here with friends last Saturday. This restaurant came highly recommended by friends.  What was odd - we got a text from them before we even arrived, saying our table was ready and to please close out our tab in the bar??? I called them and said we weren't due there for another hour and we were not in the bar.  We arrived and were seated in a very loud dining room, and served by an enthusiastic, boisterous young woman. We started with wedge salads and Del salads and they were delicious but we waited what felt like too long to get them. Just as we were about to take our first bite, the manager came over to introduce himself and insisted on shaking each of our hands. He didn't seem to notice that we just got our food or that each of us was holding a fork in mid air waiting to take a bite, and he went on rather than moving on and letting us eat. His demeanor was awkward and the whole exchange was probably well intended but didn't hit the mark. My husband was very annoyed by it.   The porterhouse my friends had was very flavorful and perfectly prepared. I had the filet medallions and they were also tasty and cooked perfectly, but the side of mashed potatoes was stone cold. The side of au gratin potatoes we got for the table to share arrived cold in the middle and we sent them back. The new order came out and was also cold in the middle and the potatoes were under cooked and crunchy. The flavor was good, tho.  3 of us had perfect martinis and the coffee service was good. We enjoyed the bread pudding and butter cake desserts and they were awesome, we just about licked our plates.  I would come back and just have a different expectation. I thought for the price point it would be a fine dining experience, and it was just much more casual than that and there didn't seem to be fine dining attention to some of the details.

-yHtRZrXrzcca57iu9jn1g.text: This place was absolutely out of this world.  Starting with the crab cake ,  the Chilean Sea Bass and the Bone in Rib eye steak the food was absolutely amazing. The attention to detail in everything that was brought to our table.  To top our evening off, the service was far beyond  what we could have imagined. The knowledge of the food given by Travis was astounding . Thank you to Lauren and your staff for a wonderful evening, we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_LlNPTaqe5ELh1q9uxeilg.text: Wow... I don't know what the hype is all about. I know we should of asked how the steak look like when it was raw. I wanted to see the marbling. What we had was not a good steak. Our server recommended the double bone in rib eye 45 days dry age. We ate at a lot of amazing steak restaurants in town and out of town. We were so excited. But when we got it,  It had no flavor. It was bland. SO DRY. No moisture. Not juicy at all. I had asked for medium rare. It was overcooked to a medium. Of course , we didn't want to make a scene because it was our dad's retirement. Disappointed we spent so much on a bad cut. It was dry and over cooked. The best was the lobster Mac and cheese and the the sphaghetti squash gratin. Service was good but their meat is not worth going back. Bad experience.

bWL4IheTBVuOe2UUdQi8iw.text: Hands down this place lived up to its reputation for steaks. I had the rib eye and it was one of the best steaks I've had in my life. My wife and I met up with some Friends here for restaurant week. I had the lobster bisque for starters and it was great. There was a lot of lobster meat on it. Again, the steak was great and the cheesecake for the dessert was amazing. Now the reasons for 4 stars instead of 5. I thought it was just me but all of  us at our table were hot. We would feel the a/c turn on periodically but it's safe to say we were uncomfortable the entire time. As for service, all the staff members were very pleasant. However, our dishes were missing something twice. I ordered my steak with truffle butter and that was missing until I had to remind the waiter. My wife's crab cakes were missing green beans while my friend's crab cakes had them. Attention to detail would've made this obvious. We also had to ask about the bread that all tables get while waiting for food. Aside from those issues, this place is great....just please turn the a/c on...

AsF6-x9sdVGDxQNp_A5RpQ.text: Not much to say but great service, AMAZING FOOD and great atmosphere. I had the best ribeye that I've ever eaten in my life and my date also loved his filet.  They have a good menu with lots of choices! Don't look at the price, the food is worth it.. Remember you get what you pay for(;

J3sDu2tUkfzezucjJJz05g.text: Over 1200 reviews of this place. I can add nothing new or noteworthy other than my brief two cents worth. What can two pennies get you? How about this...  It's not cheap. $$$$ means "expensive" so don't freak out about a $16 cocktail or $59 a la carte steak.   Service is exceptional from the front desk staff to the bartender to the waitresses and the service staff. When six people come into your private dining room to individually serve the side dishes...that's pretty cool.   Delicious drinks, hot and cold appetizers, steaks, sides and dessert. Our valuable clients, coworkers and vendors had a marvelous time.

q_cXpi4-bSNUDp4syaI2vg.text: Food and service was impeccable if I had a criticism it would be that we were handed the bill before we asked fore it.  I find that insulting and should never happen. When that happens I feel that I'm being asked to leave I almost understand when they have  people waiting and no empty tables but when there are empty table and no one waiting not ok !

KHCw1JCe6tibESk94AG_Cw.text: I'd been holding off on Del Frisco's for at least a year. It must be the highest rated  if not in all of Vegas, at least off the strip. I had a friend tell me about his experience at the one in NY and  trusted his word that I'd be coming in here to get some of the best meat around...  Their parking lot welcomes you before valet does, strange set of events. The steakhouse is classic in theme. You won't find any STK vibes here but rather 'pardon my reach' type service.   As for the wait, well I guess I'll never know because half of our party had already been seated. But service was all around attentive. Sides served onto your plate, the way it should be done. I was very impressed with how quickly your drinks (alc and no alc) are brought over too. Very high quality.  Food  Appetizers  Shanghai-Style Fried Calamari: You can taste the "shanghai" in this. A nice contemporary twist on the calamari. 4.25/5  Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes: The best crab cakes I've had up to date. They were so rich in flavor that they felt like a seafood dessert. Their cajun lobster sauce soaked in just perfect to add what it needed to add to it. 4.75/5  Tomahawk Chop: I was left unimpressed. It was cooked to the medium rare but I could not find the rich juicy flavor that is advertised with it. At the chew, it comes in nicely but that is the only spot where you can taste its quality. Tempting but I would opt for another cut. 2.75/5  For sides, I tried their mushrooms and onions, spinach, onion rings and baked potato. They were all delicious with the exception of the onion rings that were under fried and could still taste the batter with most bites. The mushrooms and onions along with the spinach were the most impressive.  It was an early dinner so I passed on drinks as stamina means all in Vegas.  I enjoyed my dinner at Del Frisco's. Even though the meat did not 'meat' my expectations everything else either met or surpassed them. They do have many other delicious cuts of meat that is forcing my future to include them in it.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7MqOIyBZOt-C9E7akJt7WQ.text: We made a reservation for Tuesday nights and man was I good that we did this place was extremely packed the first thing that set me off was the fact that they set us in a room where there is a huge party next to us celebrating their birthdays and they were Extremely Loud although it's not the restaurants fault but they probably should take into consideration that some people are on a date and they would actually like to talk to each other . so let's get onto the food, first off they only have seafood appetizers which I don't eat sorry I just don't , we did decide to get a 12 oz filet mignon and then my husband got their special which was 3/4 Oz steaks prepared in three different ways which you said was delicious.we did order some onion rings and french fries but you're also not on the menu but they could do anyways which was awesome . unfortunately the onion rings were eight of them and they were as big as my hand so I would highly recommend that you share those if at all possible my steak had very little flavor, it actually was prepared a little more done than I would have liked but other than that it tasted fine. including both steaks ala carte sides and salad and two drinks our bill was over $200 so make sure you come prepared to spend at least that much. We always love to enjoy a nice new high-end Steakhouse in every city we visit this place was no difference and met all of our expectations

_9kZBKRO5gU4YjHpFKyu1A.text: Roland was absolutely amazing this evening! A server that truly knows how to take care of his Guests! Every question I asked he had an answer to. He knew how to articulate the menu that was sophisticated, knowledgeable, and easy to understand. I'm so happy I took his suggestions, without being pushy, and he was there whenever needed. Kudos to Anthony , the Wine Director as well! I'm looking forward to a repeat visit very soon! Thank you for making the night special!

WrHHeMFax9PWqGQc-3-dwA.text: This place was absolutely out of this world.  Starting with the crab cake ,  the Chilean Sea Bass and the Bone in Rib eye steak the food was absolutely amazing. The attention to detail in everything that was brought to our table.  To top our evening off, the service was far beyond  what we could have imagin . The knowledge of the food given by Travis was astounding . Thank you to Lauren and your staff for a wonderful evening, we will definitely be back.

rn8DgBYCu8sg6htjEdz1jg.text: Thank you to the del frisco's staff we came in for our 26th anniversary Jason made it extra extraordinary he was very attentive William our waiter had a wonderful smile and a great attitude. Thank you again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 26th anniversary

AnwviMawt3UIK8Fa0QwcFQ.text: Delicious food and our waitress Morgan was very accommodating and nice. We were 3 with no reservations in shorts and t-shirts (there's a dress code we didn't know about), and they let us eat at one of their cocktail tables. We had to wait quite a bit at the beginning because no one usually eats in the bar.  The hostess assigned us a waitress and we ordered wagyu carpaccio, fried octopus, potatoes au gratin(?), mashed potatoes, 2 prime strip and 1 prime rib eye (all 16 oz and dry aged for 45 days). We told her we were in a bit of a hurry because we had to catch our flight home soon and she made sure our orders would come to us ASAP which we really appreciated.  Everything was DELICIOUS :D Wagyu carpaccio was succulent and a very nice entree to open up our appetites. Fried octopus is what it is and they did it well. The veggies was a nice counter to the oiliness of the fried part. This was the first time I had dry aged steak and it was amazing! I had the prime rib at medium rare of course and the juices of that steak were delicious. I also ordered an old fashioned and it was very nice.  Wish we had time to order desert but we had to go to the airport. The cost of the meal was well worth it. The service was amazing and the food was even more amazing. I would recommend making a reservation before going, we were lucky the cocktail table was clearing up 10 mins after we came in.

fZsb6GpzwIK1RiHpOh9eCA.text: Most amazing upscale steakhouse I've ever been to on the Strip.  I went there solo just because I felt like it, and was treated like royalty.  The steaks were amazing. The sides sublime.  Desserts were impeccable.  I will go back for sure.

qjbbHad6Yb3fm0yM0R6CdA.text: We try to go to a steakhouse whenever we are in Las Vegas and this time we chose Del Frisco's. First we generally do not care for casino steakhouses because they are overpriced and do not have to cater to their customers, they can rely upon the casino customers to provide business. Del Frisco's was very impressive, great atmosphere, very helpful staff, uncrowded and subdued lighting (not dark but reduced). We each ordered a different steak and all of us were extremely please with our choices, the meat was prime and they were each cooked to perfection. Some say you can judge a steakhouse on their scalloped potatoes and if that is the standard then Del Frisco's gets 5 stars. Both our waiter and his assistant were very helpful with the wine list (over 1600 choices) and also with the dessert menu. Del Frisco's will definitely be on our list of places to return to on our next trip.

65aDHPmQFxRRIh2ONQjtnQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised of how much I enjoyed my meal at Del Frisco's!! I ordered the salmon, and it was wonderful!! The interior is also very beautiful. It's nice to eat at a steakhouse where the beauty of the inside matches the quality of the food. Very expensive, but worth the price. I'll definitely come back, but it might be a little while, because, like I mentioned, the food's definitely not cheap here.

PhPDNvBbN3Fw-1H5XTvQvQ.text: Insane service topped on ridiculously good food. Buyer beware: the longer something is aged, the less it tastes like a steak. More nuanced than enhanced. Still can't go wrong tho.

rSn2PamZr6kXmf7zLEbYbA.text: From the second I stepped in, till I left, amazed. The service is excellent and very polite. There wasn't a single dish my date and I didn't enjoy. I'm a very picky eater and usually modify every dish. I didn't touch a single modification, and everything was just far what I expected. The filet medallions where perfect for me, and the 45-day dry age ribeye was great for him. I wouldn't change a single thing about my experience. Thank you to everyone who stopped at our table and had a conversation with us, we appreciated every greeting and congratulations from each of you. We can't wait to come back.

n0Nysv942AYkD-nn-VXaOw.text: This is the worst steakhouse I have ever been to.  Steak was over cooked and had to argue with them to get a replacement.  The GM was on site and she should be ashamed at what here restaurant is doing.  I would never come back here.

iclXw4al3E30Xvw7E5us-w.text: I came here with a group of friends on New Years Eve and we are happy to say we were pleased! We were on our way to Vegas for NYE and were debating on what new places to try. We wanted to try a steak restaurant. We did some Yelp searching and found Del Frisco's. We called to make reservations and were happy to have been able to book a reservation for 9:15 PM on NYE.   The restaurant is behind the strip. But honestly such a great location in my opinion. We didn't have to endure much traffic to get to the restaurant. The restaurant was beautiful, elegant, and definitely fancy. Come nicely dressed! You'd want to match the restaurant and occasion. Service that evening had it's ups and downs. Upon sitting down, our server did a great job at explaining the menu to us. After taking some time to look at the menu, we each decided on a steak and appetizers to share. I got the Prime Porterhouse Steak and Lobster Mac and Cheese. This was where the service started to slow down. It took a while for our food to come out. Probably about 20-25 minutes or so. But that was expected since it was NYE. Once our food arrived, the servers did a nice job at presenting each of our dishes to us. and once they were done, it was time to eat! The Prime Porterhouse Steak was delicious. It was nicely cut and deliciously tender. It was well-seasoned and wonderfully cooked with some pink! Just how I like it. The Lobster Mac and Cheese was also great. It's not your typical mac and cheese. It wasn't too creamy nor cheesy, and was evenly spread with Lobster. Great appetizer in my opinion. Both are highly recommended!! My friends ordered other appetizers such as the Sauteed Wild Mushrooms and Pearled Onions, Thick-Cut Onion Rings, and Chateau Mashed Potatoes. The Sauteed Wild Mushrooms were really good. They were salty, but for some reason, really really good. The Thick-Cut Onions were huge! We were expecting something like the onion ring tower from Yardhouse. But these rings were ginormous! and not drowned in batter, thank goodness. But maybe they should have some kind of stuffing for filling, just a recommendation. The Chateau Mashed Potatoes were good. Greatly seasoned potatoes! All the steaks and appetizers came in very good portions. Don't let your eyes fool you. Everything was very fulfilling! We each split our steak with another person and shared our appetizers with one another. and woooo, we were stuffed! We even took some of our appetizers to go!  The Prime Porterhouse was 24 oz for $63. and the Lobster Mac and Cheese was $18.50. Great portions for the price, in my opinion.  We really enjoyed Del Frisco's and recommend it to everyone to come and try! Expect to spend a good amount of money because well, that's how Steak restaurants are. Paying for the quality. and in our experience, it was definitely there. We are glad to have tried Del Frisco's! Yay Vegas steakhouses!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Porterhouse Steak!

pR6yfBzKnLHzHdJVeNWsCw.text: Hello and welcome to Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House. We once again are participating in Restaurant week here in Las Vegas. We decided to dine off the strip this time and try a favorite of many and one that is on my bucket list. We arrived early for our 6pm reservation and only had to wait a small moment for us to be seated. We were given 3 menus. First was their regular menu, second was the restaurant week menu and third was a prix fix menu that they offer. On this occasion there were 4 of us in our party so there was a hope that many items would be tried. That was not the case entirely Josie ordered off the Restaurant week menu. She ordered the Del's salad which had a nice rich Avocado ranch and two glorious thick cuts of bacon on top. (BACON STRIPS!!!) Josie also ordered the 8 oz. filet with Mashed Potatoes. For dessert she ordered the Cheese Cake. Our friend ordered the same thing with the Lobster Bisque. Lobster Bisque was creamy and had lumps of fresh crab. I only had a taste but our friend enjoyed it to the last bite or drop. The filet was of good portion and perfectly cooked to a medium well for the two that ordered them. Mashed potatoes were excellent I had ordered them from off the house Prix Fix menu along with a Prime New York. This option was also 3 courses but did not offer a dessert. Since Josie ordered from her menu we shared her Cheese cake. More on that later. My new York prime strip was cooked a perfect Mid rare and was paired with a lump Crab Cake. So the mashed Potatoes are made with skin on, which I prefer. The had bits of celery and a bit of white pepper which added for me a great bite on the back of the tongue. The dessert Cheesecake was so velvet smooth on the pallet. It was not an ordinary cheesecake I have ever had. Each bite you could taste the cream cheese or slight sour note but not in a bad way.  Overall our meal was superb. Gavin was our server and he was st the ready and very attentive. I had a beer, Josie had Duckhorn Merlot and Terri had the VIP cocktail (two). She said they were quite tasty and we also had friends recommend it as well. I like a good beer with my steak. I should branch out. As I was saying service was great. Drinks refilled and nothing left wanting. Knowledge of Menu was also good.  We enjoyed the live piano music and even had a request that was fulfilled almost immediately. Nit sure if you can ask, but if you can ask to see the 007 table. I will add photos and video later.  Thank you for dining at Del Frisco's Double eagle Steak house. We will be returning and trying out more of the menu. They will be going through a renovation starting in July so we will have to delay a revisit a couple months. If you get a chance for the remainder of restaurant week please go and try the incredible food. Or just go there because. Call ahead because as I said they will be renovating soon.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i-mBY4JUizH3fkzD8TGWcA.text: The bar menu here is a great value, and the service at the bar was excellent also. Really, no complaints. I'm trying to think of something to critique but I have nothing. The other diners at the bar were friendly, polite, and had good sense of space (a problem in Las Vegas, where for some reason people-- mainly tourists probably-- love to crowd and jostle at bars). They even have a cigar patio where you can smoke a cigar after your meal.

jeQyY7rmDBc0otDGdCS1DQ.text: I though steak house is everywhere kinda same ! So I always decided by their atmosphere....   But simply this place's food are taste soooo good ! We had a big 30 oz bone in rib eye ... taste really good .  And next day I jus ate last nite left over steak .... I'm surprised still taste goood . Usually left over microwave steak was not good as flesh . So I realized steak quality is really good here !    We also order 1 pound big Alaskan king crab ...  yesssssss I could feel real taste of crab .   Usually I think Costco big rib eye and king crab are reasonable and taste good ...   But this place can't comparable wit Costco ! Lol   Service is here so professional and everybody so nice .  Everybody working here soooooo nice and kind !!!   Thank u !

cSdSiEe7ZZtlIXcs8Dyo_A.text: Received a note from the Ashleigh, promptly provide my email address and phone number. Much like the service no response. This place is a total joke, AVOID THIS RESTAURANT. Here's the bottom line, we were forgotten when we were there, the follow up was totally poor by Ashleigh. I will never return and will make sure that every personal and professional contact are aware of the awful service. I entertain clients 3-5 times a week and would be genuinely embarrassed if I brought them to this place restaurant . Shame on the management staff for completely dropping the ball. AGAIN, GREAT SERVICE COST $0.00! Get your house in order!

B8AffII2YXX3FrmPBGJbJA.text: We enjoyed our dining experience here, but we have had better for less money, and DF is definitely a "special occasion" restaurant for us based on the prices. The service is welcoming, friendly and professional. On the Sunday they offer a prix fixe special which my wife chose; Caesar salad, filet mignon with a crab cake, and a side dish of asparagus. The Caesar salad was not prepared table-side and was served as whole leaves rather that the traditional pieces which we both prefer, but the dressing was tasty. The 8 oz. filet was very tender, but needed more flavor while the crab cake was very flavorful and very rich, and the asparagus fresh but too crunchy and underdone for our taste. I skipped a starter to focus on a dry-aged ribeye with a side of creamed corn. This was my first experience with a "True" dry-aged quality steak, and if that is what you are after, this is the place to try it! I found the flavor to truly stand out from the wet aged variety, and the meat texture was also denser, not tough just more dense from the loss of moisture during the aging process. Personally, I would go with the wet-aged in the future, but no complaints and I'm glad I tried it! The cream corn was excellent and we both enjoyed it, and both side-dishes are definitely shareable. We each enjoyed a glass of Decoy Merlot which was a perfect accompaniment to our steaks. We were full, but we were presented with a complementary dessert for our anniversary; chocolate lava cake and a rich butter cake, both with small scoops of ice cream. We ate a bit of the delicious cakes and all the ice cream then had the remaining cakes packed to go. The meal was definitely enjoyable and we left fully satisfied. I recommend this restaurant be on you short-list of steakhouses, and judge for yourself if the high prices are worth it to you!

kHtDHgwyOnboaKQmb_02Qw.text: Came here on a Saturday night for my buddy's bachelor party; he had hyped about this place for a while now, saying it's the bastion of the best scrumpdiddlyumptious steak he's ever had for the exuberant amount of coins he paid with.  Wasn't too super busy on a Saturday for a party of 8.  The decor inside was your standard steak house affair, elegant with a lot of carpet and wood along with a dimly lit place to make women look prettier than they actually are.    Got sat in the corner away from people, which is a plus for a bachelor's party since we do tend to get a bit loud and rowdy.  Server was on point with every questions about the menu and played along with the joke when asked about using canned corn for their creamed corn (said they grew it in the back, good one).  He checked on us frequently, made sure our drinks were full and see if there's anything else he can do to make our dining experience a good one.  Did notice they had attractive women bring out the main course, I wonder if that heightens our appetite and puts a bit of bias on the meat, since we're already aroused at the sight of lovely ladies bearing steaks.    Back to the steaks, we ordered four steaks and sides for eight people on a "family style" way, which I thought was awesome since I didn't know of any other steak house that did this, in fact, most will charge you a "sharing fee" for such action.  I picked the uber expensive Wagyu Tomahawk chop, porterhouse, rib eye and strip steak on a medium rare, as no good steak should be eaten beyond medium rare.    Not sure if their precious, secret "salt" is laced with meth or crack but man, these were some of the best steaks we ever had!  Tender, juicy, flavorful are understatement.  Even the toughest strip had juicy hint of tenderness to it.  Wagyu axe was clearly the winner while ribeye and porterhouse were marbled beyond expectation.  And the crust, did I tell you how excellent the salt/pepper/crack laced crust was?  It was perfectly crisped with a just the right amount of salt, or maybe too much?  Who knows, but we killed those steaks.  Definitely going to bring back my wife here and eat more chops.  Whether they made up the whole "double eagle" grading is mystery but these guys can call it whatever they want, triple turkey, quadruple hawk, these steaks are GREAT.

2QvvHEWnWpB4jw8vCfvoaQ.text: The next level of steak if you try the Double Eagle! Spiced up with volcanic salt this ribeye cut is great!

ISa761QFm-wyvCL_ZJKV-w.text: So we're in Vegas and celebrating my friend's birthday. She wanted something special for herself, steak, so Jessica got what she wanted.  Was very easy to make reservations, we actually had our hotel set up dinner reservations for two about 3 hours in advance, no problem.  It's about 5 no more than minutes drive from the strip.   My friend REALLY decided to treat herself and for appetizer we ordered the crab cakes to start. Ala carte, one very large crab cake shared between the two of us and it was creamy and moist and juicy and savory.   Next my friend ordered the caviar, I don't know which of the two choices but it was $185/oz! I personally would never but grateful I got to have a taste of fancy sturgeon caviar. It's so special, the spoon also has to be made of mother of pearl. My first time trying it, it was not what I expected. I was expecting it to be very fishy and oceany. Actually, eating by itself, it's only mildly "fishy." Topped with sour cream and or egg yolks or egg whites and chives the blend of flavors are perfect together. Creamy, subtle, only mildly salty when you eat it with the buttered toast. Maybe once in your life you should try it.   For the main entree I ordered an 8 oz fillet mignon, medium rare with truffle butter. So tender, so juicy, cooked perfectly pink all the way through. So savory as well. Had to take home he extra because everything was so savory.  We also ordered a side of the aisle gratin. Fancy cheesy potatoes.   Birthday girl ordered the prime strip, 12oz medium rare as well. It honestly looked bigger than that.  For dessert, because it was her birthday we received a hugely generous complimentary lemon cake. And a adult delicious chocolatey bailey's creamish "Adult" milkshake for using the hotels concierge service.   But also for her birthday they wrote a nice little birthday card.   Everything was so good! So savory was not disappointed at all with the service and food. The staff were friendly and the food was above par.
