VFkEqH-oigzHljAkYHJx7Q.text: The food is pretty tasty, but the portions aren't as big as they claim to be, as regards to the appetizers and sides. Servers are friendly and attentative.

YLEpGPAduzvZKYcTEcwD5g.text: Okay, one of the best steak houses I've eaten at!    I spent New Year's in Las Vegas and this was one of the places we went for dinner.  We were also seeing the Cirque du Soleil Michael Jackson One after dinner so being in a slight rush, we were hoping they would be able to get our food out in time because we had to be seated by 6:45 pm at the Mandalay Resort.  Once we told them this, the serving staff were all very accommodating and stressed that they would put a rush on things.    I made a reservation through Open Table for 5:00 and they happen to open right at 5:00. Since we got there a little earlier so as not to miss our show, we had a few minutes wait before they could seat us so we waited at the bar. I ordered a VIP Martini which is their signature drink. Very refreshing indeed!  We were finally seated and my friend and I each ordered the Prime Strip which was 16 ounces (1 lb.) of delicious aged beef.  We were first served some great bread and butter.  I also had the Bleu Cheese Wedge Salad which was really nice, big and filling.  Along with the steak, we ordered sides of the sauteed mushrooms and asparagus with almonds.  Both were really delicious but I couldn't eat very much of it because I was getting really full from the steak which I was intent on finishing.  It was my main goal since I didn't want it to go waste and the besides the fact that it tasted so darn good, so tender with the right amount of seasoning and cooked to perfection, scrumptious!!  We asked the server how they prepared it and she told us so now I can hopefully replicate it at home sometime.  It'll probably won't be the same however because it never is when you try to do it at home.  I enjoyed the dinner immensely do I will definitely come back again when I'm in Vegas when I want a  steak because they do it up right here.  They have a nice decor with dark woods making the ambiance really comfortable and inviting.  If you're looking for a good steak house, I highly recommend coming to Del Frisco's because you won't be disappointed in the food or service.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VIP Martini, signature drink
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_J_g-nvxfbzgC5-nSKYDAA.text: Came to Del Frisco's to celebrate my man's birthday. Their customer service is on point. From the hostess to our servers, they all helped us to enjoy an incredibly delicious meal. We shared the Del Frisco salad to start and enjoyed the crisp bacon on top of the salad along with the dressing. We shared the prime rib with the Del Frisco potatoes. The prime rib melted in our mouths and the truffles and cheese on the potatoes were to die for. As if this wasn't enough they surprised my guy with a birthday plate of dessert. The molten chocolate cake was decadently good and the bread pudding was the star of the desserts. We were super happy and full. Left promising to return.

9aohmASgu7J2P2VtWnaN5A.text: If you love Happy Hour than I highly recommend Del Frisco's! The pineapple martini is so delicious! All the appetizers are fantastic. The bartenders, waiters and hostesses are all so professional and friendly. The piano player is simply amazing! If you prefer dining than you have also picked a winner. The steaks are delicious and I never leave without having the lemon cake for desert!

7tNmBCy8QfIN5ptvscR9Jw.text: My wife and I are vegan (99% of the time) but we need some steak about once a year. We were in Vegas for a weekend. What a great choice.  The decor was classy. Yes, there is an odd smell in the entrance vestibule. It is more of an earthy smell. Getting past that to the rest of the place reveals unpretentious yet high-class decor.  Our server was great (maybe she spoke too fast about the specials). Our service was almost perfect (we shouldn't have had to ask for our bottle of wine after having ordered it. We started our steak without it.). But those are picayune details. The food was simply great. The steak (prime in bone) was dreamy. I hadn't had a steak in a year. I can still taste it and smell it. We didn't have any special sauce (butter, etc) on it. One steak was perfect for both of us. We had lobster mashed potatoes (special that night) and a salad and some veggies. Very friendly service. Great quality meat. We shared a lot of dishes so our bill was reasonable.  All in all, this was a great way for me to get my once-a-year steak fix. This 99% vegan couple gives a double thumbs up.

Eqlo_KfAWPMvJ7W7ydTQSQ.text: Great steak. we came in with about 6 of us. everyone loved the food. I have a few food allergies and they were great to work with me. Service is good, Ribeye was perfect.  Its hard to go wrong here. Any steak will be good.

voEpRepvbJpC5P3zntDZEA.text: One of my favorite dining locations in Las Vegas.  The food is always good and service awesome.  Love it.  Highly recommend.

2JxC2EmYrDWU54Z-HKCZ_Q.text: I had to try their 45 day dry aged steak. It was terrible. After sending it back they told me they just started carrying it and the don't cut it in house. This place is off our list. Many stellar steak houses in town that stay True to form and serve good meat.

P_h4Ch7sdwBtDXpJ9F6roQ.text: My friend and everyone else in the Yelp world talks about this place and they are right; it is pretty good.  However, I have been ruined by Mastro's in the steakhouse segment. Anything and everything that isn't Mastro's is hard to impress me.   Service: our server was great! Super nice and attentive. He did try to upsell us a lot of things but it's part of his job but it was a bit much.   Bread: sesame bread loaf. Simple. Plain. Good thought. Hot. Fluffy... But plain for this type of place.   Salad: Caesar Salad is amazing. The dressing is garlicky but super good. We also had their house special chopped salad with a basil dressing and avocado and shredded cheese. Amazing!   Steak: Got the filet trip that came Bruno style with scallops, Oscar style with crab, and a filet with a slice of Brie. Scallop wasn't seared well. It was plain. Almost undercooked. The black truffle oil was super delicious! Crab was good.   Sides: lobster Mac and cheese. AMAZING. SUPER GOOD. SUPER CREAMY! amazing! Sweet yams.... Are you serious?!?!? These are so GOOOOODDD!!!   Overall, it was good. But like I said I'm ruined for life.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shanghai Calamari... More like Thai flavor.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l3IFAZCLgnXz3CARVJdl1Q.text: My second visit to Del Frisco's, only a few months apart. I was super satisfied on my first visit, and I wanted to come back and tackle on the 32 ounce Wagyu steak.   I learned my lesson last time by ordering all these appetizers, so I skipped it this time just so I can focus on the steak. And that Wagyu steak can deliver!!! Overall, a great experience, but I had a slightly better affinity to the 22 ounce bone in rib eye on my last visit.  At $90 a plate, the Wagyu steak is one of those where you can order once in your life, be satisfied, then go back to your favorite. Don't get me wrong, still a great steak and I will definitely come back to Del's, but I'll probably go back to the rib eye or try another steak.  I still devoured that steak, minus the bone, it came to about 26 ounces of meat. And I went for their lemon cake. That cake was so moist. My server this time was Tinae. She was superb and I wish her well on her school and studies.  They said that they're opening up a Del's in Santa Monica. I'll be one of the first to visit that place and order me their finest steaks.

OaUi9q8MSder9GmQhoIsCA.text: Amazing steaks and even better customer service without the inflated prices of steakhouses on the Strip!  Del Frisco's ranks up there as one of my favorite steak houses anywhere!  My friends and I did a side-by-side comparison of the 22oz Bone-In Prime Ribeye ($56) and the off menu 32 oz " American Wagyu" Long Bone Ribeye ($90).  Both were excellent and came out a perfect medium rare.  So much glorious beefy flavor I could hardly contain my excitement!  The flavor and quality was very similar to the bone-in ribeye at Mastro's which is my all time favorite steak.  Honestly though, I could not tell the difference between the Wagyu and the regular bone-in ribeye.  The Wagyu was supposed to be more marbled, more tender, more flavorful-- hence the higher price tag.  But if not for the Wagyu having that ridiculously long bone, I would have never tasted a difference.  Unless you have money to burn, I would recommend just sticking to the regular ribeye and saving some money.  I can't say enough about the customer service.  Everyone from the girl who took the reservation, to the hostess, to the servers were all super friendly.  Our waiter in particular was very knowledgeable about the menu, from the steak, to the seafood to the booze.  Their blitzkrieg method of bringing everyone food all at once is awesome.  There were literally 4 people at our small table cleaning up plates and dropping off food all in one fast fell swoop.  And speaking of booze, I highly recommend the VIP, a pineapple infused vodka cocktail.  Delicious and refreshing.  Get a pitcher because you're gonna want more than just one.  The only part of Del Frisco's that disappointed me was the sides.  We got garlic mash, sauteed mushrooms, and creamed corn.  They were all acceptable, but nothing really stood out.  Mastro's has their black truffle gnochi.  Lawry's has their creamed corn.  I think Del Frisco's lacks a signature irresistible side dish.  This is probably the only thing that prevents this from being a True 5 star review.  4.5 stars rounded up!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Lava Cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A perfect medium rare
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz Bone-In Ribeye

NkT-LMM5amPEn-4pv8O6Sw.text: This is probably one of my favorite steakhouses in town, I've been here a total of three times, one of which I did the full priced menu, the other two times the happy hour at the bar. Chase is the best bartender! He's the handsome one with they greyish hair. He's super helpful and knowledgeable, and friendly.   It was my birthday when I went yesterday, and they were so so accommodating to me. The piano player even played happy birthday and sang!! They comped one of my drinks and even gave me their lemon cake on the house! I got the steak salad on happy hour. Perfectly dressed and seasoned. The beef was phenomenal. The other two people I was with got fresh east coast oysters, the shrimp taster app, and a burger and fries. Everything was cooked perfectly. The bread is also excellent!   The only reason for the 4 and not 5 stars is for the cocktails I tried. I got a couple mixed on the menu and they honestly weren't my favorite. It seemed like each one didn't really taste like what the menu described. The paloma one tadted like cough syrup and vicks. But hey. To each their own.   Love this place! Can't wait to come back for a steak.

8jdrOeezaYbbs0kyrK-1UA.text: Went here on a Saturday night. Service was top notch and the food was really good. We got the calamari appetizer, which was delectable. I got the tomahawk steak which is 32 ounces of meat which I split with my father (they cut it off the bone at your table and it can be cut proportionate to how you want to split). We also got a few sides - onion rings, which were massive and delicious, asparagus topped with almonds, and a baked potato. I would recommend trying this place out if your looking for a quality steakhouse in Vegas off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Discussing what piece of beef to get with the waitress

bPp_UXoO5N6z6S88WrX-Xg.text: My wife and I had our 7 year anniversary here.  I am surprised it took us this long to come here.    Bar: Bartender was nice and made strong drinks  he advised us to get the crab cakes ( we did and it was bomb, note that it comes as one, so order one for each person .... it's that good ).  Table/ambience:   very romantic !  Only thing was off was when we walked in it smelled like old people   Service: Freaking excellent.  Best service I ever had in my life.  I been to a lot of high end restaurants and this place puts them to shame.  We were helped by Joseph, he was on point.  He made good suggestions and was very knowledgeable on the menu.  Food: We shared the Tomahawk which was recommended and it was hella good!!!   We also had the crab cake for appetizer   For sides we had the creamy spinach, lobster Mac and cheese and the mushroom something.  All good,  next time we will try the onion rings and prolly pass on the spinach (gotta make sacrifices somewhere)  Joseph waived our dessert you the man bro! It was the chocolate souffle and was delicious.  We will come again with my wife's family next time their in town as they like fine dining ( used to go to Silverado, Andiron, echo rig ) but this place blows those out of the water.  If they moved to Summerlin I'd be in trouble

_CIQMtiYa7Vij9_mMV-psA.text: One of the best steakhouse in town. One of the tastiest lobster bisque soup in vegas, you can actually taste pieces of lobster unlike other restaurants and request to see in action the 1.2 million dollars James Bond wine table after dinner.

uABB1NpdmMauLeLouAO4pQ.text: What took me so long to go here .... best steak house ever!!!  Went here for my wife's birthday dinner w/some friends and we split sooooo many yummy items!  - 32 oz waygu ribeye wow mmmmmmmmm served medium rare and pre-cut sooo goood  - Accompanied with a 14 oz lobster tail ... mmmmmmmmm  - Sides included the Mac n' Cheese and Mushrooms, fantastic  - Appetizers were the delicious crab cakes and shrimp cocktail  - Dessert, since it was the wife's birthday we got a delicious lemon cake (that giant thing) and we also ordered the banana bread pudding  The Service was top notch!  Go with a group so you can share.  This place is insanely good!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 32oz ribeye mmmmm

4OempB1nDBGvAI0NAUeNFA.text: I thought the food and service were excellent as should be at a high end steak house like this. Be sure and try the giant onion rings.  12oz filets were cooked perfectly. Additional sides of lobster Mac and au gratin potato's were really good. The Del salad and crab cakes to start was both excellent.  I liked the fact that there was no attitude from the wait staff that we were just water drinkers who liked ketchup with our onion rings .

Q21A20i0b2unnhvCC1ZlbA.text: I'm a foodie. Please trust me. I came here because of the reviews and I am blown away at how many people said this is good food. Guys. This place does not have good food. I just don't understand. This place is not good. When I go out to eat...especially at a place this expensive I expect spectacular food. Something I can't cook at home. And this was gross. I got the Ceasar salad which the dressing is pure runny mayonnaise. No taste at all. My filet mignon was cooked perfectly but guys, this meat is meat you can buy at Costco. I'm not joking. And my steak wasn't seared or anything. Just cooked. Looked nuked. And the lobster Mac and cheese....I swear to you it has no taste. It's very very creamy but it's so watered down with the cream you don't get the taste of cheese at all. I was so disappointed in the food. Trust me go somewhere else. No bueno

V3NcUhKdH4dscTT4WLNL4w.text: Celebrated my fiancee bday last night so a friend recommended this place. Staff there were very friendly n welcoming. Very sweet of them to give a handwritten bday card. If review was based on them it would be 5 stars.   Started with crab cake (delicious) and shrimp cocktail (meh). For entree I had bone in ribeye and lobster tail and she had filet mignon with sauteed spinach. Her filet was ok but everything else was just too salty...I drank so much water cuz of saltiness they refilled about 5 times. I really wanted to like it cuz medium rare was made perfectly. The lobster was nothing special and still costed $84. Complimentary bday desert was good and appreciated. All in all I paid $360 including tip for this dinner and I really don't feel it's worth the price.   Also their Yelp page says attire is dressy but we saw couple people in there with shorts and some with regular t-shirts on so really not sure about dress code if they have one.   To the staff, thank u guys for being super awesome!!! This review is not about guys

9gnikYxfwd5HEbIg9TPknA.text: Excellent service and food! Great wine selection. Aged cuts. Great for a special night. Classic steak house!

UjrfWWmZhqNTVibU4zbSKw.text: Really good. A solid 3.5 Steak was good. Try it with the foie gras butter. Really enjoyed the lobster Mac and cheese. Best part - the smoking patio and a really good selection of cigars.

si6KW7AbfIi91wN3PpG59A.text: A serious contender in the best steak house ever category.  The service was impeccable.  The piano player had great energy and was highly talented.  The sazerac and the house vodka infused pineapple drinks were first class.  The hostess was spectacular and got us a great seat.  The crab cakes were Maryland style and divine.  Massive king crab legs that were as good as it gets.  Fillets were cooked to perfection and melt in your mouth good.  The lemon cake was moist and capped everything off perfectly.  I'm having a real tough time thinking of a better steak house experience that I've had.  Thank you Del Frisco!

XModE7OMlqEHnUTgJXDsOA.text: Having Lived in Vegas for a few years back in the Mid 90's and spending many a weekend here too many to count over the years, I tend to simply Check into my Hotel of choice avoid the hectic strip, taxi's, etc and dine in my hotel or within walking distance of another Hotel. Having to meet a friend of mine for dinner outside the hotel didn't originally appeal to me, but he insisted on Going to Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House off Paradise / Flamingo here in Las Vegas.  So 8PM off I head in my taxi and low and behold, as I'm approaching the restaurant my phone rings and my dinner buddy has an emergency at home and won't be joining me.  Well what to do at this point, hell I was already in the parking lot I'm having dinner and BOY AM I HAPPY I DID!  Arrived to a well appointed old style Steak house with white table cloths rich mahogany, a nice large bar that had live piano music and vocals (Always a plus). I decide to dine at the bar and was greeted by Trisha who proceeded to explain the various specials, options etc.  Being solo at this point I kept it simple.  Trish recommended the house cabernet which was produced specifically for Del Frisco's Vegas.  A very nice Napa cab, big, rich, chunky and tasty. $14.95 for a very generous pour.  (NICE)  Chopped Salad to start accompanied by nice Hot home baked bread and sweet whipped butter. Very nice salad, cold lettuce just the right amount of dressing, very tasty.  Being from NJ originally bread outside of the Garden State tends to leave you wanting more, and in this case there is no exception to the rule. Good but certainly nothing to write home about.   Moving on to the main battle Royal was the 26 ounce Double Eagle NY Strip on the Bone which is their signature dish ($59.95- Regular 16 oz strip $39.95). Requested "Charred Medium rare plus".  Trish also recommended the Garlic whipped mashed potatoes with skins left on mixed with chives.  Let me just stop right here and tell you perhaps one of the top 3 NY Strips I've ever had in my life and I've had many.  Tough to remember them all but this was a mountain of meat, cooked to absolute perfection on a very hot plate that allowed the red portion to cook to perfect temperature.     Not too much bone and the taste was incredible. Perfect amount of charred and it needed no salt, pepper nothing it was in word PERFECT.   The Potatoes (9.95) where the perfect accoutrement and unfortunately dining alone I wished I could have split another side,  perhaps a lobster tail, vegetable etc, but as it was I was so stuffed I couldn't even move when I completed this perfect meal but there is always next time.  I declined desert, hopped a taxi back to my hotel and can state without hesitation this is a MUST VISIT for anyone in Las Vegas locals or others. The staff was friendly, attentive, the piano music / vocals fantastic and a great touch and Trisha at the bar is an absolute sweetheart, thanks again JERSEY GIRL!  Put this one on you don't miss list you won't be disappointed.

tTT2GFUu6xe-psUMcO3VEg.text: Best Meal of our Honeymoon!  We had a long week of dining out for our honeymoon. We are lovers of good wine and steak and were searching all week for an amazing experience. We started at Tom Colicchio's at the MGM and were surprised by how bad their service was. We were both servers in our past lives and know when someone is doing a good job. Your servers were amazing! Service was prompt and courteous. We were never wanting for anything and the service was never overbearing... it was an experience every person would want at a restaurant. The steaks and shellfish we ordered were all perfect and offered more selection than we expected. We were pessimistic about going because we know you are a chain and we thrive on unique experiences... but i have to say, I will always hold Del Frisco's as my first choice when dining out from now on. Thank you so much.

PTAVuseH7VolPIDnghf4Vg.text: we had dinner here on Saturday might with a party of five people. We were Given such poor service by a waiter named Tommy. he had one of the worst  Attitudes of any server that I had in a upper scale restaurant in a long time. The salad and the appetizers were marginal and the cocktails were weak and  Overrated. my father had the bone in cowboy steak that was like shoe leather. we waited over a. Hour to be served our dinner and were shocked by the poor service...... Amanda the manager on duty tried extremely hard to make up for,the deficiencies and offered the table desserts and a complimentary cocktail.  THERE IS NO EXCUSE FOR,THIS TYPE OF TREATMENT. THE WAITER  TOMMY SURELY DOES. NOT BELONG WORKING IN A RESTAURANT LIKE  THIS,OTHER THAN A ONE STAR DINER KN THE STRIP.

PqEVYDLfFJil7avlAB6kzQ.text: Delicious!   The ambience and service was paralleled by the food: top notch!  Started out with the calamari, which was out of this world. It's not your usually deep fried with cocktail sauce, but more of a sweet and sour with jalapenos: savory and spicy!  The bone in fillet was tender and flavorful. The food is expensive, but you get what you pay for and if you want a delicious and attentive experience this is the place.

wimLWGJ3bzIILsY8h3KltA.text: Party of 4 celebrating a birthday. ** Waiter James from Dallas start out perfect, but soon became overwhelmed and inattentive at best, as was all of his near non-exisisting unenthusiastic * waitstaff. * Manager was lurking but apparently he was only concerned with a 2 top (must have been his friends). He walked in & out of our dinning room ignoring what appeared to be the theme of the night, a plethora of "empty drink glasses and plates". Long waits, bad meal pacing. Our plated *shrimp cocktails were not veined (black line-intestines not removed). The 2 filets mignons tasted *****outstanding, but the N.Y. (square and hidden under a blanket of gravy??) was less then mediocre. I do not recommend this chain restaurant, unless you're feeling lucky or know someone who works there.

_2ypoykeIFKO3JT4JYLopw.text: I went to this steak house for my birthday last month. For appetizer, we ordered fresh oyster, it's pretty good esp the sauce. For the main dish, I ordered the bone in ribeye 22oz, it's really good and the flavor so perfect. I was asking medium for my steak, and it's perfect with the pink inside. The waitress asked me to cut the steak to check if the steak was cooked okay. We ordered lobster mac and cheese, it was alright or maybe I am not a big fan of Mac and cheese lol but my boyfriend said it was okay too. It was over rated. Other than those, we ordered side order mushrooms and corn, I love it..   The service was pretty good!! I highly recommend it if you are craving for steak :)

_aAiMV2auVM_F0iIBAJyOw.text: We had a really nice meal at Del Frisco's, with great steak as many other reviewers can attest.  The sides were also excellent (we had green beans and lobster mac n' cheese).  Service was pleasant and attentive, but always seemed to be going for the upsell which was fine but should have toned down once she realized the type of things we were interested in.  The disappointing part for me is that there are a few different rooms at the restaurant - some more boisterous, some quieter, and one with a live musician.  We were seated in a quieter room which was nice since it was just my husband and I, however the decor was fairly bland and outdated with a grayish wall paper and mirrors.  We had made a reservation several days in advance, so we weren't "overflow."  The ambiance of the meal made me feel like I was in a more casual steak house, rather than one that serves some of the best meat in town.  With steaks that are $40-$50 (not including sides), I expect a bit more in the ambiance department.

55EON-bbeFKEk64e_kJPdw.text: Top 2 steakhouses in the country....from my list 75 steakhouses I've visited from coast to coast, peter luger, cut, etc, etc.  The steaks have the perfect char, flavor/seasoning and quality. I eat here every time I'm in this area.

Na8vA_26eUIWk8gyBMgzzg.text: The phenomenal service of the staff was only surpassed by the phenomenal food.  We had attentive service without being intrusive. Cozy and friendly atmosphere.   Definitely will go back again.

4yWtUnmrZe7QjhbE4-gH0g.text: We went there for a friend's surprised bd. The filet mignon steaks were juicy, flavorful, and well cooked to our order.  The lobster Mac and cheese was delish.  Hubby ordered a fish of the day plate And gave it a thumb up.all of our friends were pleased with their dishes as well.  Service was seamless and top notch. Cons:  Quite expensive.  Be prepared when you come so you don't get a sticker shock.

keft1q9vAheS3YFsfXt4pQ.text: We had wanted to try this place for so long and this is definitely a disappointment. Everything tasted too sweet. The Margarita is probably made from a mix from Costco. The Lamb chops are grilled pretty good but the side cranberry sauce is too sweet. The crab cake is good. The warm bread is good as well. The bone-in filet mignon is nicely done but the asparagus is too chewy. Service was slow and arrogant.  Our empty plates sat there for 10 min, none of the staff even bother to ask us if we were finished!  Definitely not worth $$$$. It felt more like an Black Angus experience than a high end restaurant.

CKrWv8-q7_uyR-fl-tMyxA.text: Stone crabs and the crab cakes appetizers rock! The staff are really on top of their game. The filet was excellent and I love the sauce that they put over it. Overall a great experience. Highly recommend.

uj4monnG7RNZtgPLzlKJBw.text: This is a really high-end steakhouse, that serves really high-end steaks.  So if you go here, expecting what they advertise, you won't be disappointed.  What might be an unexpected surprise, though, is the Prix Fixe menu that delivers some of the most popular dishes (in my case, 8 oz filet, crab cake, wedge salad, and smashed potatoes) for about half the price of the regular menu.  That makes it a deal.  Also a pleasant surprise was the wait staff, which was not only helpful, but also anxious to swap life stories and chat about any topic.  Given the lengthy conversation, the quick service can only be explained by the fact that we had three waiters and a manager hovering around us during the course of the dinner.  Having just overpaid for wet ice cubes at a strip nightclub, I was also very pleased that the drinks were a fair pour and reasonably priced.  The atmosphere was what I think of as "old Vegas" (even though this is a Dallas-based chain).  Dark wood, lighting and noise levels appropriate for romantic conversation, and generous spacing between tables.  Easy to reach on the Paradise Rd. version of restaurant row, I would recommend this place over many of the pricey steakhouses at the Strip hotels.

f627cvylLsqKROKV7Y-EEg.text: Got the bone in rib eye ($55).  I asked for it medium rare.  It was cooked perfectly and came out piping hot (not sure they let it rest).  Either way it was delicious.  Potatoes Au Gratin were a real treat.  One of the better sides I have had here in Vegas.  Once you get into the top ten Vegas steak houses it is difficult to find things to complain about.  I would say what stood out to me here was the atmosphere.  It was very friendly and I felt very welcomed even being a solo eater(here on business).  That being said, I feel that Del Frisco's had less options than some of the other steak houses but that would not deter me from coming back!  Recommend!  Great Atmosphere!

eiE_Agl88ur933INK9eATQ.text: The veal porterhouse served rare is probably the juiciest, tenderest steak I've ever had. Really flavorful too.   Don't get too many appetizers, we got crab legs, crab cakes, and a bunch of others thinking they would be small, but some of the appetizers are big enough to be entrees for multiple people. You will not be able to eat your steak if you get too many.   Service is really great, very attentive and friendly without being disruptive at all.

PsJH6i8brjY09p9UifiVqQ.text: I have to say that this was one amazing dining experience.  It started with a lovely set of 6 oysters on the half-shell and shrimp cocktail (very large tiger prawns), then the 16oz ribeye cooked medium and to perfection.  Side order was the potatoes au-gratin, one word cheesy-licious!  Then desert was the most moist and delicious lemon cake I have ever eaten!  Don't be afraid of the prices, if you can afford it, then Del Friscos Las Vegas will certainly NOT disappoint!  I am not financially able to eat there more often than on special occasions, but I will make it a tradition whenever I visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are a few of my favorite things...

IlC06YvcuURC14bxojzb5A.text: Delicious t bone steak !!! Average salmon . Beautiful ambiance ... Not a family place so if your family is a loud one , skip this place .

Tgf_zrJI0n4t5ny8z9VK-A.text: After hearing people talk about how great Del Frisco's is for a long time now, I finally tried it last night (Sunday, May 19) for the first time. I have to admit, I am usually a bit skeptical of chains - especially since we live in a city of top-notch steakhouses - but I was very impressed with the food! I was there for a friend's graduation dinner, so we had a private room in the back which made it easy to give toasts, etc.  We arrived a little late, so we missed trying the appetizers, but everyone said they were good! I tried the house salad, which had a really yummy avocado dressing, and also the Caesar, which was standard but good. I ordered the Ribeye steak and it was very very tasty! The rub on it had a LOT of salt and pepper, which might be a problem for some people, but I loved it. They asked us all to cut into our steaks before the waiters left so they could fix any problems, but there didn't seem to be any. Even my husband, who likes his steak cold rare, was happy:) The desserts I tried were fine (cheesecake and chocolate mousse), but I would skip them next time - nothing special.  Overall, I can't say I think Del Frisco's is as good as some of the places on the strip (I love CraftSteak at MGM and STK at the cosmo) but it certainly holds its own and I would definitely go back.

JTowGFZtvfqSxYAOZXxjjw.text: Came here on Christmas Eve with my family.  Everything we got was amazing. Perfect ambiance for a Christmas Eve dinner.  Steak (oscar style) was great. Chopped salad (off menu) was awesome. CRAB CAKES are the best. Their pineapple house martini was delicious as well.   I liked everything except the desserts: lemon cake and bread pudding! PASS! Much better other places.  So skip that.  Good food here!

wKQRdw7a-A9j2IvIy8amQQ.text: The service is outstanding, food great, and the wine recommendation was solid!

bC3xDhJfkVMbbJx6Ay-AIQ.text: Have been here numerous times and finally awarding the 5 stars they deserve!  Every time we have been here they have delivered on both food and service.  Prime Pairing on Sundays (summer promo) is Beef Filet with choice of crab cake or scallops or shrimp as entree with 3 salad choices and full size servings of a side dish as well.  Excellent value We have never been disappointed.  Promo or not, the place delivers!

LuuVbPP3IU03B3YkFHQcbg.text: Handsome and I had finished a disappointing dinner at Firefly and decided to walk across the street to Del Frisco's steakhouse for dessert. Yummy! We ordered a single malt scotch, glass of wine and the vanilla ice cream with the caramel sauce and toasted pralines... that was yummy...Handsome devoured the bowl...along with his scotch. We'll be back here again.

CRy9HK8BHWsosKsosxsbYQ.text: The service was really good so I didn't give them 2 stars even though they tried to sit us at the bar after we made reservations thru yelp which takes you to open table. I ordered the rib eye and when my steak came out it was clearly a strip steak. I asked the waiter if he is sure it is Rib eye?!?! He was very nice and offered to change it. The manager came and after trying to convince me over and over that it was a rib eye, agreed that they had made a mistake and it was indeed not a rib eye. 20 minutes later when my wife was done eating my steak came out. They make everyone cut the steak in half to make sure it was cooked to their liking but a real steak house would never do that! It makes the steak cold!! I know good steak from growing up in New York and going to the best steak houses there that known all over the world. This place is off the strip. I found it on yelp because of the great reviews but I'm not a fan!

QL8PO4-J7OgZlcO4wSYAiw.text: This was our first visit to this steak house, it's similar to Morton's and Capital Grill, but The decor was very dated & 70's-remember The "York Steak House"? not much ambiance, our waiter was fine, but the chef could not cook a steak medium if his life depended on it. to begin with, I had a horrible cut of fillet all gristle, first they served it practically raw, then they ruined it and sent it back charred but still rare inside. Then the Chef came out in a huff, he had butterflied the meat which had shrunk to nothing it was overcooked and inedible, I didn't complain further as I was with a client, BUT, They did nothing to correct it or replace it. I would never go back or recommend this place simply on their guest service. There are many other great steak house options available in Vegas...

mheVpD0X2VtGUPdgsqax6g.text: One of the best steaks I have ever had! Move over mortons, Ruth Chris, Jean George, and even Carne Vino.

4tpiud4u8a6ZFKwH26Cq6g.text: Had  reservations and was sat on time. I have been a big fan of Del Friscos other locations in NYC and Orlando. I am local and have eaten here before, probably 2 1/2 years ago. This particular visit was less than stellar. The fried oyster appitizer was very small. In Orlando and NYC which I ate at a couple years ago, the oysters were in abundance and falling off the plate. I don't know if slow times have caused them to cut back at this location? Calamari appetizer was ok, nothing to write home about. Now on to the main course. The prime ribeye we both ordered was for Medium. It came out still very red in the middle, was medium rare. We sent it baxck to be cooked up a little bit. Then when they brought it back out, it ended up being Medium well. We were hungry and didn't say anything. Steak was still good, just not the temperature we wanted.  For a class of steakhouse like Del Frisco's, typically a manager would have come out and stop by the table when food is sent back. Even at Outback Steakhouse a manager will come by the table when food is sent back to the kitchen. No manager ever came by. Obviously bad service there, perhaps we woudl have mentioned that the steak was now overcooked. It was very visibly light pink to brown center. The creme spinach side used to be piled high, once again, don;t know if the economy is hurting this locatation but the serving portion that typically serves 2 comfortably, left us unsatisfied. And at $12.50 for spinach, this was actually insulting.   End result, we will probably not come back here agian next time we want steak. The service and quality fo food has gone down. Could it have been just a bad experience on this particular visit? Sure, but too many thinsg were different from our last visit to make us want to come back again. And in Vegas folks, there is no lack of excellent steakhouses. I however will go back to the one in NYC and Orlando, just never again in Vegas. our server was good at least. Mastros Ocean Club in the Cystals shopping center is much better. Been there twice and both consistant good service and food quality and portions for the money. I would refer them 1st over Del Frisco's.

49IOiBpKvsaR_Ua98IP7kw.text: Expectations were high for our New Years Eve Dinner and unfortunately Del Frisco's could not deliver for our party.  In retrospect I knew I should have stayed away from the tasting menu as I know I am not a "noshing" kind of guy and I like the big portions and a full size steak.  Service was good given the place was pretty busy...BUT attention to detail was very much lacking.  We called ahead to ensure there was a good non-alc sparkling wine for my pregnant significant other who is normally a wine connoisseur (when not with child).  When we called ahead to attempt to bring in our own bottle they said they had some NA Sparkling Champagne...when we get there they whip out a freaking bottle of Martinellis Cider????  Another person in our party was the smart one and got a steak a la carte - bone in rib eye which was juicy and perfectly seasoned.  I got the Pri Fix Rib Eye which was disappointing...looked like a cut of steak you can get from Vons in the family pack.  Crab cake was good-right amount of crab (Blue) to binding portion.  Again small bite on the tasting menu, was sooo tempted to get a full order.  My general rule is to try a place more than once before ruling it out, so the crab cake was definitely enough to bring me back for another try at their Steak.

xewhnHaY1aIlyeo3K8sytQ.text: We had dinner there and found the place to be in need of an update. It is really over priced and the sides were not that great. The bread was not up to par, but the service was good.

T0p38qPosuti6H6DyLwAIw.text: I realize you're in Vegas having a grand ol' time, but please, please, please - I implore you - don't make the same mistake I did. Do not, under any circumstances drink more than five raspberry vodkas mixed with Sprite before having dinner here. For the love of God. Yet, I'm still giving it five stars.  The service is absolutely astounding. Especially when there are Vegas drunkards left and right and the servers still treat you like you're being perfectly appropriate in a classy place like this, even though you're talking about all sorts of unsavory things and the three dudes at the table next to you are trying to court a not so high class call girl. Ahhhh, Vegas.  Now, here's where those raspberry vodkas come into play. I really, really, really wish I had been drinking beer earlier or at least waited until dinner to drink because I definitely would have been able to finish more than 1/4 of my steak without feeling sick. Alas, I could not, but I did chow down on the amazing mac and cheese - you must order that here.  I know this is quite the bossy review, but listen to me, dammit. It's the truth.  Thumbs Up: -Gigantic servings. -Amazing service from a staff that must have the patience of saints. -Gooooooey mac and cheese.  Thumbs Down: -Breaking the rules I outlined. -My poor empty wallet after dinner.

uqfDOwKfsjaG0O_VhkG4wg.text: This is a great place to go if you are looking for a good steakhouse in Vegas.    We went here w/ a group of 17 for a friends b-day.  It took us sometime to get seated even if we made reservations but we did request for a private room.    While waiting we sat at the bar.  There was someone playing the piano who took requests - hello Billy Joel songs!   You also need to check out their James Bond table.  It will suddenly open and play songs from the movie.  It also has wine that is etched w/ the different James Bond movies.  Once we were seated, service was fast and good.  The B and I shared a porterhouse and crab legs.  I like my steak w/ bone and medium rare.  Our steak came medium but the server was quick to get us a new piece of steak when we complained.   The steak was coated in a seasoning of spices w/ lots of pepper.  It was really good!  Perfectly seared outside and rare inside.  Delish!  The crab legs were really good too.  We also ordered Oysters (west coast) - I like the sweeter variety. They were also superb.  Did I mention the sesame bread that comes before the meal?  It was served warm as any good restaurant should and w/ whipped butter - I think it was sweet cream butter.  This one takes the cake. Lobster Mac and Cheese!  You have to get it.  It's the best mac and cheese I've ever had in my whole life.  I will come back anytime.

6PMuzvpPkk2ibDnFRdroPw.text: If this was the first balla steakhouse I had ever been to, I would have been impressed.  The table was ready after a brief minute.  All the staff were friendly and helpful.  One guy pointed me to the restroom (which is somewhat hard to find), the guy in the can itself was cool and the waiter put up very well with the complete nonsense from our resident smart-ass in our group even though he was wearing a baseball hat to a dressy restaurant.  Overall ambience is great if you like old school style steakhouses (stuff you would expect in Chicago or New York mafia type places).  I like how the restaurant is sectioned off into different rooms so the place does not get too loud (a real problem at Flemings Newport Beach and Manhattan Beach).  Wine selection.  You can spend as much as you want here.  You could spend the GDP of a small country.  I would say the by the glass selection was smallish and was not too impressive on the "bargain" end of the menu.  I am sure that you could find a good bottle or two if you know your wines, but I am not that good.  My impression is that it is overpriced for the quality of wine.   Food.  Ribeye steaks are what you would expect from a good restaurant.  However, if you are not from LA, you will think that your steak is overdone with respect to how you ordered it.  I like mine medium rare, but it was a bit closer to medium.  It was still pretty decent with the Foie gras infused sauce.  The sides were acceptable, but not that impressive.  We had mac and cheese (seemed a bit too al dente), broccoli (a bit over steamed) and sauteed mushrooms (good, but I could actually replicate very easily at home).  We didn't have dessert because it was mostly dudes.  Since the website won't tell you the pricing, I will give you an idea (I have to go on memory since it was hosted dinner.  Thanks host!)  Ribeye 16 oz  $40 Ribeye bone in 22 oz $50 Carpetbagger (Ribeye 10oz) $30 Wine (pinot from Argentina? I forgot the name... Madderas?) $90 a bottle Penfold's Cab (don't ask me the vintage!)  $10 a glass Silver Oak (Alexander Valley, 98 I think) $40 a glass Most wines by the glass were $15 Wedge salad $10 Most appetizers (other than market price stuff) were about $10 - $15  Anyway, it really depends on what you are looking for and what your expectations are.  If you are from New York and you have been to the top steakhouses, you will hate this place and knock over a table.  But, if you are from LA, you might feel right at home.  I am from LA, but I appreciate how the old school steakhouses of New York and Chicago roll.  I went to Jack Rose in New York and Smith and Wollensky's in Chicago.  They definitely are not shy about giving you a slightly seared hunk of prime beef.  My kind of style.  Besides, I have had raw beef, horse, liver, fish and eggs, so really it's no big deal to me.  A few of other notes.  It is pretty good to go in groups (we had 8 and they had a nice large table we could all sit at, instead of pushing tables together).  The restaurant pretty much cleared out around 10:30pm or so (we had 9pm reservations, the place was pretty busy when we first got there).  If you want a quieter evening, go for a very late dinner.  Be paitent if you are cabbing it over here.  It took a bit for cabs to arrive even though we told them a few minutes before we left.  Just have a stogie or whatever and hopefully it isn't the middle of the winter or summer so you aren't freezing or boiling.

mUgDlJ064VvX6zecy_GYdw.text: Started off with a house specialty cocktail--pineapple infused vodka martini.  Just right.  For dinner, a fantastic Porterhouse (cooked to perfection), preceded by a fabulous crab cake and ceaser salad.  As a side, asparagus.  I requested they grill it--no problem or hesitation, and the spears were charred but still slightly crisp, just as they should be.  Service was fantastic, from hostess to bus person, to waitperson.  Nice glass of Napa cab at a fair price and they even had my favorite desert--a Vintage Port (with a generous pour).  Highly recommend.  If you're looking for a cheap night out, however, don't bother with the drive.

PURESkmpst-KL0s7HjokyA.text: Good drinks and nice atmosphere. Had the scallops at the bar for an appetizer and they were excellent! Next time I'll be going for an entire meal instead of just happy hour.

MV_LYmwZQvR8l9xhxhuuOg.text: One of the best restaurants in las Vegas.  I've been going to Vegas for 20 years with a group.  We always do a nice dinner somewhere.  I found Del Frisco's last year using YELP and was so glad we did.  The service is impeccable and the food is fantastic.  This place blows away Ruth Chris, Delmonico, and Smith & Wollensky.  It is slightly better than Center Cut (Flamingo), The Range (Harrahs), Mesa Grill, and the Palm.  If you have tried any of these places you will have a better experience at Del Frisco's. I can't wait to go back to Vegas.  Our server reported they might be bringing one to Chicago. I will be so excited.

cyg5CzIKdeO4DQC8rneXkA.text: Super disappointed with my experience tonight. We made an 8:30 reservation, waited till 9:05 and still not sat, nor were we approached about the unnecessary wait considering we had a "reservation". The hostess staff is completely clueless, and worthless.   Kept telling us "a couple more minutes" when clearly that ran out awhile back.  I appreciate honesty, and truth.  You can't control the course of the night, but can tell a guest when they are clearly 45mins from being sat.  Otherwise, management needs to be re-evaluated.  The restaurant gets one star only because the bartender was amazing and sensed we were annoyed and did what he could to keep us interested.  Only heard wonderful words about their steaks, but will not return to Confirm because it is RUDE to not honor your guests reservations.  I don't care how good your steak is, it's garbage if the experience before or after is subpar.

JEYeZ15OwdW9rQPBSAZDqw.text: Excellent value for the money. We split the "Tomahawk" rib eye and it was delicious. Not too noisy and a nice, low key atmosphere. The pineapple vodka drink was also great!

8Do7-3zG3Y--bqskKINwoA.text: This is the place to go for a fantastic steak dinner in Las Vegas. I was unfamiliar with Del Frisco's before my last trip to Las Vegas. That merely led to a series of happy surprises as the staff and the food at Del Frisco's kept exceeding my expectations over the course of a night.  A local booked a reservation for about sixteen for a Saturday night. I arrived uncharacteristically early, so I sat down with the wine list, which could have occupied me for the entire weekend. A wine steward asked if I had any questions, and we talked a bit about a Central Coast Cabernet from a vineyard I had visited. Many (most?) wine stewards would have tried to talk me into something pricier, but the gentleman treated me as if I had selected something thirty-times pricier. Yes, they have wine that was thirty-times pricier than what I ordered... and I ordered a bottle, not a box. If you're a wine snob with a bankroll, you'll see a dozen once-in-a-lifetime wines.  Eventually our party arrived, and we were seated in a semi-private dining room. Another party about our size shared the room. We each had two or three tables full of people. Our servers were attentive without a hint of arrogance. When some people ordered their steak medium-rare, they explained what that would actually mean, and some decided to go for medium instead. (You and I are better than that, though. You're going to follow my lead and get a big fillet, medium-rare, and savor it with a nice Cabernet, aren't you?)  For some reason, my dining companions preferred mixed drinks to wine. I only had one martini before dinner, and it was bracing and a fine palate cleanser.  The sides can be served family style. You'd have to really like brocolli or asparagus to finish them. Finishing a literally-mountainous order of onion rings on your own would be impossible.  But you're here for the steak. And it does not disappoint. The filet mignon comes in two sizes. I don't think I've had a better steak anywhere. If you're into fancy sauces or deconstructed preparation, you might want something besides the fillet, as it is simply a perfectly prepared fillet. If that's too straightforward for you to enjoy, then my advice is useless. If your mouth has been watering while reading this paragraph, then there's nothing more to say.

DkcNArZGj52MIJ2OBdrwbQ.text: I just completed a 3 day trip in Las Vegas that included a different steakhouse every night.  We started at N9NE in the Palms, moved to Bobby Flay's Mesa Grille at Ceaser's and wrapped up with Del Frisco's.   I thought N9NE was going to be hard to beat, but Del Frisco's is in a whole different class.  Far and away the best of our trip and the best steakhouse I've been to.  A few recommendations...  If you're having wine with dinner, ask for Steve Quenzer, the Sommelier.  We gave him a price range, our plans for dinner and turned him loose.  He hit the wine out of the park every time we asked his advice and really made our dinner experience.  If you get the opportunity to try a Saxum wine, don't pass it up.  As far as the food, two words.... Kobe Beef!  Worth every penny, and yes its quite a few of them.  Hands down the best steak I've ever had.  Simply fantastic.  Sides are ala carte, as you'd expect in a fine chop house, and all were outstanding.  Don't skip the Mac-n-cheese.  Finally, I really have to give a tip of the hat to the manager Jacque Viloria.  She was kind enough to take 3 guys from So Cal on a tour of the restaurant and their impressive wine cellar, even though it was a busy Saturday night.  She was friendly, approachable and a key part of a perfect dinner.  She obviously knows the importance of customer service and runs a first class operation.  And, if you're really nice, she might even show you what's under the "Do Not Touch" table. ;)  Desserts; bread pudding, HUGE lemon cake, a fantastic chocolate cake, fine French wine, mmmmm...  Oh, and don't forget the cigar room and port.  What a dinner experience!  Del Frisco's is #2 of my top 10 dinners, and will be will be on my must see list every time I find my way to Vegas.  Enjoy.

yU18QnrQh4pW6DLe8qDMYQ.text: Had one of the best steaks, and the service is impeccable.  A must for Vegas.    I had the summer promotion which consisted of a Caesar salad, 8oz perfectly cooked filet, accompanied with a 4oz crab cake, and a side dish (enough to feed two).  This deal was $59.99 which would usually be $80-/+. I was told this promotions runs all through their down time in the summer.  Our server Dan was probably one of the best we've ever had. We will definitely be back again.

HvSvmfVDv0iDIDskGiF4tQ.text: Still a favorite amongst Vegas locals, Del Frisco's is always a great place to dine. Great bar to start the evening off with a cocktail. The seafood platter is just beautiful. Steaks and sides are excellent. Service level has really dropped over the years - most of the waiters and bus boys are not trained properly so don't expect 5 star service. The patio is a favorite place to end the night with a cigar.

OKbohaMncsevFsFn1f08dw.text: 3.75 stars  So many upsides:  - sophisticated, classic steakhouse (i like that shit) - pretty/flirty waitress who checked on us often - prix fixe menu for $49 (with an upcharge if you order any cut other than filet) - amazing crab cake with lobster sauce...soft, no crunchy outer crust, but delicious, nonetheless  - VIP martini: vodka & pineapples...need i say more? - lemon cake: gigantic multi-layer fluffy cake, not-too-tart lemon buttercream frosting...amazing for breakfast the next day - avocado ranch on his salad  Downsides: - caesar salad was boring, not enough dressing - my filet had a huge chunk of something gross & inedible running through it (tendon?) After cutting that part out, the remainder was not well seasoned, far from the tastiest steak I've had  Sidenote/another downside: - table of 10+ who'd clearly pre-partied before ordering more drinks at the restaurant. Odd that a rowdy table would be placed in the same room as 6 couples; the restaurant is big enough to separate the partiers from the cupcakers. I feel the waitstaff allowed them to be loud & obnoxious because they didn't want to jeopardize the large tip coming from a large bill. Makes me laugh when 41-year olds try to party like 21-year olds...y'all gon' feel that in the morning!!!

XBda7MKhZFSC9pAm9xgvUg.text: If I can give it more than five stars I would.  I wish I took photos of my table.  The steak, the sides, the drinks...so amazing.  I have never had better service in my life.  So attentive but not to attentive where we felt bothered.   This has to be the best most perfectly cooked steak ever!!

JFDpA_SYcm0_9jRuZC4SRQ.text: This is by far my favorite steakhouse! I definitely recommend. They have AMAZING dessert as well. I ordered the chocolate cake.

UkVFFMV8bnZ9Opr9scCa2g.text: Top notch steakhouse. Great location, although a bit touristy. Always very busy, and a but loud. That said, food is exceptional, drinks are good, and service is amazing.

dc0ND8kZ4-jSlmhSTXmTHQ.text: I was here for my cousin's bachelorette dinner. Made the reservations 10 of us arrived and it was nothing but exceptional from the time we entered to the time we left!!!! The steaks were melt in your mouth to die for! The brussel sprouts mmm mmm good! The mushrooms and onions were delightful! The service was great they had their hands full w/my table. But, it all come together & was a HIT!!! This was the highlight of our trip!!!! There was nothing to complain about. The VIP drink was THE BEST!!! NO COMPLAINTS! IT WAS THE DEL FRISCO'S THAT I KNOW AND LOVE!!!

Dl8ovdJjqPks2xOX47F-Xw.text: Solid 4/5 stars Made reservations about 4 days before and we got a seating at 9:30pm on a Wednesday night.  Highly recommend you make reservations!   The ambiance is alright--nothing special, but there was a live pianist entertaining us with great songs! Service was spectacular--just the right amount of attention. I don't like places that is overbearing and always keeping an eye on you!  Ordered:  1) Crab cake: 3/5 alright 2) Del's Salad: 2/5 nothing special 2) Double Eagle Bone-In Prime Strip: 4/5 yum! (BIG portion!!!) 3) Side: Sauteed mushrooms 3/5 typical 4) Lobster Macaroni & Cheese: 4/5 YUM!  Overall great experience. Sadly, we were too stuffed to order desserts :(

hjNKcqHAfVn4EO2NvQK6-g.text: Took 30 minutes to get wine and 50 minutes for appetizer and we were one of few tables in place as it was 5 pm, not acceptable.  180 dollar bill with us sharing one meal and two glasses wine in absurdly overpriced.

cKTCcnuc6KjG-yQ8yqEfmA.text: Hands down one of the best steak houses I have been at in Vegas. We were graciously given the tour of the James Bond table. Restaurant was pretty, dark & busy. Our table was in one of the smaller rooms so lots of privacy.  Had the shrimp cocktail & the crab cakes - all were delicious and well prepared.  Then the steaks came - hmmmm !!! Perfection! All of us ordered the bone in ribeye!! Delicious and it's unfortunate we were not able to finish it. Our sides included mashed potatoes, mac and cheese and asparagus. All was well prepared. We were stuffed from our appetizers and sides and didn't have a chance to fully appreciate our perfect steak,  I had a few cocktails and they were all good! We didn't have room for dessert .  I highly suggest all to try this when in Vegas.  I will have to when in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Rib Eye - a Must for all

C4UtwWVX4GS2dnW4Eka-2g.text: Thank you Del Frisco for accommodating such a large, noisy, rowdy party at the last reservation time on a Friday night.  Came here for my name twin's bday dinner and had an AMAZING meal. Wine, steak, potatoes, and good company are all the right ingredients to make a soul happy.   I ordered a 6 oz filet, which was a nice portion and cooked to perfection. Juicy, flavorful (a little too flavorful on the crust but delicious nonetheless), tender, and literally melts in your mouth. The lobster mac n cheese was BOMB. Chunky pieces of meat and savory, creamy goodness. The potato au gratin was also very good; can't really go wrong with meat and potatoes.   The bill came out to ~$70/person, which wasn't bad at all considering all the wine and sides we ordered for a party of 20+.  It's a little ways off the strip but a WINNER in my book. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOBSTER MACARONI &amp; CHEESE *bomb @Del_Friscos
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FILET MIGNON 8 OZ @Del_Friscos
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SKILLET POTATOES &amp; ONIONS

vCTNFS-2iyCD3LtjumcBPg.text: I swear I reviewed this place.. yelp are you removing my reviews?!  well here we go again then!  I am a very very picky steak eater, I love steak and am pretty hard to impress.  but, the steak here impressed me. I honestly forgot what I got since it was a while ago but I remember it being amazing, I do remember that I added the peppercorn extra for a few dollars and it was totally worth it. cooked and marinated perfectly, steak melted in my mouth!  the sides on the other hand were not so amazing, the mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a box and the corn tasted like it was from a frozen bag BUT the point is this is a steakhouse so you come for the steak, not the sides (or that disgusting wine I got) I wanted to try some new wine so I asked for a recommendation and they were very helpful (can't fault the service for how the wine tastes right?) but the wine they suggested tasted like cough syrup! :(,   but keep in my with my disappointment in the wine and sides.. I still give it 5 stars? that's how good the steak was.. service was amazing as well! definitely will be coming back when I'm in vegas :)

ay45YACDpohmA9j7S4a4xA.text: We were here on March 29th. Our server was Jason.  Very friendly and helpful.  This wine list is staggering and its always nice to have a service that can help you pick based on your preferences. I started with the Crab Cake-this is a must have if you like crab. Then to the best 16 oz Ribeye I've had in a restaurant. I was medium rare throughout, edge to edge. For a side I had the Lobster Mac and Cheese, while not the best I've had, it was good. My wife had the Filet Medallion Entree.  This comes with the sides already paired, Chateau Potatoes and Thin Green Beans.  Again the Filet's were cooked properly. Potatoes were, well potatoes, what else is there to say on that.  Green beans were a little under cooked for our taste.  We like a snap but still cooked through. These were close to eating them raw out of the garden. Either while waiting for you meal or after the meal make sure to ask for the tour of the James Bond Table.  Would go well in any wine lovers home.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bond Table. Nice way to store your private collection.
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cake Oh so good

pBeJZlj_ofQyPAdFGlI9ng.text: My husband and I had a little "babymoon" getaway to Vegas from San Diego. Prior to our trip, I told him that aside from a prenatal massage, all I wanted was a really good steak dinner.  We have passed this restaurant several times on previous Vegas trips, while walking to Firefly restaurant... and for whatever reason it has always caught my eye and I've wanted to try it out.  Before our weekend getaway, I checked out some Yelp reviews and booked a reservation on Open Table. When I booked our reservation there was a section for any notes and I made a comment that my husband and I were celebrating our babymoon.  When we arrived at dinner - there was a "Congratulations" card signed by the staff, which I thought was a really nice personal touch!  Here is a little description of what we had:  Cocktails - Well let's be honest, mine was a "mocktail." I am usually a big fan of mules and I really like the taste of ginger beer. So I was happy to see a version of that on their menu. Theirs is made with bourbon and had blackberries in it. I asked the waitress if the bartender could make an non-alcoholic version.... and it was perfection!!! On top of that, I was pleasantly surprised that I was only charged for the ginger beer, $4.50 I think. I have been to other restaurants where they will still charge the full cost of the cocktail, even though you are ordering it without alcohol. I thought this was a nice gesture. My husband ordered a beer, and if I remember correctly it was only $5.50. I think that's a steal at a nice restaurant.  Appetizer - We got the crab cakes and they were delicious! Large chunks of crab, just the way it should be.  The sauce on the plate was so good, that when we were done with the crab cakes, I used the bread to soak up that yummy sauce!  Entree - My husband and I split the Tomahawk Rib Eye. This was $90 and definitely worth it, especially since it fed us both. We ordered it medium rare (anything else is just not right) and the majority of the meat was perfectly cooked. However there were a few small areas that were definitely more on the rare side. My husband did not mind eating those bites, and I didn't mind letting him. The steak was well seasoned and incredibly flavorful.  We both really enjoyed it!  Dessert - So we definitely didn't have room for dessert, but I considered getting something to take back to our hotel.  Well what do you know - the waitress comes by with a giant slice of their lemon cake... complimentary for our babymoon celebration.  I thought that was so awesome of them to acknowledge that and give us dessert! We ate a few bites at the restaurant, and boxed up the rest to bring back to the hotel.  The slice of cake was so big, that we ate it little by little over the course of the next 3 days! Good thing we had a fridge in our room.  The cake was moist (I hate that word - but it really was moist) and lemony without being super sweet or sour. It really was just right and a nice touch to compliment everything else I loved about our meal.  A few days after we got home from our trip to Vegas, we actually received a HAND WRITTEN THANK YOU NOTE from our server. WHAT????!!! Never in my dining experience has this ever happened. This is so above and beyond and truly is exceptional customer service.  I will definitely return in the future. Thank you Del Frisco's for a fantastic meal and incredible service!

E8hxlodNVmhDNrK5hQHYYA.text: Picked Del Frisco's over other Vegas steakhouses to celebrate my wife's birthday because I knew the food and drinks would be good.   We had an issue with the wrong crab appetizer being sent out and a different waiter (not the one who took our order) coming back to the table and basically arguing with us about it.  We ordered a cold crab cocktail and they sent out a cooked crab cake.  He then insisted to my wife that's what she ordered and then he brings back a menu and makes her point out  the item on the menu that she ordered.  Sitting here a few days later and thinking about it, it still irks me that he did that to her.    Didn't know why he had to be that confrontational about it, he could have just said no problem and taken care of it.   Ordered a ribeye medium and had to send it back because it was cold and raw in the middle.  Little bit of a bummer waiting for my steak while everyone else was enjoying theirs.   The appetizer issue really put a damper on the night,  I was hoping that management would have stepped up with an apology.   Nothing like Boston Del frisco's we always go to.  That place is top notch.

cFFAAAT2lq4XF1xTHU0irQ.text: Had a great night here the staff was lovely and made us feel right at home the manager was very nice and made sure we were happy  The food was great prepared just how we wanted the cake is boss

AKu6rhpE3MXOIDnfctyseQ.text: This place was awesome. Great service, and most importantly, the food was beyond my expectation. Ordered the $89  bone-in steak, and boy it was worth every penny. Steak was flavorful and tender. Also ordered the crab cake, mash, and brussel sprout with side order of truffel butter. Everything we ordered was extremely delicious and top it off with lemon cake; best lemon cake ever. Oh boy, i was in heaven enjoying my dinner with my wife. We left the resturant very happy customers. We would definitely go back.

xO9Um2LWEoRNQPOo-cYohw.text: How can a steakhouse not get a medium steak correct in three tries?  Once I was Ble to eat the food was very good but they need to fix the kitchen.

JYXSUNT10TXpa0YQYaUQEg.text: Del Frisco's has been my favorite steak house in Las Vegas for the past 15 years. My last two visits have been extremely disappointing.  When you walk in you get a dose of a bad sewer smell.  I made reservations for twelve in their TV room hoping to watch World Series and was specific about this when reservations were made.   When we arrived we where told that the TV's are not turned on and will not be turned on. We eventually ate outside in a park bench setting. We wanted white table cloth not picnic bench-setting.   Food was average not top notch. Not sure if there is new ownership.   I brought my group to Del Frisco raving about the great steaks.  I was embarrassed at the end of the night.

HeiNcvClfXcsULAabEBfbQ.text: In Las Vegas for a few days of golf and the group wanted excellent prime steaks. Del Frisco's did not disappoint with the help of our excellent waitress Brittany.  She recommended the dry aged New York which is my favorite. I find it hard to get an excellent one but this one was.  Thick, cooked perfectly, great texture and flavor.  Other orders included the dry aged rib eye and the 3 filets with different toppings, all were satisfied.  Added bonus was the nice vintage steakhouse atmosphere and again, the excellent service from Brittany and her team of servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten dry aged  NY, lobster mac and cheese, and asparagus.  Others got dry aged rib eye, and the 3 filets with different toppings.

h8Y1QfSL-TfKXf60SDYe5Q.text: Let me start off by saying their crab cakes are AMAZING!! Me and my boyfriend celebrated our 6th year anniversary at this location and we both enjoyed our meal very much, but what really won us over were their crab cakes! Our waiter was very knowledgeable and recommended the porterhouse and ribeye which were both very good. The lobster mac and cheese was very filling and very tasty. Love the whole experience. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uGv6Jz3VI67S5lUNBUiqHw.text: Probably one of THEE best steak houses I've been to....loved the lobster Mac and cheese & the rib eye and filet

qQvEMZJFDT16HNyyUW1DIA.text: The best Steak and Lobster around! We have had pretty much everything on the menu and it's all excellent. Their signature drink called the VIP is a cocktail with Svedka Clementine Vodka infused With Fresh Hawaiian Pineapple. It is the best cocktail I ever had.

UzrFnUCqreWCKeO0Q6hDZw.text: Went to celebrate my godmother's birthday.  We were treated like royalty from the time we walked in until we left.  Not to mentioned the cuisine matched the service....TOP NOTCH!!! We started our meal with martinis all of them were excellent. We were even given a sampler of the VIP martini and ended up indulging on the second round. For appetizer we had the crab cakes in lobster sauce...oh my a seafood delicacy. We also had the wedge salad that was fresh. Now the actually meal was pure perfection from the bone-in rib eyes to the salmon. Both were savory and delicious. All the sides were flavorful.   Lastly we had the lemon cake, melted in your mouth. Mmm!!!   Thanks to the crew especially our server Kim and the wine manager for making our experience unforgettable.

v90nUv9EEFgr-zp6BBViWw.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas! Spent my 24th wedding anniversary here. From the moment we walked in to the time we left, we were treated like royalty. The filet mignon was best. The prime strip and sea bass were excellent. Cooked to perfection. They even asked us to cut our steak and verify if it is cooked to our liking. The gift lemon cake was outstanding. Will definitely come back here when we visit again. We have tried the other steakhouses in Vegas, this is best.

pROUqEhsLzM0JrkLsOeSVw.text: I had no idea what I was getting into the first time I dined here. I mean, I knew it was a steak house, but didn't have any expectations.  When I arrived, my friend wasn't there yet, so the hostess invited me to have a drink at the bar while I waited. There was a gentleman playing the piano and singing. I ordered a drink. The bartender was very personable. He told stories, gave recommendations, and sang.  Finally, I went back to the hostess stand to be seated at my table. Shortly thereafter, my friend showed up. We ordered off the Restaurant Week menu (the reason why we had decided to eat here). I had the Del's Salad, the Handcut Filet, and the Cheesecake with strawberry topping.  The salad was amazingly different. It was topped with two strips of bacon and an avocado dressing. Altogether, it was delicious, but I didn't want to spoil my appetite so I only ate about half of it. When my filet arrived, we were asked to cut into it to make sure it was cooked to my liking. It was. The meat was so soft and seasoned to perfection. It was the best steak I had had in a very long time. The dessert was on point as well. To be up front, I'm not the big of a sweets person, but this cheesecake was to die for! It was light and not dense, and not too sweet either like how some frozen cheesecakes taste. This one felt as though it was homemade from scratch. I also need to rave about their banana bread pudding that my friend ordered. I was hesitant because I'm not a fan of banana flavored things. But this was easily one of the best bread puddings ever. It was perfectly soft and sweet and the banana wasn't too overpowering.  Our server did accidentally charged us for three people instead of two, but he quickly fixed this error.   Del Frisco's was SO GOOD, I went back to eat there again the following week. I would easily recommend this steak house to ANY ONE living in or visiting Las Vegas.  Also, if you do go, ask to see the James Bond table! Super cool AND the girls know everything about it!

mT-L2QGqbKoBdhn-NoxDWw.text: Food was certainly good while the service and atmosphere were as should be expected. For that reason I just can't give it the full rating - for the name (reputation) and price-point everything is simply what you'd expect. There was nothing that 'wows' or really makes Del Frisco's stand out.  Update: had to drop a notch when I found the server had added an extra $10 to the tip charge. Even if it was a mistake it still shows the average quality of service.   Looking for great food, deep wine selection, and the ability to share that you've eaten at a Vegas high-end restaurant? Great choice.   Looking for that over-the-top restaurant, a unique experience, or the feeling of walking away from a meal with your money very well spent. Not here.  James Bond display was neat to see but hard to see the over million dollar price tag. Best seen in person.

wi2ZB9lz2MhaqIx9pBu_cQ.text: I have gone to Del Friscos for years! Every time I am in Vegas. The quality has gone down noticeably. Steak was over cooked. Waiters just try to sell you on the most expensive wine and want you in and out. Not what I remember. Be careful....

c0VdE_geWZK9JG9GYlGF7Q.text: We walked in to an overwhelming smell of sewer!!!!! We were seated promptly and waited on promptly. My husband ordered a medium filet mignon and was served a raw filet mignon. It was corrected but he ended up eating when everyone else was finished. The food was very good but they have to do something about the smell.

2i-sOwo_S0cUx6yLWgEkyw.text: Wow what great food! We had the Caesar, a trio of fillet, a rib eye, and spinach, mushrooms, and lobster Mac n cheese sides. Everything was awesome. The wine list was a bit overpriced but it's Vegas. One star off for mediocre service. We had to ask for water 3 times and bread twice. At this price point? Surprising. Then at the end of the meal, they charged us a second time for our drinks at the bar from before dinner. They kinda apologized but it took them 10 minutes to sort the bill out. I'd come back for the food, but ride the manager for better service.

WZehFG0ywhvUv28omC41ew.text: We've been here before, but this is our first review. We made reservations for a party of 5 for our Sons birthday. Seated as soon as we arrived by very professional and friendly Hosts. As soon as we sat there were two waiters there for drink orders. Wifey and I started off with the VIP cocktail. This is a must have. We all ordered Steaks and Lobster. There were many cocktails and this restaurant went above and beyond to make sure we had a wonderful time. Everything was excellent and I don't know what could have made it a better evening with my Sons.

vUhAspO8YvgoKlsqVDhtVg.text: I been waiting almost 5 months to eat here and had my mind SET on the homahawk wagyu steak. Can you imagine the pain i felt when i asked for it and the waiter said we are OUT of it at this time? Are you serious? A top notch steakhouse should NEVER be out of anything and especially on a saturday night.. I had to settle for a bone-in ribeye which was good but NOT a wagyu. The VIP cocktails were excellent which is vodka infused with pineapple for $14 bucks each! We even met a nice couple who offered me and my date another round which was awesome. We had a crab cake not cakes, you only get 1 for $20 dollars. Also the lobster mac and cheese which was great and the Maque Choux Corn also very good! The ribeye was nice and tender, but not a tomahawk damnit!! Truffle and bone marrow butter are EXTRA ($6-$7 dollars) They have a guy on the piano all night who is just killing it! He is a great musician. They have a big parking lot for self park and VIP park service. The bar area is wonderful with a piano guy playing. The dining rooms are very nice and clean I just wish they had the wagyu, so sad!! =(

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One crab cake in a lobster sauce for $20 bucks!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib-eye with Lobster mac &amp; cheese and corn with truffle butter. The sides were very tasty!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in rib-eye with lobster and butter on top! The lobster and butter was a additional $17 dollars..

GjACzV742jAMYaSQX2XpOQ.text: Flew to Vegas during MLK weekend for a romantic getaway with the BF. He found this place through Yelp and with its exceptional reviews, he made reservations for two to wine and dine the evening we arrived. Needless to say, the food and service was beyond our expectations.  Our waiter was extremely attentive and detailed - very knowledgable with the menu items. The ambience was romantic and relaxed - perfect place for a nice fine dining exerience out of town. But the highlight of the night were the steaks....so amazingly well-cooked and flavoursome, some of the best we've ever eaten! My prime rib and his filet mignon were cooked exactly the way we specified - medium rare. In fact, they would have you cut down the middle of your steak to ensure it was cooked just the way you liked. The meat was so tender and moist; I swore it melted in your mouth. Especially my prime rib, every bite bursted with such a juicy flavor that I didn't want to stop chewing! ahhh...so delicious, so satisfying.   The tuna tartare made me want to lick the plate. We also had 2 loaves of their fresh baked bread that they direct you to pull apart instead of slicing with a knife. It was so warm, so fluffly, soooo goood. With a glass of the Double Eagle Cabernet each, we definitely had the perfect dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare

knImjc5uJ40FU_a7_i5CYQ.text: It's all about the crab cake.  OMG is soooo good!  It's topped with lobster sauce.  Yes, it's rich but oh so delicious.  I think it's about $20 or so.  The cold seafood platter was also ok.  Nothing to write home about.  ~$50 or so.  The steaks were a-ok.  The petite filet was a little dry; the ribeye was cooked to perfection and much warmer and juicier and tastier.  The Caesar salad was great - whole spears of romaine lettuce with plenty of tasty dressing.  The prix fix dinner was ~$50 and includes small meat portion, salad/soup, and a side.  The ribeye set me back about $50 or so.  I was celebrating an anniversary and they comp-ed me a slice of lemon cake.  According to the receipt, the slice runs ~$11.  Totally not worth the money.  So glad I didn't have to pay for it.
