Other important info: located in business park, many private dining spaces, classic wood paneling throughout (reminds me of old school private clubs), fantastic service, and they mentioned they're opening a location in Santa Monica where Boa Steakhouse used to be.

5LQLhIsSidvZ5qqAjLNX-Q.text: Very friendly staff. Celebrated my boyfriend's birthday. The staff wished him happy birthday immediately once seated. Food came out very fast & hot. We started with Cesar salad then we each had the bone in ribeye, potatoes with cheese & bacon and lobster mac & cheese.   Caesar salad was good. We shared it and it was a good size. Lobster mac & cheese was also good.   Steak: For a $55 steak we expected it to be tender.  If you are looking for a good steak I would recommend Mastro's ( which literally melts in your mouth ). That is the place to go! It's hard for other steak houses to have good steak & sides when they have Mastro's to compare it to... Mastro's just sets the bar too high, which makes places like this hard to give more stars.  Potatoes were hard. Would not recommended them.  They gave bread with dinner - nothing special about it.   They gave us a complimentary lemon cake for his birthday which was yummy. I'm giving 3 stars because the food was ok, a bit over priced. The staff was friendly. I would recommend it if you are in the area for dessert. We will never return for dinner.  One time is good enough ;)

d87MrTaJrAVU1OdRb4fzqQ.text: Popular steakhouse located off the strip.  This place has an old school atmosphere to it -- classy with dark wood decors and dimmed lights.  I would definitely recommend making dinner reservations as they were completely booked for the night we were there.  Even though we made reservations ahead of time, we still had to wait 30 minutes before we were seated. However we were entertained with live piano music during our wait which was enjoyable.    Of course we did our research on yelp and ordered the crab cakes and calamari.  The crab cakes were delish! Ruth Chris use to be my fave for crab cakes, but not anymore! The cakes were packed with an ample amount of crabs that tasted sweet and delicate to the tongue. I found the calamari to be mediocre; nothing spectacular about it. I probably wouldn't order it again next time. I ordered the fillet mignon and my fiance ordered the rib eye.  The fillet mignon was great, but WOW, their rib eye is scrumptious!! Aged to perfection providing the perfect taste when grilled to medium rare. We also enjoyed their sauteed mushrooms; I think it pairs well with steak.   I would highly recommend this place for anyone seeking a fulfilling steak dinner.  You can't go wrong with this place!

3Q5cvJDz7QCX0LODmRdpsA.text: Had an amazing experience trying Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House. My husband and I decided to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary at this establishment. The restaurant has a very nice ambiance with a beautiful dining room and full bar. There was also someone playing piano which gave it a touch of class. We were promptly seated and greeted by our waitress Jen. She was one of the nicest and most informative server's we have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Jen was extremely nice and explained the menu in great detail, and answered all of our questions. She wished us a Happy Anniversary, and made us feel right at home with this being our first visit.   We started with two cocktails. I had a very good margarita on the rocks, and my husband had a blackberry cocktail with fresh muddled blackberries, bourbon, crushed mint and ginger beer. Delicious!. We followed that with an appetizer of Steak Tar tare. It was very good and quite spicy, served with a side of garlic bread. Then on to the entrees. I had the 16 oz. Australian cold water lobster tail served with hot drawn butter. I also got a side of truffle butter which was excellent with the lobster, but even better with the amazing steak I'm about to describe next. My husband ordered the best steak either one of us have ever had. It's not on the menu. Granted it isn't cheap. $90 dollars! But if you like steak, do yourself a favor and try it once. It is a 32oz bone in Wagyu sirloin cut. It has an amazing marbling content and aged to create a flavor that is indescribable. The steak comes out cooked perfectly and was out of this world delicious. It was so big that even with 2 of us sharing it we still had leftovers. As a side dish we had the creamed spinach with bacon pieces. A nice compliment to the entrees. As a very nice touch, Tony surprised us with a complimentary piece of there 7 layer lemon ice cake, with a candle lit for our anniversary. A very nice touch to end a wonderful evening.                                                                                                                                       If you are looking for a place to spend a special evening no matter what the occasion, give Del Frisco's a try. The food is delicious and the staff is beyond friendly, informative, and very professional. We also signed up to be on their email list, which entitles you to special offers, and future discounts. Just an incredible restaurant to spend a special evening!!   Then to top it off. A few days later we received a nice hand written card by our wonderful servers thanking us for our visit. Have never had anyone go the extra mile like that. A very professional establishment that cares about their customers and want you to have a great experience and keep you as a repeat customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7 layer lemon cake complimentary for our 1st year wedding anniversary. Thank you Del Frisco!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu steak, best steak me and my husband ever tasted!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare. Spicy but no quail egg : ((

OCEwLooPL1TCDinb6j4GEA.text: Came here for a bachelor party dinner.  Incredible is about all I can say.  Service:  Excellent Ambiance:  Excellent Drinks:  Excellent Food:  FANTASIC  I've had Ribeye and the Filet here, both were amazing.  The seafood appetizers were a little pricey but worth every penny.  They could probably start a separate restaurant just serving their lobster mac & cheese and I think it would do pretty well all by itself.  I think we ended up ordering 5 servings total, it was that good.

kb_bZFZ8dByXY0MGVoI-sg.text: Good stuff.  Excellent ribeye, perfectly seasoned; crab cake was excellent (not deep-fried, so you really get the crab flavors coming through), lobster mac n' cheese was quite good (generous with the lobster, which is nice) and lemon cake was quality (still don't know how we fit that in our stomachs.)  Quality service- loved the staff-signed "happy anniversary" card we were presented with (as well as the label from our bottle of wine.)    Got crab cake for free with promotion- sign up for their club, get a free appetizer (and they comped the lemon cake too, as it was our anniversary.)  Price-wise, it's pretty reasonable- we saw far more expensive joints on the Strip with worse reviews.  You can walk here from the Strip pretty easily if you like- a bit ghetto past Koval, but within a mile of Flamingo area.  And yeah, see that James Bond table.  I almost came, it was that exciting and cool.  (hyperbole for dramatic effect)

c7EFGPpKb0A8-SqCEQ4yJQ.text: We visited Del Frisco's for dinner with our friends who were in town.    We all ordered drinks and they were definitely not watered down, but be prepared to pay a premium for your drinks.  They also have an excellent wine list, but being from the Bay Area I can't justify $60 for a bottle of Wente.  For starters we had the steak tartare which was perfectly seasoned and served alongside hard boiled eggs.  For dinner we all decided to have tomahawk chops.  The tomahawk is a great value at $90 and they allowed us to split the steaks.  They served the chops on sizzling plates with warm butter.  For sides we ordered the brussel sprouts with bacon and the creamed corn.  I would've preferred my brussel sprouts roasted, but they prepared it sauteed here.  It was ok, but I would personally just stick to the creamed spinach and corn next time.  We were full and skipped dessert, but everything was excellent.  We will be visiting Peter Luger's in Brooklyn, NY so it will be an interesting basis for comparison.

kQZGu1-qbKpxUDxmHQbnLw.text: This is in one of the top ten best meals I have ever had. My wife and I agree we cant find a better steak in town. The service was impeccable and the restaurant spotless.Thanks for a fantastic evening Del Frisco!

2rkC2WnYeY95JjkhOiVEiA.text: Great steakhouse!  Our table had the rib eye, filet mignon, lobster mac and cheese, cottage fries, and chopped salad.  All items were prepared almost perfectly.  The rib eye was cooked to a medium rare as ordered, had great marbling, and was season well.  The lobster mac and cheese was rich and had large chunks of lobster.  The overall food experience was excellent.  Atmosphere of the restaurant is very classy and great for business meals and date nights.  The service was fantastic.  The servers are very knowledgeable of the menu items and wine list.  They are very, very attentive, but not overbearing in any way.  The overall experience was great.

HeYusv7_6YzOJqelEbXFag.text: The service was great but the food was very overpriced for the quality. I had a bone-in ribeye medium. There was very little charring on the outside and it was more rare than I wanted. The meat is supposed to be prime grade but this steak had very little marbling, I've bought better at Costco. My wife had a 14oz. lobster tail which was dry and meally. Very disappointing meal. Save your money and try somewhere else

JP4ASzXUj0svq5T8K1Jvmg.text: Del Frisco's serves up, as far as I'm concerned, the best steak dinner in town. I'm very familiar with most of the other good steakhouses in Vegas - Charlie Palmer's, Joe's, BOA, etc -, and while they all serve a fine steak, Del Frisco's manages to outdo them nearly all the time.  Food: The porterhouse is the best I've ever had, and it never fails. Very tender, flavorful, and all around a great cut. The Double Eagle has always been a bit of a let down to me, but maybe it's just shamed by the porterhouse. The filet mignon is also excellent, and very tender, but not that much better than the competition. The sides & appetizers are also great. The calamari is excellent. Very tender, and not overly breaded. Mushrooms and creamed spinach are great side dishes, but their "signature" macaroni & cheese doesn't do much for me.  I enjoy the chopped salad, but it's not as exceptional as the steaks. Desert wise, I always get the chocolate mousse, and can definitely recommend it - but how hard is it make a good mousse?   Service is usually impeccable. Staff is very friendly, and food is delivered promptly. We arrived late once for a reservation, at about 10:30pm (closing time is 11), and they sat us without batting an eyelash and never made us feel rushed, even as we lounged around far past closing.  Ambience is nice, but not particularly extraordinary. A little more business than luxury, but I really can't complain. You don't have to put too much effort into dressing up, but it's definitely not a t-shirt and shorts kind of place (Although I did show up in shorts once & they didn't give me a hard time). One downside is that due to the oppressive Nevada smoking laws they've had to disallow cigar smoking - even in the cigar lounge! There used to be no better way to spend a evening in Vegas, but what can you do.

Dhjvf_7OrXXt_l3BgnhWGg.text: Expensive food that really isn't all that great. Steak was good...everything else we tried was just MEH

XWB6wHdcAQK17UcD187N6Q.text: I go to Vegas once a month, and I hate to give away the spots that only locals know about . . .    You see, tourists love Delmonico's, which masks its semi-flavorful steaks with a potpourri of spices.  Tourists love N9NE, which I would NEVER, ever, ever visit again. N9NE overcooked our steaks and refused to replace them.  Have you ever heard of anything like that???  Me neither.  Finally, tourists love whatever steakhouse the magazine in their hotel room tells them to love.   If you want a real Las Vegas steakhouse, and you don't want to go to Morton's or Ruth's Chris, may I recommend Del Frisco's.  Located a couple of blocks off the Strip, it's hidden from the glamor and grandeur of touristy Las Vegas.  Cab ride to Del Frisco's from, say, New York, New York, won't set you back more than $7-8.  We had reservations for 9 pm (it was Final Four weekend, and we wanted to finish watching the game).  The games ended early, and we arrived at 8:45 pm.  We were seated very quickly; so quickly, that we hardly had a chance to grab some jelly beans and some golf tees from two giant bowls by the entrance.  Remember, jelly beans are edible, but golf tees are NOT.  You've been warned.  The steak is great here.  I ordered the Double Eagle New York Strip, a 26 oz cut on the bone.  It arrived quickly, big and juicy as promised.  The meat had just the right amount of marbling, and was prepared properly.  The waiter then encouraged my friend and I to cut our steaks to make sure they were prepared to our liking.  Are you listening, Mr. CEO of Morton's?  It's a wonderful idea, and it certainly adds to the entire experience.    To be fair, I'd like to give Del Frisco's a 4.5 star rating.  I think I have to deduct half a point for mediocre sides and salads.  The lettuce wedge with blue cheese was very ordinary.  Both sides that our waiter recommended, special mac 'n' cheese and potatoes au gratin were not nearly as good as advertised.    But then again, it's kind of expected of a steakhouse.  Sides are just filler anyway.  Speaking of filler, the bread they give you is very good, too.  Fill up on bread and meat, and go easy on the sides.  Oh yeah, it's a classy place, so no flip flops or sweatpants.  Jeans are OK as long as you wear a polo, a sweater or a button down shirt.  Leave your faded "Beat Duke" t-shirts, your sequined "I love Vegas" hats and your replica Mickey Mantle jerseys at home.  I'd say, if you want a good steak in Vegas, call Del Frisco's.  They only accept reservations over the phone.

GgPlVAmAd3rwRLDcbWLBOQ.text: Took my lady here for her birthday... And damn, I did a good job picking a place for dinner. Let me first start by saying. Exceptional service. Our waiter was helpful, attentive but not in your face, annoying. The food was some of the best I've had in Vegas, without the hassle of being on the strip. Crab cakes, lobster mac, potatoes and most importantly the succulent red meat we were served... Simply amazing. Can't wait to come back

lZm_EExeyTfwMW8-Ei7EKA.text: I've been here before. I wanted to take my wife to a really nice high end steak house. This is it. GREAT steaks. for bacon eaters please listen. They put 2 full slices of bacon on there steak house salad. its applewood smoked as well. They cook the steak as you order it. not we'll lets get close and see if they like it. its right on the money. The service is great. no issues what so ever. as for attire. I had shorts on. after all it was 104 outside. I think they want them to be nice at least. I did have a button up shirt. I can't wait to go back. it is pricey though. if you have the cash its worth it.

Lc13k-HuKa09FbEQ7apuAw.text: This is THE best steakhouse in town without doubt.  Tried them all, Strip Steak #2.  Our group enjoyed filet, bone-in filet, strip steak.  All cooked to perfection.  Au gratin potatoes, creamed spinach to die for.  Outstanding wine list -magnum of Neal cab just right this night.

VMZ28s0zm8UGpynRlMhxeg.text: Fabulous meal on New Year's Eve! First rate service in lovely atmosphere. Drinks before dinner with live music in the bar! We dressed up but saw many in  their Vegas Strip jeans/sweatshirts. Too bad for them - we loved feeling special at this lovely place! Steak was divine, shrimp cocktail, scalloped potatoes all perfection. We'll be back :)

OBLBy_10YomAus1jkompDg.text: I opened the rusty door of my mind and returned to this steakhouse for another try.  I'm happy to report that the meal was considerably better than the last time I was here, and the service was attentive and charming, but Del Frisco's is still not one of the top steakhouses in Las Vegas. Particularly since their prices are not much less than the superstar joints on the strip.  The wine list is full of great choices, but the mark-up is about 3 times. And I'm told they won't allow corkage for any price, which is just plain stupid.  The lobster mac-n-cheese was a little watery and there are still no fries on the menu.  So next time I'm planning to drop fat dough on beef protein, I'll likely pick another place....maybe something that rhymes with "fat dough" and starts with an M.

psHlbXeZbUqroQ_o8lQaRg.text: In one word: fabulous. Now for the long version: We started out with the VIP (for vodka-infused pineapple) martinis. They're as delicious as they are refreshing. The menu suggests you let the waiter know how you'd like your meal to be paced. For example, they'll get you your meal faster if you're headed to a show. Dining at Del Frisco's was our event for the evening; we were in no hurry. This was a good thing, as we felt no pressure while we munched on the oven-warm bread and perused the considerable wine list and menu. I was pleased that the menu listed potatoes prepared in a variety of properly calorie-laden ways, all under the heading of "vegetables." Clearly, Del Frisco's understands the carnivore spirit! Litha ordered the crab cake and said it was better than any she'd ever had. I (as part of my duty to you, dear reader) gave it the taste test and found it spicy, dramatic and delicious. Worth noting: the crab cake isn't battered and deep-fried as so many are; rather, it contains generous chunks of real crab that actually tastes like crab. I had the steak tartare. It's not something you see very often, and you shouldn't order it unless you know what it is. I knew what to expect flavor-wise, but was surprised by the size (HUGE) of the tender and flavorful treat. Finally, the main event: she had the seared Ahi tuna, I had their signature "Double Eagle" steak, with sides of scalloped potatoes and asparagus. There was a minor issue with the asparagus -- someone forgot to serve it. When I asked a roving employee about it, it was like watching a well-oiled machine spring into action. Before Emeril could say "BAM" out was coming an order of asparagus, headed straight to our table... ...where it was headed off by our server, who knew we'd ordered the asparagus "naked" with the sauce on the side. Honestly, I have no idea how their kitchen turns expedited orders around so quickly but a (back to Emeril) BAM later and our perfectly prepared asparagus was on the table. We did our best with the entrees and had them take the plates away. We took a break between courses, and watched the show going on around us. The staff, again operating smoothly and efficiently, turned tables within just a few minutes - no looking at dirty linens for us. There was one unsightly visage, however. Being that this is Vegas, in this fine steak house, a customer dressed as a trailer-park refugee chowed down directly across from us in his very best ball cap, t-shirt, shorts and sandals. Ugh. The only solution to the visual blight was to order after dinner drinks and coffee from Del Frisco's extensive offerings (including some nice port wines). Since we were celebrating a birthday, they surprised with a comped lemon cake (light, tart, tasty). A fabulous dinner, but we were stuffed beyond redemption. After managing to make it back to our hotel to change clothes, we took a loooong walk down the Las Vegas strip. Needed! The final pleasant surprise came a week or so later after we'd returned home to Long Beach and got a personal, handwritten note from our server thanking us (see alturl.com/ohr6). Thank YOU, Brian.

Rxc-SsHvuCeuEwYbjMyI9g.text: Fantastic service. Amazing food. Try the shrimp three ways and you must finish with a piece of lemon cake.

ulK_nIMim0iaKBQIpyT7PA.text: Awesome food! Fantastic service, our server Alana was great and our food was spectacular. Best steak in Las Vegas, hands down.

vyp_N03AxYenRSn6gcUneA.text: Closer to 3.5 stars, but because I probably wouldn't go back to this place I will round down.  The service was excellent.. but we go for the steak not the service.  We went here based on the reviews on Yelp.  We got reservations for new years eve night.  It was pretty dead inside when we arrived.. we were quite surprised because it sounded busy when we called earlier.  The bread was above average.. just one kind, a loaf they give you. They brought a 2nd one when we finished.  The filet which we ordered I'd have to describe as a cross between ruth chris and flemings.  It was seasoned a little like flemings, and there was the hot butter like ruth chris.  It was on par with both of those chains, so you should know what I'm talking about.  Once you get to these quality of steaks, it's really the seasoning and flavoring that makes the difference, and the seasoning here was about a 2.5  The creme brulee was superb.. one of the best I've had.. I'd recommend it.  They don't have french fries, or a good selection of warm chocolate desserts like Morton's or Fleming's  We love chocolate so we were let down a little. .    They have a bowl of complimentary jelly beans, and the bathrooms here were excellent. There's a bathroom butler, and he walked in right when I was washing my hands offering a towel.. how did he know I was finished? A little creepy..  There was a tip jar in there with $100 bills showing. A little tempting for the partiers who walk in off the street who need to use the loo.  At about 1 minute to midnight on NYE, all the staff stopped whatever they were doing and ran to the top of the parking garage to watch the fireworks.   Prior to that, they had ESPN on until 10 minutes to midnite.. who wants to watch ESPN on NYE??  I don't even think they had any live games on.  Overall we just wanted to try this place, and were not wowed by the steak. I still like CUT as my favorite, with flemings being my 2nd favorite for a steakhouse of this caliber.  We would go back though if someone else wanted to go.. the steak was quite good.. but I couldn't stop thinking of the steak at CUT... we ended up going there the next night.

qJT_ioaBeNiGjDdZiRN6AQ.text: We have eaten at fine steak houses all over the US and this Del Frisco's is without question the best. Others have came close in food quality but never has the service been matched. The filet is perfect. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

jcBVuZ01Vj_5Xw6UVaxw_A.text: Made reservations on Open Table for a party of 4 on MDW 2014 (Sunday). Upon arrival, we were seated right away. Like a fine dining restaurant and a like a professional, our waiter greeted us right away, introduced himself and the menu. Benjamin, our waiter, had a fantastic attitude, very welcoming and made our experience personable. I guess on Sundays,  they offer a prix fix menu, which was the perfect portion. I had an 8 oz filet mignon, medium rare plus (cooked to perfection), with a Del salad, avocado dressing on the side, and their signature crab cake as my chosen side, all for $47? They allow different choice of steak with a small additional fee. Mentally, the 8 oz seemed like a tiny, small cut, but like I mentioned it was the perfection portion. We ordered additional sides that can feed the 4 of us with leftovers: lobster mac and cheese, creamed spinach, mushrooms and asparagus.  The lover had a huge 22 oz bone - in ribeye, medium rare. He killed it, nothing left on that bone. The other couple ordered prix fix menu but upgrade to ribeye. Another great fact, is everyone's food served at the same time. Great customer service. This is by far my favorite steak restaurant. Better than Mastros, Ruth Chris, Houstons, 5A5(this one in SF), Flemings Beverly Hlls, and STK. Also, forgot to mention, complimentary cakes (freshly made lemon cake and cheesecake) celebrating Anniversaries.

Gc0Q8jzXKoBAZMDfaVV56A.text: WOW!  I have to say.. Morton's, I love you, but Del Frisco's was amazing!   My boyfriend and I were craving steak when we happened to hear about this place and decided to give it a try.  I knew we were in for way more than we were expecting as soon as I opened the menu.  Thank God the server quickly came over to help go over the selections.   Honestly though, it only left me even more indecisive since everything sounded soo good - only now I'm trying to stop myself from salivating as I make a decision.  Stone Crab legs, bone-in filet mignon, 20 oz lobster tail, huge side orders of potatoes au gratin and broccoli sauteed in garlic and white wine, and more,  our table was full of yummy goodness.  Steak was done perfectly and exactly as they described when I chose "medium rare".   The lobster tail was one of the best I've ever had, and I never had Stone Crab legs before, but those were delicious!  Service was also impeccable!  At one point, I had three people trying to serve me at once: one scooping potatoes onto my plate, another serving me broccoli, and another cutting up my lobster tail.  Not exactly cheap eats, but the price very well reflects the top quality of food and service you are presented with here.  If you're winning at the craps table, make it a point to dine here!    Winner, winner, Del Frisco's dinner!!

oS0S1jqv2e_rfK6AY6hdcA.text: So far the BEST Steakhouse I've been to in Vegas the service was excellent the steaks are amazing comes to your table sizzling hot and the bar is pretty nice as well

v0AJ_oMau_yFMnBLYF9lBQ.text: Best steak I've ever had.  I had the bone-in rib-eye, medium-rare. Perfectly cooked. My husband got the Porter House which was just as good. This isn't a place that is afraid of flavoring their meat. Service was good. I got a little moody when they tried to sit us at the tiny 2 person table right in front of the kitchen entrance when there were much better tables open, but I made very clear that this wouldn't fly and we were quickly reseated appropriately (Normally I'd take a star away for this especially since we made the reservation 2 weeks in advance but they did rectify it quickly, and were polite when I requested the change).  We also got the creamed potatoes, some random drinks, a dessert, and wine,  and although all of these were good I'm giving this restaurant 5 stars for a single slab of meat which was, quite honestly, an orgasmic gastronomic experience..
